title: Sewing Mechanic
description:
Sheertex est l'entreprise qui se cache derrière les Impossibly Resilient Tights (les collants extraordinairement résistants).
Notre mission? Éliminer les deux milliards de paires de collants jetables qui se retrouvent dans les décharges chaque année et changer la relation du monde avec les collants. Nommée l'une des meilleures inventions du magazine TIME, notre technologie innovante, en attente de brevet, a fait progresser une industrie autrefois stagnante grâce à notre invention d'un tricot unique, incroyablement résistant, qu’on n'avait jamais vu auparavant dans la bonneterie. Notre équipe est composée de résolveurs de problèmes curieux et créatifs qui incarnent nos valeurs, et notre culture est celle de l'inspiration et de la détermination.

Chez Sheertex, nous nous efforçons de rendre l'impossible possible – êtes-vous prêt à relever le défi?

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un Mécanicien de couture qui aidera à dépanner, réparer et entretenir les machines à coudre industrielles et l'équipement mécanique.

Sous la responsabilité du Directeur principal de la production, vous serez chargé d'aider à l'installation, à l'essai et au dépannage, de contribuer à la réparation des machines à coudre industrielles, des appareils électriques et de l'équipement mécanique lié à la couture.

Que pouvez-vous attendre de ce poste ?

Au fur et à mesure que vous vous familiariserez avec l'entreprise, sa culture et son rythme, vous apprendrez à entretenir les machines et les équipements automatisés en inspectant les équipements, les structures et les matériaux de production afin d’identifier et signaler la raison des erreurs de production et autres défauts.
********************
Sheertex is the company behind Impossibly Resilient Tights.

Our mission? To eliminate the 2 billion pairs of disposable tights that get tossed into landfills every year and change the world's relationship with tights. Named one of TIME's Best Inventions, our innovative, patent-pending technology has advanced a once stagnant industry thanks to our invention of a unique, impossibly-strong knit that was never-before-seen in hosiery. Our team is made up of curious, creative problem solvers who embody our values and our culture is one of inspiration and determination. At Sheertex, we strive to make the impossible possible—are you up for the challenge?

We’re looking for a Sewing Mechanic who will help troubleshoot, repair, and maintain industrial sewing machinery and mechanical equipment.

Reporting to the Senior Production Manager, you will be responsible for assisting in; installing, testing and troubleshooting, repairing industrial sewing machinery, electrical repairs and mechanical equipment relating to sewing.

What can you expect from this role?

As you familiarize yourself with the company, culture and pace, you will learn to maintain automated machinery and equipment by inspecting equipment, structures and production materials to identify and report the reason for errors in production and other defects.

Responsabilités/ Responsibilities

  • Inspecter et entretenir les équipements et les matériaux de production afin d’identifier et signaler la raison des erreurs de production et autres défauts.
  • Aider au maintien des commandes de matériaux de production lorsqu'il y a pénurie.
  • Différencier le type de machine.
  • Répondre aux demandes de maintenance de la production par les superviseurs et/ou la gestion de la production en temps opportun.
  • Garder votre zone de travail, les équipements de production et les machines propres.
  • Inspect and service equipment and production materials to identify and report the reason for errors in production and other defects
  • Assisting in the upkeep of production materials orders when in shortage
  • Differentiate machine type
  • Respond to production maintenance requests by Supervisors and/or Production Management in a timely manner
  • Keeping your work area, production equipment and machines clean.

Exigences Essentielles/ Essential Requirements:

  • 2+ années d'expérience de travail avec des machines industrielles.
  • Capable de communiquer en français ou en anglais.
  • Connaissances de base en informatiqueForte capacité à résoudre les problèmes ; capable de dépanner et de faire remonter les problèmes liés aux équipements.
  • Forte capacité à établir des priorités, à être multitâche et à travailler en équipe afin de résoudre les défis.
  • 2+ years experience working with industrial machines
  • Able to communicate in French or English
  • Basic computer literacy
  • Strong problem solver; able to troubleshoot and escalate problems with equipment
  • Strong ability to prioritize, multitask and work as part of a team to resolve challenges

Exigences Souhaitables/ Desirable Requirements

  • Expérience avec les machines à coudre, à tricoter ou à bonneterie.
  • Capacité à établir des priorités et à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois.
  • Bonne compréhension de la Maintenance préventive planifiée (PPM).
  • Experience with Sewing, Knitting or Hosiery machines
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task
  • Good understanding of Planned Preventive Maintenance (PPM)

En raison d'informations exclusives et de la nature de ce poste, si vous êtes sélectionné, nous vous demanderons de signer un accord de non-divulgation (NDA) afin de permettre une discussion franche sur le rôle pendant le processus d'embauche.

Due to proprietary information and the nature of this position, if selected, we will request a Non Disclosure Agreement (NDA) be signed to enable a candid discussion of the role during the interview process.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract

Salary: $19.76 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Application question(s):

  • Do you have any experience with sewing machines or industrial sewing machinery?

Language:

  • English or French (preferred)
skills: ['Keeping your work area, production equipment and machines clean.', 'English or French (preferred)', 'Experience with Sewing, Knitting or Hosiery machines', "Nous sommes à la recherche d'un Mécanicien de couture qui aidera à dépanner, réparer et entretenir les machines à coudre industrielles et l'équipement mécanique.", 'Reporting to the Senior Production Manager, you will be responsible for assisting in; installing, testing and troubleshooting, repairing industrial sewing machinery, electrical repairs and mechanical equipment relating to sewing.', 'Respond to production maintenance requests by Supervisors and/or Production Management in a timely manner', 'Strong problem solver; able to troubleshoot and escalate problems with equipment', 'Good understanding of Planned Preventive Maintenance (PPM)', 'Able to communicate in French or English', 'Strong ability to prioritize, multitask and work as part of a team to resolve challenges', '2+ years experience working with industrial machines', 'Inspect and service equipment and production materials to identify and report the reason for errors in production and other defects', 'Differentiate machine type', 'Do you have any experience with sewing machines or industrial sewing machinery?', 'Assisting in the upkeep of production materials orders when in shortage', 'Basic computer literacy']

title: Knitting Mechanic
description:
Who are we?

*
Sheertex is the company behind Impossibly Resilient Tights. Our mission? To eliminate the 2 billion *pairs of disposable tights that get tossed into landfills every year and change the world's relationship with tights. Named one of TIME's Best Inventions, our innovative, patent-pending technology has advanced a once stagnant industry thanks to our invention of a unique, impossibly-strong fiber that was never-before-seen in hosiery. Our team is made up of curious, creative problem solvers and our culture is one of inspiration and determination. At Sheertex, we strive to make the impossible possible—are you up for the challenge?

*
Who are you?*

If you’re motivated by solving real problems for real people then, you’ve come to the right place! As the Knitting Mechanic, reporting to the* Lead Knitting Mechanic, *you will be responsible for routine maintenance, necessary mechanical adjustments, day-to-day mechanical issues and assigned tasks by leadership to ensure machines are running at peak efficiency to reaching daily targets. The Knitting mechanic is also responsible for escalated issues through our tier system.

Responsibilities:

  • Executing program changes on automatic knitting machines for work orders
  • Troubleshoot and fixing mechanical issues;
  • Performing needle renewals;
  • Completing daily reports on daily priority list;
  • Interacting with the HMI (human machine interface)

Requirements:

  • Previous mechanical experience on circular knitting machines
  • Comfortable communicating in either French or English
  • Experience with the methodology of Quality Assurance

Desired:

  • Previous experience of upkeep and maintenance routines with installing/changing/checking machine components like; dial bits, blades, selectors, sensors, KTF feeders, stitch cams etc.
  • Comfortable giving feedback
  • Team player

Job Type: Full-time

title: VP of Materials / Vice-Président des matériaux
description:
Who are we?

*
Sheertex is the company behind Impossibly Resilient Tights. Our mission? To eliminate the 2 billion *pairs of disposable tights that get tossed into landfills every year and change the world's relationship with tights. Named one of TIME's Best Inventions, our innovative, patent-pending technology has advanced a once stagnant industry thanks to our invention of a unique, impossibly-strong fibre that was never-before-seen in hosiery. Our team is made up of curious, creative problem solvers and our culture is one of inspiration and determination. At Sheertex, we strive to make the impossible possible—are you up for the challenge?

*
Who are you?*

If you’re motivated by solving real problems for real people then, you’ve come to the right place! As the* VP Materials,* reporting to the* COO, *you will be an expert in material science, responsible for development and production of materials for Sheertex. You will have produced and sold materials in volume and will have a solid understanding of the commercial viability of materials. You will be curious, innovative and keen to explore new ideas - working with a team to achieve your goals.

*
What can you expect from this role?*

In this role you will be responsible for the science behind Sheertex’s material production in a highly innovative environment working to create new products with a strong multi-skilled team. You will be at the forefront of new material production for Sheertex and the textiles manufacturing industry

********************

*
Qui sommes-nous?*

*
Sheertex est la société à l'origine des Impossibly Resilient Tights. Notre mission? Éliminer les deux milliards de paires *de collants jetables qui se retrouvent chaque année dans les décharges et changer la relation du monde avec les collants.
Nommée l'une des meilleures inventions du TIME, notre technologie innovante, en attente de brevet, a fait progresser une industrie autrefois stagnante grâce à l'utilisation d'une fibre unique, incroyablement résistante, qui n'avait jamais été vue auparavant dans les bas. Notre équipe est composée de personnes curieuses et créatives qui résolvent les problèmes et notre culture est celle de l'inspiration et de la détermination.
Chez Sheertex, nous nous efforçons de rendre l'impossible possible. Êtes-vous prêt à relever le défi?

*
Qui êtes-vous?*

Si vous êtes motivé par la résolution de problèmes réels pour des personnes réelles, vous êtes au bon endroit!
En tant que Vice-Président des Matériaux, sous l'autorité du Directeur des Opérations, vous serez un expert en science des matériaux, responsable du développement et de la production de matériaux pour Sheertex. Vous aurez produit et vendu des matériaux en volume et aurez une solide compréhension de la viabilité commerciale des matériaux. Vous serez curieux, innovant et désireux d'explorer de nouvelles idées, en travaillant avec une équipe pour atteindre vos objectifs.

*
Que pouvez-vous attendre de ce rôle?*

Dans ce rôle, vous serez responsable de la science qui sous-tend la production des matériaux de Sheertex dans un environnement hautement innovant, travaillant à la création de nouveaux produits avec une solide équipe polyvalente. Vous serez à l'avant-garde de la production de nouveaux matériaux pour Sheertex et l'industrie de fabrication de textiles.

Responsabilités/Responsibilities

  • Innovation and creation of new materials
  • Calibration of equipment/machines blending an understanding of chemistry, material science and industrial processes
  • Team leadership

*
Innovation et création de nouveaux matériaux.

  • Étalonnage d'équipements/machines combinant une compréhension de la chimie, de la science des matériaux et des processus industriels.
  • Direction d'équipes

Exigences essentielles/Essential Requirements:

  • Bachelors, and preferably Masters degree(s) in a relevant field (e.g. Industrial Engineering, Chemistry)
  • An expert in new material production in either plastics, petrochemicals or polymers.
  • Strong leadership expertise with proven experience leading and managing a cross functional team of scientists, engineers and mechanics
  • A strong understanding of industrial processes, experience in extrusion and the development of new materials
  • Strong communication skills, problem solving skills and the ability to communicate with cross functional teams; including scientists, engineers and other business functions

*
Une licence, et de préférence une ou plusieurs maîtrises dans un domaine pertinent (par exemple, ingénierie industrielle, chimie).

  • Un expert en production de nouveaux matériaux soit dans le domaine des plastiques, de la pétrochimie ou des polymères.
  • Une solide expertise en leadership avec une expérience avérée de la direction et de la gestion d'une équipe interfonctionnelle de scientifiques, d'ingénieurs et de mécaniciens.
  • Une solide compréhension des processus industriels, une expérience dans l'extrusion et le développement de nouveaux matériaux.
  • De solides compétences en matière de communication, de résolution de problèmes et la capacité de communiquer avec des équipes interfonctionnelles; y compris des scientifiques, des ingénieurs et d'autres fonctions commerciales.

Exigences souhaitables : /Desirable Requirements:

  • Bilingue en Français et en Anglais

*
Bilingual in French and English

Type d'emploi : Temps Plein

You will be at the forefront of new material production for Sheertex and the textiles manufacturing industry', 'Strong leadership expertise with proven experience leading and managing a cross functional team of scientists, engineers and mechanics', '*Bilingual in French and English']

  • Capable de communiquer en français ou en anglais.
  • Connaissances de base en informatiqueForte capacité à résoudre les problèmes ; capable de dépanner et de faire remonter les problèmes liés aux équipements.
  • Forte capacité à établir des priorités, à être multitâche et à travailler en équipe afin de résoudre les défis.
  • 2+ years experience working with industrial machines
  • Able to communicate in French or English
  • Basic computer literacy
  • Strong problem solver; able to troubleshoot and escalate problems with equipment
  • Strong ability to prioritize, multitask and work as part of a team to resolve challenges

Exigences Souhaitables/ Desirable Requirements

  • Expérience avec les machines à coudre, à tricoter ou à bonneterie.
  • Capacité à établir des priorités et à effectuer plusieurs tâches à la fois.
  • Bonne compréhension de la Maintenance préventive planifiée (PPM).
  • Experience with Sewing, Knitting or Hosiery machines
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task
  • Good understanding of Planned Preventive Maintenance (PPM)

En raison d'informations exclusives et de la nature de ce poste, si vous êtes sélectionné, nous vous demanderons de signer un accord de non-divulgation (NDA) afin de permettre une discussion franche sur le rôle pendant le processus d'embauche.

Due to proprietary information and the nature of this position, if selected, we will request a Non Disclosure Agreement (NDA) be signed to enable a candid discussion of the role during the interview process.

Job Types: Full-time, Fixed term contract

Salary: $19.76 per hour

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

  • Do you have any experience with sewing machines or industrial sewing machinery?

Language:

  • English or French (preferred)

title: Knitting Mechanic
description:
Who are we?

*
Sheertex is the company behind Impossibly Resilient Tights. Our mission? To eliminate the 2 billion *pairs of disposable tights that get tossed into landfills every year and change the world's relationship with tights. Named one of TIME's Best Inventions, our innovative, patent-pending technology has advanced a once stagnant industry thanks to our invention of a unique, impossibly-strong fiber that was never-before-seen in hosiery. Our team is made up of curious, creative problem solvers and our culture is one of inspiration and determination. At Sheertex, we strive to make the impossible possible—are you up for the challenge?

*
Who are you?*

If you’re motivated by solving real problems for real people then, you’ve come to the right place! As the Knitting Mechanic, reporting to the* Lead Knitting Mechanic, *you will be responsible for routine maintenance, necessary mechanical adjustments, day-to-day mechanical issues and assigned tasks by leadership to ensure machines are running at peak efficiency to reaching daily targets. The Knitting mechanic is also responsible for escalated issues through our tier system.

Responsibilities:

  • Executing program changes on automatic knitting machines for work orders
  • Troubleshoot and fixing mechanical issues;
  • Performing needle renewals;
  • Completing daily reports on daily priority list;
  • Interacting with the HMI (human machine interface)

Requirements:

  • Previous mechanical experience on circular knitting machines
  • Comfortable communicating in either French or English
  • Experience with the methodology of Quality Assurance

Desired:

  • Previous experience of upkeep and maintenance routines with installing/changing/checking machine components like; dial bits, blades, selectors, sensors, KTF feeders, stitch cams etc.
  • Comfortable giving feedback
  • Team player

Job Type: Full-time

title: Mécanicien de Couture / Sewing Mechanic
description:
Qui sommes-nous?

Sheertex est la société à l’origine des collants à élasticité impossible.

Notre mission ? Éliminer les deux milliards de paires de collants jetables qui sont jetés dans les décharges chaque année et changer la relation du monde avec les collants. Nommée l’une des meilleures inventions du magazine TIME, notre technologie innovante, en attente de brevet, a fait progresser une industrie autrefois stagnante grâce à notre invention d’un tricot unique, incroyablement solide, jamais vu auparavant dans la bonneterie. Notre équipe est composée de personnes curieuses et créatives qui résolvent les problèmes et incarnent nos valeurs. Notre culture est celle de l’inspiration et de la détermination.

Chez Sheertex, nous nous efforçons de rendre l’impossible possible - êtes-vous prêt à relever le défi ?

*
Qui êtes-vous?*

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un Mécanicien de Couture qui aidera à dépanner, réparer et entretenir les machines à coudre industrielles et l'équipement mécanique.

********************

*
Who are we?*

*
Sheertex is the company behind Impossibly Resilient Tights. Our mission? To eliminate the 2 billion *pairs of disposable tights that get tossed into landfills every year and change the world's relationship with tights. Named one of TIME's Best Inventions, our innovative, patent-pending technology has advanced a once stagnant industry thanks to our invention of a unique, impossibly-strong fiber that was never-before-seen in hosiery. Our team is made up of curious, creative problem solvers and our culture is one of inspiration and determination. At Sheertex, we strive to make the impossible possible—are you up for the challenge?

*
Who are you?*

We’re looking for a Sewing Mechanic who will help troubleshoot, repair, and maintain industrial sewing machinery and mechanical equipment.

Responsabilités/ Responsibilities

  • Installer et contribuer à la réparation des machines à coudre industrielles
  • Aider au maintien des commandes de matériaux de production lorsqu'il y a pénurie.
  • Répondre aux demandes de maintenance de la production en temps opportun.
  • Garder votre zone de travail, les équipements de production et les machines propres.

*
Installing, testing and troubleshooting, repairing industrial sewing machinery

  • Assisting in the upkeep of production materials orders when in shortage.
  • Respond to production maintenance requests in a timely manner.
  • Keeping your work area, production equipment and machines clean.

Exigences essentielles/ Essential Requirements:

  • 2+ années d'expérience de travail avec, et de réparation des machines à coudre.
  • Capable de communiquer en français ou en anglais.
  • Forte capacité à résoudre les problèmes ; capable de dépanner et de faire remonter les problèmes liés aux équipements.

*
2+ years experience working with, and repairing Sewing machines

  • Able to communicate in French or English
  • Strong problem solver; able to troubleshoot and escalate problems with equipment

Exigences souhaitables/ Desirable Requirements

  • Expérience avec les machines à tricoter ou à bonneterie.
  • Bonne compréhension de la Maintenance préventive planifiée (PPM).

*
Experience with Knitting or Hosiery machines

  • Good understanding of Planned Preventive Maintenance (PPM)

En raison d'informations exclusives et de la nature de ce poste, si vous êtes sélectionné, nous vous demanderons de signer un accord de non-divulgation (NDA) afin de permettre une discussion franche sur le rôle pendant le processus d'embauche.

Due to proprietary information and the nature of this position, if selected, we will request a Non Disclosure Agreement (NDA) be signed to enable a candid discussion of the role during the interview process.

title: VP of Materials / Vice-Président des matériaux
description:
Who are we?

*
Sheertex is the company behind Impossibly Resilient Tights. Our mission? To eliminate the 2 billion *pairs of disposable tights that get tossed into landfills every year and change the world's relationship with tights. Named one of TIME's Best Inventions, our innovative, patent-pending technology has advanced a once stagnant industry thanks to our invention of a unique, impossibly-strong fibre that was never-before-seen in hosiery. Our team is made up of curious, creative problem solvers and our culture is one of inspiration and determination. At Sheertex, we strive to make the impossible possible—are you up for the challenge?

*
Who are you?*

If you’re motivated by solving real problems for real people then, you’ve come to the right place! As the* VP Materials,* reporting to the* COO, *you will be an expert in material science, responsible for development and production of materials for Sheertex. You will have produced and sold materials in volume and will have a solid understanding of the commercial viability of materials. You will be curious, innovative and keen to explore new ideas - working with a team to achieve your goals.

*
What can you expect from this role?*

In this role you will be responsible for the science behind Sheertex’s material production in a highly innovative environment working to create new products with a strong multi-skilled team. You will be at the forefront of new material production for Sheertex and the textiles manufacturing industry

********************

*
Qui sommes-nous?*

*
Sheertex est la société à l'origine des Impossibly Resilient Tights. Notre mission? Éliminer les deux milliards de paires *de collants jetables qui se retrouvent chaque année dans les décharges et changer la relation du monde avec les collants.
Nommée l'une des meilleures inventions du TIME, notre technologie innovante, en attente de brevet, a fait progresser une industrie autrefois stagnante grâce à l'utilisation d'une fibre unique, incroyablement résistante, qui n'avait jamais été vue auparavant dans les bas. Notre équipe est composée de personnes curieuses et créatives qui résolvent les problèmes et notre culture est celle de l'inspiration et de la détermination.
Chez Sheertex, nous nous efforçons de rendre l'impossible possible. Êtes-vous prêt à relever le défi?

*
Qui êtes-vous?*

Si vous êtes motivé par la résolution de problèmes réels pour des personnes réelles, vous êtes au bon endroit!
En tant que Vice-Président des Matériaux, sous l'autorité du Directeur des Opérations, vous serez un expert en science des matériaux, responsable du développement et de la production de matériaux pour Sheertex. Vous aurez produit et vendu des matériaux en volume et aurez une solide compréhension de la viabilité commerciale des matériaux. Vous serez curieux, innovant et désireux d'explorer de nouvelles idées, en travaillant avec une équipe pour atteindre vos objectifs.

*
Que pouvez-vous attendre de ce rôle?*

Dans ce rôle, vous serez responsable de la science qui sous-tend la production des matériaux de Sheertex dans un environnement hautement innovant, travaillant à la création de nouveaux produits avec une solide équipe polyvalente. Vous serez à l'avant-garde de la production de nouveaux matériaux pour Sheertex et l'industrie de fabrication de textiles.

Responsabilités/Responsibilities

  • Innovation and creation of new materials
  • Calibration of equipment/machines blending an understanding of chemistry, material science and industrial processes
  • Team leadership

*
Innovation et création de nouveaux matériaux.

  • Étalonnage d'équipements/machines combinant une compréhension de la chimie, de la science des matériaux et des processus industriels.
  • Direction d'équipes

Exigences essentielles/Essential Requirements:

  • Bachelors, and preferably Masters degree(s) in a relevant field (e.g. Industrial Engineering, Chemistry)
  • An expert in new material production in either plastics, petrochemicals or polymers.
  • Strong leadership expertise with proven experience leading and managing a cross functional team of scientists, engineers and mechanics
  • A strong understanding of industrial processes, experience in extrusion and the development of new materials
  • Strong communication skills, problem solving skills and the ability to communicate with cross functional teams; including scientists, engineers and other business functions

*
Une licence, et de préférence une ou plusieurs maîtrises dans un domaine pertinent (par exemple, ingénierie industrielle, chimie).

  • Un expert en production de nouveaux matériaux soit dans le domaine des plastiques, de la pétrochimie ou des polymères.
  • Une solide expertise en leadership avec une expérience avérée de la direction et de la gestion d'une équipe interfonctionnelle de scientifiques, d'ingénieurs et de mécaniciens.
  • Une solide compréhension des processus industriels, une expérience dans l'extrusion et le développement de nouveaux matériaux.
  • De solides compétences en matière de communication, de résolution de problèmes et la capacité de communiquer avec des équipes interfonctionnelles; y compris des scientifiques, des ingénieurs et d'autres fonctions commerciales.

Exigences souhaitables : /Desirable Requirements:

  • Bilingue en Français et en Anglais

*
Bilingual in French and English

Type d'emploi : Temps Plein

title: Industrial Mechanic (Millwright) - Press Experience a must
description:
Job description

Industrial Mechanic (Millwright) - Press Experience a must

About us

OUR SERVICES

For decades, we have been working hard to bring together the equipment and expertise to become one of the most complete jobbing shops in the field. Today we offer more services under one roof than any of our competitors, including:

MACHINING

· A full spectrum of conventional and CNC machines that can be applied to both large and small precision machining projects

WELDING AND FABRICATION

· Fully equipped CWB and TSSA certified fabrication/weld shop with years of experience in most industries

AUTOMATION

· Custom automated solutions engineered to suit your specific needs

· Full support through all project phases from design through to installation

PRESS TECHNOLOGIES

· Complete stamping press repair and rebuilds, including but not limited to hydraulic systems, electrical control systems, preventative maintenance, and on-site assessment

POWER GENERATION SERVICES

· Experience with most generation types including nuclear, hydro, wind, and solar

· Services include manufacture of components, repairs to existing equipment, and provision of automated manufacturing/processing equipment

The position we are looking for is: Millwright (Mechanic)

You have a minimum of 5 plus years experience as a qualified millwright working with large machinery.

Press Experience A MUST - Position requires a self-motivated individual with strong problem solving/troubleshooting skills and ability to detect equipment malfunctions. Ability to repair or fabricate and replace defective parts. Experience in hydraulics, pneumatics and electrical systems. Capable of multitasking, working with a attention to detail and accuracy

Work requires exercise of independent judgment and making decisions within established regulations and policies, Strong interpersonal and organizational skills, communication skills to work in a team environment

Ability to work with and direct the work of others

Job Summary

· Minimum of 3-5 years experience as a qualified millwright working within the stamping press and large machinery industry. CFQ for Millwrights an asset

· Position requires a self-motivated individual with strong problem solving/troubleshooting skills and ability to detect equipment malfunctions with the ability to repair or fabricate and replace defective parts with stamping presses & large machinery repairs

· Experience in hydraulics, pneumatics and electrical systems

· Capable of multitasking and working with attention to detail and accuracy

· Work requires exercise of independent judgment and making decisions within established regulations and policies a self starter with Strong interpersonal and organizational skills

· Communication skills to work in a team environment with the ability to work with and direct the work of others

Job Type/Category

· Custom jobbing shop work environment

·Full time position

·Strong interpersonal and organizational skills

· Requires exercise of independent judgement and making decisions within established regulations and policies

·Positive attitude and team player

·Press Experience a must

Full-time, Permanent

Up to $37.00 per hour

title: Facilities Maintenance Technician
description:
This role is responsible for performing routine building maintenance tasks including but not limited to carpentry, electrical, heating, Ventilation and Air Condition (HVAC), plumbing etc. in accordance with established SOPs, GMP guidelines and EH&S policies.

Duties and Responsibilities:
• Inspect buildings and other structures to determine functional systems and detect malfunctions and needed repair; make notes and recommendations
• Perform minor electrical maintenance to include but not limited to replacement or repair of fixtures such as wall switches and outlets, incandescent and fluorescent bulbs and tubes, ballast, sockets, fuses, minor appliances, cords etc. using appropriate hand, powder and specialty tools
• Perform minor plumbing maintenance such as replacement or repair of leaks in drains and faucets, unclogging of drains, trenching and laying new lines, replacing drain hoses on washers and similar devices, etc.
• Perform minor painting, carpentry and masonry work such as preparing surfaces and using brush, sprayer, or roller to apply paints, stains, and varnishes, hanging doors, fitting locks and handles etc.
• Reconfigure, install, position and remount modular offices and space such as furniture, wall panels, work surfaces, lighting, file cabinets etc. to accommodate user needs and maximize office space using various hand, power and specialty tools, dollies and hand trucks
• Prepare the surfaces and paint various structure and equipment such as walls, refrigerators, evaporative coolers, floors, roofs, doors, restroom facilities etc. to preserve wood and metal parts from corrosion and maintain a safe working environment using various painting equipment and related tools such as sprayers, rollers, brushes and thinners
• Perform other related duties as assigned

Skills and Qualifications:
• 2 years experiences in facility maintenance and working in manufacturing environment is preferred.
• Completion of high school education
• Basic understanding of electrical, plumbing and carpentry is a plus
• Show dignity, respect while performing duties and contributes to department goals
• Take ownership and accountability for issues, Strong interpersonal & problem solving skills and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision
• Be a team player, a positive contributor; be open to suggesting and implementing ideas to better the business.
• Willing to participate in skill enhancement programs
• Experience in food/pharmaceutical environment preferable but not required

title: Millwright
description:
Reference Code: ENG044546

Details and Requirements:

Our client, a large food manufacturer, is looking for an experienced Millwright to start immediately.
Title: Millwright
Location: Downtown Toronto, ON
Shift: Continental Days and will transition to Continental Nights after a few months
Status: Contract to Permanent
Start: ASAP


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Repairing and performing routine maintenance on production equipment.
- Maintaining logs and records of work performed as well as materials and equipment used.
- Responsible for checking and calibrating instruments.
- Perform equipment change-overs and production line set ups.
- Maintain safe practices and actively engage in continuous improvement projects to improve safety
- Assist with minimizing production downtime through preventive maintenance. Provide input and assist with implementation of a Preventive Maintenance program to ensure that all equipment are routinely maintained.


REQUIREMENTS:
- A valid millwright license (433-A)
- 5 years of experience as a Maintenance Mechanic
- Proven experience with High-speed bottling/packaging machinery including; Bottlers, labelers, palletizers, conveyors, etc.
• Applicable knowledge of electrical controls
• Ability to interpret information from complex machine manuals and generate reports
• Working knowledge of electronic components such as PLC controls, Variable Frequency and Servomotor drives
- Experience performing Preventative Maintenance and regular work on packaging and bottling equipment
- Knowledge of GMP and HACCP standards
- Proven ability to work in compliance with Occupational Health and Safety guidelines.
- Must be able to work from heights and confined spaces.
- Must have own tools

title: Industrial Mechanic
description:
Inland Technologies

Industrial Mechanic

Truro, NS

The members of the Inland Group of Companies (Inland Technologies, IDS and Quantem Aviation Services) are highly experienced in environmental management, aircraft de-icing, ground handling and pretty much any other aviation support service you can think of. We operate at over 50 airports in four countries. Inland Technologies core business is the delivery of airport environmental compliance programs. We are continuously innovating the technologies we use to provide our range of services including, spent aircraft de-icing fluid collection and recycling, wastewater management, and aircraft de-icing fluid manufacturing for reuse.

Our business is built on a foundation of excellence in customer service, innovation and continuous improvement and safety is at the forefront of everything we do.  We provide a workplace where respect, integrity and a high degree of ethical behaviour is a minimum expectation.  To learn more about our organization, please visit our website at:  www.inlandgroup.ca

 

We are currently providing an opportunity for a well-rounded safety focused individual to join our team in the position of Industrial Mechanic at our Brookside Manufacturing Facility.

Please Note: We are hiring for various skill levels from entry level to senior level skill sets. 

 

About You:

The ideal candidate will be someone who is passionate about safety, doesnâ€™t shy away from a challenge and is comfortable working in an environment where the noise level can be excessive at times.

 

About the Position:

Aside from the excitement of working in a busy manufacturing facility, the essential duties and responsibilities of this position include:

  • Perform equipment builds and repairs using a variety of hand and power tools, cranes/lifts, while following all safety procedures and regulations;
  • Assemble/test specially designed equipment for recovering and processing de-icing fluids to ensure proper working condition;
  • Interprets construction drawings (blueprints and general layouts);
  • Set hydraulic pressures, flows, and other system adjustments to ensure assembled equipment meets specifications;
  • Work with many different parts and materials (Steel, fasteners, rubber, wood, etc.) to be installed following proper procedures, to ensure proper operation, quality and fitment;
  • Disassemble and rebuild component assemblies, including troubleshooting, diagnosing and repairing malfunctions and restoring to proper working order;
  • Perform/complete other additional projects, duties, and assignments as required and/or by management request;
  • Promoting and adhering to our safety and respectful workplace policy;  
  • Follow established Standard Operating Procedures (SOPâ€™s) and HAVE ZERO TOLERANCE FOR UNSAFE ACTS!

 

Qualifications:

  • Previous experience with heavy equipment diagnostics, repair, maintenance or assembly;
  • 3rd year registered apprentice or an equivalent combination of education and experience;
  • Red Seal/Journey Person or Diploma in â€œHeavy Duty Equipment/ truck & Transport Repairâ€ considered an asset;
  • The ability to troubleshoot, diagnose and repair systems such as hydraulics, powertrains and electrical and electronic systems used in heavy duty equipment and truck and transport vehicles;
  • Willingness to be trained on other duties and positions within the fabrication facility;
  • Ability to follow drawings, schematics, procedures, to make and or assemble sub-assemblies, along with kits for electrical, and hydraulic systems without damage to pre-painted parts for a final product that passes Inlandâ€™s Quality and Operational standards;
  • Read, write, speak and communicate effectively;
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills;
  • Must possess a strong work ethic, positive attitude, with an ability to motivate and work in a team environment;
  • Willing to learn new skills and adapt to change in order to support the growth of the company and meet needs of customers.

 

About Inland: 

At Inland, we offer the following benefits, some of which are subject to eligibility:

  • A rewarding and safe work environment (company provided PPE);
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching;
  • Growth and advancement opportunities for high potential employees;
  • Employee and family assistance program;
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package;
  • Pension plan with employer contribution;
  • Access to group rates and discounts.

 

If you are a self-starter who is committed to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction and your experience and ability meet with the above minimum requirements, please forward your cover letter and resume to the Inland HR Team, quoting posting number 22-03.  Full job description available upon request. 

 

Please apply online.

 

Inland is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

Please note:  All employees working in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 unless provided by Inland with an approved accommodation under Canada's Human Rights Act.

title: Mechanic/Millwright
description:
Overview:

Blommer Chocolate Company is the largest cocoa processor and ingredient chocolate supplier in North America.   The company provides comprehensive business solutions for domestic and international customers of all sizes in the confectionery, baking and dairy industries.

 

Blommer has been providing delicious, high quality chocolate and cocoa products to customers since 1939.  Built as a family business, we are continuing to grow and are looking for motivated and reliable maintenance mechanics/millwrights to help in our mission of Bringing Chocolate to Life!

Responsibilities:

 

Job summary:  Maintenance Mechanic/Millwright conducts troubleshooting, repair and preventative maintenance services to equipment throughout the plant, builds and assembles new equipment, performance preventative maintenance services and general building maintenance tasks.

 

Position duties:

  • Perform mechanic skills including, but not limited to, mechanical, electrical, pneumatic and hydraulic troubleshooting and repair of packaging and production machines.
  • Ensures operation of machinery and mechanical equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements on engines, motors, pneumatic tools, conveyor systems, tanks and production machines.
  • Observe equipment concerns and initiative corrective action/repair.
  • Understanding of PLCs to reduce downtime.
Qualifications:
  • High School Diploma - required.
  • Red Seal certified is an asset.
  • Minimum 5 yearsâ€™ experience in production machine repair working with shop tools such as shear, lathe, drill press, mill; welding experience a plus
  • Basic use of computer, tablet, scanner, iPad for recording information
  • Mechanical Aptitude

We offer a competitive starting wage for the qualified, chosen candidate. Blommer understands that our employees are our biggest assets. With this in mind we offer a generous benefits package that includes: Paid Time Off, Health, Dental and Life Insurance, a Pension Plan (after a one year probationary period) and 10 pounds of free chocolate for your birthday and much more!

 

Blommer Chocolate Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Journeyman Millwright or Heavy Duty Mechanic - National Service Group
description:
Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, industrial and forestry industries that maximizes value for customers through innovative solutions. With a full line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels and a global service network, we help customers safely and sustainably optimize their operations. Our Komatsu, P&H, Joy, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC and Gigaphoton equipment and services are used to extract fundamental minerals and develop modern infrastructure.

 

Komatsu Mining brings advanced equipment, systems and direct services to the global mining industry. With its focus solely on mining, Komatsu Mining designs, manufactures, distributes and services extensive product lines of highly reliable P&H surface mining equipment and JOY underground mining machinery used to cut, crush, load and convey coal and industrial minerals worldwide. Customers receive a superior experience through direct relationships with Komatsu Mining's support people, and through its services located close to the mines. Komatsu Mining's products and related services are used extensively for the mining of coal, copper, iron, gold and other mineral resources and the company employs 14,000 people worldwide.

 

Komatsu Mining is continuously working to make mining operations safer and more productive. With Komatsu Mining's innovative equipment and life-cycle services, mine operators are able to consistently achieve the lowest cost per unit of production over the life of the equipment.

 

Komatsu Mining Corp. offers rewarding experiences and unique opportunities for growth:

 

  • Competitive salary
  • Comprehensive benefits package (dental, prescription drug, health spending account, paramedical, medical, vision)
  • Registered Pension Plan 
  • Paid Vacation
  • Company supplied tools
  • Ability to be a part of an exciting innovative company developing new state of the art technology and equipment 

 

Please visit our website https://mining.komatsu/ for more information.

Job Overview

 

We are currently looking to add a Journeyman Millwright or Heavy Duty Mechanic to our National Service Group (NSG) - Mobile/Project Based.

 

Reports to:   Manager, Project Planning & Scheduling (NSG) 

Shift:  Multiple shifts, Variance Agreement 

Location:   Home office located in Edmonton, AB, but work is project-based across Canada (Candidates from Western Canada preferred (BC, Alberta, Saskatchewan)

Relocation: This position does not offer relocation.

Key Job Responsibilities

  • Assembly, maintenance, repair, service, and inspection of the mining equipment.
  • Read and interpret drawings, blueprints, schematics, and code specifications.
  • Work with multiple supervisors from varying trades as well as work closely with other trades.
  • Troubleshoot and diagnose faults and malfunctions.
  • Adjust, repair or replace all defective equipment parts, components or systems serviced at customer sites.
  • Test the repaired equipment for proper performance.
  • Conduct preventative maintenance programs and keep applicable records.
  • Follow all safety rules and wear PPE at all times.
  • Follow varying shift schedules as required.
  • Maintain a safe and clean work environment.
  • Maintain a safe and clean work environment.
  • Other duties, as assigned.

Qualifications/Requirements

  • Red Seal Journeyperson Millwright or Heavy-Duty Mechanic Certification
  • 3-5 years of mining or construction related experience
  • Must have no restrictions for access for any mine site across Canada
  • Previous experience work with P&H and Joy products would be an asset
  • Able to travel and work in remote locations (100%, potentially 3-4 weeks at a time)
  • Strong proficiency in reading and interpreting technical manuals relating to manufacturer specifications and warranty environments
  • Must have a demonstrated ability to efficiently diagnose, troubleshoot, and repair issues in mechanical systems common to mining and/or construction equipment products
  • Experience in a customer facing role and a sound understanding of the importance of customer relationships
  • Good organizational and planning skills
  • Strong attention to detail and able to work within the framework of multiple deadlines
  • Hold a strong standard for quality and safety
  • Have a team-oriented approach and thought process
  • Experience using Micrometers to measure tight tolerances
  • Must be able to work with minimal supervision but also participate in the work of other mechanics and apprentices within the field environment

Additional Information

Komatsu Mining offers an excellent benefit package. We are an equal opportunity employer. We thank all applicants for their interest however, only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

 

No agency or candidate phone calls please.

 

Komatsu Mining Corporation welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Matrix is hiring ticketed Heavy Duty Mechanics,  This is an exceptional opportunity for the right candidate.  With a wage of $48/hr,/12 hrs per day,  fly in/fly out from near Montreal and 3 weeks on, 3 weeks off schedule,  candidates will have an opportunity for work life balance and financial freedom.  Group benefits and RRSP available. This job is on Baffin Island and will last for at least 2 years.

Duties: 
-overhaul, repair and service equipment such as graders, loaders, shovels, tractors, trucks, forklifts, drills, and wheeled and tracked vehicles
-troubleshoot any issues and repair.

Qualifications: 
-Possess a valid ticket for Heavy Duty Mechanic
-Ability to provide a clear Drug and Alcohol screening result.
-Must be able to be outside in cold temperatures and work.
-Physical ability to stand, bend, move and lift 50lbs continuously.  

All flights from St.Hubert airport and camp accommodation are provided.  Apply now!




    About Matrix Labour Leasing Ltd.:

    Matrix Labour Leasing is a full-service recruitment agency specializing in the placement and administration of the skilled trades workforce all across Canada. We have been in business for over nineteen years and have placed over 4,000,000 employment-hours in the Canadian workforce. We have been recognized as one of Alberta Venture’s Fast Growth 50 and as a Leader of Tomorrow by Business in Calgary.As a leader in our industry, Matrix remains committed remaining cutting edge of the Full Service Temporary/Permanent Placement model as well as best in class managed services in Payroll and Back Office Support. We are proud to serve the following industries:Industrial ConstructionCommercial ConstructionOil and GasManufacturingWarehousingHospitality HealthcarePipeline Construction

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Waste Connections of Canada has an immediate opening for a Licensed Journeyman Truck Transport Mechanic to join our team in Winnipeg, MB to work on a fleet of garbage trucks specialized for waste handling in a hauling district setting. We do a lot of hydraulics and electrical along with preventative maintenance and minor engine repair. We are looking for a SAFETY inclined, energetic, autonomous and proactive team player capable of making a difference in his/her team and community.




We offer top hourly wages and shift incentives, and as this is a union position, you get great benefits and a pension plan. We supply boots, uniforms, and any necessary PPE.




Shift timing: Monday to Thursday - 2:00 p m to 12:30 pm (4X10s)


Hourly rate: $38.49 per hour


Location: Winnipeg - 375 Oak Point Hwy, Winnipeg, MB R2R 1T9




Call Fatah at (403) 470-3335 for more information!




Qualifications:



+ Red Seal Equivalent


+ 3-5 years of experience with earth moving equipment


+ 2-3 years with waste experience would be an asset, but not necessary


+ Must be able to pass all pre-employment tests


+ Caterpillar & Mack truck experience an asset


+ Welding and hydraulic experience also an asset


+ Class 3 would be an asset






What’s In It for You?


You will be joining a company with great operating values and colleagues who embrace a “work hard, play harder” culture. We offer competitive compensation, benefits, and retirement packages, alongside a variety of rewards, bonuses, and incentives.




Come, become part of a team that leads by example, through a strong presence in our local communities, charitable giving, sustainability initiatives, and more.




Please apply online at www.wasteconnectionscanada.com.




Waste Connections of Canada/Enviro Connexions is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Red Seal Industrial Mechanic
description:
Are you seeking a new challenge? Are you mechanically inclined with a strong ability to troubleshoot issues? Are you a Red Seal Millwright?- then look no further!
An agricultural facility in Northgate Saskatchewan is looking for an Industrial Millwright to join their maintenance team.
This role will focus on both preventative maintenance and urgent repair. Previous experience with heavy machinery and equipment used in the manufacturing industry will be an asset.

Apply today as interviews are happening now!

Permanent Position
Hours: Monday to Friday 7:00 AM - 3:30 - 8:00 AM - 4:30
Salary: Range based on experience $36 - 40 an hour

Advantages
- $200 - 400 Travel Allowance
- Competitive wage based on experience
- Consistent schedule
- Team-friendly environment
- Health benefits paid for sick days, and a pension plan available after probation
- 3 weeks of vacation
- RRSP and Employee Profit-Sharing Plan


Responsibilities
- Utilizes safe work practices and promotes safety policies to others
- Must maintain a clean and safe work area
- Responsible for safe and conscientious use of equipment including a forklift, skid steer loader, scissor lifts, and power tools
- Proficient in material take-offs
-Reads and understands construction drawings, including providing an accurate layout of the work and building to drawings and specifications
- Install, examine, diagnose and adjust various types of industrial and mechanical equipment
-Understanding of multi hp industrial drives, shafts, bearings, and lubrication
- Assemble and commission mechanical systems
- Teaches and trains junior workers to develop trade related skills


Qualifications
What do you need for this position?
- Post-secondary education in a technical field or trade certificate as a Millwright
- Basic welding skills
- Candidates that are Red Seal certified with a minimum of 2 years of experience preferred
- Physically capable of prolonged standing, bending, lifting 40lbs, standing for long periods of time
- Experience with conveyor belts, drags conveyers, large gearboxes, large electric motors and bucket elevators
- Able to climb stairs, ladders on a daily basis
- Able to work at heights of 100 feet or more


Summary
If you are interested in this position, please apply today!

How to apply:
1) Respond directly to this job posting
2) Apply on www.randstad.ca
3) Email your resume directly to richard.soriano@randstad.ca
4) Call 833-983-2884

If you are interested in applying to this, or interested in other positions Randstad has to offer.

We are currently working remotely and will be able to connect with you via phone or video chat.

Our services will not ever be at a cost to you. Registration with Randstad offers you the benefit of our industry knowledge and client database which spans many industries.

Do you believe a strong work ethic builds character? Do you think an honest, hard day’s work is something to be proud of? Do you take pride in being a part of an industry that builds communities? Industrial support might be the field for you.

Industrial support makes up the majority of Randstad Canada's workforce. At any given time, we have several thousand roles available in this sector. If you're looking for work in industrial support or general labour, we can help.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Mécanicien industriel
description:
Graymont est un leader mondial dans le domaine des solutions de chaux et de pierre calcaire. Leurs produits sont utilisés notamment pour l’assainissement de l’air et de l’eau, ainsi que la production d’articles essentiels tels que l’acier, le papier et les métaux. Entreprise familiale établie depuis plus de 70 ans et ayant son siège social au Canada, Graymont dessert les marchés d’Amérique du Nord et d’Asie-Pacifique.

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un mécanicien industriel pour son usine de Bedford. L’usine est située à 30 min du St-Jean-sur-Richelieu et 40 min de Granby.

Bienvenue aux finissants!


Ce que notre client vous offre :

  • Un milieu sécuritaire et respectueux de l’environnement;
  • Des postes permanents et des possibilités de progression intéressantes;
  • Un programme d'assurances collectives complet (Médical, dentaire, invalidité et vie);
  • Le programme d'aide aux employés (PAE);
  • Un régime de retraite avec contribution de l'employeur;
  • Des vêtements et bottes de travail;
  • Un salaire compétitif de 40.59$/h.

DESCRIPTION DU POSTE

  • Planifier et participer aux travaux mécaniques, de soudure et de plomberie;
  • Effectuer les interventions d’entretien préventif;
  • Diagnostiquer les problèmes mécaniques et effectuer les réparations nécessaires;
  • Participer aux réparations majeures;
  • Maintenir l’ordre et la propreté de son environnement de travail.

Il s’agit d’un horaire rotatif de 40h/semaine, du lundi au vendredi.

PROFIL RECHERCHÉ

  • DEP en mécanique industrielle;
  • Expérience dans un milieu industriel (un atout);
  • Permis de conduire classe 3 valide émis par la SAAQ;
  • Connaissance et respect des règles de sécurité;
  • Capacité d’adaptation rapide au changement fréquent de tâche;
  • Aptitude pour les travaux manuels et physiques.

Cet employeur souscrit au principe d'équité en emploi et applique des pratiques et des comportements concrets favorisant l’équité, la diversité et l’inclusion chez Graymont.

Le genre masculin a été utilisé dans le seul but d’en alléger le texte. Toutes les candidatures reçues seront traitées confidentiellement. Seules les candidatures retenues seront contactées.

L’usine est située à 30 min du St-Jean-sur-Richelieu et 40 min de Granby.']

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Company:

Finning Canada

Number of Openings:

1

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

Join the Finning Canada family, part of the world’s largest Caterpillar dealer. We are currently looking for a dedicated Heavy Duty Mechanic who will be responsible for troubleshooting and overseeing repairs on a variety of Caterpillar equipment.

If you are a safety conscious team player, self-motivated, detail-oriented and possess your Journeyperson Heavy Equipment Technician certification then you are exactly who we are looking for!

Job Description:

Major Job Functions

  • Trouble shooting equipment and perform equipment repairs
  • Interface with customers, products and sales support
  • Working with the Supervisor on various tasks
  • Providing support with reference to on-site safety requirements
  • Maintain Finning Customer Service Commitment
  • Various related duties as required

**Candidate selection will be in compliance with the terms of the current Collective Agreement**

Specific Skills & Experience

  • Journeyperson Heavy Equipment Technician Certification
  • Minimum 1 year experience as a Heavy Duty Technician
  • Dedication to safety
  • Strong interpersonal and communications skills, both written and verbal
  • Understanding of the Caterpillar product line will be considered an asset
  • Engine and/or component rebuilding experience would be considered an asset
  • Transmission or Hydraulic testing would be considered an asset
  • Experience with Lawson, SIS (Service Information System) and warranty systems considered assets

Note:

  • Shift work may be required

Please note that any future shift changes that may occur will be made in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Collective Agreement.

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

title: Red Seal Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Company Logo:

Overview:

Keller Foundations Ltd, has built a solid reputation throughout Canada as an industry leader in providing innovative, comprehensive, Ground Engineering solutions.  We take pride in providing the highest possible level of service to our clients. Keller offers a challenging and rewarding business atmosphere to those who value teamwork, integrity, and diversity. We actively encourage our employees to contribute their diverse strengths to the team. We recognize the individual needs of our staff while supporting and assisting them to reach their full potential.

 

We are seeking a Red Seal  Heavy Duty Mechanic based out of our  Winnipeg, MB  office.

Responsibilities:
  • Inspect and test equipment components, diagnose faults and malfunctions, repair and replace mechanical units, test, and adjust equipment to specifications and manufactureâ€™s standards
  • Complete reports to record problems and work performed
  • Advise the Shop Supervisor of required major repairs or replacements to mobile and stationary equipment
  • Provide input and recommendations to Shop Supervisor regarding mechanical information for equipment and parts purchases
  • Research information and follow up with manufacturers to keep apprised of current practices and techniques, prevent recurring performance issues, increase reliability and efficiency of equipment
  • Maintain safe working conditions and adhere to Occupational Health and Safety Regulations
  • Coach and instruct apprentice Service Technician involved in maintenance tasks
  • Perform other related duties as assigned
Qualifications:

Education and Experience

  • Heavy Equipment Mechanic Trade Certification; Red Seal
  • Courses in heavy equipment, diesel, gas and hydraulics.
  • Valid Manitoba non-probationary driver's license.
  • 10 years related experience including heavy equipment and gas mechanics.
  • Possess an acceptable driving record.
  • Manitoba Safety Certificate

Knowledge, Skills and Ability Requirements

  • Sound mechanical knowledge.
  • Able to operate drilling equipment, hands on experience with pneumatic and electrical work.
  • Able to operate required tools in a safe and responsible manner.
  • Technically inclined with proven ability to troubleshoot and repair heavy equipment operation problems using computerized and traditional diagnostic methods.
  • Knowledge of machines and tools, including their designs, uses, repair, and maintenance.
  • Knowledge and commitment to workplace safety requirements and procedures.
  • Energetic, self-directed, and able to handle multiple projects and tasks at any given time.
  • Good planning, coordinating and organizational skills.
  • Personable and professional with strong customer service skills.
  • Sound judgment and decision-making skills.
  • Good oral and written communication skills.
  • Able to work in a fast-paced environment with daily / hourly changing needs.

Physical Demands

  • Perform physical activities that require considerable use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling of materials
  • Able to exert maximum muscle force to lift, push, pull, or carry objects (up to 70lbs)
  • Manual dexterity and visual acuity

title: Millwright Mechanic
description:
Millwright Mechanic

P&H Milling Group
Cambridge, ON

Join our team that shares your Passion & Heart for Canadian agriculture! Parrish & Heimbecker, Limited (P&H) has an opportunity for a motivated, forward-thinking, and dedicated individual as a Millwright Mechanic with P&H Milling Group based in Cambridge, Ontario.

Work and grow with a family-owned company.

Join our team with Purpose & History! P&Hâ€™s roots go back over 110 years. We have always been a Canadian, family-owned and managed agri-business that understands the qualities and conditions needed for meaningful growth. Our corporate culture values are family values; honesty and integrity with a focus on listening and continuous learning. Like family, we support our staff to always do better.

With over 70 locations spanning from coast to coast, and trade links around the globe, P&H is growth-oriented, diversified and vertically integrated with operations spanning across grain merchandising, flour milling, crop input distribution and animal feed production.

Skills and experience for the next step in your career.

Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, the Millwright Mechanic will be responsible for conducting routine preventative maintenance, service, repair, and maintenance of plant and facilities equipment in a safe and efficient working manner. Maintaining the safety and reliability of machineries and equipment is critical in achieving optimal production efficiency of the plant operations and production.

Your day to day activities will include:

  • Conduct routine preventative maintenance of processing and plant equipment according to schedule and during planned maintenance.
  • Perform troubleshooting, repair and maintenance, overhaul, assembly/disassembly, and installation of equipment.
  • Conduct regular inspection and report the status and condition of the equipment to prepare and schedule the necessary service and repair prior to planned maintenance schedule.
  • Complete the work orders and log them in the Computerized Maintenance Management System.
  • Work effectively in a food processing environment with emphasis and compliance to food safety, Brand Reputation Compliance Global Standards (BRCGS) and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) requirements.
  • Optimize equipment safety, food safety and reliability of machines and equipment by following and complying with appropriate precautions to prevent risk to employees and to the product. 
  • Perform maintenance post clean up and maintain high standard of sanitation and housekeeping at the processing area and maintenance shop.
  • Participate in continuous improvement projects and initiatives.
  • Perform other duties as assigned such as but not limited to welding, machining, and fabrication where trained and qualified.

The successful candidate should enter the position with the following qualifications:

  • Certificate as Red Seal Journeyman Millwright
  • Minimum of 3 years experience in industrial plant maintenance
  • Experience with MIG and Stick non-structural welding
  • Experience in the installation and repair of machines and equipment in a Flour Mill Plant will be an asset
  • Experience in aluminum or steel fabrications as well as building construction and repair will be an asset
  • Working knowledge of flour mill operations, packing equipment and robots is an asset
  • Competent communication skills, both oral and written
  • Computer skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, etc.)
  • Proficient with CMMS programs, preferably CompuCal
  • Ability to work after-hours tasks and with minimum supervision
  • This position is rotational with weekend call in requirements as per a schedule

To apply and learn more, visit us atwww.parrishandheimbecker.com

We thank all applicants, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

P&H is committed to building a skilled and diverse workforce that is reflective of Canadian society. As a result, Parrish & Heimbecker, Limited is an equal opportunity employer and is in compliance with the Employment Equity Act. We welcome applications from women, aboriginal people, people with disabilities and members of visible minorities. Accommodations in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Heavy Duty Mechanic

Apply now »



Date:May 3, 2022


Location: Guelph, ON, CA


Company: RailWorks




Job ID: 13565


Reporting to the Equipment Manager/Shop Foreman, the Mechanic performs duties and tasks related to the preventative and corrective maintenance of specialized railway construction equipment and other related construction equipment and vehicles. Working hours during the probation period will be straight day shift once the probation period ends the working hours will change based on business needs these positions are not for day shift only.





Primary Duties and Tasks of the Heavy Duty Mechanic:



+ Perform preventative and corrective maintenance of all systems associated with work equipment (mechanical, electrical and hydraulic)


+ Work from blueprints, service manuals and schematic drawings


+ Conduct inspections and tests, repair or replace parts with limited resources in remote locations outdoors in all types of weather conditions


+ Evaluate parts for reuse, repair or replacement


+ Use of cutting torches and welder to perform various fabrication tasks, comfortable using both stick and mig welding applications


+ Use various hand and power hand tools


+ Operates equipment such as overhead or mobile cranes and forklifts to assist in assignments


+ Diagnose equipment problems and take corrective action in order to minimize the impact on crew production


+ Adapts to new methods, processes, material and equipment


+ Prepare and submit equipment maintenance records, time sheets, etc.


+ Follows prescribed safety procedures including the use of safety clothing and equipment


+ Ensures cleanliness and organization of shop, maintenance of shop tools and equipment, loading/unloading and storage of equipment, etc.


+ Working on heavy duty equipment such as Excavators and Backhoes


+ Assists other Heavy Duty Mechanics when needed






Qualifications






+ Licenced heavy equipment and/or Ag equipment technician required (3rd Year apprentices will be considered)


+ Previous field service experience


+ Previous rail experience, an asset


+ Own tools required


+ DZ or higher drivers licence, an asset


+ A safety-oriented work ethic supported by experience within the labour industry


+ The ability to follow instructions, rules and regulations is essential


+ Written and verbal communications skills


+ Ability to work as a valuable member of a team


+ Problem solving skills


+ Hydraulic & Electrical trouble shooting and repair background


+ Fluent on reading hydraulic and electrical schematics


+ Knowledge of Hydraulic & Electrical components and systems

+ Please note our office is in Guelph but the majority of our service work is in the GTA.




#LI-RG1-PNR


#LI-RG1-PNR







All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment with PNR RailWorks without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristics protected by law.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Overview:

Fountain Tire Calgary (Blackfoot) is currently seeking an Journeyman  Heavy Duty Technician.  

 

What  is in it for you?

  • Work at a shop committed  to safety excellence
  • An extremely competitive compensation structure  
  • We take care of you and your family with our impressive health, dental and vision benefits
  • A retirement savings plan with company matching to help you achieve your financial goals
  • Save your money with our staff discounts on tires, parts and mechanical services at all Fountain Tire locations

What  each day will bring:

  • Something different! You never know what kind of heavy duty vehicle you may be required to work on
  • The opportunity to inspect,  repair and service  commercial vehicles and equipment
  • Amazing customers to impress with professional  and friendly customer service
  • The responsibility  to keep yourself and your coworkers safe
  • Pride in  the work you've done keeping your customers on the road

What does it take to get on track?

  • Heavy Duty Mechanic (Journeyman or Red Seal)
  • Experience CVIP CVIP and out of province inspections an asset
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License and satisfactory driver's abstract
  • Ability to lift up to 100 pounds using safe  lifting techniques
  • Strong communication skills are an asset

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply online or in store Today!

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
SUMMARY OF THE ROLE:

Mammoet is currently looking for an energetic individual to join our Edmonton branch as a heavy-duty transport mechanic. This position requires a candidate with an excellent work ethic, ability to travel, willingness to learn new things in a safe and efficient manner.

WHAT YOUÃ¢LL BE DOING:

Responsibilities (including but not limited to)

 

  • Able to diagnose and/or determine technical problems
  • Able to perform regular inspection of all equipment within the department
  • Must document all repairs and parts replacement for equipment files
  • Be able to read, understand and follow hydraulic, pneumatic and electrical diagrams
  • Able to perform regular maintenance of equipment/material within the department
  • Able to perform/execute repairs on equipment within the department
  • Mentor apprentices
  • Conduct all business in a professional, respectful manner
  • Understand and support Mammoet, SHE-Q and Business Policies and Procedures
  • Ensures all safety policies and procedures are followed
  • Carry out all work in accordance with Mammoet HSE/SHE-Q and business policies and procedures, including the use of all required Personal Protection Equipment (PPE)
  • Other duties as assigned by EMD supervision
WHAT YOUÃ¢LL NEED:

Job Qualifications

 

Experience

  • Must have sufficient training and experience in repairing of major brands of tractors & trailers in Mammoets fleet.

Education

  • Journeyman trade certificate (Red Seal preferred)
  • Leadership, basic computer knowledge and strong organizational skills and experience will be an asset.
  • Minimum of 5 years work experience  

Languages

  • Proficient in English, written and spoken  

Characteristics

  • Good communicator
  • Quick learner
  • Motivated
  • Attention to detail
  • Safety Orientated
  • Service Orientated
WHAT YOUÃ¢LL GET:

Mammoet helps clients improve construction efficiency and optimize the uptime of plants and installations. For that purpose, we provide solutions for lifting, transporting, installing and decommissioning large and heavy structures.

Our services are focused on the petrochemical and mining industries, civil engineering, power generation and offshore projects. The logistic challenges in these industries are growing daily. Factors such as remote locations, harsh climates and a strong emphasis on the environment are constantly driving us towards smarter and safer solutions.

We provide the following services:

  • Engineered lifting and transportation services
  • Lifting, transportation and installation of modular constructions
  • Factory-to-foundation projects
  • Plant turnaround logistics
  • Salvage and wreck removal
  • Decommissioning of onshore and offshore installations
  • Trading in new and used equipment worldwide

 

For over two hundred years, weâ€™ve been known for the unique capability of our state-of-the-art equipment. But itâ€™s the trust of our clients that has brought us where we are today. Their confidence inspires 5,000 Mammoet professionals to give it their all each day and truly make a difference in projects all over the world.

 

About our region

This will be a full-time position based out of our Edmonton branch.

WANT TO KNOW MORE?:

To Apply

Interested candidates may submit their resumes to this job posting by:

 

HR.CAWEST@mammoet.com

or by Fax to:  1-780-465-9425

 

Mammoet is dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diversity. Mammoet encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We thank all applicants for their interest in Mammoet, however we will only contact those selected for an interview. Applicants who require accommodation due to disability during the selection process should notify human capital when contacted for an interview.
