title: Aprendiz de Mecánico Industrial
description:
Número de Empleo: 44332 
Grupo: Cosma International 
División: Formex1 
Tipo de trabajo: Permanente/regular 
Localidad: RAMOS ARIZPE, RAMOS ARZIPE
 

Descripción del grupo

Cosma ofrece una extensa gama de soluciones de carrocería, chasis e ingeniería a los clientes en todo el mundo.A través de nuestra solida ingeniería de productos,excepcionales capacidades de herramientas y variada experiencia en procesos, continuamos aportando al mercado productos ligeros e innovadores.

 

Resumen de la función

El titular del puesto es responsable de Participar activamente en el Proyecto de Capacitación Diseñado para obtener una Certificación Internacional como Mecánico Industrial, en la cual estará siendo evaluado tanto teórica como Practica constantemente para estar dentro de los estándares requeridos en el proyecto.

Responsabilidades clave

  • Cumplir con las tareas encomendadas a lo largo del proyecto para la certificación.
  • Participar en todas las actividades relacionadas con Equipos de trabajo manteniendo un agradable clima laboral.
  • Participar y tomar atención en todas las explicaciones referentes a los Proyectos encomendados o tareas entregadas para mejorar las Habilidades Prácticas.
  • Participar y tomar toda la información proporcionada por la Universidad, para ser evaluado y sumar información valiosa en la Teoría de su especialidad.
  • Participar en las Ideas de Mejora continua del Centro de Entrenamiento en el proyecto de Aprendiz de Mecánico Industrial.

Calificaciones/requerimientos clave

Competencias

Aboga por el cambio
Actúa de forma decisiva
Es ágil y se adapta
Inspira a otros
Lidera el equipo
Piensa de forma estratégica
Piensa en los mejores y los peores resultados... comprensión del negocio
Prioriza los logros

Información adicional

REQUISITOS INDISPENSABLES:

-Escolaridad: Bachillerato/Preparatoria concluida

-Promedio académico: Mínimo de 8.0

-Acta de nacimiento original

-CURP

-Número de Seguro Social

-Acreditar exámenes de admisión

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
OCL Group Inc. (OCL), is a proudly 100% Canadian, privately held, employee owned fully integrated general contractor with design build solutions across Western Canada serving energy and municipal infrastructure markets since 2009. Our competitive advantage lies in our foundation of an empowered employee ownership group resulting in competitive pricing, fiscal responsibility, integrity, client centric relationships based in value and a history of client satisfaction.


We are currently accepting resumes for Journeyperson Heavy Duty Mechanics - Intermediate to Senior experience to support a project near Fort McMurray, AB.


Opportunities for Heavy Duty Mechanics with or without rig.


Responsibilities include:

  • Engine oil changes and oil sampling
  • Minor running maintenance repairs, lights, wipers, leaks, etc.
  • Greasing machines, adjusting tracks
  • G.E.T work. Replacing ripper tips, ripper shanks, bucket teeth, inspecting cutting edges and reporting, measuring ice lugs and reporting.
  • HVAC certification is required as well. Air conditioning and heating system repairs.
  • Ensure FLRA is completed at the beginning of every job and work is completed safely
  • Complete equipment maintenance in line with OCL, client and industry standards, procedures and practices
  • Independent work environment, without direct supervision
  • Ensure goals are met and communicate progress to supervisor
  • Journey-Certified Heavy Duty Mechanic/Inter-provincial Red Seal Certification
  • Experience working on Caterpillar equipment and Caterpillar service information systems
  • Previous side boom, shovel and pipeline equipment repair experience
  • Experience both in-field and in shop an asset
  • A clean driver’s abstract
  • H2S Awareness
  • WHMIS
  • One of CSTS/OSSA or BSO/CSO
  • Great attitude towards health and safety
  • Strong work ethic
  • Comfortable working outside in various weather conditions
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug and alcohol test

OCL offers a collaborative work environment, competitive industry rates and health benefit eligibility.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic / Service Technician
description:
Westerra Equipment has been selling, renting, and fixing equipment for over 100 years. We also train people in all corners of British Columbia on how to operate machinery safely and effectively. From forklifts to skid steers, excavators, loaders, and dump trucks, Westerra Equipment services industries such as warehousing, milling, construction, forestry, recycling, and more with their equipment needs. Join our award-winning company and experience working at a Gold Certified Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Company, and one of BCâ€™s Top Employers. 

Are you interested in servicing a diverse range of equipment including Bobcat, Linde, Doosan, Clark, and Vermeer? From skid steers to excavators and more, our service teams handle it all. We are looking for a Service Technician to join our Westerra Equipment, the Abbotsford team. Reporting to the Service Manager a successful candidate is customer-focused and a team player who can also work independently. No matter which industry you have experience in, whether that is automotive or any similar industry, we hone your transferable skills and teach you all about the ever-changing world of equipment!

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Diagnosis and repair of Doosan Heavy Equipment, Bobcat excavators/loaders, Vermeer Heavy and Tree Equipment
  • Perform routine scheduled and planned maintenance services and safety inspections
  • Complete repair reports, time cards, and other documentation
  • Shop work as required
  • Communicate repair requirements with customers
  • Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction
  • Whenever possible capture new business and new customers

Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:  

  • Red Seal Certified Heavy Duty Technician
  • Repair and maintenance of mechanical equipment as outlined above
  • Excellent diagnostic skills
  • Self-motivated and can work with minimal supervision
  • Superb customer service skills
  • Team Oriented
  • Experience in Electrical systems and Electronic Controls
  • Experience in Diesel engine service, repair, and overhaul
  • Thorough knowledge and experience troubleshooting and repairing of Hydraulic Componentry and Systems, Hydrostatic Drives, Automatic Power Shift and Standard Transmissions and Driveline componentry
  • Welding experience

Who We Are: Our people are at the core of what we do. We take the time to hire the right people who share our 5 core values, train them, coach them, and reward them for their successes.

  1. Build Trust â€“ Build trust with others and & each other.
  2. Be a Team Player â€“ Commit to working together to win.
  3. Be Customer Focused â€“ â€œWowâ€ customers so they become â€œRaving Fansâ€.
  4. Support Community â€“ Care for our people, our community, and the planet.
  5. Deliver Results â€“ Know what you need to do and get it done.

Due to the volume of applicants, please accept our apologies in advance, as only those candidates shortlisted will be contacted. We sincerely appreciate your interest in our company. Thank you for exploring career opportunities with Westerra Equipment.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic Apprentice
description:
Headwater Equipment is looking for full time Heavy Duty Apprentice Mechanics; apprentices will be trained in our shop and in the field with our field mechanics.

Apprentices will be given a chance to learn their trade working on some of the biggest construction and mining equipment in the world.

Work Hours and Locations:

  • 1 to 3rd year apprentices will be working in our Sparwood Shop
  • As apprentices gain experience, they will get the opportunity to work in the field on their own and with other mechanics
  • Accommodations and living out allowance is provided for work away from our shop
  • Field work is outside in the elements
  • Successful candidate will be expected to be living in the Elk Valley area

Applicants should have:

  • An interest in mechanics and enjoy the challenge of learning new things
  • Experience in the construction industry or a farming background is a great asset
  • Be able to handle hard work, training as an apprentice does not happen overnight, it takes committed and hard working people
  • Be able to take direction and work well with senior mechanics
  • Ability to work independently
  • Good Problem Solving Skills
  • Valid drivers license
  • Enjoy working in a team environment

What Headwater has to offer:

  • Modern facility
  • Clean and Healthy work environment
  • Benefit Package
  • • Includes Vision, Dental and Prescription drugs
  • Competitive Pay
  • Potential for advancement
  • We want to see our apprentices get their tickets and grow with our company
  • We hire apprentices for the long term and want them to grow with our company
  • Positive Work Environment.
  • We are a family run company that cares for its employees
  • We have a proven record with a low turnover rate, we want long term people
  • Top notch safety program, safety training provided

Pay Structure:

  • Our ticketed mechanics earn between $34 and $48 per hour, wage is dependent on level of apprenticeship/years of experience
  • Pre Apprentice employees start at $24.15/hr
  • Field employees are paid a daily subsistence, lodgings are in a condo with their own room
  • Apprentices are paid a night shift premium
  • Overtime is paid after 8 hours per day, travel time is paid
  • Paid 1/2 hour lunch break

Duties to Include:

  • General shop laborer duties (Pre Apprentice)
  • Troubleshooting and inspecting machinery
  • Working on all aspects of rebuilding and repairing equipment
  • Work with other mechanics on troubleshooting and rebuilds

A bit about Headwater

We are a Heavy Equipment Sales and Service company, we refurbish and repair late model Cat/Deere/Hitachi heavy construction equipment.  We are the authorized dealer for Sany, Terex Trucks, and a repair center for Cummins, Isuzu and Scania.  Headwater runs a very clean modern shop. With over 25 field service and welding trucks, we pride ourselves on hiring and retaining good people. Headwater Equipment is a family run business that believes its employees are its greatest asset, we do all we can to ensure our employees are satisfied with their position within our company.

We have been expanding our service department, and are looking to grow our field work, and our local customer base. We need talented and personable people to help us do this.

To Apply, please reply to this ad with your resume. Only candidates selected for a pre screen will be contacted.

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - Field
description:
Headwater Equipment believes that no organization is any better than the people who work for it.  Therefore, it is of the utmost importance that we set high standards of integrity with an enthusiastic attitude in all that we do. We promise to maintain a well-trained workforce and a safe, modern facility in order to render our customers the best possible support and to provide our employees a secure future.

What Headwater has to offer:

  • Late Model Field Service Truck with Crane
  • Modern facility
  • Clean and Healthy work environment
  • Benefit Package is a Employee – Employer split cost
  • Includes Basic Family Dental and 80% of Cost on Prescription drugs (Family)
  • Life Insurance, Accidental Death and Dismemberment, Long Term Disability
  • Employer matching RRSP Program
  • Competitive Pay – See Pay structure below
  • Potential for advancement into management or sales
  • Positive Work Environment.
  • We are a family run company that cares for its employees
  • We have a proven record with a low turnover rate, we want long term people
  • Dealer for Sany Equipment, Terex Trucks and Cummins Repair dealer - Cummins and Terex certification and training available for employees showing interest

Applicants should have:

  • Experience with Cat and or Komatsu/Deere/Hitachi Equipment
  • Ability to work independently
  • Journeyman or Red Seal Heavy Equipment Technician - Off Road and/or On Road
  • Good Problem Solving Skills
  • Valid drivers license – abstract required
  • Enjoy working in a team environment
  • 2 to 3 years experience work on Heavy Duty Off Road Equipment
  • Potential employee’s to need valid Off road equipment ticket from their province, if not in possession of Red seal, or AB Off Road ticket; be willing to challenge AB exam and/or Red seal within 6 months

Job Duties to Include:

  • Running repair on off road heavy trucks, heavy construction equipment, diesel and diesel electric mining machinery
  • Repairs on bulldozers, graders, dump truck and excavators
  • Will require ability to troubleshoot and inspect equipment to detect faults and malfunctions, determine extent of repair required, adjust equipment and repair or replace defective parts
  • Instruct apprentices, keep maintenance reports and documentation
  • Job role will include being in the field and working in our shop in NW Edmonton

Pay Structure:

  • Industry competitive wages, and above
  • o $34/hr to $48/hr – Depending on Experience and if in the Field or Shop
  • Overtime at time and half - paid after 8 hours/day
  • Nightshift premium
  • When in the field, Hotels/Condo are paid, travel time paid, as well living out allowance
  • Headwater will assist with relocation costs if needed
  • This is a permanent full time position

Other Requirements:

  • Pre employment Medical exam
  • Some sites we travel to require you pass a drug screen

Shift Structures:

  • Guaranteed minimum of 44 Hrs/week – Overtime available and paid at time and a half
  • Shift Structure varies with our different locations we work at –please contact us and we can give a run down of what you could expect and see if we have a shift rotation that can work for you.

Locations:

  • We are looking for mechanics to ideally be based out of the Edmonton area
  • We are also hiring for a field technician to be based out of the Lethbridge area
  • Our mechanics must be willing to travel to remote job sites, travel time, accommodations, and living out allowance paid for trave
  • Locations include Sparwood BC, Edmonton AB, Southern AB - Remote work locations include Northern AB, Southern SK and Manitoba
  • Our new Edmonton branch is at 18014 - 111 Ave NW Edmonton
  • Our main shop is at 5-92041 River Ridge Road, Coalhurst AB (5 KM West of Lethbridge)

Contact:

  • Submit your resume thru the contact info given on this website
  • Only candidates selected for pre screen will be contacted

A bit about Headwater

We are a Heavy Equipment Sales and Service company, we refurbish and repair late model Cat/Deere/Hitachi heavy construction equipment. We are also a Sany America, Terex Trucks dealer, as well as a Cummins and Isuzu Certified repair center. (Dealer training is available for technicians interested) Headwater runs a very clean modern shop with separate Welding, Washing and Paint bays. We are a family run business that believes its employees are its greatest asset, we do all we can to ensure our employees are satisfied with their position within our company.

We run a fleet of late model 3 and 5 Ton service trucks – our trucks are top of the line, and we run only 1 man per truck.

For more information about Headwater and to see the quality products we turn out, visit our website or visit us on facebook

Headwater Equipment is looking for full time Heavy Duty Apprentice Mechanics; apprentices will be trained in our shop and in the field with our field mechanics.

Apprentices will be given a chance to learn their trade working on some of the biggest construction and mining equipment in the world.

Work Hours and Locations:

  • 1 to 3rd year apprentices will be working in our Sparwood Shop
  • As apprentices gain experience, they will get the opportunity to work in the field on their own and with other mechanics
  • Accommodations and living out allowance is provided for work away from our shop
  • Field work is outside in the elements
  • Successful candidate will be expected to be living in the Elk Valley area

Applicants should have:

  • An interest in mechanics and enjoy the challenge of learning new things
  • Experience in the construction industry or a farming background is a great asset
  • Be able to handle hard work, training as an apprentice does not happen overnight, it takes committed and hard working people
  • Be able to take direction and work well with senior mechanics
  • Ability to work independently
  • Good Problem Solving Skills
  • Valid drivers license
  • Enjoy working in a team environment

What Headwater has to offer:

  • Modern facility
  • Clean and Healthy work environment
  • Benefit Package
  • • Includes Vision, Dental and Prescription drugs
  • Competitive Pay
  • Potential for advancement
  • We want to see our apprentices get their tickets and grow with our company
  • We hire apprentices for the long term and want them to grow with our company
  • Positive Work Environment.
  • We are a family run company that cares for its employees
  • We have a proven record with a low turnover rate, we want long term people
  • Top notch safety program, safety training provided

Pay Structure:

  • Our ticketed mechanics earn between $34 and $48 per hour, wage is dependent on level of apprenticeship/years of experience
  • Pre Apprentice employees start at $24.15/hr
  • Field employees are paid a daily subsistence, lodgings are in a condo with their own room
  • Apprentices are paid a night shift premium
  • Overtime is paid after 8 hours per day, travel time is paid
  • Paid 1/2 hour lunch break

Duties to Include:

  • General shop laborer duties (Pre Apprentice)
  • Troubleshooting and inspecting machinery
  • Working on all aspects of rebuilding and repairing equipment
  • Work with other mechanics on troubleshooting and rebuilds

A bit about Headwater

We are a Heavy Equipment Sales and Service company, we refurbish and repair late model Cat/Deere/Hitachi heavy construction equipment.  We are the authorized dealer for Sany, Terex Trucks, and a repair center for Cummins, Isuzu and Scania.  Headwater runs a very clean modern shop. With over 25 field service and welding trucks, we pride ourselves on hiring and retaining good people. Headwater Equipment is a family run business that believes its employees are its greatest asset, we do all we can to ensure our employees are satisfied with their position within our company.

We have been expanding our service department, and are looking to grow our field work, and our local customer base. We need talented and personable people to help us do this.

To Apply, please reply to this ad with your resume. Only candidates selected for a pre screen will be contacted.

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Industrial Millwright
description:
Since 1953, ALMAG has built a reputation as an industry leader in extruding high-visual, tight tolerance, complex, thin-walled, lightweight and precision aluminum extrusions. Pushing the limits of industry standards, ALMAG is capable of providing solutions to some of the most complex designs by combining its skills, knowledge and experience with engineering to deliver best in class, quality solutions with the industry’s shortest lead times.

Recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, ALMAG understands that true customer satisfaction comes from delivering an exceptional service and a superior product. Our goal is to provide customers with peace of mind knowing that quality products, short lead times and customer satisfaction is our top priority through all four pillars of service — Design, Extrude, Fabricate and Finish. We believe in building strong relationships around reliability and ownership which go hand-in-hand with our core values; respect and fairness, humility, passion for progress and ownership. Recognizing that people create culture, our core values are fundamental drivers of our workplace environment.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Directly reports to the Maintenance Manager. Must communicate effectively with all plant personnel. Functionally responsible for the maintenance and efficient operation of all production and plant equipment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work without supervision in a safe manner maintaining a clean and orderly shop
  • Carry out all related safety procedures required such as Lock Out Tag Out
  • Proactively involved in maintenance to ensure that the plant and production equipment function with minimum downtime
  • Follow and take initiative as directed in PM maintenance as per ISO requirements
  • Accountable for all mechanical, fluidic, welding and plant equipment maintenance with minor electrical troubleshooting
  • Maintain the inventory of spare parts and their associated storage location
  • Ensure that spares used are replaced immediately with written notification
  • Respond to break-downs immediately and /or provide communication for repairs
  • Read and interpret machine drawings and schematics
  • Troubleshoot Hydraulic, Pneumatic and Electrical circuits
  • Repair, Overhaul, Fabricate, Assemble, Dismantle equipment using power tools, hand tools, machine tools and welding tools
  • Operate machine tools such as a Lathe, Milling machine, Drill press and various cutting tools to fabricate machine parts to dimensional specifications
  • Independently weld and fabricate to in order to repair machinery and improve production
  • Maintain all shop tools and equipment in good condition and notify deficiencies
  • Monitor equipment performance, document and evaluate potential problems for root cause solutions and improvements
  • Focus on continuous improvement of equipment performance to improve efficiency
  • Comply with all ISO and quality related policies, procedures and system requirements
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Experience

  • Candidates should have a minimum of 5 years’ experience as a Millwright/Maintenance Mechanic in related industrial maintenance
  • A strong understanding of hydraulics and Pneumatics is essential
  • Exposure to Electrical Controls and PLCs (Allen Bradley) would be a strong asset
  • Welding and Fabrication experience
  • Ability to read Electrical and mechanical drawings and schematics
  • High energy level, good creativity, self-confidence, time management and must be a team player
  • Able to work with minimum supervision in a safe and orderly manner
  • A solid understanding of the following equipment/technology; hand tools, drill press, lathe, crane and lifting equipment, multicenter and electrical instruments, cut-off saw, welding machine, forklift and scissor lift equipment, power tools, milling machine, torch and cutting equipment

Education

  • Possession of a valid Ontario Industrial Mechanic Millwright (433a) Trade Certification with minimum grade 12
  • Training or experience in troubleshooting related industrial maintenance machine’s

We offer a full and competitive benefits package including:

  • Profit sharing
  • Health care spending account
  • Education assistance program
  • Health and dental
  • Life AD&D
  • Long-term disability
  • Critical illness insurance
  • Gym memberships
  • Wellness programs
  • Monthly social committee activities

title: Mécanicien(ne) industriel (16653)
description:
Chez Produits forestiers Résolu, nous sommes une équipe dynamique, aux horizons variés.  Nous croyons qu'offrir à chacun les moyens de se réaliser est la clé de notre succès.  C'est pourquoi nous encourageons l'effort individuel, tout en soutenant le travail d'équipe.  Si vous souhaitez vous développer dans un nouvel emploi ou domaine, n'hésitez pas: posez votre candidature.

Description :
Relevant du Superviseur général, vos défis seront les suivants :
•    Travailler en collaboration avec le personnel des opérations afin de maximiser la productivité et diagnostiquer les problèmes reliés à la disponibilité des équipements;
•    Assurer l’exécution des bons de travail qui vous sont assignés et participer activement à l’application et l’amélioration de la démarche de fiabilité/maintenance;
•    Émettre des recommandations d’améliorations ou d’entretiens futurs dans une optique d’optimisation des équipements de l’usine;
•    Assurer un service d’entretien mécanique et préventif des équipements et ce, en travaillant de façon sécuritaire et dans le respect de l’environnement.
•    Poste permanent et à temps complet avec rémunération concurrentielle, régime de retraite et programme d’assurance groupe.
 

Exigences
•    Être  titulaire d’un diplôme d’études professionnelles (D.E.P.) en mécanique industrielle ou d’un diplôme d’études collégiales (D.E.C.) en génie mécanique;
•    Toute autre combinaison d’expérience et de formation jugée équivalente sera considérée.
•    Être dynamique, rigoureux, autonome et avoir le sens de l’organisation;
•    Détenir de bonnes compétences en communication, leadership et travail d’équipe;
•    Horaire de travail en continue de 4-5-5 jour-nuit

Veuillez poser votre candidature:  Section carrière https://www.pfresolu.com/Carrieres/

title: Industrial Mechanic Millwright
description:
Job Responsibilities

Reporting to the Maintenance Manager, this role is responsible for, but not limited to the following:

  • Troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve equipment failures as well as perform periodic inspections of equipment and systems
  • Perform mechanical repair & maintenance activities throughout the plant on equipment and facilities.
  • Motors, hydraulics & pneumatic systems, bearings & gearboxes. Water heating and cooling systems. Reading blueprints and schematics. Equipment installations & rigging.
  • Welding & fabrication.
  • Utilize Root Cause Analysis and Continuous Improvement to maximize equipment output and processes
  • Execute preventative maintenance activities including troubleshooting and repairs to all production equipment, hydraulic systems and pumps in a timely manner
  • Utilize the computerized maintenance management system for processing work orders, PM's and updating the equipment databases
  • Support divisional and corporate objectives including health & safety, productivity, continuous improvement, innovation, quality, and waste

Qualifications

  • Certified Industrial Millwright 433A (Red Seal ticket)
  • 2 -3 years of work experience preferably in a manufacturing environment
  • Exceptional mechanical aptitude and troubleshooting skills
  • Energetic and enthusiastic approach with the ability to work as part of an interdisciplinary team
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Knowledgeable of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and possesses a strong safety focus
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office applications and maintenance management software\\
  • Available and flexible to work in a fast paced environment, be self-driven to meet or exceed targets and work a flexible schedule that includes planned, unplanned and on-call shifts
  • Experience with electronics & PLCs. AC & DC motors and controls an asset.
  • Ability to operate specialized vehicles such as forklifts, scissor lifts, etc.
  • Physically fit & able to negotiate inclines, stairs and ladders Able to perform physically demanding activities while working in all types of extreme hot environments, both indoors and outdoors. The job requires bending, kneeling, crawling, stooping, and standing for long periods of time. Must be physically able to push, pull, and lift 40 lbs. Working in conditions may include exposure to noise, dust.
  • Willingness to work extended hours when and where required, including nights, weekends, and holidays.
  • Verbal and written communication skills / English

Rate of Pay

  • $38.00/hour
  • Shift Premiums

Shifts

  • Permanent, Full Time Position
  • 12 hr continental day/night shift, with 4-week turnaround
  • Averaging agreements in place
  • 84 hrs biweekly
  • with opportunity for OT
Location- Orangeville, ON

title: Mécanicien industriel
description:
St-Marys Cement - Usine McInnis opère une cimenterie à la fine pointe de la technologie, dont le rayonnement touche toute l'Amérique du Nord.

Notre mission est de fournir à nos clients des ciments de qualité supérieure, fabriqués et distribués selon les principes du développement durable.

Sous la responsabilité du Superviseur mécanique, le mécanicien industriel est responsable d'effectuer les entretiens, les réparations et la maintenance des divers équipements de l'usine afin d'en assurer le bon fonctionnement.


RESPONSABILITÉS

  • Inspecter, installer, entretenir et calibrer les instruments mécaniques industriels et les dispositifs connexes;
  • Effectuer les entretiens, les installations et le dépannage des divers équipements fixes et roulants de la production, ainsi que certains périphériques;
  • Exécuter les ordres de travail en lien avec le plan d'entretien préventif, prédictif et correctif des installations de l'usine;
  • Proposer des solutions lors de bris ou de non-performance d'équipements et procéder aux essais mécaniques pour identifier les éventuels problèmes;
  • Rédiger des rapports avec justesse et colliger les informations dans le système SAP.

COMPTÉTENCES ET APTITUDES

  • Facilité à travailler en équipe et bonne capacité de communication;
  • Capacité d'analyse, de résolution de problèmes et de priorisation;
  • Sens de l'initiative, autonomie et débrouillardise;
  • Connaissance et respect des normes de sécurité.

EXIGENCES

  • DEC en génie mécanique ou maintenance industrielle ou DEP en mécanique industrielle ou DEP en soudure;
  • De deux à dix ans d'expérience en maintenance industrielle, selon le niveau de scolarité;
  • Disponible jour et nuit sur un horaire 4-5-5-4.

AVANTAGES

  • Régime d'assurances collectives et un régime de retraite REER collectif.
  • Borne de rechargement pour voiture électrique.
  • Allocation mensuelle de conditionnement physique de 30 $ par mois, pour le gym, y compris les camps d'entraînement, les salles spécialisées, etc.
  • Plan de développement de carrière.

Statut de l'emploi : Permanent

Nous vous offronsde travailler dans une organisation en pleine croissance, où vous retrouverez un environnement de travail dynamique et convivial tout en contribuant à l'activité économique locale de la Gaspésie!

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - All Service Drilling
description:
The Geotech Drilling Group of Companies is hiring for a Heavy Duty Mechanic for our Alberta based subsidiary, All Service Drilling. this is an exciting role based in Airdrie, AB, working Monday to Friday with the potential for overtime. This dynamic role will allow for growth and further training within the drilling industry.

The Geotech Drilling Group of Companies remains sharply focused on being the drilling contractor of choice for our employees and clients, providing industry leading safety programs, technologically advanced equipment and positive, solution minded employees. For more information on All Service Drilling visit http://www.allservicedrilling.com/.

Key Responsibilities

  • Disassemble and reassemble components such as engines, transmissions, cooling systems, fuel and exhaust systems, breaks, clutches, differentials, hydraulics, electrical systems and lubrication systems
  • Inspect and test to detect faults and malfunctions in drill units, diesel compressors, hydraulic support equipment, high pressure water pumps
  • Diagnose faults or malfunctions using computerized and other testing equipment to determine extent of repair required
  • Perform duties that range from routine preventative maintenance to repairing major breakdowns, including troubleshooting and diagnostics
  • Contributing to the development of apprentices and working as part of a team to accomplish maintenance goals and targets.
  • Service attachments and working tools
  • Verify and repair emission control systems

Professional Experience / Qualifications

  • 3-5 years of experience with industrial heavy equipment including hydraulic equipment, diesel engines and compressors, high-pressure water pumps, drill units, diesel trucks, crawlers, and pumps
  • Ability to diligently organize work, make decisions, and set priorities
  • Valid driver's licence
  • Previous experience working on drilling equipment is an asset.
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Complete and pass a pre-employment drug & alcohol test

Education

  • High School Diploma or equivalent.
  • Preference will be given to individuals with their Red Seal trade qualifications in Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanics.

Compensation

At Geotech, we pride ourselves in offering a challenging and rewarding work environment. Our employees have the opportunity for career and professional growth through development and education.

In addition, our compensation benefit package includes competitive salaries and vacation packages, Health and Insurance benefit program, and Retirement Savings Plan.

If you are qualified for the position posted and are interested in being part of reshaping the future of Geotech Drilling, please contact us through our website at https://www.geotechdrilling.com/geotech-careers/job-opportunities/

title: MÉCANICIEN INDUSTRIEL
description:
Description du poste

Être mécanicien industriel chez EACOM Gogama, une filiale d'INTERFOR, c’est d’avoir le « coffre à outils » qui te permet de réparer/entretenir/souder/usiner/régler/chouchouter les équipements et la machinerie de la scierie. Tout ça pour que les opérations… opèrent. 

Enracinées dans les régions du nord de l’Ontario et du Québec, nos scieries transforment bien plus que du bois, elles améliorent nos communautés. 

Viens voir chez EACOM. On veut savoir de quel bois tu chauffes quand vient le temps de jouer dans les grosses machines. L’équipe t’attend !

Ce que tu vas faire concrètement :

  • Réparer les équipements : convoyeurs, composantes hydrauliques et pneumatiques, systèmes automatisés, etc. (incluant des travaux de soudure);
  • Identifier la cause des pannes ou du mal fonctionnement de la machinerie et effectuer les réparations nécessaires;
  • Installer/optimiser/régler tous les équipements de l'usine pour en maximiser l’efficacité;
  • Répondre aux situations d’urgence lors de bris mécaniques affectant les opérations;
  • Opérer des outils d'usinage pour fabriquer des pièces.

Ton profil pour bien réussir chez nous :

  • Efficace et organisé;
  • Analytique, consciencieux et rigoureux;
  • Joueur d’équipe avec de l’initiative;
  • Performant, mais sécuritaire (respect des normes en vigueur).
Qualifications

Le genre de vécu qui te servira :

  • DEC en mécanique industrielle ou DEP en maintenance industrielle (une expérience équivalente pourrait aussi bien faire);
  • Minimum 2 ans d’expérience en entretien d’équipements industriels (surtout si c’est dans l’industrie du sciage);
  • Le coffre à outils nécessaires pour ce travail.

SALAIRE ET HEURES :

  • 31,72 $ par heure (sans licence) - 35,38 $ certifié sceau rouge
  • Horaire - 7/7 – Quart de 12,5 heures
  • Rotation des quarts (le cas échéant) : rotation – jours et nuits

AVANTAGES:

  • L'assurance invalidité
  • Assurance dentaire
  • Pension
  • Assurance médicale complémentaire (p. ex. médicaments sur ordonnance, services paramédicaux, services et équipements médicaux)
  • Vacances payées

EXIGENCES PHYSIQUES:

  • Doit maintenir un état alerte et attentif
  • Nécessite de soulever, pousser et tirer des objets lourds 
  • Escaliers, échelles et escalade


Informations complémentaires

Chez EACOM, on est là pour toi.

EACOM supporte l’équité en matière d’emploi, la diversité est la bienvenue chez nous, en fait, on l’encourage !  Nous te contacterons si tu es sélectionné pour une entrevue et si tu as besoin d’accommodations particulières, laisse-le nous savoir. Toute information que tu nous envoies sera traitée avec respect et en toute confidentialité. Nos postes sont écrits au masculin pour répondre aux algorithmes de référencement, mais sache que tu es aussi LA BIENVENUE !

title: Banff, Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?:

Maintaining our fleet of 21 unique Ice Explorers, 16 Highway Coaches and other heavy duty equipment.

What perks can you expect?:
  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe  
  • Work experience in an  iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location  
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuitâ€™s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an  inclusive culture  and  make life-long friends  
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth  or future work at  other Pursuit  locations  
  • Access to one of the worldâ€™s most beautiful and iconic National Parks
What will you do in this job?:

As a Heavy Duty Mechanic at the Banff Shop, you will contribute to making the Transportation and BJC fleet as safe as possible for our guests. As a Heavy Duty Mechanic, our #1 Core value of Safety 1st starts with you, in ensuring the mechanical fitness of our motorcoaches, heavy equipment, light vehicle fleet and 21 unique Ice Explorers.

This is a multi-faceted position and can include any, or all, of the following:

  • Safety 1st! Ensure to follow adequate and proper safety procedures when performing any duties
  • Perform preventative maintenance
  • Diagnose equipment problems and determine repairs as needed
  • Adjust equipment and repair or replace defective parts
  • Test repaired equipment for proper performance
  • Service attachments and working tools
  • Maintain a clean and tidy work area and assist with cleaning duties in working environment
  • Maintain daily record of all works orders, part orders and other administrative tasks
  • Demonstrate continuous efforts to improve operations, decrease downtime and improve processes
  • Assist in training apprentice mechanics in the trade
  • Support colleagues and co-workers in their duties
  • Act as a coach and subject matter expert when it comes to everything vehicles
What skills and experience do you need for this job?:
  • Valid Alberta (or inter-provincial) Heavy Duty Mechanic Journeyman certification
  • CVIP license for Alberta
  • Experience troubleshooting and diagnostics on Detroit Diesel, CAT, Cummins, MTU and Allison engines/transmissions
  • Familiar with MCI & Prevost highway coaches
  • Class 1, 2 or 3 driverâ€™s licenses with airbrake (Q) endorsement an asset
  • Ability to supply own tools up to ¾â€ and impact drives
  • Ability to think outside the box with a positive attitude, and problem-solving skills
  • Mature, energetic, dependable, and self-motivated
  • Enjoy working with a team in a busy, fast-paced environment
  • Must enjoy working outdoors, even in challenging mountain weather conditions
  • Comfortable working on your feet for extended periods in an indoor/outdoor environment. Be prepared for all types of weather (Snow, Rain, Wind, Hail) at all times. The weather changes quickly in the park.
  • Must adhere to the Companyâ€™s Drug and Alcohol policy
  • Must meet the Organization grooming and appearance standards
  • To honor our commitment to be â€œAlways Honestâ€ all employees must consent to a criminal record check
  • Standard First-Aid or higher an asset
What will your work environment be like?:
  • Beautiful.  Youâ€™ll work in iconic, unforgettable and inspiring locations. Youâ€™ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. Youâ€™ll participate in team events â€“ and fun!  
  • Independent.  Youâ€™ll spend your days in and around  national parks.  
  • Remote.  Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog.  Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of  through  WiFi  
  • Busy.  You  need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required  

This job description describes this role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up.  We work as a team and believe that we succeed together â€“ these job duties may change based on the needs of the  team and company as a whole.  

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in  Alberta, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in  Canada  is required.  

 

EEO Information:Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic & Heavy Duty Mechanic Apprentice
description:
Come build with a BC Top Employer 2022 winner!

Jacob Bros Construction is immediately hiringa Heavy Duty Mechanic, and a Heavy Duty Mechanic Apprenticeto support our shop and maintenance facility in South Surrey, BC.

Heavy Duty Mechanic Requirements:
  • Interprovincial Red Seal Heavy Duty Mechanic trade certification
  • Valid Class 5 license with air brake endorsement required
  • Minimum of four (4) years’ Red Seal certified experience
  • Prior experience with Caterpillar, Hitachi, Deere, Komatsu equipment
  • CSTS certificate, First Aid and WHMIS certificate(s) are an asset
Appentice Heavy Duty Mechanic Requirements:
  • Registered 2nd, 3rd or 4th year Heavy Duty Mechanic Apprentice
  • Valid class 5 driver's license (or better), air endorsement a strong asset
  • Prior experience with Caterpillar, Hitachi, Deere, Komatsu equipment
  • CSTS certificate, First Aid and WHMIS certificate(s) are assets
Responsibilities:
  • Repair and service Caterpillar, Hitachi, Deere, Komatsu equipment both in the shop and in the field
  • Diagnose, identify and repair problems, faults and malfunctions in structural, mechanical or hydraulic systems
  • Maintain and repair vehicles including but not limited to: earth moving equipment, trucks, trailers and tracked equipment
  • Use hand and power tools to repair and perform maintenance on equipment
  • Take direction from shop Foreman and work harmoniously with co-workers to ensure all repairs and tests are performed satisfactorily
  • Other duties as assigned
Your ​Rewards:
  • Full-time, permanentemployment
  • Work 10-12/h days, 5-6 days per week
  • Earn overtime after8 hours per day, and double time after 12 hours per day
  • Group Medical, Extended Health and Dental Plan
  • Group RRSP contribution
  • Vacation pay
  • 5 Year Service Award (Trip for twoanywhere in North America)
  • Eligibility for up to $2000.00 Referral Bonus Program
​About Jacob Bros:

At Jacob Bros, our team of talented construction professionals is taking on some the most challenging projects in British Columbia's construction industry.

We are one of BC’s largest and most respected construction organizations, offering construction services in a variety of markets including heavy civil construction, major public infrastructure, and industrial, commercial, institutional and residential projects.

Jacob Bros has proudly served every major sector of Western Canada’s construction industry since 2008, and has been consistently recognized as a BC Top Employer.

Jacob Bros employs over 300 construction professionals, including staff and craft employees.

title: Industrial mechanic - Metcalfe, ON
description:
Job ID:  400825

 

Permacon, a CRH Company, is a leader and pioneer in the manufacturing of concrete masonry and landscaping products.  Permacon is a division of Oldcastle APG and operates 9 plants in Ontario and Quebec. 

 

We are currently looking for an Industrial Mechanician, to fill a position at our Metcalfe facility. The candidate must be available to work on dayshift during week or weekend, when required.

 

The incumbent will be mainly responsible for the reliability and good functioning of machines, equipment and systems.   

More specifically, he or she will be a self-starter, troubleshoot, repair, adjust, program and lead the preventative maintenance on mechanical components under his or her responsibility.  

 

The incumbent will also be involved in parts inventory, lead mechanical shutdowns, reporting, record keeping, housekeeping, and safety improvements.

 

Qualifications and requirement
 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or abilities required. 

 

  • Diploma in industrial mechanics or electromechanics
  • Electric competency
  • Minimum of three years of relevant experience in an industrial environment
  • Hydrolic and pneumatic experience
  • Machining experience
  • Know how to arc/tig welding
  • Knowing how to interpret mechanical parts
  • Demonstrated experience with hand tools

 

 

WHY WORK AT PERMACON ?

 

  • We offer a very competitive group insurance plan, including dental, healthcare, life insurance and benefits
  • Competitive salary
  • Pension fund
  • Permacon continuously strives to create a secure, respectful and inclusive work environment
  • Opportunity of career

 

 

 

 

 

APPLY NOW!

 

 

At Permacon, diversity is one of our main assets! We therefore invite visible minorities, ethnic minorities and people living with a disability to apply.

title: Millwright Mechanic
description:
Company Overview

Sherritt International is one of the worldâ€™s largest producers of nickel from lateritic sources with operations in Canada and Cuba. We pride ourselves on being a leading low-cost producer that generates sustainable prosperity for our employees, investors and the communities in which we operate. We are also the largest independent energy producer in Cuba, with extensive oil and power operations across the island.

Across all of Sherrittâ€™s operations, safety is our top priority and we are committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture.  Sherritt is proud to be an equal opportunity employer where all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, family/marital status, national origin or disability status.  We believe our employees should feel comfortable bringing their whole self to work where everyone is welcomed as they are.

Position Summary:

Reporting to the Supervisor, Maintenance Millwrights, the Millwright Mechanic will be accountable for contributing to the ongoing maintenance in the nickel, cobalt, leach, utilities and fertilizer plants within the Sherritt Metals refinery.

Accountabilities:

  • Complete ongoing maintenance on and accountable for the time, quality and cost for maintaining Pumps, Compressors, Conveyors, Turbines, Gear boxes, Large Stationary and Rotating Equipment plus other daily routine maintenance.
  • Review and understand the scopes of work provided by the Crew Leader and/or Planner on a daily basis including routine maintenance and shutdown activities.
  • Actively participate in safe work procedure reviews, development, and implementation.
  • Prepare accurate and detailed service reports and update existing documentation as required.
  • Adhere to all safety standards and policies and supporting documentation.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Millwright Trade Certification is required
  • Minimum 5 years of industrial experience
  • Flexible to work regular/periodic shift work is required
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Strong technical abilities and mechanical aptitude
  • Excellent work ethic, attendance and proven positive work performance

What Sherritt can Offer You:

  • Competitive wage with comprehensive benefits and retirement savings programs that holistically support employee well-being
  • Generous paid time off to support and empower employee work/life balance
  • Ongoing learning and professional development opportunities within a diverse, inclusive and dynamic work environment

Application Deadline:  The job posting will remain open until a qualified candidate is selected.  

We thank all candidates for their application.  Only qualified candidates will be contacted directly and engaged in the interview process.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic (FT)
description:
Recon Metal Ltd. is seeking an experienced Heavy Equipment Mechanic for our shop located centrally in Ogden Calgary.

Summary:
As the Heavy Equipment Mechanic, you will be responsible for performing preventative maintenance, inspections, and repairs to all off-road equipment, excavators, material handlers, skid steers, and other equipment as necessary. Recon Metal Ltd. offers competitive wages, a consistent year-round employment schedule, and a comprehensive benefits program. 

Job Duties:
  • Inspect and perform preventative maintenance  
  • Troubleshoot and diagnose potential failures and repair 
  • Evaluate parts required for maintenance and repairs and communicate with the parts department  
  • Complete all necessary maintenance and repair documents  
  • Maintain a tidy, organized, and safe workplace 

Required Skills and Experience:
  • Licensed Heavy Equipment Technician or Off-Road Journeyman/women Certificate.
  • Familiar with diagnostic software.
  • Experience with Cat ET is considered an asset.
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing.
  • Computer literacy, including excel and email.
  • Strong work ethic, integrity, and organization.
  • Own toolbox and tools.

Job type:
Full-time, permanent.

Salary:
$50-$60

Schedule: 
  • 10hr shift.
  • Monday to Friday.
  • Overtime.
  • Weekend repairs when required.

title: Journeyperson Millwright (Industrial Mechanic) (Hiring Bonus $1,000*)
description:
Hiring Bonus: total amount of $1,000*

  • $500 after completion of the Probationary Period (90 working days)
  • $500 after One Year of continuous employment (365 days)

*Note: New Hires referred by current employees of Tree Island will not be eligible for the Hiring Bonus.

 

COMPANY BACKGROUND

Tree Island Steel Ltd.  (â€œTree Island Steelâ€ or the â€œCompanyâ€) is a publicly listed company whose shares are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol TSL.  Headquartered in Richmond, British Columbia, since 1964, Tree Island Steel, through its four operating facilities in Canada and the United States, produces wire products for a diverse range of industrial, residential construction, commercial construction, agricultural, and specialty applications. Its products include bright wire; a broad array of fasteners, including packaged, collated and bulk nails; stucco reinforcing products; concrete reinforcing mesh; fencing and other fabricated wire products. The Company markets these products under the Tree IslandÂ®, HalsteelÂ®, True-SpecÂ®, K-LathÂ®, TI-WireÂ® and Tough StrandÂ® brand names. Tree Island Steel operates in Canada under Tree Island Industries Ltd and in the United States under Tree Island Wire (USA) Inc.

 What Youâ€™ll Do:

Our Millwrights work within our Maintenance team and play an important role in providing maintenance to our manufacturing equipment and machinery on both an emergency- and preventative- maintenance basis.

Millwrights report to the Maintenance Manager or a designate. Within our manufacturing facility, we have a variety or equipment and machinery including galvanizing lines, wiredraw machines, mesh machines, nail machines, packing lines, etc. Safety is our # 1 priority.

The position offers a competitive hourly rate as per the table below and includes a comprehensive benefits package.

Membership in the Teamsters Union, Local 213 is required.

Shift

$ 42.20

 

What Youâ€™ll Bring:

The successful candidate requires a BC or Inter-Provincial Millwright Trade Qualification with a minimum of 5 years' related work experience in a heavy industrial environment that includes the maintenance and repair of:

  • overhead cranes;
  • gas furnaces;
  • pneumatic and hydraulic equipment;
  • gear reducers; and
  • conveyors.

Competitive Wages & the Opportunity for Overtime

Tree Island Steel Ltd.  (â€œTree Island Steelâ€ or the â€œCompanyâ€) is a publicly listed company whose shares are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol TSL.  Headquartered in Richmond, British Columbia, since 1964, Tree Island Steel, through its four operating facilities in Canada and the United States, produces wire products for a diverse range of industrial, residential construction, commercial construction, agricultural, and specialty applications.

Its products include bright wire; a broad array of fasteners, including packaged, collated and bulk nails; stucco reinforcing products; concrete reinforcing mesh; fencing and other fabricated wire products. title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - (Job Number: 43593)
description:
Description43593
Qualifications

Getting your hands dirty does not bother you at all. You love working with a variety of hand tools, power tools and computer diagnostic tools. Working on major and minor repairs, or modifications on any equipment you could get your hands on excites you. You are highly skilled and you are an expert when it comes to mechanical processes including inspection, maintenance, and repair of LRT support equipment.


City of Edmonton’s Light Rail Transit (LRT) Section in the Transportation Department is seeking a Heavy Duty Mechanic who will diagnose, problem solve, plan and perform repairs to LRT Track support equipment to ensure they are safe and reliable for the Track Maintenance section. More reasons why you want this job!


Your success will be measured by your ability to ensure there are no breakdowns in equipment and reduction in overtime, while meeting specified timelines.


With a focus on the City of Edmonton’s Cultural Commitments to Safe, Helpful, Accountable, Integrated and Excellent, you will:

  • Troubleshoot, repair and overhaul all auxiliary and associated rail maintenance equipment such as but not limited to: tampers, regulators, hydrovacs, locomotives and heavy duty rolling stock
  • Complete preventative maintenance checks and diagnostic work on LRT vehicles and equipment including electrical and hydraulic systems
  • Perform service and repairs, modifications on engines, suspension, brakes, HVAC equipment and high rail equipment
  • Complete paperwork for inspections, authorization forms and provincial certification forms - manually and on a computer
  • Perform re-railing procedures and off-loading of light rail vehicles as required
  • Identify and estimate the resources and materials require to complete the job
  • Maintain equipment inventory including parts and tools for preventative maintenance service schedule
  • Respond to disabled equipment on or off site and perform repairs or recovery.

title: Industrial Millwright
description:
Come join us! The Molded Products Division of Windsor Mold Group is a full service supplier of interior and exterior injection molded plastic components and assemblies, providing innovative solutions for automotive plastics applications to original equipment manufacturers and their suppliers. We offer a great work environment offering industry-competitive pay and benefits.

We are currently seeking apprentice candidates for Industrial Millwright for the Automotive Components Division Emrick Plastics, Windsor to perform a wide variety of Maintenance functions that require a thorough knowledge of machine assembly, procedures, and practices.

DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Read blueprints, diagrams and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Install, align, dismantle and move stationary industrial machinery and mechanical equipment, such as pumps, fans, tanks, conveyors, furnaces and generators according to layout plans using hand and power tools
  • Operate hoisting and lifting devices such as cranes, jacks and lift trucks to position machinery and parts during the installation, set-up and repair of machinery
  • Inspect and examine machinery and equipment to detect and investigate irregularities and malfunctions
  • Install, troubleshoot and maintain power transmission, vacuum, hydraulic and pneumatic systems, and programmable logic controls
  • Adjust machinery and repair or replace defective parts
  • Operate machine tools such as lathes and grinders to fabricate parts required during overhaul, maintenance or set-up of machinery
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other routine maintenance work on machinery
  • Assemble machinery and equipment prior to installation using hand and power tools and welding equipment
  • Plastic injection machine experience preferred
  • Must be available to work rotating shifts

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High school diploma or equivalent (GED)
  • Completion of a in class portion and registered for journeyperson apprentice an asset

Windsor Mold is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation we will work with you to meet your needs. Please review our accessibility policies on our website at www.wmgtec.com

title: Industrial Millwright
description:
Hiring Industrial Millwright / experienced

  • Proficient in welding , machining and fabricating skills

  • Ability to read blueprints

  • Highly motivated

  • Knowledgeable in Industrial maintenance , and fabricating skills

  • Able to work all shifts, after hours call-in and on weekends;

  • Keeping all equipment operational and minimizing downtime

  • Able to investigate faults and providing preventive maintenance



Full time , Permanent position

The Employer is a large , established company in GTA area ,

title: Field Service Technician / Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Williams Machinery has been selling, renting, and fixing equipment for over 100 years. We also train people in all corners of British Columbia on how to operate machinery safely and effectively. From forklifts to skid steers, excavators, loaders, and dump trucks, Williams Machinery services industries such as warehousing, milling, construction, forestry, recycling, and more with their equipment needs. Join our award-winning company and experience working at a Gold Certified Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Company, and one of BCâ€™s Top Employers. 

Are you interested in servicing a diverse range of equipment, including Bobcat, Linde, Doosan, Clark, and Vermeer? From skid steers to excavators and more, our service teams handle it all. We are looking for a Service Technician to join our Williams Machinery dealership in the Surrey team. Reporting to the Service Manager, a successful candidate is customer-focused and a team player who can work independently. No matter which industry you have experience in, we hone your transferable skills and teach you all about the ever-changing world of equipment!

Apply Today!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Efficiently and effectively evaluate the working condition of, diagnose, assemble/disassemble, order parts for, and repair equipment;
  • Utilize OEM diagnosis software and interface tools to repair of Material Handling Equipment, Arial Equipment and other Heavy Duty Equipment as required.
  • Work closely with the OEM Technical support group;
  • Interpret work orders and technical manuals;
  • Perform routine scheduled, planned maintenance services and safety inspections;
  • Continually assess service task hazards and ensure work is performed safely, and to accepted standards;
  • Road test equipment and check attachment operation as required
  • Make recommendations regarding the extent of repairs and suggest methods of improvement;
  • Build and maintain customer relationships while at worksite and through Service Advisors;
  • Complete detailed service reports, time cards, warranty documentation and other documentation;
  • Ensure high levels of customer satisfaction, through quality of repairs;
  • Think logically and keep up with changes in technology;
  • Employ workplace health and safety practices at all times;
  • Protect all company assets while in use from damage or theft and complete regular service truck cleaning, organization and servicing;
  • Be motivated and able to work in a challenging environment with minimal supervision;
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:  

  • Heavy-Duty Journeyman certification or equivalent (no-licensed technicians with at least four years of working experience as HD mechanics)
  • Experience in LPG / Gas engine service, repair, and overhaul;
  • Strong troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to contribute positively to the team environment
  • Willingness and desire to learn
  • Intermediate English language skills (Spoken and written)
  • A valid driver's license and current Driver's abstract may be required. *

 

Benefits and Perks:

*Our Service Technicians enjoy a competitive remuneration package with the benefits of having membership in the International Union of Operating Engineers. The salary range for a service technician varies from $38.01/hr to $44.64/hr, depending on the experience and qualifications. A valid driver's license and current Driverâ€™s abstract may be required.*

 

Who We Are: Our people are at the core of what we do. We take the time to hire the right people who share our 5 core values, train them, coach them, and reward them for their successes.

  1. Build Trust â€“ Build trust with others and & each other.
  2. Be a Team Player â€“ Commit to working together to win.
  3. Be Customer Focused â€“ â€œWowâ€ customers so they become â€œRaving Fansâ€.
  4. Support Community â€“ Care for our people, our community, and the planet.
  5. Deliver Results â€“ Know what you need to do and get it done.

 

Due to the volume of applicants, please accept our apologies in advance, as only those candidates shortlisted will be contacted. We sincerely appreciate your interest in our company. Thank you for exploring career opportunities with Williams Machinery.

title: Millwright Mechanic
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

Maintains, fabricates and repairs all mechanical equipment in the facility by ensuring operation of machinery and mechanical equipment.

Responsibilities:
  • Redesigns and rebuilds paint line equipment including, air motors, paint pumps, water pumps, vacuum pumps and systems, and paint atomizers using blueprint and sketches;
  • Maintains, fabricates and repairs all mechanical components in the facility as required;
  • Performs all preventative maintenance, responds to production breakdowns throughout the facility moves and installs standard equipment;
  • Dismantles and assembles complicated machines to determine cause of problem;
  • Completes preventative maintenance requirement on moulding machines pneumatic tools, injection robots conveyer systems, vacuum systems, air compressors, paint robots, paint pump, air motors and troubleshooting malfunctions;
  • Locates sources of problems by observing mechanical devices, using precision measuring of testing instruments, micrometers, vaniers and telescopic gauges;
  • Lift equipment and heavy moulds using hoisting, cranes and lift trucks;
  • Determines changes in dimensional measurements or requirements by using callipers, micrometers, depth gauges, tape measures and measuring scale and weight scales;
  • Adjusts functional parts of devices by using plumb bobs and straightedges;
  • Installs new equipment and ensures levelling of equipment and assists supplier with testing;
  • Prepares work report at the end of each shift;
Qualifications:

Ontario Millwrightâ€™s Certificate.

Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Now Hiring

HEAVY DUTY MECHANIC / JOURNEYMAN

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add  full-time, Heavy Duty Mechanics to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Located at 490 Lucas Avenue, Winnipeg Manitoba and reporting to the Service Manager, the Heavy Duty Mechanic with Canada Cartage Systems, will be performing preventative maintenance on our fleet. This will include carrying out diagnostic testing and repairs to primarily OTR truck & trailer equipment, using modern maintenance practices. This position is maintenance shop based, however our mechanics may be called on to carry out service calls and perform test drives to adequately service our fleet.

Available shift:

Monday to Friday - 6:00am - 2:30pm (5 day work week)

 

Responsibilities:

  • Performs assigned repairs and preventive maintenance services
  • Performs inspections, diagnostics and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake, and air systems on vehicles and equipment
  • Utilizes vehicle on board diagnostics and diagnostic laptop/software to troubleshoot faults & failures in order to repair as required
  • Performs all work within the Standard Repair Times (SRTs)
  • Conducts safety checks on all vehicles and equipment
  • Completes the required paperwork, enters repair into Transman FMS program. Including detail of vehicle repair, parts used, and repair time
  • Reviews, completes, repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports. As assigned
  • Performs maintenance related repairs as required
  • Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate / OSHA Standards
  • Performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures
  • Is responsible for the quality of their work and the safety of the equipment that is worked on

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • Licensed Heavy Duty Mechanic
  • Proficient in performing various diagnostics, tests, and repairs with a diagnostic computer system
  • Physical requirements of this position will include the ability to push, pull, drag, and lift items up to 50 pounds, and occasionally must work at shoulder level with equipment weighing up to 25 pounds
  • Must be able to supply your own set of hand tools to perform basic repairs
  • Must have steel toe work boots. We provide an annual allowance for new boots and we provide all PPE and coveralls and a heavy parka, as you will primarily be working outside.
  • Must hold Safety of self & equipment as highest priority
  • CVI inspector license is beneficial
  • Must successfully pass a background check
  • Have your own hand tools

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

  • No mandatory overtime.
  • Minimal outside mobile work (only boosting).
  • Heated shop equipped with pits for easy servicing.
  • Uniforms provided.
  • Recession-proof business model, steady hours all year around.
  • Well maintained, modern fleet (mostly 2018 and newer).
  • Performance based remuneration.
  • Online OEM Education (Navistar, Cummins).
  • Comprehensive benefits (life, disability, medication, dental, vision, RRSP and more).
  • 3 paid sick days per year.
  • Group discounts (Costco, Hertz, Bell, GMC, Lenovo, Goodlife Fitness and more).
  • Tool, boot and winter coat allowance.
  • College tuition fees reimbursement for apprentices.
  • Solid career advancement opportunities.


Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits.

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

 

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Rempel Brothers Concreteis currently looking for a responsible, safe, and dependable2nd to4th year Apprenticeor Heavy Duty Mechanic/Commercial Transport Mechanicto join our local team on our afternoon shift. As a Mechanic you will be responsible for the preventative and repair maintenance, and troubleshooting on all heavy mobile equipment.
$41.91 /hour

Who We Are:

Rempel Brothers Concreteis part of the Lehigh Hanson group of companies. Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.
With our diverse product lines and locations across North America, there are opportunities to explore different roles and work on a variety of exciting and interesting projects. At Lehigh Hanson, we believe our employees play a key role in the company’s success and future growth.

We offer:

  • Secure, long-term employment
  • Competitive wage and benefits package
  • Training and development
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • OT available
What You Will Get to Do:
  • Lubricate and perform breakdown maintenance and scheduled repairs of mixer trucks and other equipment as required to achieve optimum performance.
  • Operate and inspect machines or heavy equipment to diagnose problems.
  • Ensure that all equipment repairs are performed accurately to the manufacturer standards.
  • Test mechanical products and equipment after repair or assembly to ensure proper performance and compliance with specifications.
  • Perform other miscellaneous mechanical and maintenance duties as assigned.
Who We Are Looking For:
  • Valid Interprovincial or Red Seal Journeyman ticket or2nd to 4th year apprentice
  • 2 years related experience.
  • Proficiency in servicing transmissions, rear ends, running gear, electrical, pneumatic and hydraulic systems on mixer trucks is an asset.
  • Understanding of DOT inspection requirements.
  • Proficient computer skills MS Office.
  • Experience with formal maintenance programs.
  • Requires lifting, kneeling, bending, twisting, pushing and pulling, working at elevated heights, at times in tight and awkward positions.

title: Industrial Mechanic/Millwright (Oiler)
description:
Job Description:

 

 

Do you want to work for a stable, growing organization that reaches back more than 130 years?   Our steel tube and pipe products have helped build landmarks and buildings in North America; Come build your career at Zekelman Industries!

Zekelman Industries is searching for a Industrial Maintenance Mechanic/Millwright (Oiler) for our Atlas Tube Harrow, Ontario location.  

 

Only applications submitted online will be accepted. Please do not drop off your application or call the Harrow facility.

 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Need to be able to work steady midnights
  • Work safely following Ontario Health & Safety Act and workplace safety practices set forth by Atlas Tube policy
  • Repair and maintain mechanical production and facilities equipment
  • Fabricate, assemble or repair components and assemblies to make ready for use on production and facilities equipment.
  • Precision machinery lubrication.
  • Strong hydraulics background & knowledge.
  • Responsible for the installation, preventative maintenance and modification of all production and/or facilities mechanical equipment: Mills, Slitters, Cranes, Conveyors, Coolant and Lubrication Systems, Exhaust Systems, other as required.
  • Work within a Team environment as well as individually and participate in Team meetings as requested.
  • Perform emergency maintenance work to maintain a high levels of Overall Equipment Effectiveness (O.E.E.)
  • Contribute to root cause analysis efforts and continuous improvement toward failure reduction/elimination.
  • Knowledge of Hydraulics
  • Initiate follow up work orders for open concerns.
  • Specify part requirement details for planned work.
  • Provide continuous improvement suggestions which improve PM activity effectiveness and the reduction of unanticipated failures.
  • Report discrepancies in drawings and BOM for subsequent correction
  • Fabricate, machine (lathe, grinder, mill, etc.), weld, fit/assemble components and assemblies as required in support of planned and unplanned maintenance.
  • Document full details of work activities with respect to symptom/s, root cause, extent of damage, corrective action/s.
  • Use the SAP - Computerized Maintenance Management System to capture daily work activities and locate parts.
  • Maintain high levels of 5S in within defined work and storage areas.
  • Other duties as assigned.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES:

  • Achieved a Certificate of Qualification Industrial Maintenance Mechanic within the Ontario College of Trades Apprenticeship Industrial Mechanic (Millwright) Training Standard.      
  • Bend, twist, stand, sit, kneel, crawl, push and pull.   Able to reach in all directions.
  • Walk and stand for extended periods of time to cover 12-hour shifts
  • Other physical requirements as needed for job.
  • Lead and promote health and safety work practices as required by regulatory agencies and company policy.
  • Regular, full-time, predictable onsite attendance per the posted schedule is an essential function of this rol

Zekelman Industries offers competitive compensation and excellent benefits. In addition, we have an amazing tuition assistance program and incentives.

We are Zekelman Industries.

We manufacture superior quality tubular and related products, and provide outstanding service for our valued customers.

We seek to continuously advance the skills and opportunities of our employees, utilizing the latest technology and management tools available to consistently increase profitability and the enterprise value of Zekelman Industries and of our customers.
