title: Apprentice Millwright / Industrial Mechanic
description:
DynaIndustrial specializes in custom design, manufacturing and repair of heavy industrial equipment for the steel industry, off shore oil equipment, mining equipment and pipe mill equipment. Visit www.dynaindustrial.comto learn more.

We are looking for a talented Industrial Mechanic/ Millwright with 1-3 years of experience. We are looking for an individual that has a positive outlook and a proven track record. Join our team and use your skills to contribute to great quality results. This is a full time permanent, in shop position. 

We are seeking someone that has the ability to complete work such as;

  • Rebuild various types of industrial equipment
  • Perform work requiring a working knowledge of welding processes and practices
  • Check tools and equipment regularly and report defects or unusual conditions to supervisor
  • Operate overhead cranes, forklift and trucks to install or transport materials, equipment and tools
  • Able to diagnose failure mode and include a written technical report
  • Measure components to determine repair or replacement needs
  • Select and source replacement parts as required
  • Hydraulic system installation and repair
  • Interpret drawings and sketches; plan working procedure, including tool and material requirements
  • Assembly of custom designed industrial and mining equipment that includes mechanical, hydraulic and electrical components
  • Diagnose failure mode
  • Disassemble, reassemble, pressure test.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Capable of working a day shift and night shift rotation
  • Current CWB Welding Tickets is an asset

Benefits:

  • Complete Full Featured Benefits Package
  • Matching RRSP contributions
  • Competitive wages
  • Regular performance discussions & advancement opportunity
  • Work/ life balance focus
  • Team work Environment

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

Our Power & HVAC Rental team can take care of our customers’ power and HVAC needs with more than 900 MW of power in North America, dedicated technicians and 24/7 real-time response.

We offer the broadest range of power and climate control solutions across various industries including but not limited to refining and petrochemical; electrical solutions; disaster and restoration; industrial manufacturing; utility and power generation; construction services; sports and entertainment, more.  

As a Service Tech II within the Power/HVAC division at United Rentals, you’ll use your skills to perform maintenance tasks as well as minor repairs on equipment in a safe and professional manner. You will be responsible for the maintenance and repair of diesel engines, HVAC equipment, and dehumidification/air purification equipment. Every day, you can improve and challenge yourself, and if you have the desire and ambition, you’ll have the potential to work towards higher level Tech roles in our Service Department. Like every member of our team, we will rely on you to provide exceptional customer service to our customers.

If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. We'll provide the training, tools, the technology and the support you need to do the job right. You will also be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals.

Additional duties include the following:

  • Maintenance and repair of mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and diesel systems on a variety of rental and customer equipment and tools

  • Responsible for service documentation

  • Occasional travel to customer sites

  • Demonstrate equipment for customers

  • Assist with pick-up and delivery of equipment & parts

  • Other duties assigned as needed

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma or equivalent

  • 1-2 years of experience with repairing and maintaining diesel engines or HVAC equipment

  • Intermediate diagnostic and repair skills for mechanical, hydraulic, diesel, pneumatic and other systems

  • Basic understanding of schematics and diagrams

  • Own the tools applicable to position

  • Superior customer service, teamwork and verbal/written communication skills

  • Valid driver's license with acceptable driving record

  • Ability to frequently lift items up to 45 lbs.

Job Code = Service Tech II-Tool - 6N0005-018

As a Specialty Tools Tech II at United Rentals, you’ll use your skills to perform manual and maintenance tasks as well as minor repairs of specialty tools in a safe and professional manner. Every day, you can improve and challenge yourself, and if you have the desire and ambition, you’ll have the potential to work towards higher level Tech roles in our Service Department. Like every member of our team, we will rely on you to provide exceptional customer service to our customers.

Your strong work ethic, reliability and positive attitude will make you an asset to our branch and entire organization. If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. You will be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals. Excellence in this challenging and rewarding position paves the way for advancement opportunities.

Additional duties include the following:

  • Perform maintenance check on rental equipment before and after use

  • Report machine condition to Management

  • Perform routine repairs on Tools with some supervision

  • Perform major repairs under direct supervision of higher level service technicians

  • Recognize and communicate the need for parts and inventory

  • Maintain paperwork/electronic documentation of work performed (work orders) in a complete and timely manner on a daily/job basis

  • Assist with pick-up and delivery of equipment & parts

  • Checkout, familiarize, and demonstrate a wider array of more complex Tools for customers

  • Other duties assigned as needed

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma or equivalent

  • 1-2 years of experience repairing/maintaining Specialty Tools and equipment; or trade school graduate

  • Demonstrate mechanical aptitude and working knowledge of tools

  • Basic understanding of schematics and diagrams

  • Basic knowledge of diagnostic equipment

  • Must own tools applicable to position

  • Valid driver's license with acceptable driving record

  • Superior customer service, teamwork and verbal/written communication skills

  • Ability to frequently lift items up to 45 lbs.

Job Code = Service Tech II-Trucking Center - 6N0005

As a Service Tech II in a Trucking Center at United Rentals, you’ll use your skills to perform maintenance, preventive maintenance and minor repairs of Commercial and Utility trucks in a safe and professional manner. Every day, you can improve and challenge yourself, and if you have the desire and ambition, you’ll have the potential to work towards higher level Tech roles in our Service Department. Like every member of our team, we will rely on you to provide exceptional customer service to our customers.

If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. You will be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals. Plus, you will have the opportunity to relocate to one of our 1,000+ locations.

Additional duties include the following:

  • Perform maintenance, preventive maintenance and repair of commercial and utility trucks  and tools involving mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and diesel systems

  • Maintain paperwork/electronic documentation of work performed (work orders) in a complete and timely manner on a daily basis

  • Demonstrate a wide array of commercial and utility trucks for customers

  • Assist with pick-up and delivery of trucks & parts

  • Other duties assigned as needed

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma or equivalent

  • Valid driver's license with acceptable driving record

  • CDL preferred or the ability to get

  • 1-2 years of automotive/ light truck and/or diesel experience for repairing/maintaining commercial and utility trucks; or trade school graduate

  • Must own tools applicable to position

  • Basic understanding of schematics and diagrams

  • Superior customer service, teamwork and verbal/written communication skills

  • Ability to frequently lift items up to 45 lbs.

At United Rentals, the largest equipment rental company, we believe that it takes great employees to build a great organization – and we’re passionate about helping our people grow professionally and embrace teamwork in everything they do. Our culture is based on our corporate values and centers on mutual respect, job satisfaction, diversity and a shared responsibility to build a better future.

What's in it for you?

U.S. Full Time roles:  Best in class benefits offering includes medical, dental, vision, flex spending and health savings accounts;  401(k) retirement with company match; life and disability insurance; and paid time off including sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental leave.  Comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

U.S. Part Time roles: Benefits offering includes 401(k) retirement with company match/RRSP; paid time off including sick, vacation and holidays; and comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

Canada: Best in class benefits package which includes medical, dental & vision, RRSP/DPSP*, paid time off, comprehensive training and development, and career growth opportunities.

*Offered for full time roles, part time eligibility in select provinces

United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Location: Calgary, AB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/18/2022Job ID: 9S525818418Category: Engineering & Technical

Join a top employer and advance your career. David Aplin Group has partnered with a Sparwood, British Columbia-based company to hire an experienced Heavy Duty Mechanic.

 

Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, Heavy Duty Mechanic is responsible for maintaining the fleet of mining equipment in a shop or field environment. The shift schedule is 4 days on 4 days off! Offer a full relocation bonus.

 


Perks & Benefits: 

Permanent full-time tradespeople are offered a competitive compensation package that includes: 

  • Comprehensive Benefits Plan including but not limited to medical, dental, and vision
  • Retirement Package
  • Two Annual Bonus Plans
  • Trades Retention Bonus
  • Relocation Assistance
  • Employee Share Purchase Plan
  • Healthy Lifestyle Account

 

Responsibilities: 

  • Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures
  • Perform duties that range from routine preventative maintenance to repairing major breakdowns, including troubleshooting and diagnostics
  • Disassemble and reassemble components such as engines, transmissions, cooling systems, fuel and exhaust systems, breaks, clutches, differentials, hydraulics, electrical systems, and lubrication systems
  • Provide innovative solutions and best practices
  • Diagnose, maintain, and repair mobile off-road mining equipment including haul trucks, graders, bulldozers, excavators, shovels, loaders, and other heavy equipment

 

Qualifications:

  • Valid Interprovincial Red Seal Journeyperson’s Heavy Duty Mechanic or Heavy-Duty Technician Certification
  • Valid driver’s license
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work independently or as part of a team
  • Previous mining experience is an asset

 

Job ID: 9S525818418

 

If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted. 

 

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com


#LI-DNP #IND-DNP

title: Millwright Mechanic
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW

Knoll is a constellation of design-driven brands and people, working together with our clients to create inspired modern interiors. Since 1938, we’ve been thinking about how people interact with their environments, and how their environments impact what they do. Our strength in office systems, seating, furniture, textiles, leather, architectural accessories allows us to compose integrated solutions from products and services that naturally work together.

To learn more, visitwww.knoll.com

POSITION PROFILE

We are looking for a self-motivated individual who pay close attention to detail and has the desire to learn and grow in a fast paced environment.

• Repair, install and troubleshoot CNC and other numerically controlled industrial machines
• Able to evaluate, prepare and execute preventative and predictive maintenance schedules
• Troubleshooting/repairing/installing of wood processing equipment with a working knowledge of electrical to allow efficient repair/replacement results
• Plan, organize & perform assigned tasks in sequence with minimum supervision & direction
• Assist the production lines with changeovers and set ups
• Must own a full complement of proper tools to perform tasks
• Must be able to read and interpret drawings, sketches, OEM manuals and related technical data
• Assess parts needed to repair equipment, create purchase requests
• Ability to work in a team environment
• Able to take the initiative to solve problems, where appropriate
• Must be willing to cross-train in various areas of the department as required
• Follow all Knoll safety policies and procedures
• Maintain a clean and safe working environment
• Participate and maintain 5S in the workplace
• Maintain and follow the ISO standard operating procedures
• Ability to work in a multi-shift environment including flexible hours and weekends
• Participate in and contribute to the continuous improvement process

REQUIRED SKILLS:

• Licensed Millwright, certified to work in Ontario as an industrial millwright
• Knowledge of Hydraulic, Pneumatic, Pipefitting and Welding
• Intermediate to advanced CNC and servo systems knowledge
• High School diploma or equivalent
• Must be able to communicate in English (both oral and written)

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:

• Minimum five (5) years of related experience
• Machine shop experience
• Working knowledge of a Computerized Maintenance Management System

We are an Equal Employment opportunity employer. Employment selection and related decisions are made without regard to race, color, sex, religion, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, genetic information, veteran status or any other characteristic protected under federal or provincial law.

title: Industrial Millwright
description:
Duties & Responsibilities:
• Proficiently and safely troubleshoot, repair, install, inspect, adjust, all types of mechanical machinery and equipment in the manufacturing plant
• Repair and install piping, pneumatics, hydraulic systems
• Fabricate and install machine guards, guard rails and other non-structural welding
• Apply preventive and predictive maintenance techniques including lube oil analysis, vibration analysis and thermal imaging
• Utilize computerized work order system to report on completion of assigned tasks and recommend further actions.
• Read and interpret equipment manuals, drawings and work instructions.
• Respond to facility emergencies
• Perform other duties as assigned Required Education, 

Requirements

Skills and Qualifications
· Valid 433A licence, Industrial Mechanic (Millwright)
· Strong service and troubleshooting and preventative maintenance experience in a manufacturing facility
· Ability to prioritize work with input from maintenance and production supervisors and other
· Work closely with other CGT trades to assist troubleshooting and expedite repairs
· Compressed air, chilled water, steam and thermal oil piping
· Hydraulics and Pneumatic systems experience
· Pneumatic conveying and batch processing
· Conveyors, rollers · Bearings, gear reducers, couplings, belt and chain drives. Precision alignment experience. Fractional to 400 HP.
· Rebuilding and installation of centrifugal, diaphragm and gear pumps
· Rebuilding and installation of fans and blowers
· Ability and experience in safely rigging and lifting machine components with hoists, chainfalls, forklifts etc
· Machinery lubrication
· Support building plumbing and sprinkler systems
· Excellent communications skills
· Basic computer skills and experience using work order systems
· Experience in thermoplastic sheet film manufacturing or other web fed processes including printing, laminating, winding, and conveyors (preferred). · Operate forklifts, scissor and boom lifts and other mobile equipment
· Must demonstrate and be committed to safe work practices
· Ability to work in a fast paced environment
· Must be able to work rotating shifts Monday – Friday, on a weekly rotation

Benefits

• Overtime pay
• Shift premium
• Vacation pay
• Company pension
• Extended health care
• Dental care
• Disability insurance
• Vision care
• Life insurance
• Tuition reimbursement
• Tool replacement plan
• Safety and technical training provided
• Work clothing and PPE provided

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic (FT)
description:
Please Note: Any applicant must provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19, a condition of employment, subject to any accommodation required according to applicable human rights legislation.
All safety-sensitive positions will require pre-employment screening which includes drug and alcohol screening.

  • Position Title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
  • Work Location: Nisku
  • Title of manager this position reports to: Fleet Maintenance Manager
  • Work Rotation (if applicable): 8 days on, 6 days off
  • Work Days / Hours: 7:00 am – 5:30 pm – ½ hour unpaid lunch.
  • Purpose of Role: Maintaining Tiger’s vehicle fleet.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Perform maintenance and repair of heavy trucks and trailers.
  • Perform preventative and predictive maintenance.
  • Diagnose the cause of any malfunction and perform repairs to the manufacturer's specifications.
  • Assist apprentices as needed with maintenance repairs to grow knowledge.
  • Maintain a clean and tidy personal work area and assist with general cleaning duties in a workshop environment.
  • Maintain a record of all work tasks on work orders in the TMT system.
  • Support and encourage continuous improvement in work practices.
  • Adhere to Tiger’s HSE policies and procedures.
  • Some out of hours work may be required for a call-out basis.
  • Perform related work as required.
  • Completing daily job hazard assessments.
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, WORK EXPERIENCE, SKILLS:
  • Journeyman Heavy Duty Mechanic.
  • Minimum of 3 years experience.
  • Valid driver's license, Class 1 preferred.
  • Current CVIP certificate would be considered an asset.
  • Experience with Cummins engines, hydraulic systems, and Super B would be considered an asset.
  • Experience and considerable knowledge of the methods, materials and equipment used in the maintenance and repair of various types of heavy equipment and other power-driven equipment and tools.
  • Working knowledge of the occupational hazards and safety precautions of the trade.
  • Skilled in the operation of a variety of tools and equipment used in the repair of trucks and heavy equipment
  • Capable of preparing and maintaining accurate records and reports.
  • Familiarity with the TMT software program would be considered an asset.
  • Ability to analyze and repair mechanical failures.
  • Has a collaborative communication style at all levels of the organization demonstrating an open, honest and consistent approach to working with others. Must be able to successfully pass pre-employment screening requirements including drug and alcohol and health assessment.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORK CONDITIONS:
  • Lifting, pulling, climbing, standing, sitting, lying down, squatting and kneeling and managing equipment and tools.
  • Must work outside in all different weather conditions, including cold and extreme heat. Work is performed in a repair shop environment.

title: Industrial Mechanic (Manufacturing Plant)
description:
Industrial Mechanic (Manufacturing Plant)
Standard Manufacturers Services Limited 

Job details
Location: Winnipeg, MB
Salary: $20.00 to $30.00 / hour (To be negotiated)
2 vacancies
Terms of employment: Permanent employment, Full time40 hours / week
Start date: As soon as possible

Languages:
English

Education:
No degree, certificate or diploma, industrial mechanic certificate an asset

Experience:
  • 1 to 2 years shop experience would be considered an asset

Own Tools/Equipment:
  • Steel-toed safety boots

Security and Safety:
  • Bondable, Basic security clearance, Criminal record check

Transportation/Travel Information:
  • Own transportation

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities:
  • Handling heavy loads, Physically demanding, Attention to detail, Bending, crouching, kneeling, Overtime required, Work under pressure, Standing for extended periods

Work Site Environment:
  • At heights, Noisy, Odours, Dusty, Confined spaces

Personal Suitability:
  • Team player, Excellent oral communication, Excellent written communication

Area of Specialization:
  • Start-up and testing, Shutdown operations, Renovating and restoring, Rigging and handling, Troubleshooting, Bearing, seals and packing

Equipment and Machinery Experience:
  • Fans and blowers, Pneumatic system, Welding equipment, Hydraulic system, Lathes and other machining tools, Automated and robotic system, Conveyor, Press brakes and metalworking equipment, Pumps and compressors, Tool grinders, Hand tools

Major Work Area:
  • Machinery installation, Maintenance, Service, Repair, Overhaul, Machine set-up

Specific Skills:
  • Detect and troubleshoot irregularities and malfunctions, Construct foundations for machinery, Repair or replace defective machinery parts, Fabricate parts required during overhaul, maintenance or set-up, Perform routine maintenance work on machinery, Operate machining tools to fabricate parts, Assembling machinery and equipment (prior to installation), Installing machinery and equipment, Operate hoisting and lifting equipment

Weight Handling:
Up to 23 kg (50 lbs)

How to apply
By email:

hr@standardmanufacturers.com


By fax: 204-661-4613

By mail: 691 Golspie Street, Winnipeg, MB, R2K 2V3

In person: 691 Golspie Street, Winnipeg, MB, R2K 2V3, from 09:00 to 16:00

Who can apply to this job?
Only apply to this job if:
  • You are a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident of Canada.
  • You have a valid Canadian work permit.
If you are not authorized to work in Canada, do not apply. The employer will not respond to your application.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - FIFO
description:
MATRIX is a national company providing camps, logistics and aviation management services to a diverse range of clients in the resource and service sectors, focusing on our people. Are you seeking an opportunity to work in a remote picturesque environment? This is not just an opportunity to utilize your expertise and experience but an opportunity to see the mountains? MATRIX is a drug and alcohol-free company; with over 250 employees annually, we offer excellent career advancements for all skillsets. 

MATRIX is looking for an experienced Heavy-Duty Mechanic. Red Seal or Journeyman to support on-going maintenance and repair of our heavy equipment located at remote camp in Nunavut.  You are a team oriented, motivated person with attention to detail. CAT equipment experience required, proficient in CAT ET and SIS Systems.

This position will be a fly in fly out position, based on site with the project team. 

Responsibilities:

  • Keeps equipment available for use by completing preventive maintenance schedules; installing component and part upgrades; controlling corrosion; completing winterization procedures.
  • Corrects equipment deficiencies by removing, repairing, adjusting, overhauling, disassembling, assembling, and replacing major assemblies, components, parts, electrical, adjusting and alignments including bearing loads, gear tooth contact, valve mechanisms, governors, oil systems, control linkages, clutches, and traction units.
  • Familiar with Loaders, Dozers, Excavators, Graders, SnowCats, light and heavy duty trucks.
  • Verifies vehicle performance by conducting test drives; adjusting controls and systems.
  • Oversee vehicle appearance by cleaning and washing.
  • Maintains vehicle records by annotating services and repairs.
  • Keeps shop equipment operating by following operating instructions; troubleshooting breakdowns; maintaining supplies; performing preventive maintenance; calling for repairs.
  • Willing to work in remote sites outside of a shop.
  • Arctic experience would be an asset.
  • Keeps supplies ready by inventorying stock; placing orders; verifying receipt.
  • Facilitate and or participate in daily tool box meetings.
  • Ensure work environment meets corporate safety practices.
  • Report unsafe conditions to immediate supervisor.

Preferred Licensing & Certifications:

  • Journey-Certified Heavy-Duty Mechanic/Interprovincial Red Seal Certification.
  • A minimum 3-5 years mining equipment care and maintenance experience.
  • Previous experience working in remote camp setting.

We thank all applicants for their interest in working at MATRIX; only those identified for further consideration will be contacted.  Visit our careers page at www.matrixco.ca

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Job ID:  395504 

Work Type:  Full Time Permanent 

 

It is a great time to join the CRH Canada team! CRH Canada is going through an exciting business transformation which demands first-class Talent Management support to drive results.


We are building a world- class team. Make your mark!


You will be a successful addition to our team if you look at change as an opportunity to develop and contribute to the business. You will be successful in your role if you like partnering with the business, presenting new ideas and providing excellent customer service.

Mechanic

Are you looking to become part of a dedicated team and contribute to the day-to-day operation of a large shop that services and repairs equipment, and the maintenance of all mobile and contractor equipment? Do you want to stay active in a fast-paced environment? Are you looking for a career path that includes professional growth and career advancement? 


Responsibilities:

Under the general direction of the Shop Superintendent and shop foreman, you will perform shop and field work to support our growing fleet and perform the following duties:

Responsible for providing maintenance and repairs to the Dufferin Construction fleet of heavy-duty trucks and equipment. This includes ordering required parts, removal, rework and installation of various engine and chassis components, as well as performing maintenance schedules.

  • Adhere to all Operations policies and procedures
  • Reading electrical and hydraulic schematic is an asset 
  • Basic knowledge of the construction industry is an asset
  • Other duties as assigned

 Experience & Educational Criteria:

  • 310S or 310T mechanic license
  • Basic knowledge of truck and heavy equipment operation
  • Working knowledge of related maintenance and repair practices
  • Working knowledge of diesel engines, hydraulic pumps, motors, and air brake systems
  • Fabrication and welding skills
  • Knowledge with on and off-road computer systems
  • Dealer trained i.e. Cat, Deere, Hitachi, Volvo, etc.
  • Full G License required

Working Conditions:

  • Standard 50 hours per week, will be required to work overtime, nights weekends, based on operational requirements   
  • Open to working at other locations, as needed
  • The employee will travel to/ from/ within jobsites 
  • Daily exposure to construction environment i.e., heavy equipment, oncoming traffic, inclement weather (heat, cold, rain etc.) 

 

What Makes a Successful Candidate?

  •  Must be self-motivated and work independently
  •  Must have ability to follow directions and effectively perform the work
  • Must be able to maintain a clean safe work environment in and out of shop 
  • Maintain a consistent, high level of productivity 
  • Takes immediate and independent action to resolve issues or problems when they arise.
  • Safety oriented
  • Communicates effectively
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and be reliable well under pressure
  • Ability to deal with multiple tasks and prioritize work effectively
  • Team oriented
  • Flexibility to perform other duties as assigned

Why work for us?

  • We recognize safety as our top priority and support that through our COR certification and Annual Safety recognition awards
  •  With parent companies in Concord, the US and Ireland, your growth potential is limitless!

About Us

  • Under the long established and respected name of Dufferin Construction, CRH Canada operates a multi-million construction business which provides construction services throughout Southern Ontario and on key projects across Canada.
  • Founded in 1912, Dufferin Construction has built a solid reputation for market excellence, drawing on a rich history and a strong heritage of quality, stability and innovative leadership in the marketplace.  Dufferin Construction is one of the largest heavy civil engineering contractors in the industry, employing over 1000 people.

Dufferin Construction offers a wide range of construction services that cater to the Heavy Civil, Commercial/Industrial, Municipal and Land Development market segments.

  • Concrete Construction Services: Concrete paving, roller compacted concrete paving, construction of retaining walls, sidewalks and curbs, barrier walls, cement stabilized base placement and Dufferin-Slipstone extruded wall system
  • Asphalt Construction Services: Asphalt paving, operate ten Asphalt hot mix plants and one portable asphalt plant 
  • Excavation and Underground Construction Services: Sewer and watermain, earth excavation, earth borrow and grading and granular placement
  • Structural Construction Services: Bridge structures, retaining walls, structure rehabilitation and cast in place utility structures
  • Environmental Construction Services: Landfill reclamation and rehabilitation, and the manufacturing of recycled granular materials
  • Design Build Construction Services: Participated in some of the largest and most complex projects in the country including Sir Adam Beck Tunnel in Niagara Falls, Highway 407 and the Infield Development project at the Toronto Pearson International Airport
  • Other Construction Services: Airport snow removal

 

Dufferin Construction builds careers. Our door is always open to hire highly skilled and motivated individuals who want to develop to their full potential while playing a key role in our future plans.  Solid growth opportunities are available that provide progression from entry level to senior management positions.  Our growth and development strategy involves defined practical experience in project management, augmented with annual training programs to accelerate career progression.

 

Visit our website for more information: http://www.crhcanada.com

CRH Canada Group Inc. recognizes Canada’s diverse landscape. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Journeyman (Journeyperson) Heavy Duty Mechanic (Fort Mackay Shop)
description:
Position Scope:

NACG is seeking an experienced Journeyman (Journeyperson) Heavy Duty Mechanic (Off Road) to join our dynamic and industry leading organization. Upon hire, you will be eligible for a $7,500 Attraction Bonus (subject to 2-year return service agreement) and our long-term service awards which are made in yearly payments. The sooner you start the more you earn!!

 

Looking to build your career?  You can earn up to $71.87 per hour (includes base rate, Living Out Allowance, pension, training, vacation and general holiday pay, tool allowance and health and wellness â€“ benefits, dental and disability). Successful candidates will also receive  $225.00 per year of Boot Allowance.

 

Site: Fort Mackay Shop

Schedule:  14x14  

Overtime: Time and a half after 8 hours or 44 in a week

Accommodations: Not provided, $15/hour Living Out Allowance

Transportation: Transportation to and from site provided.

 

The successful candidate  will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955.  

 

NACG also offers an Employee Referral Program,  an employee may be eligible to receive a referral bonus if he / she refers an eligible candidate for a posted Heavy Equipment Technician (HET) position in the Acheson Shop and/or Fort McMurray area with NACG. Each successful referral will result in a payment of $2,500.

 

Responsibilities:
  • Complete repairs on CAT/Komatsu/Hitachi equipment of all sizes.
  • Work closely with peers in both maintenance and operations.
  • Preventative Maintenance and servicing of all equipment.
  • Evaluate equipment performance and inspect to detect faults and malfunctions.
  • Trouble shooting systems â€“ example: hydraulic, electrical & mechanical of all equipment and determine faults and extent of repair.
  • Test repaired equipment for proper performance and to ensure that work meets manufacturer specifications.
  • Mobilization of equipment for maintenance and repair.
  • Develop work scopes and schedules for equipment to be repaired.
  • Order required repair parts, complete reports and fill out work orders.
  • Teach and evaluate apprentices and mentor Mechanics.
  • Follow NACG codes of practice and Safe Operating Procedures.
  • Other maintenance duties as assigned.

Specific Requirements:

  • Minimum 2 yearsâ€™ experience post Journeyman certification on large Haul Trucks/Dozers/Graders and Excavators.
  • Possess excellent diagnostic and troubleshooting skills and abilities.
  • Capable of working with minimal supervision.
  • Exhibit professional work behaviors.
  • Committed to continuous learning.
  • Basic knowledge of computer applications.
  • Demonstrate leadership skills in daily work interaction
Qualifications:
  • A valid Alberta Journeyman (Journeyperson) Equipment Technician (Off Road) Certificate or an Interprovincial Red Seal Journeyman (Journeyperson) Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic/Technician (Off Road).
  • Experience with Cat SIS is an asset.
  • Previous experience on a Safety Sensitive work site an asset

 

Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  4. Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  5. Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

 

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. CSO or BSO Certification
  2. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  4. VOID cheque/direct deposit form

Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  1. Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  2. An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  3. After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

 

Overview:

North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.   In that time, weâ€™ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. Weâ€™ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers.  

In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

  • Significant Growth â€“ As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
  • Long Term Contracts â€“ With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
  • Commitment To Safety â€“ With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.

North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

 

Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Journeyman Millwright - Industrial Mechanic
description:
Motion Canada is currently recruiting for a Journeyman Millwright with extensive hydraulic and mechanical experience in their service shop in Prince George, BC. Working in the repair and machine shop, the candidate will be primarily involved in the repairing and maintenance of hydraulic and mechanical components. This exciting and challenging position will report into the Shop Foreman. The position may also require off-site troubleshooting and mechanical repairs in the field.

Motion Canada, is a leading distributor of industrial MRO (maintenance, repair and operation replacement) parts, and the largest Bearing and Power Transmission Company in North America is an industry leader with annual sales around $500 million. We have over 50 branches including 12 service centers across Canada. With a national platform, a track record of success, an entrepreneurial executive team, and the backing of a multi-billion dollar parent company (Motion Industries) Motion Canada is positioned for strong growth across Canada. The company is a provider of more than 4.8 million parts and services.

REQUIREMENTS:

• Minimum 3-5 years of shop experience in rebuilding hydraulic components (pumps, motors, cylinders, valves, etc.) and mechanical components (gear reducers, process pumps, blowers, fluid couplings, clutches, etc.)
• Journeyman or equivalent trade certification (i.e. Millwright/Industrial Mechanic/Heavy Duty Mechanic)
• Excellent communication skills in English, both verbal and written
• Ability to read and interpret blueprints and schematics
• Detail oriented with ability to work independently
• Basic computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook
• Strong planning and organizational skills
• A complete basic set of tools required
• Ability to multitask in a dynamic environment
• Team player coupled with solid troubleshooting skills
• Ability to assess and estimate times for rebuild work
• Must be in great physical condition
• Possess a valid driver's license
• Forklift license preferred
• Basic manual machining skills are an asset
• Basic welding skills are an asset

READY TO BE A PARTNER?           
Submit your well-crafted, error-free resume below and think about:
  • Your learning and development goals
  • Your definition of team player and integrity

THE WORK EXPERIENCE AT MOTION CANADA INCLUDES
  • Comprehensive flex benefits 
  • Competitive salary 
  • An attractive pension plan
  • Learning, growth and development opportunities
  • Great company culture with a strong leadership team
  • Open and frequent communication
  • Timely feedback on individual performance and career development opportunities

title: Certified Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Relocation assistance is available for this position.
At Weyerhaeuser, our focus is as much on building our people as building our business. We are committed to creating an environment where individuals can flourish, diversities encouraged, and communities supported. We are one of the premier integrated forest organizations in the world. We've been in business for nearly 120 years and believe strongly in our core values of safety, integrity, citizenship and sustainability which has awarded us being named as one of the World's most Ethical Companies 10 times.
At Weyerhaeuser, we’re always looking for people who can innovate, contribute, grow, and create! Our employees are the real reason we've been in business for nearly 120 years. Their skill and ingenuity have made Weyerhaeuser one of the largest and premium timber, land and forest products company in the world.
*About Princeton*
Small town living on the doorstep of the Okanagan and Lower Mainland. Princeton, BC is located at the juncture of the Tulameen and Similkameen rivers approximately 1 ½ hours from Kelowna, Penticton and Kamloops, and about 2 ½ hours from Vancouver. This beautiful community offers a pool, ice rink, baseball fields, cross country ski trails, tennis courts, mountain bike trails, a Jr. B hockey team, and several great restaurants with a variety of foods. Princeton Lumber is one of the largest employers in the community and has been in operation more than 50 years.
*Description:*
Reporting to the Fiber Optimization Manager, the Red Seal Journeyperson Heavy Duty Mechanic is responsible for the maintenance and repair of mobile equipment at the mill. The current pay rate is $44.96, increasing to $46.08 on July 1, 2022.
*Primary Responsibilities:*
* Safely troubleshoot and repair industrial mobile equipment.
* Complete preventative maintenance responsibilities.
* Support the goals and objectives of the overall maintenance team and mill operations.



* Red Seal Journeyperson Heavy Duty Mechanic is required
* High School Diploma or equivalent is required
* Minimum 3 years of related experience in an industrial environment
* A passion and history for working safely.
* Collaborates with the maintenance team to deliver preventative and predictive maintenance programs.
*About Wood Products*
We've been delivering quality building products and solutions to our customers for more than 100 years. From builders and dealers to specifiers and homeowners, we offer exceptional product performance and unparalleled support.
*For more than a century, we’ve been building our reputation as a leader in sustainable wood products.*
*About Weyerhaeuser*
We sustainably manage forests and manufacture products that make the world a better place. We’re serious about safety, driven to achieve excellence, and proud of what we do. With multiple business lines in locations across North America, we offer a range of exciting career opportunities for smart, talented people who are passionate about making a difference.
*We know you have a choice in your career. We want you to choose us. *

/Weyerhaeuser is an equal opportunity employer. Inclusion is one of our five core values and we strive to maintain a culture where all our people feel a sense of belonging, opportunity and shared purpose. We are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce and supporting an equitable and inclusive environment that inspires people of all backgrounds to join, stay and thrive with our team. /



Job:Operations, Manufacturing, & Construction*


Title: *Certified Heavy Duty Mechanic*

Location: *CAN-BC-Princeton*

Requisition ID:** *01017809*

title: Industrial Millwright - Night Shift
description:
A Sustainable, Forward Thinking Protein Company

Maple Leaf Foods is a leading meat and plant-based protein company, employing over 11,500 people and publicly traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange. We are proud of our roots, which trace back well over 100 years, but our vision and purpose are decidedly forward looking. As we pursue our vision to become the most sustainable protein company on earth, we are committed to creating shared value – creative business value through addressing some of the world’s most critical social and environmental challenges. Our goal is to build a more sustainable food system, which provides nutritious affordable food, operates within planetary limits, cares for animals responsibly, and meaningfully engages with our communities to advance a more just society. We are advancing bold changes within Maple Leaf and more broadly within society to pursue our vision. We deeply believe this is the sustainable path to growth.

Our job is to make great food

Maple Leaf Foods embraces a strong values-based culture, where our people are deeply engaged in work that is purposeful, fast-paced and challenging.  We cultivate an open, non-bureaucratic and inclusive workplace that fosters safety and transparency, along with individual leadership and accountability. Each Maple Leaf team member has a voice and plays an active role in helping all of us achieve our goals with passion and discipline. We support one another to grow professionally, to learn new skills and to take on challenging experiences in the spirit of continuous improvement. 

Raise the Good in Food

We have united behind a shared purpose – to Raise the Good in Food. This spans a dramatic transformation of our flagship Maple Leaf brand, replacing anything artificial with simple, natural ingredients; investments and process changes to reduce our environmental footprint by 50% by 2025; building a diverse and inclusive culture where all talent thrives; becoming a leader in animal care; and advancing food security through our charitable foundation, the Maple Leaf Centre for Action on Food Security.

Our Leadership Values 

Eight core values guide us in everything that we do.
  • Do What’s Right
  • Shared Value
  • High Performance
  • Diverse and Inclusive Teams
  • Disciplined Decision Making
  • Our Accountability
  • Intense Curiosity
  • Transparency and Humility

The Opportunity:

As part of Maple Leaf Food’s Maintenance team, the individual will be responsible for maintaining and servicing equipment used in the facility for the daily production of our products. Furthermore, they will ensure safe plant operations and a safe working environment for all employees. Our Millwright rate is $42.27/hour, with an additional premium of $0.45/hour for the night shift.

A snapshot of some of the exciting things you will lead and do:

  • Trouble shooting/repairs/installations of processing equipment to allow efficient repair/replacement results
  • Extensive mechanical knowledge including power transmission, pneumatics and hydraulics
  • Carry out oral/printed work requests and apply corrective action
  • Perform regular Work Orders and account for inventory and labour on a computerized maintenance program
  • Be able to read and understand mechanical drawings/schematics
  • Machining and fabricating for equipment repairs and/or upgrades
  • Welding of equipment or part repair
  • Understand and adhere to all plant Food/Health and Safety Polices

What you will bring:

  • Must have Red Seal Certification
  • Must have own hand tools
  • Knowledge of plant and equipment operations
  • Ability to organize and plan daily tasks with minimal supervision
  • Ability to work in a team based environment
  • Must be able to work overnight shift
  • Good mathematical, analytical and problem solving skills
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Available for weekend overtime as production demands require

What we have to offer you:

  • Be part of a company with an inspiring and unique vision, with a deep commitment to sustainability and expanding its leadership in sustainable protein across North America
  • Competitive Health and Wellness benefits
  • Defined Contribution Pension Plan
  • Commitment to Learning – courses, resources and tools provided to all employees
  • Employee Assistance Program

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees.  As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination.   In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022).  We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws
We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.
Championing diversity and inclusion is a critical component to advancing our collective purpose and vision, living the Maple Leaf Leadership Values, and delivering winning results. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired; please contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

.

title: Industrial Millwright Mechanic
description:
$25 - $32 an hour depending on skill set

The function of Millwright is to ensure that all machines are maintained and in
proper working order


Required Education and Experience:
High degree of Mechanical aptitude and complete understanding of Mechanical and Electrical procedures
Knowledge of machine rigging procedures
Basic knowledge of machining and welding
Ability to read drawings, blueprints, specifications and manuals
Ability to incorporate technical reports
Good communicator in the English language, both written and oral
Minimum 1 year experience in similar position, or successfully completing an accredited apprenticeship program
High level of time management

Essential Functions:
Maintain Preventive Maintenance Schedule

Perform full diagnostics on equipment and advise Maintenance Supervisor and/or Purchasing Manager of parts required to perform necessary Mechanical and electrical troubleshooting and repairs

Physically maintain machines and equipment
Must ensure all paperwork and logs are completed prior to shift end
Follow Machine Safety Guidelines, ensure proper lock out procedure are followed at all times
Maintain proper Company housekeeping standards
Responsible to maintain company tools as required to fulfill duties
All other duties as assigned by Supervisors and Managers
Support weekly production requirements
Participate in any continuous improvement activities
Assist in monitoring downtime/uptime and abide within the Department/Company goals

Work Environment:
Working in a plant environment
Frequent distractions and interruptions
Multiple demands, challenging, fast paced, team orientated environment, can be noisy 100% plant floor (PPE required)

Physical Demands:
Constant communication with employees, peers, and management
Constant standing, walking, bending and lifting (light to heavy) and climbing
Warm/Cold temperatures
Overtime as required, 24 hour on call

title: Mécanicien industriel
description:
Poste : mécanicien industriel
Lieu de travail : Mirabel
Salaire :25 $ l’heure à 30 $ l’heure
Type de poste : permanent
Quart de travail : jour

Vous venez récemment de compléter votre DEP en mécanique industrielle, ou vous êtes tout simplement un génie dans le domaine grâce à vos nombreuses années d’expérience? Dans tous les cas, nous avons une belle occasion de carrière qui s’offre à vous dès aujourd’hui!

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un mécanicien industriel pour compléter l’équipe de jour d’une grande entreprise manufacturière située à Mirabel.

Ce que nous offrons :

- Horaire de jour en semaine
- Assurance complète
- Cotisation au fonds FTQ
- Salaire pouvant atteindre 30 $ l'heure selon l'expérience

Ce qu’il faut pour postuler :

- Détenir au moins 1 an d'expérience comme mécanicien industriel ou un DEP en mécanique industrielle ou usinage

Vos tâches :
- Couper, percer et polir des pièces
- Assembler des composantes hydrauliques
- Tester le matériel sous pression
- Inspecter des pièces hydrauliques et les faire coulisser manuellement

title: Millwright - Industrial Millwright
description:
Top of Form

Industrial Millwright

  • 10 Tempo Avenue, Toronto, Canada
  • Full-time

Company Description

Metroland Media is a dynamic Media Company delivering vital business and community information to millions of readers across Ontario each week. With a healthy product offering in-print, online, trade shows and distribution networks, no target is unreachable. We are Ontario's largest and most successful community news and information source, provides local news and multi-media marketing solutions in Canada's heartland.

Metroland's diverse array of online products are visited by over 4 million unique visitors each month and print products are in the hands of more than 4.5 million customers a week. We are continuously bringing new and acquired online products to market to provide our customers with a one-stop, comprehensive marketing solution. To connect with us, visit www.metroland.com

Job Description

  • Must be able to work well in an unsupervised environment and as part of a project team.
  • Proven troubleshooting ability with emphasis on safety and reliability.
  • Must be well organized.
  • Effective communications and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to perform machining would be an asset.
  • Must be aware of all safety standards and requirements for maintenance work.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Work closely with the Maintenance Manager, mechanics, and electricians
  • Perform the required maintenance on all stationary equipment, plant equipment and building components of the Plant. Schedule any major PM repairs with pressroom office.
  • Maintain records to support all PM work.
  • Carry out regular inventory control procedures and advise Maintenance Manager when parts need to be ordered.
  • Maintain, overhaul and repair weekly and monthly inspection of all equipment in the Plant i.e.: Presses, conveyors/delivery systems, prepress equipment, and all other related equipment.
  • Modify and fabricate equipment to fit new production requirements or solve production issues.
  • Work with blueprints, sketches, and technical drawings.
  • Perform cutting, grinding, fabricating, and welding as required.
  • Operate mobile equipment as required (skyjack 5-ton overhead crane)
  • Constantly monitor plant equipment to pinpoint problems before they arise
  • Some weekends and night shift work will be required during major breakdowns or pager “call-in”

Qualifications

  • Valid Industrial Millwright’s License. A433 or red seal
  • 3 to 5 years in a manufacturing or related industry

Assets

  • Previous experience in the printing industry
  • Skyjack training
  • Forklift training

Benefits

  • Reimbursement of Safety Shoes
  • Attractive Health and Dental Benefits Plans
  • Employee Assistance Plan
  • CAAT Pension Plan

Compensation

  • $35.00-$40.00 per hour 

Additional information

Diversity & Inclusion
Torstar Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Torstar is committed to ensuring employment opportunity to qualified applicants without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, family status or disability or any other factor protected by law.

AODA
Torstar Group of Companies is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free recruitment process ensuring equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. In compliance with Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Ontario Human Rights Code we will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify the hiring manager upon scheduling the interview of your requirements.

COVID-19
Torstar Corporation remains committed to its employees and to providing a safe workplace.  As of November 30, 2021, candidates for employment are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and successful candidates must agree to obtain any additional vaccinations or booster dose(s) that may be required. Proof of such vaccination will be required. We will make accommodation for qualifying medical or religious exemptions.

title: Industrial Mechanic
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better. 

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview

 

This is an hourly paid position included within the bargaining unit of the Boilermakers Union, Local D454, posting 2022-02. Competitive hourly rate ($33.59/hour) and benefits are offered.

Responsibilities

 

As a member of the plant maintenance team, you will be responsible for troubleshooting, inspection and repairs on all Lafarge owned equipment.

Qualifications

 

  • Must hold a valid Nova Scotia or Interprovincial Industrial Mechanic’s Ticket
  • A Mechanical Technologist would be an asset
  • Must be physically fit to perform the job and be able to work in areas of high elevation
  • Must have the ability to work with limited supervision in a team environment
  • Must hold a valid driver’s license

 

Reqirements of the Position

 

  • Will participate in ongoing training and/or certification for millwright, welding, PPM technologies (e.g. vibration, lubrication, non-destructive testing, etc.).
  • Will perform inspection functions as required (e.g. running checks).
  • Will use Computerized Maintenance Management Systems.
  • Will participate in planning and scheduling activities as required.
  • Will be expected to respond to Plant overtime needs and perform shift work when scheduled.
  • Working safely is a condition of employment at the Brookfield Plant.  You must comply with all safety rules and regulations.

LafargeHolcim

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs. 

 

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. 

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Industrial Mechanic Millwright/Assembler
description:
Industrial Mechanic Millwright/Assembler
(Custom Machine Build)
Location: Mississauga, ON


Do you have a background as a custom machine builder and are a Licensed Industrial Mechanic Millwright /Assembler in Ontario (433A) OR a Certified Tool and Die maker (430A) OR a Certified Engineering Technician/Technologist or equivalent? If you answered yes, and you have your own tools, our client wants to talk to you! Come join their ever growing team!

About this Position:

The Mechanical Assembler/Fitter/Millwright is responsible for the assembling, debugging, modifying and installing machinery accordingly mechanical design. This position is also responsible for, start-up and commissioning of machine lines and systems.

  • Assemble, debug, modify and install custom designed machinery according to the schedule, the company quality standards and to meet or exceed customer expectations
  • Responsible for the integration of purchased mechanical and pneumatic components, manufactured details and sub-assemblies to construct automated machinery for custom applications
  • Perform critical precision alignments and set-ups of mechanical components and systems and take measures to ensure integrity of set-up
  • Responsible for installing pneumatic components and sub-systems as per supplied schematics and specifications, plumbing.
  • Perform machining tasks when required (grinding, milling, lathe etc.)
  • Responsible for testing, pre-commissioning and optimizing system performance and equipment durability concerns, adhering to all applicable codes and standards.
  • Participate in equipment tear down, packaging, rigging and transporting and installation as required
  • Must identify all tools, fasteners, miscellaneous items and equipment required to complete tasks efficiently and work with plant manager to secure all required material in a timely manner.
  • Perform plant related maintenance and maintenance on plant equipment as required.
  • Other duties as assigned

Required Experience
  • 10+ years experience in custom machine building field (preferably wire & cable industry), experience in high speed lean manufacturing environment is an asset
  • Demonstrated experience in building equipment utilizing the following technologies: robotic systems, high speed index transfer (dial, indexing chain, walking beam etc..), pneumatic actuators, servo motors and actuators
  • Familiarity with modern electrical controls technologies as they apply to automated equipment (e.g. PLC’s, HMI’s, safety devices, and instrumentation)

Desired Skills:
  • Read and interpret AutoCAD (2D) and SolidWorks (3D) drawings and understand tolerances & critical dimensions.
  • Perform dimensional & quality inspections using measuring devices (micrometers, Vernier’s, measuring tapes, etc.).

Ability to use the following machine shop equipment safely and efficiently to complete tasks;
  • milling machine, lathe, surface grinder etc. (CNC milling, sink or wire EDM experience would be an asset)
  • Ability to weld common metals (MIG/TIG) encountered in machine building is an asset
  • Understanding of basic machinery rigging principles and the ability to operate rigging equipment including, cranes and forklifts etc.AND
  • Good working knowledge of pneumatic/hydraulic control circuits
  • Good working knowledge of bearing installation and press fits.


Must Haves:
Ability to work overtime as required and travel worldwide on short notice (valid and current Canadian passport is required) is a must
Experience with machine start-up and commissioning activities.
Valid Ontario Driver’s License and access to insured vehicle for travel within the G.T.A. and surrounding areas is a must

Excellent compensation and benefits will be offered and will be based on experience

All qualified candidates are invited to apply

Keywords: hydraulics, assemblies, industrial automation, electromechanical engineering, Brampton, Toronto, North York, Vaughan, Woodbridge, Etobicoke, Halton, Caledon, Bolton, ON, Oakville, Georgetown, Bolton, Acton, Milton, Mechanical Assembler, Custom Machine Assembler, Mechanical Machine Assembler, Machine Builder

TSSHP

title: Mécanicien Industriel
description:
Premier imprimeur au Canada et quatrième en Amérique du Nord, TC Transcontinental est une entreprise comptant plus de 8 000 employés à travers le monde. Travailler pour TC Transcontinental, c’est être associé à une entreprise qui met au cœur de sa pratique un ensemble de valeurs, dont le respect, l’innovation et la performance et le travail d’équipe. TC Transcontinental St-Hyacinthe œuvre plus particulièrement dans l’impression de circulaires.


Mécanicien (poste de nuit)

Chez TC Transcontinental, nous offrons:
  • Un environnement de travail sécuritaire;
        • Un programme de partage des profits qui vous donne accès à un boni annuel important;
        • Remplacement des outils par l’employeur;
        • Outils spécialisés fournis par le département de maintenance;
        • Atelier de maintenance complète (tour, fraiseuse, salle de soudure, table de travail…)
        • Vêtement de travail;
        • Des avantages sociaux (assurances collectives, régime de retraite, REER collectif, programme de mise en forme, club récréatif, etc.);
        • Des possibilités d’avancement;
        • Une formation continue.

Description des tâches:
  • Répondre aux situations d’urgence sur les presses (presse Allemande KBA, GOSS) et effectuer le changement des pièces mécaniques sur les presses;
  • Répondre aux situations d’urgence dans la zone robotique (Robot Kuka);
  • Procéder à la réparation des bris mécaniques;
  • Effectuer le travail d’entretien dans le département selon les bons d’entretien;
  • Installer des équipements pour la production;
  • Effectuer le programme d’entretien préventif et troubleshooting;
  • Participer à des projets d’installations et d’amélioration;
  • S’acquitter de toute tâche liée à la bonne marche des affaires.


L’échelle salariale dans la convention collective pour le poste de mécanicien s’étend du 25,12$/h à 36,94$/h, le salaire d’entrée peut varier en fonction de l’expérience. Les augmentations de salaires sont à tous les 6 mois travaillé. Une prime de 2.10$ s’ajoute au taux horaire à titre de prime de nuit.


Exigences:
  • Le candidat doit posséder un DEP en mécanique industriel ou l’équivalent (électromécanique…);
  • Le candidat doit posséder de l’expérience en industrie,
  • Expérience en imprimerie un atout;
  • Le candidat doit posséder une bonne approche en résolution de problème;
  • Le candidat doit posséder des connaissances en soudure, hydraulique et pneumatique;
  • Le candidat doit être disponible pour travailler sur le quart de nuit et une fin de semaine sur deux;
  • Le candidat doit être apte à travailler sous pression;
  • Des connaissances au niveau de la maintenance préventive sont un atout;
Le candidat doit posséder les outils de bases.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic (Nisku)
description:
• Nisku, AB
  • $40 per hour
  • 10-hr Shifts, 8 days on, 6 days off
  • 7% Annual Bonus
  • Signing Bonus
  • Full-Time, Permanent


Ian Martin Workforce has partnered with a well-established and growing calcium chloride company based in Nisku. They are seeking an experienced Heavy Duty On-Road Mechanic to join their team to maintain their fleet and mentor apprentices.


What you will be doing…

  • Perform maintenance and repair of heavy trucks and trailers.
  • Perform preventative and predictive maintenance.
  • Diagnose cause of any malfunction and perform repairs to manufacturer's specifications.
  • Assist apprentices as needed with maintenance repairs to grow knowledge.
  • Maintain a clean and tidy personal work area and assist with general cleaning duties in a workshop environment.
  • Maintain a record of all work tasks on work orders in the TMT system;
  • Support and encourage continuous improvement in work practices;
  • Adhere to company's HSE policies and procedures;
  • Some out of hours work may be required for a call-out basis;
  • Perform related work as required;
  •  Completing daily job hazard assessments.


Why this is for you…

  • Journeyman Heavy Duty Mechanic.
  • Minimum of 3 years experience.
  • Valid driver's license, Class 1 preferred.
  • Current CVIP certificate would be considered an asset.
  • Experience with Cummins engines, hydraulic systems, and Super B would be considered an asset.
  • Experience and considerable knowledge of the methods, materials, and equipment used in the maintenance and repair of various types of heavy equipment and other power-driven equipment and tools.
  • Working knowledge of the occupational hazards and safety precautions of the trade.
  • Skilled in the operation of a variety of tools and equipment used in the repair of trucks and heavy equipment
  • Capable of preparing and maintaining accurate records and reports.
  • Familiar with the TMT software program would be considered an asset.
  • Ability to analyze and repair mechanical failures.
  • Has a collaborative communication style at all levels of the organization demonstrating an open, honest and consistent approach to working with others.
  • Must be able to successfully pass pre-employment screening requirements including drug and alcohol and health assessment.
  • This client requires proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as it is a requirement of their client's sites.



Looking for Meaningful Work? We can help.

At the Ian Martin Workforce, we exist to connect people like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at 

http://tiffany.clark@ianmartin.com/

or text (905) 330 9861.

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: RS Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

Job Description and Responsibilities

Perform routine repairs on Recycling Facility equipment and preventative maintenance (PM) on all heavy equipment.

EVRAZ is committed to maintaining and promoting a safe, healthy and injury-free environment.  It is required for all jobs.

  • Responsible for maintaining all mill equipment at the Calgary Navajo Metals/Recycling facility

  • Inspect, troubleshoot, and diagnose different systems including but not limited to: ignition systems, fuel systems, hydraulic systems, transmissions, axles, suspensions, lighting systems, electrical and computer control systems

  • Diagnose and repair all types of gas and diesel equipment including but not limited to: forklifts, wheel loaders, service trucks, pickups, dump trucks/trailers and other support equipment

  • Maintain a tidy, clean, and organized shop and ensure a clean and safe working conditions at all times

  • Maintain regular communication with the Operational Manager and Parts Manager

  • Repair or replace defective parts, components and/or systems.

  • Assist the management team with planning projects, providing input and recommendations to safely initiate the most efficient and effective approach

  • Keep Operational Manager and Parts Manager informed and updated about any orders placed, order status, and when parts shipments can be expected to arrive at the facility

  • Test repaired equipment for proper performance and ensure that the work meets specifications and regulations

  • Responsible for monitoring and inspecting equipment to avoid failures before they happen

  • Understand monthly shred commitments to the Navajo Recycling Facility and have the ability to plan for required maintenance to avoid shortfalls in production

  • Ability to understand the cost associated with a particular repair and the effect it has to the bottom line

  • Perform safety inspections

  • Notifies Yard Superintendent of any mechanical or repair issues.

  • Observes and follows all safety rules and regulations at the Recycling Facility

  • Performs other duties as they might be assigned

Job Requirements

  • Minimum education level – Possesses a Provincial Red Seal Journeyman Heavy Duty Mechanic Certificate

  • Minimum 5 Years of experience in heavy equipment maintenance and repair

  • Experience repairing a variety of equipment and strong proficiency in reading and interpreting technical manuals relating to manufacturer specifications

  • Knowledge in mobile equipment hydraulics, 12v and 24v electrical, diesel and gas combustion engines, transmissions, differentials, suspensions, air brakes, ECU and other computer systems.

  • Able to read work orders and technical manuals

  • Preference will be given for candidates with experience operating Liebherr cranes (924, 934, 944) and Volvo 120 Front End Loaders in past work roles

  • Independent worker/self-starter who thrives in an environment with minimal to limited supervision and has the ability to take action before being required to do so

  • Experience in welding and fabrication will be considered an asset for this role

  • Strong work ethic – uses time efficiently, works safely, and ensure everyone around him/her is working safely

  • Strong problem solving skills with the ability to ‘think outside the box’ and come up with innovative solutions to issues

  • Strong communication skills – communicates clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing, and over mobile radio devices

  • Strong attention to detail with close visual attention for sustained/long periods of time

  • Team player – establishes trust with team members, stating clear expectations and recognizes group morale and acts to protect and/or build as required

  • Able to work in a heavy industrial environment subject to heat, humidity, fumes, odors, dust, cold, and noise

  • Safety conscious and orientated

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

title: Industrial Millwright Apprentice - Dempster's Bakery
description:
Who are we?
Bimbo Canada is a leading producer and distributor of packaged fresh bread and bakery products with brands such as Dempster’s®, Villaggio®, POM®, Bon Matin®, Ben’s®, Healthy Way® and McGavins®. Dempster’s is the national brand leader and a market leader in the health and well-being segment of bread products in Canada

Position Summary:
You would become a member of our maintenance team learning different skills by working alongside qualified license maintenance professionals in a fast-paced, food manufacturing environment. To ensure you are learning all the aspects of the trade, you will be required to attend school on a day release program. Where you will learn certain trade skills and apply them on the job.Attending school is a requirement of the program and the timing will be based on both the availability of the school schedule and the needs of the business.

Shift:Must be flexible and willing to work any shift/time
Pay Rate: $21- $31/ hr (depending on the year and experience)

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION:
  • Minimum grade 12 or equivalent required. Successful candidates must provide proof of Grade 12 (or GED) to Ministry of Training, colleges and Universities when signing up for the Apprenticeship
  • Must be registered with the Ontario College of Trades
  • Must be pursuing Industrial Millwright designation – 433A and in 3rd or 4th year
  • Related work experience and/or training in a machining environment (high volume automotive manufacturing environment would be viewed as an asset); experience with CNC machines a definite asset
  • Able to communicate effectively, both written and verbally, at all levels of the organization.
  • High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results orientation

REQUIRED SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:
  • Strong mathematical, diagnostic and troubleshooting skills are required. Computer fundamentals an asset
  • Must possess good communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Must be able to demonstrate good multi-tasking skills and deal with a rapidly changing work environment
  • Must work in compliance of Occupational Health and Safety Act and regulations
  • Strong Electronic/Mechanical background is considered a definite asset.
  • Must have ability to safely lift up to 40-50lbs
