title: Mécanicien industriel
description:
Vous êtes à la recherche d’un nouveau défi? Vous êtes passionné de mécanique industrielle? Lisez ce qui suit, cette offre est pour vous!

Votre future équipe
Premier Tech Producteurs et Consommateurs est un leader nord-américain dans les marchés de l’horticulture professionnelle et commerciale. Grâce à notre vaste réseau de production et de distribution, nous fournissons des produits de qualité supérieure. Nos clients peuvent alors contribuer à nourrir, protéger et améliorer notre planète à leur tour!

Votre futur rôle

  • Effectuer l’entretien préventif des équipements de production
  • Réparer les équipements de production défectueux
  • Réaliser des tâches diverses reliées à la réparation des équipements
  • Maintenir les aires de production à l’ordre et propres
  • Respecter les procédures sécuritaires de travail

Compétences requises

  • Diplôme en mécanique industrielle ou toute autre expérience connexe
  • Trois à cinq années d’expérience
  • Expérience en tant que millwright – un atout
  • Bonne connaissance des systèmes mécaniques, hydrauliques et pneumatiques
  • Rigueur
  • Fiabilité
  • Disponibilité à travailler selon différents quarts de travail
  • Bilinguisme anglais et français – un atout

Ces mots vous parlent?

Entretien d’équipement industriel, maintenance, SST, travail physique

Envie d’en savoir plus? N’attends plus, vous êtes à un clic de propulser votre carrière au niveau supérieur!

title: Journeyman Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Job Description:

Are you a safety advocate at work and have a passion for diagnosing and fixing heavy equipment? Do you enjoy working in heavy equipment shop environment and have experience with troubleshooting various pieces of heavy equipment such as Haul Trucks, Dozers, Excavators and/or Graders? If you said yes, then we are your Clear Choice!

 

Due to unprecedented growth, Flint, a division of ClearStream is looking to add to their team in Fort McMurray, AB. We are seeking Journeyman Heavy Equipment Mechanics, with a minimum of 1 year of experience for exciting permanent opportunities.

 

This opportunity is a fly-in, fly-out position with shifts starting immediately. Flight hubs are located in Calgary and Edmonton to/from Fort McMurray with the option for bussing also offered. Camp accommodation is provided for all staff.

 

 

Perks of the Job

  • Total compensation for this position is $65.04/hour
  • Merit Benefits after 300 hours.
  • 7/7 schedule alternating day and night shift, 12 hrs/day
  • Overtime for any additional worked hours outside of schedule
  • Camp accommodation
  • Flights from Calgary and Edmonton

 

What would you be doing?

  • Diagnose faults or malfunctions using computerized and other testing equipment to determine extent of repair required
  • Inspect and examine equipment to detect irregularities and malfunctions
  • Use hand and power tools to perform repairs and test repaired equipment for proper performance and ensure that the work done meets manufacturersâ€™ specifications and legislated regulation
  • Read and understand work orders, prepare estimates and interpret technical manuals
  • Large scale overhauls and rebuilds
  • Relocate/operate heavy equipment to move it within the shop area
  • Adjust equipment and repair or replace defective parts
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other preventative maintenance work
  • Equipment and facility continuous improvements
  • Interface with customers, products and sales support
  • Provide support with reference to on-site safety requirements
  • Writing technical reports and complete paperwork as required
  • Ensure that safety policies, quality standards, and standard operating procedures are followed
  • Will primarily do work  on the following pieces of equipment or the like:  
    • CAT 797 D & F  
    • Liebherr T284 C    
    • Komatsu 930E  
    • CAT 793 C & D  
    • CAT 777  
    • CAT 785  
    • Hitachi 5000  
    • Engines would be Cummins, CAT or MTU4000  

 

Does this sound like you?

  • Journeyman Heavy Equipment Technician Certification-   Off road.
  • Minimum 1 year experience as a Heavy Equipment Technician
  • Large off-highway Caterpillar, Liebherr, Komatsu and/or Hitachi mining equipment experience would be considered an asset
  • Oil Sands or large open pit mining equipment experience would be considered an asset
  • Specialize in fuel pumps and injectors, track equipment, engine overhaul, hydraulic controls, power shift transmissions and allied equipment
  • Computer skills, including experience with Microsoft office is essential
  • Dedication to safety
  • Ability to interpret technical manuals.
  • Safety tickets required (CSO or BSO, Fall Protection and AWP)

 

Other Important Details

 

This position has been identified as a safety sensitive position and will require completion of drug and alcohol testing.  

Mask Fit will be required and you will be requested to be clean shaven

 

Why ClearStream  

 

We are the clear choice for rewarding opportunities and challenging careers. Joining our team would mean you would contribute to the quality of work we do and to the success of ClearStream along with the values we share. If you are driven, dedicated and have a passion for helping our customers bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.â€¯â€¯  

 

We are committed to creating a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion, including fostering a safe and respectful environment that allows for diverse perspectivesâ€”a work environment in which all employees are valued and have an equal opportunity to achieve success.â€¯ Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected factors.â€¯

title: Journeyperson Industrial Mechanic or Journeyperson Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Job Description:

Journeyperson Industrial Mechanic or Journeyperson Heavy Duty Mechanic - (Lanigan, Saskatchewan, Canada)

At Nutrien, our Purpose is to grow our world from the ground up and we do so with safety and integrity as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With approximately 23,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the worldâ€™s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture  retail  network that services over 500,000 growers.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career.

The  Journeyperson Mechanic reports to the Mine Mechanical Supervisor.

What you will do:

  • Work safely in a mining environment and able to follow the procedures and policies that are in place
  • Inspect, diagnose, adjust, repair, fabricate, modify, and install plant equipment
  • Plan, layout, and use trade skills for assigned work
  • Play a critical role not only ensuring your own safety, but also the safety of others

What you will bring:

  • Valid Saskatchewan Provincial or Inter-provincial Journeyperson Industrial or Heavy-Duty Certificate
  • Previous experience in an industrial environment is an asset
  • Positive safety behavior and safety leadership
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work in the field or shop environment
  • Ability to interact positively with co-workers and supervisors
  • Ability to work safely and effectively in a labour-intensive team environment as well as independently
  • Willingness to learn and gain adequate knowledge and experience through training
  • Stable work record

 

Are you a good match? Apply today!

Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

This job will remain posted until filled. In accordance with Nutrien policies, you will  be required to undergo a background check and may be required to undergo a substance test. Being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 is a condition of employment and that proof of vaccination will be required, with minimal exceptions, unless prohibited by applicable law.   While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

To stay connected to us and for the latest job postings and news, follow us on:  LinkedIn,  Facebook  and  Twitter  

 

**EOE race/color/sex/sexual orientation/gender identity/disability/veteran

title: Mobile Industrial Technician - Millwright (FT)
description:
MILLER WASTE SYSTEMS – PICKERING

Title: Mobile Industrial Technician - Millwright
Location: Miller Waste Systems – Durham Region
Start Date: To be determined
Shift: Days
Reporting to: District Equipment Manager
Description:
Miller Waste Systems Inc. has been in operation since 1961. Miller is a leader in waste management and diversion, providing governments and industries with a wide range of services in the provinces of Ontario, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, and Manitoba. Miller has over 50 years of experience in the waste management sector and currently operates out of more than 30 locations. We are looking for a highly capable Mobile Industrial Technician - Millwright to be located out of our Pickering location in Ontario.
Miller Waste Systems is looking for a Mobile Industrial Technician - Millwright with 5+ years of experience in industrial equipment repair and with 1+ years of mobile service experience. A collaborative but strong nature is essential, and the applicant’s background in parts and maintenance and the transportation industry will allow them to succeed and grow within Miller Waste.
Responsibilities:
In the position of Mobile Industrial Technician your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
  • Must adhere to Miller Waste System safety protocols and must be familiar with occupational Health & Safety Act.
  • Performing daily preventative checklists and recording the conditions of equipment following the manufacturer-recommended preventative maintenance program for various sites within Durham Region.
  • You will be required to perform electrical repairs on equipment as well you will have experience and general knowledge with welding and cutting.
  • You must be able to troubleshoot and diagnose breakdowns on MRF and Transfer facility equipment and lines.
  • This position will require frequent travel to other MRF and transfer station locations within Durham Region.
  • Previous experience with heavy equipment & conveyor systems maintenance, as well as previous experience with baling equipment and compactors is key for this position.
  • Experience with Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) is an asset.
Requirements:
  • Journeyman Certification as a Millwright/Industrial Mechanic, but will also consider 3rd and 4th Year Apprentices with a strong working knowledge of conveyors, stationary engines, pumps, compressor, grinders, welding equipment, electrical/electronic controls, power tools, fans/blowers, and hydraulic systems.
  • Must have a full complement of professional hand tools.
  • Must have a sense of urgency and attention to detail.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills are required as well as excellent organizational skills.
  • Must be a team player and a self-motivated individual who is able to work without supervision and function safely around equipment.
  • Must follow all Miller Waste Safety policies & procedures (ie. Lockout/tag-out procedures).
  • A valid and clean driver's license is required.
  • Flexibility is also required as this position occasionally requires travel, early starts, late finishes, and, on rare occasions, weekend work.

All Miller Waste Systems Employeesmust comply with the company's COVID-19 policy and protocols.
We are committed to equity, diversity, and inclusivity in the workplace, we welcome applications from women, racially visible individuals, people with disabilities, indigenous peoples, and LGBTQ2S+ persons.

We are committed to providing persons with disabilities with equal opportunities and standards of goods and services and are fully compliant with the applicable provincial Disabilities Act.

Miller Waste Systems strives to be ‘only the best’. As a privately owned and operated Waste Company we have 50 years experience of in providing quality service to all our customers. We have been successful in achieving this goal by providing a family and employee-centric environment at all our locations. By providing an industry-leading work environment and compensation, benefits, and pension programs, Miller Waste continues to grow our business.

title: Industrial Millwright/Mechanic (Weekend Shift)
description:
Employee Type:

Full time

Location:

ON Kitchener

Job Type:

Production Maintenance

Job Posting Title:

Industrial Millwright/Mechanic (Weekend Shift)

Job Description:

About us

TreeHouse Foods produces a broad range of food and beverages for all eating occasions. We are a private label food and beverages company that provides products for retail grocery, foodservice, and industrial customers. Our Kitchener location produces the finest quality cracker for private label companies.

Mission, Vision, and Values.

  • Our purpose is to Make High-Quality food and beverages affordable to all.
  • Our vision I to be the undisputed solutions leader for custom brands.
  • Our mission is to be the preferred manufacturer and distribution partner through leadership, superior innovation, and relentless execution.

Safety Culture:

  • We value human life above all else
  • We treat co-workers as family members, expecting safe behaviors and responsibility from all.
  • Safety will make us a healthier company – healthier people, healthier land, healthier quality, and healthier fiscally.
     

Job Summary

The Preventative Maintenance Mechanic/Millwright is responsible for installing or dismantling machinery and equipment according to company plans, blueprints, and other diagrams. This will be accomplished through the safe and effective use of hoists, lift trucks, hand tools, and power tools. This position also requires that the Millwright troubleshoot and diagnose mechanical, hydraulic, or pneumatic problems with associated equipment. The Millwright is also responsible for repairing malfunctioning equipment, such as motors, pumps, valves, controls, packaging machinery, conveyors, and other machines

Available Positions: 1

Shift: Weekend Shift ( Saturday, Sunday, Monday 6:00 am - 6:00 pm)

Responsibilities

  • Ensures operation of machinery and mechanical equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements on motors, gearboxes, pneumatics, conveyor systems, and high-speed packaging machines; following diagrams, sketches, operations manuals, manufacturer's instructions, and engineering specifications; troubleshooting malfunctions.
  • Locates sources of problems by observing mechanical devices in operation; listening for problems; using precision measuring and testing instruments.
  • Removes defective parts by dismantling devices; using hoists, cranes, and hand and power tools; examining form and texture of parts.
  • Determines changes in dimensional requirements of parts by inspecting used parts; using rules, calipers, micrometers, and other measuring instruments.
  • Controls downtime by informing production workers of routine preventive maintenance techniques; monitoring compliance.
  • Fabricates repair parts by using machine shop instrumentation and equipment.
  • Maintains equipment, parts, and supplies inventories by checking stock to determine inventory level; anticipating needed equipment, parts, and supplies; placing and expediting orders; verifying receipt.
  • Conserves maintenance resources by using equipment and supplies as needed to accomplish job results.
  • Provides mechanical maintenance information by answering questions and requests.
  • Prepares mechanical maintenance reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
  • Maintains technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing technical publications; establishing personal networks.
  • Maintains continuity among work teams by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs.
  • Maintains a safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations.
  • Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
  • Leads apprentices and directs them to ensure successful task completion.
  • Ensure that all safety policies, quality standards, and standard operating procedures are followed.

Preferred candidates have:

  • Licensed Millwright, Industrial Maintenance Mechanic, or related post-secondary education.
  • Prior work experience in the food industry and previous packaging experience preferred.

millwright, industrial mechanic, mechanic, maintenance, maintenance mechanic

#IND1

                                                              

                                                                                                                                              

TreeHouse Use Only: #IND1

title: Industrial Mechanic Apprentice (FT)
description:
We are looking for a team player for whom the challenges of a manufacturing environment is what you are searching for. You will work in collaboration with the production department and will be responsible for the proper functioning of production equipment and mechanical installations.

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure optimal operation of equipment
  • Respond to service calls quickly
  • Identify and diagnose breakdowns, irregularities and failures
  • Carry out preventive and corrective maintenance
  • Participate in continuous improvement projects
  • Installation of electromechanical equipment
  • Perform safety improvements on equipment
  • Respect the standards of quality as well as health and safety at work
Requirements 
  • Diploma in Industrial Maintenance/Mechanic/Millwright 433A.
  • Experience in electrical troubleshooting.
  • Experience in offset flexible flexograph printing (asset).
  • Knowledge of rigging and machinery moving techniques.
  • Knowledge of PLCs and mastery of computer tools such as the Internet, the MS Office suite.
  • Flexibility to answer emergency calls outside of your shift.
  • Good physical condition and ability to work in a warm environment, narrow places, in height and in different working positions.
  • Ability to work independently as well as on a team to complete major projects.
  • Interpersonal communication skills, autonomous, methodical and efficient.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
The Nuna Group of Companies is now accepting resumes for Heavy Duty Mechanics.  These roles are for Nuna's newest adventure located in Northern Canada, Nunavut.  This is your opportunity to experience one of Canada's most exclusive work locations!

Nuna offers:
  • Very competitive compensation package which consists of a balance pay schedule that will also provide income during your rotational days off; 
  • Extensive benefits package with a matching RRSP plan;
  • Company supplied flights;
  • Single / Private room accommodations;
  • On-site recreational facilities include weight room with tanning booth, gymnasium, theater, multiple entertainment/recreation rooms, and a bar/ lounge; 
  • Accommodations and full meals provided;
  • Annual Bonus program (at completion of term); 
  • Employee recognition program;
  • Rotation allowances - provided every rotation;
  • Long-term opportunities.

All successful candidates will be required to clear all pre-access conditions which will include criminal and security backgrounds, full medical /physical testing, and Drug and Alcohol testing. 

Due to the location of this remote worksite rotations will be 8 weeks in / 8 weeks out*  

Job Duties:
  • Assist with the maintenance, repair, and service of large off-road industrial equipment (Snowcats, Pistenbullyand Prinoth Cat snow groomers, Loaders, Back Hoes, Mac Dump Trucks, Fire Trucks, Graders, Dozers etc.)
  • Assist with the maintenance, repair and service of smaller equipment when required - vehicles (side by sides, ¾ Ton 4x4s, snow blowers, etc.)
  • Troubleshoot and inspect equipment to detect faults and malfunctions and determine extent of repair required.
  • Adjust equipment and repair or replace defective parts.
  • Test repaired equipment for proper performance.
  • Service attachments and working tools.
  • Welding to repair defective parts / equipment.
  • Keep maintenance reports and documentation 


Qualifications:
  • Minimum of 5 years working as a Heavy-Duty Mechanic, preferably in a remote work site,
  • Red Seal Certified Journeyman Heavy-Duty Mechanic.
  • Welding experience is required.
  • Must be qualified in accordance with current territory (Nunavut) or hold a provincial regulation to operate the vehicles and equipment listed above.
  • Must have qualifications to operate vehicles containing Hazardous Materials, where applicable.
  • Must be trained on driving with an attached trailer and safe backing.
  • Must be eligible for a valid DND 404 Driver Permit/ License.
  • Must be qualified 421A or certification (Nunavut). for restricted Off-Road Earth Moving Equipment (i.e., graders, loaders, and backhoes).
  • Must be qualified to maintain the specialty vehicles listed, which includes a qualification on turbine engines used in the CSUs.
  • Small Engine Mechanic to be qualified 435A or equivalent.
  • Previous experience operating heavy equipment is considered an asset.
  • Heavy civil, mining and/or exploration work setting experience is considered an asset. 
*Covid-19 Quarantine periods up to 14 days will be required before each rotation.

All successful candidates must:
  1. All candidates must be proficient in English, both verbally and written. (Bilingual candidates preferred).
  2. Have experience as requested in the job description above.
  3. Able to work in a remote location for extended rotations.
  4. Clear all pre-access testing/requirements.
  5. Eligible to work for any employer in Canada.
  6. Reside within Canada and have a valid Canadian Passport.
 
Nuna is committed to the principle of employment equity. We welcome diversity and encourage all who are qualified to express their interest.   

Interested applicants are asked to apply online at: http://nunalogistics.com/jobs.html
Or by email: hr@nunalogistics.com
 
We thank all who apply but only those selected for interviews will be contacted.  All resumes will be held for other current and future opportunities.
  
Nuna Logistics is a highly regarded civil construction company with hundreds of employees working across the Arctic and Northern Canada. Working often in remote locations, Nuna offers unique on-the-job experience and opportunity to build an exciting career. Our multi-disciplined teams provide a comprehensive array of services and innovative solutions to the most challenging and remote sites in northern Canada. Nuna's core values of: Safety - Integrity - Teamwork - Respect for Cultural Diversity and for Community & Environment; reflect our reputation as a safe, cost-effective, and innovative operator in the north.

title: Mécanicien(ne) industriel
description:
Job Details

Job Description

MÉCANICIEN(NE) INDUSTRIEL

 

Chez Produits Kruger, nous partageons la même vision de l'excellence. Nous fabriquons certaines des marques de produits de papier les plus populaires de l'Amérique du Nord - Cashmere®, Purex®, Scotties®’, SpongeTowels®, White Cloud®, ainsi que des produits hors foyer. Nous souhaitons toujours faire mieux pour nos clients et notre planète. Les prix que nous avons remportés nous rappellent que notre travail soutenu et notre engagement à agir comme il se doit ont porté fruit. Mais ces prix ne sont pas la raison qui nous pousse à continuer. Ce sont les personnes qui travaillent ici, qui croient en ce que nous faisons – et la manière dont nous le faisons qui comptent réellement.

 

Nous exerçons notre leadership dans les collectivités ainsi qu'en matière de développement durable et de relations avec nos consommateurs. Notre siège social est situé à Mississauga en Ontario et nous sommes fiers de nos quelque 2 500 employés répartis dans sept usines au Québec, en Colombie-Britannique, en Ontario et au Tennessee.

 

RESPONSABILITÉS :

L’objectif principal du poste est d’assurer la maintenance régulière et périodique des machines de transformation et d’effectuer d’autres tâches connexes de l’usine telles que : l’optimisation, le reconditionnement de pièces et de la soudure. Le candidat devra aussi démontrer de fortes aptitudes en dépannage (trouble shooting) afin de résoudre des problèmes complexes.

 

QUALIFICATIONS :

  • Être détenteur d’un DEC/AEC en maintenance industrielle. Toute autre combinaison de scolarité et d’expérience jugée équivalente pourra être considérée.
  • Détenir un minimum de 5 ans d’expérience de travail à titre de mécanicien dans le milieu industriel (obligatoire)
  • Avoir de bonnes connaissances générales en mécanique, hydraulique, pneumatique, soudure et usinage
  • Avoir une bonne acuité visuelle et auditive
  • Posséder un bon sens de l’observation et de l’initiative
  • Bonne habiletés et dextérité manuelles
  • Avoir de la minutie, précision et souci du détail
  • Bonne capacité à travailler sous pression et en équipe
  • Posséder un bon sens de l’organisation et avoir une bonne capacité d’analyse
  • Travailler sur un horaire rotatif en alternance (jour-soir-nuit)
  • Connaitre et respecter les lois ainsi que les règlements en santé et sécurité au travail

 

ÉVALUATION

Le candidat devra compléter avec succès un examen théorique et pratique.

 

QU’EST-CE QUE CE TRAVAIL VOUS APPORTERA?

  • Un environnement de travail stimulant et un excellent programme de formation
  • Une gamme complète d’avantages sociaux dont un régime de retraite à prestations déterminées
  • Une rémunération concurrentielle débutant à 34,96$ (38,69$ après la période de jumelage)
  • La possibilité de mettre de côté les heures supplémentaires effectuées et de les échanger pour journées de congés
  • Tous les équipements de protection individuelle fournis par l’entreprise
  • Tarifs privilégiés sur les produits Kruger : Cashmere®, Purex®, Scotties®’, SpongeTowels®, White Cloud®
  • Stationnement sur place gratuit

 

Notre mission est de rendre la vie quotidienne plus confortable pour nos consommateurs. Ensemble, nous faisons de cette mission une réalité. En tant qu'entreprise en constante évolution, il y a toujours de nouveaux défis passionnants, des options de carrière variées et des occasions d'innover. Vous voulez en savoir plus? Venez libérer la grandeur qui sommeille en vous chez Produits Kruger.

 

Nous avons été nommés l’un des meilleurs employeurs de la région du Grand Toronto au cours des neuf dernières années et figurons au palmarès des Meilleurs employeurs au Canada selon Forbes.

 

Produits Kruger souscrit à une politique d'équité en matière d'emploi et de ce fait, encourage tous les candidats qualifiés à postuler. Des mesures d’adaptation seront fournies dans le cadre de tous les volets du processus d’embauche, conformément à la politique d’accessibilité et du plan d’accessibilité pluriannuel de PK S.E.C. - 1.04.33. Les candidats doivent faire connaître leurs besoins à l’avance. 

 

Nous tenons à remercier tous les candidats pour leur intérêt à l’endroit de Produits Kruger. Seuls les candidats retenus seront conviés à une entrevue.

title: Millwrights/Mechanics
description:
Seaspan Shipyards is proud to be Canada’s long-term, strategic shipbuilding partner for the Canadian Coast Guard and Royal Canadian Navy. As a direct result of this work, while creating jobs and rebuilding our domestic shipbuilding industry, Seaspan Shipyards is delivering on the promise of ships built in Canada, by Canadians.

Vancouver Shipyards, based in North Vancouver, has a very busy and exciting year ahead, as we continue to make progress on the first of two 174m long Joint Support Ships (JSS) for the Royal Canadian Navy – the largest ships ever built in Canada! We are also constructing an Offshore Oceanographic Science Vessel (OOSV) for the Canadian Coast Guard and have secured significant contracts to build a second JSS, a Polar Icebreaker and several Multi-Purpose Vessels. These projects will bring long-term job stability for many years to come.

Now is the best time to be part of Canada’s shipbuilding industry! Join us and be part of the regeneration of the shipbuilding tradition and become a member of a talented, diverse team that is forging a bright future for Canadian shipbuilding at one of the most modern shipyards in North America.

Please send us your resume today! 

 

All candidates must show proof of:

  • Millwright, Mechanic or Heavy-Duty Mechanic Certificate of Qualification with Interprovincial Red Seal Endorsement; or a Recognized Equivalent Provincial Trades Qualification; or a Recognized Equivalent International Trade Qualification
  • Minimum of 30 Months Documented Mechanical Experience

Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • Shipbuilding experience in a new construction shipyard preferred
  • Comprehend and follow written and spoken directions and work in a safe & efficient manner
  • Good communication skills both written and verbal in the English language
  • Ability to work in a team environment or individually with a positive attitude
  • Demonstrated proficiency reading and interpreting blueprints and drawings
  • Demonstrates proficiency with alignment, rigging, layout and a variety of hand tooling
  • Must be able to work in a construction environment involving confined spaces, working at heights, physical labour, and various weather conditions
  • Must be able to be qualified to wear a respirator

 

On offer to you:

Seaspan is a progressive employer with a collaborative culture that supports health, safety, and diversity. Dispatch for this position will be managed through the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers - Local 692 and union membership will be required upon hire. Together we can provide you with a rewarding and challenging long-term career building state-of-the-art ships, as well as a competitive compensation and benefits package.

If you are interested in future opportunities, please apply online today.

 

Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, aboriginal persons, and persons with disabilities.

 

Disclaimers:

By applying, you agree that Seaspan may share your resume with our Union partner, International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers - Local 692

Note: Unsolicited applications from recruitment agencies will not be accepted

title: Mécanicien(ne) industriel / Industrial mechanic
description:
English version will follow

** BONUS DE SIGNATURE DE 1500$ après 6mois de service continu **

Poste : Mécanicien(ne) industrel
Quart de travail: Quart de 8h (nuit)
Lieu de travail: Montreal

POURQUOI VENIR TRAVAILLER CHEZ BALCAN INNOVATIONS ?
• Poste permanent et à temps plein
• Couverture d’assurance (Vie, Médicaments et paramédical)
• Formation à la tâche rémunérée et accompagnement par des collègues expérimentés
• Possibilité d’avancement et de te bâtir une carrière dans un domaine technique
• Prime de soir de 0,75$/h et de nuit de 2$/h
• Prime de fin de semaine : 1,50$/h samedi et dimanche
• Horaire avec temps supplémentaire
• RPDB (contribution employeur à un régime d’épargne)
• Environnement dynamique ; pas le temps de s'ennuyer!

Responsabilités:
• Modifier, réparer, installer, entretenir, améliorer et résoudre les divers types de machines, matériel et installations dans les départements de production
• Diagnostiquer les problèmes mécaniques, de fournir des solutions rapides et innovantes pour bris d'équipement mécanique en appliquant des compétences avérées dans les principes de la mécanique, de montage, de plomberie, la soudure de base, la fabrication métallique, l'usinage, le dépannage et résolution de problèmes analytiques
• Faire fonctionner un moulin, tour, perceuse, meuleuse, scie, et tous les autres outils d'ateliers d'usinage
• Installation, retrait et la réinstallation des processus et de l'équipement
• Modifier les machines d'emballage pour les produits nouveaux processus
• Effectuer l'entretien préventif et d'inspection de sécurité
• Fournir des solutions aux problèmes d'équipements de routine ou uniques
• Répondre rapidement aux questions liées à l'équipement de manière orientée vers le client

Exigences:
• Minimum 3 ans d'expérience mécanique dans le plastique et / ou de l'environnement de production
• Posséder de solides compétences en communication orale et écrite et les relations interpersonnelles
• Bonne connaissance des programmes d'entretien préventif
• Doit être flexible pour le temps supplémentaire et la fin de semaine
• Capacité à effectuer plusieurs tâches dans un environnement au rythme rapide, avec beaucoup de changement
• Excellente connaissance des procédures de santé et de sécurité et de verrouillage
• Esprit d'équipe avec des compétences en résolution de problèmes

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

** $1500 SIGNATURE BONUS after 6 months **

Job Title : Industrial mechanic
Workshift: 8 hours (Night)
Location : Montreal, Qc

WHY WORK AT BALCAN INNOVATIONS ?
• Full time and permanent position
• Group Insurance Benefits (Life, Medical and Paramedical)
• Paid on-the-job training and mentoring from experienced coworkers
• Opportunity for growth and to build a career in a technical field
• Evening premium of $ 0.75/h and night premium of $ 2/ h
• Saturday and Sunday premium of $1,50/h
• Schedule with overtime
• RPDB (employer contribution to a savings plan)
• Dynamic environment; no time to get bored!

Responsibilities:
• Modify, repair, install, maintain, improve and resolve various types of machines, equipment and installations in production departments
• Diagnose mechanical problems, provide rapid and innovative solutions for mechanical equipment breakdowns by applying proven skills in the principles of mechanics, assembly, plumbing, basic welding, metal fabrication, machining, troubleshooting and solving analytical problems
• Operate a mill, lathe, drill, grinder, saw, and all other machine shop tools
• Installation, removal and reinstallation of processes and equipment
• Modify packaging machines for new process products
• Perform preventive maintenance and safety inspections
• Provide solutions to routine or unique equipment problems
• Respond quickly to equipment-related questions in a customer-oriented manner

Requirements:
• Minimum 3 years of mechanical experience in plastic and / or production environment
• Possess strong oral and written communication and interpersonal skills
• Good knowledge of preventive maintenance programs
• Must be flexible for overtime and weekends
• Ability to multitask in a fast paced environment, with a lot of change
• Excellent knowledge of health and safety and lockout procedures
• Team player with problem solving skills

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic (FT)
description:
KPA Oilfield Services has been in business since 2004.  KPA is located in Northern BC in the community of Chetwynd. Our company offers gravel, limestone and rip rap, sales, and delivery, as well as a full line of heavy equipment including crushing equipment, graders, dozers, excavators, and various trucks.  We are currently looking for a reliable, hardworking mechanic to join our team and assist in maintaining our companies’ trucks and equipment.

Duties Include:
  • Preventative maintenance.
  • Truck and trailer repairs.
  • Heavy duty equipment service and repair.
  • Maintaining a safe, clean, and organized work area.
  • Other duties as required.

Knowledge and Skills Required:
  • Journeyman Certification preferred, but not required.
  • 2-5 years related experience desired.
  • Valid drivers license.
  • Exposure to working on diesel engines.
  • Basic problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
  • Ability to read and understand parts and services manuals in English.
  • General Knowledge of truck software and computer diagnostics.
  • Health and Safety Knowledge—OH&S rules and regulations guidelines.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Daily maintenance.
  • Diagnose equipment problems.
  • Preventative maintenance.
  • Work with management to maintain schedules and priorities.
  • Follow procedures and guideline.
  • Complete all documentation associated with equipment repairs.
  • Maintain a clean and orderly work environment.
  • Attend company training and safety programs as required.
 
Required experience:  2 years
Required license or certificate: Class 5 drivers license

title: Industrial Mechanic (Millwright)
description:
Ready for a new challenge?
Join a stable organization that will invest in your future, helping you advance and increase your value!

KP Building Products, a member of the Kaycan Group of companies is seeking an Industrial Mechanic to join our team at our Acton facility. As a Millwright, you will be responsible for, but not limited to, repairing, assembling and testing all types of equipment for production readiness.

Schedule: 8h - Day shift

We Offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Health and Dental benefits (after 3-months)
  • RRSP
  • Ongoing training initiatives

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for safely and effectively repairing, testing, installing and maintaining production equipment and facility systems
  • Identify and troubleshoot machine irregularities and breakdowns on extruders, cut off machinery, packaging equipment, power transmission, power transfer systems, compressors, pumps, grinders, process water cooling systems, shipping doors and gates
  • Work with and maintain hydraulic and pneumatic systems as well as pumps, gearboxes, bearings, seals and alignment of couplings
  • Perform preventive maintenance tasks as well as breakdown repairs
  • Fabrication for equipment repairs and/or upgrades
  • Perform other duties as assigned
  • Working from heights
  • Good understanding of blueprint reading
  • Good documentation & organizational skills
  • Fit and assemble parts using a variety of hand tools
  • Perform welding, hand finishing, grinding, and polishing
  • Participate in and provide on the Job training with/to other maintenance Team Members and Apprentices

Qualifications:

  • Possess a Certificate of Apprenticeship for Millwright, Industrial Mechanic
  • 3 years of relevant experience in a production plant
  • Experience with welding, fabrication, repair of all equipment found in a manufacturing plant
  • Experience with machining, mill, lathe, grinder, etc. would be an asset
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively with cross functional team members
  • Proven ability to adapt to changing priorities and working conditions
  • Capacity to identify short term and long term countermeasures for production problems that arise specifically when extruding plastic
  • Passion for teamwork, ongoing learning, continuous improvement and maintaining a respectful environment.
  • Support a call-in system for emergency repair
  • Willing to work overtime upon request
  • Strong English language communication skills (both verbal & written)

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements of the role will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Industrial Mechanic Millwright - Mon-Fri 7a-3:30p
description:
Company Description

About O-I

Remember the last time you opened a bottle of champagne? A cold beer after a hard day’s work or a bottle of sparkling mineral water to quench your thirst? Well, it was probably made by us. We are O-I and we love that we make more glass containers than anyone in the world. 

O-I has more than a century of experience crafting pure, sustainable, brand-building glass packaging for many of the world’s best-known food and beverage brands. We are proud to provide high quality glass packaging for beer, wine, spirits, food, non-alcoholic beverages, cosmetics and pharmaceuticals. 

Job Description

As an Industrial Millwright you will:

  • Install, repair, assemble and maintain plant machinery, equipment and structures. 
  • Reading and interpreting engineering blueprints
  • Works from complex blueprints, shop handbooks, layouts, and other specifications (written or verbal) to determine the materials and working procedures needed in the maintenance of plant machinery, equipment, and structures.
  • Welds, brazes, scrapes, solders, cuts, etc. various types of metals necessary for maintenance repairs and fabrication of new components and equipment.
  • Involved in rigging and scaffolding; moves heavy machinery and equipment; lubricates greases, oils, etc., plant machinery and equipment.
  • Conducting routine maintenance and safety checks.
  • Preparing and submitting maintenance reports.
Qualifications

The Industrial Millwright should have:

  • Must possess Industrial Millwright License with Red Seal Endorsement.
  • 5 years of related work experience as an Industrial Maintenance Mechanic
  • Must have experience using hand tools and power tools.
  • Must have experience and basic knowledge of computers and be able to enter PM activities
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills with the ability to read blueprints, diagrams and drawings
  • Basic computer and report writing skills
  • Must be able to read, write, and communicate using English language
  • Must be able to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodations.
  • Must be authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis
  • Ability to lift and manipulate heavy equipment
  • Good time-management skills

Hours of Work:

  • Mon-Fri 7:00 AM to 3:30 PM

What O-I Offers:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Opportunity for future growth and advancement
  • DC Pension Plan (3% Base company contribution and optional employee/company match component)
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • Paid time off
  • and much more…


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic (FT, Perm)
description:
Alpha Better Landscaping Inc is a leader in the commercial and residential landscaping industry; we are looking for an experienced Full-time Journeyman Heavy Equipment Mechanic located at our Calgary facility. This is a year round, full-time permanent position with an exciting opportunity to work in the green industry!

Key Responsibilities:
  • Read diagrams/schematics and manufacturers' repair manuals for work procedures.
  • Operate a hoist and lift device to position machinery parts in a safe manner.
  • Inspect and examine vehicles and equipment.
  • Lubricate, service, diagnose, repair, assemble, and maintain vehicles and equipment.
  • Timely and accurate diagnosis and repair including computer connection/diagnosis with a machine to identify fault codes.
  • Provides guidance and instruction to less experienced, or apprentice maintenance personnel.
  • Performing hands-on maintenance and repairs of all equipment.
  • Diagnosing electrical, mechanical, and hydraulic troubles.
  • Making repairs according to the manufacturer’s specifications.
  • Suggest positive changes to policy and procedures as required.
  • Initiative, diligence, and reliability.
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Other duties as required:
  • Knowledge of component R&R and electrical systems.
  • Repair both small and large engines including:  Landscaping equipment
  • Repairs to a fleet of Excavators, Dozers, Loaders, Skid steers, and Gravel Trucks, trailers.
  • Work is generally on heavy equipment, however, repairs to a fleet of class 7-8 tractors, gravel trucks, and water trucks may be required.
Required Knowledge and Experience:
  • Journeyman Certificate (Red Seal) Heavy Equipment Mechanic.
  • 7+ years of industry experience.
  • Valid class 5 (non-GDL) driver's license or higher.
  • Relatively clean driver’s abstract.
  • Excellent mechanical knowledge.
  • Physically fit, heavy lifting required.
  • Dual tickets will be considered an asset.
ABL offers competitive wages and a safe, professional work environment.  Company sponsored training (if applicable)




    About Alpha Better Landscaping:

    Our mission and core purpose is, "Building a Living Legacy."Divisions of the Alpha Better TeamThe Alpha Better Group of Companies is comprised of four different divisions, each of them representing a different aspect of the landscaping industry. Divisions: Alpha Better Landscaping, Delta Landscaping, Wheatland Trees and Homescapes.Alpha Better Landscaping Inc.This is the larges division in our group. ABL specializes in commercial landscaping construction in the developer and general contractor market. We help to create the neighbourhoods around the new homes that are being built in such new areas like Auburn Bay, Legacy, and Skyview. We also work in surrounding areas of Calgary like Mountainview in Okotoks, Heartland in Cochrane and Hillcrest and Reunion in Airdrie. We are also very proud to complete such high profile jobs like the Alberta Children's Hospital and Central Memorial Park.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Our client is a leading diversified forest products company, listed on the TSX, NYSE, and rated as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for eight years. Are you interested in working for a company that offers both a challenging work environment and a rewarding career path? Quesnel Plywood division in BC has an opportunity for a fully certified:

This position offers a challenging, diverse and exciting opportunity to become part of the team. Job duties will fall within our Mobile Shop department. This position requires an individual who will perform a variety of tasks related to the safe and efficient application of the technical skills and knowledge of a Heavy Duty Mechanic.

Duties involve the repair and maintenance of industrial equipment such as:
  • Log loaders, Wheel Loaders, Forklifts and other mobile equipment used in the manufacture of lumber.
  • Continually ensuring the quality and standards of service to safety and production are maintained.

Our ideal candidate must possess:
  • A valid Inter-Provincial or Provincial Journeyperson mechanic certification
  • Ability to read manuals and schematics
  • Knowledge of Hydraulics
  • Commitment to working safely and creating a safe work place
  • Ability to work independently with little supervision
  • Organizational and planning skills
  • Flexible schedule to work day, evening and weekend shifts
  • Considered a strong asset:
  • Experience working in a fleet shop
  • Cummins and Cat engine experience
  • Strong Electrical back ground
  • Welding
Client has over 60 locations across Canada, the United States and Europe. they believe strongly in promoting from within and pride ourselves on providing a challenging environment with continuous development. The successful candidate should be interested in future growth opportunities within the company.

Client offers an excellent compensation package including a competitive salary, excellent benefits and an outstanding pension plan.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
ROLE
The Mechanic is responsible for repairing, troubleshooting, adjusting, overhauling and maintaining mobile heavy-duty equipment.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Fabricate, construct, install, and repair equipment and machinery.
  • Diagnose equipment problems and determine required repairs.
  • Demonstrate continuous effort to improve operations, decrease turnaround times, and streamline work processes.
  • Perform daily safety and maintenance checks.
  • Repair, overhaul, maintain, and service heavy trucks and heavy construction equipment.
  • Repair, overhaul, maintain and service fuel injection systems, exhaust systems, cooling systems, air conditioning systems, lubrication systems, engine control systems, major internal engine repairs or overhaul, installation and alignment of engines and machinery.
  • Repair, overhaul, maintain and service drive trains and final drives, hydraulic transmissions, power take-offs, tracked vehicle suspensions and steering, vehicle brake systems, wheel-mounted vehicle suspension and steering.
  • Troubleshoot and inspect equipment to detect faults and malfunctions.

Note: In addition to these duties personnel are required to carry out such other duties as may be reasonably required in order to support the objectives of the company.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS
Qualifications
  • HD Equipment Mechanic Journeyman Certificate from a recognized provincial training authority is considered an asset.
  • Valid Class 3 Driver’s License including air brake endorsement.
Skills and Knowledge
  • Knowledge of truck and equipment safety.
  • Knowledge of workplace safety requirements and procedures.
  • Knowledge of operation of various pieces of heavy equipment.
  • Knowledge of equipment maintenance and storage procedures.
  • Knowledge of equipment cleaning standards and procedures.
  • Knowledge of handling hazardous materials and industry waste.
  • Mechanical aptitude and interest.

WORKING CONDITIONS
This position is field based and often works within remote project locations. Travel and/or living in temporary accommodations is required.

REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS
The Mechanic reports to the Master Mechanic. The position provides guidance to Mechanic Helpers.

 We thank all applicants in advance. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Heavy Duty Field Mechanic 8/6 Rotation
description:
Location: Grande Prairie, Alberta
Job Title: Heavy Duty Field Mechanic
Job Type: Permanent
Number of Openings: 1
Pay Scale: Up to $46/hr
Shift: 8/6 Rotation- 10 hour days - Wed-Thurs

Job Description:

Our client is one of the largest heavy-duty parts and service providers in Alberta. They are looking to hire a skilled and talented Service Truck Mechanic to start right away!

As a Heavy-Duty Service Truck Mechanic or Technician, you will be responsible for maintaining and repairing trucks, buses and other heavy diesel vehicles. The job of a Heavy Duty Diesel Truck Mechanic includes diagnosing and repairing brakes, engines, suspension and steering, and performing tasks from routine services to complete engine rebuilds to ensure smooth functioning.

This is a great opportunity for a Heavy Duty Service Truck technician/Mechanic to earn some decent income while working at a leading company. Searching for the best Diesel Truck Mechanic jobs in Alberta, Canada? Apply now!!
Position Requirements:
  • At least 3-5 years experience in the truck and transport or heavy-duty parts and services industry as a Heavy Duty Mechanic
  • 5 years experience as a field mechanic or running a service truck preferred.
  • Journeyman Ticket preferred but can consider strong 3rd or 4th Year Apprentice
  • Air Brakes tickets are considered an asset.
  • Class 3 drivers' license preferred but can consider Class 5
  • Excellent teamwork skills
Position Duties:
  • Repair and maintain large trucks equipment
  • Complete preventative maintenance: changing oil, batteries, lubricating, etc.
  • Request parts and equipment to maintain inventory as needed
  • Maintain all tools, work area and equipment in a clean and orderly fashion
  • Ensure work areas are kept clean and free of hazards
  • Ensure tools and equipment are returned to job boxes and tool cribs
  • Other tasks and labor duties as required on the job site
What’s in it for you?
  • Fantastic work environment
  • Opportunities for growth
  • Competitive Salary
  • Comprehensive benefits

title: Industrial Millwright
description:
Resolution Staffing Inc., is looking to a hire a certified Industrial Millwright for a long standing company in the Cobourg area.

The ideal candidate will be able to install, maintain, troubleshoot, overhaul and repair machinery and mechanical equipment.

Responsibilities

  • Assemble machinery and equipment prior to installation
  • Install, align, and relocate stationary industrial machinery and mechanical equipment
  • Assist with new plant construction, renovation and expansion
  • Identify and troubleshoot machine irregularities and breakdowns
  • Repair and replace defective machine parts and equipment
  • Perform routine and preventative maintenance on mechanical equipment
  • Able to read blueprints, diagrams and schematic

Requirements

  • C of Q and at least 5 years experience in an industrial setting
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and written
  • Experienced in metal fabrication, MIG and TIG welding
  • Ability to work in a team environment
  • Previous manufacturing/industrial experience
  • Able to pass a criminal record check
  • Experience using PLCs is an asset

Why Work for Us

  • Day Shift - Monday to Friday
  • Overtime after 8 hours
  • Benefits
  • RRSP Matching Plan
  • Growth and Advancement Opportunities

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $34.00-$39.00 per hour

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Heavy Duty Mechanic

PME Inc. is based in Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta. The PME Group provides civil site work and common construction services to the oil and gas industry in Western Canada. The key bases of work have most recently been to the oil refineries, oil sands development and oil and gas pipeline sectors in the greater Edmonton, Fort Saskatchewan and Fort McMurray areas.

At PME Group, we're constantly pushing the limits of what we've done in the past - propelling ourselves toward bigger and better opportunities, while exploring new market sectors and services. So it only seems natural that we'd hire people who have their own voice and aren't afraid to use it. These are people who are simultaneously critical, creative and captivated by construction. They make our business their business, and follow a path that with continuous learning and an innovative spirit leads them to be recognized as leaders in the industry. We hire these types of people knowing they are as diverse as we are, and they come on board because they share our core values. Then we simply give them the freedom to take their career (and PME Group) further.


  • Repair and maintain all makes of heavy construction equipment. (Dozers, Bulldozers, Excavators, Wheel Loaders, Scrapers, Water Wagons, Motor Graders, Compaction Rollers , Articulated Trucks)
  • Checking and sampling on all components of machine, fueling equipment, maintain paperwork and truck upkeep.
  • Work safely and in a timely fashion, staying in compliance with all company rules and regulations.
  • Some evenings and Saturdays may be required.
  • Candidate must have clean driving record and be able to pass Drug and Alcohol Screening.
  • CSTS-09, WHMIS 2015 and Standard First Aid/CPR are required.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Employer:

Conuma Resources Limited

#200, 235 Front Street, PO Box 2140, Tumbler Ridge, BC  V0C 2W0

Location:

Wolverine Mining Complex Limitedâ€“ Wolverine Forest Service Road, Tumbler Ridge, BC  V0C 2W0

Brule Mining Complex Limited â€“ Brule Forest Service Road, Chetwynd, BC  V0C 1J0

Willow Creek Mining Complex Limited â€“ Willow Creek Service Road, Chetwynd, BC  V0C 1J0

Position:

Journeymen/Red Seal Heavy Duty Equipment Technician

Term of Employment:

Permanent Full Time

Rate:

$48.69/hour to 51.26/hour (dependent on education)

Function:

Maintenance

Schedule:

12 hour shifts (7 days on / 7 days off / 7 nights on / 7 days off)

Transportation:

Employee bus transportation from Tumbler Ridge (Wolverine & Brule), Chetwynd (Brule & Willow Creek) and Mackenzie (Willow Creek)

Please be aware no camp facilities are available

Responsibilities:

  • Ensure adherence to Conumaâ€™s workplace policies and standard operating procedures.
  • Maintain a high level of Environmental and Health and Safety performance; identify and report risks, near misses and incidents with the goal of supporting and developing Conumaâ€™s excellent safety standards.
  • Attend and participate in all scheduled health, safety and environmental meetings and training.
  • Troubleshoot, diagnose and repair heavy mining equipment and ancillary equipment used in open pit coal mining such as shovels, drills, haul trucks, loaders, dozers and excavators.
  • Follow and comply with all safety, environmental, technical and HR procedures.
  • Actively participate in continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Respond to mechanical issues both in the maintenance shop and in the field.
  • Use hand tools (eg. Wrenches, screwdrivers), air and impact tools (eg. Wrenches, drills), sledge hammers and hydraulic torque equipment.
  • Operate materials handling equipment (eg. Hydraulic jacks and hoists, chains, overhead cranes, slings, come-a-longs), ladders, man-lifts, safety harness and lanyard, fork lifts, small loaders and trucks to access field repairs.
  • Other duties and tasks as assigned.

Education, Experience & Qualifications:

  • Red Seal Certification (Heavy Duty Equipment Technician) is preferred.
  • Minimum of 3 to 5 year apprenticeship program or a combination of over 4 years of work experience and industry course in heavy equipment repair.
  • 3-5 years mining experience repairing haul trucks, shovels, excavators and other heavy equipment.
  • Experience with OEM troubleshooting guides and systems preferred.
  • Experience creating parts lists from OEM web-based systems such as Caterpillar SIS preferred.
  • Completion of Grade 12.
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License.

Technical Competencies & Skills:

  • Work assignments could be shop or field, ability to work in either space.
  • Able to work 12-hour day and night shifts; on a 7x7 rotation.
  • Self-motivated, team player with a  positive attitude and the ability to work with minimal supervision.
  • Understanding of mining processes and mine monitoring control systems (operations and maintenance).
  • Good English communication skills both oral and written.
  • Willingness to work in adverse weather conditions.
  • Proven safety and attendance record.
  • Knowledge of computer maintenance systems.

Leadership & Problem Solving Capability:

  • Proven initiative and self-motivation.
  • Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively and within established timelines.
  • Ability to manage and prioritize assignments.
  • Demonstrated problem solving, decision making and critical thinking skills.
  • Lead by example to maintain high standards of conduct at workplace.
  • Possess cultural awareness and sensitivity skills.
  • Be consistent and fair in decision making process.
  • Proven conflict management skills.
  • Lead by example, possess a positive attitude and be a good ambassador for Conuma and the maintenance department.

Wage & Benefits:

  • Conuma provides competitive wages and benefits. Benefits include paid vacation, RRSP matching and extended healthcare.

Please forward all resumes to lsikora@conumacoal.com

Company Information

Conuma is a leading Canadian producer and exporter of metallurgical coal for the global steel industry. Products from our three mine operations in Northeastern BC, Brule, Willow Creek and Wolverine, leave us well-positioned to serve customers in South America, Europe and Asia.

Four time winner of the Edward Prior Mine Safety Award for the lowest injury frequency rate in British Columbia, Conuma continues to lead the industry with multi-million-dollar investments in the latest collision avoidance and fatigue monitoring safety technologies for the protection of our employees. Safety is not a goal to be achieved, it is our standard of expectation.

Conuma is much more than metallurgical coal. Conuma and its employees are embedded in our communities. The company’s Pay It Forward program began in 2017 and since then has raised over $425,000 in support The Children’s Foundation. Locally, Conuma’s employee winter hockey matches ensure much-needed donations to the Food Bank, while in the summer, our employees get together to assist the local high school teams as they prepare their go-karts for the Conuma Challenge.

Our local communities in Northeastern British Columbia are amongst some of the most beautiful surroundings in North America. At the Tumbler Ridge UNESCO Global Geopark, employees can enjoy almost limitless hiking amongst some of Canada’s biggest waterfalls, ride through ATV and snowmobile trails, explore 97 million-year-old dinosaur footprints, ski cross-country trails, play ice-hockey, swim indoors and out, cycle, and enjoy the sense of community only a small town provides. An hour and a quarter away, Chetwynd is famous for its chainsaw wood carvings and offers a range of kayaking, snowmobiling and rock-climbing opportunities. Regarded as a wonderful place to raise a family, with affordable costs of living, Northeast British Columbia is the outdoor paradise our employees are proud to call home.

Conuma Resources is an equal opportunity employer.

description:
MÉCANICIEN INDUSTRIEL

Description du poste
Notre client situé à Val-d’Or cherche unmécanicien industriel,capable deréparer/entretenir/souder/usiner/régler leséquipementset lamachineriede lascierie.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Job Description:

Heavy Duty Mechanic

 

Voice is a privately owned civil construction firm providing services for high profile clients and projects across Alberta and British Columbia. We specialize in petrochemical site preparation and related earthwork construction projects. Since our founding in 1939 Voice has grown considerably yet still maintains a family culture. At Voice you will find challenging work and opportunities for career growth through mentorship and career development!

 

Voice Construction is hiring a Heavy Duty Mechanic. The successful candidate will be  responsible for making sure all necessary equipment repairs are completed on large earth-moving and construction equipment.

 

The Heavy Duty Mechanic will be based in the field and shop in Kitimat, BC.

 

Project Shift Schedule: Monday - Friday; this shift is subject to change

 

We are looking for a LOCAL worker from the Kititmat area.

 

Essential Job Functions

  • Interpret work orders and technical manuals
  • Diagnose faults and malfunctions
  • Adjust equipment and repair or replace defective parts, components or systems
  • Component rebuilds
  • Test repaired equipment for performance

Required Experience and Education

  • Journey-person   Heavy Duty Mechanic
  • Field experience on industrial projects
  • Experience on service truck

We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

 

For more information about starting your career with Voice please visit www.voiceconst.com.

title: Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic Opportunities in Surrey, BC
description:
Talon Recruiting has partnered witha market leader in innovative equipment solutions in the industrial, heavy equipment, and material handling sectors. Together, we are searching for Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanics to join their team in Surrey, BC.
These positions are part of our client's busy Service, Installation/New Build or Rail Departments, responsible for:
  • Installing and assembling equipment and supporting systems
  • Performing maintenance, repairs and testing on our customers’ various types of equipment focusing on truck-mounted cranes and a variety of municipal and rail equipment
  • Completing some minor fabrication work
  • Performing other duties as required
Our ideal candidates will have:
  • 3 to 5 years of related experience with heavy equipment installations and/or maintenance
  • Their Red Seal Certification as a Heavy Duty Equipment Technician / MechanicOrwill be in their 3rd or 4th year of their apprenticeship with related heavy equipment experience
  • Strong hydraulic and electrical experience and knowledge
  • Solid mechanical skills with the ability to troubleshoot problems and read schematics
  • The ability to maneuver in and around heavy equipment
  • Excellent communication skills and enjoy working as part of a team
  • The ability to work independently
  • Your own tools
  • Forklift certification
  • A welding ticket and/or experience is a definite asset
  • A Class 5 driver’s license with air endorsement would also be an asset

About the Benefits:

The successful candidates will be rewarded with acompetitive salary, based on their skills and experience. In addition, they’ll also receive access to a wide range of benefits, including:
  • 100% prescription coverage and paramedical coverage
  • 100% basic dental coverage
  • Long-term disability (LTD)
  • Employee family assistance program
  • Paid sick days
  • Paid vacation available in the first year of employment
  • RRSP/DPSP plan with matching contribution by the company
  • Premiums if you hold a current occupational first aid ticket
  • Opportunities for overtime
  • Opportunities for training and development
  • Non-unionized environment
  • Balanced work/life with casual and fun professional atmosphere
  • Social events including summer cook-offs, lunches and seasonal parties
Please send resumes to nate@talonrecruiting.com

title: Junior Industrial Mechanics
description:
RS Breakers & Controls is an Original Equipment Supplier and we are dedicated to providing excellent customer service by providing customized solutions. Our 35,000 square foot warehouse stocks over 100,000 products including MCC Wrapper/Buckets, Panel Switches, Circuit Breakers, Bus Plugs, Distribution Panel Boards, and so much more. We stock products of all amperages and voltages to serve residential, commercial, and industrial needs.

Primary functions: 

We are looking for industrial mechanics to disassemble and re assemble mechanical mechanism and other industrial parts.  Responsibilities include assisting technicians in reconditioning and testing various types of electrical apparatus such as sticky circuit breakers, vacuum breakers, transformers, and motor control systems.

Qualifications:

  • High school/vocational school/trade school.
  • Basic industrial mechanics skills.
  • Class G license.
  • Knowledge of air breakers and other electrical apparatus is an asset but not mandatory.

Experience:

Not essential though some experience with air breakers and other electrical apparatus would be an asset.

Technical and business skills:

  • Willingness to learn and self-study with ability to train into the job.
  • Must have good work ethics – e.g. reliable and punctual.
  • Must have a industrial mechanics aptitude.
  • Experience with basic hand tools and knowledge of basic mechanisms
  • Good English skills - reading, writing and spoken.
  • Basic MS office skills.

Wage and Benefits:

  • Hourly rate of $16-18 depending on qualifications.
  • Extended health benefits after three months including prescription drugs, dental, etc. fully paid by the Company.
  • Vacation of two weeks per year and paid sick leave up to five days per year.
  • Work environment that supports development and growth with opportunities to grow with the Company with training opportunities.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - Journeyman
location: Fort McKay Incubator ParkIncubator Park, AB
description:
Birch Mountain Enterprises (BME) are hiring experienced Heavy Duty Technicians immediately. We have guaranteed work, 12 hour days, day and night shift, with multiple shift schedules available to choose from. We also provide competitive hourly rates, overtime after 8 hours a day, monthly living allowance, company health and dental benefits, with disability and life insurance, a health spending account, a retirements savings plan (RSP), employee assistance program, and access to discounts for various businesses in town.

Company Background: 

Established in 2005, Birch Mountain Enterprises is an equal opportunity employer with over 350 employees throughout the Fort McMurray region. Operating from its main operations in Fort McKay, BME provides vac, water, waste, fuel, and flat bed hauling services to industrial and commercial customers. 

When you join our team, you join a family of employees dedicated to a safe, enjoyable, and positive work environment. We offer competitive wages and seek candidates that are seeking secure, long-term employment. 
 

Job Summary: 

Operating from our Fort McKay main shop, this position involves shop and field repairs to our fleet of heavy-duty highway trucks.  Candidates shall have knowledge on all aspects of heavy spec trucks with preference given to those that possess experience with water, vac, high pressure and flusher units.  


Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Repair or replace defective parts, components or systems
  • Install new or replacement parts according to manufacturer and/or truck specification
  • Test repaired equipment for proper performance and to ensure work completed meets manufacturersâ€™ specification and AB Transportation regulations
  • Completion of repair documentation including but not limited to work order, field level risk assessment, and hazard identification
  • Follow instructions for tasks assigned by shop supervisor
  • Complete daily housekeeping of assigned area or service vehicle to ensure maintenance of company image
  • Attend daily tool box and safety meetings as scheduled and adhere to corporate and site safety regulations and procedures.

 

Qualifications:

  • Must be certified as a Journeyman Heavy Equipment Technician (min 3 years heavy truck experience)
  • Possess valid driverâ€™s license (min class 5) with clean abstract
  • Be knowledgeable in all aspects of heavy truck repair including, but not limited to hydraulic, electronic, suspension and computer diagnosis
  • Previous or related experience with water, vac and steam trucks preferred
  • Clear verbal and written communication skills
  • OSSA (or OSSA BSO) and CSTS certification
  • Must successfully pass BME pre-employment evaluation, D&A and fit for duty pre-employment screening

 

Submission: 

We thank you for your interest in Birch Mountain and remind all candidates that only successful applicants will be contacted. Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to local candidates. 

For more information about Birch Mountain Enterprises, visit www.bmel.ca

title: Millwright/Mechanic
description:
Job Description

Job Title: Millwright/MechanicWork Site: Plant Maintenance, Vancouver General HospitalStatus: Regular Full TimeStart Date: As soon as possibleSalary: $34.29 per hourHours:

0730-1530

Days off: Saturday, Sunday, and statutory holidays

Reference#: 147926-ndh

 

Come work as a Millwright/Mechanic with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Millwright/Mechanic to join the Plant Maintenance team at Vancouver General Hospital. Apply today to join our team!

 

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order) as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

 

As a Millwright/Mechanic with VCH you will perform skilled work at the journeyman level in the maintenance, installation, movement, fabrication/construction and repair of hospital equipment and machinery using a variety of tools such as lathes, drill presses, cutters, electric arc and gas welders, grinders, drills, rigging, and a variety of hand tools.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience

  • Grade 10 plus two years’ recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

  • Certificate of Apprenticeship or Trades Qualification Certificate as a Journeyman Millwright recognized by the Province of B.C.

Knowledge & Abilities

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints and drawings.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.

  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff

Diversity, equity and inclusion are essential to delivering exceptional care and building a great place to work. At VCH, we value and accommodate unique differences to ensure that our staff and medical staff (both current and prospective) have the opportunity and are supported to thrive.To build a strong and representative workforce, we are seeking candidates who will contribute to a caring and inclusive culture. We encourage applications from members of communities that are disadvantaged on any grounds under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including Indigenous Peoples, people of colour, people of all genders and sexualities and people with disabilities.VCH is proud to be recognized as a Best Place to Work in Canada in 2021 by Glassdoor and Forbes.Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting. ***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.
