title: Temporary Utility Worker
description:
Highlights of the job

EPCOR is looking to hire up to three (3) temporary full-time Utility Worker positions for up to 11 months in Edmonton, AB!

 

We are looking to add a motivated and capable Utility Worker to work alongside Utility Workers, cablemen, power linemen, and other EPCOR team members. While putting safety first in all your tasks, you will be completing operational functions as assigned from civil construction, cable pulling and materials support in Electricity. You work as a team player as you carry out work efficiently, effectively and co-operatively with other work groups. You are also a self-starterwhile working independently. As part of the utility construction crew, you will be responsible for day to day field operations contributing to the capital placement or maintenance of Electricity Operations infrastructure.

What you’d be responsible for

  • Operating an EPCOR vehicle in a safe manner.
  • Assisting the cableman, power lineman or equipment operators in their tasks and duties.
  • Analyzing situations and determining appropriate actions including communication with other crews, contractors and the foreman.
  • Stocking trucks and assembling materials for use.
  • Ensuring safety of workers in the air, underground and vicinity of the work zone.
  • Reading and understanding basic electrical maps and relevant work package documents.
  • Ensuring all required documentation is on the truck including insurance and registrations, daily trip forms and safety fitness certificate.
  • Assisting equipment operations.
  • Completing landscaping and working with concrete.
  • Assisting in developing Safe Work plans and promoting a safe work environment for workers and the public.
  • Following EPCOR and Occupational Health & Safety regulations, procedures and policies.
  • Loading and unloading of material.
  • Responding to emergency callout situations and demonstrating a high level of safety awareness.
  • Ensuring work is compliant with applicable government regulations, codes and company operational and safety standards.
  • Gathering and organizing job specific tools and supplies.
  • Assisting trades and equipment operators when required.

What’s required to be successful

  • Grade 12 diploma or GED or equivalent.
  • Valid Class 5 Alberta Motor Vehicle Operator's License with no more than 6 demerits.
  • Minimum 1 year of experience working in utilities.
  • Ability to qualify for and maintain an EPCOR Driver's permit.
  • Attention to detail, open communication and analytical thinking and problem solving skills.
  • The following qualifications will be considered an asset and preference may be provided to individuals who possess:
    • Previous related work experience in Electricity Operations;
    • Being familiar with EPCOR’s confined space requirements and having up to date confined space training;
    • Working knowledge of AEUC, EPCOR policies, procedures, work practices, OH&S act First Aid/CPR certification;
    • Trained in confined space protocols;
    • Proven mechanical inclination; and
    • A valid class 3 or 1 license with air brakes.

 

The successful applicant must demonstrate exceptional interpersonal skills, interact professionally with team members and the public. They are also able to openly communicate and work with their coworkers to resolve issues positively. They demonstrate their attention to detail, take initiative in their own learning, and is comfortable with learning new skills. Health and safety is integral to EPCOR's work, and we strive to maintain a zero-injury organizational culture. As such, all candidates must possess a high level of safety awareness and demonstrate safe work practices at all times. Employees are required to actively participate in safety and other job-related training.

Other important facts about this job

Jurisdiction: IBEW 1007

Class: SS1 (8700)

Wage: $22.48 to $37.60 per hour

Hours of work: 8 hours per day between the hours of 0700h -1800h, 5 days per week, Monday through Friday. However, in accordance with Article 6.02 of the Agreement, the work week may be any 5 consecutive days.

 

Application deadline: May 12, 2022

 

EPCOR employees: please ensure that you are using your “@epcor.com” email address.

 

Learn more about Working at EPCOR!

Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, Glassdoor or Facebook!

 

#LI-TA2

 

Please note the following information:

  • A requirement of working for EPCOR is that you are at least 18 years of age, successfully attained a high school diploma (GED, or equivalent level of secondary education)and legally entitled to work in Canada. (A copy of a valid work permit may be required.)
  • If you are considered for the position, clearance on all applicable background checks (which may include criminal, identity, educational, and/or credit) and professional reference checks is required. Some EPCOR positions require an enhanced level of background assessment, which is dictated by law. These positions require advanced criminal record checks that must also be conducted from time to time after commencement of employment.
  • A technical/practical assessment may be administered during the selection process and this exercise will be used as a part of the selection criterion.
  • To meet the physical demands required of some positions, candidates must be in good physical condition and willing to work in all weather conditions. Clearance on pre-placement medical and drug and alcohol testing may be required.

title: Tool Rental Service Technician Full Time (1 Year) BRAMPTON NORTH
description:
Position Purpose:

Tool Rental Service Technicians are responsible for the day-to-day operation and maintenance of equipment in the tool rental department. Providing outstanding service to customers by having available equipment that is reliable and properly maintained is the key responsibility of this position. Service Technicians must have a thorough knowledge of all tools and must effectively manage the tool inventory by maintaining the tools and repairing them as necessary. This position also involves forecasting and ordering parts for repair, using a computer to process transactions, training Tool Rental Associates on how to turn and service tools properly, maintenance duties (e.g., keeping work area clean and organized), and acting as a Sales Associate on the floor.

Position Responsibilities:

We're looking for the type of associates who can tap into their inner orange by:

  • Performing preventive maintenance on tools
  • Forecasting and maintain an adequate inventory of parts for repair
  • Using information from manuals, vendors, etc. to help diagnose problems and restore equipment
  • Cleaning, inspecting, and preparing tools for rental to customers
  • Ensuring tools are repaired and available for rental in a timely manner while keeping costs to a minimum
  • Processing tool rental transactions (logging repairs and work orders, generating contracts, taking deposits, turning contracts into invoices upon equipment return etc.)
  • Training Tool Rental Sales Associates on turning, operation, and minor repair of new and existing tools
  • Helping customers by providing information and answering questions
  • Ensuring rental equipment is properly displayed, signed, and maintained
  • Troubleshooting and maintenance of all equipment
  • Demonstrating working knowledge and/or hands-on experience with all products in department
  • Must operate cash register and follow all related procedures
  • Maintaining a high level of knowledge of all tools including how to maintain, repair, order parts, proper usage, etc.
  • Analyzing information to recognize potential problems, identifying causes of equipment problems (loose parts, misuse by customers, etc.) and proposing solutions
  • Providing outstanding customer service
  • Safety expectations for this role are outlined under The Home Depot Canada Environmental Health & Safety Management system element under "Worker"

Experience/Knowledge Required:

The kind of orange we’re looking for will possess:

  • Minimum time in position and performance management code requirements of V2 (or P3 in previous system)
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and weekends
  • Excellent communication skills and customer service skills
  • Knowledge of all policies, procedures and duties related to customer service
  • Excellent decision making ability and problem solving skills
  • Knowledge of tools including how to maintain, repair, order parts, proper usage, etc.

title: Building Maintenance Technician
description:
Description:

Agilus is recruiting for a Building Maintenance Technician in the Real Estate Industry in Kitchener, Ontario.
This position provides an opportunity for an experienced maintenance professional and includes an employer-provided apartment. Working as part of a live-in team for a leading real estate services company, your expertise will contribute to ongoing tenant satisfaction and safety.
You will:
  • Perform scheduled maintenance tasks and safety checks
  • Respond to unscheduled repair requests indoors and outdoors
  • Handle cleaning duties and seasonal activities such as snow removal, spraying or watering
  • Accompany contractors while work is being completed onsite
  • Practice occupational health and safety, adhere to emergency procedures and report breaches of regulations

Successful candidates will have:
  • Experience with Residential Property Management (and related regulations) as well as strong customer service skills
  • Extensive knowledge of maintenance related to HVAC, generators, boilers, swimming pools, sprinklers etc.
  • An ability to multi-task and respond to varying requests from minor repairs to apartment turn-over, to updating records
  • Flexibility with hours, on-call schedules and particularly around end-of month activities
  • Relationship skills and communicating effectively in person or electronically with vendors, residents, staff, etc.

You'll receive:
  • $30000.00 - $35000.00 annually
  • 5% bonus linked to performance
  • Provided two bed-room apartment with hydro, basic cable and parking spot included.
  • Paid benefits & available pension plan

Interested?
Please apply directly online by email jblack@agilus.ca
Agilus would like to thank all candidates for their interest in this opportunity. Due to the volume of resumes we receive; we may only be able to respond directly to those candidates being selected for an interview.
We encourage you to visit agilus.ca regularly or subscribe to our email alerts at agilus.ca/Account/Register as new exciting employment opportunities become available daily.

We value a diverse workplace.
Agilus Work Solutions is committed to employ people from diverse backgrounds and we actively demonstrate inclusiveness through fair, equitable and accessible hiring practices. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome candidates who identify as visible minorities, Indigenous people, persons with disabilities, and persons within the LGBTQ+ community. We feel it is important as an organization that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

 Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities will be provided upon request during the recruitment, assessment, selection and placement process. Alternative format available onRequest.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Canuck Compounders, located in Cambridge, Ontario, is a company of NanoXplore Inc., a manufacturing company specializing in the production of recycled compounds for the various markets.


We are currently seeking to fill the following position:

Maintenance Technician


Reporting To The Operations Manager, Job Duties Include:


  • Maintain, troubleshoot, repair and overhaul plant manufacturing equipment
  • Perform routine preventative maintenance activities on key equipment
  • Maintain complete and accurate records of all maintenance activities
  • Maintain and repair the facilities and building grounds
  • Support the installation and commissioning of new equipment and upgrades
  • Additional maintenance duties as assigned

Candidates must possess the following qualifications:

  • Excellent mechanical aptitude and problem solving skills
  • 3-5 years' experience maintaining, troubleshooting, and repairing mechanical, hydraulic, and pneumatic systems (preferable in an industrial setting)
  • The ability to work independently
  • A motivated self-starter with attention to detail and the ability to multi-task
  • Proven track record of past attendance and punctuality
  • Health & Safety conscious attitude
  • Physically fit and able to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Comfortable working in an industrial plant setting
  • Experienced using computers and Microsoft Office programs
  • Knowledge of PLC's and electrical systems an asset
  • Relevant education and training or Industrial Mechanic/Millwright certification an asset
  • Fabrication, welding (ARC, MIG, or TIG), or machining experience an asset

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
We are searching for a experienced maintenance technician.

Requirements:
  • General experience and have the ability to be mobile to attend to various Job sites in GTA.
  • Tools would be an asset and we are prepared to train the right candidate. 
  • This opportunity offers career development for those who are interested to be engaged in both maintenance and renovation. 
  • Our company offers competitive wages plus car allowance and bonuses. Interested candidates should send their resume to schedule an interview.

title: Millwright
description:
One of our manufacturing clients in Brampton, ON is looking for a Millwright for their manufacturing facility.

Shift - Afternoon or Midnight

Responsibilities-

  • To analyze, repair, and troubleshoot mechanical machinery, equipment, and components

  • Certified/Licensed Industrial Millwright;

  • Two years of experience in an automotive manufacturing environment or a minimum five years of experience in an industrial environment;

  • Physically capable of performing essential duties of the job.

  • Skills: Numatics, Stamping press, Hydroforming process, Assembly welding lines, Fabrications, Welding, and Machining

  • Analyze, repair, and troubleshoot machinery such as: Stamping presses, Hydroforming presses, Robotic welding assembly lines, Conveyors and other Hydraulic Systems.

  • Analyze, repair, and troubleshoot pneumatic and hydraulic circuits and their associated components. (Hydraulic experience is a prerequisite).

  • Design, modify, and update related schematics;

  • Optimization of machine functionality for uptime, cycle time, and energy conservation;

  • Commitment to continuous improvement and work place safety;

  • Assist the maintenance department planning of PM activity scheduling;

  • TS16949 awareness and adherence;

  • ISO14001 awareness and adherence;

  • Lean Manufacturing and 5S concepts awareness and adherence;

  • Services, maintains, repairs, installs and tests new or existing equipment and verifies conformance to specifications

  • Accepts personal responsibility to plan and conduct their work safely in compliance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act as well as company policies and guidelines;

title: Maintenance Person
description:
Join our team and enjoy the many benefits of working for Canada's fastest-growing, privately-owned hospitality company, including a competitive employee compensation package, diverse employee schedules, and internal corporate career advancement. If you are looking for a future career in hospitality, then the Sandman Hotel Group is for you.

The Maintenance Person will be responsible for performing general building and property maintenance. The duties will include Routine Maintenance of pools, hot tubs and the boiler room. Servicing heating, ventilation and air conditioning units. Drywall repairs and painting, caulking and apply silicone when needed. Replace light bulbs and fixtures as needed. Respond to guest's maintenance requests to improve their stay. The Maintenance Person needs to be competent with using hand and power tools and work to a WHMIS Health and Safety Standard. Personal protection equipment MUST be used in compliance with Work Safe regulations.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must have a valid Drivers' License and own vehicle.
  • High school diploma/GED.
  • 2 years of maintenance experience.
  • Minimum 1 year of experience in the operation and maintenance of buildings.
  • Overtime as required.

DUTIES:

  • Drywalls repairs and caulking (required)
  • General knowledge of plumbing repairing.
  • Gerenal knowledge about heating units and air conditioners (PTAC units)
  • Seasonal outdoor landscaping
  • Perform regular property inspections of the hotel including common areas, building exterior, and landscape.
  • Responsible for vandalism clean up and repair, within skill level.
  • Maintain heating and air conditioning systems, boilers, pumps, fan units, control panels, thermostats, cooling towers, etc.
  • Maintain working knowledge of environmental safeguards and alarm systems.
  • Maintain fire alarms and extinguishers..
  • Maintain outside grounds (remove snow, ice, and debris, spray and remove weeds, sweep and clean gutters, water and maintain sprinkling systems)..
  • Detect faulty operations, defective material and report those and any unusual situations to proper supervisor.
  • Prepare, paint and decorate interior and exterior surfaces, as required.

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

  • Ability to perform small repairs
  • Carpentry skills and refinishing wood preferred
  • Effective communication skills with individuals at all levels.
  • Must be familiar with cleaning products.
  • Strong customer service orientation and skills.
  • Interact with management, co-workers, and public.
  • Ability to stand for long periods of time.
  • Must be able to lift, push, pull, and move a minimum of 25 pounds.
  • Must have or be prepared to take Pool Operator's Course provided by AHS.

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.

title: Millwright (FT)
description:
Crown Packaging is an integrated manufacturer and marketer of corrugated cartons and sheets, printed paper wraps and wallboard tape. We have built a strong and loyal customer base by developing and nurturing strategic partnership-style relationships.

Crown Packaging is dedicated to providing an engaging and positive work environment. Many of our employees have enjoyed working for Crown Packaging for the greater part of their careers; we have many employees with 20, 25, 30, or even 35 years of service.

We currently have an opening for a Millwright to join our Maintenance Team for our plant located in Richmond, BC. This role reports directly to the Maintenance Supervisor.

Benefits:
  • A competitive hourly rate of $44.98 per hour.
  • Afternoon and graveyard shift differentials.
  • A comprehensive health care plan including drug cards, vision care, life insurance and dental coverage.
  • 10% pension.
  • An exceptional retirement plan.
  • 3-7 weeks of vacations, pending years of service.
  • 13 paid holidays (stats plus, Christmas Eve, Boxing Day and Easter Monday), per year.
  • Employee Assistance coverage with full services, including dietary and nutritional services, retirement planning, and support services.
  • Annual Events~ holiday, safety and employee recognition events.
  • Free on-site parking.
  • Opportunities for overtime.

Main Responsibilities:
  • Works around and in close proximity to rotating (operating) equipment in order to troubleshoot, diagnose equipment failure and carry out repairs.
  • Completes assigned and scheduled work orders and performs preventive maintenance on all associated equipment.
  • Determines parts required for repairs and replacement.
  • Dismantles modifies and maintains all equipment as needed.
  • Reads and interprets drawings, diagrams, and plans.
  • Determines and follows procedures for testing existing and newly installed machines and equipment to maximize output.
  • Uses a variety of hand and power tools, electric meters and material handling equipment while performing duties
  • Follows all maintenance procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory codes while always maintaining a safe work environment.
  • Reports any safety and/or quality issues as needed.
  • Operates forklifts as required.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Requirements:
  • Communicates effectively with Maintenance employees, the Operations team and all other departments, suppliers, and contractors to review, fix and determine effective maintenance practices.
  • Follows all Company processes and procedures.
  • Exceptional communication skills.
  • Accountable and dependable, and, has the ability to manage time effectively.
  • Superior problem-solving abilities.
  • The ability to work on a shift rotation.
  • Has a strong work ethic.
  • Able to lift and carry objects, as required.
  • Experience in a manufacturing setting is an asset.

Education/Experience:
  • Red Seal certification, required
  • Forklift tickets, Propane tickets and scissor lift tickets are all beneficial.
  • 5+ years of related experience in an industrial setting

Shift Rotation:
  • Day: 7:00am – 3:00pm (4-6 weeks)
  • Afternoon: 3:00pm – 11:00pm (2 weeks)
  • Graveyard: 11:00pm – 7:00am (2 weeks)

We are an equal opportunity employer, and as such, will review all qualified applications for this posted position.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Please note, our location is not situated near public transit, applicants must have their own vehicle.

title: Maintenance Assistant
description:
EQ3 was born in opposition to trends, vowing instead to focus on timeless designs. We make furniture not fast, but to last. Our greatest hope is to have our pieces passed down like heirlooms. We pride ourselves on being innovators in our industry, and we believe that the more voices and choices we incorporate into our perspective, the better we're able to find creative solutions for modern life.

Everything we do is made in consideration of people, of the planet and of our space.

We are looking for an enthusiastic, collaborative individual to join our Maintenance Team as our Maintenance Assistant. This role is full-time, permanent working out of our head office and plant located at 70 Lexington Park, Winnipeg, MB. The Maintenance Assistant will be responsible for performing highly diversified duties to assist and support all maintenance production activities and other facility equipment.

THE SKILLS YOU'LL NEED:

  • Previous experience using power tools and equipment
  • Mechanical engineering certification or degree considered as asset  
  • Basic carpentry skills such as cutting, nailing, sanding, use of a router, etc.
  • Knowledge in lathe milling operation, welding, drilling, grinding, and other related works
  • The ability to interpret drawings and schematic diagrams
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively under pressure with minimal supervision
  • Experience collecting, recording, and maintaining data with a strong attention to detail
  • Physically fit with the ability to lift, carry, and climb as needed
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a team environment
  • Good written and verbal communication skills

MORE ABOUT THE ROLE:

  • Perform scheduled preventive maintenance activities of all machineries and equipment
  • Troubleshooting, repairing, and replacing parts as necessary
  • Complete job work order requests in a timely manner. Tasks include metal fabrication, carpentry, operation lay-out changes, installation and bringing down high rise racking, office's task requests
  • Organize and update maintenance tools and spare parts inventory
  • Support maintenance manager to identify all spare part requirements
  • Respond to after-hours emergency calls including weekends as necessary

WORK LIFE AT EQ3:

  • A company that supports work-life balance with paid time off and flexibility
  • Competitive compensation and benefit packages
  • Employee discount program for products, wellness plans, group banking and more
  • EQ3 Spirit Committee that promotes community engagement, rewards, and recognition for all employees
  • Surround yourself with a community that supports professional growth and collaboration

CLOSING DATE: May 12, 2022

HOW TO APPLY: Submit your complete application by clicking on “Apply to Position” now!

We thank all interested individuals, however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Maintenance Support
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald's Ottawa team is growing! If you are committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you. The Maintenance Support position is located in Sudbury. Their primary focus is to maintain property and equipment as assigned and assist the Maintenance Mechanic(s) as required.

Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Performs physical inspections of building service rooms and areas both interior and exterior
  • Performs periodic and seasonal preventive maintenance tasks and minor repairs
  • Assists Maintenance Mechanic with mechanical maintenance such as filter and belt changing, greasing, etc.
  • Complete planned maintenance activities as assigned, providing notes and comments on completed work, identifying repair opportunities, taking pictures as required and ensuring minimal rework
  • Report all system, equipment and/or condition anomalies
  • Perform property maintenance tasks such as lawn and walkway maintenance, utilizing property equipment such as mowers (push and ride), weed trimmers, snow blowers, UTV with plow etc
  • Assist with setup and teardown of internal events (i.e. setting tables and chairs for functions)
  • Assist Maintenance Mechanic with project related component or system replacements and repair
  • Conduct system investigations with Facility Manager as required
  • Perform light duties such as sweeping, cleaning, painting, garbage removal, snow removal, assisting zone technicians, mechanics, etc.

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Customer Focus
  • Teamwork and Collaboration
  • Values and Respects Others

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 3 or more years' experience as a Maintenance Support or General Labour/Handyman support
  • Experience working with various hand tools
  • Experience working with property maintenance equipment

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Must be able to attain and maintain a Secret security clearance
  • Basic mechanical and repair skills
  • Excellent customer service skills with desire to exceed customer expectations
  • Excellent verbal and written communications.
  • A team player, committed to working in a quality environment
  • Ability to work in confined spaces, on a ladder or scaffold at various heights
  • Bending, lifting, pushing or pulling required; up to 50lbs.
  • Bilingualism (French/English) is an asset

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Dual License Maintenance Mechanic
description:
DUAL LICENSE MAINTENANCE MECHANIC
MISSISSAUGA
PERMANENT FULL-TIME


The Dual License Maintenance Mechanic is responsible for the repair and maintenance of processing packaging equipment to ensure ongoing, cost effective operations, in a multi shift environment. Assist with repair and maintenance of electrical and electronic components when required.


ACCOUNTABILITIES

• Repair and maintain packaging equipment and high speed PLC controlled equipment
• Repair and maintain processing and material handling equipment
• Carry out requirements of Preventative Maintenance programs
• Perform facility repairs as required
• Ensure all work is completed in a safe manner and complies with applicable industry standards
• Repair, upgrade and install electronic controls and equipment
• Program and modify PLC's
• Train other mechanics in electronic controls
• Assist equipment operators to improve line efficiency

QUALIFICATIONS

• Minimum grade 12 or equivalent
• Preference given to candidates with previous experience in a food manufacturing environment
• Millwright & Electrical licenses required
• 5 years' experience in repair and overhaul, troubleshooting of processing, packaging and material handling equipment in a manufacturing environment
• Preference given to candidates with experience with welding and machining
• Familiarity with one or more of the following equipment: Golio, Triangles, TransWrap, Nelson, Jones, Pod machines, Can Lines, Grinders and Roasters
• Must have demonstrated history of safe work habits
• Troubleshooting electrical, pneumatic and hydraulic systems
• Able to take direction, both verbal and written, and communicate effectively
• Electronic and analytical aptitude
• Ability to bend frequently and lift heavy equipment as required
• Able to work under pressure

OTHER RELEVANT INFORMATION

• Availability to work rotating shifts
• Overtime available
• Candidate to report into the Maintenance Supervisor

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
The Salvation Army is an international Christian church. Its message is based on the Bible; its ministry is motivated by love for God and the needs of humanity.

Mission Statement
The Salvation Army exists to share the love of Jesus Christ, meet human needs and be a transforming influence in the communities of our world.

Core Values
The Salvation Army Canada and Bermuda has four core values:

Hope: We give hope through the power of the gospel of Jesus Christ.
Service: We reach out to support others without discrimination.
Dignity: We respect and value each other, recognizing everyone’s worth.
Stewardship: We responsibly manage the resources entrusted to us.

Broadview Village has 40+ years of providing outstanding support to adults with developmental disabilities and mental health challenges. We are currently hiring a Full-Time Maintenance Worker. This position reports to the Director of Operation and is currently assigned to work in the East York (Broadview Avenue & O'Connor Drive) area. This is a full-time position that works 40 hours per week currently scheduled to work a combination of weekdays and weekends rotating as applicable, flexible to meet program needs.

The performance of the job requires operating equipment and tools, painting/plastering, bending/twisting/lifting, and occasional ladder work and fine motor skills (when working with small pieces of equipment in confined areas). The successful candidate is required to lift more than 20 pounds and carry out work throughout a specific portfolio of buildings and group homes, and external grounds.


RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE

  • Monitor and carry out general maintenance of vehicles. Report any problems to supervisor.
  • Meet with supervisor daily to discuss any priorities and maintenance concerns
  • Complete general plumbing repairs as needed or requested.  Report any other plumbing concerns to supervisor
  • Complete any repairs to electrical fixtures within scope of experience and knowledge.  Report any other electrical problems to supervisor.
  • Clean all exterior windows, eaves troughs, drains and spouts
  • Complete all minor carpentry, plastering, painting, glass/screen replacement and general repair
  • Identify materials required for repair/maintenance and submit to supervisor
  • Assist in the moving of furniture, appliance and household supplies as required
  • Maintenance of grounds as needed or requested
  • Inform supervisor of any maintenance requirements which require the use of outside service providers.  This includes, but is not limited to plumbing, electrical and vehicles.
  • Comply with the provisions of the Occupational Health & Safety Act and regulations
  • Adhere to agency’s Health & Safety Policies and program
  • Complete daily walkthroughs/inspections of site as assigned
  • Report accidents/injuries/workplace hazards in a timely manner
  • Responsible use of agency’s vehicles, equipment and property
  •  Follow the principles of nonviolent crisis intervention philosophy


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • General knowledge of repair and maintenance
  • An appreciation, sensitivity and respect for community living of persons with developmental disabilities
  • Valid First Aid Certificate, including CPR
  • Valid Driver’s License
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • General Computer skills – Microsoft office


LOCATION: East York (Broadview Avenue & O'Connor Drive) area.

HOURS: This is a full-time position that works 40 hours per week currently scheduled to work a combination of weekdays and weekends rotating as applicable, flexible to meet program needs

RATE OF PAY: $20.88 per hour

POSTING EXPIRES: May 15, 2022 at 11:59 pm

The Salvation Army will accommodate candidates as required under applicable human rights legislation. If you require a disability-related accommodation during this process, please inform us of your requirements.

At Broadview Village we are committed to living as an inclusive organizational culture by:

  • Purposefully cultivating and promoting equity, diversity, and inclusion of all persons regardless of their differences
  • Not accepting any discrimination, intolerance or inequitable treatment and committing to working together to combat these actions wherever they may be found
  • Valuing the unique differences inherent in all of us
  • Gaining inspiration and support through the collective voices and actions of all of us

In support of our commitment to a healthy and safe workplace and community, The Salvation Army (TSA) has a vaccination requirement for all employees in Canada. The successful candidate will be made an offer of employment on the condition of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and will be required to provide proof of full vaccination, prior to their employment start date. The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to provincial/territorial human rights legislation. If the candidate is unable to vaccinate for a reason protected by the Human Rights Code, a request for accommodation can be submitted and written proof satisfactory to TSA will be required.

We thank all applicants, however, only those candidates to be interviewed will be contacted.

Internal Applicants, please advise your managing supervisor of your intentions prior to submitting your application.

This is a Bargaining Unit position represented by OPSEU Local 550

title: Maintenance Technician - Parkside
description:
You’re going to love it here. That’s a promise we make to both our residents and our employees. At American Campus Communities we are passionate about creating rewarding careers for our team members. As a Maintenance Technician you’ll find a hardworking, motivating culture with unlimited potential for contribution and growth.

As a full-time Maintenance Technician, you will be responsible for preserving the condition and functionality of a student housing community. The successful candidate will prepare apartments for new residents to move into and provide excellent customer service while performing general maintenance work orders in their homes.

We’re looking for a professional who can take initiative! Here’s what your typical day may look like:

  • Complete interior and exterior work orders including, but not limited to: electrical, plumbing, HVAC, drywall repair, painting, appliances and make readies.
  • Preventative apartment maintenance and general repairs of the buildings’ exterior and interior systems
  • Assist with maintaining swimming pool and spa, snow/ice removal, removing debris from the grounds, moving furniture, and unloading/storing supplies
  • Responsible for being On-Call for emergency work orders and lock-outs
  • Assist in completing Monthly Facilities Plan tasks and Basic Operating Systems & Standards to meet our goal of a clean, well maintained community
  • Attend employee staff meetings and company safety meetings/webinars
  • Report any observed violations of property rules and regulations to Maintenance Supervisor/Manager and/or General Manager

American Campus Communities Culture Commitments

  • Our people are devoted to a culture of inclusion, diversity, and equality in the workplace and our communities.  We are committed to intentionally executing an evolving set of goals specific to inclusion, diversity, and accountability, driven by empathetic leadership and embraced by all.
  • The core of American Campus culture involves everyone being fully invested in everything that we do down to picking up the smallest piece of trash. No matter their position or duration at any given property, everyone picks up trash because we take pride in our community.
  • Serve as an American Campus representative and liaison in all interactions.
  • Certain activities involved in this position may be photographed and/or video and audio recorded for quality control and/or training purposes. Compliance with the Photo, Video and Voice Recording Policy is a condition of employment

Your background and experience needed to excel in this role should include:

  • A High School diploma or GED
  • One to three years of building maintenance experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • HVAC and appliance repair experience
  • The ability to operate various types of tools and equipment safely and lift various items up to 50 lbs.
  • The ability to understand and follow all safety protocols including understanding MSDS on use of chemicals

ACC is now hiring, and we’re committed to creating rewarding careers for our team members from day one!

No matter their position or duration at any given property, everyone picks up trash because we take pride in our community.', 'Serve as an American Campus representative and liaison in all interactions.', 'Complete interior and exterior work orders including, but not limited to: electrical, plumbing, HVAC, drywall repair, painting, appliances and make readies.', 'Assist with maintaining swimming pool and spa, snow/ice removal, removing debris from the grounds, moving furniture, and unloading/storing supplies', 'Certain activities involved in this position may be photographed and/or video and audio recorded for quality control and/or training purposes. Compliance with the Photo, Video and Voice Recording Policy is a condition of employment']

title: Maintenance Technician (Electrical Specialist) (Sarnia, ON, CA)
description:
WHO WE ARE

“Powering Economies and Communities”

TransAlta owns, operates, and develops a diverse fleet of electrical generation assets in Canada, the United States and Australia, providing municipalities, industries, and businesses with safe, low-cost, and reliable clean electricity. For over 100 years, TransAlta has been a responsible operator and proud community-member where its employees work and live. We are committed to fostering a dynamic, productive, and safe work environment. Our employees contribute to a diverse, open, and transparent culture with clear accountabilities, strong leadership, and challenging opportunities for personal career growth.

For more information about TransAlta, visit our website at, www.transalta.com.

Our Commitment to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion

It is our collective mission to ensure that every single employee feels a sense of inclusion and belonging and can show up to work as their true authentic self. TransAlta is committed to hiring a diverse workforce including women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities, and members of the LGBTQ2+ community. TransAlta believes that diversity enhances the quality of its performance, is an essential element to effective corporate governance, and cultivates a strong workplace culture. Click here for our Diversity and Inclusion Pledge.

TransAlta has received certification fromDiversio, a technology company setting the global standard for equity, diversity, and inclusion, for its continued commitment to and meaningful performance on ED&I in the workplace.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are currentlyseekinga full-time Maintenance Technician, specializing in electrical controls and high voltage to join our team in Sarnia. As the Maintenance Technician, you must be willing to learn and work with others. Additionally, there is an expectation that you willbeavailable for call-out as required to respond to emergency maintenance needs. Please review the following responsibilities and experience / qualifications to see if this role is a fit for you. All applications will be reviewed upon receipt.

This is a full-time unionized, site-based position located at our Cogeneration Plant in Sarnia, Ontario. The successful candidate will be required to complete pre-employment testing.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Ensure high voltage protection and control, medium and low voltage relay, as well as breaker testing and maintenance
  • Maintain and test of high and medium voltage transformers and auxiliary equipment
  • Be responsible for the repair of all electrical and controls equipment within the plant
  • Perform regular preventative and predictive maintenance checks on plant equipment
  • Read and interpret electrical single line drawings
  • Work with vendors, consultants, and electrical contractors
  • Research,investigate, and preparereports
  • Troubleshoot plant systems and submit job requests on those systems that require maintenance work
  • Maintain the units within all applicable guidelines and regulations, including emissions, efficiency, heat rate, capacity, and safety
  • Maintain a complete set of maintenance records and schedules on plant equipment using computerized maintenance management system
  • Take corrective action for all situations in which the health or safety of the staff or plant equipment is at risk
  • Strictly adhere to policies and procedures for the safe isolation of equipment and systems while performing maintenance work
  • Follow all accepted equipment maintenance procedures, and at the same time is continually seeking methods for improving the reliability of the equipment and/or systems
  • Maintain a thorough knowledge of the plant systems, and updates training material as changes to the plant systems are made
  • Be available for call-out as required to respond to emergency maintenance needs
  • Work with Maintenance Support Staff to support maintenance activities within the plant
  • Work with the Maintenance Support Staff to ensure adequate supply of spare parts are on hand
  • Other duties as required

ABOUT YOU


To be successful in this role, we are looking for the following must-have qualifications and experience:

  • Engineering Technologist Diploma
  • High Voltage protection and control, medium and low voltage relay and breaker testing and maintenance
  • Knowledge of SEL relays
  • Knowledge of electrical high, medium, and low voltage Health and Safety practices
  • Experience with predictive and preventive maintenance techniques
  • Root Cause Analysis and problem-solving expertise
  • Demonstrate initiative, integrity, resilience, and tenacity
  • Ability to work in teams and influence others
  • Organized with a high level of attention to detail
  • Quality customer service orientation

Nice to Haves

  • Bachelor of Applied Science degree or Engineering degree
  • 309A, 442A Electrical Licenses
  • CET designation
  • Engineering design experience
  • Project Management experience
  • SAP experience

Our comprehensive and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, incentive, and rewards programs form the foundation of TransAlta’s excellent employment proposition.Our commitment is to attract and retain the best talent. Some positions may require the successful completion of one or more background checks such as criminal, medical, or compliance. If these verifications are needed, they will be indicated on the job posting.

Become part of our TransAlta team today! We look forward to reviewing your application. All applications will be reviewed in a timely manner to the best of our abilities. We appreciate your patience and understanding during the recruitment process.

title: Journeyman Millwright
description:
Journeyman Millwright - (2200005W)

Description

 

We invite you to Explore the Potential of being part of something Clearly Essential! 

Compass Minerals (NYSE: CMP) is a leading global provider of essential minerals focused on safely delivering where and when it matters to help solve nature’s challenges for customers and communities. The company’s salt products help keep roadways safe during winter weather and are used in numerous other consumer, industrial, chemical and agricultural applications. Its plant nutrition products help improve the quality and yield of crops, while supporting sustainable agriculture. Additionally, the company is pursuing development of a sustainable lithium brine resource to support the North American battery market and is a minority owner of Fortress North America, a next-generation fire retardant company.

Compass Minerals operates 12 production and packaging facilities with nearly 2,000 employees throughout the U.S., Canada and the U.K. Visitcompassminerals.comfor more information about the company and its products.

We are currently seeking an Industrial Mechanic (Millwright) to join our Team at our Wynyard Plant site in Wynyard, Saskatchewan.

The  Wynyard Plant is located right on Big Quill Lake, in a friendly community of 1,800, situated 50 minutes from the city of Humboldt and a 2 hour drive from Saskatoon. Our Wynyard Plant is Canada’s largest producer of sulfate of potash (SOP), currently employing 34 people, with an annual production of 37,000 metric tonnes of SOP.  Our product is used in pharmaceuticals, specialized agricultural fertilizer, animal food and in various industrial applications, serving our customers throughout North America, South America, Europe, and regions of Asia.

 

What you’ll like about us:

  • Well Compensated: We offer a competitive compensation package including bonus plan.
  • Rest and Relaxation:Paid vacation, paid sick and personal floating days.
  • Benefits:Medical, dental, vision, disability, employee assistance program, tuition reimbursement, and much more.
  • Prepare for your Future:Defined Contribution Pension Plan with company match and contribution.
  • Shared Core Values: Our people must share five core value in everything we do  - high performance, value creation, collaboration, respect, and integrity.
  • Safety: We are committed to creating a safe work environment and protecting our employees and customers.
  • Environmentally Responsible:We are commited to safely carrying out our tasks in an environmentally responsible manner, ensuring pollution prevention, reduction of waste and minimizing the consumption of resources.
  • Meaningful Work: What sets us apart is the work we do impact daily lives – and every employee contributes. We transform Earth’s resources that ultimately help keep people safe, feed the world and enrich lives, every day.
  • Growth and Development:We see our development programs and helping our employees meet their personal growth goals as a key part of our business’s growth.
 
How will you contribute to the team?
 
Summary: This position, reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, will be responsible for the maintenance, repair, and installation work of mining infrastructure. The position will also be responsible for manning the various fixed plant services on site.
 

Essential Responsibilities and Requirements

(Management reserves the right to add or modify the duties and responsibilities at any time.)

  • Support and participate actively in all site-level Environmental, Health, Safety, and Security initiatives and comply with all OH&S policies and regulations.
  • Repair, assemble and/or disassemble gear boxes, pumps, and other machinery in accordance with proper specifications and techniques.
  • Maintain valves inclusive of packing, lubricating and disassembly/replacement/repair.
  • Learn and utilize the JD Edwards EnterpriseOne Maintenance Module at an appropriate level (Generate work order requests, data entry, close out work orders, etc.)
  • Lubricate and inspect assigned plant/shop equipment as per routine schedule.
  • Provide assessment of general equipment condition (e.g. unusual vibration, noise, and/or heat) and reports perceived problems to the proper authority.
  • Perform routine oil changes, filter changes, inspection, and basic maintenance and repair of plant and mobile equipment as required.
  • Clean and wash equipment and machinery.
  • Scrape paint, grease and accumulated material from equipment.
  • Paint and apply protective coatings. 
  • Proficiently and safely operate common hand and power tools.
  • Pipe fitting in metallic and plastic piping systems.
  • Read and correctly interpret information contained in equipment and vendor manuals.
  • Perform blueprint interpretation and layout.
  • Assist with a wide variety of plant maintenance and/or upgrade procedures.
  • Conduct inspections related to the structural Asset Management Plan and complete follow-up repairs as assigned.
  • Respond to audible pages and intercom calls for assistance, diagnosis, and equipment repairs as required.
  • Ensure that work areas are maintained and left in a clean and safe fashion.
  • The ability to work in tight spaces, hot, wet, dry, and dusty environment(s), climb ladders/stairs, and retain a high degree of physical stamina for extended hours. 
  • Be willing to work at heights.
  • Ability to work overtime as necessary and/or rotating shifts.
  • Be available for after hours and weekend on-call (In rotation with other maintenance personnel).
 

Qualifications

 

You bring to the role:

Education and Experience

  • Journeyperson certification in the Industrial Mechanic (Millwright) trade. Apprentices may apply.
  • Five years of related experience in an industrial setting is preferred.
  • Must have or be able to obtain CWB Welding Certification.

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to carry out each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

  • Must demonstrate a strong mechanical aptitude with the ability to troubleshoot, repair or replace equipment. 
  • Be proficient in equipment rigging and hoisting techniques.
  • Proficiency with the operation of mobile equipment (Forklifts, Skid-Steer Loader, Wheel Loader, Aerial Personnel Platforms, Tractors, etc.).
  • Metal fabrication, welding, and cutting (Proficiency in operating SMAW (“stick”), GMAW (“mig”), Oxy-Fuel, Plasma welding and cutting equipment).
  • Basic carpentry skills.

Licenses: Possess a minimum of a valid Class 5 driver’s license.

Computer Skills: The individual should possess basic proficiency with computers. 

 

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies.

Interpersonal Skills: Ability to present issues clearly and concisely in group settings.

Written Communication: Concise, complete and well-organized written communications are essential.

Planning/Organization: Must have the ability to independently and effectively plan organize, coordinate and follow-up on assignments. Possess the ability to perform duties in a productive and quality manner with minimal supervision.

Professionalism: Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Follows through on commitments.

Quality: Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality.

Language Skills: Proficiency in the English language, both oral and written communications. Ability to read, analyze and interpret job related information.

Mathematical and Reasoning Ability and Skills: The ability to perform mathematical functions pertaining to maintenance and fabrication work.  Must be able to proof own work for accuracy. 

 

 

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is routinely required to:

  • Stand, walk, climb stairs, climb ladders, kneel, crouch, stoop, sit, lay, crawl, and to work and travel on a variety of surfaces and terrain. 
  • Reach with hands and arms, push and pull, show good manual dexterity, and use hands to handle or feel.  
  • Speak, hear and have specific vision abilities including close vision.
  • Frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds, occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds, occasionally lift and/or move greater than 50 pounds with assistance. 
  • Work in both indoor and outdoor conditions, heat, cold, high humidity, rain, snow, and in wet and dusty locations. 

Compass Minerals is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive considerations for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. Compass Minerals is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. To request reasonable accommodations, contact careers@compassminerals.com or (519) 524-8351.

 
 

Primary Location

: CA-CA-Wynyard

Work Locations

: 
Wynyard, SK CAN 
2 Big Quill Road Off Hwy 16
 Wynyard S0A 4T0

Job

: Craftworker

Organization

: Plant Nutrition

Schedule

: Regular

Shift

: Standard

Job Type

: Full-time

 Variable

: May 4, 2022, 10:51:24 PM

title: Maintenance Technician (Relocatable Structures)
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?
At Dexterra, we create exceptional customer experiences that make our clients shine. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together to turn problems into solutions and challenges into moments of ingenuity.

As a Maintenance Technician, you will inspect buildings and other structures to determine functional systems and detect malfunctions and needed repair; make notes and recommendations.

Your work will include:

  • Perform minor electrical maintenance to include but not limited to replacement or repair of fixtures such as wall switches and outlets, incandescent and fluorescent bulbs and tubes, ballast, sockets, fuses, minor appliances, cords etc. using appropriate hand, powder and specialty tools
  • Perform minor plumbing maintenance such as replacement or repair of leaks in drains and faucets, unclogging of drains, trenching and laying new lines, replacing drain hoses on washers and similar devices, etc.
  • Perform minor carpentry work such as preparing surfaces, drywall, hanging doors, fitting locks and handles etc.
  • Reconfigure, install, position and remount modular offices. Using various hand, power and specialty tools.
  • Operate heavy equipment to load/unload materials and set modular offices. 

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Be part of an industry that's more important than ever!
  • Career advancement opportunities.
  • Whereas other companies are downsizing, we are growing!
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader.

Follow Dexterra on LinkedIn and Facebook. 

Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Minimum of one to three years’ experience working in a commercial property maintenance environment.
  • Aptitude for servicing tenants with the ability to see both the customer’s perspective and the impact on the organization.
  • Adapt to change and deal with difficult and stressful situations in a professional manner.
  • Demonstrate a high level of discretion and confidentiality.


Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: Level I Technician
description:
Company Bio:

Applus+ is a global leader in the Testing, Inspection and Certification sector delivering non-destructive testing, inspection, engineering, and manpower services to the aerospace, power, and, oil and gas industries. We are a trusted partner who enhances the quality and safety of our clientsâ€™ assets and infrastructures while safeguarding their operations. We deliver this through our technical capabilities, innovative approach, and our motivated team who are committed to operational excellence.

 

Applus+ has achieved a significant global presence and a leading position in its target markets and regions. As a result, our teams have expanded with 19,000 professionals across the world, attracting the very best talent in the industry.

 

Together beyond standards.

Position Purpose:

The overall duty of this position is to provide field support by performing NDT inspections in compliance with legislated industry codes, standards and procedures under direct guidance of the Level II Technician. Supporting the Level II Technician, the Level I Technician conducts NDT inspections by supplying and/or holding materials or tools required for the applicable NDT method/s including transporting the necessary equipment required to perform the inspections. Assisting the Level II Technician, the Level I Technician provides guidance, knowledge and skills to develop and mentor the Trainee Technicians.

 

Due to the nature of this position there will be on-call and overtime requirements as well as some travel.

Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Assists the Level II Technician in work execution and daily tasks assigned as required.
  • Prepares and completes all necessary paperwork required in compliance with client, industry and company standards and policies.
  • Replenishes and organizes the required supplies, as needed, to perform assigned NDT methods.
  • Performs basic NDT inspections under direct guidance of the Level II Technician.
  • Responsible for cleanliness of all work areas and vehicles.
  • Observes test procedures and product compliance to learn internal and industry specifications; applying knowledge and skill learned based on Level I certifications.
  • Observes and learns the procedures required to perform work and to gain certification in the required NDT methods.
  • Observes and learns proper documentation and reporting processes required for NDT in accordance to relevant industry codes, standards and procedures.
  • Actively promotes and proactively models the companyâ€™s focus on safety when interacting with all current and future employees and clients.
  • Strong commitment to quality inspection and reporting.
  • Represents Applus with outside groups, regulatory bodies, associations, and clients.
  • Adhering to organizational policies and procedures, including but not limited to Applus Code of Ethics and Confidentiality Agreements.
  • Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary.
Knowledge and Skills:
  • Firmly adheres to the values and ethics of Applus. Exhibits honesty, discretion, confidentiality, and sound judgment.
  • Strong technical knowledge and understanding of NDT techniques, services and procedures.
  • Fundamental understanding of industry codes, regulations and practices.
  • Ability to operate NDT equipment including setup and tear down.
  • Knowledge of radiation safety and operational field requirements regarding radiation safety.
  • Ability to read technical documents and procedures and apply them in the field.
  • Excellent report writing and review skills.
  • Excellent customer service focus, ability to quickly build strong working relationships with business partners and colleagues.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills matched with the ability to negotiate and build relationships with key stakeholders.
  • Ability to adapt in a high pressure and high production environment while managing competing priorities with minimal supervision.
  • Strong organizational skills with demonstrated ability to prioritize, solve problems, and consistently meet deadlines.
  • Focused on continuous improvement and committed to learning new practices and developing better ways of doing things.
  • A sense of urgency, good attention to detail, excellent organizational and analytical skills, pragmatic, eager to learn.
  • Ability to excel in a team environment.
  • Strong computer skills in MS Office and other software applications.
Education and Work Experience:
  • High School Diploma or Canadian General Equivalency Diploma, (GED).
  • Canadian General Standards Board (CGSB) Level I certification/s.
  • 3-5 yearsâ€™ experience in NDT inspection.
  • Valid Class 5 driverâ€™s license.
Working Conditions:
  • Required to work both inside and outside in heat/cold, wet/humid and dry/arid conditions in temperature extremes and inclement weather.
  • Frequently required to use personal protective equipment to prevent exposure to hazardous materials in various working environments.
  • Commonly exposed to walking on slippery or uneven surfaces.
  • Occasionally required to work in noisy/loud working environments especially on project
  • Required to work overtime during the week and weekend depending on project scope and work volume.
  • Occasional to frequent travel will be required within Canada.
  • Working conditions will vary between project locations.
  • Overtime required during the week and weekend with work volume
  • Ability to be flexible with work schedules and respond to requests without advance warning or notification

Applus+ has achieved a significant global presence and a leading position in its target markets and regions. As a result, our teams have expanded with 19,000 professionals across the world, attracting the very best talent in the industry.

 

Together beyond standards.

The overall duty of this position is to provide field support by performing NDT inspections in compliance with legislated industry codes, standards and procedures under direct guidance of the Level II Technician. Supporting the Level II Technician, the Level I Technician conducts NDT inspections by supplying and/or holding materials or tools required for the applicable NDT method/s including transporting the necessary equipment required to perform the inspections. Assisting the Level II Technician, the Level I Technician provides guidance, knowledge and skills to develop and mentor the Trainee Technicians.

 

Due to the nature of this position there will be on-call and overtime requirements as well as some travel.

Duties and Responsibilities

  • Assists the Level II Technician in work execution and daily tasks assigned as required.
  • Prepares and completes all necessary paperwork required in compliance with client, industry and company standards and policies.
  • Replenishes and organizes the required supplies, as needed, to perform assigned NDT methods.
  • Performs basic NDT inspections under direct guidance of the Level II Technician.
  • Responsible for cleanliness of all work areas and vehicles.
  • Observes test procedures and product compliance to learn internal and industry specifications; applying knowledge and skill learned based on Level I certifications.
  • Observes and learns the procedures required to perform work and to gain certification in the required NDT methods.
  • Observes and learns proper documentation and reporting processes required for NDT in accordance to relevant industry codes, standards and procedures.
  • Actively promotes and proactively models the company’s focus on safety when interacting with all current and future employees and clients.
  • Strong commitment to quality inspection and reporting.
  • Represents Applus with outside groups, regulatory bodies, associations, and clients.
  • Adhering to organizational policies and procedures, including but not limited to Applus Code of Ethics and Confidentiality Agreements.
  • Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary.

Knowledge and Skills

  • Firmly adheres to the values and ethics of Applus. Exhibits honesty, discretion, confidentiality, and sound judgment.
  • Strong technical knowledge and understanding of NDT techniques, services and procedures.
  • Fundamental understanding of industry codes, regulations and practices.
  • Ability to operate NDT equipment including setup and tear down.
  • Knowledge of radiation safety and operational field requirements regarding radiation safety.
  • Ability to read technical documents and procedures and apply them in the field.
  • Excellent report writing and review skills.
  • Excellent customer service focus, ability to quickly build strong working relationships with business partners and colleagues.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills matched with the ability to negotiate and build relationships with key stakeholders.
  • Ability to adapt in a high pressure and high production environment while managing competing priorities with minimal supervision.
  • Strong organizational skills with demonstrated ability to prioritize, solve problems, and consistently meet deadlines.
  • Focused on continuous improvement and committed to learning new practices and developing better ways of doing things.
  • A sense of urgency, good attention to detail, excellent organizational and analytical skills, pragmatic, eager to learn.
  • Ability to excel in a team environment.
  • Strong computer skills in MS Office and other software applications.

Education and Work Experience

  • High School Diploma or Canadian General Equivalency Diploma, (GED).
  • Canadian General Standards Board (CGSB) Level I certification/s.
  • 3-5 years’ experience in NDT inspection.
  • Valid Class 5 driver’s license.

Working Conditions

  • Required to work both inside and outside in heat/cold, wet/humid and dry/arid conditions in temperature extremes and inclement weather.
  • Frequently required to use personal protective equipment to prevent exposure to hazardous materials in various working environments.
  • Commonly exposed to walking on slippery or uneven surfaces.
  • Occasionally required to work in noisy/loud working environments especially on project
  • Required to work overtime during the week and weekend depending on project scope and work volume.
  • Occasional to frequent travel will be required within Canada.
  • Working conditions will vary between project locations.
  • Overtime required during the week and weekend with work volume
  • Ability to be flexible with work schedules and respond to requests without advance warning or notification

title: Maintenance Mechanic- North York
description:
Job Description:

Weâ€™re a naan traditional companyâ€¦

 

What is the recipe for a great career at FGF?

Working at FGF Brands, there is never a dull moment! As a successful company that is continually growing there is always challenging yet rewarding work to be a part of.  We have an entrepreneurial spirit which encourages all our team members to use their own creativity and out of the box thinking to come up with solutions and new ideas.

 

Letâ€™s be frank. FGF is not for everybody. Our culture is unique. We dive headfirst into the unknown. If youâ€™re fun-loving, talented and fearless, weâ€™re for you.

 

What FGF Offers:

  • Disruptive and a naan-traditional mindset
  • An inclusive and dynamic culture
  • Accelerated career progression
  • Commitment to learning and development
  • Opportunity to be impactful
  • Competitive compensation

Maintenance Mechanic

 

Responsible for providing overall support to the production group in the areas of packaging as well as processing and facilities to ensure continuous operations.

 

  • Perform all maintenance on plant equipment in a safe manner, ensure equipment and machines are in good working condition while following GMP
  • Modify, repair, install, maintain, improve, and troubleshoot various types of machinery, equipment, and facilities in the processing & packaging departments
  • Diagnose problems, provide quick & innovative solutions for equipment breakdowns by applying proven skills in the principles of mechanics, fitting, basic welding, metal fabrication, machining, troubleshooting, and analytical problem solving
  • Perform both corrective and preventative maintenance on a variety of equipment
  • A good understanding of the mechanical and electrical components in manufacturing equipment
  • Experience with drill press, grinder, saws, and all other machine shop tools
  • Provide recommendations for continual improvements and maximize efficiencies.
  • Setup, takedown, and relocation of Bakery and Packaging equipment
  • Assist production in setting up the equipment on the line
  • Fill out shift report electronically for specific issues or tasks completed during shift
  • Responsible for maintaining and organizing the shop and toolbox.
  • Rotating continental shifts and vacation fill in

 

 

 

Requirements

  • Millwright License or equivalent
  • Must possess a high school diploma or Equivalent
  • A minimum of 4 years working experience with mechanical, electrical; including set-up, adjustments, and troubleshooting
  • Experience in a high-speed manufacturing environment (Food industry is highly preferred)
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills  
  • Knowledge of Health & Safety and Lockout Procedures is an asset
  • Knowledge of preventative maintenance program is an asset
  • Must have a valid driverâ€™s license
  • Flexible to move between shifts to meet department requirements
  • Complete all other duties as instructed and assigned by Leader
  • Knowledge of using any CMMS is preferred

 

FGF DNA

 

Weâ€™re foodies and our passion are baked inâ€¦

  • Customer and Product Centricity â€“ You are always keeping our products front and center.
  • Flexibility, Agility, Adaptability â€“ You embrace speed, change and uncertainty.
  • Teamwork and Collaboration â€“ You are a relationship builder.
  • Passion for Excellence â€“ You look for innovative solutions and challenges the status quo.
  • Drives Executionâ€“ You are a risk taker!

 

www.fgfbrands.com/careers

 

Follow us on LinkedIn   Follow us on Glassdoor     Follow us on Instagram

 

Disclaimer: The above describes the general responsibilities, required knowledge and skills.   Please keep in mind that other duties may be added, or this description may be amended at any time.

title: Apartment Maintenance Technician
description:
Sonora

We recognize the Apartment Maintenance Technician is the core of the resident experience. Not only are they troubleshooting and solving various maintenance issues, they are going into the homes of our residents. This is a huge responsibility and we value the level of customer care it takes to do this well.

The Apartment Maintenance Technician is responsible for assisting in the upkeep and maintenance of the Weidner community. The Apartment Maintenance Technician is very motivated to find solutions to complex issues and has an eye for detail. Most of all, Apartment Maintenance Technicians enjoy the work they do and continuously help create the resident experience.

Responsibilities:
  • Assist in the preparation of apartments for occupancy
  • Respond to service requests
  • Performs maintenance and repairs on electrical, plumbing, as well as small and large appliances
  • Maintain pools and wading area and HVAC systems depending on the community amenities
  • Modest carpentry work as needed
  • Interior and exterior painting as needed
  • Provide customer service
Qualifications:
  • Experience in apartment maintenance or related field preferred
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • All service personnel are also required to have a personal set of general tools
  • Ability to lift and carry up to 80 pounds
  • Push/pull up to 200 pounds
  • Have a valid driver license and reliable transportation

title: Maintenance Technician Canada
description:
Overview:

Whatâ€™s the difference between a job and a meaningful, rewarding career? The people you serve. When you work at Atria, you have a front-row seat to the amazing life stories of the wisest people on earth. Whatâ€™s more, you are part of an extraordinary company â€“ one thatâ€™s investing in the future of senior living by investing in you. Donâ€™t just do a job. Be part of an extraordinary life.

 

Atria is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.  Atria will not tolerate harassment or discrimination based on any of these protected classifications.

Responsibilities:
  • Diagnose and repair problems in such areas as HVAC, electrical, plumbing, major appliances, carpentry, emergency systems, flooring, hardware accessories, masonry, painting/wallpaper, water features (pools, spas, etc.) and waste management systems.
  • Complete assigned service requests and repairs consistent with company operating and equipment/supply standards and in a safe and timely manner.
  • Perform turn-key work as required to ensure vacant apartment homes are rent-ready in a timely manner.  
  • Maintain customer service standards.   Respond to resident requests and work with residents to minimize/resolve problems and complaints.   Follow-through to ensure issue is resolved.
  • Apply all applicable Atria Policies and Procedures such as, but not limited to, company operating and safety standards.   Promote safe work practices among on-site staff.
  • Ensure compliance with all federal, state and local laws, specifically Fair Housing regulations, building codes and environmental laws and regulations.
  • Assist with organizing and prioritizing service requests and general maintenance tasks.
  • May drive company vehicle from community to social and other various destinations (only if required by community).
  • May supervise the work of other associates and outside contractors.
  • May perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
  • High School diploma or equivalent (GED) preferred.
  • 1 year experience in property management maintenance performing the duties associated with a Maintenance Technician.
  • Able to perform basic arithmetic skills such as measurement, addition, subtraction, multiplication and division in order to do basic calculations and analysis such as estimating, determining averages and percentages, and totals.
  • Able to occasionally operate general office equipment such as, but not limited to, personal computer, telephone, photocopying machine, facsimile machine and postage machine.
  • Able to frequently use general maintenance tools, supplies and equipment such as, but not limited to, hand tools, pressure washers, blowers, paint equipment, pool chemicals, ice removal equipment, ladders, landscaping equipment, sanders and safety equipment.
  • Able to frequently handle and use chemicals and general cleaning supplies.
  • Must possess basic hand tools necessary for performing maintenance related duties
  • Position requires driving responsibilities (may use Company provided vehicle and/or personal vehicle).
  • Must possess valid driverâ€™s license.
  • Must satisfactorily meet and be in compliance with Atria motor vehicle policy standards.
  • Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal requirements.

Maintenance Tech, Maintenance Technician, Facilities Technician, Property Maintenance, Maintenance Assistant, Porter, maintenance, HVAC, heat, ventilation, air conditioning, facilities
