title: Maintenance Person
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

The Maintenance Person reports directly to the Maintenance Manager, performs tasks involving physical labour within the plant.  They must have a good general knowledge of hand and power tools.

The Maintenance person performs some or all of the following duties;

  • Repairs and maintenance of building and equipment assets.
  • Working within a preventative maintenance plan.
  • Performing minor repairs and maintenance on a wide range of equipment and tools.
  • Performing basic carpentry tasks.
  • Troubleshooting and problem solving basic repairs.
  • Some administrative duties involving documenting repairs and adhering to maintenance protocols and schedules.
  • Inspection of Fire Equipment
  • Requires successful completion of man lift, fork lift and fall protection certifications.
  • Cleaning and storage of tools and equipment and cleans work sites.
  • Wears required Personal Protective Equipment at all times and adheres to all legislative and company safety policies and procedures.
  • Other duties as required.
Qualifications

  • Must have achieved at least a high school diploma
  • 1-3 years experience in a related industrial or construction environment
  • Must be physically fit, able to lift 50 lbs comfortably
  • Must have basic knowledge of carpentry, electrical and plumbing tasks
  • Able to demonstrate good organizationl, time management and decision-making skills
  • Able to manage a fluctuating workload, set priorities to meet deadlines
  • Good communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Must hold a valid driver's license.
  • Must have own tools.

NOTE:  all candidates must be fully vaccinated against Covid-19.



Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
General Duties:
Perform tasks including electrical, mechanical, hydraulic and pneumatic repairs on sheet metal, cutting and forming, refrigeration and light assembly equipment in a 1 shift manufacturing environment.
 
Responsibilities:
  • To competently support manufacturing by providing technical support, along with leadership in dealing with breakdowns, preventative maintenance, and repairs.
  • Perform required preventative maintenance as assigned, report machine deficiencies, irregularities and unsafe conditions.
  • Learn and understand the operation of all equipment to confidently identify problem root cause by reading relevant schematics, assembly drawings, and other work instructions.
  • Identify and resolve equipment and material problems, maintain optimal parts inventory levels.
  • Attend training related to production, safety, and machinery for professional growth.
  • Perform other duties as required.

Qualifications:
  • High school graduate required with 5+ years of prior experience in a Canadian manufacturing environment.
  • Prefer industrial millwright or electrician license.
  • Hard working, ability to multi-task.
  • Good problem-solving and leadership skills and takes initiative to get things done.
  • Personable, respectful, energetic personality.
  • Good listening skills and can take direction and communicate effectively.
  • Above all, take pride in establishing and maintaining a clean efficient work environment .

title: Maintenance Team Leader
description:
Wonderbrands, is a leading North American bakery (formerly Weston Foods, fresh and frozen businesses) with 140 years of experience in baking packaged breads, artisan breads, and donuts. We are one of the largest bakeries in North America and makers of Wonder Bread, Country Harvest, D’Italiano, Gadoua, and Casa Mendosa.

Wonderbrands, a division of FGF Brands, is unlocking an incredible opportunity for growth through a focus on production innovation capabilities, through a leading edge supply chain practice and investing deeply in communities where we bake.

Summary

The Maintenance Team Leader will be responsible for the day to day activities of the shift Mechanics. You will support and improve maintenance operations by becoming the technical expert on all the production equipment for your site.  You will troubleshoot and repair equipment, and lead by example.

Primary Responsibilities

·       Be responsible for maintenance and repair of mechanical and electrical equipment, has 24-hour ownership of line results

·       Be a “hands-on” leader and work very closely with all operations departments to provide immediate, timely support in order to ensure operational targets are met

·       Train; coach; guide and mentor existing, as well as new shift mechanics

·       Ensure that troubleshooting and repair is accomplished in a safe and efficient manner

·       Complete maintenance related projects as required

·       Insure that Preventative and Predictive Maintenance programs are executed as scheduled

·       Recommend additional training for shift mechanics as needed

·       Collaborate with Maintenance Coordinator to ensure supplies of required tools, parts and labour are available for timely repairs

·      Promote and support Continuous Improvement activities in Manufacturing

Requirements:

·       You have 3-5 years of experience working in maintenance, preferably in a manufacturing environment (even better if it was food manufacturing!). 

·       Licensed Millwright 433A and or Electrician 442A preferred

·       Must be flexible and have around the clock availability to address maintenance issues

·       Experience with maintenance systems and computer programs (MS Office; Excel; Outlook)

·       You bring a strong background in team leadership, coaching, mentoring, and empowering your crew

·       Dedicated to the health and safety of yourself and your colleagues  

·       You have a mindset that focuses on Compliance topics (Safety, Quality, Environment)

·       You enjoy a fast paced and multi-faceted workload, always on the go and finding solutions to unique problems

·       You’re invested in the development of your colleagues – you set goals, coach, and provide constructive feedback to help your team develop and meet timelines on deliverables

·       You’re a problem solver - you enjoy bringing new ideas and process improvements forward, and are always learning

·       You resolve issues with high integrity and in a supportive, constructive manner

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
GENERAL PURPOSE:

Performs variety of skilled duties in one or more of the building trades, such as painting, carpentry, minor electrical, cement masonry, dry wall or other recognized crafts for the purpose of maintaining, repairing or remodeling within a LTC facility, including H.V.A.C., fire safety and other mechanical systems.

DUTIES:

  • Constructs and repairs existing structural woodwork and equipment where required or as directed and approved by supervisors; works from blueprints, drawings, or oral instructions.
  • Builds, repairs, and installs counters, cabinets, benches, partitions, floors, doors, associated hardware, building framework, and trim; uses carpenter's hand tools and power tools.
  • Repairs or installs glass in windows, doors, and partitions; Replaces mirrors; replaces damaged ceiling tile, floor tile, and sheet plastic wall coverings.
  • Landscaping and outdoor work
  • Prepares and paints walls and woodwork or performs other types of refinish; installs or repairs carpet; performs custodial duties as required or instructed by supervisors.
  • Assists as directed in the operation and maintenance of mechanical systems, such as: plumbing, heating, ventilating, air conditioning, automatic temperature control, electrical, ozone system, operates snow plow or blower or other similar equipment as needed.
  • May be responsible for maintaining equipment warranties and maintenance agreements for machinery and equipment within the facility.
  • Performs daily and weekly safety checks throughout the facility to ensure a safe and clean environment for the patrons of the facility and to eliminate all hazards.
  • Performs duties associated with life safety equipment for preventative maintenance
  • Performs related duties as required or assigned by supervisors.

REQUIREMENTS or QUALIFICATIONS: 

  • Graduation from High School plus four (4) years of related employment in the building trades, or any equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
  • Considerable knowledge of construction practices and procedures; considerable knowledge of maintenance and repair work; considerable knowledge of rough and finished carpentry techniques; considerable knowledge of carpentry supplies, equipment and their use; considerable knowledge of material grades and types and their adaptability to various uses; considerable knowledge of modern methods and techniques of building construction and construction materials; considerable knowledge of preparing walls and woodwork for various types of refinishing; thorough knowledge of proper safety techniques and procedures.
  • Competent knowledge basic electrical work and understanding of regulatory regulations limiting work where not authorized to do so.
  • Skill in the operation of a variety of hand tools and equipment common to the building trades and/or H.V.A.C., filtration systems, etc.
  • Ability to follow written and verbal instructions; ability to communicate, both verbally and in writing; ability to work in a Long Term Care environment with co-workers and the public.
  • Must be able to maintain a good attendance record.
  • Must be available and flexible for call ins and available for weekend scheduled shifts.
  • Must maintain a professional and courteous manner with all residents, vendors, contractors and fellow employees.
  • Must assure that safety standards are used which comply with all company, local, provincial and federal guidelines.
  • The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to forward reach, overreach, carry and lift with hands and arms, sitting, standing, walking, climbing, bending, twisting, kneeling, crawling, use hands to finger, handle, feel or operate objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to use vision, hearing, speech and writing. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move materials and or equipment weighing up to 100 pounds.

title: Mechanical Millwright
description:
Together, we are stronger and achieve more.

Viterra is seeking a Millwright at our Pacific Terminal. The successful candidate will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, and repair and troubleshooting of stationary industrial grain handling and cleaning machinery. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Reads equipment diagrams and schematic drawings to determine work procedures.
  • Operates rigging equipment and dollies to place and move heavy machinery and parts.
  • Fits bearings, align gears and shafts, attach motors, and connect couplings and belts.
  • Performs preventative maintenance inspections and checks on mechanical equipment.
  • Performs alignment and tests equipment, making any necessary adjustments.
  • Performs preventative and corrective maintenance as per recommendations from vibration analysis reports, oil sample analysis, etc.  Repairs and replaces defective parts when required.
  • Completes maintenance and operational repairs follow all manufacturer and company procedures.
  • Trouble-shoots and repairs hydraulic systems.
  • Trouble-shoots and repairs pneumatic systems.
  • Uses plasma cutting and welding equipment for fabrication of small parts required during maintenance.
  • Maintains pollution control systems, dust collection and control systems, air-slides, grain spouting, material blowing, and other air systems.
  • Maintains large vertical and horizontal conveying systems and their associated drive systems including transmissions, couplings, bearings, etc.
  • Performs lubrication and oil replacement for conveyors, wheels, rollers, bearings, reducers, etc.  Maintains and replaces auto-lubrication equipment.
  • Installs, services and repairs air handling equipment.
  • Works alongside and assists other trades as required.
  • Performs other related duties as required.

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Knowledge of industrial machinery including grain handling and cleaning equipment would be an asset.
  • A solid safety record and good knowledge of health and safety policies and practices.
  • Experience with conveyor and material handling equipment would be beneficial.
  • Ability to work in a team environment and able to work on small projects with minimal supervision. Strong problem solving skills and high work standards.
  • Willing to work a 24 hour shift schedule.

Education and Qualifications:

  • Must be a certified Journeyman Industrial Mechanic (Millwright) with an Interprovincial Red Seal certification.
  • A minimum of 3 years experience in an industrial setting or comparable service work in the industry.

Equivalent combinations of education and experience that result in the required level of knowledge, skill and competence will be considered.

Employment Type: 

Regular

Posting Close Date:

5/9/2022

title: Apartment Maintenance Technician
description:
Sonora

We recognize the Apartment Maintenance Technician is the core of the resident experience. Not only are they troubleshooting and solving various maintenance issues, they are going into the homes of our residents. This is a huge responsibility and we value the level of customer care it takes to do this well.

The Apartment Maintenance Technician is responsible for assisting in the upkeep and maintenance of the Weidner community. The Apartment Maintenance Technician is very motivated to find solutions to complex issues and has an eye for detail. Most of all, Apartment Maintenance Technicians enjoy the work they do and continuously help create the resident experience.

Responsibilities:
  • Assist in the preparation of apartments for occupancy
  • Respond to service requests
  • Performs maintenance and repairs on electrical, plumbing, as well as small and large appliances
  • Maintain pools and wading area and HVAC systems depending on the community amenities
  • Modest carpentry work as needed
  • Interior and exterior painting as needed
  • Provide customer service
Qualifications:
  • Experience in apartment maintenance or related field preferred
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • All service personnel are also required to have a personal set of general tools
  • Ability to lift and carry up to 80 pounds
  • Push/pull up to 200 pounds
  • Have a valid driver license and reliable transportation

title: Service Technician - Shop
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Service Technician for our Williams Lake location. This position is responsible for the repair and maintenance of construction and forestry based equipment and attachments in a shop environment.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Efficiently and effectively evaluate the working condition of, diagnose, assemble/disassemble, order parts for, and repair heavy duty equipment
  • Use secondary materials and equipment safely and efficiently
  • Use related instruments, hand and power tools, secondary equipment, and computer systems
  • Accurately and completely document on work orders all machine information, actions taken, and time taken
  • Continually assess service task hazards and ensure work is performed safely, and to accepted standards
  • Use computer applications and information systems (i.e. John Deere Service Advisor) to document maintenance, inspection, and diagnosis
  • Use parts catalogues to locate parts, and order parts from parts personnel
  • Road test equipment and check attachment operation as required
  • Must have the ability to communicate and work effectively with customers, the service team, and branch personnel
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Previous mechanical experience in a heavy equipment environment is preferred
  • Certified Journeyperson in the Heavy Duty Equipment technician trade or equivalent designated trade preferred
  • Must be committed to customer service and service excellence

title: Lead Water Damage Technician
description:
First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Lead Water Damage Technician to save the day for our residential and commercial customers as the first responder for water-related emergencies. Do you have previous experience in restoration or construction? Are you looking to build a successful career while rebuilding lives? If so, keep reading!

Our Lead Water Damage Technician earns a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!

Position Summary:

The Lead Water Damage Technician supports the emergency response and restoration project to ensure the goals and needs of the insurance companies and our customers are being met.

The Lead Water Damage Technician will provide assistance and support as required to move projects along in a timely manner. Responsibilities will include use of hand and power tools. Tasks will involve the cleaning and preparation of sites that includes clean-up of rubble, debris, plus set up of site protection and may be required to remove mould, asbestos, lead and other hazardous materials.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Trains new water damage technicians and/or labourers on job site
  • Responsible for onsite emergency response activities under the direction of a Water Damage Technician.
  • Ensure that the workplace is a clean, safe and uncluttered workplace that minimizes cross contamination
  • Learn and practice correct procedures when environmental work is required
  • Provide assistance and support co-workers with completion of tasks as required
  • Some heavy lifting is required

Qualifications

  • High School graduate or equivalent
  • Valid driver's license with a clean driving record
  • Solid interpersonal skills with strong customer service orientation
  • WRT certification is an asset
  • Availability for scheduled on-call and after-hour shifts

Are you able to work independently? Do you have excellent communication and interpersonal skills? Can you work collaboratively with construction crews? Are you service-oriented? Is safety important to you? Do you project a professional appearance and attitude? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Position Title: Maintenance Technician Department: Property Services

Reports to: Assistant Maintenance Manager Pay Range: $26.52-$28.56 per hour

Location: Nanaimo, BC

Position 1: 7:30am-6:00pm, Monday-Thursday (80 hours bi-weekly)

Position 2: 7:30am-6:00pm, Sunday-Wednesday(80 hours bi-weekly)


Organizational Focus:

Pacifica Housing has been providing safe and affordable homes for almost 35 years. We are a rapidly growing organization dedicated to meeting the housing and support needs of our community. As such, we are committed to building our fast-growing team with a culture that supports our people and reinforces our core values of authenticity, leadership, respect, and social justice.

Pacifica is proud to be a Certified Living Wage Employer by The Living Wage for Families Campaign.

What we Offer:

  • A mission driven, meaningful working environment.
  • Minimum three (3) Weeks Vacation Entitlement.
  • Best-in-class Benefits Package for full-time employees (includes extended health & dental, life insurance, among others).
  • Employer RRSP Contributions (employee matching not required).
  • Significant wellness time.
  • Career development and internal advancement opportunities.
  • Organization and individual training opportunities.
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP).


Primary Objectives:

The Maintenance Technician is primarily accountable for fulfilling maintenance work orders according to a prescribed schedule and to meet quality standards established by Property Services.

Key Responsibilities:

  1. As a member of the Maintenance Team performs a variety of maintenance functions according to maintenance work orders and following an established schedule, including:
  • Carrying out repairs and other maintenance activities as required such as plumbing, appliance, drywall, painting and minor electrical repairs;
  • Residential installation and assembly including: doors, blinds, etc.;
  • Posting a variety of notices as instructed by the Property Services Coordinator or by the Assistant Maintenance Manager, such as Notice To End Tenancy and Notices To Enter, in compliance with the Residential Tenancy Act;
  • Cleaning and repairing units upon turnover and according to the Society’s specifications;
  • Immediately reporting safety or accident/injury incidents to the Assistant Maintenance Manager or to the Property Services Coordinator;
  • Completing required paperwork such as maintenance work orders and mileage claims and submitting to the Assistant Maintenance Manager;
  • Maintaining cordial and cooperative relationships with Supportive Housing staff and with the tenants of Pacifica Housing;
  • Work independently to meet deadlines and complete assignments as arranged; and
  • Report to the Assistant Maintenance Manager regarding issues resolved, those needing attention, and those currently in progress.


Qualifications (minimum Education and Experience requirements)

Education:

  • High school graduation
  • Must hold a Basic First Aid Certificate


Experience:

  • Experience as a Maintenance Technician or other similar position, preferably in a non-profit housing environment.
  • Demonstrated experience in a building maintenance role.
  • Experience using hand and electrical tools.
  • Preferred 2 years’ experience doing suite renovations/ building maintenance.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Ability to demonstrate skills in residential building maintenance including carpentry, plumbing and electrical is required.
  • General proficiency using a mobile phone to e-mail, text, call and manage calendar appointments.
  • Must have trade skills including painting, drywall patching and installation, door hardware repairs, and flooring and carpentry repairs.

Note: An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

Additional Criteria for Role:

  • Completion of a Criminal Record Check with the Vulnerable Sector is required before employment commences.
  • Must have valid driver’s licence and access to a reliable vehicle with a minimum of $2 million liability ‘business class’ insurance.

Pacifica Housing advises all employees, contractors and volunteers of the risk of violence, injury and harm that is present in the execution of their duties. Pacifica Housing is committed to providing a safe and risk-free work place, however, we acknowledge the inherent risk in social housing and direct support work while in homes and in other support relationships.

Pacifica celebrates diversity and what makes you uniquely you. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your culture, ethnicity, race, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, nation of origin, age, languages spoken, veteran’s status, color, religion, and diversability.

title: Plumber / Pipefitter / Millwright
description:
Job Description:

Plumbers, Pipefitters & Millwrights

 

Maple Reinders Constructors Ltd. is looking for Plumbers, Pipefitters and Millwrights for a construction project in Sarnia. This is your chance to work with one of Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies!

 

$39.21 - $41.21 / hr, plus benefits

 

We are looking for Journeypersons with the following experience and qualifications:

  • Red Seal preferred
  • Reading & interpreting interferences from all drawings
  • Establishing control points with accuracy
  • Experience with PVC/HDPE and stainless steel piping
  • Able to install various types of mechanical equipment and architectural hardware
  • Able to transfer levels over large distances with accuracy
  • Rigging and installing equipment
  • Mechanical bolt-up
  • Experience with industrial and/or commercial construction is an asset
  • Knowledge of water treatment and/or wastewater treatment facility construction an asset

If you are interested in applying for this position please submit your resume.

 

Thank you for your interest in a career with Maple Reinders. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Maple Reinders is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, Maple Reinders accommodates candidates with disabilities throughout the hiring process.

 

No agency calls please.

 

People, Passion, Performance

title: Skilled Maintenance Yardperson (Kearl)
description:
Position Scope:

NACG is seeking an experienced Skilled Maintenance Yardperson to join our dynamic and industry leading organization.  

 

Site: Kearl

Schedule: 14x14

Accommodations: Camp Accommodations

Transportation: Client Provided flights to/from Edmonton or Calgary

Blended Rate: $43.41 (based rate is $39.46) Blended rate is to compensate for no Overtime during the 14-day rotation

 

The successful candidate  will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955.  

 

Effective February 15th  2022, Kearl is requiring all employees to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. If you are selected for this position, you will be asked to declare your vaccination status and to submit copies of proof of vaccination.

Responsibilities:
  • Operate various equipment performing maintenance duties â€“ Loader/Grader/Forklift/Skid-Steer/Light Duty Vehicles
  • Assist technicians with assembly and testing when required (minimal supervision)
  • Load/off-load freight components from delivery trucks with forklift
  • Install/replace Ground Engagement Tools (G.E.T.)
  • Proficient in all Intermediate Maintenance Yardperson duties

Specific Requirements:

  • Forklift/skid-steer certifications is considered an asset
  • Class 3 License w/air endorsement and prior experience with hauling/reversing trailers with a light duty truck is an asset
Qualifications:
  • Minimum 3 months previous experience operating grader/loader
  • Minimum 6 months previous experience in a shop/field heavy equipment maintenance environment
Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  4. Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  5. Disclose COVID-19 vaccination status:
    • Fully immunized individuals must provide government issued proof of vaccination to be exempt from site testing requirements
    • Individuals not fully immunized may be subject to site COVID-19 testing requirements and associated costs
  7. Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

 

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. CSO or BSO Certification
  2. CSTS Certification and OSSA Regional only required if candidate  does not have the above certification
  3. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  4. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  5. VOID cheque/direct deposit form

Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  1. Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  2. An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  3. After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

Overview:

North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.   In that time, weâ€™ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. Weâ€™ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers.  

 

In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

  • Significant Growth â€“ As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
  • Long Term Contracts â€“ With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
  • Commitment To Safety â€“ With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
  • Competitive Compensation â€“ NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

 

Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Shop Technician - Athabasca
description:
PTW is a leading industry solutions provider delivering construction, fabrication, and maintenance services. Our network extends across Canada and the United States. We have workforce of talented people proud of the safe and reliable work we perform for our customers every day. We create and deliver innovative industrial solutions to customers in the agricultural, mining, oil and gas, petrochemical, pulp and paper, nuclear and renewable energy industries.

PTW is urgently hiring a Shop Technician to join our team in Athabasca, Alberta.  

GOOD TO KNOW

  • Local or within commuting distance
  • Work Schedule – 5 days on and 2 days off

A DAY IN THE LIFE…

  • Repair/calibration of many instrumentation end devices, control valves, process controllers, measurement devices, and various pumps.
  • Repair, tracking and management of exchange glycol pumps and water turbines.
  • Calibration, tracking, and management of Dryflow rental recorders, and rental digital gauges
  • Receiving of daily materials/stocking material shelves
  • Sending out items in need of third-party repair
  • Shop and yard maintenance/repairs

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • Previous shop experience is preferred.
  • Must possess construction and maintenance instrumentation experience.
  • Must be able to take initiative, work independently as well as in a team. 
  • Must be reliable and dependable (i.e.: punctual and ready to work).
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • A demonstrated ability to work safely.

TICKETS REQUIREMENTS

  • Must have applicable safety tickets ( CSTS-20, WHMIS 2015, Standard First Aid)
  • Must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license

Why PTW?

Competitive Wages and benefits plans | PTW Apprenticeship Tuition Program | RRSP program available | Quality work | Safety and quality are built into everything we do | Safety Training and PPE provided | Consistent work | Opportunity for advancement | Learning and development | Opportunities to travel, stay local or relocate | Team atmosphere | People-focused company

ADDITIONAL INFO

We care about your health and safety. At PTW, we follow all protocols set by the provincial and local governments. We also implement measures as required by our clients and our own Health and Safety team.

PTW is an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process. Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.

OUR VALUES GROUND US: CARE | EXCELLENCE | PASSION

title: Maintenance Technician - Part-Time
company: Northview Canadian High Yield Residential Fund
description:
At Northview, we are a passionate, community-focused team dedicated to making our properties the best they can be. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve, next to our residents, hotel guests and commercial tenants across Canada.

We are looking for a Maintenance Technician to join our Residential team in Fort Saint John, BC. Reporting to the Regional Manager, you will  be critical to our delivery of world class customer service in our buildings that depict pride of ownership and respect for our residents. While following our Health and Safety requirements, our maintenance technicians ensure the safety of common areas, as well as troubleshoot and prioritize work orders and handle emergency situations

Responsibilities:

  • Installation of floors, specifically vinyl and carpet
  • Drywall repairs, painting prep and painting, minor electrical and plumbing repairs
  • Perform water and sewer line repairs where applicable
  • Assisting with and or performing suite renovations and other upgrades
  • Moving furniture, equipment, materials and supplies, including clearing of vacant suites as   necessary
  • Maintain clean vacant lots, and removal of garbage and debris from building and grounds as required
  • Snow removal and ice control from all entrances/exits and walkways as required
  • Delivery of notices to building residents & posting of notices in common areas where applicable required
  • Resident services and assistance as required and maintaining good resident relations
  • Other duties relating to upkeep of buildings and suites as assigned

Qualifications:

  • Three years’ experience in building maintenance
  • Work as part of an on-call team, and weekends as needed
  • Valid driver’s license and Criminal Record Check (free of relevant convictions)
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs

About Northview

Northview is a leading property management company operating in six provinces and two territories. We manage over 11,000 multi-residential units, 1.1 million sq. ft. of commercial space, three hotels and 200 executive suites. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve.

As a condition of employment, all Northview employees are expected to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or can provide reason for exemption based on a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. The successful candidate will be required to demonstrate their vaccinated status or reason for exemption before they start work with Northview. Northview will review and consider requests for exemption and will accommodate where required. Personal preference is not sufficient grounds for an exemption.

If your background matches the qualifications listed above and you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference in the communities we serve, please submit your resume in confidence to www.rentnorthview.com/about/careers. Please note, only those candidates chosen to continue through the selection process will be contacted. Northview welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require a specific accommodation, please contact

hr@northviewfund.com

.

title: Millwright Red Seal
description:
Responsibilities & Duties:

  • Provide Mechanical expertise and support TOC in mechanical installation and maintenance of plant equipment and production assets.
  • Troubleshoot Mechanical failure, identifying the root cause
  • Perform routine preventative maintenance and work order tasks as requested by Maintenance Supervisor/Manager,
  • Liaise with other departments within facility, ensuring effective communication
  • Work effectively in a processing environment without jeopardizing food safety
  • Complete maintenance reports and logs as required to support effective maintenance planning
  • Maintain good housekeeping practices in work area and in the maintenance shop
  • Work within a team to provide support for the production line to troubleshoot and repair breakdowns
  • Coordinate with Maintenance Contractors.

Position Requirements:

  • Valid Interprovincial Red Seal Industrial Millwright license is a must
  • Previous experience in a food manufacturing and/or pharmaceutical plant is a definite advantage
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Be able to work quickly, under pressure, and have a sense of urgency
  • Have the ability to work independently or as part of a team with minimal direction
  • Have strong organizational skills, detailed-oriented, and able to multitask and prioritize
  • AM & PM shift open- hours assigned by seniority 
  • Be able to work flexible shifts, including overnight shift

What We Offer:

A full time job and $4000 as a welcome bonus!

Your taxable bonus will be paid out in 4 instalments:

$1000 after completing your first, second and third month respectively

The final $1000 after passing probation.

We will also cover your Union initiation fees!

Pay Rate: $41.13/hr

title: Facilities Maintenance Specialist
description:
Description

PeaceHealth is seeking a Facilities Maintenance Specialist for a Per Diem/Relief, Variable position. Hourly compensation starts at $25.78, more depending on experience.

Must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 including 2 doses of a 2-dose series or 1 dose of a 1-dose series plus 14 days beyond the final dose prior to start date.

JOB SUMMARY

Responsible for performing repairs and maintenance to plant facilities which may include utilizing some or all of the following skills areas: carpentry, locksmith, painting and plastering, plumbing, minor mechanical/electrical repairs, lighting, and furniture/fixture installation.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

1. Performs repairs and maintenance. This includes: locksmith functions—maintaining building master key system and duplicate keys for various types of furniture and fixtures; maintaining, troubleshooting, repairing Access Card Systems; installing and maintaining equipment and managing database installing and repairing door hardware; installing and moving signage as needed; inspection/assessment, maintenance for roofs and drains; flooring and ceramic tile repairs and maintenance; installation of various types of fixtures (i.e. soap dispensers, bulletin boards, etc.); installation and moving of modular furniture, keyboard installations and changes for ergonomic issues; and painting and patch work.

2. Coordinates contractor installs and repairs for all areas of responsibility.

3. Performs cost estimates as needed in support of capital projects as well as for other materials and remodel projects.

4. Works collaboratively with Employee Health and Safety (EH&S) to address safety issues. This includes: fall risk analysis and mitigate planning and implementation; incident investigation and risk mitigation; infection control leak team response.

5. Assures compliance with all regulatory standards.

6. Participates in maintenance and construction contractor/vendor selection and oversight.

7. Participates in process improvement project planning support and execution in sensitive environments.

8. Performs creative needs assessments and problem solving.

9. Performs/participates in preventive maintenance inspection, correction and evaluation programs as appropriate.

10. Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS

EDUCATION

+ Post high school carpentry apprenticeship or other equivalent formalized training preferred.

EXPERIENCE/TRAINING

+ Minimum of five years of commercial carpentry/facilities maintenance experience or equivalent required including at least one year of related painting experience.

LICENSE/CERTIFICATION

+ Valid state driver’s license.

OTHER SKILLS

+ Basic computer skills including Microsoft Office applications.

+ Good visual color discrimination.

+ Good communication skills.

REGION/LOCATION SPECIFIC NOTES

PIMC

+ Responsible for performing routine maintenance on the physical plant stocking and delivering of materials and supplies to the appropriate unit.

+ Will perform environmental services, security assistance and emergency response duties as needed.

+ Successfully completes the non-violent Crisis Intervention (CPI) course during orientation and renews training as outlined in policy.

PIMC PHYSICAL COGNITIVE REQUIREMENTS

+ Work requires moderate physical exertion 33-66% of the time.

+ Ability to frequently lift objects weighing 50 lbs and occasionally lift 80 lbs. Must push/pull up to 100 lbs occasionally.

+ Work requires occasional exposure to minor cold, outdoor elements, heat, poor ventilation, or sharp tools. Reasonably anticipated exposure to blood or body fluids on rare occasion exists. Work may require operating company owned vehicles. Work may require exposure to lung or skin irritants.

+ Job duties require intense concentration and attention to detail up to 80% of the time. May require on call availability 24/7.

+ Work may require occasional use of PPE including respirator, mask, gloves, gowns. Must be able to bend/twist/stretch/squat, reach and climb ladders.

See how PeaceHealth is committed to Inclusivity, Respect for Diversity and Cultural Humility (https://www.thecaregiver.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/PeaceHealth-Statement-of-Commitment-to-Diversity-and-Inclusion-vFINAL.pdf) .

For full consideration of your skills and abilities, please attach a current resume with your application. EEO Affirmative Action Employer/Vets/Disabled in accordance with applicable local, state or federal laws.

title: DataCentre Facility Technician
description:
At Rogers, the entrepreneurial spirit is part of our DNA. Our Rogers Business teams help foster and grow the Canadian economy by supporting businesses of all sizes. From small to large-scale enterprises, our teams help deliver innovative technology, network services, and a suite of solutions to help them succeed. We offer Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network for our customers and are proud leaders in wireless private networking and IoT! We continuously expand and evolve our networks, invest in new technology capabilities, and invest in our people to serve our business customers and their communities. 
Come play a key role in driving the future of business innovation in Canada. We are looking for team members with a passion for delivering industry-leading value to customers and supporting businesses in the communities where we live and work.    
Are you up for the challenge? If so, consider the following opportunity: Providing 7x24 support, the Data Centre Facility Technician (DCFT) is expected to deliver the highest level of customer service by adhering to Rogers policies and procedures. The DCFT is the local primary point of contact for the local data centre, monitoring of the data centre facility, and is the coordinator of client escalations. The DCFT is responsible for the operation, monitoring, trouble shooting and basic maintenance of HVAC equipment and electrical systems located within the site. These include computer room air conditioning equipment, UPS equipment, generators, associated switchgear, and peripheral equipment.  In additional, the Data Center Facility Technician is responsible for embracing and maintaining the established rigorous internal controls designed to maintain SOC SOC II, and PCI compliance. The DCFT is responsible for signing in and assisting collocation clients as required, while they visit the data centre to work on their equipment. The DCFT is required to perform regular walk-throughs of the facility to ensure that everything is functioning properly. Data Centre Facility Technicians are responsible for monitoring and analyzing Rogers Data Centre network and infrastructure alarms and escalating to appropriate internal and/or external teams as required.During escalations within their local data centre, the DCFTs will be the primary point of contact to identify and feed information to the local operational teams, as well as the National Operations Centre (NOC).This position reports to the Data Centre Manager
What you'll be doing: The position includes, but is not limited to, the following:Ability to work rotating shifts, including days, afternoons, nights and weekends; including holidaysReliability Level Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:Our people are at the heart of our successOur customers come first. They inspire everything we doWe do what’s right, each and every dayWe believe in the power of new ideasWe work as one team, with one visionWe give back to our communities and protect our environment What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered. We recognize the business value in creating a workplace where each team member has the tools to reach their full potential. title: Maintenance Technician
description:
The role of Maintenance Technician at Crystal Claire Cosmetics is for the right person who can work in a fast-paced environment. The position is for a person who is driven by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, you will perform mechanical and electrical installation, modification, troubleshooting, maintenance and repair of site equipment, utilities, systems and/or facilities in accordance with established SOPs, GMP guidelines and EH&S policies.

Duties and Responsibilities:
• Performs maintenance procedures according to the established SOP and PM schedule, coordinating parts and service, as required.
• Builds & grows existing preventative maintenance program while maintaining a proactive approach to Plant and Equipment maintenance & repair.
• Performs operational checks on equipment and systems. Detects and investigates variance in performance of equipment, utilities, systems and/ or facilities to ensure proper or enhanced functioning
• Completes required compliance documentation, log books, timesheets, etc. when executing duties. Maintains an assortment of common spare parts.
• Ensure issues, follow-up actions and /or resolutions are clearly communicated to peers and supervisors. This information should be transferred at shift overlaps as well as during the shift.
• Ensures that maintenance or repair of Production Equipment, Site Facilities, Systems and Utilities are carried out in a timely manner. Great team player to achieve all outcomes
• Must be able to work independently on a variety of shifts and overtime request, including weekend, holiday and after-hours duty.
• Help with process improvement, miscellaneous duties and other tasks as assigned
• Fabricate parts, as necessary, utilize shop equipment
• Other duties as assigned

Skills and Qualifications:
• At least 2 years experiences in maintenance of manufacturing type equipment or equivalent in an medium or large organization
• Shows dignity, respect while performing duties and contributes to department goals. Take ownership and accountability for issues, Strong interpersonal & problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
• Basic Systems Diagnostics; Electrical, Mechanic, Pneumatic, Hydraulic, Instrumentation & PLC. Capable of using electrical testing equipment to diagnose problems
• Applied technical skills, knowledge and experience to identify, recommend and implement improvements to equipment, utilities, and facilities.

title: Millwright
description:
We are St Barbara. A growing gold company with a global outlook. ​

We’re an Australian based, ASX 200 company with gold mining operations in Australia, Canada and Papua New Guinea. Our vision is to be a brilliant, global mining company that grows sustainably and creates enduring, positive impacts.

Our Atlantic Operations Touqouy mine site is located an hour outside of Halifax, Nova Scotia. Situated in Canada’s Ocean Playground, it’s no surprise that Nova Scotian’s quality of life is second to none. Whether you prefer sandy beaches and coastal cliffs, or the culture and energy of city life, you’re never far from either. Halifax is one of the fastest growing cities in Canada and has been rated by Maclean’s Magazine as Canada’s best place to live and work.

Now is an exciting time for our business and for our people. We’re going through a period of significant change and have gained real momentum in transforming our business so that, together, we can build a brilliant future. We’re looking for people who are ready to grow through opportunity and build brilliance with us.​

We are currently seeking a Millwright to join our team. This is a full time 6 month contract term position with our Atlantic Operations based at our Touquoy mine in Middle Musquodoboit. The work schedule is 4 days on, 4 days off, 12 hour shifts, switching between days and nights. Reporting to the Mechanical Maintenance Supervisor, the Millwright will be an active member of the Mill Maintenance team and conduct inspections and repairs to all fixed plant equipment.

The Opportunity

  • Ensuring and monitoring safety in the workplace by identifying and addressing hazards, participating in improving safety and ensuring all reporting requirements are completed.
  • Ensuring safe and efficient maintenance activities on a range of equipment and machinery.
  • Inspect, maintain and repair equipment for proper performance and safety compliance.
  • Using tools to commission, diagnose, and repair equipment.
  • Providing input into maintenance planning for mechanical work.
  • Diagnose faults and malfunctions.
  • Providing input to develop safe work procedures.
  • Promote and foster company goals and objectives with all maintenance activities.
  • All other duties as may be assigned from time to time.

Are you ready to come and build a brilliant future with us?

We need the very best people. People who genuinely care for the work they do and the positive impact they can make. People who see challenge as an opportunity for growth and value working with others towards a common goal.​

We would love to hear from you if you have​:

  • A personal commitment to behavior consistent with St Barbara's Values including honesty and integrity, respect, working together, delivering to promise and striving to do better.
  • Licensed as a Red Seal Millwright.
  • Committed to Continuous Improvement and Reliability Centered Maintenance.
  • Prepared to discuss complex problems and solutions in a team environment.
  • Be a technical resource for mechanical knowledge.
  • Ability to use a computer effectively – automated maintenance programs and Microsoft Office.
  • Experience with both small, medium, heavy and specialized tools.
  • Ability to think critically about problems and to select the right tool to complete the task.
  • Familiarity with conveyors, crushers and grinding mills is an asset.
  • Previous experience in a mineral processing, mill manufacturing plant or similar is an asset.
  • Ability to pass a background check.
  • Current unencumbered Class 5 Driver’s License.

For further information on St Barbara and to apply for this role, please visit: https://stbarbara.com.au/working-with-us/current-opportunities/

At St Barbara, we’re committed to finding the best fit for every role. We are a diverse and inclusive workplace, welcoming diversity in all its forms. All qualified applicants will be given equal consideration, regardless of their race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation or gender identity. We are the only Australian mining company to be recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for seven consecutive years. 

We encourage Members of the Mi’ kmaq community to self-identify in their cover letter.

title: Facilities Assistant
description:
About Fresh City Family of Brands:
Fresh City is an award-winning urban farm and omnichannel retailer. Founder-led, we’re on a mission to provide a better life through food. More than one decade after we first began, our belief in that is even stronger. Every day, we deliver organic produce, chef-inspired and made from scratch prepared foods, bespoke meats and more to thousands of Greater Toronto Area families.

In 2018, Fresh City acquired Mabel’s Bakery, a popular bakery in Toronto producing artisan bread and pastries, and shortly after acquired The Healthy Butcher, a pioneer in organic and 100% Grass-Fed beef, in 2019. In 2022, subscription-based organic produce and grocery delivery company Mama Earth Organics was added to the lineup of brands making Fresh City the largest organic online retailer in Ontario.

With eight retail locations and home delivery across the GTA between our four brands, the Fresh City family of brands continues to bring farmers, makers and eaters, together to deliver a food experience that respects our bodies, our planet, and our shared tomorrow.

Food is our passion. We proudly employ over 500 employees across our four brands including our farm, our two warehouses, our food production facilities, our offices and our retail locations. We’re continuously advancing our culture of belonging, where everyone feels seen, heard, valued and free to be their authentic selves.

What you will be doing:
  • Maintain essential systems including but not limited to refrigeration, plumbing, lighting and kitchen equipment in retail locations
  • Monitor and troubleshoot the efficiency of all building systems
  • Ensure all utility systems are inspected and in accordance with regulations
  • Assist store managers with store interior and exterior maintenance
  • Work proactively with Facilities leadership in planning and executing repair and maintenance tasks, warehouse facilities and space allocation and equipment moves
  • Participate in retail safety programs, including Joint Health and Safety Committee meetings as scheduled
  • Oversee third party workers as necessary and keep an open line of communication back to the Retail Facilities and Maintenance Manager to troubleshoot issues
  • Other duties as required
What you will bring to the table:
  • Experience with facilities maintenance, including but not limited to refrigeration, plumbing and HVAC
  • High school diploma, facilities management, business management or related field preferred
  • Strong verbal communication skills and written skills in preparing service reports
  • Self-motivated and self-directed with excellent time management, multitasking and organizational skills
  • Access to a vehicle is required
Certification/Licensing Requirements:
  • Valid G class Ontario driver’s license
  • Certification or enrollment in facilities management is an asset
Physical Requirements:
  • Ability to physically stand, bend, squat, and lift up to 50lbs
Working Conditions:
  • Some weekend and emergency calls required
  • Able to move swiftly and proactively to deal with emergency situations
  • Mileage reimbursement to cover costs of travel between retail locations

We thank all interested applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
Fresh City is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We consider all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, and Indigenous status. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

title: Red Seal Millwright
description:
Location:
Horizon Plastics International / Core Molding Technologies
Cobourg, ON

Job Purpose:
Maintain production and facility equipment in working condition for maximum uptime.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Complete work assignments as directed through assignment of work orders; ensure work completed thoroughly and in a timely manner
  • Perform outlined procedures for regular machine preventive/predictive maintenance program.
  • Conduct troubleshooting and repair activities for machine breakdowns as necessary.
  • Install new equipment coordinated with outside services, as required
  • Establish and maintain maintenance standards and develop and recommend maintenance programs.
  • Notify appropriate personnel of stock deficiencies and tool/material requirements
  • Construct, assemble, and dismantle machinery and equipment.

Qualifications:

  • Red Seal Millwright certification -433A
  • Self-motivated individual with a demonstrated commitment to safety
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to organize and prioritize workload
  • Familiarity with computers and Microsoft Office software
  • Experience working with Hydraulics and Pneumatics
  • Plastic injection molding experience an asset
  • Utilizes ERP as required

**Must be able to work 12 hour continental shifts

title: Shift Maintenance Technician
description:
Overview:

The main purpose of the job is to support and assist the responsible manager to maintain a safe environment. The key role would be to repair and maintenance of equipment.

Responsibilities:
  • Perform preventive maintenance on guestrooms per checklist and maintain all records.
  • Perform building maintenance duties
  • Perform preventive maintenance on equipment/tools when needed.
  • Display basic knowledge or ability to acquire knowledge in the following categories: air conditioning and refrigeration, electrical, mechanical, plumbing, pneumatic/electronic systems and controls, carpentry and finish skills, kitchen equipment, vehicles, energy conservation, and/or general building.
  • Perform all surface preparation, painting, minor drywall and wood trim repair, light bulb and A/C filter replacement and the complete and thorough clean-up of the painting or repair area.
  • Test, troubleshoot and perform basic repair on all types of equipment, plumbing (e.g., plunge toilets and unclog drains), electrical components including lamps, cosmetic items, extension cords, vacuum cleaners, internet devices, replace electrical switches and outlets, and other guestroom items.
  • Fire Alarm/Life Safety System- to monitor systems as necessary.
  • To act as quickly and responsibly as possible to return the building to its normal operating status.To inform Engineering Management of any such emergencies.
  • Records - to read, log, track and interpret readings from meters, gauges and other measuring units. To maintain a thorough log of each dayâ€™s activities and problems that occur and to ensure this information is passed on to other shifts.  
  • Departmental Duties - to clean all engineering areas as directed by Engineering Management. To work in a neat and efficient manner, keeping work areas clean and well organized.   To serve as otherwise directed or needed to help maintain the effective and efficient operation of the resort.
  • Each associate is expected to carry out, within their capabilities, all reasonable requests by management.
  • To look out for the safety of yourself, co-workers and to follow all Health and Safety requirements in the workplace.
  • All other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • High school diploma or equivalent preferred
  • Emphasis in Technical Trades, two or more yearsâ€™ experience in a Technical Trade
  • Two yearsâ€™ experience as Maintenance Technician
  • Journeymen or professional Painting and Decorating experience is highly desired
  • Operator Certificate or equivalent trade experience
  • Must hold a valid Alberta Driverâ€™s License
  • Clear drivers abstract
  • This position requires proficiency in any one of the following categories, average skills in two more of the following categories and basic skills in the remaining categories.

 

    • Air Conditioning and Refrigeration
    • Electrical
    • Mechanical
    • Plumbing
    • Pneumatic/Electronic Systems & Controls
    • Carpentry & Finish Skills
    • Kitchen Equipment
    • Vehicles
    • Energy Conservation
    • Building

The schedule for this position may require the availability to do shift work, late nights, weekends and holidays. The environment is high energy, noisy and the incumbent is required to work in a â€œsmokingâ€ environment.

 

WE OFFER

  •  A competitive wage and excellent benefits.
  • Shuttle service from West Edmonton location.
  • All associates participate in our â€œCircle of Serviceâ€ program which rewards and empowers individuals who provide outstanding customer service.
  • An opportunity to work within a progressive, exciting team environment.
  • An opportunity to work with a skilled Management team.

title: Maintenance Mechanic - Millwright 433A License
description:
Company Description

Gentek is a leading manufacturer and distributor of vinyl/aluminum siding and windows and other exterior home improvement products. With 3 manufacturing facilities and 22 distribution branches in Canada we are well-positioned to provide our customers with the best products and a superior service experience.

At Gentek Building Products, we’ve made a commitment to our customers that they can rely on us to provide the quality exterior home improvement products they need. But that’s not enough. For us to be considered as their business partner, we know we also need to ensure that every transaction with us, at every point of contact, equates to a superior service experience, and that’s where our great employees come in. 

Maybe you are just the person to join our team? Keep reading!

Job Description

We are currently hiring for a full-time Mechanic to provide maintenance support at our Burlington Manufacturing plant.

  • Constructs, maintains, and tests mechanical equipment, machinery, and components
  • Build and repair machine shop tools
  • Create, repair and install machine guarding
  • Ability to detect, troubleshoot, and repair irregularities and malfunctions in production equipment
  • Fabricate parts as required, do overhauls, and changeovers/set ups as required
  • Install machinery and equipment according to layout plans, blueprints, and other drawings in industrial establishment, using hoists, lift trucks, hand tools, and power tools
  • Dismantles machines and equipment
  • Maintain a clean and safe work environment
  • Complete documentation/paperwork as required
  • Communicate with Supervisors and Managers on safety or process related issues
  • Adhere to plant safety rules, health and safety policies and procedures
  • Other duties as assigned

What's in it for you?

  • We offer a starting wage of $36.07/hour (increasing to $37.07/hr after 9 months) plus shift premiums.
  • A competitive benefit program with 100% company paid premiums!
  • A pension plan with 100% employer contributions!
  • An annual clothing and tool allowance and tool box provided!
Qualifications

  • Must possess an Ontario Certificate of Qualification, Red Seal Millwright 433A License
  • Preferably 2-3 years trade experience
  • Experience in an extrusion equipment environment is an asset
  • Available to work 8 hour day shift but must also be available to work rotating days, nights, and afternoons and overtime as needed
  • Strong written and oral English communication skills combined with excellent attendance
  • Self-starter with the ability to work independently and safely
  • Knowledge of CMMS systems, excel, Microsoft Windows/Office
  • Secondary Trade Qualifications and/or experience in Electrical, Welding, or Pipefitting are definite assets
  • Knowledge of PLC's.

Physical Demands:

  • Regularly required to stand, bend, twist, lift, use hands, finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms.
  • Must regularly lift and/or move more than 25 lbs.
  • Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, and ability to adjust focus.


Additional Information

Our people are the difference. If you are qualified, please apply with resume and cover letter describing your experience and your interest in working with us at Gentek Building Products. If your qualifications are a match, you will be contacted.

Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request.

title: Maintenance Technician & Maintenance Assistant
description:
VANCOUVER ISLAND JOBS

Position: Maintenance Technician and Maintenance Assistant
Organization: Shawnigan Lake School
Location: Shawnigan Lake, near Duncan, BC


ABOUT SHAWNIGAN LAKE SCHOOL

Shawnigan Lake School is a leading independent co-educational boarding school for ages 13-18 (grades 8-12) on Canada’s beautiful west coast. Our world-class facilities situated on a stunning 270-acre campus include eleven boarding houses, an observatory, salmon hatchery, rowing crew house on the lake, state of the art Learning Commons and Library, recording studio, and robotics lab. Our diverse, inter-disciplinary and innovative programming helps shape the next generation of global leaders.


OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU

At Shawnigan we want to offer all our staff the chance to shine and we and appreciate each staff member’s skills and contributions to the team. Our Operations team are provided with a great opportunity to learn and develop a career in their respected industry.

Shawnigan Lake School is an equal opportunity employer committed to establishing an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment for all. We offer a very competitive compensation package and a nurturing, family-friendly workplace.

We express our appreciation to all applicants for their interest in this position, however only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Competition closes when filled.

 

MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN

Our maintenance team is growing, and we are looking for an energetic Maintenance Technician to join our team.

The Maintenance Technician adapts on a daily basis to the changing needs of the school by completing a wide range of labour assignments and tasks as required. These include handling materials and supplies, general clean-up, and assisting senior team members with repairs and maintenance throughout the school year.

This is a full-time, permanent (contract to start) opportunity. We offer a competitive salary, full benefits package, excellent RRSP contributions, tuition discount for day students, a flexible work environment, and a nurturing, family-friendly workplace.

 

MAINTENANCE ASSISTANT

Our maintenance team is growing, and we are looking for an energetic and eager-to-learn Maintenance Assistant to join our team as soon as possible. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work alongside inspirational staff and students on a beautiful campus.

Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, the Maintenance Assistant adapts on a daily basis to the changing needs of the school by completing a wide range of labour assignments and tasks as required. These include handling materials and supplies, recycling and general clean-up, and assisting senior team members with repairs and maintenance throughout the school year.

This is a full-time, contract opportunity. We offer a competitive compensation package and a nurturing, family-friendly workplace.

Contact

Please reach out to Megan Anderson, HR Coordinator at manderson@shawnigan.ca if you have questions about the role or if you would like more information on the benefits of working at Shawnigan Lake School. 

 

 

HOW TO APPLY

Please see our careers page for more information or send a copy of your resume and / or cover letter expressing your interest to the attention of Wendy Milne, Assistant Head, Academics, via email at recruitment@shawnigan.ca


Shawnigan Lake School is an equal opportunity employer committed to establishing an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment for all. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status or any other basis protected by applicable law.

title: Part-Time Facilities Assistant
location: Glen Abbey Golf Club, Oakville, ON
description:
Glen Abbey Golf Club is Hiring!

Responsibilities:

  • Opening/Closing of the Clubhouse ensuring the alarm is turned off/on.
  • A self-motivated worker that will occasionally work unsupervised.
  • Dedicated to cleanliness including maintaining locker rooms, washrooms, toilets and sinks on a daily basis.
  • Restocking of restrooms and locker rooms.
  • Vacuuming meeting and banquet rooms, sweeping and mopping floors.
  • Perform daily tasks such as cleaning windows, cleaning stairwells and walkways.
  • Cleaning of on course washroom (must be able to operate a golf cart - will train).
  • Empty garbage from various areas around the club.

Qualifications:

  • Detailed and service-oriented professional.
  • Previous experience cleaning and basic repair is an asset.

This is a part-time seasonal position, working Saturdays and Sundays from 9:00am - 5:00pm.

ClubLink is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. Please contact

jobs@clublink.ca

if a workplace accommodation is needed throughout the selection process. Thank you for your interest in ClubLink.

title: Solutions Maintenance Technician
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:

AGS Automotive Systems is a full-service automotive supplier specializing in the manufacture and supply of complex high value-add automotive metal components, including in particular front and rear impact assemblies, principally for pick-ups and the heavy truck market. AGS offers full range of in-house capabilities including design and engineering, high tonnage metal stamping, light weighting solutions, innovative multi-material joining, high performance coatings including chrome plating and automated manufacturing processes.

AGS is committed to delivering high quality, high value products to our customers, who include several of North America's largest automakers. For over 70 years AGS has stood behind our belief in quality, technology, and teamwork.

BASIC FUNCTION:

Reporting to the Solutions Maintenance Supervisor, the Solutions Maintenance Technician is responsible for, but not limited to, overseeing the operation of the D.I. Water System, Boiler, and E-coat systems, providing guidance to production personnel on the chemical adds required to maintain the processes within normal operating parameters.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

-Adherence to the IATF Procedures and Instructions.
-Comply with all Company safety policies, procedures and rules.
-Monitor inventory levels of process chemicals and orders replenishment quantities.
-Act as the backup Waste Water Treatment Operator.
-Monitor processes on a time schedule as outlined in the Control Plans and proactively makes necessary adjustments to ensure optimum process parameters are maintained by adding chemicals or raw materials to process solutions or product batches to correct or establish the formulations required to meet specifications.
-Select the appropriate test method and test equipment and tests solutions used in the coating processes such as pre-treatment solutions, cleaning, plating, and paint solutions for chemical concentration, specific gravity and other characteristics.
-Select samples for tests at specific stages in the production process and tests the parts or has the parts tested for a variety of characteristics such as; dimensions, coating performance, mechanical, electrical or chemical characteristics of the coatings.
-Issue date: September 2006 Revision#/Date: 05 / 29JL16 HRF-18.102
-Setup or adjusts test equipment as required to perform the solutions tests following established procedures and safe practices to ensure accuracy and safety.
-Record test data, prepare graphs or charts of analysis data and record solution adjustments using established procedures or methods.
-Participate in ISO / IATF internal or external audits.
-Clean and sterilize laboratory equipment. Report any equipment malfunctions, Calibrate instruments per established procedures and frequencies.
-Participate in APQP activities such as developing and updating Process Flow Charts, PFMEA's and Control Plans.
-Actively participate in PDT meetings, process improvement, Problem Solving and corrective action review and meetings.
-Liaise with internal and external customers and suppliers as required.
-Conduct system audits of the production and support areas and provide reports of findings to area supervision and management.
-Assist when required in the solution of shop floor problems.
-Interact with customer to help reduce and eliminate PPM's including review of accumulations prior to PPM reporting.
-Ability to travel if required representing the company during meetings.
-Ensure the Standards of Section 28 of the OHSA are met.
-Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

-Post secondary education in chemistry related field and two (2) years related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience would be an asset.
-Proficiency in mathematics to perform calculations and analysis would be an asset.
-Analytical ability and problem solving skills to recognize deficiencies and abnormalities and to recommend the appropriate corrective actions would be an asset.
-Proficiency in the operation, calibration and maintenance of instrumentation and equipment would be an asset.
-A well-organized approach to problem solving, good record keeping skills as well as the ability to follow instructions and procedures would be an asset.

AGS Automotive Systems is proud to support the full inclusion of persons with disabilities as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At AGS we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request by contacting AGS Human Resources at HR@agsautomotive.com.

title: Millwright Apprentice 3
description:
Millwright Apprentice 3

 Build Your Future. Come Build With Us!

 

Job Overview

JVD Installations Inc. is seeking experienced Millwright Apprentice 3 to work in Edmonton, Alberta. The successful candidate will be responsible for executing Millwright duties in a maintenance setting.

Rotation Schedule:

  • 4 days on, 4 days off
  • 12hr shifts (10hr straight time and 2hr Overtime daily)
  • Positions available: Temporary night shift 

 Responsibilities: 

  • Comprehends diagrams and schematic drawings and service manuals to determine work procedures
  • Operates rigging equipment to place heavy machinery and parts
  • Understands how to fit bearings, align gears, pulleys, and shafts, attach motors, and connect couplings and belts to precise tolerances
  • Track, maintain and repair belt and chain conveyors
  • Aligns and tests equipment to make any necessary adjustments
  • Performs predictive and operational maintenance using procedures manufacturers specifications and repair or replace defective parts when necessary
  • Clean equipment as required to perform maintenance activities
  • May perform other related duties as assigned.

 Job Requirements:

  • Must be willing to be hired as a direct employee.
  • Must be able to perform physically demanding work for a long duration of time
  • Must be able to perform duties at heights
  • Must be able to work in a live plant environment
  • Work will be a combination of indoors and outdoors in various weather conditions
  • Must have previous millwright experience in a maintenance environment
  • Must complete specific in class and online training as a pre-hire requirement

Required Certificates: 

  • Certified Apprentice Ticket
  • Valid government issued photo identification
  • Valid Drivers license

Preferred Certificates

  • CSTS 09 or CSTS 2020
  • Fall Protection
  • Elevated Work Platform
  • Confined Space
  • Rigging-Basic
  • WHMIS2015
