title: Maintenance Mechanic
description:
Eaton’s Electrical – AMER – ESSG Canada Division is seeking a Maintenance Mechanic to join our team.This position is located in Airdrie, Canada

Position Overview:

Reporting to the Facilities Manager, the Maintenance Mechanic is responsible for the installation, preventive maintenance, and repair of any mechanical/pneumatic/hydraulic equipment or components that support the production and facility operations for the LVCA facilities in Airdrie, Canada.

Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality,eachday. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours.

In this function you will:

  • You will repair mechanical, pneumatic, and hydraulic equipment, machines and components.
  • You will perform preventative maintenance duties
  • You will maintain service equipment, work area, maintenance tool crib and spare parts inventory.
  • You will assist with installing new equipment as required
  • You will move machinery and equipment when required
  • You will coordinate the work of outsourced mechanical contractors performing work for or within the plant

When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

Qualifications

Required (Basic) Requirements:

  • Grade 12 High School diploma or GED
  • Completed an Industrial Mechanic (Millwright) or Electrician apprenticeship program

Preferred (Basic) Qualifications:

  • Minimum of 3 years of fabrication and production machinery experience.
  • Minimum of 3 years of experience with measurement, machine, and hand tools, e.g., grinder, band saw.
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience with lockout-tagout programs
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience troubleshooting/repairing hydraulic equipment
  • Current Fall protection certification
  • Current Aerial lift certification
  • Previous Forklift certification
  • Previous spill containment training

Position Criteria:

  • Effective communication and coordination skills
  • Ability to aid outside contractors and specialists needed for our business

We provide benefits that are industry competitive and focused on employee well-being. Listed below are programs that are offered globally, but program availabilities may vary by site.

  • Flexible work options to help balance work/life demands (at participating Eaton sites)
  • Healthcare/retirement savings programs
  • Competitive compensation packages to reward skills and performance
  • Tuition assistance or financial help for ongoing learning and development
  • Health, Dental, Vision & Wellness programs
  • Donation matching (U.S., Canada, Puerto Rico)

Accessibility Statement

“Eaton has in place accessibility policies for accommodating employees with disabilities.  If you are selected for an interview and require accommodations, please let the recruiter or hiring manager know so that we can work to make reasonable adjustments that best suit your needs.   Accessibility information may be found at: https://www.eaton.com/ca/en-gb/company/policies-and-statements/accessibility.html

What you will get from us

Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.

We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.

We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.

We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

Job: Manufacturing & Operations

Region: North America – Canada
Organization: ESSG CA Canada

Job Level: Individual Contributor
Schedule: Full-time
Does this position offer relocation?: No
Travel: No

title: Handyman for Residential and Light Commercial
description:
Operating your own Handyman business can be challenging.  Doing the work is your passion and very rewarding, but everything else is just a pain and a distraction from what you really love to do.

Handyman Connection is here to take care of "the other stuff" so you can spend your time doing work and earning money.

Our team is in need of a Handyman Contractor that has 10+ years of experience and a wide variety of skills.

Benefits:

  • Earn $42-$48/hr
  • Work as an INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR - on your own schedule
  • Work where and when YOU want
  • Choose the jobs YOU want
  • Enjoy top-rate office support so you can focus better on your jobs
  • Access to our Handyman Connection mobile app to assist with scheduling
  • Experience a marketing strategy that attracts desirable Ottawa customers on a regular basis
  • Benefit from our support to sell and close more jobs
  • Branded apparel and signage
  • Work in beautiful Ottawa and the surrounding area
Become a Handyman Specialist at Handyman Connection of Ottawa today!

Job Summary:

  • Work on Handyman projects for residents in Ottawa and the surrounding area.
  • Perform repairs, installation and general construction.
  • Potential to work on light-commercial projects
  • Generate quotes and perform outlined work.
  • Remain in constant contact with clients, the office, and fellow contractors.
Job Requirements

  • General competence in at least three (3) of these capacities: 
    • Remodels
    • Carpentry
    • Drywall
    • Painting
    • Flooring
    • Tiling
    • Residential maintenance
    • Commercial maintenance
  • Know building codes and materials management
  • Possess driver's license & insurance
  • Possess tools & vehicle
  • Undergo personal screening & background check
  • Have smart phone and Internet access
  • Customer Service attitude
Please, no project managers or primarily new construction.

Contact Handyman Connection in Ottawa to apply. Let’s do this!

title: Journeyperson Millwright, Full-Time, Hourly, Edmonton AB
description:
Job Title: Journeyperson Millwright
Location: 12151 160th Street NW, Edmonton AB T5V 1M4
Job Type: Full-Time
Shift: Afternoon & Overnight Shifts                  
 
Bimbo Canada will provide a $1,500.00 signing bonus for all successful applicants to this job   

Work where you live! This is your chance to work locally and make a positive impact right within your community. Not only do we pride ourselves in Nourishing a Better world through sustainable, highly productive and deeply humane values, but we care first and foremost in the well-being of our associates. We value the person first, and our associate’s safety is #1. Working for Bimbo Canada you will be provided with hands on training in order to possess the skills required to perform your duties safely, and efficiently.

WHY WORK FOR US?
Bimbo Canada is a leading producer and distributor of packaged fresh bread and bakery products with brands such as Dempster’s®, Villaggio®, POM®, Bon Matin®, Ben’s®, Healthy Way® and McGavins®. At Bimbo Canada, We Value the Person and follow our Golden Rule by treating everyone with Respect, Fairness, Trust and Care.

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
A skilled and confidant Journeyperson Millwright to join our amazing Maintenance team! We want someone who possesses manual dexterity and has an eye for detail, install, maintain, test and trouble-shoot equipment, and values safety as your number one priority. This is a full-time role, which presents a great opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast paced facility in the food industry.

WHAT WE NEED?
  • Must be able to work independently to troubleshoot machine problems and devise solutions
  • Identify and correct any problems found in machines, equipment or processes in order to facilitate production
  • Maintain, repair and overhaul of plant production equipment, building and grounds
  • Provide quick response to trouble calls by shift supervisors and or operators/technicians.
  • Assist Operating Engineers in maintenance of plant utilities
  • Perform preventive maintenance and improvements or modifications to production equipment
  • Support projects including working on a project team in the design, installation and commissioning
  • Maintain complete and accurate records of shift logs, maintenance inspections and meter readings
  • Ensure smooth, efficient communication to the next team at shift change
  • Participates collaboratively in process improvement teams as required
  • Actively participate in our 5S program and any other duties as assigned

PREFERRED HIRING CRITERIA:
  • Must hold a valid provincial certification as a Journeyperson Millwright License
  • Must have 3 – 5 years proven practical experience performing as a mechanic in a fast paced, high volume production environment or similar
  • Experience in food manufacturing and industrial setting is an asset
  • Ability to communicate, read, and write in English
  • Strong verbal communication and teamwork skills. Must be able to communicate well with operators.
  • Possesses intermediate math skills
  • Interacts and shares information with associates at all levels
  • Participates collaboratively in work groups
  • Ensures ongoing communication with supervisory and/or maintenance staff in the event of equipment malfunctioning
  • Must be capable of working independently at a high level, dealing with contractors, other tradespersons, supervisors and line operators/technicians
  • Demonstrated ability to wear proper PPE and comply
  • Adherence with safety requirements and policies, eg. Ensures lock out tag out policy adherence is enforced by self and others
  • Ensures appropriate GMP apparel and procedures are being followed
  • Ensures all procedures are in accordance with Health & Safety legislation, Company Joint Safety Committee programs and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP)
  • Ensures compliance with BRC food safety guidelines
  • Actively finds new and improved ways of completing tasks and is willing to try new things.
  • Maximo, PLC, and controls knowledge would be an asset
  • Good use of computer programs is an asset

WORKING CONDITIONS:
Environment:
  • Required to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Must be able to work shifts including days, evenings, nights based on a 24 hour/7 day a week operation, including general holidays
  • Start times, scope and duties of this position may change periodically
Volume of work: 
  • Depending on production requirements, associates may be assigned alternate duties and additional responsibilities
Physical Requirement:
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs overhead
  • Frequent twisting, bending, pulling, pushing, crouching, kneeling, walking, and heavy lifting are required

ADDITIONAL PERKS:
  • Free Parking
  • Casual Attire
  • Occasional Team BBQs/Food Trucks
  • Rewards & Recognition
  • Career Growth
  • Professional Development and Advancement Opportunities
  • Appreciation from Management
To be considered for this role please apply with an updated resume by clicking “Apply Now” below.

Click the link below to peek inside our bakery:-
 https://vimeo.com/329880983/c2a4cd799b

We thank all interested applicants, but only those selected will be contacted. Please note all offers of employment at Bimbo Canada (Formerly Canada Bread Company Limited) are conditional upon the successful completion of a pre-hire background check. This may include anything up to and including a criminal history check, reference checks and/or credit check.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Maintenance Technician

Are you looking for an inviting and exciting career opportunity? Do you have a strong drive and enjoy conducting repairs and maintenance work? If the answer is “Yes!”, this is the job for you! 

Catholic Social Services is currently recruiting for one (1), full time, forty (40) hours per week Maintenance Technician to join our team! This position supports our programs in Central Region located in Camrose, AB or Wetaskiwin, AB. The successful candidate must reside in Camrose, AB or Wetaskiwin, AB area. 

You will be joining an established Agency that is guided by faith to care for and bring hope to people in need with humility, compassion and respect. With more than 50 years of service delivery, Catholic Social Services is one of the largest multi-function social services agencies in Canada, with more than 1800 staff, and hundreds of volunteers delivering 130+ programs throughout Central Alberta. 

“As a Catholic social services agency, we are guided by faith to care for and bring hope to people in need with humility, compassion and respect.” 

Our values are at the core of everything we do!

  • Humility: We acknowledge with gratitude our human abilities and limitations. We demonstrate humility by doing the best that we can with the resources that we have.
  • Compassion: We respond to people in need with love. We demonstrate our compassion by caring for people without judgment and without condition.
  • Respect: We demonstrate our respect by being personally present, open and attentive to those we care for and by honouring their dignity and freedom.

The Meaningful Work You'll Do: 

The Maintenance Technician is responsible for performing general maintenance and repair for Catholic Social Services. This position completes general carpentry and electrical repair and maintenance work as required. The Maintenance Technician also performs basic repairs and maintenance on the mechanical operating systems found within our Agency.

Primary job duties include but are not limited to:

  • Perform maintenance tasks of a complex nature in areas of carpentry, plumbing, heating, etc. as assigned
  • Coordinate entire process from assessing the work to be done, determining what materials are need, ordering the necessary material, picking up or arranging for delivery of materials, completing the job and cleanup of work site.
  • Complete requested information reports, job completion reports, billing information and other required documentation in a timely manner
  • Operate Agency vehicle(s) in a safe and courteous manner, including regular service and repair of the vehicle(s)
  • Represent the Agency in a professional and courteous manner
  • Provide service and information in a courteous manner
  • Establish positive working relationships with external suppliers and vendors

Education and Experience:

  • Completed Grade twelve (12) or equivalent
  • Three (3) years experience in general maintenance work preferred
  • Basic knowledge, skill and work experience in: 
    • Carpentry
    • Electrical work
    • Plumbing
    • Simple cement work
  • Physical ability to lift up to 75lb
  • Valid Alberta Class five (5) vehicle operating license
  • Drivers Abstract showing six (6) or less demerits
  • Travel to the site, and off-site locations will be required
  • Police Information Check including vulnerable sector search and Intervention Record Check are conditions of employment and the financial responsibility of the candidate. 

Skills and Abilities:

  • Highly motivated and able to work independently
  • Ability to comprehend and communicate detailed instructions orally and in writing
  • Ability to multi-task and establish priorities
  • Ability to maintain organization of maintenance schedule and files in a changing environment
  • Exhibit initiative, responsibility, flexibility and leadership
  • Possess a thorough knowledge of contract administration and office procedures
  • Ability to perform small repairs (e.g. caulking, replacing washers, and replacing light fixtures)
  • Strong communication and problem solving skills
  • Able to work well under pressure
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Able to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally at all times

What We Offer:

  • The compensation for this position is $22.55 to $25.38 per hour based on qualifications and experience.
  • Flexible benefit options when eligible.
  • Work within a highly collaborative, team-oriented organization, where your ideas are heard, and you can see your impact daily.
  • Growth Opportunities: Apply and grow your skills within a dynamic, innovative and expanding Agency that is taking a leadership role in our industry

This requisition will remain open until a suitable candidate is found.

 Please apply online at www.cssalberta.ca/careers to competition number 2751.

We thank all applicants. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
We offer flexibility, a comprehensive benefits package and a supportive working environment.
We embrace diversity and offer equal opportunities to all qualified applicants regardless of origin, culture, ethnicity, age, ability, gender identity and people of faith or no faith

title: Maintenance Technician III
description:
About Gap Inc.


Our past is full of iconic moments — but our future is going to spark many more. We're looking for the people who'll help make our next decade just as revolutionary as our first five. If you're one of the super-talented who thrive on change, aren't afraid to take risks and love to make a difference, you're the right fit. Come grow with us.


About the Role


In this position, you will support a continuous improvement culture that will maximize capabilities and efficiencies in our distribution centers. You will Try Fast, Learn Fast and Think Big as you develop, implement, maintain material handling equipment (MHE) and property maintenance. You will identify and effectively troubleshoot complex mechanical or electrical problems while making sound decisions to effectively eliminate downtime.


What You'll Do


+ Identify and troubleshoot solutions that impact facility product flow

+ Perform all major repairs/tasks using shop equipment: band saw, Arc and Mig welders, Torch, Hydraulic Press, drill press, lift equipment etc..

+ Function as a lead technician in the absence of the Maintenance Supervisor

+ Subject matter expert of all DC technology, systems, and process flows

+ Maintain and troubleshoot all HVAC equipment in the facility

+ Perform all conveyor, forklift and electrical maintenance

+ Listen and ask questions to solicit feedback to understand needs and provide service


Who You Are


+ Strong technical knowledge of MHE, electrical (PLC) and automation in a distribution center environment

+ Ability to work, plan, and prioritize independently and in a cross functional team

+ Strong verbal, written, analytical and persuasive skills inclusive of exercising good judgement

+ Capable of multitasking, highly organized, with excellent time management skills


Benefits at Gap Inc.


+ Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic, Old Navy and Athleta, 30% off at Outlet, and 10% off markdowns at Gap, Banana Republic and Outlet.

+ Competitive Paid Time Off plans.*

+ Company match for donations and volunteer time*

+ Registered Retirement Savings Plan

+ Employee stock purchase plan.*

+ Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*

+ Virtual health care 24/7*

+ Maternity/Parental Top Up.*

+ See more of the benefits we offer.


*For eligible employees


Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the Best Places to Work by the Human Rights Campaign (https://www.hrc.org/resources/best-places-to-work-for-lgbtq-equality-2022) for the seventeenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2021 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index for the fourth year in a row.

title: Regular Part Time - Facilities Maintenance Technician
description:
FACILITIES MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN - PERMANENT PART TIME 

Every other weekend 0800am-600pm - 20 hours per pay 

Starting hourly rate $27.68

DUTIES:

This position requires a self-motivated individual who can work effectively with minimum supervision.  Must possess excellent customer service skills and be able to interact with residents, co-workers and visitors.  Involvement in all aspects of building operations including monitoring of building environment and equipment, energy management, maintenance of life safety equipment, preventive/predictive maintenance, electrical systems, plumbing systems, fire and emergency plans. While performing any and all duties of the position the employee will work in a safe and healthy manner and will follow the regulations outlined in the Occupational Health and Safety Act as outlined in the organization Health & Safety Policy, Infection Control and safe work procedures.

 

QUALIFICATIONS: 

  • Ability to read, write and follow oral and written instructions in English
  • Understanding and willingness to work in accordance with the Health & Safety Act
  • Be aware of the use of chemicals and WHMIS
  • Good communication skills both verbal and written
  • Physically able to perform the duties of the job
  • One year certification from college of technical school; Gas Fitter II certificate, Plumbing, Electrical, HVAC trade certificate, Facilities Systems Technician.
  • Current valid driver's license. 
  • Yearly training, Fire/Emergency, Asbestos Type Two removal and fit testing, Roof Top tying off, Spill and WHMIS.

Please contact John Noble Home if you require accommodations during the application process. 

John Noble Home thanks all applicants for their interest, however only those candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Facilities Maintenance Mechanic – (CAT 27) – HVAC
description:
Description

Are you passionate about reaching new heights, teamwork and making a meaningful contribution? Do you picture yourself as a valued member of an industry-leading organization?  If you answered yes to these questions, Air Canada is seeking enthusiastic individuals to join the diverse and vibrant team working together to lead the growth and expansion of Canada’s flag carrier. 

 

Description:

  • Perform preventative maintenance & servicing, to Building related HVAC equipment. 
  • Investigate and troubleshoot faulty Boilers, Chillers, Air Handling units, Rooftop units. 
  • Ability to install, maintain, repair, dismantle, and reassemble HVAC related components  
  • Ability to work at heights, form a scissor lift, boom lift or catwalks.  
  • Perform minor repairs including replacement of Filters, belts, bearings, ignition controls  
  • Preform visual inspections of buildings to maintain Building Code standards. 
  • Ensure all work is completed in a safe manner and complies with applicable industry standards. 
  • Performing other facility related duties as requested. 
  • Team oriented individual with demonstrated ability to work unsupervised and self directed. 
  • Able to work under pressure. 
  • Able to work shifts, including weekends & participate in on-call rotation  

Qualifications

 
  • Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required
  • Must posses a valid DVS (Diploma of Vocational Studies). 
  • Must posses valid Driver’s licence with clean abstract  
  • Must posses 313A Certification or equivalent  
  • Must Posses G1/G2 Gas licence Certification  
  • Minimum 5 years field experience. 
  • Knowledge of building mechanics, Complex HVAC systems, Mechanical system operation, Building Automation, CMMS   
  • Candidate must have excellent written and oral communication skills and be detailed oriented. 
  • Basic computer knowledge (Word, Excel, e-mail and internet). 
  • Employees in this role, conduct safety-critical work and as such, Air Canada medical standards must be met in order to qualify for the role. Candidates will be subject to a medical evaluation, including a drug and alcohol test and are expected to be free of any intoxicating substances.
  • Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibly of the candidates applying for this position.

Linguistic Requirements:

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

Diversity and Inclusion

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

title: Senior Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
This position includes diagnosis of causes of breakdown, ordering required parts, removal, rework and installation of various engine and chassis components, as well as implementing and /or modifying maintenance schedules.  Work assignments will be received in the form of oral or written work orders, but the Heavy Equipment Mechanic will be expected to determine the nature and extent of the necessary repairs.

Job Duties:

  • Repair and adjust hydraulic pumps, safety valves, and any other necessary mechanical components
  • Inspect, repair and adjust gasoline and diesel powered units
  • Adhere to workplace safety policies, regulations and compliances
  • Communicate any unsafe conditions or accidents/injuries in a timely manner to the supervisor in order to facilitate prompt correction or reporting
  • Diagnose defects in heavy duty equipment
  • Perform mechanical repairs on equipment in the shop and road calls when required
  • Operate automotive servicing equipment
  • Installation of new and added-on equipment
  • Electrical and hydraulic troubleshooting and diagnostics
  • Repair cooling, and lubrication systems
  • Install and align engines and machinery
  • Repair mechanical transmissions, drive-trains and final drives
  • Test repaired equipment for proper performance
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other maintenance work
  • Maintain a working knowledge of changes in technology and repair techniques
  • Other mechanical repair work as required
  • Mentor apprentice mechanics

Requirements:

  • 310T or 421License 
  • Completion of college/CEGEP/vocational or technical training
  • Appropriate credentials and certifications
  • 5-10 years experience as a Heavy Equipment Mechanic
  • Possess a valid driver’s license
  • Mathematics, oral and written communication skills at the trade journeyman level
  • Ability to work independently in a busy environment
  • Experience with routine maintenance operations
  • Working knowledge of related maintenance and repair practices
  • Working knowledge of diesel engines, hydraulic pumps, motors, and air brake systems
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
  • Able to work well under pressure
  • Ability to deal with multiple tasks and prioritize work effectively
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Able to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally at all time

Work Conditions

  • Physical ability to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Travel to off-site locations may be required
  • Safety equipment will be required, e.g. steel-toed safety boots, safety glasses/goggles, etc.
  • Overtime as required including nights and weekends
  • Hazards associated with the trade
  • Work both indoors and outdoors
  • May be exposed to construction sites
  • Safety oriented

We are committed to enhancing workplace diversity and fostering a workplace that is representative of the resident population we serve.  We are committed to identifying and removing barriers for diverse employees in recruitment, advancement and retention.  We are an equal opportunity employer and consider applicants without regard to age, race, colour, creed or religion, ancestry, origin, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, record of offences, disability, or other protected status. We have policies and procedures to accommodate applicants and employees with a disability.

title: General Maintenance Worker
description:
Best Buy Canada’s Distribution and Service Centre, based out of Langley, BC, is currently looking for a General Maintenance Worker! The General Maintenance Worker will be responsible for day to day building issues, maintaining our 5S program and working on special building/renovation projects. 

 

Availability Requirement                                                                                                                                                                     

  • This is a permanent part time position. – you must be available to work a minimum of 32 hours a week 

  • Afternoon shift availability (12pm -8:15). Hours will vary throughout the year  

  • Must be open to a flexible schedule including weekends 

 

As a General Maintenance Worker, you will…. 

  • Ensure the building is clear of debris, looks organized, and is safe at all times 

  • Work on and assist with special building/renovation projects related to facilities issues, such as hanging signs, painting, moving furniture, assisting with special functions. 

  • Build functional solutions for the building using shop equipment 

  • Operate the garbage compactor and cardboard baler 

  • Provide timely support to all associates by ensuring that our machine batteries are maintained, inspected, and changed, as necessary. 

  • Other responsibilities include reporting problems or damages with the compactor, cardboard baler, MHE, conveyor, racking and damaged product 

  • Occasionally work at heights (up to 30 feet), indoor and outdoor 

  • Operate power-jacks and lift trucks 

 

The experience and education we need… 

  • Completion of High School Diploma or Equivalent 

  • Experience with general building maintenance or grounds keeping 

  • Experience operating many different types of power tools 

  • Required repetitive lifting up to 50 lbs., bending and twisting 

  • Experience with driving material handling equipment (MHE) is considered an asset 

 

What we offer … 

  • Competitive salary and benefits 

  • Employee purchase discounts 

  • Company paid MHE certification 

  • A workplace culture where collaboration is fostered 

  • Afternoon shift premiums 

 

 

We believe we have the unique opportunity to help customers enrich their lives and pursue their passions with the help of technology

title: Millwright - (GY Shift)
description:
Conagra Brands is one of North America's leading branded food companies. We have a rich heritage of making great food, and a team that’s passionate about innovation and growth. Conagra offers choices for every occasion through iconic brands, such as Hunts, Aylmer, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, VH Sauces, Pogo and Vlasic®, and emerging brands, including Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein®, and Frontera®. We pride ourselves on having the most impactful, energized and inclusive culture in the food industry. For more information, visit www.conagrabrands.ca. Conagra Brands est une des principales entreprises d’aliments de marque en Amérique du Nord. Son histoire est jalonnée de grands succès alimentaires qui sont le fruit du travail d’une équipe passionnée par l’innovation et la croissance. Conagra offre des choix pour toute occasion grâce à des marques réputées comme Hunt’s®, Aylmer®, Marie Callender's®, Healthy Choice®, Slim Jim®, les sauces VH®, Pogo®, Vlasic® et des marques émergentes, dont Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®, Duke's®, Earth Balance®, Gardein® et Frontera®. Nous sommes très fiers d’avoir la culture la plus influente, la plus dynamique et la plus inclusive du secteur alimentaire. Pour en savoir plus, visitez www.conagrabrands.ca. Conagra Brands is one of North America's leading branded food companies with an established presence in Canada. We have a rich heritage of making great food, and a team in Richmond, British Columbia that’s passionate about innovation and growth. Conagra offers choices for every occasion through iconic and emerging brands like Gardein™ (made in Richmond, British Columbia), Healthy Choice®, Hunt's®, Aylmer®, Snack Pack®, Orville Redenbacher’s®, Chef Boyardee® and Angie's® BOOMCHICKAPOP®. Our Canadian manufacturing facilities are in Richmond, British Columbia, Boisbriand, Quebec, and Dresden, Ontario. We also have Canadian offices in Mississauga, Ontario and Boisbriand, Quebec. Conagra is proud to have the most impactful, energized and inclusive culture in food. To find your next job in Canada, visit https://careers.conagrabrands.ca/. For more information about our Gardein™ plant-based food products in Canada, visit https://gardein.ca/

Position Summary:

Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, the Millwright shares the responsibility for the timely and quality repair and preventative maintenance of plant machinery and equipment to minimize downtime, maintain the life of equipment and ensure safe and efficient operations. This position is night shift of 12 hours and rotation. Duties and Responsibilities: Troubleshoot/ diagnose equipment failure and carryout repairs Work around and in close proximity of rotating (operating) equipment in order to diagnose suspected probable failures Conduct regular preventive maintenance to reduce down time Install and dismantle machinery and equipment according to plans which involves working at heights, climbing ladders and using mobile equipment. Determining parts required for repairs and replacement Operate mobile equipment used in the repair, installation or fabrication of equipment including but not limited to lathes, welders, milling machine, drills, grinders, hammers, wrenches, blow torches and other variety of power tools. Report any food safety and/or quality issues to the Lead Hand and or Supervisor to ensure appropriate resolution Participate in improving operations through effective planning and scheduling of building and equipment maintenance activities and resources Prepared all aspect of the maintenance department to ensure that equipment and building are operating effectively Complete assigned and schedules work orders and carry out preventive maintenance Manage capital and operating expenses for maintenance within budgets and forecasts Follow all maintenance procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory codes while maintaining a safe workplace environment Request for procurement and arrange for direct building and equipment maintenance/repair, parts and services Comply with and follow all safety regulations including Work Safe BC regulations and Garden Protein International plant rules and regulations Follow all company policies and procedures, including: GMP, SQF, HACCP, Health & Safety, Attendance, etc. Work in varying conditions (hot/cold) environment and enclosed rooms during night and day shifts. Move machinery and equipment using hoists, dollies, rollers, pallet jacks and forklifts. Cleaning, lubricating and performing other duties as assigned. Experience and Qualifications: 3-5 years’ experience in an industrial/food processing environment an asset. Red Seal Ticket Industrial mechanics and electrical background (PLC knowledge an asset). Knowledge, Skills & Abilities: Ability to identify and solve problems Product and production process knowledge Knowledge of facility equipment and machinery Able to perform physical tasks that require frequent bending and twisting throughout the shift Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and effectively meet deadlines Able to perform repetitive hand movements Strong time management skills, and ability to prioritize and multi-task Highly organized, efficient and detail oriented Ability to work independently and in teams Able to perform some keyboarding functions Able to communicate and maintain working relationship with coworkers We care about your total well-being and will support you with the following: Health: Company paid Health & Dental Benefits, Accident and Disability insurance, Health Spending account and Wellness Spending Account Wealth: Great compensation, Wealth Accumulation Program Growth: Onsite training, individual development plans for employees Balance: Paid-time off, Confidential Employee Assistance Program (EAP), Best Doctors referral service Conagra Brands is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or any other protected factor. À titre d'employeur souscrivant au principe de l'égalité d'accès à l'emploi, Conagra Brand considère les candidats qui sont qualifiés pour les offres d'emplois sans égard à la race, la couleur, les croyances religieuses, l'origine, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité de genre, la langue parlée, l'âge, le handicap ou tout autre facteur discriminatoire.

title: Handyman for Residential
description:
To meet the demands of our rapidly growing base of satisfied customers Handyman Connection is seeking an experienced Handyman.  This skilled handyman would ideally have a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work.  Our customers love us!  We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!


What You Will Receive

  • Earn $35-40/hour or up to $1000/week, depending on your skills and availability
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers
  • Branded apparel and signage
Responsibilities

The handyman will need to have expertise in multiple types of home repair, maintenance and remodeling. You must have basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate with others with a positive attitude.  We are looking for a craftsman or craftswoman who can bid work and produce it.  If you have at least 3 of the following skill areas, you're the kind of person we need to add to our team:
  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish
  • Painting Interior and Exterior
  • Drywall Repair / Patching / Caulking
  • Flooring Repair and Installation
  • General Home Repairs and Maintenance work
All candidates should be confident in the following areas:

  • Great Customer Service and Client Relations
  • Knowledge of Building Codes
  • Material Management
Requirements

  • Must have current Driver's License 
  • Must have tools, work vehicle and good references
  • Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades
  • Must pass screening process which includes a background check
  • Independent Contractors must carry liability insurance and workers comp
  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet
Please, no Project Managers or those whose experience is primarily New Construction.


Ready to Learn More?

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.  Check us out on the web at: www.handymanconnection.com

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
MAINTENANCE WORKER

Gold’s Gym B.C. is hiring full time Maintenance Worker, with potential to grow! Are you hard working, experienced, and driven? We would love to hear from you!

About Gold’s Gym

Gold’s Gym has been the authority on fitness since 1965. It was then that fitness legend Joe Gold took the knowledge and expertise he gained from training at the world famous “Muscle Beach” and opened up the first Gold’s Gym on Pacific Avenue in Venice, California. At Gold’s Gym, our goal is simple: We’re here to help you Know Your Own Strength®. We are committed to helping people find their inner strength and reach their goals.

Key Responsibilities

  • Performs routine maintenance and repair duties related to buildings and fitness equipment
  • Performs basic mechanical and electrical to equipment and systems
  • Performs basic drywall duties including boarding, mudding, taping and sanding
  • Maintains the physical appearance of the buildings and grounds which may include landscaping and snow clearing when required
  • Completes general plumbing repairs, such as leaky taps, replaced and/or repair plugged toilets, drains, etc.
  • Documents any repair maintenance and inspection work carried out in the specified format
  • Completes all maintenance requests in a timely manner
Qualifications

  • Class 5 driver’s license and able to commute around Vancouver, Port Coquitlam and Langley as needed
  • Electrical and plumbing experience is an asset
  • A provincial, other vocational, and/or professional certificate/degree is an asset
  • Able to perform physical duties, including able to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Strong work ethic, punctual, reliable, and a team player
What We Offer

  • Positive, rewarding, and collaborative team environment
  • Competitive compensation
  • Complimentary club membership
  • Discount on Gold’s Gym products and services
NOTE: This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

Gold’s Gym British Columbia is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at https://goldsgymbc.ca/

Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.

title: Shop Technician
description:
Overview:

Weatherford is a leading global energy services company. Our world-class experts partner with customers to optimize their resources and realize the full potential of their assets. Across our operating locations, including manufacturing, research and development, service, and training facilities, operators choose us for strategic solutions that add efficiency, flexibility, and responsibility to any energy operation.

We are focused on technology development, digital solutions, and defining our footprint in the new energy space. Our ability to provide integrated solutions across our segments will be critical to growth in our core operations and the energy transition.

Energy producers face unique challenges every day, so it is our job to create solutions that enhance safety, streamline operations, and sustain uptime to meet or exceed their targets. We operate across the global energy landscape employing some of the best diverse talent in the industry. At Weatherford, we understand the value each individual brings to the table. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and are immensely proud of our workforce. We invite you to join our passionate, talented, word-class team.

When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger â€“ a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each otherâ€™s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.

Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provide you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.

 

Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Job Requirements:

Entry level job - Has responsibility for providing "hands-on" technical support to the production, and repair of equipment and/or tools. In shop environment, receives field tools, takes them apart, repairs and refurbishes tool to go back to the field

 

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: (not listed in any particular order)  

  • To maintain/redress tools as per procedure or as per supervisor  requests with completing relevant paperwork.  
  • Perform make ups of tubulars with torque machine.  
  • Conduct hydraulic pressure tests to ensure integrity of made up assemblies  
  • To prepare equipment and taking part in loading/unloading when sending/receiving equipment to/from the rig site.  
  • Operate overhead cranes and fork lifts. Perform slinging as per regulation.  
  • To ensure that workshop is in a clean state at all times.  
  • Organization of verification of metrology and equipment calibration  
  • Maintenance of equipment in proper form  
  • Know and understand Weatherford Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions  
  • Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford
Experience:
  • Minimal Oil and Gas related experience required
  • High School Diploma preferred  
  • Must be able to communicate fluently  in English
  • General knowledge of oilfield operations- workshop  
  • Knowledge of windows based systems

title: Gutter Installer
description:
Looking for a motivated person to remove existing aluminum gutters and downpipes off residential houses and make up and install new ones.

Requirements:
  • A driver's license is a must there is no transit bus stops near shop and it is also an asset to drive work trucks to job sites. Must be willing to work out doors and not afraid of heights and be able to carry ladders.
  • Experience is an asset but willing to train the right person that is motivated and has a positive attitude. 

Job is full-time Monday - Friday.

title: Industrial Maintenance Electrician Afternoon Shift
description:
Wonderbrands, is a leading North American bakery (formerly Weston Foods, fresh and frozen businesses) with 140 years of experience in baking packaged breads, artisan breads, and donuts.  We are one of the largest bakeries in North America and makers of Wonder Bread, Country Harvest, D’Italiano, Gadoua, and Casa Mendosa.

Wonderbrands, a division of FGF Brands, is unlocking an incredible opportunity for growth through a focus on production innovation capabilities, through a leading edge supply chain practice and investing deeply in communities where we bake.  We are hiring to build a robust  Talent and Development team to support our bakeries and Team Members.

Shift:

  • Steady Afternoons, 8 Hour Shifts, 2:00 p.m. - 10:00 p.m.
  •  Rate: $36.00 per hour, Benefits, Pension, Unionized. 

As a member of the maintenance team, your primary responsibility includes perform electrical maintenance, install, examine, replace or repair components; trouble shoot electrical systems and building services. In addition, you will provide technical support to production teams in supporting production uptime, ensuring optimal functioning of the production equipment and facilities. This position provides critical support in reducing production down time, implementing and maintaining electrical programs, preventive maintenance of equipment, and effective troubleshooting and repair of equipment. The Electrician is a member of the maintenance team and as such, participates in team efforts to achieve assigned department goals; works closely with other team members to ensure all maintenance activities are completed on time, according to SOPs and regulatory requirements; and provides support to other roles within the maintenance team.

  • PLC and HMI programming changes and troubleshooting including modification and calibration of equipment; weight scales VFD, Servomotors and network communications experience.
  • Repair, troubleshooting and installation of machinery including electrical and electronic equipment, control systems and automation
  • Electrical wiring and testing of automated systems
  • Optimize equipment safety, efficiency and reliability, participating in continuous improvement projects and completing work orders according to PM schedules
  • Previous Food industry experience preferred
  • Comply with all applicable legislative and Bakery food safety, health and safety and environmental policies and procedures.
  • Service, clean and perform preventative maintenance and overhaul on all production and bakery equipment
  • Continually improve equipment function via design improvements
  • Ensure that work area is clean of debris and hazards at all times and check work area for such hazards upon arrival and when departing each area of work
  • Work in a safe manner in accordance with legislated and company health and safety standards
  • Perform other related duties as assigned or required.
  • Must have Industrial Electrician License (442A) or 309A or 433A Millwright 
  • Strong Mechanical Aptitude
  • 2-5 years' industrial, electrical and mechanical experience, preferably in the food industry
  • Strong knowledge of PLC (Programmable Logic Controllers) and ability to assist all trades people as required
  • Problem solving skills and good communication skills are required
  • Ability to work straight Nights, as well as on weekends and holidays

title: Maintenance Technician, Commercial - Woodstock/London Territory
description:
Overview:

Commercial HVAC Maintenance Technician

 

Reports To: General Manager and/or Operations Manager

Status: Full-time, Regular

Category: Maintenance

Location Name: Service Experts Commercial HVAC - GTA Commercial

Location Address : 32 Selby Road, Brampton,  Ontario  L6W 3L7

 

NOTE: This position would service the Woodstock/London  territory.

 

 

Join the team of experts and realize your true potential!

 

 

Why You Should Join the Service Experts Team?

 

Our team consists of the very best; we believe in doing what is right for our customers and our employees. We provide our employees with the training, support and an opportunity for unlimited professional growth. Join us and become an EXPERT!

 

Qualifications:

Qualifications:

  • The qualified candidate must have a high school diploma or equivalent.
  • Must hold a Gasfitter 3 or Gasfitter 2 License with at least 1 year of commercial experience.
  • Must possess all valid licensing or certifications as required by provincial or local governmental laws or regulations for the geographical work area.
  • A license in plumbing, electrical work, sheet metal, or refrigeration an asset.
  • Proven mechanical aptitude and experience in the commercial HVAC field.  
  • Able to operate all necessary tools and equipment to perform various projects.
  • The successful candidate will also have the ability to read wiring diagrams and troubleshoot problems with electrical, refrigerant, and duct systems on HVAC equipment.
  • Demonstrated commitment to the delivery of customer-focused service.
  • The ability to work occasional overtime and weekend hours as required.
  • The successful incumbent must be able to meet the minimum requirements for our background check criteria.

What Do We Offer You as a Service Experts Employee?

Service Experts offers a comprehensive benefits package designed to support employees and their families in managing their health and wellness needs. Following is a summary of the many benefits that could be available to you as a Service Experts valued employee:

 

  • Competitive pay, including incentive opportunities for many positions.
  • Medical /Dental /Vision Insurance programs.
  • RRSP Plan with company matching contributions.
  • Life Insurance for you and options you can elect for your family.
  • Short-Term and Long-Term disability insurance, that protects you and your family if you are unable to work.
  • World class training opportunities through our Expert University Learning Management System.
  • Career development opportunities.

 

 

Service Experts is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment process. We will accommodate the needs of applicants under the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please contact the Human Resources Department and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Responsibilities:

Position Summary:

As a member of our team, you will perform equipment maintenance on commercial sites. With a strong focus on customer service and a commitment to integrity, you will answer questions and resolve customer concerns.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for maintenance of HVAC equipment within commercial environments.
  • Performing service and/or cleaning of IAQ products and equipment, as well as soldering, welding, brazing and performing minor field fabrication.
  • Responsible for delivery of excellent service to commercial customers and sustaining high levels of customer satisfaction.
  • Handle customer concerns, questions or problems in an effective manner.
  • Prepare material requisition forms.

title: Assistant, Building Maintenance - Summer Student
description:
Company Description

Who we are:

At Reitmans (Canada) Limited (RCL), every moment of every day revolves around our customers and our love of fashion. We believe fashion empowers our customers to put their best foot forward when it matters the most. From the design table to the stores and our digital channels, we are always finding new ways to create memorable customer experiences, backed by a strong brand portfolio and powered by the most passionate people in the industry.

Job Description

Job Description:

Reporting to the Facilities Supervisor, your role is to provide assistant to building maintenance team for the head office of Reitmans Canada Limited.

  • ‎Moving furniture, boxes, materials;‎
  • ‎Carry out layout of offices, meeting rooms, mechanical rooms;
  • ‎Assemble furniture‎;
  • Cleaning‎;
  • Miscellaneous work according needs‎.
  • Work schedule : Monday - Thursday 7:00 to 3:00 / Friday 7:00 - 1:00

Qualifications

  • Currently pursing CEGEP , University or trade school;
  • Ability to perform physical labor;
  • Able to handle boxes and objects weighing up to 45 pounds;
  • There may be occasional work outdoors and in non-air conditioned environments;
  • bilingual.

Additional Information

 

What we offer (Why work with us):

  • A competitive benefits package (Full Time Employees Only)
  • Paid Time Off  Sick Time, Flex Days & Vacation (Full Time Employees Only)
  • Additional benefits include monthly bonus potential, opportunities for advancement and tuition reimbursement
  • 50% discount at all Reitmans (Canada) Limited brands (Penningtons, Reitmans & RW&CO.)
  • Generous Employee Referral Policy.

If this inspires you…let’s talk. Send us your resume today! 

By the way, did you know that Reitmans (Canada) Limited has several hundreds of stores all across Canada and three fashion apparel banners? Get ready to join the Canadian fashion retail icon, with a great success story where you can have a voice and make a real difference. 

There are many ways to wear a career at RCL! #ReadytoRCL 

Reitmans (Canada) Limited is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees -- their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for providing an accessible candidate experience. 

We thank all applicants. Only selected candidates will be contacted.

title: Heddle/HOPA (Hamilton Oshawa Port Authority) 208 Hillyard St, Hamilton - Thursday, May 26th - Millwright
company: Support Ontario Youth - Tools in the Trades
description:
Support Ontario Youth’s Skilled Development Team, in partnership with their funder, The Ministry of Labour, Government of Ontario, is offering a one-day bootcamp in communities impacted by the COVID-19 Pandemic. This is a FREE one-day training opportunity during which you will learn more about the Manufacturing/Millwright Field, and the apprenticeship process. The event includes a complimentary lunch, a free apprenticeship starter tool kit, and an opportunity to network with employers.

To be eligible for this free one-day training opportunity you must be:

DOUBLE VACCINATED WITH PROOF AGAINST COVID-19. NO EXCEPTIONS.

·         A minimum of 18+ years old

·         A Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident

·         Have a strong interest in becoming a Millwright

Support Ontario Youth, Tools in the Trades is designed specifically for recent high school and/or College graduates, or adults looking to retrain in a new career. This one-day bootcamp experience will afford you the opportunity to gain hands on tool experience with qualified instructors from the Industrial/Millwright. You will also learn essential employability skills including workplace etiquette, resume writing, interviewing skills, networking, and financial planning. Each participant will receive a  free apprenticeship starter tool kit valued at $250.00. The bootcamp specifically will focus on those who may have lost employment during the Pandemic, as well as those who are looking to start a new career in a growing industry which is lacking in skilled trades persons. The one-day program is open to all Canadians.  Those who are newcomers, women, and/or BIPOC, are strongly encouraged to apply!

Employers from the area, as well as Support Ontario Youth Staff, will be onsite to answer questions and offer guidance and assistance in the apprenticeship process. Opportunities may even be available for some to sign on as an apprentice, on the day of the event.

To apply, please go direct to our website at www.supportontarioyouth.ca and click on the bootcamp link. This page will bring you to our application page. Once you click on the appropriate event location, and you will be directed to complete an assessment questionnaire. The assessment will determine if you are qualified to attend the bootcamp. Each one-day event will have a maximum of 30 participants.

Registration: 7:30am

Time: 8:00am to 3:30pm

 

For more information, please visit our website for additional camps in communities across Ontario, or email

Bootcamp@supportontarioyouth.ca

title: Maintenance Technicians
description:
C-P Flexible Packaging is a successful and fast-growing essential manufacturing company that uses an impressive array of digital pre-press and wide-web flexographic printing capabilities and extrusion and adhesive laminators to produce creative flexible packaging solutions for our customers. With a primary focus on serving the food industry, C-P specializes in roll stock, pouches, re-sealable packaging and shrink sleeves. Our headquarters and main manufacturing facility is located York, PA, with additional operations in Bristol, PA, Buffalo, NY, Lakeville, MN, and Aurora, Ontario.

In addition to the other advantages of working for CP, we're offering premium pay of $40 to $45 / hour based on experience and shift premiums for nights and weekends

Benefits
  • Medical, dental, vision, and prescription drug coverage
  • Pension plan with generous company match
  • Bonus program
  • Paid vacation and personal days
  • Paid holidays
  • Life and AD&D insurance
  • Company paid group medical & dental benefits & short-term disability coverage
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Our Aurora, Ontario facility is currently looking for Millwrights and / or Electricians to join our Maintenance Team on a contiental shift rotation, 

The successful candidates will have;

* 2 to 5 years of relevant work experience
* Experience in flexographic printing industry as a Maintenance Technician is preferred
* Technical degree or advanced education
* Welding and electrical (AC/DC and high voltage equipment) experience

title: Living Wall Maintenance Crew Member (Clone)
description:
Are you a plant person? Nedlaw Living Walls is looking for a reliable self-starter to join our team!

Job Requirements:

  • Knowledge & Experience with hydroponic systems
  • Thorough understanding of horticulture
  • Comfortable working on ladders at heights
  • This role is physically demanding. Must be physically fit and able to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • Strict adherence to health and safety policies and procedures
  • Efficiency in completing tasks & time management
  • Candidate must be flexible in job schedule. Shifts are Monday – Friday, with varied hours. Potential for occasional weekend work, however this is not typical.
  • G License and clean driver’s abstract
  • Working at Heights and WHMIS certification (provided if not obtained)
  • Pest management, interior green house exterminator license would be beneficial
  • Basic plumbing HVAC and mechanical knowledge an asset
  • CSA approved steel toe safety boots

Job Description:

  • Complete duties such as pruning, maintaining vertical hydroponic system
  • Complete maintenance record keeping
  • Review plumbing and mechanical components of hydroponic system

Additional Information:

  • Clothing and boot allowance offered after probationary period
  • Health and dental benefits provided after probationary period

title: Millwright Apprentice
description:
Our AGS Oshawa team is looking for a Millwright Apprentice to meet the challenges of an established manufacturing operation, as well as new product launches. The right candidate is an individual who is keen to learn and grow in our dynamic environment.This position is a key part of a team committed to producing and delivering high quality product to one of North America's largest automakers.Together, as one team, we strive to change the automotive landscape and excel within the highly competitive automotive industry.

JOB SUMMARY

Responsible for installing, maintaining machinery and supporting structures efficiently, safely by following the Ontario Occupational Health and Safety Act and in accordance with the plant standards.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Protect self and others by performing job functions in accordance with the organization's policies and procedures, and regulatory requirements for a safe working environment.
  • Give and receive oral and written instructions; read technical literature and manufacturer's specifications; write maintenance and job reports to company requirements; use computer and job maintenance software for specific applications.
  • Read drawings and schematics; interpret manufacturer's manuals, specifications, and drawing symbols.
  • Use of hand and power tools.
  • Set up and use machines tools.
  • Use and care of precision measuring equipment.
  • Select and use materials and fasteners.
  • Select and apply lubricants and greases for specific applications.
  • Also responsible for assembling, erecting, locating and dismantling scaffolds, lifting devices and elevating platforms.
  • Plan lifts; perform calculations using load charts; select and use correct rigging/hoisting equipment; inspect and maintain rigging/hoisting equipment; use hand and radio signals.
  • Install and maintain material handling systems.
  • Install and maintain power transmission systems.
  • Install and maintain hydrodynamic and hydrostatic pumps.
  • Install, commission and maintain prime movers and machinery
  • Set up and operate welding equipment.
  • Identify and apply bearing materials, fits and tolerances.
  • Install single and multi-stage fan and blower systems.
  • Install and maintain pneumatic systems.
  • Install and maintain hydraulic systems
  • Perform preventive and predictive maintenance.
  • Perform other duties as assigned

SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Completion of Grade 12 or equivalent.
  • Completion of academic standards prescribed by the regulations for the trade will be considered an asset.
  • Prior experience in a manufacturing facility is an asset.
  • Knowledge of workplace safety and safe lifting and handling procedures.
  • Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and in a team, as required and complete daily activities according to schedule.
  • Strong problem solving and analytical skills.
  • Ability to meet all physical demands of the job, including, but not limited to, heavy lifting, standing for long periods of time, working in hot and cold environments, rotating shifts.
  • Must agree and follow the standards of apprenticeship.

Accessibility: AGS Automotive Systems is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. Employees with disabilities who require accommodation during the recruitment process or would like more details about accessibility should contact your local HR Team.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Water Made Exciting!

At SodaStream, we are growing fast and looking for problem-solvers and thought leaders that are ready to grow with us. If you have the energy and determination, then we'll provide the tools you need for success. We have fantastic benefits and a variety of perks that create an outstanding work environment for all our employees.

Benefits

  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
  • Basic life insurance, disability, and wellness programs.
  • RRSP with Employer match.
  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.

Job Summary:

The Maintenance Technician will be responsible for providing overall support to the Mechanical Supervisor to include hands-on maintenance of the production lines, other mechanical equipment throughout the facility and building requirements. This role will perform repairs and help in the operation, monitoring, and performance of preventative maintenance as necessary.

Shift: Sunday to Thursday 9pm to 6am . During Training Period shift will be from Monday to Friday 7am to 4pm.

Responsibilities:

  • Conducts routine production line maintenance and repairs such as; replacement of belts, cleaning and repair of filling heads, troubleshooting performance issues.
  • Follows established preventive maintenance schedules and/or provides support for routine maintenance.
  • Assesses and repairs other equipment such as heat tunnel, box maker, fork lift and pallet jacks. Provides routine maintenance on equipment as instructed. Inspect the machinery equipment and manage the inspection records on a regular basis.
  • Maintain inventory of parts and supplies.
  • Records and reports on maintenance repairs and issues as needed.
  • Ensure all safety and work procedures are followed.
  • Maintains building/facility needs such as painting, cleaning, fire/safety equipment, lightbulb changes and other general facility needs.
  • Comfortable in the efficient use of PPE.
  • Provide training for line operators and shift leads on basic maintenance tasks as well as training on machine settings and parameters.
  • Document and analyze trends of scheduled and unscheduled downtime.
  • Assist with the development of written SOP.
  • Other duties as assigned.


Country:
Canada

Requirements:

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years of mechanical experience required. Electrical background a plus.
  • Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
  • Must be available for shift, weekend assignments and on-call.
  • Ability to read blueprints and wiring diagrams.
  • Prior forklift certification preferred, recertification or initial certification will be completed when hired.
  • Strong work ethic, detail to attention and teamwork attitude.
  • Experience and knowledge of hydraulics a plus.
  • Knowledge of electricity in an industrial basis a plus.
  • Knowledge of PLC SW a plus.
  • Knowledge of pneumatics 

Working conditions:

  • Warehouse environment with varying temperatures.
  • Must be able to sit, stand and exert well-paced mobility for up to 4 hours in length.
  • Must be able to bend, stoop, squat and stretch to fulfill cleaning and repair/maintenance tasks.
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs. on a regular basis.
  • Requires grasping, writing, typing, standing, sitting, walking, repetitive motions, bending, climbing, listening and hearing ability and visual acuity.

title: Millwright
description:
Division Description
Our client is located in Rexdale, Ontario is an automotive parts manufacturing facility that produces automotive components for Original Equipment Manufacturers (“OEM”) including BMW, Chrysler, Ford, General Motors, and Toyota/Lexus.  
 
Role Summary
To analyze, repair, and troubleshoot mechanical machinery, equipment, and components.

Key Qualifications/Requirements
  • Certified/Licensed Industrial Millwright;
  • Two years of experience in an automotive manufacturing environment or a minimum five years of experience in an industrial environment;
  • Physically capable of performing essential duties of the job.
  • Skills: Numatics, Stamping press, Assembly welding lines, Fabrications, Welding, and Machining
Key Responsibilities
  • Analyze, repair, and troubleshoot machinery such as: Stamping presses, Robotic welding assembly lines, Conveyors and other Hydraulic Systems.
  • Analyze, repair, and troubleshoot pneumatic and hydraulic circuits and their associated components. (Hydraulic experience is a prerequisite).
  • Design, modify, and update related schematics;
  • Optimization of machine functionality for uptime, cycle time, and energy conservation
  • Commitment to continuous improvement and work place safety;
  • Assist the maintenance department planning of PM activity scheduling;
  • TS16949 awareness and adherence;
  • ISO14001 awareness and adherence;
  • Lean Manufacturing and 5S concepts awareness and adherence;
  • Work safely and within the guidelines of the Employee Handbook.
  • Maintain safety standards of equipment and work area and perform all duties in a safe manner in accordance with the safety policies and within the guidelines of the Employee Handbook
  • Filling out daily shift report.
  • Services, maintains, repairs, installs and tests new or existing equipment and verifies conformance to specifications
  • Has good interpersonal and communication skills and is results oriented.
  • Team Player.
  • Other duties as may be required
  • Accepts personal responsibility to plan and conduct their work safely in compliance with the Occupational Health & Safety Act as well as company policies and guidelines;
  • Responsible for Good House Keeping in your area.
Additional Information
Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Come Join the Sierra Difference!

We are currently seeking to hire a Maintenance Technician at our Brampton Facility!

Who We Are:

Sierra Supply Chain Services (a division of Eastern Meat Solutions) provides protein (poultry, beef, pork) solutions to the food processing and distribution sector. We simplify supply chain services and provide expanding value to the protein sector across our three locations in Brampton, Hamilton, and Mississauga.

What You will Be Doing/Position Details:

The Maintenance Technician is responsible for the upkeep of the Hamilton Warehouse facility, assisting in all areas and equipment.

Minimum Requirements:

  • Previous Experience in Maintenance is Required/Preferred
  • Experience working with food processing equipment
  • Comfortable working in a cool environment and around the smell of meat
  • Positive Attitude
  • Comfortable being available/flexible for changing shift times (AM and AFTERNOON)

Perks of the Job? We Have Plenty!

In addition to our entrepreneurial environment with a collaborative, flat organization, we offer:

  • Employee Events
  • On-Site Parking
  • Paid Time Off
  • Comprehensive Benefits
  • Competitive Salary 
  • Incremental Increases
  • Signing Bonus
  • Ability for Overtime
  • And Many More!

Affirmative Action Statement:

As part of Sierra Supply Chain Services commitment to equal employment opportunities, all forms of diversity are celebrated! Sierra encourages all women, people of colour, sexual and gender minorities and other minoritized identities to apply to our company! We would like to thank all those who apply in advance as only qualified applicants will be contacted.
