title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Inland Group

Maintenance Technician

YYC â€“ Calgary International Airport

The members of the Inland Group of Companies (IDS, Inland Technologies and Quantem Aviation Services) are highly experienced in aircraft de-icing, environmental management, aircraft fuelling, ground handling and pretty much any other aviation support service you can think of. We operate at over 50 airports in four countries. Through our brands we collectively de-ice/anti-ice more than 40,000 aircraft, collect and process more than 40,000,000 litres of glycol impacted stormwater, and handle more than 52,000,000 kilograms of material each year.

Our business is built on a foundation of excellence in customer service, innovation and continuous improvement and safety is at the forefront of everything we do.  We provide a workplace where respect, integrity and a high degree of ethical behaviour is a minimum expectation.  To learn more about our organization, please visit our website at:  www.inlandgroup.ca

 

We are currently providing an opportunity for a well-rounded, detail oriented, and focused professional to join our team in the position of Maintenance Technician to oversee the safe and cost-effective maintenance and repair of our equipment at our YYC Calgary International Airport station.  In addition, this position will require all of the responsibilities of a Processing Operator (which will be to perform facility services on a case-by-case basis) and to ensure all other Processing Operators are in compliance with Inlandâ€™s policy of superior service and customer satisfaction.

 

About the Position:

The essential duties and responsibilities of this position include:

  • Promoting and adhering to our safety and respectful workplace culture and instilling this culture while ensuring safety and regulatory compliance with all provincial and federal rules and regulations;
  • Perform routine maintenance and repairs engines, motors, pneumatic tools, pumps and production machines; following diagrams, sketches, operations manuals, manufacturerâ€™s instructions, and engineering specifications; troubleshooting malfunctions;
  • Set up parts supply relationships and accounts with equipment manufacturers;
  • Maintain an inventory of all spare replacement parts and ensure that sufficient supplies are kept on hand at all times to minimize unnecessary equipment downtime;
  • Make daily rounds of the facility to look, hear and touch all running equipment for any signs of abnormal conditions, reporting any negative findings to supervisors and coordinate the necessary corrections;
  • Ensure that all required minor repairs are completed when necessary and all major repairs get reported to Facility Supervisor and Operations Manager;
  • Oversee facility Preventative Maintenance Program (PMS) for all recycling equipment, as well as recurrent training on Health & Safety issues;
  • Prepare a weekly report of equipment status, upcoming PMS to schedule, and any inventory purchase requests;
  • Communicate daily with team members to ensure that all are informed about equipment status and expected outcome from the next shift on maintenance items that are outstanding;
  • Maintain historical maintenance records of all equipment at the facility to include but not limited to, maintenance logs, trend analysis, lockout & tag out program, hazardous material storage, and any other forms or records deemed necessary;
  • Work cooperatively and supervise any sub-contractors duties;
  • Develop and maintain a strong relationship with DIA staff and Inland customers;
  • Perform/complete other additional projects, duties, and assignments as required and/or by management request.

 

Qualifications:

Interested candidates will have demonstrated expertise in the following required skills and experience:

  • Minimum of 1-year previous experience performing general mechanical repairs;
  • Valid Driverâ€™s License and driving record that meets Company insurance standards;
  • Certified Journeyman Heavy Duty Technician or registered apprentice considered an asset;
  • Fifth Class Power Engineer considered an asset;
  • Valid Restricted Area Identity Card (RAIC) and Airside Vehicle Operatorâ€™s Permit (AVOP) considered an asset;
  • Must possess basic hand tools common to the trade up to 1/2" drive;
  • Availability to on-call anytime scheduled (day or night) for emergency repairs of equipment;
  • Working knowledge of manuals, schematics, diagnostic tools, fluid types, diesel-powered machines, and tools including their designs, uses repair and maintenance;
  • Must possess basic welding and fabrication skills;
  • Ability to read, write, speak and communicate effectively;
  • Basic computer skills with working knowledge of Microsoft programs;
  • Proven success delivering results in a fast-paced, multi-deadline, high-stress environment;
  • Willing to learn new skills and adapt to change in order to support the growth of the company and meet needs of customers.

 

In this job, you can expect to â€œget your hands dirtyâ€ when you are supporting your team. Other physical demands include but are not limited to:

  • Ability to lift, push, and pull objects up to fifty (50) pounds occasionally and twenty (20) pounds regularly;
  • Must have the ability to climb 15-foot heights for work;
  • Position involves standing or sitting for extended periods of time as well as bending, kneeling, lifting, climbing, using hands to control tools and feel objects, reaching with hands and arms;
  • Must be comfortable working outside in all types of weather conditions (SNOW, RAIN, WIND, and whatever else Mother Nature deems necessary) when necessary;
  • Ability to work in a confined space for extended periods of time; 
  • Wearing of personal protective equipment when required and full mobility allowing for freedom of movement in high-risk environment;
  • Must be able to speak clearly and fluently in English and head efficiently;
  • Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus;
  • May be required to move, connect, disconnect hoses and be able to operate industrial valves and perform general labor duties.

 

About Inland: 

At Inland, we offer the following benefits, some of which are subject to eligibility requirements:

  • A rewarding and safe work environment (company provided PPE);
  • On the job training, mentoring and coaching;
  • Growth and advancement opportunities for high potential employees;
  • Employee and family assistance program;
  • Competitive compensation and benefits package;
  • Pension plan with employer contribution;
  • Access to group rates and discounts.

 

If you are a self-starter who is committed to providing the highest level of customer satisfaction and your experience and ability meet with the above minimum requirements, please forward your cover letter and resume to the Inland HR Team, quoting posting number 22-19.  Full job description available upon request. 

 

Please apply online.

 

Inland is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

Please note:  All employees working in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 unless provided by Inland with an approved accommodation under Canada's Human Rights Act.

title: Seasonal Facility Maintenance Technician II
description:
Company Description

WHO ARE WE?
We've been serving Canadian clients for over 75 years. The companies that began independently and now form Dexterra Group have an outstanding record of supporting the infrastructure and built assets that play a vital role in our society and helping our clients achieve higher performance and productivity. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together – offering both experience and regional expertise so companies can operate their day to day, confidently and successfully.

Job Description

WHAT’S THE JOB?
At Dexterra, we create exceptional customer experiences that make our clients shine. Powered by passionate people, we bring the right teams with the right skills together to turn problems into solutions and challenges into moments of ingenuity.

As a Facility Maintenance Technician II, reporting to Operations Manager, you will conduct general building maintenance for a site in London, ON. This position will also respond to reactive maintenance calls. This opportunity is great for summer students who are looking to get into the field with a possibility of extenstion in the Fall.

 

Conditions of employment is Fully vaccinated and Reliability Screening Clearance must be meet 

Your work will include:

Responsibilities:

  • Sweeping and mopping floors, as well as vacuuming carpets
  • Daily cleaning and sanitizing of all bathroom facilities, locker rooms, including toilets, sinks, showers, and mirrors along with replacing soaps, toilet tissue, sanitary napkins and paper towels
  • Dusting of work areas, woodwork, furniture, and other equipment
  • Empties waste baskets, garbage bins, recyclable bins and transports garbage, recycle refuse, from drop points to designated garbage bins or compactor
  • Cleans walls, partitions, light switches, doors, and window sills
  • Cleans and polishes chrome and other polished metal surfaces Dusts baseboards and low air vests
  • Damp mops all hardwood floor surfaces
  • Cleans exercise equipment, disinfects and sanitizes
  • Ensures that all cleaning equipment is kept clean, well maintained and properly stored, and janitor’s closet is organized and stocked
  • Maintain a professional courteous manner and communication with client, employees, vendors, contractors and fellow employees.
  • Maintains tools and materials for the work site.
  • Performs other related duties as required and as assigned by Contract Representatives.
  • This role is part of an Integrated Facilities Management Solution that provides a diverse portfolio of services to our client
  •  Landscaping , cutting grass , weed wrecker, use of snow blower

WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Security - in a time when other companies are downsizing, we are growing
  • Very competitive compensation package
  • Advancement opportunities
  • Be #1 on day 1 by joining an industry leader

Follow Dexterra on LinkedIn and Facebook. 

Qualifications

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Working knowledge of building cleaning practices, supplies and equipment and the ability to use them economically and efficiently
  • Ability to make minor plumbing, electrical, carpentry, and mechanical repair, and perform a variety of general routine maintenance tasks
  •  Ability to prioritize and manage multi-functional tasks.
  • Ability to work effectively under pressure and against strict time constraints.
  • Must be able to effectively communicate (oral and written) with all employees, contractors and vendors.
  • Self-starter and team player.
  • Maintain a calm demeanor in emergency situations.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Understand and follow oral and written instructions.

Knowledge and Applied Skills:

  • Must have a valid driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract
  • Minimum of 2-3 years of previous cleaning experience in a similar position
  • Ability to read, write and speak English fluently
  • Provides verbal and written communication as requested.
  • Completes assigned tasks in a professional and workmanlike manner.
  • Adheres to the occupational health and safety acts and other legislative enactment.
  • Represent the department with a positive and professional attitude.
  • Maintain an industry level standard productivity level
  • Ability to acquire and maintain Security clearance at the Reliability Status level

Working Conditions:

  • Ability to walk, bend, stoop, balance crawl and reach for extended periods of time.
  • Must be able to lift up to 50lbs.
  •  Must be comfortable and able to work on a ladder. Working at Heights.
  • Job will require inside and outside working. Cold and Heat.
  •  Must be able to work independently without direct supervision.
  •  Regular hours of operation 7.30 am to 4.00pm Monday to Friday    
  •  Hand tools, and equipment will be supplied

 



Additional Information

Dexterra Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans’ status, Indigenous status, or any other legally protected factors. Disability-related accommodations during the hiring selection process are available upon request.

title: Maintenance Technician II
description:
About the client:
Our client is a licensed producer of pharmaceutical products. It has been around for over 8 years and has over 700 employees and growing.


Position type:
Permanent, Full-Time, Onsite, Bradford

What is your role:

  1. Respond to production issues in a timely manner and make quick decisions
  2. Be responsible for repairing, maintaining, and performing preventative maintenance on all types of equipment
  3. Keep all equipment in good working condition consistent with current SOP’s
  4. Inspect and test machinery and equipment
  5. Safely operate all required equipment and tools including standard shop safety processes
  6. Make parts to support equipment repair and improvements
  7. Utilize blueprints, sketches, descriptions, experience and support from Engineering and other sources of technical support to accomplish tasks.
  8. Utilize precision measuring tools to verify parts, components and details are dimensionally correct.
  9. Work independently to service various internal customers.

Requirements

What qualifies you:
  1. A High school diploma/GED with a Machine Tool Technology Associates Degree, or completion of Millwright/Mechanic Apprenticeship program or equivalent experience
  2. Experience with/in pressure systems, small, automated packaging equipment, the food or pharmaceutical industry
  3. Experience with all standard Millwright/Mechanical equipment
  4. Must possess welding experience and/or appropriate
  5. Experience with piping systems including Swagelok, Parker A-Lok
  6. Thorough Pneumatic systems knowledge

Benefits

Why work for our client?

  • Pay scale: $60000 - $76000 annually ($39/hr. forTicketed and $31/hr. for Non-Ticketed)
  • Competitive Afternoon Premium
  • Fast-paced environment with a great team
  • Extended Health Benefits
  • Annual Personal/Health Spending account
  • Annual Medical Cannabis Coverage
  • Safety Boot Allowance
  • Group RRSP and DPSP Plan
  • Annual Performance Bonus
  • Professional Developmental Opportunities
  • Paid Training and Education programs

Flexibility: You will enjoy a flexible work environment that is the perfect blend of work and fun! With flexible working hours to compressed work weeks to paid sick and vacation time, you will be empowered to achieve work-life balance.
 
Total rewards: The Company will motivate you to go above and beyond with a competitive salary or hourly wage (with shift premiums), stock options, an RRSP program, annual bonuses, and a health and personal care spending account for you to use for gym memberships, ski passes or staycations.
 
Benefits: The Company will foster your health and wellness (and your dependents) with the employee benefits package including - employer-paid health and dentalcare premiums, life insurance and LTD policies and a medical cannabis coverage program, designed exclusively for our A-Team, that will provide you with $3,000 of coverage each year (because we truly believe cannabis is the best medicine). 
 
Life-long learning: The Company is lifelong learners and will invest in your professional development throughout all aspects of your career! You will have access to a tuition assistance program, virtual learning activities and annual performance reviews, to ensure you are provided with the toolkit and support you need to succeed.
 
Perks: The Company loves to celebrate their people by providing corporate perks including employee discounts, perkopolis memberships, company SWAG, paid volunteer time, modern technology and snacks and beverages at all their office locations.

 
Team: The Company is a diverse and global team of cannabis enthusiasts, energetic innovators, fitness gurus, caring parents, foodies and more, with a collective passion to nurture an inclusive environment that helps you grow and provide people better days with medical cannabis.




What qualifies you: A High school diploma/GED with a Machine Tool Technology Associates Degree, or completion of Millwright/Mechanic Apprenticeship program or equivalent experience Experience with/in pressure systems, small, automated packaging equipment, the food or pharmaceutical industry Experience with all standard Millwright/Mechanical equipment Must possess welding experience and/or appropriate Experience with piping systems including Swagelok, Parker A-Lok Thorough Pneumatic systems knowledge

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Plasman

One Company, One Driving Force

We believe that what separates the impossible from the possible is perspective. Together we have the solution. More important than where you are going, is who you get there with. We are innovative and collaborative, time-honored and future-focused, and above all we are dedicated to our work, our customers, and each other. From design to delivery, across the globe, we make shared visions a reality. And together, we will accomplish more than ever imagined. We are Plasman, and we are One Driving Force.

At Plasman, you will work with the world's best and brightest to shape the future of our global company. Our employees come from rich and diverse backgrounds working collectively together for the success of one company. With over 4000 employees across 24 locations we believe the most impressive thing we've built is our workforce.

We are presently looking for a new member to join our W3M team as:

MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN

Our ideal candidate is a self-motivated team player with good communication skills and would be responsible for, but not limited to, the following:

Proactively complete maintenance work to include electrical, pneumatic, hydraulic and general repair and maintenance of all equipment to maintain quality and production levels

  • Perform preventative maintenance of equipment within manufacturers specifications
  • Maintain the building by repairing as required
  • Fabricating or building items as requested by the Maintenance Supervisor
  • Maintain CMMS software and update assigned work orders
  • Promote an atmosphere of team work at all time
  • Recommend and participate in Continuous Improvement activities.
  • Maintain a clean and safe work environment.
  • Work in compliance with the Quality and Business Operating Systems and all health and safety and environmental legislation.
  • Completion of any other duties as assigned.
  • Abide by Company Value Statement and the Company Standard Code of Conduct Trouble shooting of equipment and maximizing production time
  • Trouble shooting and teaching robotic applications

MINIMUM EDUCATION AND/OR DESIGNATION REQUIREMENTS:

Must possess a secondary school diploma or equivalent, with preference given to those who have completed Maintenance diploma/certificate and/or hold a ticket in industrial maintenance.

  • Preference will be given to those candidates who have education in the areas of electrical, PLC, mechanical and pneumatic and hydraulic systems.
  • The successful candidate must also achieve the Company determined pass on an internal Technical Test.

MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must have at least three years' experience in maintenance, with preference given to those who have knowledge and experience in the areas of PLC, electrical, mechanical , pneumatic and hydraulic systems.
  • Able to pass the forklift, fall arrest and boom training provided by the company.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must be able to work in a fast paced environment, have reliable transportation, willing and able to work all three shifts (Days, Afternoons, Midnights)

COMPETITIVE WAGE RATE

title: Millwright
description:
itec group is recruiting  for a number of licensed  Millwrights in theHalton region.

Responsibilities include:
  • Troubleshoot and perform preventative maintenance on all  industrial machinery
  • Work closely with  electricians, and automation technicians on the floor
  • Welding and machining experience is an asset

What you bring to the table:
  • Valid 433A Industrial Mechanic License or 4th year apprentice 
  • Knowledge of automated machinery and preventative maintenance procedures
  • Ability to troubleshoot hydraulics/pneumatics and response to equipment breakdown

 

Location:  Halton, ON

Position Type:  Permanent

Shift:  3 shift rotation

Please contact steve@itecgroup.ca  to apply

itec group Inc. emphasizes the importance of building effective relationships between candidates and industry-leading companies. We recruit for the IT, engineering/advanced manufacturing and construction industries. We offer individuals looking for contract or full-time positions desirable career opportunities. Our committed team who are leaders within the recruitment industry have built a foundation of solid working relationships based on quality service, integrity and respect. itec group Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. By applying for this position you are consenting to receive electronic messages related to the consideration of employment through itec group and its clients.

title: Tool Repair Technician
description:
Samuel, Son & Co. is growing! If you're looking for a rewarding career opportunity with a family run, industry leading organization, bring your experience and motivated attitude to Samuel, Son & Co. Due to our continued success, we are seeking a Tool Repair Technician to join one of our team in Vaughan, ON. 

Here are some of what we have to offer: 

  • Competitive compensation 
  • Paid vacation and an annual bonus 
  • Health, dental and vision insurance 
  • Pension plan with company match 
  • Opportunity for career growth and stability   

RESPONSIBILITIES :

  • Adherence to the Safety related aspects of the position and area working within.
  • Have a strong electrical troubleshooting skill level.
  • Have a strong mechanical troubleshooting skill level.
  • Be able to travel at times within the local market to provide customer technical support.
  • Apply sound mechanical and electrical diagnosis of tools, heads, and equipment.
  • Work closely with other team members to Improve and grow our Tool and Head repair operations.
  • To have good Communication and Teamwork skills.
  • To be able to provide consistent and high quality of workmanship.
  • High Level adherence to work hours and be flexible to work overtime when asked to do so.
  • The ability to provide support for all equipment trained on as assigned by Management.
  • Other related duties and responsibilities as required or assigned.

EQUIPMENT KNOWLEDGE:

  • Ability to use a laptop, smartphone and other devices normally used in conducting business via remote access in various geographic settings
  • Ability to retain knowledge on trained upon equipment.    

ROLE REQUIREMENTS:

  • 3+ Years’ experience in a manufacturing, service, or other technical environment.
  • Ability to work unsupervised
  • Excellent interpersonal and verbal communication skills.
  • The ability to operate standard shop and warehouse equipment and to assist others in the training to do so.
  • Proficiency in Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint.
  • Dependable work history.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

  • The physical ability to evaluate operational needs and concerns related to industrial packaging equipment and Parts.
  • The ability to work in high stress and challenging situations.
  • The ability to safely work within a production environment.
  • Must be able to safely visit and evaluate a production environment which may include:
  • Hot and cold temperatures, climbing stairs, wearing required PPE, following local safety protocols, standing, walking. stooping for extended periods of time.
  • The ability to lift 50lbs.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

  • Environment can fluctuate between extreme cold and extreme hot conditions.  Must be able to withstand either. 
  • Must be able to work safely around automated equipment with little to no supervision while following all company and customer safety policies.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Weâ€™re growing!! And looking for a detail-oriented and enthusiastic candidate to join our team for the position of Maintenance Technician located in Kingston, Ontario. This is an ideal FULL-TIME opportunity for someone who is mechanically inclined and loves a challenge! 

Duties include:

  • Maintaining the physical integrity of the building through general maintenance and up-keep of the assigned properties.
  • Cleaning and repairing items in vacant and occupied units (minor plumbing, electrical, carpentry, etc).
  • Completing physically demanding work which includes the use of ladders, power tools and occasionally lifting up to 50 pounds.
  • Applying knowledge of building HVAC, plumbing, electrical, DDC BAS systems and life safety systems. 

Qualifications:

  • Proven relevant mechanical/electrical aptitude and trouble-shooting skills.
  • General understanding of basic plumbing, electrical and carpentry.
  • Ability to troubleshoot and problem solve effectively. 
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills required.
  • Ability to multi-task and remain detail oriented.
  • Ability to work independently as well as with a team.
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs.
  • Ability to bend, push and pull as well as go up and down stairs.
  • PC skills are an asset (Word, Excel, e-mail/web).

Education & Experience:

  • High School Diploma and 1 years work related experience.
  • Previous experience in residential maintenance or related field.
  • Previous experience renting apartments and assisting tenants an asset.
  • Knowledge of applicable legislation respecting residential tenancies in Ontario and the rights and obligations of Landlords and Tenants an asset. 

Why you want to work here:

  • Providing great customer service is something you thrive on.
  • You get a thrill from staying organized and details are your â€œthingâ€.
  • Being part of a great team has been your dream.
  • Working for a growing company that supports environmental stewardship and social responsibilities is a must for you.
  • You are a jack-of-all-trades and love working with your hands!

*Please note that all Skyline buildings, apartment units, and premises are smoke free, with the exception of a designated outdoor smoking area*

How to Apply:
Online: www.skylineonline.ca/careers
Fax: 519 341 0178

The Skyline Group of Companies is comprised of four primary entities to oversee its real estate investment, development, asset management and property management interests. The Skyline Group prides itself on its continuous ability to achieve its objective of owning and managing viable, reputable and accretive commercial and multi-residential real estate. We offer our employees competitive pay, benefits, paid volunteer day, on-going training, growth potential and so much more. Our workplace culture empowers staff at all levels of Skyline to become involved in supporting and building vibrant communities.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Join the Westcorp Team!:

Position Summary:

 

Westcorp is seeking a capable Maintenance Technician for the Windsor Park Plaza/Lofts and Galen Lofts properties. The successful candidate is a front-line professional, providing excellent maintenance and customer service to the residents. This position may require some extra hours from time to time, particularly at month-end, so the ability to work some weekends is required.    

 

Working in property management is not just a job. It is a career dedicated to bettering people's lives. As property management specialists, we have the critical responsibility of being the caretaker of people's homes. This is an opportunity to build lasting relationships and create community. Do you possess great trouble-shooting and maintenance repair abilities? If so, we are looking for you, and we would love to talk to you.  

 

Who You Are & What You Bring:

  • You possess excellent maintenance repair abilities in plumbing, basic electrical, and other general maintenance areas of expertise.  
  • You have your own tools  
  • You enjoy working in a team environment  
  • You have a great customer service philosophy  
  • You are a strong communicator with proven conflict resolution skills  
  • You are an agile high-performer who can collaborate effectively and hustle independently  
  • Primary Key Responsiblities:
  • Perform general maintenance in the assets assigned, including heating repairs, sink backups or drain problems, faucet repairs, door repairs, caulking, etc.  
  • Perform predictive and preventative maintenance and regular building checks as required.  
  • Check and replace lights throughout the complex.  
  • Change locks and cut keys.  
  • Perform maintenance as required for suite turnover.  
  • Track inventory of parts, supplies and small tools.  
  • Assist in snow removal for the complex when required (in heavy snowfall situations).  
  • Participate in regular rotational on-call services.  
  • Assist personnel from other Westcorp departments as required.  
  • Execute all work in a safe, professional manner in compliance with Occupational Health and Safety Legislation.  
  • Ensure compliance with the Residential Tenancies Act in all procedures.  
  • Ensure local, provincial, & federal laws and regulations are observed in the community.  
  • Ensure comprehension and compliance with all Westcorp Playbook policies.        
  • Positively embrace Westcorp Corporate Values.  
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the Maintenance Manager.  

Required Skills & Abilities:

  • High School Graduate; Post Secondary Education an asset    
  • Minimum three years relevant maintenance experience required  
  • Extensive knowledge of plumbing is required, and preference will be given to candidates with strong maintenance knowledge in other areas such as electrical, carpentry and appliance repairs  
  • Must be proficient in the use of technology as we are working towards 100% paperless processes  
  • Must have the flexibility to change roles/tasks as required and be available to work the hours that can be irregular as required for the business needs, and must participate in the on-call rotation  
  • A high level of customer service-ability is a must as Westcorp is a highly service-oriented organization  
  • A high degree of professionalism and dedication  
  • Strong interpersonal skills    
  • Strong written and verbal communication ability in English  
  • Must be physically fit with the ability to lift, carry or move heavy items  
  • Safety conscience and safety-oriented attitude    
  • Highly organized, results-oriented and with the ability to work in a multi-functional team environment  
  • Must have own tools and safety footwear  
  • Must have valid driver's license and own vehicle  
  • Security clearance required upon offer of employment  
  • Only candidates who have received two doses of their COVID-19 vaccines will be considered for this opportunity  

Working at Westcorp:

 

Headquartered in Edmonton, Westcorp Property Management Inc. is a vertically integrated company that creates, invests in, and manages residential, commercial, and hotel properties. Westcorp operates in Edmonton, Calgary, Kelowna, Bonnyville, and Michigan in the United States, and they are committed to significant growth in the coming years. Based on its existing development land holdings, Westcorp confidently expects to double the size of its portfolio in the next 5-7 years.  

â€¯  

Westcorp is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status.  

â€¯  

Westcorp employs 200 people with decades of combined, extensive and successful experience. We provide our employees with a work environment that promotes professional and personal development.  

â€¯  

Our approach to employee attraction and retention is straightforward: We want the best of the best. To attract the 'best of class' and the best new entrants to the real estate field, Westcorp provides:  

  • Competitive wages
  • Comprehensive benefits package including a Health Spending Account
  • Employee assistance program
  • Career plan
  • Recognition programs
  • Professional development learning
  • An exceptional work environment
  • A mentoring culture

title: IS Technician
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

GHD is seeking an IS Technician to join to join our Waterloo, ON office.

The successful candidate will have the following responsibilities:

  • Be an active member of a supportive and customer service oriented team
  • Provide technical support for Server, Workstations and Helpdesk
  • Accurately log all client requests in the Service Desk ticketing system
  • Diagnose and resolve client issues related to hardware, printers, software etc. including upgrades in a timely manner
  • Escalation and communication of incidents to other relevant internal IS
  • Maintenance of network & non-network computers
  • Follow standard Service Desk procedures, IS Security, administration, access controls etc.
  • Installation & control of approved software applications being used by the company
  • Ensure that all issues logged are tagged, tracked and resolved at the earliest to minimize downtime
  • Perform asset management activities, both hardware and software in accordance with GHD policies and procedures.
  • Take ownership for own workload, coordinating and monitoring specific tasks.
  • Patient attitude and ability to communicate with users of varying expertise and seniority
  • Highly organized and able to deliver outcomes through determining priorities

Skills, Competencies and Qualifications:

  • Requires a post-secondary education in IT-related training, and minimum 2 years of experience.

Requires a solid understanding of:

  • Windows 10 desktop environment and networking in a global corporate environment
  • Active Directory, Hypervisors, Microsoft 365 and Azure is desirable.
  • Ticketing systems; service desk escalations;
  • PC Imaging and new hire training
  • Mobile device configuration; Microsoft Desktop products
  • Network cabling, TCP/IP networks and server infrastructure will also be a requirement of this position.
  • Excellent Time Management and Organization Skills
  • Excellent Written and verbal communication abilities
  • Positive attitude along with solid communications skills
  • Valid driver's license

This position is not remote and the successful candidate will be required to work from the office.

As a diverse and inclusive organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, GHD will provide reasonable accommodation for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

description:

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES

 

Stratosphere Quality is currently hiring for production associates in the Alliston area.Currently seeking to fill slots for both days and afternoon shifts.Shift requirements   are

06:30 AM-03:00 PM  Afternoon:03:30 PM -11: 30PM  Monday to Friday with occasional Saturdays

  • Drive tugger machines in moving heavier parts
  • Ensuring proper and safe use of pump truck

  • Assisting with other duties as needed

 

Shift Options:

 

  •

Job requirements :

  • Ability to lift, push or pull up to (50) pounds  
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Flexible and adaptable
  • Positive attitude and self-motivated
  • Ability to work under pressure and on given timelines
  • Must be punctual and reliable

title: Handyperson – Building Maintenance Associate (88201042)
description:
Company Description

Looking for a change, an opportunity to show your exceptional skills, a chance to help lead and build a team? Grow your career with a company that shares your passion!

Contributing to The Well-Being and Quality of Our Consumers

The well-being of our consumers is at the heart of Sodexo's approach, customer engagement is integral in the services provided by Sodexo employees in various locations across Canada. We work closely with our consumers and clients to create an interactive and personalized environment for the well-being of everyone we serve.

Sodexo is proud to announce these nominations:  2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employer; 2021 Canada’s Greenest Employers; 2020 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index featured company; 2020 Parity Certification - Platinum level and Progressive Aboriginal Relations (PAR) Program company – Gold Level.

What We Can Offer You

Sodexo offers you a flexible and dynamic work environment, competitive compensation, access to ongoing training and development programs, and countless opportunities to grow within the company.

Job Description

Sodexo is growing! We are looking for a Handyperson – Building Maintenance Associate to join our dynamic team. This position is a part-time role  You will be offered is a great team environment, work/life balance and the ability to ensure customer satisfaction.

Rate: $24/hour

Monday to Friday

Timing: 12pm - 4pm (20 hours a week) ~ negotiable to change to match candiadate availability

Accountabilities:

As a member of our team, you will contribute to providing excellent customer service:

·         Carryout light maintenance service including plumbing, carpentry, painting and plastering (if required, under supervision or in collaboration with a qualified journeyman/trades maintenance personnel)

·         Performs tasks such as but not limited to changing light bulbs, installing paper dispenser units, changing filters, changing locks on doors, minor decorative maintenance and other tasks not requiring a licensed skilled trades person or journeyman

·         Identifies and corrects unsafe working conditions with management oversight

·         May be required to assist with special events

·         Assists skilled trade workers and subcontractors/vendors

·         Perform cleaning including perimeter litter pick-up and occasional non-routine cleaning tasks

·         Perform move services as required

·         Assist in snow removal and de-icing of walkways when needed

·         Maintenance of internal plants

·         Ensure availability of materials by checking stock levels of parts and components; prepare requisitions as required

·         Complies with all company safety and risk management policies and procedures

·         Performs all work in accordance with municipal/provincial/federal regulatory requirements

·         Use of CMMS (work order system) or equivalent systems to schedule and/or document work orders both on Reactive and Preventive maintenance activities - training will be provided

·         Work with hand tools, power tools and have the ability to perform labor-intensive duties including lifting up to 50 lbs safely, and the ability to climb stairs/ladders as part of daily activities

·         May perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned

·         Participates in regular safety meetings, safety training and hazard assessments

Qualifications

You are a dynamic and reliable person with good communication and interpersonal skills. You are committed to quality assurance and safety.

You must have a high school diploma, GED or equivalent experience. Minimum of one-year related experience. Bilingualism is an asset and you must have the ability to occasionally lift up to 50 pounds.

What's Next?

If you're looking for a role where you can truly impact the lives of others, click "I'm interested" for a quick 5-minute online application.



Additional Information

Sodexo is committed to Employment Equity and Diversity. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of national origin, race, religion, ethnicity, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other federal, provincial, or local protected class.

We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates who participate in all aspects of the selection process. 

Thank you for your interest in Sodexo.

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.

Follow us on social media to see first-hand what we are all about!  

Instagram: @SodexoCanadaCareers

Twitter: @SodexoJobsCA

LinkedIn: Sodexo Canada Careers

Facebook: Sodexo CA Jobs

title: Technicien de maintenance f/h (Lyon)
description:
Technicien de Maintenance Automates Bancaires & Retail et Telco f/h (CDI)




NCR est un groupe international américain présent dans 160 pays et spécialisé dans la gestion des transactions financières dans les domaines de la finance, du retail et de l’ hospitality .




A ce titre, NCR développe des solutions logiciels et matériels tels que des distributeurs automatiques de billets ou des bornes de commandes tactiles.










Votre Fonction




Rattaché à un Territory Manager - véritable Manager de Proximité - vous intégrez une équipe d’une trentaine de Techniciens de Maintenance. (170 techniciens sur le plan national )




Après un parcours d’intégration, vous assurez des installations et/ou de la maintenance d’automates pour nos Clients Bancaires & Retail , ainsi que des interventions Telco . Dans le cadre de vos déplacements professionnels une voiture de service, une carte carburant et un téléphone portable sont mis à votre disposition. 




Interventions dans le cadre de l’offre « Maintien en Condition Opérationnelle » :

+ Diagnostics

+ Opérations de maintenance curative, réglages, contrôles et inspections  

+ Réparations par échanges standards ou par remplacement de petites pièces, de modules simples et accessibles       

+ Opérations de maintenance préventive (avec ou sans accompagnement)










Interventions dans le cadre d’installation ou de mise à jour logiciel & matériel » :

+ Installations ou mises à jour et upgrades

+ Installations et désinstallations dans le cadre des interventions FLM ( Telco / Retail )             

+ Rechargements « Logiciel » dans le cadre de migrations










Gestion administrative : 

+ Clôture des appels en temps réel

+ Suivi administratif (rapports d’intervention facturables et compte-rendu d’installation)












Les déplacements se font à la journée au sein de la région Auvergne-Rh ô ne-Alpes , et principalement dans le département des Rhône.




Ce poste comprend une astreinte (7j/7, 24h/24) d’une semaine par mois environ.




Lors de votre intégration puis lors de votre parcours au sein de l’entreprise, vous bénéficierez de formations et certifications afin de développer vos compétences et vous permettre d’évoluer.









Votre Profil




Issus d’une formation technique de niveau Bac+2, vous possédez une première expérience professionnelle et avez acquis des compétences en mécanique et en électricité/électronique .




Vous êtes à l’aise avec l’informatiq u e et les notions de réseaux.




Votre niveau d’anglais vous permet d’échanger sur des sujets techniques par téléphone et mail.




Autonome, dynamique rigoureux vous êtes reconnus pour votre sens de la communication et du service.









Pour en savoir plus 




Nous sommes NCR (https://www.ncr.com/) . Nous offrons des expériences incroyables qui facilitent la vie.




Nous changeons votre façon de faire de la banque, d’acheter, de manger et de voyager, ce qui permet près de 700 millions de transactions par jour.




Comment pouvons-nous tout faire ? Avec des gens iNCRedibles comme vous.




Une carrière ici signifie embrasser notre culture et nos valeurs partagées, (https://www.ncr.com/careers/life-at-ncr) toujours à la recherche de nouvelles aventures, et trouver votre propre chemin.




Nous sommes là depuis plus de 130 ans (https://www.ncr.com/company) et ce n’est qu’un début. Joignez-vous à nous pour construire l’avenir des expériences omnicanales, et ENJOY !

title: Maintenance Administrator
description:
About Kerry


A career with Kerry Taste & Nutrition offers you an opportunity to shape how people across the globe view food and beverage while providing you opportunities to explore and grow as your interests do. With our commitment to a sustainable future, a career with Kerry is something you can feel good about.




About the role



The maintenance Administrator is responsible for ordering, tracking, and inventorying all maintenance materials and parts as required to keep production facilities operable.





Key responsibilities




+ Ensure fellow employees, contractors and visitors are following all applicable quality and food safety procedures and policies.


+ Assures that work requested is needed. If need is questioned and not readily resolved with production or requesting personnel, refers the work order to the maintenance Manager.


+ Verifies the availability of parts, materials and special tools required for planned and estimated jobs prior to scheduling its execution.


+ Reviews and screens each work order to see that it has been properly filled out.


+ Creates weekly work schedule for all maintenance technicians.


+ Cycle-count the maintenance inventory semi-annually. Maintain the proper parts location in the stock room.


+ Perform monthly GMP Plant inspections and chemical inventory checks


+ Ensure all maintenance related works align with corporate engineering standards including sanitary design, ergonomics, employee safety and food safety requirements.


+ Maintain workorder and control documents for internal and external audits in SAP.


+ Identifies and obtains (Requisitions/POs, orders, kits as appropriate and in keeping with procedures) determinable materials, entering material needs on the work order. Determines if critical items are in stock by verifying availability with stores.


+ VMI (vendor managed inventory) liaison and administrator.


+ Obtains blueprints, drawings, instructional manuals and special procedures, as needed, from files or other source.






Qualifications and skills




+ Food Industry experience


+ SAP knowledge mandatory


+ 3+ years in Manufacturing and/or Maintenance experience, supervisor experience an asset


+ High school diploma, Engineering degree or technical school training preferred.


+ Able to read blueprints and shop drawings.


+ Good understanding of mechanical and electrical systems.


+ Good oral & written communication skills, possess tact, and the ability to negotiate maintenance needs in balance with other departmental requirements.

title: Maintenance Technician, Full-time
description:
Full-time| 30-40 hours per week| Benefited

Do you love problem solving and fixing things? Feel the positive impact your technical abilities and well-crafted care makes in the lives of senior residents every day?

At PARC, we are a leader in independent senior living and are driven to create an active, vibrant lifestyle for our residents. PARC is an exceptional workplace with opportunities, challenges and rewards to inspire employees to do their best daily.

Weâ€™re looking for an ambitious Maintenance Technician to join our Cedar Springs PARC in North Vancouver.

What can you expect when you join our customer-service-oriented team?

Youâ€™ll work in a state-of-the-art building where you can practice your well-honed skills, meet enticing challenges that help move PARC and your career ahead and youâ€™ll develop meaningful relationships with our residents and their families. Watch the video and see what our employees have to say.

About the  Maintenance Technician Job

  • Work closely with the Building Services Manager to ensure a clean and safe environment for our residents.
  • Refurbish suites - including minor drywall, painting, plumbing and electrical repairs, carpet shampooing;
  • Responding to resident requests and troubleshooting building problems are all part of the day-to-day.
  • Supporting the different departments by assisting with garbage removal, industrial cleaning and event set ups. Everyday will be different and bring a new challenge

About You

  • Youâ€™re creative when you fix things, you can make a whole lot of something out of nothing but always prioritize safety.
  • You will bring experience using hand tools, performing basic electric, plumbing, carpentry and painting tasks. Any knowledge of mechanical systems and formal trade training or a Building Service Worker Certificate is a plus.
  • Having experience using Microsoft Outlook, Excel and Building Maintenance Software is important too.
  • Youâ€™ll enjoy the self directedness of this role and rise to the challenge of managing multiple urgent tasks, responding to emergencies and meeting deadlines.
  • Youâ€™re also not afraid to ask when you do not know the answer. Your excellent English communication skills will come in handy when asking questions or reporting incidents to management.
  • You understand and respect the needs of seniors, their families and the professionals engaged in their care.

The Perks of Joining PARC

  • Receive competitive compensation and benefits
  • Training and development opportunities to enhance your skills, grow and advance professionally with PARC
  • Employee recognition when its due and annually, to celebrate your commitment and reward your tenure with us
  • Pride in serving higher purpose and see first-hand impact of your efforts on the lives of our residents

title: Junior Maintenance Mechanic
description:
Naylor Building Partnerships Inc. is an award winning, Canadian owned and run multi-trade mechanical, electrical, plumbing and compressed air contractor. We have been providing quality service, maintenance, repairs and installations to the commercial and industrial sector for over 50 years. Our commitment to hiring the best people allows us to provide strong technical expertise and knowledge to our customers, fostering long term partnerships with both our customers and employees.

We are currently looking for a dynamic, hardworking Commercial Junior Maintenance Mechanic to join our team in the Cambridge Area.

Requirements:

  • Related Pre-Apprenticeship training
  • G3 Gas Technician license required, GT2 preferred
  • Ozone Depletion Prevention certification
  • Experience working in commercial & industrial environments considered an asset
  • Ability to provide exceptional customer service through clear and consistent verbal communication and detailed written reporting
  • Completion of Working at Heights and Elevated Work Platform training considered an asset
  • Valid Ontario Driverâ€™s license and insurable on our fleet policy
  • Ability to obtain a clean security clearance check
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Mechanical and electrical skills
  • Computer aptitude

Perks:

  • We offer competitive wages 
  • Generous benefits
  • RRSP matching & profit sharing after one year of service
  • Uniform allowance
  • Tool and tuition loan program

Accessibility for Applicants:Naylor Building Partnerships Inc. is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free workplace that reflects the communities we serve. We will provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities at all stages of the hiring process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and Naylorâ€™s Accessibility Policy. If you are a person with a disability and need the job posting in an alternative format or any other accessible accommodations during the hiring process, please email your request to our Human Resources department at

careers@naylorbp.com

.

title: Building Maintenance
description:
Location



Brookfield Place - 181 Bay Street



Business




Within our office business, this conviction guides every aspect of our work. Our signature structures not only define skylines but are also true destinations — bringing together office areas, retail spaces, and dining options all in one. And our high-end design capabilities and strong sustainability practices allow us to create properties that raise the bar for real estate everywhere. It’s why the world’s most respected businesses, non-profits, and start-ups choose us as their partner.




If you’re ready to be a part of our team, we encourage you to apply.




Job Description




Reporting to the Chief Engineer at Brookfield Place and working within a multi-task team environment performing and/or assisting in maintenance routines on building equipment. This position is responsible for attending to Tenant Service requests for light bulb replacement, minor plumbing requests, mechanical repairs and assisting Building Operators and trades as requested. Performing preventative maintenance routines on building equipment and washroom deficiencies are also required. The position demands flexibility, and the ability to multi-task while maintaining a positive, cooperative work attitude.




RESPONSIBILITIES:



+ Service tenant requests as they are dispatched by 310-SERV, relating to lighting and plumbing issues.


+ Perform standard maintenance routines on building equipment and systems.


+ Perform standard washroom inspections and minor repairs.


+ Cleans and maintains workshop, mechanical rooms, electrical rooms, etc.


+ Other duties as assigned





SERVICE/ PERSONAL SKILLS:




Service oriented with excellent communication skills. This position requires an individual that can consistently demonstrate empathy and courtesy in all customer interactions. The candidate must be able to communicate a sincere desire to contribute to tenant satisfaction, by taking personal responsibility to assist with resolving the tenant’s concerns. The candidate must be self-motivated, with the ability to work both independently and in a team environment, while learning from others. This individual will have a positive attitude, demonstrating the highest standards of professionalism while maintaining a professionalism image. Ability to work rotational shifts, overtime, including evenings, weekends and holidays as required.




EXPERIENCE:



+ General building maintenance experience an asset.


+ Must be able to work independently with minimum supervision





EDUCATION / DESIGNATIONS / LICENSES:



+ Some general building maintenance experience would be preferred: pumps, motors, boilers, chillers, Air Handling equipment and water treatment practices.


+ Completion of Secondary education is required.


+ Successfully completed or currently enrolled, working towards BES Class II certification; or is willing to commit to obtaining BES Class II certification within the first two years.





TECHNICAL SKILLS:



+ Must have a technical/mechanical aptitude, as most of the responsibilities involve working with sophisticated equipment.


+ Preference will be given to individuals with hand/power tool experience. Knowledge of HVAC system maintenance an asset.


+ Able to work on 6 to 14 foot step ladders








We are proud to create a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we will accommodate the needs of all qualified applicants with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.

title: Maintenance Mechanic ($32.00 - $40.00 hourly)
description:
Job ID:  378806

 

Oldcastle BuildingEnvelope®, a CRH company, is the leading supplier of products specified to close the building envelope. They include: custom-engineered curtain wall and window wall, architectural windows, storefront systems, doors, skylights and architectural glass.

 

As part of the manufacturing process, the Mechanic is responsible for ensuring proper functioning of the various production machines, installation and assembly of new machines and equipment, adjusting and repairing equipment, calibration, and proactively performing maintenance to ensure it operates at peak efficiency. 

 

The successful candidate is a hands-on individual who enjoys being part of of a team that thrives on success through teamwork while focusing on safety.

This is a regular full-time opportunity with benefit and pension eligibility after 3 months. All PPE required will be supplied. Regular and reliable attedance as well as consistent punctuality is rewarded with a generous attendance bonus paid out on a bi-weekly basis.

 

This role reports to the Maintenance Manager.

 

  • Perform highly diversified duties to install and maintain production machines and the plant facility’s equipment.
  • Perform mechanic skills including, but not limited to, mechanical, electrical, pneumatic, hydraulic, troubleshooting and repair of all production machines.
  • Trouble shooting of plants instrumentations and process equipment.
  • Provide emergency/unscheduled repairs of production equipment during production and perform scheduled maintenance repairs of production equipment during machine service.
  • Perform simple machinist duties and responsibilities. Minor equipment fabrication.
  • Diagnose problems, replace or repair parts, test and make adjustments.
  • Participate in PM program to ensure continuous improvement on all machines.
  • Perform a basic knowledge on PLC’s troubleshooting.
  • Work with other members of the maintenance team to ensure compliance to any construction, renovation or updates.
  • Perform scheduled preventative maintenance, checks of all electrical alarms on the plant.
  • Work from ladders, scaffolds, Scissor Lifts, booms and roofs to install, maintain or repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures.
  • Ability to work with production to ensure timely repair of equipment is essential.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

Must be able to accommodate a flexible work schedule including working different shifts and weekends as necessary.

 

To be considered for this position, the successful candidate should possess the following:

  • High school diploma, or equivalent.
  • Minimum 5 years related experience in a high-volume Manufacturing environment; Red seal experience is a definite asset but not required.
  • Licensed Millwright certified to work in Ontario as an Industrial Mechanical Millwright.
  • Experience using PLC’s and working with Robotic controlled industrial equipment is an asset.
  • Experience of Mig and Stick welding.
  • Strong mechanical and electrical aptitude.
  • Basic understanding of pneumatic and hydraulic systems.
  • Ability to understand and work from mechanical and electrical prints.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to effectively liaise with staff and management.
  • Able to efficiently and effectively handle shifting and multiple priorities.
  • Able to create alternative solutions to problems.
  • Able to work well under pressure in fast paced environment.

 

 

 

What CRH Offers You

 

  • Highly competitive base pay
  • Comprehensive medical, dental and disability benefits programs
  • Group retirement savings program
  • Health and wellness programs
  • A culture that values opportunity for growth, development, and internal promotion

 

 

About CRH

 

CRH has a long and proud heritage. We are a collection of hundreds of family businesses, regional companies and large enterprises that together form the CRH family. CRH operates in a decentralized, diversified structure that allows you to work in a small company environment while having the career opportunities of large international organization.

 

If you’re up for a rewarding challenge, we invite you to take the first step and apply today! Once you click apply now, you will be brought to our official employment application. Please complete your online profile and it will be sent to the hiring manager. Our system allows you to view and track your status 24 hours a day. Thank you for your interest!

 

CRH is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer.

 

EOE/Vet/Disability--If you want to know more, please click on this link.

title: Millwright
description:
We are looking for a skilled Millwright who has experience with industrial equipment operation and maintenance. We operate a safe and clean facility and consider it one of our top priorities. You will be working on various industrial sites both locally and in the shop so some travel may be involved with this position. The responsibility of the Millwright/Industrial Mechanic is to build and install machinery and equipment according to layout plans, engineered drawings, and other specifications as presented by the operations and engineering departments. This applies to in house and site work.

  • Use precision measuring tools such as micrometers, bore gauges, dial indicators, etc.
  • Have an excellent understanding of engineered drawings, diagrams, and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Dismantle, assemble and align industrial machinery and mechanical equipment according to specifications
  • Demonstrate safe rigging practices, operate hoisting and lifting devices to position machinery and parts during the assembly, installation, and repair of machinery
  • Test and provide constructive feedback on existing and newly manufactured industrial equipment
  • Troubleshooting Skills: Must be able to follow a problem to the source and solve the issue.
  • Clean, lubricate, and perform other routine maintenance work on machinery
  • Work in an environment where the products and jobs are continually changing
  • Must have solid working knowledge of mechanical drives and assemblies
  • Have an excellent understanding of hydraulic and pneumatic systems as well as pumps and gearboxes
  • Perform other duties as assigned
  • Overtime may be required to get our customer up and running in a timely manner
  • Five years practical experience in the millwright trade
  • Journeyperson’s certification from a recognized trade school, not required but is considered a major asset
  • Successful candidate may need to do shift work, overtime and customer site work
  • Strong ability to teach and train apprentices and other staff as required
  • Knowledge and execution of workplace safety, safe rigging & hoisting practices
  • Ability to operate required equipment in a safe and responsible manner
  • Effective verbal and listening communication skills
  • Demonstrates a strong customer service orientation and is able to communicate withcustomers as required
  • Show initiative in learning about our products and customers
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Ability to read schematics, engineered drawings and other technical diagrams
  • Critical eye for identifying defects and a high attention to detail
  • Commitment to safety and quality
  • Ability to readily determine the correct tools and equipment needed to do a job
  • Ability to work independently and complete daily activities according to work schedule
  • Ability to lift heavy up to 50 pounds, walk and or stand for long periods of time and perform strenuous physical activity

title: SUMMER STUDENT - MAINTENANCE WORKER 2022
description:
Vision statement:  Every person we support will have a full and meaningful life, which means having a home, relationships of all kinds, and a variety of socially valued roles.

 

Mission statement: Rygiel Supports for Community Living serves people who have a developmental disability and multiple handicaps.  The services are determined by a personâ€™s individual needs and are designed to enable each person to be a fulfilled participatory member of the community.

 

SUMMER STUDENT - MAINTENANCE WORKER 2022  

Period: June 6, 2022 â€“ August 26, 2022

Number of positions: 3

Hours/week: 30-35 hours/ week

Wage:  $17.00 per Hour

 

 

The Student Maintenance Worker will be responsible for assisting Maintenance staff. Functioning as a student, the successful applicant will assist in performing repairs and upkeep in residential homes and in the administrative office (COVID-19 permitted). Duties will include assisting maintenance in household repairs, painting, plumbing, carpentry, dry wall, etc. The student will be accountable to the Manager of Properties & Facilities and support the Maintenance Team by adhering to Health and Safety regulations, and preserving a pleasant home environment when attending to maintenance tasks in homes. The summer student will work in a manner which effectively models and reinforces RYGIELâ€™s established Vision, Mission, Values, attitudes and standard of support.

 

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Current Criminal Reference Check â€“ vulnerable sector
  • Currently a full time student in a relevant post-secondary education (University or Community College) and/or returning to full time school in the fall of 2022
  • Meets the eligibility criteria to qualify for wage subsidy with the Canada Summer Jobs program for the 2022 year
  • Ongoing commitment to and participation in continuous learning
  • Relevant training/experience in maintenance duties, and/or an interest in maintenance support
  • Valid driverâ€™s license and availability of a reliable vehicle with appropriate insurance coverage, an asset
  • Proof of Vaccination is required

 

JOB SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

Interpersonal Communication

  • Maintaining constructive, open, honest, two-way communication with the Maintenance team
  • Demonstrated oral and written English language proficiency appropriate to the language requirements of the position. Fluency in French is an asset.
  • Establishing and working according to appropriate work priorities reflecting all areas of responsibility and to carry out effective, ongoing self-monitoring of job performance

Problem Solving/Decision Making

  • Systematically seeking alternative solutions to identify or anticipate problems, and to respond to emerging opportunities or needs
  • Making appropriate decisions regarding actions to be taken in consultation with other team members

Interpersonal Skills

  • Works within and nurtures a team environment as well as working independently
  • Relates to and ensures a positive, nurturing and effective manner with the individuals being supported, the support staff and other team members
  • Organizes and completes tasks independently under the supervision of Maintenance workers and the Manager of Properties and Facilities.

Availability

Available for various hours including weekends and willingness to be flexible and adjust working schedules according to the needs of the role.

 

Interested applicants, please apply with cover letter and resume (please quote Summer Student â€“ Maintenance Worker 2022) to:

Rygiel Supports for Community Living, Attention: Human Resources, 220 Cranbrook Drive, Hamilton, ON  L9C 5V7 

Email:  humanresources@rygiel.ca

 

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, we will contact only those selected for an interview.

RYGIEL Supports for Community Living is an Equal Opportunity Employer

and will provide reasonable accommodations, accessible formats and communication supports upon request to persons with disabilities who take part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Millwright
description:
Job Description

JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is looking for a Millwright in Burlington, ON!

Formerly Cogent Power Inc., JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc. is under new management.

While we appreciate all applicants, we will only be contacting those selected for an interview.

This position will be on rotating continental shifts (12-hour shifts) and overtime available as required, there will be a shift premium (80 cents) on all regular hours.

Salary: $30-$38 an hour 

Job Summary:

To complete work orders and general preventative maintenance on all machines. Identifying and troubleshooting machine irregularities and breakdowns. Assemble equipment and machinery using hand and power tools.

The Perks:

  • $500 signing bonus after your first 4 weeks
  • Travel Subsidy:
    • Starting April to September 2022 we will be providing a subsidy to all employees that incur the costs of travelling to work. These subsidies will be provided at the end of the month in the form of a gas card (i.e April subsidy will be provided by mid-May).
    • For those who take a city bus to work, we will be providing a transit pass.  
  • 100% Health & Benefit Plan 
  • RRSP RPP Pension Plan (Company matching!)
  • Perkopolis Account - get access to 5000 exclusive online discounts to stores & sports events (Hello Fresh, Apple, Indigo, Toronto Marlies, Toronto Raptors, etc.)
  • Boot & Prescription Safety Glasses Reimbursement
  • Employee & Family Assistance (free confidential counselling program)

What you'll do as a Millwright:

  • To install and repair mechanical equipment and systems
  • Observe all safety rules and maintain an orderly workplace.  Works from blueprints, machine/ piping diagrams, shop orders, instructions and ideas.
  • Plans with supervision proposed mechanical work during planned shutdowns. Maintains the inventory of mechanical supplies and equipment and requisitions same, as necessary
  • Installs dismantles, examines, repairs, reconditions, rebuilds/overhauls and re-installs mechanical systems and equipment such as motors, gearboxes, drives, chains, pulleys, hydraulic components, air systems, filtration,  aids and/or performs predictive maintenance. Gathers information for replacement parts.
  • Performs a testing routine on a scheduled basis.
  • Examines and repairs all equipment when required for continuous plant operation.
  • Makes minor adjustments to and lubricates tools and equipment used.
  • Reports any abnormal conditions of materials, products or equipment to the supervisor
  • Performs preventative maintenances on required equipment and scheduled work as required.
  • Performs 5s related tasks.
  • Assemble machinery and equipment prior to installation using hand and power tools and welding equipment
  • Perform routine maintenance work on all machinery
  • Identify and troubleshoot machine irregularities and breakdowns

About you, simply stated: 

  • High school diploma or equivalent qualification.
  • A minimum of 3 years experience as a millwright or similar job.
  • In-depth knowledge of machinery and troubleshooting
  • Completion of an accredited millwright certificate program.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Strong attention to detail with excellent mathematical skills.
  • Must be able to work well in a team environment.

About JFE Shoji Power Canada Inc:

On September 20th, 2019, JFE Shoji Trade Corporation acquired 100% of the shares of Cogent Power Inc, from Tata Steel Europe. Grouped together, the Cogent and JFE Shoji Steel America business make it possible for JFE Shoji to capture a greater market share in the electrical steel market for both transformer and automotive products. The combination of Cogent and JFE Shoji has become one of the largest processors of electrical steel transformers in the world. JFE Shoji currently has many other production and processing facilities throughout Asia, as well as a facility in Tijuana, Mexico.

Globally, JFE Shoji enhanced the businessâ€™ competitiveness by sharing and integrating technical skills with deep business experience, which can be strongly applied to the global and North American markets. With this investment, JFE Shoji has one of the worldâ€™s leading processing and distribution functions for core design and manufacturing for transformers.

Based in Tokyo, JFE is one of the worldâ€™s largest steel producers with over 45,000 employees and operations globally.

If you would like to be considered, please apply by submitting your resume

For more information about starting your career with JFE Shoji Power Canada, please visit https://www.jfeshojipower.com/

Job Type: Full time, benefits, vacation, RRSP and Pension offered!

#JFELP

title: Handyman for Residential and Light Commercial
description:
To meet the demands of our rapidly growing base of satisfied customers, Handyman Connection of Toronto west is seeking an experienced Handyman.  This skilled Handyman would ideally have a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work.  Our customers love us!  We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

What You Will Receive

  • Earn $30-45/hour, depending on your skills and availability
  • Work as Independent Contractor on your own schedule
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers
  • Branded apparel and signage

Responsibilities

The handyman will need to have expertise in multiple types of home repair, maintenance and remodeling. You must have basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate with others with a positive attitude.  We are looking for a craftsman or craftswoman who can bid work and produce it.  If you have at least 3 of the following skill areas, you're the kind of person we need to add to our team:

  • Handyman, General Home Repairs and Maintenance Work
  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish
  • Painting Interior and Exterior
  • Drywall Repair / Patching / Caulking
  • Minor Plumbing and Minor Electrical Knowledge
  • Flooring Repair and Installation
  • Bathroom Upgrades / Remodel
  • Kitchen Refresh / Remodel

All candidates should be confident in the following areas:

  • Great Customer Service and Client Relations
  • Knowledge of Building Codes
  • Material Management

Requirements

  • Must have current Driver's License and Insurance
  • Must have tools, work vehicle and good references
  • Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades
  • Must pass screening process which includes a background check
  • Independent Contractors must carry liability insurance and WSIB Clearance 
  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet

Please, no Project Managers or those whose experience is primarily New Construction.

Ready to Learn More?

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.  Check us out on the web at: https://handymantorontowest.careerplug.com/account 

What our customers say:

Watch More

Why Handyman Connection?

title: Facility Support Technician - On site
description:
Why CompuCom? (Overview):

CompuCom is a large IT services provider. We are a global company that offers IT managed services and Infrastructure solutions.

 

We are presently looking for a Facility IT Support Technician to join our team, providing operational support for our Markham, ON location. The Markham facility performs warehousing, custom configuration, repair and distribution of IT equipment to customers.

 

Proof of Covid-19 vaccination is required for employment.

 

This position is on-site and not eligible for remote work.

 

What We Need & What You'll Do (Responsibilities):

· Install, maintain, and support a wide variety of IT Infrastructure equipment including:

o Workstations

o Wireless access points

o Wireless terminals

o Servers and storage

o RF barcode scan guns

o Routers

o Switches

o Printers

o IP video cameras

· Off-hours/on-call support as required

· Prioritize tasks as needed

· Solve basic problems using online resources, prior experience and training

· Seek support for complex issues

· Desk-side application support and troubleshooting
