title: Night Maintenance Associate (FT)
description:
Do you love hospitality? Love to meet and interact with fun and diverse people? Love to work in a friendly environment? If so, come be a part of our Boulevard Club family.

We take pride in providing safe and inclusive communities;
that inspire wellness, growth, and excellence.
We create exceptional, social, athletic, and recreational
environments; celebrating memorable experiences
and positive connections.

For over a century, The Boulevard Club has built a reputation around time honoured traditions, exemplary service, and unrivalled athletics programs for all ages and abilities, including tennis, badminton, water sports, fitness, swimming, basketball, pickleball, and more.

We pride ourselves on creating an exceptional Member experience thanks to an equally diverse and inclusive team. We know that our team members are vital to the success of the Club, which is why we hire well and enjoy developing and rewarding our team.

If you would like to work and learn from a team of professionals and build your career at one of Toronto’s top private clubs, The Boulevard Club may be a good fit.

As an employee of The Boulevard Club, you will enjoy a high quality pleasant working environment and the following benefits:

  • Education & Professional Development Assistance
  • Employee Health & Wellness Program
  • Extensive medical and dental benefits for Employees and their families
  • Summer and Holiday Bonus (eligibility criteria applies)
  • Meal Plan
  • Bike Share TO
  • Night Transportation Assistance
  • Summer Recognition Program
  • Complimentary Parking (subject to availability)

Job Overview

Reporting to the Facilities Manager and Night Supervisor, this person will perform tennis court maintenance and repairs as well as will ensure the Club property and equipment are maintained in good working order and well presented for the benefit of Members and Staff. Specific duties would include, but are not limited to:

  • Maintains tennis courts (including watering, dragging, sweeping, rolling, court amenities, etc.) and grounds within and around the tennis courts, including the tennis patio (cleaning, tidying, set up/take down of the patio).
  • Monitors air temperatures and pressure readings of the tennis bubbles and takes immediate action to correct incorrect conditions.
  • Performs nightly walk rounds within the Club’s property.
  • Clears snow from doorways, walkways, around structures and applies salt/ice melter product to outdoor surfaces as required.
  • Performs general cleaning tasks such as windows, spider webs, doors, handles, etc. as required.
  • Provides support (physical and/or skilled labour) to other departments as directed.

Job Qualifications

  • Related post-secondary education and/or skills and experience
  • Awareness of health and safety
  • Private Club industry experience an asset
  • Ability to speak, read and write English
  • Pleasant personality appropriate for a hospitality environment

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

The Boulevard Club is an inclusive work environment and as such, has a workplace accommodation policy in place. Accommodations are available, upon request, for the interview process and other selection stages for job applicants with accessibility needs. Please contact Human Resources to discuss further.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Position: Maintenance Technician (Full-Time, Permanent)
Location: Jasper, Alberta
Start Date: ASAP

About Us
Tribe Management is part of the Tribe Property Technologies family. Together we are the sixth largest strata/condo and rental management company in Canada with offices in downtown Vancouver, Delta, Victoria, Kelowna, Kamloops, Calgary and Cambridge. Our Tribe Management division specializes in strata and rental management services. We are responsible for the day-to-day operation and management of residential & mixed-use properties in our portfolio. Combining our obsession with technology and an unwavering passion for creating vibrant strata communities, we provide community management with heart. 

Job Responsibilities
The position will be responsible for regular maintenance at a residential rental building of which includes but are not limited to:

  • Minor appliance repair and fixture installation
  • Minor heating and plumbing repairs
  • Minor repair of electrical systems
  • Other repairs such as basic carpentry, drywall patching, and painting
  • Snow removal and de-icing of common walkways and stairs
  • Minor suite cleaning
  • Lawn mowing and cleaning as needed

Qualifications
The ideal candidate will possess:

  • Self-motivated with the ability to take directions and work without supervision
  • Has a professional work ethic
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills
  • Knowledge and/or experience regarding electrical, plumbing, and general maintenance is preferred
  • Working knowledge of the Residential Tenancy Act an asset
  • Availability to work weekends and an on-call rotation for after hour emergencies

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Extended health and dental benefits
  • Travel insurance
  • Life Insurance & AD&D
  • Employer-funded dependent benefits

If you are currently exploring a new career challenge in property operations, apply online by submitting your resume. Due to anticipated response, only those candidates who will be interviewed will be contacted.

title: Handyperson
description:
Company Description

We are hiring part time/casual: Handyperson (Yard Work) in Niagara on the Lake, ON.

Seniors for Seniors (a division of Spectrum Health Care) is a non-medical home care agency proudly serving seniors for over 30 years. 

If you enjoy helping seniors - Apply Today! 

Job Description

  • Provide general household maintenance, painting, minor plumbing, and other projects
  •  Listen, observe, and communicate any concerns/changes in the client’s physical, emotional, and/or environmental
Qualifications

title: Overnight Maintenance Crew
description:
Company Description

In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald’s® history. In 1967, the first McDonald’s Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we’ve been growing with our communities and serving quality food at a great value ever since. Today, McDonald’s Canada is proud to be one of the world’s leading foodservice retailers. From coast to coast, we serve delicious choices to more than 2.5 million people in over 1,400 locations every day. We’re also more than just your local restaurant. We’re hardworking small-business men and women, students working part-time, seniors getting the most out of life, and volunteers lending time to make a difference in the communities we live and work in

Job Description

Requirements:
The Maintenance Person assists management in achieving and maintaining outstanding interior  restaurant cleanliness and maintaining restaurant equipment. As a member of the Maintenance Team, your restaurant will support you with the tools and training needed to succeed.

The Maintenance Person's responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:

  • Filtering oil fryers daily
  • Clean equipment
  • Daily cleaning and Maintenance of Kitchen Equipment Grills and Fryers  small equipment and Facility maintenance
  • Dishes
Qualifications

• Night Owls who are passionate about Customer Service and put the customer at the forefront of everything they do • Detailed oriented individuals who pride themselves on accuracy

• Energetic, positive, trustworthy, enthusiastic people with a drive to succeed

• People who believe and thrive in a team focused environment • Reliability and Dependability

  •  ABILITY TO WORK FULL TIME OVERNIGHT SHIFT
  •  Able to handle physical, manual labour 
  •  Able to work independently and work off of a planned maintenance checklist
  • Able to lift & carry heavy loads (20 lbs)


Additional Information

This job runs from 11pm-7am. Your weekly schedule would be from 11pm to 7am daily starting on Sunday night and ending on Friday morning. We offer paid breaks, free uniforms, cost sharing benefits and many more perks. Starting wage above minimum wage. we would love to have you

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Job Description:

Schneider Electric Victoria acknowledges that our people are privileged to live and work in the traditional territories of the Lkwungen, Malahat, Pacheedaht, Sciaâ€™new, Tâ€™Sou-ke and WÌ±SÃNEÄ† peoples.   Schneider Electric endeavors to continue to work with Indigenous First Nations to respectfully acknowledge history and mutual goals for prosperity.  

 

As a Maintenance Technician youâ€™ll be the â€˜first responderâ€™ to all process and equipment related issues on the production floor. This includes to build, repair and maintain automated test equipment and applications, keep all processes and equipment in good working condition, ensure maintenance and calibration of equipment is up to date and escalate issues to higher levels if needed.  

 

What will you do?

  • React to all kind of equipment and process issues as soon as they occur
  • Troubleshoot/repair, maintain and build test-equipment, tools and machines
  • Improve the performance of equipment and automation processes
  • Establish and execute maintenance routines and equipment calibrations
  • Monitor performance of equipment and improve its uptime

 

What qualifications will make you successful?  

  • You are aware of safety/electrical safety procedures (LOTO, electrical safety codes etc)
  • You are interested in working in a test/automation and production environment
  • You have an education and/or experience in troubleshooting automated test equipment
  • You are organized and hands-on in structured de-bugging
  • You have knowledge of Total Productive Maintenance

 

Benefits Highlights:

  • Highly competitive salary
  • Annual bonus based on company and individual performance
  • Annual discounted stock purchase offer
  • Company matched retirement savings program
  • Extended health and dental benefits. Basic and optional life insurance. Disability insurance
  • Paid Time Off: 19-29 days based on length of service. 12 paid holidays annually
  • Paid Time Off purchase program
  • Paid Family leave (12 weeks for primary parent, 2 weeks for secondary parent)
  • Employee and Family assistance program
  • Well-being program (training and coaching for healthy habits, and rewards for achievements)
  • Internal mobility

Who will you report to?   The Methods and Maintenance Manager

 

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

45% of revenue from IoT

title: Maintenance Millwright Night Shift
description:
You already LOVE us and the SNACKS WE MAKE

Chips, Cookies, Crackers, Wafers, Cheese Curls, Popcorn, Tortilla Chips... yeah, we make them ALL! Shearer's is the company behind all your favorite snack brands.

We have nearly 5,000 associates in 11 state-of-the-art manufacturing and warehouse sites in North America that produce over 800 million pounds of snacks per year.  Did you know that we buy 20% of all the potatoes grown in the US?  WOW!

 

And we know what you're thinking…how can I get my hands on some free goodies? Our team members can crunch on oodles of free snacks – everyday!

  • *Maintenance Millwright Night Shift* - Guelph, Canada $38.10/hr*

Your seat at the best snacks table
Are you a motivated, focused and eager leader looking for an opportunity where you can make a difference from day one? Then we want you! This full time position works Sunday 9:00 pm -7:30 am, then Monday through Thursday 11:30 pm-7:30 am. As a critical team member, they are responsible for performing maintenance, troubleshooting, and installing upgrades on our state of the art equipment and facility.


What you bring to the party
We are building the best team in the food industry, and we're looking for people like you who possess the following:

  • Industrial Mechanic Millwrights License 433A
  • Knowledge of conveyors, high speed pumps/compressor & packaging equipment
  • Experience using a lathe, mill, drill press and other machining equipment
  • Experience of Arc & Tig welding
  • Experience with electrical safety circuit controls
  • Experience with a computerized maintenance management systems (CMMS)
  • Good understanding of 5S and other Lean Manufacturing principles
  • Experience in Food Processing facility preferred
  • Sense of urgency and attention to detail
  • Heavy lifting may be required
  • Excellent verbal and written communication
  • Provides maintenance support 24/7 schedule when necessary

These Qualifications are required of the successful candidate:

  • Self-starter, working with minimal supervision
  • Must follow all safety regulations while working
  • Must be comfortable working at various heights
  • Basic knowledge of electric motor controls, programmable logic controllers, basic wiring circuits and skills necessary to safety test common electrical systems and can make minor repairs where permitted
  • Must have a full complement of personal/professional hand tools
  • *We offer a variety pack of benefits

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Retirement Savings Plan with Match, Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, and Employee Assistance Plan

You will be considered for employment in our inclusive workplace
Shearer's Foods Canada, Inc. is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please advise us if you require accommodation during the recruitment process.

This is your invitation to apply now!

title: Maintenance Millwright - Weekend Afternoon Shift
description:
The Company:Grand River Foods is a leading food solutions company serving customers in the North American grocery and food service industry. As a member of the Sunrise Farm family, we remain as dedicated as ever to both providing a quality work environment for our employees, as well as producing only the highest quality products for our customers. We are known for the great care we take with clients and employees alike.

The Location: Grand River Foods is based in Cambridge, Ontario. Our location is commutable from a number of cities in the region: Kitchener, Waterloo, Brantford, Guelph, and more. For those living in Cambridge, our facility is located nearby a number of GRT transit stops.

GRF is currently seeking an experienced Millwright for our weekend afternoon shift – 12 hour shifts every Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.

GRF operates in a cold, fast-paced, and physical environment. Applicants must be comfortable handling meat products (beef, pork, chicken, seafood, soy, etc.) and must be comfortable with 10-40 pounds of repetitive lifting.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Follow preventative maintenance programs to minimize disruptions in warehouse operations
  • Ensure all material handling equipment is serviced as required
  • Monitor and adjust equipment to lower utility costs
  • Enforce established safety, health, contamination and housekeeping policies and procedures in order to minimize staff injuries, lost production time, damage, and contamination of product
  • Track building and equipment repairs
  • Ensure that work area is clean of debris and hazards at all times and check work area for such hazards upon arrival and when departing each area of work
  • Work in a safe manner in accordance with legislated and company health and safety standards
  • Perform other duties as required

 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Proven track record working with mechanics, machine shop practices (lathe & milling machines), welding (ARC, TIG, MIG), and pneumatic & hydraulic fields is required
  • 2-5 years' industrial mechanical experience, preferably in the food industry
  • Service, clean and perform preventative maintenance and overhaul on all production equipment (spiral ovens, freezers, formers, cartoners, traypacks, bread and batter equipment)
  • Continually improve equipment function via design improvements
  • Problem solving skills and good communication skills
  • Knowledge of appropriate health & safety and environmental regulations
  • Adherence to Food Safety Protocols
  • Must have Ontario Millwright License

Wages and Benefits:

$37.30/hr to start, increasing to $39.80/hr upon successful completion of the three-month probationary period.

Wages starting from $26.67+/hr for apprentices, depending on years of schooling/training completed

GRF also offers its employees:

  • Comprehensive benefits after three-month probation
  • Option to participate in GRF Pension Program after three-month probation
  • Product can be purchased at a reduced cost
  • All company PPE provided


Grand River Foods (Cambridge) embraces diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. Grand River Foods (Cambridge) is dedicated to attracting, development and retaining talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), 2005, under the Human Rights Code accommodation will be provided at any point throughout the recruitment process, the candidate will need to make their accommodation need known to the HR Department.

title: 310J Technician - Weekend Days + $5000 Signing Bonus
description:
Company Description

For 60 years, Manitoulin Transport has been providing comprehensive transportation and logistics solutions for clients across North America. Our success lies in our innovation and safety, and our dedication to reliable, on-time delivery. So, if you know where you’re headed, we have the training and career development to help you get there.

Job Description

You will be responsible for preventative maintenance as assigned. You will code and complete work orders and any other associated paperwork, deliver and pick up trucks from third-party maintenance providers and work safely in compliance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act and/or other pertinent regulations, including compliance with all company policies and procedures. 

Hours are Friday - Sunday from 5:30 am - 18:00 pm

Qualifications

  • 310J Mechanics license. 
  • Valid Drivers License


Additional Information

What do we offer to you? 

  • $35.14/hr base
  • Work 36 hours and be paid 4 hours top up totaling 40 hours per week
  • $5000 signing bonus
  • $450/year tool allowance
  • Comprehensive Benefits Program
  • Profit Sharing Opportunities
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • Opportunities for growth and advancement

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN

Job Summary

Atlas Growers Ltd. is currently recruiting for a Maintenance Technician (Millwright, Maintenance/Automation, Electrician), to join our Atlas One Facility. They will ensure the smooth operation of all HVAC, automation, cultivation and production equipment. In addition, they will create preventative maintenance schedules to minimize downtime while maximizing crop yield.

Reports to: Facility Manager

Skills and Abilities

  • Use logical step-by-step procedures in work
  • Make decisions based on measurable information
  • Perform a variety of duties which may change often; and operate machinery
  • Ability to act with minimal supervision, discretion, maturity, and with absolute confidentiality
  • Ability to work under tight timelines and to balance multiple and varied projects at one time
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Proficiency in the use of computer software for word processing, spreadsheets, email, Internet
  • Knowledge of BAS, PLCs, CMMS, Conveyor systems, motors, pumps, cranes, mills, production and processing equipment.
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to multi-task and ability to exercise independent judgment
  • Excellent communication skills, both in oral and written


Role and Responsibilities

  • Perform Maintenance duties relating to our grow lighting, HVAC, automation, production and harvest lines.
  • Develop and maintain a preventative maintenance schedule for all equipment in conjunctions with SOPs.
  • Assist with periodic quality assurance checks.
  • Troubleshoot mechanical and electrical issues quickly and repair equipment to keep production lines moving, work with purchaser and suppliers on necessary replacement parts and returns.
  • Assist in new equipment purchases, asses requirements, assist in assembling and ongoing maintenance of all production equipment.
  • Contact and subcontract necessary large scale and specialty work, coordinating with facility team
  • Use hoisting and moving equipment as needed
  • Read blueprints and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Dismantle machinery or equipment, using hammers, wrenches, crowbars, and other hand tools

Qualifications

  • Minimum 3 years of experience conducting Millwright, Electrician, Technician or similar duties in a production environment
  • Be able to follow instructions and read schematics with proven experience doing both
  • Experience in leadership and project management
  • Experience in an automated facility, using PC software
  • Security Clearance from Health Canada may be requested for this position

We would like to thank all applicants for their interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Atlas Growers seeks to fully integrate the principles of Employment Equity and will ensure the full participation and advancement of members of historically disadvantaged groups (i.e., members of visible minorities, persons with disabilities, women, and indigenous peoples).

title: Maintenance Mechanic - Millwright
description:
Maintenance Mechanic - Millwright


Date: May 3, 2022


Location:

Toronto, ON, CA


-42.62$/hour - Temporary position with possibility of permanency


A Career in Beer and Beyond: 


   


Our purpose at Molson Coors Beverage Company is to brew beverages that unite people to celebrate all life’s moments.  We’ve been brewing iconic brands for over 350 years and are now proud to be offering a modern portfolio that expands beyond the beer aisle.   


 


We are Talent Brewers with our culture rooted in our core Values. We believe in our brands and our people, and that diversity, equity and inclusion are the key ingredients to a winning team culture.  We want you to join our team of brand ambassadors who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get excited about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.  


The Headlines_:_


_Are you a licensed Millwright(433A) looking to use your skills, and gain valuable training and experience in a World Class Manufacturing Environment? With a competitve rate of $42.62/hr, and access to great perks (including a beer alottment), this could be your next great gig!_


In the Temporary role of Maintenance Millwright/Mechanic working out of our Toronto Brewery, you will be part of the Maintenance Team. You will be responsible for working with High-Speed Packaging Lines – Breakdown Maintenance, Proactive Maintenance, Repair and Overhaul. You will also be responsible for troubleshooting, maintaining Krones high speed packaging equipment, notably Filers,Seamers, Labelers and Packers as well as Palletizers. This position reports to the Asset Care Team Leader and actively works with fellow members of the maintenance and supply chain departments.


The Responsibilities_:_


+ Identify and troubleshoot repairs / installations of equipment irregularities and equipment malfunctions

+ Repair and / or replace malfunctioning machinery parts through a preventative maintenance program or through ad hoc maintenance requirements

+ Perform parts fabrication required with overhaul, maintenance and / or set-up

+ Administer preventative maintenance and standard work orders

+ Manage / Log inventory and labour reporting on a computerized maintenance program

+ Perform equipment repairs and upgrades to machinery; including; welding repairs and fabrication of equipment parts as needed

+ Provide effective and efficient resolution of ad hoc issues as they occur

+ Deliver vertical start-up after rapid equipment change overs

+ Other tasks as required and assigned


Work Perks that You Need to Know About_:_


+ Hourly Wage Rate of _$42.62/hr_

+ Participation in our Collective Agreement

+ The opportunity to train and work within a World Class Manufacturing Environment

+ As the worlds family brewer, we have the scale to make big things happen and still get to know colleagues on a first name basis across the globe

+ Access to cool brand clothing and swag, top events, beer allotment, and Employee Assistance Program and discount plans

+ Work within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experience.

+ We play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks – giving back to the community is a part of our culture and who we are


The Other Qualifications:


+ You have completed Post Secondary Education

+ You are a Licensed Millwright/Mechanic (433A) within the Province of Ontario

+ 1+ years experience preferred, with experience in a high-speed packaging environment an asset

+ Possess solid understanding of predictive and preventative technique

+ You have experience working with Hydraulics, pneumatics, pumps, reducers, screw conveyors, belt conveyors, machinery rebuilding and troubleshooting experience; welding experience is an asset

+ You have excellent written and verbal communication skills

+ You have strong computer skills, including experience with maintenance software systems

+ You are able to work rotating shifts (Day, Evening, Night and Weekends), or straight nights after training period if preferred

+ You are comfortable working in environment of constant changes and comfortable working in both cold and warm climates

+ You are able to demonstrate World Class Manufacturing Best Practices

+ You are comfortable working in confined space; work on heights, on scaffolding, etc.

+ You are comfortable using face shields, full mask and any specific PPEs required when working with chemicals in any special situations.

+ Demonstrable evidence of driving World Class Supply Initiatives to deliver on challenging objectives

+ You are serious about delivering results, and take pride in a proven track record in delivering.

+ You respect your commitments and are able to obtain optimal results from your team through respect and development

+ As part of the recruitment process, the candidates will be required to provide consent to complete a criminal background check


At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.

title: Maintenance Millwright
description:
Reporting to the Maintenance manager, this position is responsible for the safe operation and maintenance of Edmonton's packaging facility with emphasis on safety, productivity, quality, cost control, envrionmenatl compliance and positive inter-departmental relations. 

 

Core Functions:

  • Perform corrective and preventative maintenance on industrial equipment in a production environment
  • Troubleshooting the following packaging and process equipment: conveyor systems, rotary filling equipment, automated boxing equipment, heat exchangers, palletizing etc.
  • Perform preventative maintenance and regular Work Orders and account for inventory and labor.
  • Adhere to Bunge’s policies, safety procedures and with provincial codes and regulations
  • Fulfill all Health and Safety, Food Safety, HACCP, WHIMS, MSDS and SQF and Company policy requirements
  • Contribute to the overall plant safety by participating in plant safety training and hazard detection
  • Be able to read and understand mechanical drawings/schematics.
  • Other duties as assigned.

 

 

Skill/Experience Requirements:

  • Must have a valid Provincial Millwright Journeyman Certificate, or a recognized interprovincial equivalent coupled with a minimum of two years’ experience
  • Experience in food manufacturing maintenance would be considered an asset.
  • Ammonia refrigeration/boiler experience is an asset
  • Knowledge and experience with PLC controls and programming systems. Allen Bradley an asset
  • Demonstrated success in the application of safety standards, compliance with safety regulations, and the promotion of a safe working environment
  • Tig welding and milling is an asset
  • Superior verbal, written and listening skills
  • Ability to perform medium to heavy manual labor
  • Candidates must be strong, independent individual while possessing the ability to function within a highly integrated team environment

Afternoon shift 3pm-11:30pm

Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.

 

Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

title: Component Shop Technician
description:
We are hiring a Component Shop Technician who is detail oriented and self-motivated, with an ability to focus on quality and safety. 

We are seeking a candidate with some pre-existing mechanical experience and has the potential to pay $25-$30/hour.  

This is a full-time position located in Port Alberni, on Vancouver Island. Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Cleaning of parts in both media and chemical.
  • Shop organization.
  • Cleaning of tools and equipment.
  • Ensure stock of required consumables.
  • Packaging of parts for services.
  • Other duties as assigned by manager.

Position Requirements:

    • Valid Drivers License
    • Excellent listening, verbal, & communication skills.
    • Good record keeping/organizational skills.
    • Valid passport and ability to travel internationally.
    • Work in a shop environment as part of a team and works well independently.
    • Strong interest in mechanics and aviation.
    • Self motivated and driven.
    • Must be eligible to work in Canada

title: 2nd Year Apprentice Millwright - Brooks, AB
description:
2nd Year Apprentice Millwright

Please note: This position is on B shift (Night Time)

With approximately 3,300 employees, JBS Food Canada ULC ( JBS Canada ) is one of Canada's largest beef processors. Consisting of four locations the main processing facility located in Brooks, Alberta, where approximately 4,200 head of cattle are harvested and processed daily; the Head Office and a case ready plant, both based in Calgary, Alberta; and JBS Ontario, a case ready plant located in Belleville, Ontario. The JBS Canada facility in Brooks has the capacity to produce products ranging from boxed beef primals, ground beef, beef trimmings, beef by-products and hides which are shipped across Canada and worldwide. At the multi-protein Mountain Creek Farms case-ready facility in Calgary, JBS Canada produces value-added products including marinated, portion sized, multi-pack options, kebabs and much more. JBS Ontario in Belleville produces fresh meat and seafood products for leading retailers in Canada.

During the pandemic, we have implemented hundreds of safety measures including offering unlimited PPE, constructing permanent physical barriers, establishing physical distancing protocols, and installing hospital-grade ventilation systems in all of our facilities.

JBS Food Canada ULC is one of the largest beef processors in Canada. We are currently recruiting Apprentice Millwrights for our Brooks, Alberta facility which has the capacity to harvest more than 4,000 head of cattle per day.

This Roleis eligible for the JBS Canada Critical Worker bonus program and $500 HiringBonus

NOTE: Apprentice Millwright Job will be located in Brooks, Alberta

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:

  • Read blueprints, diagrams and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Install, align, dismantle and move stationary industrial machinery and mechanical equipment, such as pumps, fans, tanks, conveyors, furnaces and generators according to layout plans using hand and power tools
  • Inspect and examine machinery and equipment to detect and investigate irregularities and malfunctions
  • Install, troubleshoot and maintain power transmission, vacuum, hydraulic and pneumatic systems, and programmable logic controls
  • Adjust machinery and repair or replace defective parts
  • Operate machine tools such as lathes and grinders to fabricate parts required during overhaul, maintenance or set-up of machinery
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other routine maintenance work on machinery
  • Construct foundations for machinery or direct other workers to construct foundations
  • Assemble machinery and equipment prior to installation using hand and power tools and welding equipment.

Requirements:

  • Completion of college/CEGEP/vocational or technical training;
  • 2 or more years in a maintenance function; demonstrated experienced in hands-on support of operations, technical and maintenance work teams; (inclusive of time spent as a millwright/industrial mechanic apprentice)
  • Must be registered as an Apprentice In Alberta
  • Leadership of a multi-disciplined work group during operating and turnaround situations would be considered an asset;
  • Technical strength coupled with good people skills, and good planning;
  • Basic computer skills, written and verbal communication skills;
  • Rotating and stationary equipment maintenance experience;
  • Foundation in Preventive and predictive maintenance systems;
  • RPS/RCM maintenance troubleshooting techniques;
  • Superior skills within your area of expertise;
  • Must be available for Shift Work.

Work Site Environment:Noisy, Odours, Hot, Cold/refrigerated.

Please note that Applicants will be asked to complete a pre-hire medical and drug and alcohol test. Any offer of employment to the Applicant will be conditional upon passing satisfactory completion of the medical and passing the drug and alcohol test.

Exceptional Benefits including:

Competitive Wage | Relocation Assistance | Extended Health/Medical Benefit | Group Life &Accidental Death Insurance | Long Term Disability | Vision/Dental Care | Employee Beef Purchasing Program | Voluntary Employee RRSP Contributions | Employer RRSP Contributions | Medical Clinic on-site | Career Growth and Continued Training

www.jbsfoodcanada.ca

Telephone: 403-501-2223 Fax: 403-501-2239

Physical Location: 193002A Range Road 150, Brooks, Alberta, T1R1C6

title: Industrial Maintenance Mechanic (Apprentice)
description:
Industrial Maintenance Mechanic (Apprentice)

Location: 

Stratford, CA, N4Z 1H3

Job Requisition ID: 4484

 

Schaeffler is a dynamic global technology company and its success has been a result of its entrepreneurial spirit and long history of private ownership. Does that sound interesting to you? As a partner to all of the major automobile manufacturers, as well as key players in the aerospace and industrial sectors, we offer you many development opportunities.  

 

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Working alongside and taking direction from the Journeyman Millwright on site
  • Perform routine maintenance work on industrial machinery.
  • Able to use/learn to use measuring instruments, crane, and forklift as required
  • Read drawings and communicate problems to Journeyman Millwright
  • Welding and fabrication projects as required
  • Ability to work unsupervised to a high standard and to deadlines
  • Troubleshoot machine irregularities and breakdowns.
  • Identify and or repair/replace defective machine parts and equipment.
  • Perform preventative maintenance tasks on industrial equipment as scheduled.
  • Ability and/or knowledge for heavy rigging and machinery moving.
  • Work within company health and safety policies, practices and standards.

Your Qualifications

  • Mechanical aptitude and knowledge of CNC machining equipment and PLC’s.
  • Excellent troubleshooting ability.
  • Ability to use hand tools safely and effectively.
  • Operation of forklift and overhead crane.
  • Willing to work at elevated heights and obtain aerial lift certification.
  • Strong team player and ability to work with minimal supervision.

 

Exciting assignments and outstanding development opportunities await you because we impact the future with innovation. We look forward to your application.

 

 

Your contact

Schaeffler Aerospace CDN 

Erica Lynn King 

+15192766627 

 

Schaeffler Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

 

Keywords: Administration, Services & Support; Production

title: 310s Licensed Technician
description:
The 401 Group of Companies, is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's fastest growing dealer groups offering a full line of automotive, recreational vehicle, powersport and marine products and services. The 401 Group of Companies has 20+ locations across Ontario including the Blackshop Restaurant and Wine Bar as well as our headquarters, both located in the thriving city of Cambridge, Ontario. Our brands include but aren't limited to Kia, Mitsubishi, Volkswagen, Hyundai, Yamaha, 401 Auto Financing, CampMart and Grand River Boats. If you have a growth mindset like us, we'd love to see your resume and have a conversation. The opportunities at the 401 Group of Companies are endless!


Location: 974 Syer Line in Fraserville, Ontario


Come and grow with us, we’d love to meet you!


How we VALUE our employees:

  • A COVID-19 compliant workspace in our state-of-the-art facility
  • A high energy, fast paced and fun work environment with various initiatives and rewards
  • A work culture that truly cares about its employee’s both professionally and personally
  • Individual and team-oriented coaching, mentoring and training
  • Opportunities for career path planning, growth and advancement from within
  • Health & wellness benefit enrolment opportunities
  • Employee referral bonus opportunities
  • Employee pricing on vehicles and RV’s


Role and Responsibilities:

  • Diagnosing source of malfunctions and performing repairs
  • Determining if additional safety or service work is required by thoroughly examining vehicles
  • Ensure all vehicles qualify for warranty prior to performing warranty repairs
  • Performing road tests using safe driving standards
  • Excellent customer service, communication, and time management skills both verbal and written
  • Ensure the service shop is maintained in a clean, organized, hazard-free manner
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment


Qualifications and Skills:

  • Applicant must possess a 310S License
  • Valid G Driver’s License with a clean driver’s abstract
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Positive Teamwork Attitude


The 401 Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer and we are pleased to accommodate individual needs within our recruitment process. Please speak with our HR department should you require any accommodation.

title: Maintenance Team Leader
description:
Maintenance Team Leader

Role Summary

A Division of Magna, Polycon Industries is a World Class supplier of automotive parts.  Polycon moulds, paints, assembles and sequences automotive products to OEM’s (Original Equipment Manufacturers).       

JOB PROFILE:
We are in search of a highly skilled maintenance Team Leader with excellent ability to provide leadership and technical support.  

Salaried, Night shift position: 11:15 pm – 7:15 am
 

Key Responsibilities

- Responsible for ensuring all processes and equipment are maintained with a minimum of down time to      
   maximize production yield                                 
- Schedule, maintain and improve the Preventative Maintenance program to avoid downtime
- Troubleshoot, diagnose and repair equipment in a timely manner
- Responsible for safety standards through safety talks, accident/incident reporting, Safety Person of the Month; (SPOTMs), weekly safety inspections and daily team meetings
- Responsible for training, performance feedback, succession planning, counselling, discipline, safety, orientation,   
  assigning, checking and scheduling of work                                                                             
- Perform layered Process Audits (LPA) and 5S audits
- Responsible for ordering and tracking of equipment parts and supplies
- Responsible for administering company policies and departmental procedures
- Track team hours for payroll, distribution of overtime, vacation scheduling and floaters
- Support of all required cross-functional teams
- Support Continuous Improvement ideas and submissions
- Perform weekly safety audits and follow all audits to completion
- Develop and maintain management systems to further lead continuous improvement results
- Other duties as assigned

Key Qualifications/Requirements

- Post-secondary education Certificate of Qualification in a skilled trade (Millwright, Electrician) and 3-5 years of   
  related work experience required                                                                                                            
- Previous supervisory experience required
- Experience troubleshooting and repairing maintenance equipment required
- Ability to provide guidance, coaching and mentorship to team
- Computer skills, including working knowledge of MS Office required
- Excellent problem solving and decision making skills
- Must be results and team oriented
- Must be safety conscious and reliable
 

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

title: Industrial Maintenance Assistant - Manufacturing
description:
Location: Headingley, MB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/4/2022Job ID: DS44147744Category: Engineering & Technical
If you are a talented and experienced Industrial Maintenance Assistance with experience in Manufacturing, Deborah Sutherland, Senior Consultant at David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you!  Our client, a leader in their field, has partnered with David Aplin Group to grow their team in Headingly, MB, to assist the Maintenance Manager with diversified duties such as installing, repairing, troubleshooting, and maintaining manufacturing moulds and processing equipment.
 
Benefits & Perks
  • Full benefits
  • $45,000 to $50,000
  • Opportunity to work with a successful team in a family environment

Responsibilities
  • Complete maintenance and repairs on manufacturing moulds
  • Complete scheduled preventative maintenance on all processing, production, and building equipment
  • Perform minor repairs on the production equipment, including potential hydraulic leaks, based on daily requirements
  • Periodically check all work done by employees for the daily and weekly preventative maintenance of their equipment
  • Train employees on completing daily clean up of the equipment they are using 
  • After-hours response to emergency equipment breakdowns may be required
  • Comply with safety regulations and maintain clean and orderly work areas

Qualifications
  • 2+ years of industrial maintenance in a manufacturing environment preferred
  • Strong mechanical background with the ability to dismantle and replace components of equipment/ tools
  • Ability to read and understand hydraulic and electrical schematics along with experience in minor hydraulic repairs (dismantling, replacing seals or valves)
  • Able to use a Voltmeter (voltage, amperage, and continuity measuring)
  • Valid driver's license and preference is given to those certified on both Forklift and Sky Lift (onsite training possible)
  • Flexibility to respond to issues outside of regular working hours as needed
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills including Microsoft Office


If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.  #LI-DNP #IND-DNP


David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Certified Millwright - Fox Creek - Relocation Assistance Provided (Various Locations, AB, CA)
description:
Posting ID:    22934
Position Type:  Regular    
City: Fox Creek, AB 
Location:  Fox Creek

 

**$5000 Signing Bonus & Relocation Assistance Available**

** These are positions with competitive wages, starting at $46.65/hr**

 

Canfor’s strength comes from the diversity of our skilled and resilient workforce. As our company continues to grow and diversify, so do our career opportunities. Let us take this opportunity to tell you how you could be the best fit for Canfor.  

 

You are a Certified Millwright who knows the ins and outs of keeping a mill’s machinery up and running. You have a natural ability to diagnose and resolve complex mechanical issues and you're looking to expand your knowledge with an amazing company where safety and sustainability are the most important priorities. If this speaks to you, this opportunity, at our Fox Creek sawmill in Fox Creek, AB might just be your calling. 

 

This is your opportunity to use your Red Seal technical chops, communication, and troubleshooting skills to keep our modern sawmill running at peak performance.  You will be working alongside the best and brightest in the business with an innovative leader in the forest products industry.

 

At a minimum, you bring your Red Seal certification and for bonus points, you've got a couple of years of experience in an industrial or wood products manufacturing environment, so you can recognize why we’re consistently rated amongst BC’s best employers. You’re a Millwright who is a critical thinker, problem-solver, and quick learner who brings a “can-do” attitude to everything you do. You will make $46.65/hour as a Red Seal with benefits and pension to add! We also offer a relocation package if you're not from the area. Come make a difference and build your career with Canfor!

 

Our Talent Acquisition team is actively recruiting for this role. If you would like to be considered, please apply today.

 

At Canfor, diversity means understanding, recognizing and valuing the differences that make each person unique. We see inclusion and diversity as an essential part of our productivity, creativity, innovation and competitive advantage. We strive for a fair and equitable recruitment process, where hiring decisions are based on the individual qualifications and experience of each applicant. 

We are not your run of the mill forest products company, join us and find out why. #canfortalent


Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!

title: Core Facility Technician
description:
Atlantic Gold is a wholly owned subsidiary of St Barbara Limited, an ASX listed gold producer and explorer with mining assets in Canada, Australia and Papua New Guinea. We are proud to be a Company recognized by industry awards for operational excellence and performance, sustainability, gender diversity and pay equity.

We seek an experienced professional to fill the role of a Core Facility Technician.

This full time 6 month term contract position is based at the Touquoy mine site located approximately 1-hour northeast of Halifax, near Middle Musquodoboit, Nova Scotia. The mine is fully permitted and began production in fall 2017.

Our Core Facility Technician will join a dedicated Exploration team. Reporting to the Core Facility Supervisor, your role will Handle and process core to the highest standards to ensure outstanding data quality while following health and safety and standard operating procedures. Additionally, the core facility technician will assist with day to day duties around Exploration and Operations. 

The Opportunity

  • Handle and process core to the highest standards to ensure outstanding data quality while following health and safety and standard operating procedures
  • Assist with day to day duties around Exploration and Operations
  •  Monitor / ensure contractors safety
  • Thoroughly proof-read sample sheet, looking for irregularities and notifying the supervisor if anything needs to be corrected
  •  Maintain samples in correct order
  • Count, measure, weigh and label samples as needed
  • Ensure sampling machinery and tools are clean and in a workable condition, notify supervisor if there are any necessary repairs to be done
  • Organize and prepare samples as requested
  • Work with Core Facility Supervisor to improve sample processes
  • Assist Geologists in the field during drilling campaigns
  • Site clean-up as required
  • General labour work

Our successful candidate will demonstrate the following:

  • A personal commitment to behavior consistent with St Barbara's Values including honesty and integrity, respect, working together, delivering to promise and striving to do better
  • Current and Valid Class 5
  • Ability to pass a criminal background check
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Previous experience in a similar role considered an asset
  • Previous work in a safety sensitive role considered an asset

About Us

  • Developed and structured professional development opportunities and educational assistance
  • 2020 PDAC Viola R. MacMillan Award recipients for developing the Touquoy open pit mine and consolidating other gold deposits near Moose River
  • Be a part of the high performing St Barbara community - a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and Employer of Choice.

We are an equal opportunity employer committed to employment equity and encourage applications from women, aboriginal peoples and members of visible minorities and we provide nil gender pay gap in like for like roles and a commitment to addressing pay equity and gender equality through our recruitment, promotions, reward and recognition programs.

Members of the Mi’ kmaq community are encouraged to self-identify in your cover letter.

For further information about St Barbara visit https://stbarbara.com.au/careers/

Please understand that screening and interviewing may take place prior to the advertised close date.

title: HANDYPERSON (Part-Time) – Extendicare Oshawa
description:
HANDYPERSON (Part-Time) – Extendicare Oshawa

Candidates are invited to apply for the position of Part Time Handyperson at our Extendicare Oshawa facility located in Oshawa, Ontario.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Maintenance and servicing of equipment, furnishings, fixtures and outside grounds.
  • General maintenance around the facility (i.e. mechanical) repairs, patchwork, painting, plumbing and minor electrical work.
  • Performs general carpentry work and repairs such as installing floor and wall tiles, repairing drywall, replacing doors and door hardware, repairing roof leaks, painting, installing wallpaper and other redecorating tasks.
  • Must adhere to established policies and procedures regarding quality assurance, fire safety and environment and infection control.
  • Must be able to do moderate to heavy lifting.
  • Must be able to work under minimal supervision
  • Other duties as assigned by Supervisor or delegate.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Must have mechanical aptitude and be able to read and write the English language.
  • Experience in patchwork, painting and wallpapering preferred
  • Ability to work safely, following established safety practices and procedures.
  • Knowledgeable about WHMIS, OH & S
  • High School Diploma

 

CLOSING DATE: March 30, 2022

 

Interested applicants please forward your resume in confidence to the attention of:

Christa Griffiths, Administrator

Christa.Griffiths@extendicare.com

 

 

In Ontario, Extendicare, ParaMed Home Health Care and affiliated organizations including our partner homes in Extendicare Assist, accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodation needs must be provided in advance.   To discuss your needs, please contact the individual noted in the posting.

Extendicare was founded in Canada in 1968 and is now one of the largest providers of long-term care, operating a total of 81 long-term care centres across four provinces, with a capacity for just over 11,000 residents. The company also provides development, management and consulting services to a wide array of clients in the Canadian health care industry. Extendicare is the largest private sector provider of home health care services in Canada through ParaMed Home Health Care.

title: MAINTENANCE WORKER (Various Availabilities)
description:
MAINTENANCE WORKER (Temporary Full Time and Part Time Opportunities Available) – Extendicare Oshawa

Extendicare is a leading provider of care and services for seniors throughout Canada. Through our network of over 115 operated senior care and living centres, as well as our home health care operations, we are committed to delivering care throughout the health care continuum to meet the needs of a growing seniors’ population in Canada. Our qualified and highly trained workforce of 23,700 individuals are united by a dedication to quality care and by our vision of being the best provider of senior care and services in Canada.

Candidates are invited to apply for the part-time position of Maintenance Worker at our Extendicare Oshawa home, a 175-bed long-term care facility, located in Oshawa, Ontario. Reporting to the Administrator, the Maintenance Worker performs general, routine maintenance and servicing operations throughout the facility, reports unsafe conditions/situations in accordance with applicable codes and regulations and as directed.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Performs a variety of routine maintenance, servicing and repair operations to maintain facility, equipment, furnishings, fixtures, and grounds in proper condition.
  • Observes and monitors all areas of the facility for ongoing maintenance requirements and carries out repairs as required. Documents and implements the preventative maintenance programs. Maintains adequate inventory of tools and spare parts.
  • Performs mechanical maintenance and repairs to equipment such as replacing drive belts, lubricating motors and hinges, repairs to heating and ventilation systems, repairs to kitchen and laundry equipment, repairs to beds, chairs, tables etc.
  • Performs general maintenance and repairs to plumbing and electrical systems such as replacing water valves, clearing drains and removing stoppages, repairing or replacing fixtures, replacing switches, replacing fuses and light bulbs, repairing Emergency Nurse Call and Fire Alarm Systems
  • Performs general carpentry work and repairs such as installing floor and wall tiles, repairing drywall, replacing doors and door hardware, repairing roof leaks, painting, installing wallpaper and other redecorating tasks.
  • Following approval, refers problems requiring specialized work such as electrical or plumbing, to outside contractors and monitors work performed; provides general assistance to skilled trade persons such as mechanics, electricians, carpenters, plumbers, etc. as required.
  • Adheres to established policies and procedures regarding quality assurance, fire, safety, environment and infection control.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3-5 years experience and/or knowledge of mechanical and electrical systems, plumbing, carpentry and heating and ventilation systems. Technical training in building maintenance is preferred.
  • Ability to read and interpret manuals related to equipment and systems.
  • Ability to work safely, following established safety practices and procedures.
  • Ability to read and write English and understand moderately complex oral and written instructions.

CLOSING DATE: March 30, 2022

Interested applicants may forward their resume in confidence to the attention of:

Christa Gritths

Extendicare Oshawa

82 Park Road North

Oshawa, Ontario

L1J 4L1

905-579-0011

Christa.Griffiths@extendicare.com

 

In Ontario, Extendicare and affiliated organizations including our partner homes in Extendicare Assist, accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act.  Accommodation needs must be provided in advance.   To discuss your needs, please contact the individual noted in the posting.

Extendicare recognizes the importance of immunization to protect our residents, patients, team members and visitors from COVID-19. As such, subject to medical exemptions, a condition of employment with Extendicare is requiring that all new hires have received all required doses of a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada.

title: Maintenance Repair C-250-Canada (Victoria, BC, CA)
description:
With over 80 years as an industrial technology leader, Kennametal Inc. delivers productivity to customers through materials science, tooling and wear-resistant solutions. Customers across aerospace, earthworks, energy, general engineering and transportation turn to Kennametal to help them manufacture with precision and efficiency. Every day approximately 9,000 employees are helping customers in more than 60 countries stay competitive. Kennametal generated nearly $1.9 billion in revenues in fiscal 2020. Learn more at www.kennametal.com. Follow @Kennametal: Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn and YouTube.

Millwright -Red Seal Journeymen

 

Flexible Day Shifts:  4 x 10hr. Shifts- “Mon to Thurs” or “Tues to Fri”– either way 3 day weekends to enjoy all the outdoor recreation Vancouver Island has to offer.

 

  • Also available conventional “Mon to Fri”  40 hr work week.
  • All shifts offer overtime opportunities.

 

Kennametal a Global company with approximately 10,000 employees worldwide, focuses on Energy, Mining, Aerospace, and Machine Tool Technologies. We have a cutting-edge manufacturing plant in beautiful Victoria BC. Our team is world recognized for making core drill components for NASA’s Perseverance Rover on planet Mars.

 

Live in one of Canada’s top places to work, play and raise a family. Enjoy all that beautiful Vancouver Island has to offer. Enjoy a work life balance with flexible day shifts to fit in with your lifestyle. We have a permanent full-time position available for a ticketed Red Seal Millwright.

 

Education: 

Journeyman Red Seal Millwright, successful completion a 4-year millwright apprenticeship program.

 

Job Description and Duties

 

  • Prioritize safety and work within compliance of established environmental, health and safety standards, including LOTO and JSA procedures and WSBC reg’s.
  • Participate in daily toolbox and safety team meetings and take part in corrective actions on safety work orders and safety tracking.
  • Install, maintain, repair, and troubleshoot all plant areas and plant machinery and building equipment, and re-locate and move heavy equipment and parts.
  • Perform predictive, preventative, commissioning and decommissioning operations and vibration analysis and oil analysis functions.
  • Read blueprints, schematic drawings, and service manuals to determine work procedures and perform measuring and layout use of dials, micrometers, vernier calipers and lasers.
  • Service hydraulic and mechanical presses and powder material handling, including process pumps and vacuum pumps, fans, blowers, process piping and valves, tanks/sumps/vessels, compressors, conveying systems/dust collection, robotics and automated equipment, HVAC, boilers and furnaces, all types of grinders, lathes, milling machines.
  • Service fluid power systems including hydraulics, pneumatics, and vacuum systems.
  • Service mechanical power transmission components and systems including prime movers, shafts, bearings and seals, couplings, clutches and brakes, chain and belt drive systems, gear systems to precise tolerances.
  • Operate and maintain rigging equipment cranes/hoists/lifts.
  • Perform SMAW, GMAW, GTAW welding process, CNC waterjet/plasma cutting, fabrication design and oxy acetylene torch work.
  • Machine shop duties/design on manual and CNC lathes, milling machines, surface grinders.
  • Prioritize work according to production demands and major project coordination.
  • Research, test and develop modern technology, equipment, and maintenance practices.
  • Obtain quotes from contractors for work to be performed and/or parts to be purchased.
  • Use CMMS computerized maintenance system to track work orders and preventative maintenance schedules and order parts and materials.
  • Use of Solidworks and AutoCAD and use of 3D printer.
  • Help train and mentor mechanical apprentices and other tradesmen.
  • Safely operate forklift, AWP/scissor lifts, company truck.
  • May be required to other shifts/overtime as required.

 

 

Education, Training &/or Experience:

  • Journeyman Certificate of IP Qualification in the trade of Industrial Mechanic/Millwright (Canadian recognized)
  • Grade 12 or GED equivalent (Canadian recognized)
  • Valid Class 5 driver’s License in province of BC.
  • Forklift ticket, AWP/Scissor lift certification.
  • Communicate effectively in English, both written and verbal.
  • Be in good health and be able to perform lifting duties as required.
  • Have good interpersonal, organization and teamwork skills.
  • Be self-motivated and be able to work under limited supervision.
  • May be encouraged to pursue training in a complementary trade/field to become multi-skilled

 

Hourly wage  $38.28/hr with OT opportunities

 

Benefits include:

  • Flexible 10 hr. Day Shifts “Mon to Thurs”  or “Tues to Fri”  - 3 days off per weekend.
  • Medical, Vision, Dental, and Life
  • Pension Plan
  • 80 hrs. of Vacation per Year
  • Plus 1 floating Holiday
  • Company-paid training and development
  • Free onsite employee parking
  • Paid work boot allowance
  • Recognition initiatives for safety and KPI performance
  • Company social events – eg. annual salmon fishing derby

 

 As part of our core values, Kennametal is committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all people.  We are an Equal Opportunity employer.

title: Maintenance Mechanic 2022-35
description:
Company Description

The West Nipissing General Hospital was built in 1977 and boasts a clean, modern facility, with over 100 beds in operation at any given time. The Hospital operates a 24/7 Emergency Department serviced by General Practitioners, visiting Surgeons, Anesthetists, and Internists.

The West Nipissing General Hospital hosts regular cardiology, urology, nephrology, otolaryngology, endoscopy, surgical lumps & bumps and psychiatry clinics and consultation visits by specialists. There exists an excellent referral relationship between West Nipissing General Hospital and the Regional Health Centre in North Bay and Health Sciences North in Sudbury. The West Nipissing General Hospital is the sponsoring agency for a community Mental Health and Addictions Program.

The West Nipissing General Hospital collaborates with the Ontario Telemedicine Network to provide consultations and follow-up visits with specialists. In addition, Ontario Telemedicine Network hosts numerous education events for both staff members and physicians. The West Nipissing General Hospital offers a satellite Oncology program through the Regional Cancer Program of Northeastern Ontario Regional Cancer Centre. Chemotherapy services are provided to the residents of West Nipissing

Job Description

The Maintenance Mechanic assists the skilled maintenance staff with plumbing, carpentry, electrical and mechanical work and works in accordance with Hospital policies and procedures. 

Status: Permanent, Part-time

Department: Plant Maintenance

Shift: Days, evenings, weekends          

Language: Bilingualism is an asset

$26.31 - $27.22 per hour (as per CUPE Collective Agreement)

Qualifications

  • College Program (2 years) of recognized Trade School in area of electricity, plumbing, mechanical or relevant field
  • Valid driver’s license and personal automobile insurance is required
  • Related experience an asset
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
  • Proven time management and organizational skills
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize workload efficiently
  • Proven ability to work with minimal supervision and collaboratively within a team Computer proficiency is an asset
  • Up to date immunizations required, including COVID-19

title: Maintenance Person
description:
Our client is a private real estate partnership, was established in 2004 with a mandate to acquire and operate income producing properties the Yukon. Since then, they expanded outside of Whitehorse with investments in Carcross, Dawson City, and Mayo, while still growing it’s Whitehorse base.

The Maintenance position reports directly to the Maintenance Manager. You will achieve excellence by facilitating the day-to-day maintenance of the properties including the Downtown Coast Hotel, Midnight Sun Hotel, and the staff accommodation buildings. The position will oversee minor repairs and improvements, preventative maintenance, championing life & safety standards, collaborating with the Whitehorse head office on major repairs and improvements and supporting other operational departments. Your efforts will align to deliver the best quality products, improve both guest and employee satisfaction and deliver against key financial goals and performance metrics for your department. Relocation assistance may be provided for the right candidate.

Responsibilities:
  • Inspecting the condition of the property is an important part of the job; maintain and promptly repair what you can.
  • Document and report immediately all deficiencies you can’t fix.
  • Meeting with your team daily, weekly and monthly; keeping your people informed of property and corporate goals.
  • Achieving a target of 50% conversion ratio on all incoming inquiries Guarding our guests and your own personal safety and security is paramount; you must know and practice all emergency procedures for the hotel and policies that protect the privacy and security of our guests and yourself.
  • Owning the guest experience by maintaining the physical building, grounds, guest rooms, and amenities to their fullest potential.
  • Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variables in situations where only limited resources/solutions exist. Must be able to respond to emergencies when not on site.
Education:
  • Secondary School Diploma
  • Trade Qualification in one or more of the following: electrical, plumbing, HVAC, or refrigeration an preferred
  • Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) training an asset
  • Able to obtain a clear criminal record check
Skills:
  • Physical mobility and stamina
  • Experience working with contractors and sub-trades
  • Excellent communication, specifically written and oral English, and customer service skills
  • Excellent knowledge of health and safety regulations
  • Attention to details;
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a group environment;
  • Ability to prioritize workload and adjust to shifting priorities;
  • Strong work ethic, respectful and reliable;
  • Excellent written, oral, listening and communication skills;
  • Valid driver’s license.
  • Clear criminal record
Compensation: $20 to $24 Hourly
Extended Benefits, Life Insurance, Paid vacation and sick leave, hotel and flight discounts
Security & Building Maintenance
Duration: Permanent
Job Level: Assistant

Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

title: Millwright Mentor - Apprentice Support
description:
JOB POSTING

Millwright Mentor - Apprentice Support in Ontario

 

 

Support Ontario Youth (SOY) a registered charitable organization, is a group sponsor of apprentices. We are looking for an experienced journeyman millwright to work with apprentices during their apprenticeship as an independent advisor. As the Manager Apprentice Support, you will have regular contact with the apprentices to discuss their progress and address any issues that they may be having whether technical or other. The position is remote based and hours (maximum 80 per month) are variable depending on how many apprentices are in the Group Sponsor and what is needed by them on a monthly basis.

 

Job Duties & Responsibilities

Apprentice Mentoring

 

  • Regular communication with apprentices to track progress (competencies and hours)
  • Advise apprentices on work related issues and conflict management
  • Assist with technical issues when encountered whether on the job or during school
  • Report any non-resolved issues to Program Manager for additional support
  • Identify areas for improvement within the group sponsor program
  • Participate in interviews and skills assessments of potential new apprentices
  • If required, visit apprentices in person to address any issues
  • Document all communications in Growth Zone

 

Employer Engagement

 

  • Attend SOY functions and other outreach events
  • Attend SOY Local Apprenticeship Committee meetings as needed

 

Qualifications:

 

  • Valid 433A license and in member in good standing with Ontario College of Trades
  • Valid drivers license
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task and solve problems
  • Attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Previous experience training apprentices

 

How to apply:

Click on the link to complete an online application AND assessment https://bit.ly/3iOQ0bH

1.       Attach a detailed cover letter and resume. 

We will ONLY be in touch with candidates who qualify for the positions.  We wish all applicants success.

title: Préposé(e) l'entretien du bâtiment
description:
Rôle

Le (la) préposé(e) à l'entretien du bâtiment assure l'entretien régulier de l'immeuble hôtellier. 

Responsabilités

  • Aider au nettoyage, à la maintenance et aux réparations sur divers équipements ,
  • Effectuer les travaux d’entretien général et de réparation,
  • Participer aux rénovations.

Qualités recherchées:

  • Polyvalente et autonome
  • Avec le souci du détail
  • Une attitude positive et un sourire contagieux
  • Un service clientèle hors pair comme première priorité

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, the Maintenance Technician performs routine daily maintenance activities for the facility and scheduled preventative maintenance on the processing equipment. Troubleshoots mechanical failures, recommends corrective action and carries out the necessary repairs in a timely manner to restore equipment and operational status. Adheres to all facility safety programs.

Responsibilities

  • Performs routine daily maintenance activities for the facility and scheduled preventative maintenance on the processing equipment as directed by the Supervisor
  • Identifies problems, collects data, draws valid conclusions, recommends corrective action and carries out necessary repairs in a timely manner to restore equipment to operational status
  • Identifies the materials needed, obtains pricing information, completes purchase orders and with the Supervisors approval, orders materials needed
  • Interfaces with operations personnel regarding work orders and outside contractors, as necessary
  • Adheres to all facility safety programs
  • Assists with other tasks as assigned by Supervisor

Qualifications
  • High School Diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience
  • Language, mathematical and reasoning skills necessary to compute complex measurements and read and comprehend detailed instructions and electrical/mechanical drawings
  • Five (5) years of maintenance experience in a processing/manufacturing environment preferred
  • Specific areas of knowledge include:
  • Purchasing
  • Knowledge of 480 volt 3 Phase power
  • Ability to read and interpret ladder logic and electrical diagrams
  • Electric motor control troubleshooting
  • Repair and troubleshooting of mechanical systems
  • Ability to operate welding equipment and a cutting torch
  • Knowledge of hand and power tools and their safe use
  • Must be able to read, write and speak fluent English
  • Must be able to lift 50 pounds

Special Requirements:
  • Must be medically approved for respirator use (EO)
  • Must be able to tolerate exposure to high temperatures and high humidity (120F and 60% RH for 20 minutes) (EO)

Training Required:
  • Must complete all required training for a Maintenance Technician outlined in the training manual.
The name Sotera Health was inspired by Soteria, the Greek goddess of safety, and reflects the Companys unwavering commitment to its mission, Safeguarding Global Health. Sotera Health Company is a leading global provider of mission-critical sterilization and lab testing and advisory services for the healthcare industry. With a combined tenure across our businesses of nearly 200 years and our industry recognized scientific and technological expertise, we help to ensure the safety of millions of patients and healthcare practitioners around the world every year. Across our 64 facilities worldwide, we have over 3,000 employees who are dedicated to safety and quality. We are a trusted partner to more than 5,800 customers in over 50 countries, including more than 40 of the top 50 medical device companies and 8 of the top 10 global pharmaceutical companies.

Sotera Health goes to market through its three best-in-class businesses " Sterigenics, Nordion and Nelson Labs. Sterigenics is a leading global provider of outsourced terminal sterilization and irradiation services for the medical device, pharmaceutical, food safety and advanced applications markets. Nordion is the leading global provider of Co-60 and gamma irradiators, which are key components to the gamma sterilization process. Nelson Labs is a global leader in outsourced microbiological and analytical chemistry testing and advisory services for the medical device and pharmaceutical industries. Learn more about Sotera Health at soterahealth.com.
skills: ['Performs routine daily maintenance activities for the facility and scheduled preventative maintenance on the processing equipment as directed by the Supervisor', 'Specific areas of knowledge include:', 'Five (5) years of maintenance experience in a processing/manufacturing environment preferred', 'Must be able to lift 50 pounds', 'Must be able to read, write and speak fluent English', 'Electric motor control troubleshooting', 'Identifies the materials needed, obtains pricing information, completes purchase orders and with the Supervisors approval, orders materials needed', 'Must be able to tolerate exposure to high temperatures and high humidity (120F and 60% RH for 20 minutes) (EO)', 'Purchasing', 'Must complete all required training for a Maintenance Technician outlined in the training manual.', 'High School Diploma or equivalent combination of education and experience', 'Must be medically approved for respirator use (EO)']

title: Handyman (FT)
description:
Goals & Outcomes:
Assist with a variety of service projects and installations at various sites. Customer service and attention to detail are critical skills to ensure that projects are completed to Customer specifications.

Responsibilities include:
  • Efficiently completes all daily work orders in a specific amount of time. Communicates any delays in completing a work order with the supervisor.
  • Troubleshoot and repair maintenance issues involving electrical, plumbing and carpentry.
Knowledge and Skills:
  • Knowledge of carpentry, experience with door and window installation, and lock repair.
  • Ability to perform basic arithmetic skills such as measurement, addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
  • Candidate must have computer skills that include knowledge of MS Office suite.
Work Environment/Physical Demands:
  • Extensive daily travel around northern Alberta
  • Be able to climb ladders multiple times a day.
  • Lift 75 lbs.
  • Work long hours.
  • Experience using hand tools.
  • Experience using small power tools.
  • Take direction from supervisors.
  • Detail-oriented.
  • Fast learner.
  • Valid Full driver's license.
