title: Building Maintainer - áƒá“ªá“—áƒá‘¦ áƒá“—á–á“á“‚á‘¦ á‘²á’ªá”¨
description:
The City of Iqaluit is looking for a skilled and experienced individual to join our growing team and city as the Building Maintainer

Title:                       Building Maintainer

Department:        Public Works

Status:                   Full-time, Permanent

Salary:                    $52,565.18 per annum, 35 hour/week

Settlement

Allowance:            $20,907.43 per annum

Union Status:       Unionized

Housing:                No Staff Housing Available

Closing Date:        Open until filled

This employment opportunity is open to all applicants.

Under the direction of the Facility Manager, the Building Maintainer shall provide maintenance and repair services to the City of Iqaluit owned buildings i.e Arenaâ€™s, City Hall, Aquatic Centre, Youth Centre, Curling Rink, Abe Okpik Hall, Garage, City housing units, Fire Hall, Public Workâ€™s buildings and any and all owned buildings or facilities at various sites. Build required items including stairs, specialty furniture, and other items. Construct and maintain structural woodwork, shelving, flooring, tables, chairs, etc. Perform renovations as required, build and install cupboards, bookcases, tack boards etc. and repairing furniture. Prepare, paint and decorate interior and exterior surfaces as required. Performing minor construction work. Perform other related duties, including minor duties of other trades where certification is not required and the work does not exceed own limitations. Operate and Maintain carpentry tools and equipment.

Required Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 Diploma or equivilant, Journeyperson Carpenter preferred;
  • Knowledge and experience of carpentry, building maintenance and minor repairs;
  • Knowledge and experience of safe operation of basic hand and power tools;
  • Knowledge of workplace safety and safe lifting and handling procedures;
  • The ability to operate required equipment in a safe and responsible manner;
  • Client service and public interaction skills;
  • Effective tiem management skills with the ability to multi-task and establish pritorites;
  • First aid and CPR;
  • Strong mathematical and analytical skills;
  • Must posses a valid class 5 driverâ€™s license

The ideal candidate must prove to be reliable and punctual, must be able to work with minimal supervision and/or within a team atmosphere, and must be willing to work in harsh outdoor weather conditions. They must have the ability to follow instructions, perform duties safely and quickly and be able to work under time constraints.

Compensation for this position will be dependent on qualifications and experience.  In addition, the City of Iqaluit also provides an excellent benefits package.

Equivalencies that include a combination of education and experience may be considered.

All relevant certifications are required at time of application.  The successful candidate would be required to submit a Criminal Record Check, as well as an acceptable Driverâ€™s Abstract. 

Please visit our website https://www.iqaluit.ca/careers to apply. Due to Covid-19 precautions the city will not be accepting in person applications until further notice.

â€¢              The City of Iqaluit embraces the intent and spirit of the Nunavut Land Claims Agreement.  Priority will be given to Nunavut Inuit; Candidates must clearly identify their eligibility in order to receive consideration under this agreement.

â€¢              Only those selected to interview will be contacted.

title: Maintenance Technician - Eurofins CDMO Alphora Inc.
description:
Company Description

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate. Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies.

In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 58,000 staff across a network of more than 1000 independent companies in over 54 countries and operating more than 900 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing.

In 2021, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR € 6.7 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.

__________________________________________________________________

Eurofins CDMO Alphora Inc. provides a fully integrated suite of services to support drug substance and drug product development from the IND enabling development stage, through to phase II & III supply, and commercial validation and manufacturing for niche APIs.  In addition to a continuing flow of interesting and challenging projects for global pharmaceutical and biotech companies, Eurofins CDMO Alphora Inc. is committed to growing its state-of-the-art organization, with continued investments in its people, modern facilities, equipment, and instrumentation.

Job Description

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Maintenance Technician is accountable to the Team Leader, Maintenance to perform duties whose functions include mechanical and electrical installation, modification, troubleshooting, maintenance and repair of site equipment, utilities, systems and/or facilities in accordance with established SOPs, GMP guidelines and EH&S policies.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

·                 Follow Environmental, Health and Safety rules/regulations and report any workplace injuries or accidents immediately. 

·                 Adhere to the policies and guidelines set out in the Alphora Employee Handbook.

·                 Responsible for compliance with GMP guidelines and ensuring that all GMPs and SOPs are followed.

·                 Work harmoniously with all fellow employees.

·                 Travel between operating facilities.

·                 Perform other related duties as required.

·                 Perform maintenance procedures according to the established SOP and PM schedule, coordinating parts and service, as required.

·                 Coordinate routine maintenance with Operations to ensure that, whenever possible, maintenance work scheduling does not disrupt production scheduling needs.

·                 Build & grow existing preventative maintenance program while maintaining a proactive approach to Plant and Equipment maintenance & repair.

·                 Anticipate on-going maintenance needs of equipment and surroundings, focusing on safety.

·                 Identify, recommend and implement improvements to line procedures, equipment, utilities, systems and/or facilities to enhance the productivity, quality or safety of products, processes and/or procedures.

·                 Perform operational checks on equipment and systems. Detect and investigate variance in performance of equipment, utilities, systems and/ or facilities to ensure proper or enhanced functioning.

·                 Resolve equipment failure.  Isolate issues, conduct repair or source external resource to conduct repair.

·                 Complete required compliance documentation, log books, timesheets, etc. when executing duties.

·                 Maintain an assortment of common spare parts.

·                 Coordinate, recommend and/or initiate purchase orders for parts, equipment or spare parts inventory according to Company's purchasing guidelines.

·                 Complete and maintain current training and awareness of related legislated codes, EH&S procedures, SOPs and GMP requirements. Complete ongoing training to maintain certification and respond to technology change at the Site, as well as improving knowledge of facilities, systems and equipment.

·                 Ensure that maintenance or repair of Production Equipment, Site Facilities, Systems and Utilities are carried out in a timely manner.

Respond to "off hours" emergencies, as required and provide essential services coverage during site shutdowns.
 

Qualifications

·        Education: College 2 year diploma in engineering or related field

·        Experience:Entry level applicants are encouraged to apply

·        Must be a team player

·        Strong oral/written communication skill



Additional Information

Eurofins supports equal opportunities for inclusion and invites all qualified applicants to apply; if accommodations are required in the application or interview process, please contact us via www.eurofins.ca. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. 

Accommodation: Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process, or those needing job postings in an alternative format, may e-mail a request via the website at www.eurofins.ca.  

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted - no phone calls or emails please. 

Selected candidates can expect to be contacted in 3-6 weeks.

NO AGENCIES, PHONECALLS OR EMAILS PLEASE.

title: Weld Maintenance Technician (Cambridge, ON, CA)
description:
BWXT Canada Ltd. is a world leader in design, engineering, manufacture, construction and service of nuclear power generation equipment.  As a supplier of innovative, high-quality nuclear components and services we cater to a worldwide customer base.  We take great pride in supplying highly engineered solutions that allow our customers to compete within the complex nuclear power generation industry.

 

Weld Maintenance Technician 

 

We are currently recruiting for a Weld Maintenance Technician for our facility in Cambridge, Ontario.

 

RESPONSIBILITIES:

 

·      Maintain project welding and supporting equipment.

·      Develop and control weld tool operating procedures.

·      Responsible for project specific weld development techniques, development welding procedures and maintaining welder qualifications.

·      Participate in moderately complex engineering assignments supporting activities associated with design, testing, production, and operation of equipment/systems.

·      Assist professional /senior staff in diagnosing equipment, system(s) and material failures using various processes and tooling.

·      Recognize and implement process improvements through tooling, fixtures, mockups and processing.

·      Review/oversee the work of other groups performing routine assignments.

·      Routinely work unsupervised in field situations.

·      Responsible for weld tooling continuous improvements, monitoring of tooling performance and completing any tooling modifications as identified in project lessons learned.

·      Support remote project specific outages including operation, troubleshooting and maintaining welding equipment used in the field.

·      Responsible for project specific training (trades and project staff).

·      Maintain spare parts inventory.

·      Manage the project specific budget for weld tooling.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

 

·      Post-secondary education in a technical field. A Welding Technologist is preferred.

·      Strong welding automation background is an asset.

·      Familiarity with the ASME code is an asset.

·      Field projects will require shift work and extended hours of work.

·      Routine project site work/travel (up to 25% - 30%).

·      Excellent communications skills.

·      Previous work experience in an associated welding discipline.

·      Excellent interpersonal skills to effectively work in a team setting of professional staff.

·      Displays technical competence while understanding objectives as presented by Design Engineering.

 

WHY JOIN BWXT?

 

  • Work with collaborative teams within the growing nuclear industry
  • Employer-paid pension plan
  • Profit sharing plan
  • Bonus plan
  • Excellent Health and Dental benefits
  • Educational Refund Program
  • Life insurance and so much more!

 

We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.

 

BWXT Canada Ltd. is committed to fostering an accessible, fair, and inclusive environment where all employees are able to access goods and services while being respected and supported. If you require accommodations during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so appropriate arrangements can be made. If you require information in a format that is accessible to you, please contact Human Resources.

 

BWXT Canada Ltd. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status or disability, or any other category protected by provincial law.

title: Millwright
description:
Role Summary/Purpose

The Millwright will report to the Provost Manager and will play an important role supporting Lufkinâ€™s customers.

Essential Responsibilities

  • Repair Pumpjacks of various sizes and brands including all parts and assemblies.
  • Gearbox diagnosis and repairs
  • Repair bearing assemblies for Exchange inventory
  • Assemble and pre delivery inspection on new pumping units.
  • Complete paper work for parts used in repairs and assembly builds
  • Work with others as well as working independently
  • Completing any related job certification , and Job safety training
  • Candidate may be required to work at times in the yard or field
  • Fully participate in EHS Management Program and comply with all Environmental, Health and Safety regulations
  • Ensure compliance in respective areas of control with all QHSE Management System requirements, policies and procedures
  • Ensure product quality, workmanship and conformance to all applicable processes, requirements and regulatory standards in accordance with the established quality assurance system
  • Be a proactive team member and identify particular needs for product lines and/or processes
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications/Requirements

  • Red Seal Journeyman Ticket preferred, but not required 
  • Able to work well on a team or independently depending on job requirements.
  • 4 yearsâ€™ experience in the Millwright trade
  • Ability to read and follow written instructions, analyze, and interpret working drawings, technical specifications, etc.
  • Must be mechanically inclined
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Experience with overhead lifting equipment
  • High School GED (General Education Diploma) or equivalent
  • Must have unrestricted authorization to work in the country in which the position is located
  • Able to follow verbal and written instructions with minimal supervision

Lufkin’s proud past extends back to the early 20th century when the Lufkin Foundry manufactured railroad and sawmill equipment. The company expanded soon after by pioneering oilfield pumping units in the 1920s. Today, Lufkin is a world leader in its field, providing precision-engineered oilfield equipment, products, and services to customers around the globe.

Lufkin Industries is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Licensed Millwright, Manufacturing
description:
Join our team of Canada’s top Millwrights!

Working at one of Canada’s Top 100 employers means opportunity, challenge and teamwork.
 

"I really like the security and stability of the employment. It helps me understand that my kids are provided for" – TMMC Team Member

“I like the diversity of the different shops that you can go work in. You can have different careers under 1 roof” – TMMC Team Member

“The sense of teamwork is huge” – TMMC Team Member


Why join TMMC

  • Great compensation
  • Comprehensive benefits from Day 1
  • Safe, modern facilities
  • Paid training
  • Onsite fitness facility
  • Opportunity to make an impact

 

What we offer

Compensation:

  • Starting rate of $41.84/hour and after 6 working months, a full rate of $44.04/hour
  • Earn an afternoon shift premium of $2.20/hour, a night shift premium of $4.40/hour, paid overtime and an annual bonus
  • Paid overtime
  • Annual bonus

Benefits & Perks:

  • Flexible Health Care Benefits starting on your 1st day
  • Competitive Defined Contribution Pension with contribution matching by TMMC
  • Vehicle Discounts
  • 19 days paid time off
  • Training on equipment and technologies
  • Tuition reimbursement for career development and personal interest courses
  • Tools and equipment provided
  • Allowance for uniforms
  • Free membership to our onsite fitness center
  • Relocation allowance

 

What you’ll do as a Millwright

Work with advanced manufacturing equipment such as conveyors, overhead and transfer systems, automated guided vehicles, robotic systems, and presses.

  • Work in a fast-paced team-orientated flexible manufacturing environment
  • Perform preventative maintenance on electrical and mechanical equipment under standardized procedures
  • Troubleshoot and repair hydraulic, pneumatic, and electrical equipment
  • Troubleshoot, replace and/or repair machine components including cylinders, pumps, motors, spindles, fixtures, slides, valves, gears, switches, and bearings
  • Perform welding, sheet metal fabricating, hand finishing, grinding, and polishing
  • Design and test hydraulic, pneumatic, and electrical equipment and systems

 

What you need to join our team

  • Ontario or Inter-Provincial 426A/433A Millwright Certificate of Qualification
  • Completion of Apprenticeship as a Millwright with minimum 2 years of relevant work experience as a Licensed Millwright is preferred or 7 years relevant work experience as a Licensed Millwright
  • Ability to work 3 rotating shifts
  • Strong problem-solving skills related to troubleshooting equipment issues, preferably in a fast-paced manufacturing/industrial environment
  • Demonstrated experience troubleshooting and repairing many different types of automated equipment
  • A background in or affinity toward troubleshooting hydraulic, pneumatic, electrical, and machine components
  • Demonstrated experience with PLC - Ladder Logic, VFD 
  • Demonstrated experience performing preventative maintenance on electrical and mechanical equipment
  • Welding and machine shop/fabrication experience
  • Interest in working in a multi-skilled position (mechanical and electrical)
  • Proven ability to adapt to changing priorities and working conditions
  • Passion for teamwork, ongoing learning, continuous improvement, and maintaining a respectful and safe environment
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively with cross-functional team members
  • Rigging and hoisting experience is preferred
  • The flexibility to work at Cambridge and/or Woodstock facility


Apply today and build your career with TMMC.

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us at TMMC_Recruitment@Toyota.com. You can also learn more by visiting our Skilled Trades Career Page.

TMMC is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse team. We believe in enabling people of different ages, sexes, sexual orientations, gender identities, gender expressions, TMMC colours, races, ancestries, citizenships, ethnic origins, places of origin, and creeds to work together and realize their full potential. Applicants with disabilities, please advise us during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.

title: Industrial Maintenance Mechanic (Food Processing Plant)
description:
Shah Trading Co. Ltd is a leader in the food industry with a 40 year history serving customers both in Canada and globally. With a deep understanding of food markets and food safety requirements we are committed to continued leadership, growth, and service to our customers.


We are recruiting for a Maintenance Technician at our Canning Plant located in Scarborough, ON.
 

Job Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Setting up, operating, dismantling, and replacing parts and the assembly of equipment.
  • Timely Preventive Maintenance (PM), troubleshooting, repair and overhaul tasks on all equipment
  • Fabrication of auxiliary equipment including stands, platforms, etc. as directed
  • Participates in process improvement by recommending Preventative Maintenance and Quality improvements
  • Cleaning, sanitizing mechanical equipment, arranging, and cleaning work area
  • Preventative maintenance and troubleshooting equipment.
  • Knowledgeable in regards to the electrics, pneumatics and mechanics of assigned equipment.                  
  • Understand the qualities and properties of the packaging materials used on the assigned equipment
  • Procurement of necessary parts and recommendations for improvement
  • Responsible to ensure proper clean-up activities are complete
  • Comply with all applicable health and safety legislation –
  • Perform any other related duties, or follow any other instructions as may be directed by the Supervisor

Requirements:

  • Must be mechanically skilled or skilled in a trade
  • Prefer candidates with 2-year technical degree (or other formal technical training) in maintenance related field or with a minimum of 5 years experience in an industrial maintenance department.
  • Must have a general knowledge of packaging machinery and have the ability to replace, program, set-up and operate equipment
  • Must be comfortable working at heights and in confined spaces
  • Must know how to use both power and hand tools
  • Certified millwright preferred
  • Some electrical and mechanical knowledge
  • Must have good problem-solving skills
  • Strong attention to detail / Accuracy
  • Good knowledge of Packaging Machines & processes preferred
  • Must comply with all applicable GMP, Health and Safety Training

Personal Suitability

  • Team player
  • Reliability
Shah Trading Company is committed to providing equal opportunities for all applicants and employees regardless of race, ancestry, place of origin, color, ethnic or national origin, citizenship, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences (for which a pardon has been granted), disability, marital or family status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you require an accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please contact us to provide your contact information. While we appreciate all resume submissions, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Millwright
description:
Job Description:

 

 

 

 

Scope of the Position

 

The Millwright will support the preventive and corrective maintenance program for our Ammonium Sulphate plant. They will provide installation, preventive maintenance, trouble-shooting and repair of plant equipment (including conveyors, pumps and compressors, fans and blowers, hydraulic systems, pneumatic systems,   power transmission systems and mobile equipment). This position requires flexibility in meeting multiple job demands and the requirement to assist other trades-persons as and when needed.

 

Rate:   $60.00/hr

Position: hourly, non-exempt

Shift: days - 7 on 7off

 

What You Need To Be Successful

  • 3+ years experience in a journey maintenance role in a hands-on troubleshooting environment
  • Hands-on experience working with Rotating and Stationary equipment is preferred but not mandatory
  • Must have a strong mechanical aptitude with ability to work both independently and a team environment
  • Red Seal Journeyman background needed (4th year apprentices will be considered as well)
  • Strong commitment to Safety and Environmental issues within a plant environment
  • Excellent work ethic with a positive attitude a must
  • Ability to work a rotating shift

 

Key Responsibilities

  • Maintain, install, inspect, replace or repair Plant Equipment
  • Conduct preventative maintenance programs and keep maintenance records
  • Use the Work Order system to track hours, parts and supplies, and equipment history
  • Deal with suppliers and initiate purchases through the Chemtrade Purchasing system
  • Assist other trades-persons as and when needed and supervise an apprentice
  • Perform other maintenance related duties as and when needed
  • Be willing and able to work overtime and be on call as required
  • Maintain familiarity, and comply with all Chemtrade corporate and site Environmental, Safety & Health (ES&H) policies and procedures
  • Immediately report all ES&H incidents (injuries, near misses, releases)
  • Complete all required ES&H training in a timely fashion
  • Follow all Chemtrade facility and corporate ES&H procedures and practices
  • Attend and actively participate in facility ES&H meetings and forums that will drive employee involvement
  • Provide feedback and suggestions for ES&H program improvement
  • Participate in job safety analysis activities, housekeeping tours,  in Safety programs and initiatives, such as Behaviour-Based Observations

Reports to:   Maintenance Manager

 

CHEMTRADE is a publically traded (TSX: CHE.UN) chemical manufacturing and handling company headquartered in Toronto, Canada with 65+ locations across North America and Brazil. Chemtrade provides industrial chemicals and services to our customers in three main business segments; Sulphur & Performance Chemicals, Water Solutions and Electrochemicals. Chemtrade is a reliable industry partner to the Oil & Gas, Pulp & Paper, Water Treatment, Food & Beverage and Pharmaceutical industries and is committed to the codes and ethics of Responsible Care 14001.

 

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

 

Learn more about Chemtrade by visiting www.chemtradelogistics.com or follow us on Facebook.

 

#chemtrade123

 

#chemtrade123

title: Maintenance Worker (Part-time)
description:
It's an amazing time to join Golden Life as we continue to expand our seniors housing, care, and services within western Canada.

We’re looking for a qualified, part-timeMaintenance Workerto join our team at Mountain Side Village in Fruitvale, BC. This position will include work on 1 day (8 hours) a week. If you are an enthusiastic team player, with a passion for providing high quality care and support for seniors, then we would love to hear from you!

Duties will include, but are not limited to:
  • Under the direction of the Community Manager will maintain all aspects of the building including but not limited to building interior, exterior, and grounds, mechanical, electrical and site aesthetics.
  • Ensure preventative maintenance duties on all building components are fulfilled as per the preventative maintenance schedule and manufactures specification.
  • In conjunction with the Community Manager, will review, perform or coordinate all maintenance requests and resident requests; these items will be reviewed daily and will be prioritized in order of importance.
  • Directly deal with trades, suppliers and contracted services that relate to the maintenance department.
  • Works closely with the Community Managers to mitigate all resident and staff
    complaints.
  • Sources new trades, suppliers, material & manpower.
  • Assists the Community Managers in training and ongoing education of staff in
    relation to building system components and maintenance practices.
  • Works closely with construction during the turnover of a new building, addition or
    project.
The successful candidate will meet the following qualifications:
  • A strong mechanical or electrical understanding.
  • Minimum of three years’ related experience.
  • Must have a strong ability to trouble shoot and work through a variety of situations.
  • Ability to multi-task, manage time effectively and prioritize work.
  • Ability to plan, deliver and evaluate budgets.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • The ability to create sound & economical solutions in emergency situation.
  • Able to provide a Clear Vulnerable Sector Criminal Record Check.
  • Able to provide a Physician’s Waiver.
  • Proof of full and current Covid-19 vaccines.
Our culture attracts proactive self-starters who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, inclusion, integrity, passion, and curiosity. If this resonates, maybe you’re the right person to join the Golden Life team.

What we offer you

At Golden Life Management Corporation, we are purpose-led. Our Philosophy is focused entirely upon providing the best possible quality of care to our residents and those we serve. We recognize that engaged employees are necessary to achieve our purpose and our Philosophy.

As a Golden Life Team member, you can expect to be treated with dignity and respect, to be challenged with your work, and to have the autonomy necessary to excel. We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package that includes a voluntary retirement program with company contributions, for eligible employees.

Golden Life welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If this sounds attractive to you, please apply today!

title: Maintenance Technician - Winkler
description:
MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN – Winkler MB
Winkler, MB Area – Full Time Position
                                                                                                                          
POSITION SUMMARY
 
The Maintenance Technician will be responsible for providing general maintenance support and will be based out of the Winkler, MB area.  Travel will be required throughout the province of MB with the possibility of occasional travel to SK.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES 
  • General carpentry
  • Drywall repairs, painting
  • Basic plumbing
  • Moving furniture and equipment
  • Cleaning and organizing
  • Basic welding of stalls and crates
  • Installation of equipment such as feed and water lines and animal stalls
  • Preventative maintenance to generators, tractors and other equipment
  • Active contribution to the preventative maintenance program by submitting recommendations for improvement
  • Document and record all finished and unfinished scheduled work orders
  • Seek out and apply best practices as solutions to correct deficiencies
  • Conduct assessments and/or audits of facilities and/or equipment
  • Minimize production downtime by responding to production calls promptly
  • Provide on the job training to barn staff and other employees
  • Other related duties as assigned
 
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS: 
  • Grade 12 diploma
  • Trades related post-secondary education is preferred
  • Thorough working knowledge of general computer programs (Microsoft Office, Excel)
  • Ability to lift 25 kgs
  • One to three years related experience in general maintenance
  • A valid driver’s license and the ability to travel (including overnighting) within business operation
  • Self-directed/motivated team player
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to work in a livestock farm (hogs) atmosphere
  • Ability to adhere to all Biosecurity requirements
  • Knowledge of Health and Safety regulations
  • The ability to work at various heights and in confined spaces
  • An ability to live and teach our Maple Leaf Leadership Values
 
Please submit resume to:
Email:

mlafjobs@mapleleaf.com



Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees.  As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination.   In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022).  We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position. We offer a diverse workforce inclusive to all.

title: Facilities Engineering
description:
Toyota Motor Manufacturing Canada (TMMC) is a world-class automotive facility with manufacturing plants located in Cambridge and Woodstock, Ontario. Our plants currently manufacture the best-selling Toyota RAV4, RAV4 Hybrid and the Lexus RX 350 and RX 450h vehicles, and will also soon be building the popular Lexus NX and Lexus NX Hybrid models. Recognized year after year on the global stage for manufacturing quality by our customers, we are also recognized as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers.


The world-famous Toyota Production System, a philosophy of continuous improvement and on-going training, enables each Team Member to work towards their highest potential. The results of our company stem from hiring committed, self-motivated team members, with the ability to work together to achieve team goals.
 

What We Offer

  • Competitive compensation package including overtime pay and annual bonus
  • Flexible health benefits plan after 12 weeks; including Medical, Life Insurance, Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurance and a Health Care Spending Account
  • 12-Paid vacation days, including 1-week in July
  • Vitality Wellness App that encourages and rewards you for leading a healthier lifestyle
  • Company Diversity and Inclusion business partnering groups
  • Employee Vehicle Discounts
  • Build friendly and long-lasting relationships through social events and an on-site fitness facility

 

Contract ending Sept. 29, 2023

 

In our Facilities Engineering role at TMMC, you will support operations and maintenance of the Assembly Plant Facilities.  This role is responsible for leading capital projects, energy reduction, cost control, ISO and legal code compliance, managing service contracts and supporting the daily operation of the facility.

 

What you’ll be doing

  • Provide technical support to all aspects of the power plant’s operations
  • Execute capital investment projects and coordinate all aspects of execution (i.e. budget, schedule, install, commissioning and buy-off)
  • Monitor equipment performance to identify continuous improvement opportunities
  • Coordinate contractor activities for project support or maintenance refurbishments
  • Conduct troubleshooting and problem-solving activities, provide solutions and support for process/quality/equipment related issues
  • Provide technical support to other departments such as Production Control, Quality Control, Human Resources, Information Services and Engineering Specialists in other shops
  • Support U.S. affiliates by participating in technical working groups for capital projects and daily operations

 

Desired Skills and Experiences

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Chemical, Electrical or Mechanical preferred) or equivalent degree
  • Must meet the educational and character requirements for P.Eng. license eligibility
  • Minimum of 1 to 3 years of post graduate engineering experience in manufacturing (automotive preferred) with high emphasis on process design, setup improvements or continuous improvement initiatives
  • Multi-disciplinary experience in facilities or equipment engineering
  • Advanced MS Excel skills; strong aptitude in data mining, trending, analysis and reporting
  • Demonstrated experience applying legal, safety, and regulatory code requirements (Pre-Start Heath & Safety Review (PSHSR), Fire Codes, Building Codes)
  • Strong proficiency with technical drawings, AutoCAD and 3D imaging software
  • Strong problem-solving skills with ability to combine theory and practical hands-on approach
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple and significantly complex projects and assignments with high level of autonomy and accountability for results 
  • Experience with control systems, networks, and programmable logic controllers (PLC’s) of various manufacturers and vintages preferred
  • Demonstrated experience with HVAC controls is preferred
  • Demonstrated experience with waste water and water treatment is preferred
  • Willing to support daily and weekend overtime requirements as needed
  • Possible travel to USA and Japan
  • Must be flexible to work in Cambridge and/or Woodstock

 


If you have any questions, please reach out to TMMC_Recruitment@Toyota.com. To promote a comfortable, safe and productive work environment, as well as to comply with all federal, provincial and/or local laws, TMMC is a smoke-free property.

TMMC is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse team. We believe in enabling people of different ages, sexes, sexual orientations, gender identities, gender expressions, colours, races, ancestries, citizenships, ethnic origins, places of origin, and creeds to work together and realize their full potential. TMMC is committed to compliance with all applicable legislation including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.

title: Millwright - Midnight shift
description:
Posted Date:4/28/2022
Job Category:
Position Title:Millwright - Midnight shift
Salary Range:$37.00 - $39.30
Location:Bradford, Ontario, Canada
Desired Skills:
Description:Our client, a world class manufacturer, has an immediate requirement for an Industrial Millwright on their midnight shift. This person is accountable to support the Maintenance function by preventing and repairing mechanical breakdowns.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:
Opportunity to work for a very well respected, world class manufacturer that has enjoyed many years of success and stability.
Paid additional training and development.
Excellent growth and advancement opportunities.
An excellent compensation package including:
- Competitive salary
- Excellent benefits
- RRSP matching
- Profit sharing

QUALIFICATIONS & SKILLS:
• 3 to 5 years of work related experience.
• Minimum Certified Tradesman (Maintenance Mechanic/Millwright)
• Minimum 1 year directly related trade experience in a manufacturing or industrial environment.
• Skilled in Hydraulics, Pneumatics, and Mechanics and Controls

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO:
• Perform repairs to machinery and plant support systems with regards to hydraulics, pneumatics, and mechanical problems
• Perform preventative maintenance (PM) schedules (as required) on machinery and Plant Support equipment
• Suggest preventative measures to minimize or eliminate breakdowns
• Maintain correct safety standards at all times
• Diagnose and repair basic electrical problems with equipment

CONTACT + RESUME SUBMISSION:
If you feel you are an excellent candidate and have the required skills and experience indicated above, please send your attached resume and any important details to HCR Permanent Search, care of the Recruitment Consultant listed below. Only those who meet the minimum qualifications above and are eligible to work in Canada without restriction will be contacted. Thank you for your interest.

Please ensure that you indicate the name of the position you are applying for in the subject heading. Thank you for your interest.

Dennis Bossé
Director of Operations
HCR Permanent Search
Email: dbosse@hcr.ca
Phone: 905-669-2400 x2236

title: Facility Assistant
description:
Pharma Medica Research Inc. is a full-service contract research organization in need of a Facility Assistant to join our team!  The Facility Assistant is  responsible for the maintenance of the clinic facility and maintain cleanliness in an orderly fashion.  The Facility Assistant ensures that any cleaning requirements according to protocol and guidelines are met at Pharma Medica Research Inc. (PMRI). The Facility Assistant reports to the Supervisor, Clinic Administration and/or designate.

Duties and Responsibilities

The Facility Assistant is responsible for ensuring all rooms in the building are maintained and kept in an orderly fashion.  

The Facility Assistant ensures floors are swept and damp-mopped, carpets are vacuumed and spot cleaned, furniture, fixtures and equipment are dusted, responsible for moving furniture as required, removing obvious finger marks and smudges, spot clean light switches, walls and doors, damp-wipe telephones with a germicidal agent.  Areas should be cleaned and polished, glass doors/partitions and any mirrors are maintained.

All fixtures and sinks in the kitchen and washrooms should be cleaned, responsible for removing garbage to a designated area for disposal, perform cleaning duties as required in the clinic and office areas including washrooms. These duties include but are not limited to, vacuuming, dusting, removal of garbage, sweeping and damp mopping as required.  Make all necessary repairs that will be requested by your supervisor, place recycling waste in the appropriate area, damp-wipe all heaters and ledges, dust all low and high reach areas, damp-wipe tables, chairs, desks and leather sofas.

Maintenance of the supply room in an orderly fashion. General building maintenance including repairs, painting etc.  Clear snow and provide salt at all doorways during winter weather.

And other duties as required.

    Requirements:

    • Completion of High School
    • Excellent communication skills including excellent English verbal and written skills.
    • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with other clinical staff.
    • Excellent interpersonal skills.
    •* Valid drivers' license*
    • Ability to work both independently and as a team member.
    • Knowledge of general repairs

    If interested, apply today!

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Maintenance Technician

 

Purpose

  • Work closely and in partnership with Operational Management, EHS, HR and Trainers/Assessors to develop a robust training and development functional and role based (maintenance, manufacturing and safety critical) competency assessment process.
  • Project manages all aspects of the identification of training need, design, delivery, assessment and verification processes for in-house job-related training and competency assessment.
  • Directly manages and coordinates the Assessors across the business, to develop a standard efficient and robust training (maintenance, manufacturing and safety critical) competency assessment process.
  • To identify cost effective ways to fully utilise internal training and reduce the cost of external training.

 

Responsibilities

  • Delivery of KPIs against target. Consistent management of training interventions, systems and role based competency assessment processes to Alstom Level 3, delivered in accordance with project plan to time and quality.
  • Delivery of training plan, against actual. Budgetary responsibility on planned versus actual and savings on external expenditure.
  • Production of regular project reports/recommendations on in-house training process/competency assessment from design, delivery to external accreditation/verification, if appropriate
  • Assess relevant training needs for staff individuals and organisation, in consultation with departmental heads, including assessment methods and measurement systems entailed.
  • Plan departmental/functional training budgets, forecast costs and delegate numbers as required by organisational planning and budgeting systems.
  • Recruit, manage and develop direct-reporting staff
  • Ensure in-house trainers deliver high quality, cost effective training interventions in line with customer and business requirements in accordance with rail legislation/regulations.
  • Develop and roll out competence based assessment scheme for all Safety Critical staff
  • Ensure training and assessment processes are audit compliant
  • Represent the company at training/customer training audits
  • Stays informed as to relevant skill and qualifications levels required by staff for effective performance, and circulate requirements and relevant information to the organisation as appropriate.
  • Produce organisational strategy and plans to meet training and development needs, and manage training delivery, measurement and follow-up as necessary.
  • Design training courses and programmes necessary to meet training needs, or manage this activity via external provider(s).
  • Identify, select and manage external training and accreditation bodies, agencies and providers necessary to deliver required training to appropriate standards.
  • Plan and deliver training courses personally where necessary to augment that provided externally or internally by others.
  • Arrange for the maintenance of all necessary equipment and materials relating to the effective delivery and measurement of training.
  • To provide regular and timely updates/feedback and KPI'S to relevant managers
  • Development/maintenance of training database/record keeping systems
  • Ensure all training activities and materials meet with relevant organisational and statutory policies, including health and safety, employment and equality laws.
  • Monitor and report on activities, costs, performance, etc. as required.
  • Benchmark and share best practice with other ALSTOM businesses and external companies, keeping abreast of new thinking on learning tools and technologies.

 

Requirements

  • 10y+ of experience in heavy industry
  • 3y+ of experience in training deployment
  • Excellent project management, organisational and planning skills.
  • Good written and oral skills.
  • Qualified in Learning and Development, or equivalent proven experience in Learning & Development.
  • Technical qualification/background and Assessor qualification.
  • Trainer/Teacher qualification/background
  • Knowledge of rail industry/group standards.
  • People management/project management skills.
  • Self motivated and customer focused.

Maintenance Technician

Purpose

  • Work closely and in partnership with Operational Management, EHS, HR and Trainers/Assessors to develop a robust training and development functional and role based (maintenance, manufacturing and safety critical) competency assessment process.
  • Project manages all aspects of the identification of training need, design, delivery, assessment and verification processes for in-house job-related training and competency assessment.
  • Directly manages and coordinates the Assessors across the business, to develop a standard efficient and robust training (maintenance, manufacturing and safety critical) competency assessment process.
  • To identify cost effective ways to fully utilise internal training and reduce the cost of external training.

Responsibilities

  • Delivery of KPIs against target. Consistent management of training interventions, systems and role based competency assessment processes to Alstom Level 3, delivered in accordance with project plan to time and quality.
  • Delivery of training plan, against actual. Budgetary responsibility on planned versus actual and savings on external expenditure.
  • Production of regular project reports/recommendations on in-house training process/competency assessment from design, delivery to external accreditation/verification, if appropriate
  • Assess relevant training needs for staff individuals and organisation, in consultation with departmental heads, including assessment methods and measurement systems entailed.
  • Plan departmental/functional training budgets, forecast costs and delegate numbers as required by organisational planning and budgeting systems.
  • Recruit, manage and develop direct-reporting staff
  • Ensure in-house trainers deliver high quality, cost effective training interventions in line with customer and business requirements in accordance with rail legislation/regulations.
  • Develop and roll out competence based assessment scheme for all Safety Critical staff
  • Ensure training and assessment processes are audit compliant
  • Represent the company at training/customer training audits
  • Stays informed as to relevant skill and qualifications levels required by staff for effective performance, and circulate requirements and relevant information to the organisation as appropriate.
  • Produce organisational strategy and plans to meet training and development needs, and manage training delivery, measurement and follow-up as necessary.
  • Design training courses and programmes necessary to meet training needs, or manage this activity via external provider(s).
  • Identify, select and manage external training and accreditation bodies, agencies and providers necessary to deliver required training to appropriate standards.
  • Plan and deliver training courses personally where necessary to augment that provided externally or internally by others.
  • Arrange for the maintenance of all necessary equipment and materials relating to the effective delivery and measurement of training.
  • To provide regular and timely updates/feedback and KPI'S to relevant managers
  • Development/maintenance of training database/record keeping systems
  • Ensure all training activities and materials meet with relevant organisational and statutory policies, including health and safety, employment and equality laws.
  • Monitor and report on activities, costs, performance, etc. as required.
  • Benchmark and share best practice with other ALSTOM businesses and external companies, keeping abreast of new thinking on learning tools and technologies.

 

Requirements

  • 10y+ of experience in heavy industry
  • 3y+ of experience in training deployment
  • Excellent project management, organisational and planning skills.
  • Good written and oral skills.
  • Qualified in Learning and Development, or equivalent proven experience in Learning & Development.
  • Technical qualification/background and Assessor qualification.
  • Trainer/Teacher qualification/background
  • Knowledge of rail industry/group standards.
  • People management/project management skills.
  • Self motivated and customer focused.

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
Black & McDonald’s Saskatchewan team is growing! If you are a hands-on, customer service-oriented, and technically-inclined professional searching for the opportunity to build a solid foundation for your career, this position is for you. The Maintenance Worker is located in Regina & 15 Wing Moose Jaw and reports directly to the Project Manager.

The Maintenance Worker is responsible for facility general maintenance and repairs, minor carpentry, drywall repair and painting, preventative maintenance, and assisting other trades.

  • Prepare areas for painting by repairing & patching surfaces.
  • Perform various duties to maintain the Facility including work associated with carpentry, furniture, drywall, painting, mechanical & plumbing repairs.
  • Assist with obtaining quotes, meet with sub-contractors and quote work.
  • Provide repairs and preventative maintenance to locks, doors & door closing systems.
  • Responsible for replacing locks, hinges, changing cores and adjusting door closers.
  • Assist other maintenance trades and perform other duties, e.g. changing filters or fan belts, preparing HVAC & plumbing systems for operation or winterization.
  • Assist in grounds keeping and snow removal
  • Performs daily rounds and log readings.
  • Complete maintenance records and work orders; input histories and comments as required.
  • Observe and implement safety regulations and practices.
  • Maintain the cleanliness of all sites, workspaces, and mechanical rooms.

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Holds Self and Others Accountable
  • Teamwork and Collaboration
  • Values and Respects Others
  • Change Orientation
  • Continuous Learning
  • Customer Focus
  • Problem Solving & Innovation
  • Working Knowledge of Email Platforms & Calendars

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • A minimum of 3 years’ experience in all aspects of facility maintenance.

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Basic general maintenance knowledge and experience.
  • Knowledge of the Health and Safety Act and all applicable CSA Codes.
  • Must be able to speak, read & write in English.
  • Must work in compliance with the provisions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and the regulations including but not limited to: use or wear of equipment or protective devices or clothing for safety purposes, report any known contravention of this Act or regulations or the existence of any hazards.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills required.
  • Follow instructions both written and verbal.
  • Maintain a professional demeanor at all times with fellow employees and customer.
  • Maintain clear and courteous phone etiquette.
  • A team player, committed to working in a quality environment.
  • Comply with all company policies and procedures and adhere to company standards.
  • Act in accordance with the commitment to safe and compassionate patient care and a safe and healthy work environment.
  • Must be able to lift up to 30 kg (bending and lifting is required).
  • Must be able to work on ladder or scaffold at various heights.
  • Must be able to pass Federal Security Clearance to work on military facilities.
  • Must provide proof of double vaccination to meet Covid protocols.

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Maintenance Worker III
description:
Our client is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you need to be accommodated during any phase of the evaluation process, please use the Contact information below to request specialized accommodation. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.

Duties:
  • Provides semi-skilled and general maintenance, repair, building, and installation services
  • Acceptable experience in routine maintenance tasks, general labouring, and/or building maintenance tasks including the operation and maintenance of hand and power tools.
  • Acceptable experience in providing leadership, supervision and direction to work crews, reviewing crew work and performance management;
  • Acceptable experience in the supervision of job sites in relation to the maintenance and repair of built infrastructure at campgrounds, and day use areas, and other built assets.
  • Acceptable is defined by a minimum of 12 months experience.
Knowledge:
  • Knowledge of building maintenance and construction techniques;
  • Knowledge of appropriate use, care and maintenance of construction and maintenance equipment;
  • Knowledge of safety procedures;
  • Knowledge of Parks Canada and its mandate and corporate objectives including the National Parks Act, park regulations and policies.

Abilities:

  • Ability to supervise staff, including use of constructive criticism and positive reinforcement;
  • Ability to construct and/or maintain assets including not limited to buildings, roads, campgrounds and day use areas;
  • Ability to lead, plan and organize for successful delivery of project requirements;
  • Ability to read and interpret construction plans and specifications;
  • Ability to think analytically, problem-solve and make decisions;
  • Ability to maintain logs and records;
  • Ability to use a variety of computer software programs such as Microsoft Office and e-mail;
  • Ability to lift and carry 45 kilograms or allowable under OHS requirements.
Personal Suitability:
  • Provides vision and leadership;
  • Personally connects with others;
  • Exercises sound judgment;
  • Dependable;
  • Demonstrates initiative;
  • Works well in adverse weather conditions;
  • Helps create a team environment.
Other condition(s) of employment:
  • You are required to possess and maintain a valid Class 5 driver’s licence recognized by the province/territory applicable to this offer of employment.
  • You must be willing to work overtime.
  • You will be required to work shift-work, and/or weekends, and/or statutory holidays and provincial/territorial holidays as scheduled by your delegated manager.
  • You may be required to wear a uniform while performing your duties. In this case, Parks Canada will provide you with the uniforms you require in accordance with the Parks Canada Uniform Policy;
  • You must be willing to work and travel in a variety of terrains and weather conditions in the performance of the duties.
  • You must be willing to obtain and maintain a valid Standard First Aid and CPR-C.
  • You will be required to work primarily on job sites, and have minor administrative functions.

title: Millwright and Rigging Estimator
description:
ABOUT US:

Established in 1934 as a small plumbing and heating company, E.S. Fox Limited today is recognized as a pre-eminent Canadian multi-trade Industrial, Commercial, Institutional and Nuclear constructor and fabricator. E.S. Fox Limited works in the industries of oil and gas, petrochemical, mining, pulp and paper, steel, automotive, pharmaceutical, casinos, hotels, hospitals, schools, and themed entertainment.

The company is headquartered in Niagara Falls, Ontario, and maintains full-service regional offices in Hamilton, Toronto, Port Robinson, Oshawa, Tiverton, Kingston, Sudbury, and Thunder Bay.

With a strong commitment to health, safety, and the protection of the environment, E.S. Fox Limited has earned a reputation as a people-first, environmentally conscious, socially responsible constructor.

The Niagara Falls, ON head office is looking for an organized and professional Millwright and Rigging Estimator to join the Estimating team.

SUMMARY OF THE ROLE:

Responsible for analyzing, negotiating, estimating, and pricing scopes of work for the purposes of assembling trade estimates and quotations.


KEY CUSTOMERS SERVED:

  • Prospective Customer
  • Suppliers and Vendors
  • Company Managers
  • Tool, Purchasing and Estimating Groups

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND/OR SERVICES PROVIDED:

  • Reviews bid packages to determine resources required to complete request for quotation
  • Coordinates estimate between trades involved, ensuring tender scope is being fully accounted for in the most cost efficient manner
  • Review bid documents and determine which sub-contractors need to be involved in the completion of the bid
  • May need to prepare Scope of Work for other trades or subcontractors
  • Prepares detailed bid packages for applicable trades and subcontractors for their use in preparing supporting quotations
  • Assembles pricing
  • Assesses cost of rentals, tools, equipment, non-productive labour and determine average labour rate
  • Assists in tender proposal requirements, including:
    • review of terms and conditions
    • bonding and insurance requirements
    • tender breakdown requirements
    • organization charts and resumes
    • preliminary schedules
  • Assembles estimate and pricing and review with Estimating Manager including:
    • labour efficiencies and productivity related issues
    • indirect labour requirements
    • construction equipment requirements
    • overhead and profit levels
  • Prepares material takeoff
  • Participates in post tender activities, such as:
    • coordination of sales effort and follow up
    • tender review meeting
    • tender negotiations
    • project initiation activities
  • Attends kick off meeting as required
  • Maintains up to date knowledge and awareness of current market conditions affecting the cost of construction
  • Maintains knowledge of contract laws and obligations, material specifications, scheduling and regional variations affecting the supply of labour, materials and modern construction methods
  • Ensures responsibilities and accountabilities are carried out in a safe manner in accordance with E.S. Fox Limited safety policy/procedures, ISO 18001 standards and OHSA requirements
  • Ensures that environmental aspects within his/her sphere of responsibility are adhered to pursuant to ISO 14001 requirements

KNOWLEDGE AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Construction Estimator experience or enrolled in the Gold Seal Estimator Certification program (C.C.A.) and/or
  • Construction Industry Trade experience would be an asset
  • Completion of required courses through the Canadian Institute of Quantity Surveyors would be an asset

SPECIFIC EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:

  • Trade experience would be an asset
  • Scheduling experience would be an asset
  • Knowledge of multi-trade disciplines would be an asset

PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES:

  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Excellent interpersonal relations
  • Proficiency in Word, Excel, Microsoft Project
  • Team player
  • Works well under time constraints and deadlines

E.S. Fox Limited is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. We will accommodate applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please advise Human Resources to ensure your accessibility needs are accommodated throughout this process.

Fox Limited today is recognized as a pre-eminent Canadian multi-trade Industrial, Commercial, Institutional and Nuclear constructor and fabricator. E.S. title: Millwright
description:
Millwright


Position Description


Job Summary


We are looking for a experienced Millwright for our Factory Services department. As a Milllwright, the job consists of repairing, rebuilding, replacing and reproducing equipment and equipment components by gas cutting, welding and brazing. As and when required, the Millwright does minor mechanical work. In this position you will also fabricate and install new equipment and facilities. Performs all duties in a safe, responsible manner, observing all Plant and Government regulations. Observes and reports all unsafe conditions to the Shift Supervisor.


OBJECTIVE:


To strive for continuous improvement in quality and productivity on a daily basis.


The Millwright reports to the Shift Supervisor and/or the Production Manager.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


1. Maintain and repair all plant machinery and facilities using any and all equipment and tools as required.

2. Read and interpret blueprints, measure and layout operations, select work piece materials, repair or build machines or components to pre-scribed tolerances.

3. Perform necessary repairs and modifications to buildings/facilities.

4. Work with Maintenance/Production Supervisor.

5. Maintain clean and safe work area.

6. Obey all existing fire and safety regulations.


STANDARDS OF PERFORMANCE:


1. Correct procedures must be known and followed in:


+ Making linear and angular measurements

+ Making simple layout

+ Selecting the right type of rods and amperage for arc welding


1. Be conscientious, dependable and cooperative in performing the job and maintain an efficient operation by meeting satisfactory factory standard of work quality, work output, safety, good housekeeping to 5S Plant Standards and orderliness.

2. Must possess a thorough understanding of all safety standards, regulations and Saint-Gobain Policies and Procedures.


Required Qualifications


The Millwright must be able to fulfill the following requirements:


1. Must have Grade 12 Technical School training in the welding trade, or be Certified under the Apprenticeship and Tradesmen’s Qualification Act.

2. Physically able of performing the job

3. Communicate clearly both verbally and in writing with other personnel. Submit neat and accurate reports.

4. Must know how to use a template to layout and produce elbows, transitions, cylinders and conical shapes.

5. Must know how to prepare the material for welding .

6. Be conscientious in the performance of all duties and require a minimum of supervision.

7. Have the ability to lead a group of workers on a repair job and make decisions regarding the job.

8. Must comprehend oral and written instructions sufficiently to carry them out properly and efficiently.

9. Perform all other duties that are associates with the job as and when requested by the Shift Supervisor .

10. Must be familiar with and observe all Company safety rules and regulations.

11. Must complete all safety training as assigned.

12. Participate in World Class Manufacturing activities as requested.

13. Must adhere to the General Principles of Conduct and Action of the Saint-Gobain Group.


Company Summary


With over 60,000 employees working across 46 countries, Saint-Gobain’s Innovative Materials Sector boasts a unique and profitable portfolio of high-tech and high value-added solutions for housing and construction, mobility, healthcare and industry.


A true technology bridgehead for the Saint-Gobain Group, the Innovative Materials Sector is supported by 3 powerful growth drivers: innovation, co-development and research.


In the field of High Performance Materials, it proposes a comprehensive range of innovative technologies targeting the housing and construction market, transport, industry and healthcare, and combined into four families of materials: ceramics, polymers, abrasives and technical fabrics. Flat Glass is a world leader in manufacturing, processing and selling glass products for the construction and transportation sector (including the automotive industry).


At Saint-Gobain we design, manufacture and distribute materials which are key ingredients in the wellbeing of each of us and the future of all. Join our innovative, passionate and entrepreneurial community to improve the world of tomorrow with us.


Legal Statement


Saint-Gobain is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout the recruitment process to applicants upon their request. This commitment is in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA).


Millwright


Location: Niagara Falls, CA-ON


Posting Date: 03/01/2022


Job Code: CAN00082


See yourself here (https://maps.google.com/?q=SG+Canada+-+SGP+%28Chippawa%29 NIAGARA FALLS CA-ON)

title: Crew Member/Labourer on Property Maintenance Crew
description:
We are looking for a self-motivated, detail-oriented and hardworking individual to be a crew member on a property maintenance crew.  This position can lead to a crew leader position. 

Requirements for a successful applicant:

  • must have own transportation to and from the shop
  • general knowledge of equipment
  • critical thinking
  • ability to work as a team player
  • reliable & punctual

Experience is an asset but we are willing to train. 

Payment is based on experience.  Benefits are available after a short probationary period for full-time employees.

title: Maintenance Tech - Manufacturing
description:
Maintenance Technician - Manufacturing

POSITION PURPOSE:
Maintain, troubleshoot, and repair manufacturing machinery and facilities at the Clinson Missouri Printing and Packaging Plants.  (Includes maintaining equipment safety devices and the use of proper safety procedures.)
 
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Maintain familiarity with production and support equipment. 
  • Provide electrical and mechanical support to ensure proper operation of production machinery
  • Perform project work as assigned. 
  • Complete all paperwork such as work orders, parts usage sheets and misc. logs as required.
  • Know  safety requirements for Lock Out / Tag Out, Hazard Com. Std. and equipment specific safety procedures
  • Handle waste material in accordance with TC Transcontinental policy and training provided at new hire orientation and annual training thereafter. 
  • Interact and communicate problems and their resolutions to all levels of plant personnel including machine operators, team leaders, engineers, and other members of management, in a positive, team building fashion.


Requirements
2-3 years industrial maintenance experience or equivalent education/training: working knowledge of electrical, pneumatics, hydraulics and PLC’s.  Consideration to candidates with applicable education and less experience.

title: Maintenance Licensed Millwright - Permanent Full Time
description:
Overview:

Our Environment: We provide a positive team-oriented environment where a collaborative approach with the sharing of knowledge is encouraged. Our permanent full time Mechanics mentor apprentices and seasonal staff while having the room to grow, develop skills and advance their own careers. Working at Canadaâ€™s Wonderland, you will perform rewarding work in a niche industry and have the opportunity to work both indoors and outdoors throughout the year. You will obtain an Amusement license certificate (ADM-AR) while being paid and maintain and repair unique equipment with top tier mechanics in the industry.

 

Candidate Profile:  The ideal candidate will be an experienced Millwright with excellent experience and proven strong trouble shooting skills coupled with a positive attitude towards both peers and the public. Willing to learn and be flexible to adapt to different situations that arise throughout the day, this individual will be able to work with our Rides Preventative Maintenance program while assisting with projects as assigned.

 

Scope of Position: A â€œhands-onâ€ individual who is responsible to assist with the maintenance and installation of all mechanical/welding needs in our Rides Maintenance Department.

 

Benefits: We proudly offer an industry leading benefit package for all our permanent associates including a robust pension plan, healthcare, annual bonus, RRSP, 3 weeks' vacation to start, disability insurance, life insurance and more. We also offer some fun perks like passes to the Park for friends and family.

 

Responsibilities:
  • Rebuild and/or repair of equipment as specified
  • Maintain all required service records and logs
  • Make recommendations for improvements, modification, upgrades and report findings to Supervisor on a timely basis
  • Assist with major overhauls, modifications and alterations as required
  • Ensure the safe operation of each work area and each work project
  • Assist with general cleaning, inspection and reassemble equipment as needed
  • Responsible for assisting with daily preventative maintenance program
  • Install new equipment
Qualifications:

  • Mechanic or Millwright license required

  • Valid Ontario driverâ€™s license (must provide driverâ€™s abstract)

  • Must obtain TSSA license after completing the required hours

  • Experience in a diverse industrial environment

  • Strong mechanical aptitude and strong communication skills both written and oral

  • Ability to work both day and afternoon shifts, weekends and holidays as required

  • Proven abilities to problem solve, trouble shoot and work with deadlines

  • Ownership of tools and safety boots a must

  • Exposure to machining equipment an asset

  • Diverse background trouble shooting hydraulics an asset

  • Welding experience is an asset (SMAW all position CWB certified welder/fitter)

  • Ability to work outdoors in all types of weather conditions

  • Required to meet the physical demands of the job including weights of up to 23kg, heights of  106m, frequent standing, walking, twisting, reaching, bending, crawling and ability to work with ladders

title: Plant Maintenance Technician
description:
Overview:

 

 

PLANT MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN

 

Hermitage Processing Inc., a division of Cooke Aquaculture Inc., a dynamic and growing east coast family company, with Platinum Member status in the Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Companies Program has an opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join the Companyâ€™s Maintenance Team based out of our facility located in Hermitage, NL.

Cooke is a global seafood company with operations in North America, Europe, and South America. Our companyâ€™s success is driven by our dynamic, highly-skilled and innovative management team, supported by dedicated employees who live in coastal communities and contribute to the local areaâ€™s economy and sense of community.

 

The Role:
As a result of our robust growth, we are adding to our maintenance team of professionals. Reporting to the Plant Manager, this position will be responsible for the repair and service of equipment as per maintenance schedule. You will be required to detect and troubleshoot irregularities and malfunctions as well as perform safety and security checks on equipment and building.

 

The ideal candidate will be a team player who possess excellent problem solving and communication skills. Preference will be given to applicants who are mechanically inclined with a background in and understanding of preventative maintenance. This position is based mainly out of our Hermitage Processing Plant facility; however, support to the maintenance departments of our 24/7 operations may be required.

 

Salary commensurate with experience which includes a competitive health and dental benefit package.

 

The Opportunity:
The role description is just one part of the story. This is an opportunity to grow, to stretch, to work within the parameters of the role but stretch to your fullest potential. We are a team that counts performance, we reward contribution and we recognize talent. It is about being at the center of the fastest growing company in New Brunswick and knowing you are part of that growth. The ability to bring your passion for learning, desire for growth, and energy for moving your career forward is what we offer.

The Why:
Why Cookeâ€¦simple because we are a company that rewards initiative, resourcefulness and work ethic. We will champion your growth and provide you with the platform to create your path, your career, and your future.

title: Technician ( Apprentice or Licensed )
description:
If you are looking for a fast-paced, customer-focused environment where you can start your career or grow your skills alongside one of the best teams of mechanics in Atlantic Canada, Peterbilt Atlantic is the place to do it. Peterbilt Atlantic now boasts eight locations across Atlantic Canada and eastern Québec. We offer a state-of-the-art work environment and a comprehensive benefits plan, including pension and healthcare benefits. It’s your opportunity to work alongside a top-notch team in some of the most modern facilities in the region.
 
Note : Must be available to work nights
Pay range would be based on experience and/or blocks 

Benefits 

  • Blue Cross Insurance 
  • RRSP Contributions 
  • Paid time off and vacation
  • Long Term Disability
  • Growth opportunities 
  • Paid Training
  • Family owned and operated
  • Long term job security
  • Discounts on products and services
  • Above average industry pay.
Technician Specific Benefits
  • Relocation assistance available for qualified candidates
  • In-floor heat at most locations
  • State-of-the-art, brand new facility with multiple service bays and cutting edge technology
  • Multiple bays with lifts
  • Shop equipped with the newest technology and equipment
  • Uniforms provided 
  • Discounts on products and services
  • Highly productive shop
  • Career advancement opportunities, promote from within
  • Certification reimbursement and all training expenses paid to further your career
  • Continued education, manufacturer hands on and web based training
  • Clean and professional work environment 
  • Apprenticeship program 
  • Competitive wages 
  • In-house dealer trainer/TC
Responsibilities
  • Provide assistance to Service Department for vehicles and equipment.
  • Observe, listen, and learn from the Diesel Technician.
  • Follow checklists, ensuring all critical parts are examined.
  • Examine and adjust protective guards, loose bolts, and specified safety devices on trucks as needed.
  • Test-drive vehicles to ensure that they run smoothly.
  • Tag all warranty parts and returns to Warranty Clerk.
  • Attend training classes and keep tabs on factory technical bulletins.
  • Develop and maintain positive relationships with customers to increase overall customer happiness.
Qualifications
  • Teammate with dream to advance technical career
  • Self-motivated and professional
  • Strong customer service skills/experience
  • Licensed or registered apprentice
  • High school diploma or equivalent 
  • Experience in the heavy duty truck industry preferred

 

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Maintenance / General Handyman (PT)
description:
RETIRED TOO SOON? LIKE HANDMAN WORK? THIS COULD BE JUST THE P/T JOB FOR YOU! 

COIT Services is the industry leader in specialty in-home cleaning services. We have been in business for over 71 years, and are centrally located in North Burnaby, BC.

Job Details:
  • We are currently seeking a part-time maintenance person to do:
  • General handyman work, some assistance to the full-time mechanic in the maintenance of trucks and cleaning equipment.
  • Groundskeeping duties, some maintenance of the building, etc. on a part-time basis.
  • Ideally, we are looking for someone to work 24 hours weekly. 
  • A schedule of three 8 hour days a week, including Saturdays (no Sundays).
This is a great position for a semi-retired individual who wants to keep "a little busy", and work for a long-standing, reliable company with good ethics & integrity. 

Position reports to the Assistant General Manager.
