title: Maintenance Service Worker
description:
Maintenance Service Worker

Education Department

 

ABOUT FORT MCKAY

The Fort McKay First Nation (FMFN) is composed of over 800 band members, including those of Cree and Dene heritage, with approximately 400 members residing in the hamlet of Fort McKay â€” a community located approximately 65 km north of Fort McMurray. Fort McKay offers the best of both worlds: remote northern life for the nature lover and proximity to a large city of about 70,000 people with all the amenities you need.

ABOUT THE NEW SCHOOL - Opening Fall of 2022 - Come Join the Team!

The Fort McKay First Nation is nearing completion of its Brand-New K-9 school located in the community of Fort McKay. The Elsie Fabian School will be opening its doors September of 2022 and we are looking for dynamic and passionate Educators who love Northern Living to join the team! The school will incorporate both the Dene and Cree Language, culture, and Land-Based Education where students will learn about their rich local history. Fort McKay is looking for talented educators who practice and believe that the well-being of the child is at the center of everything; this is the shared practice and belief of the Fort McKay elders, parents and community members.

The foundation of the Elsie Fabian School is engagement in teaching and learning, parents and community, culture and traditions, and a school environment based on the principles of love, responsibility, respect, listening, nurturing, relationships, humility and learning. Join us and be apart of the Fort McKay community - a Nation that is committed toadvancing quality education for all First Nations learners by connecting to land and honouring our languages.

ABOUT THE ROLE

We are seeking a highly dependable individual who is dedicated to safety and is committed to providing excellent customer service to fill the Maintenance Service Worker role.  This individual will perform general maintenance work in and around the school and other facilities operated by the district. The Maintenance Service Worker will ensure the school and other facilities are in good working condition and safe for the students, staff and public. This is a full-time position and will work under the direction of thePrincipal.   


KEY RESPONSIBITIES

Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • General cleaning of assigned building area.
  • Move, transport and assemble furniture and equipment.
  • Perform repair of general maintenance work on facilities, buildings, grounds, and equipment at the school or directed locations.
  • Coordinate with the Building Administrator(s) for the purpose of completing projects and work orders efficiently.
  • Inspect facilities, systems and their components for the purpose of identifying necessary repairs and preventative maintenance.
  • Perform facility inspections as required.
  • Install items such as white boards and bulletin boards.
  • Complete all work orders safely and within established time frames.
  • Maintain and repair tools, equipment and other systems and/or components to ensure they are in safe operating condition.
  • Respond to emergency situations for the purpose of resolving immediate safety concerns.
  • Activating and deactivate building alarms and responding to alarm calls during and after regular work hours.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

KEY REQUIREMENTS

  • High school diploma or equivalent is required
  • Experience and training in the areas of carpentry, plumbing, heating, mechanical and other building systems
  • Good computer skills
  • Knowledge of safe work practices and applicable procedures
  • Safety certifications to perform required duties. (Fall arrest, aerial lift operation, first aid, WHMIS, etc.)
  • Experience working in a First Nations community including knowledge of First Nations culture, traditions and values is an asset.
  • Ability to speak, read and write Cree and/or Dene is considered an asset
  • Clean Criminal Record Check with vulnerable sector required
  • Valid class five (5) Driverâ€™s License & Clean Driverâ€™s Abstract required
  • Successful candidate will be required to live in (or relocate to) Fort McMurray, Alberta

WHY APPLY?

Fort McKay is committed to the success of its employees and in addition to a competitive compensation structure, we also offer the following:

  • An employer matched Pension Plan
  • Comprehensive Health benefits package with Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
  • On-site Fitness Centre because a healthy work-life balance is important to us!
  • The opportunity to work with a community that is committed to protecting its traditional lands - to learn more about the Moose Lake Plan visit: http://www.mooselaketogether.ca

 

HOW TO APPLY:

ONLINE:https://fortmckayfirstnation2.applytojob.com/apply

Please indicate Competition #018-2022

Check us out on social media -> Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter & Instagram or www.fortmckay.com

 

Qualified candidates are invited to apply with a comprehensive resume detailing qualifications and experience as it relates to the position of interest. *Preference will be given to qualified applicants of Indigenous ancestry in any hiring decision, please declare your Indigenous status in your application.

title: Maintenance Technician
company: The Wohl Group - Recruitment Made Easy!
description:
Position Summary

The Maintenance Technician will ensure that production runs uninterrupted by maintaining a preventative maintenance schedule and supporting departments troubleshoot issues as they arise with minimum downtime. The Maintenance Technician will coordinate with Machine Operators, Team Leads, and external stakeholders to ensure all required quality and safety requirements are met in a cost-efficient manner. The Successful candidate will need to have experience in developing and maintaining preventative maintenance systems and supporting/training a team of operators in a manufacturing environment. The successful candidate possess strong interpersonal skills and is able to collaborate with multiple stakeholders and execute targets in a fast-paced, time-sensitive environment.

Responsibilities

• Develop and maintain preventive maintenance standards and schedules for all mechanical/electrical systems and equipment; this includes disassembly, cleaning, reassembly, and calibration.
• Develop a repair and maintenance data tracker and reporting system. Collect repair and maintenance data performed and ensure proper follow-up actions are taken and documented.
• Analyze test results, machine error messages, and information obtained from operators; troubleshoot and diagnose equipment and system problems based on data received.
• Repair and maintain the operating condition of production equipment, including reassembly of parts after completion of repair, testing, or inspection.
• Read and interpret drawings, blueprints, schematics and electrical code specifications to determine layout of industrial electrical equipment installations
• Continuous learning and improvement of technical skills to remain current on equipment installation and operations, including the set-up and programming processes.
• Utilize welding skills to cut and weld metal for parts repairs, fabrication, and assembly of new equipment.
• Provides operations demonstrations on production equipment for new machine operators; communicates the various safety, control, and operating features in a clear and concise manner.
• Coordinate completion of work orders with cross-functional team members, to ensure cost-effectiveness and productivity standards are met.
• Communicates potential mechanical hazards on equipment to appropriate leadership and operators.
• Ensure that any safety related work orders are given a top priority in operations, ensuring adherence to Provincial and Federal regulations as well as company policy and procedures.
• Support continuous improvement initiatives. Present suggestion for improvement to achieve best practice standards.
• Provide recommendations on preventative maintenance programs for applicable equipment and improvement opportunities for systems functionality.
• Perform other tasks as assigned.

Qualifications

• Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering or certificate/licence in related trade preferred.
• 3-5 years of hands-on experience in manufacturing/industrial maintenance.
• 2 years supervisory or team lead experience.
• Excellent English language skills (oral and written) required.
• Strong mechanical and electrical aptitude required.
• Strong computer skills (MS Office and other applications).
• Demonstrates leadership, reliability, commitment, and initiative.
• Ability to lead by example and encourage teams learning and development.
• Ability to develop new systems/procedures and train others on them.
• Ability to lead a team and influence change.
• Ability to lift to 50 lbs. as needed

Remuneration

• Competitive based on experience.
• Benefits

We support diversity, equity and a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. There is zero-tolerance for any form of harassment, bullying or discrimination and hope maintain a safe and healthy work environment for all. We are committed to providing accommodation for people with disabilities. If you require accommodation through any aspects of the selection process, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Salary Range: $30-35/hr

***Only qualified candidates who meet all of the requirements our client is looking for will be contacted for interview. Thank you and good luck with your search.

title: Entry Level Technician
description:
Job Description:

Job Status: Full-time, Permanent

Wage & Pay Grade: $25.17/hour ; plus benefit enrollment  

Date Posted: July 9, 2021

 

Who we areâ€¦

The Pacific National Exhibition is an iconic institution in BC, famous for bringing generations of people together to celebrate and build memories. This110-year-old, non-profit organization has an annual operating budget of $48 million dollars and generates revenue through four activity streams:   the 15 day annual summer Fair which averages 800,000 guests each year, Playland amusement park which welcomes 375,000 guests annually including Fright Nights, year-round events including concerts, trade shows and film, cultural and community events.   The fourth activity stream is park care and facility maintenance.   The PNE is proud of the work it does at Hastings Park and has a vibrant team that is passionate about events, guest experience and being the best we can be.

 

At the PNE, we strive to create an environment that reflects our organizationâ€™s core values: Enthusiasm, Excellence and Evolution.   With a focus on these core values, we are committed to achieving our mission which is to â€œDeliver Memorable Experiencesâ€ for all who interact with the PNE whether it is our guests, our employees or the community.

We are looking for a talented individual to join our Playland Maintenance Team and play a key role in Playland operations. The Entry Level Technician will complete general labour tasks, assist with ride repairs and support set up and tear down of the Playland grounds, rides and attractions.   General labour duties can include cleaning, gardening, painting, and carpentry in addition to operating mobile equipment including forklifts, scissor lifts and zoom booms. This is a great opportunity to develop skills in multiple areas.  

 

Why join our Team?

  • Exhilarating and team focused culture
  • Flexible work environment
  • Health and wellness employee events â€“ put your hiking boots on, or enjoy an evening out with your favorite colleagues
  • Opportunity for free or discounted tickets to shows, events, sports games, and much more
  • Staff discounts for Playland, The Fair, and Fright Nights, as well as all PNE Food Stands
  • On-site fitness center
  • Competitive compensation package

 

What will you do this year?

 

In your role as a Entry Level Technician, your primary accountabilities will be to:

 

  • Provide services for general labour: cleaning, gardening, painting, and carpentry
  • Complete daily timesheets in an accurate and timely manner
  • Maintain a safe and clean work environment
  • Operate mobile equipment as required (forklifts, scissor lifts, zoom booms)
  • Complete daily ride and vehicle inspections and report all deficiencies found
  • Conduct basic repairs to rides and attractions under supervision and assist higher level Technicians with more complex repairs
  • Assist with set up and tear down of rides, attractions and grounds
  • Develop various skill sets in multiple areas
  • Perform other related duties as required

 

What else?

 

  • Must have 1-2 years of general mechanical experience
  • Must have experience performing general labour duties
  • Must have a valid Class 5 BC Driverâ€™s License and provide an up-to-date Driver's Abstract confirming a clean driving record.
  • Must be capable of working at heights (up to 250 feet), working in awkward positions and lifting heavy equipment and have CSA approved steel toed boots
  • Must be capable of understanding and executing written and oral English instructions and have the ability to work independently
  • Must be able to work various rotating shifts, evenings, weekends and holidays and work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Valid forklift operatorâ€™s license is preferred
  • Fall Protection Training and/or Propane Filling Certificate considered an asset.
  • Occupational First Aid Level II considered an asset
  • Candidates must undergo a Criminal Record Check

 

Who are you?

 

  • Mechanically inclined
  • A handyperson
  • Hardworking
  • Team player
  • Reliable

 

Where and when to APPLY?

 

Applications can be submitted via the PNE website at www.pne.ca/jobs and will be accepted until the role is filled.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

The PNE is proud to be an  equal  opportunity  employer, committed to creating an inclusive workforce that reflects the diverse community we proudly serve. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, national or ethnic origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, or age. If you require any support or accommodations throughout any stage of the recruitment process, please contact the People & Culture Department at  

hr@pne.ca

.

title: Maintenance Leader-Utilities
description:
What are we looking for?

  • 3rd class Stationary engineering degree -5 years experience
  • in depth knowledge of boilers, fire systems, HVAC, cooling towers, compressors
  • extensive troubleshooting and decision making skills
  • good record keeping and knowledge of BAS systems

What will be your key responsibilities?

  • day to day operation of boilers, HVAC, cooling towers and all associated utilities
  • scheduling and overseeing maintenance activities
  • Arranging and consulting with outside vendors
  • coordinating all required inspections as per legislation

What can you expect from Mars?

  • Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
  • Join a purpose driven company, where we're striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.

title: Millwright Technician
description:
Job Reference #: 36133

Company Overview

Do you want to work with one of Canadaâ€™s top oil and gas companies represented by an award-winning staffing agency? Look no further and join the Spirit circle today!

Our large and well-established Oil and Gas client is looking for a Millwright Technician at Cold Lake Operations. 

What's in it for you? 

  • Work with one of Canada's "Top 100 Employers," with possibility of extension or permanent placement.
  • Work Location: Cold Lake Operations
  • Job Title: Cold Lake Millwright Technician
  • The term is a year and a half contract.
  • Competitive Compensation and Benefits.
  • Representation by an award-winning staffing agency that takes pride in our personalized approach to staffing, ensuring you are a valued member of the team - not just a number

IMPORTANT: Business does not need an engineering person, what the business is looking for is a Millwright journeyman with oil and gas experience.

Job description

A Millwright technician position is available at Alberta location.  As an initial assignment you will train as a member of our maintenance staff to gain practical hands-on experience with maintenance and safety procedures. On-the-job experience will be supplemented with additional related formal training. You will be required to work on your own without direct supervision following the initial training period. Frequent driving on gravel roads is a key component of this position.

Responsibilities

  • Abiding by all safety rules and standards, reporting hazards and holding responsibility for the safe operation of assigned facilities
  • Participating in safety programs and attending training sessions; completing self-development courses
  • Executing all work within government regulations and company standards this includes but is not inclusive to alignments (laser), Troubleshooting pumps, Tear downs and rebuilding pumps. Some common manufactures of pumps include: Nash, Bornemann, Bingham, Sulzer and Union
  • Executing specific activities defined within the preventative maintenance program to maintain the integrity of assigned equipment and machinery
  • Repairing machinery malfunctions identified through work order system and performing associated plant/field housekeeping
  •  Demonstrating ability and initiative to improve or modify existing systems or procedures
  •  Utilize shop tools and equipment and complete predictive maintenance tasks such as vibration monitoring, temperature monitoring etc.
  •  Assisting in root cause and cost benefit analysis to reduce cost and eliminate recurring problems
  •  Working together with operations and contract personnel as necessary
  •  Attending and participating in the maintenance network as required

Qualifications: 

  • Grade 12 high school diploma or GED equivalent is a minimum requirement
  • Journeyman Mechanical Technician certification is required

Other: 

  • Valid driver's license and a safe driving record are required for this position- required having their own vehicle. 
  • Able to work in a team environment
  • Able to work shift work
  • Able to communicate effectively with team members
  • Truck and tools and required. Truck equipped with air compressor would be preferred.

Course Requirements / training:

  • WHMIS
  • TDG
  • Gas Testing
  • Confined Space
  • First Aid
  • H2S
  • Fall Arrest

CLOSES SOONER IF A SUCCESSFUL IS CANDIDATE IDENTIFIED - APPLY ASAP 

Kindly submit your resume in Word format and ensure your work history includes the Month/Year for every employer.  

**We thank all applicants for applying, however only those considered for an interview will be contacted directly**

Looking for more opportunities? Check out our website at www.spiritomega.org

Don't see a posting that suits you? Apply to our "General Application" and our recruiters will get in touch when they have a job that fits you!

Follow us "Spirit Omega" on LinkedIn, Facebook, and Twitter for all our new postings.

title: Handyman / Service Technician
company: Mr. Handyman of Burnaby and New Westminster
description:
North America's most trusted and reliable handyman service is seeking a professional Service Technician.  Mr Handyman of Burnaby, New Westminster and N Vancouver is seeking reliable, customer service-focused employees who are both knowledgeable and skilled. They are experienced in many areas of handyman repair and they know the value of building relationships with our clients. We need great people like you to join us.

As Handyman/Service Technician, you be a key member of our team responsible for quality repairs, remodeling, and home improvement projects. Your are a skilled tradesman with a knack for problem solving.  You are also independent, "hands-on" and like to WOW the customer through quality work, good time management and excellent customer service. 

Our Service Techs Receive:

  • Competitive Wages - you are our employee, not a subcontractor
  • Company Vehicle - fuel, insurance, maintenance are all covered by the company
  • Good Benefits - extended health, dental, vision, LTD - after a probation period.
  • Flexible Monday to Friday work - weekends overtime is available 
  • Independence - you are the professional so you plan and execute the project to the customers satisfaction.
  • Office support team - your focus is on the customer, ours is finding and setting-up the next one.
  • Great Culture and Great Future - we are an established firm with a growing market share.
What You Bring:

  • Experience 5-10+ years of home maintenance/repair. drywall, carpentry and minor electrical / plumbing. 
  • Remodeling and tiling experience is a bonus.
  • A "can do" attitude able to complete work in a timely manner.
  • Your own hand/power tools fit for many job types.  Larger equipment is provided and shared with the team.
  • Proficiency working with iPad or other tablets.
  • Team player who can work independently
  • Must take pride in work and leave customers pleased and eager to use Mr. Handyman again.

Notice

Mr. Handyman International LLC is the franchisor of the Mr. Handyman® franchised system. Each Mr. Handyman® franchised location is independently-owned and operated by an independent franchisee performing services. As a service to its independent franchisees, Mr. Handyman International LLC lists employment opportunities available throughout the franchised network so those employment opportunities may be conveniently found by interested parties at one central location for brand management purposes only. Mr. Handyman International LLC is NOT the employer seeking help. The only employer is the independent franchisee who has listed its available positions on this website.

*Acknowledgement

I acknowledge that each independent Mr. Handyman® franchisee hires and determines the terms and conditions of employment for its own employees. Any employment benefits, compensation and employment practices vary by location. Neither Mr. Handyman International LLC (“Franchisor”) nor its affiliates have the power to: (1) hire, fire or modify the employment condition of franchisee’s employees; (2) supervise and control franchisee’s employee work schedule or conditions of employment; (3) determine the rate and method of payment; or (4) accept, review or maintain franchisee employment records. Mr. Handyman International LLC is NOT the employer and/or joint employer for: (i) any of the job opportunities listed on this website; (ii) any of the independent franchisees; and, (iii) any of the employees of the independent franchisees.

title: Maintenance Mechanic
description:
Overview / vue gÃƒ ©nÃƒ ©rale:

King Edward Hotel

 

With its rich history, timeless elegance, and modern hospitality, the Omni King Edward Hotel has been a favourite of both locals and visitors for over 110 years. Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, this landmark hotel is just steps away from a wealth of diverse restaurants, tourist hotspots, and shopping centres.   It's no wonder the Omni King Edward is the perfect destination for business and leisure travellers alike.  


The Omni King Edward Hotel's associates enjoy a dynamic and exciting work environment, comprehensive training and mentoring, along with the pride that comes from working for a company with a reputation for exceptional service. We embody a culture of respect, gratitude and empowerment day in and day out. If you are a friendly, motivated person, with a passion to serve others, the Omni King Edward Hotel may be your perfect match

Job Description / description de l'emploi:

This position is responsible for ensuring a safe, efficient, and well-maintained hotel environment and providing excellent guest service.

Qualifications / qualifications:
  • High school or equivalent education required.
  • 4th Class Stationary certificate is an asset.
  • Appropriate Trade Certificates and post-secondary education is an asset.
  • Previous experience as a maintenance mechanic; experience in plumbing, electrical, HVAC, and locks.
  • Must be able to work a variety of shifts, weekdays, evenings, overnight and weekends.
Responsibilities / responsabilitÃƒ ©s:
  • Under direction of the Chief Engineer, perform general repair and maintenance of any and all equipment found in and around the hotel.
  • Maintain accurate records on assigned tasks and ensure that all safety systems on equipment are operable.
  • Troubleshoot and repair heating, ventilation, pumps, boilers and air handling system.
  • Conduct scheduled inspections on HVAC system, identify issues and initiate corrective actions.
  • Perform cooling towers and annual cleaning.
  • Perform annual cleaning of the domestic boilers, heating boilers, and the steam boiler.
  • Install and repair mechanical and electronic lock (Safelock), and mechanical closing devices.
  • Respond to guests, departmental requests and tasks generated through Synergy MMS.
  • Perform all duties required as Fire Alarm Response Team

title: Leader Maintenance
description:
Job Description

BOMBARDIER
Bombardier is a global leader, creating innovative and game-changing planes. Our products and services provide world-class transportation experiences that set new standards in passenger comfort, energy, efficiency,reliability and safety. We are a global organization focused on working together with a team spirit.
In your role, you will:
  • Exert leadership skills while respecting the vision and values of Bombardier Aviation
  • Lead an engaged and experienced team towards machinery maintenance and reliability for a 1.7M square foot facility
  • Establish and control the achievement of maintenance objectives
  • Deploy reliability strategies for existing equipment and support the capital acquisition process
  • Support the budgeting process and ensure tracking of actual costs
  • Identify, document, and standardize key processes leading to the achievement of objectives
  • Ensure continuous improvement, notably with the application of operational excellence concepts and problem resolution process
  • Coach the team and develop their talent in the organization
  • Optimize the sharing of knowledge and best practices throughout the organization

Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,
  • You hold a college diploma or university degree in Aerospace, engineering or manufacturing management or equivalent experience that have allowed you to develop strong management skills
  • You have over 5 years of experience in maintenance management
  • You hold strong communication skills in French language (bilingualism is an advantage)
  • You have a good understanding of CMMS applications
  • You have strong communication skills
  • You have extraordinary flexibility and are passionate about non-recurring work activities
  • You have aptitude to plan and organize to ensure the attainment of results
  • You have the capacity to demonstrate entrepreneurship skills in your work

Bombardier is an equal opportunity employer and encourages persons of any race, religion, ethnicity, gender identity, sexual orientation, age immigration status, disability or other applicable legally protected Characteristics to apply.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.
Join us at https://bombardier.com/en/careers/career-opportunities

Your ideas move people.

title: Técnico de Mantenimiento en Maquinas de Inyección
description:
Descripción del grupo

El grupo de Mechatronics, Mirrors y Lighting se especializa en tecnologías automotrices que impulsan el futuro de la movilidad. Combinando un profundo conocimiento de sistemas para desarrollar experiencias únicas de acceso a vehículos, sistemas de visión inteligentes y tecnologías avanzadas de iluminación automotriz, la experiencia de MML ilumina el camino hacia la innovación, la seguridad y el estilo.

 

Resumen de la función

 

Brindar soporte en las áreas moldeo atacando fallas de los equipos con la finalidad de mantener la producción estable, así como dar cumplimiento a las actividades de mantenimiento preventivo de máquinas de inyección y equipos periféricos.

Responsabilidades clave

  • ​​​​​​Cumplimiento del Mantenimiento Preventivo al 100%, deberá de realizar las actividades programadas del mantenimiento preventivo semanalmente.
  • Reducción de Tiempo Muerto en Equipo, deberá de mantener trabajando los equipos en óptimas condiciones en cada turno y deberá de resolver las fallas que se puedan presentar lo más pronto posible para no interrumpir la producción.
  • Deberá de realizar recorridos aleatorios para monitorear y observar los equipos para descartar la  probabilidad de alguna falla en los equipos, tales como maquinas inyectoras, robots, secadores y cargadores de resina y cualquier otro equipo en general.
  • Mantenimiento Correctivo a Equipo, deberá de reparar, modificar o reconstruir componentes de máquina de inyección o equipo periférico de esta según se requiera.
  • Cumplir con 5’s, deberá de aplicar constantemente los sistemas del proceso de 5s, para mantener el área limpia y ordenada.
  • Elaboración de rutinas de Mantenimiento Preventivo
  • Administrar eficientemente las refacciones y ordenar y/o mantener inventario de piezas para reparaciones, cuidando el presupuesto del departamento.
  • Asegurar que dispositivos de seguridad estén funcionando en máquinas de inyección y equipo periférico.
  • Coordinación de actividades con proveedores externos.
  • Proponer mejoras a los equipos o procesos.

Calificaciones/requerimientos clave

  • Carrera técnica de mecánico electricista o electrónica.
  • Mínimo 4 años de experiencia como técnico de mantenimiento en áreas de moldeo.

.

title: Industrial Maintenance Electrician
description:
Resolution Staffing Inc. is working in partnership with a local manufacturer in the Cobourg area who is seeking a qualified Industrial Electrician/Mechanic.

This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking to grow their career. Having your 309 A certification would be an asset.

Responsibilities

  • Troubleshoot, diagnose, and maintain all electrical aspects of equipment and software systems
  • Service, repair and install production equipment
  • Performing preventative maintenance on machines
  • Development of new equipment
  • Read and interpret blueprints
  • Read and interpret drawings and electrical code specifications

Requirements

  • Experience in a manufacturing setting would be an asset
  • Excellent troubleshooting, problem solving and technical skills
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
  • Able to work straight afternoons, Monday to Thursday 10 hour shifts
  • Must be mechanically inclined
  • Must be flexible and adaptable

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $32.00 per hour

title: Service Maintenance Associate - Swiss Chalet
description:
Overview:

Swiss Chalet is looking for a Service Maintenance Associate for our Grimsby location!

 

At Swiss Chalet we deliver delicious â€œhome-madeâ€ food, made fresh in-house just for you. Our atmosphere is warm, welcoming and feels like home.  

 

At Swiss Chalet, we work as a team and help each other succeed. Our Managers are hands-on and our team works together to deliver the Perfect Guest Experience to our guests each and every time. We genuinely care about each Guest and every Associate.

 

We are looking for individuals that are passionate about Food, Hospitality, and are Guest focused as well as being a strong and motivating team player.

 

Responsibilities:  

  • Keep the main areas organized, tidy and clean  
  • Complete cleaning jobs outlined by management teams  
  • Keep garbage containers emptied and cleaned  
  • Adhere to all Health & Safety policies and procedures  
  • Assist all team members whenever needed  

 

Qualifications:

  • Responsible and reliable  
  • Ability to multi-task and maintain high energy in a fast-paced environment  
  • Takes pride in doing a job well done  
  • Follows standards and procedures  
  • Willing to help and support the team  
  • Reliable and punctual  
  • Able to work a flexible schedule (i.e. days, nights, weekends) start at 6 am

 

PERKS! Why should you work for us?  

  • 20% employee discount dining card valid at all Recipe brands
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Competitive wages
  • Growth and advancement opportunities within the restaurant
  • Career advancement opportunities in a company that has more than 1,400 restaurants across Canada

 

At Swiss Chalet "Every Guest Leaves Happy "!

 

If you want to be part of a great team and have an exciting career then apply online today!

 

Some opportunities may exist with our Franchise partners which are independently owned and operated.

 

Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.  


Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact

recruit@recipeunlimited.com

.

title: Maintenance Technician (FT)
description:
Kawartha Ethanol is a three shift 365 day/yr operation. The available position is a Mon – Fri day shift based on a 40 hour work week. Reporting to the Maintenance Manager the successful candidate will join an existing Maintenance team and offer support for day to day mechanical requirements. Due to 24/hr operations, “Call Ins” will be expected.

Successful candidate may possess the following:  
  • Possess an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent.
  • C of Q as an Industrial Millwright, Heavy Equipment Mechanic or equivalent.
  • Millwright experience > 5 years.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently or as a group in a safety oriented environment.

Skills listed below would be an asset:
  • Experience with completing PM, PDM and emergency machine repair.
  • Strong Mechanical skills and the ability to follow & understand process flow.
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills.
  • Familiar with safe rigging and hoisting practices.
  • Basic welding skills.
  • Detect and troubleshoot irregularities or malfunctions.
  • Assembly and adjustment of  machinery and equipment.
  • Responsible for start-up and testing of new and repaired machinery.
  • Repairs to pumps, bearings, seals and packing.
  • Communicate material and inventory requirements to maintenance buyer or supervisor.
  • Perform regular housekeeping duties.
  • Must comply with assigned objectives, priorities.
  • Willing to be available after hours including weekends as part of our breakdown response mandate.
  • Ability to read & understand Electrical Schematics and P&ID drawings.

Kawartha Ethanol offers a pleasant work environment, competitive wages & a benefit package.

If you are interested in pursuing this opportunity please email your Resume & Cover Letter stating the Position, and your Salary Expectations in confidence to: info@kawarthaethanol.ca.

No Phone Calls Please. We thank all who apply, but only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

KEI welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities.  Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.


About KawarthaEthanol.ca:

Kawartha Ethanol Inc. is a state of the art Ethanol facility located in Havelock Ontario. We are a 3 shift, 365 day/year operation.

title: General Maintenance Person, Permanent Full-time, Nights
description:
We currently have a full-time permanent opportunity in our Maintenance Department. Work days are Friday to Tuesday from 11pm- 7:30am.

Find meaningful work with seniors.

Enjoy working on a high-performance team while making a difference in the lives of independent seniors.

Choose to work at one of our many communities across Calgary.

Benefit from flexible hours, healthcare coverage and a pension plan.

Reporting to the Community Manager, the General Maintenance Person (GMP) is responsible for following maintenance processes and procedures for routine, preventative, emergency, and after-hours maintenance requests and work orders. The General Maintenance Person is responsible for the overall maintenance, servicing, and repairs required to ensure Silvera’s Independent and Supportive Living Communities including, equipment, furnishings, fixtures and the surrounding grounds remain in excellent condition.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Troubleshoot and repair maintenance issues; Estimate vendor costs and issue vendor purchase orders in accordance with Silvera’s signing authority matrix
  • Perform minor electrical, heating, mechanical, HVAC, plumbing, light carpentry, light landscaping, and building repairs
  • Complete work orders in order of priority; update Maintenance Supervisors on outstanding work orders and escalate issues as required
  • Support Silvera’s Move In/Out KPI and KPM targets by completing timely suite renovation work orders in accordance to Silvera’s established standards and guidelines; monitor vendor work and update Move In/Out Coordinator on the renovation progress
  • Complete all routine and preventative maintenance work orders within scheduled timelines and ensure accurate record keeping
  • Comply with all fire, health, and safety regulations and remain alert to any potential threats to the safety and security of residents, staff, and visitors
  • Serve as On-Call Maintenance GMP on a rotational basis

Desired qualifications:

  • High school diploma or GED required
  • 1 - 3 years of previous general maintenance experience required. Basic electrical, heating, mechanical, HVAC, and plumbing experience required
  • Experience operating low-pressure boiler systems an asset
  • Building operator training or certification an asset
  • Must be in good health with no history of back problems – a medical may be required
  • Class 5 driver’s license and a clean driver’s abstract are required

Working conditions:

  • Company vehicle provided as extensive travel within Calgary will be required; must be comfortable driving in heavy traffic
  • Heavy lifting will be required (up to 50lbs), including pulling, pushing and lifting equipment
  • Some exposure to corrosive and non-corrosive chemicals will be required
  • Frequent bending and stretching will be required
  • Operation of various types of equipment and machinery will be required
  • Working alone and in confined spaces will be required
  • Working under somewhat stressful situations may be required.
  • Working outdoors in inclement weather will be required

Silvera is a leading advocate and caring provider of homes and services for older Calgarians. We offer non-profit service to more than 1,450 residents and have continued to do so proudly for over 60 years.

Silvera employees create positive impact every day. Together, we serve people who make their home with us, including in our supportive living communities, which provide meals, housekeeping and Active Aging programs. Silvera provides a respectful, inclusive, diverse workplace. Our employees work hard to make our communities the safe, comfortable places residents call home. We offer employment opportunities in dining, housekeeping, maintenance and administration. We reward staff through training, recognition and opportunities for growth. We offer flexible full-time, part-time and casual hours, and lieu time.. Our communities are located in all quadrants of Calgary and our head office is located on Macleod Trail near Chinook Centre.

Come build a career with our committed, high-performing team and make a positive difference in the lives of others.

  • Our singular purpose: Live your best life.
  • We value accountability, honesty, relationships and innovation.

We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Due to the current high volume of applications, we will not be accepting phone calls about individual applications.

All pre-screen questions must be answered completed for an application to be processed.

In accordance with the Alberta Accommodation Standards, all successful candidates are required to complete a criminal record check prior to commencing employment and all offers made are contingent upon a successful criminal record check.

For further information on us, please visit our website: www.silvera.ca

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
Westridge HR, on behalf of the Skylon Tower looking to fill the role ofMaintenance Team Member.

Job Summary:

As a member of the Maintenance Department, you will be responsible for the on-going maintenance of the building, the building’s systems, and property grounds. This will include conducting minor equipment repairs, painting, basic carpentry, basic plumbing, and basic electrical.

Start:Asap

Shifts:Days, evenings, weekends, and holidays.

Job Type:Full-Time

Compensation:$15 to $17 per hour, based on experience.

Why Choose the Skylon Tower?

· Work at the iconic Skylon Tower in the heart of the Niagara Falls Tourist District.

· Great opportunity to meet new people from all over the world.

· Work in a fun location where you can feel like you are part of a winning team.

Responsibilities:

· Greet all customers and guests in a friendly manner.

· Ensure that property is maintained and is safe for both guests and employees

· Ensure maintenance/repair services level is maintained to include electrical, plumbing, refrigeration, HVAC, structural, facilities, ground, and parking areas.

· Ensure timely response to requests for service by guests, employees, and management to include repair or replacement of all interior fixtures and furnishings.

· Ensure implementation of ongoing Preventive Maintenance program.

· Maintain emergency procedures and equipment and assists with the implementation of all emergency procedures for the safety of all guests and employees.

· Maintain a clean and orderly work area free of hazards.

· Ensure that all public areas are clean and orderly, including picking up debris or garbage.

· Maintain departmental communication.

· Other duties as assigned by management.

Qualifications:

· 5+ years ‘hands on’ general institutional or industrial building maintenance experience.

· Plumbing, electrical, and/or mechanical experience a definite asset.

· Strong problem-solving skills.

· Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing.

· Ability to multi-task and establish priorities.

· High degree of resourcefulness, flexibility, and adaptability.

· Demonstrated ability to prioritize a diverse workload.

· Must be available to work evenings and weekends.

How to Apply:

Qualified candidates, please send your resume. We thank all who apply however, only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Skylon Tower is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse workforce. Skylon Tower believes in fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment that brings people together to realize their full potential. We are committed to compliance with all applicable legislation including providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities. Please advise us at any point during the recruitment and selection process if you require accommodation.

title: Maintenance Waterpark Technician - 2022
description:
Overview:

This position is ideal for candidates with pool maintenance expereince. Maintaining the mechanical areas, equipment and quality of water in the pools and waterways throughout the facility.

This position pays $18.00-$19.00 per hour.

Responsibilities:
  • Maintaining the mechanical areas, equipment and quality of water in the pools and waterways throughout the facility
  • Assist more senior staff in the Utilities Department
  • Responsible for the condition of the assigned areas and equipment and will be instructed on the basics of plumbing, plumbing related mechanical equipment, pool and waterway maintenance and the chemical treatment these waters
  • Organize, document and perform with minimal supervision after having completed the training and becoming familiar with the facility
  • Use colour comparator test equipment, results and understand the automated chemical controls system and its components
  • May assist with training of junior team members
  • May read flow meters, gauges and other recording devises
  • May monitor and inspect plant equipment and systems for normal operation
  • May collect, test and analyze water samples for chemical and bacterial analysis
  • Assist with other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Enrolled in or graduate of an Environmental/Chemical Engineering post-secondary program or previous experience in plumbing, pool maintenance or chemical treatment
  • Positive attitude, a willingness to learn and good work ethic
  • Interact well with other team members and accept direction from more senior staff
  • Reliable source of transportation, outside of public transit
  • Able to use the colour comparator test equipment
  • Possess a valid Ontario driverâ€™s license (class G/G2)
  • Provide own CSA approved work shoes
  • Must be a minimum of 18 years of age to be considered
  • Must be able to swim as employees may be required to enter the water/pools to clean debris and surfaces
  • Available for rotating shifts starting at 6:00am with a 7 on, 3 off; 7 on, 4 off shift schedule that will cover days, afternoons, on weekends and statutory holidays
  • Able to wear personal protective equipment deemed necessary to perform this job safely (may include; gloves, mask and/or face shield, non-slip shoes etc)

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Hiring experienced and self-motivated Electrician 442A or 309A or Industrial Millwright 433A to join a prestigious Automotive parts manufacturing Company

Rate range: $35.00 per hour

Located in Tillsonburg, ON - approx. 45 minutes from London., Around 1 hour drive from Cambridge, Kitchener, 30 minutes from Woodstock

Must have own transportation.

Qualification: Millwright (433A) or  Electrician (442A preferred 309A accepted) red seal certification

Job Responsibilities:

  • Maintain and repair machines with a minimum downtime
  • Complete machine work orders
  • Operate CNC machining centres as well as robotic assembly dials
  • Equipment modification and re-locations
  • Machining, welding and fabrication
  • Machine electrical upgrades and changes
  • Member of the Emergency Response Team
  • Attend annual health and safety training, including but not limited to, WHMIS and Lockout/Tagout
  • Perform related duties as required

Shift Schedules:

  • Rotating eight hour shift Monday to Friday and have regular weekend overtime

title: Industrial Maintenance Technician - Day Shift
description:
Based in Alexandria, Ontario, KP Windows is a high-quality window and patio door manufacturer that has been a member of the Kaycan family since 2014. We foster a strong and lasting employment relationship, enhanced by the strength of the group to which we belong.

We are currently seeking an Industrial Maintenance Technician to join our maintenance team. Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, the persons we are looking for will be responsible for the maintenance and repair of mechanical equipment.

Shifts: Day - Monday to Friday : 7:00 a.m. to 3p.m.

    We offer:

    • Competitive salary
    • Flexible group insurance program
    • RRSP
    • Opportunity for growth and development

    Duties:

    • Maintenance and repair of facility equipment
    • Maintenance and repair of structural components
    • Maintenance and repair of manufacturing and process systems
    • Maintenance and repair of mechanical systems
    • Electrical repairs and troubleshooting
    • Hydraulic and pneumatic repairs and troubleshooting
    • Inspection, Maintenance and Repair of fork ifts, materials handling equipment and cranes
    • Documentation of work
    • Accurate and updated work schedule and logs
    • Training/Certification Hazmat transportation
    • Welding/Fabrication and Assembly Skills

    Requirements:

    • Completed Certificate, Diploma or apprenticeship program in a related discipline
    • Red Seal License (or in process)
    • MIG welding
    • Knowledge of H&S Standards, all appropriate life safety and fire and health codes, and applicable provincial and local building codes
    • Familiar with multimeter, servo drives, encoders, a variety of presence sensors, temperature controllers and thermocouples
    • Ability to interpret electrical and pneumatic schematics

    While we appreciate any interest expressed in joining our team, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

    KP Windows is committed to creating a diverse environment and takes pride in being an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Windows will provide reasonable accommodations for disabilities to promote candidate participation in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Preventative Maintenance Technician (FT)
description:
Job Title: Preventative Maintenance Technician
Location: WorldMark Whistler Sundance

Location: WorldMark Whistler Sundance
At Wyndham Destinations our mission is simple: to put the world on vacation. With a spirit of caring, creativity, and fun, our teams help families and friends create memories that last a lifetime. As the world’s largest vacation ownership company and part of Travel + Leisure Co., we’re shaping the future of the travel industry.

The resort does NOT supply housing
Pay-Rate $23.00

Summary
The preventative maintenance technician works to ensure electrical/mechanical equipment is functioning properly at all times. Will respond to guest calls in-room repairs and maintenance. Installs maintains and operations mechanical/electrical systems as well as responds to outages, take logs on critical equipment, and establishes operating parameters.

Essential Job Functions
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Applies advanced skills in electrical/mechanical equipment including generators, chillers, pumps, cooling towers, and HVAC units.
  • Ensured regular preventative maintenance of these units. (30% time) Responding to the guest's requests for in-unit repairs or maintenance. (10% time)
  • Performs plumbing maintenance such as pipes, drains, faucets, disposals, showers, and Jacuzzi tubs using methods that include soldering, brazing silver, PVC, CPVC, and fittings. (10% time)
  • Resets replace breakers, ballasts, and other electrical fixtures including switches and sockets; prevent and troubleshoot possible electric hazards. (10% time)
  • Completes preventative programs on all systems such as HVAC, boilers, pool certification, etc.
  • Competencies in plumbing, electric, and HVAC repairs with minimal assistance or supervision. (20% time) Applies critical skills to support operating equipment. (15% time)
  • Assist with unit inspections (5% time)

Travel Requirements:
  • No travel requirements for this role.
  • Minimum Requirements and Qualifications.

Education:
  • High school or equivalent preferred, with 2 years of related work experience.
  • 2-4 years of painting experience.
  • HVAC certification.
  • CPO certification.
  • EAP certification.
Training requirements:
  • Technical training 1-2 years.
  • Basic landscape training 1-2 years.
  • HVAC training preferred.
  • Plumping training is preferred.
  • Training in all hand and mechanical tools.
  • Safety training experience preferred.
  • Critical operating unit training.
Knowledge and skills:
  • Ability to complete work orders.
  • Ability to take direction and complete tasks.
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize assignments.
  • Basic computer, tablet skills required.
  • Ability to communicate effectively.
  • Ability to maintain composure under pressure environments.
  • Emergency response training is preferred.
Technical Skills:
  • Basic PC skills preferred.
  • Operating equipment skills: generators, chillers, pumps, cooling towers, HVAC units, fire, and safety equipment.
Job experience:
  • 2-4 years in the role or similar role is preferred:
Complexity:
Describe the following:
Level of decision-making authority
  • Moderate to high decision making in role
  • Will be required to make immediate repair decisions daily or in emergencies.
Level of autonomy
  • Will have the autonomy to work with limited supervision.
The impact of his/her decision on the organization
  • Decisions have a moderate to high impact on the role.
Supervisory responsibility:
  • This position does not have direct reports but is expected to partner with co-employees at the site and vendors that are part of the work environment.
Scope/Financial Responsibility
  • The role does not have financial responsibility.
Preventative techs will encounter all associates and guests at the resort. The employee is expected to display the count on my behavior in all relationships.

Work Environment
Preventative maintenance Techs are expected to work with small hand tools and complex electric tools. Will be in hot and cold environments, working outside and inside the resort. The technician will work with small and large appliances in the resort, heavy equipment, and electricity.

title: Millwright Maintenance
description:
Business Unit Overview:

At Post Consumer Brands, we have mor ethan 125 years of experience making the breakfast cereals that people love. And even after a century, we're still innovating. We are driven by our mission to Make Better Happen - and we want YOU to join our team!

Brand:

With names like Pebbles, Honey Bunches of Oats, Great Grains, and Malt-O-Meal in our portfolio, weâ€™ve earned more spots in the top 50 best-selling brands than any other cereal company. And as the third-ranked company in the cereal category, our business is growing. Thatâ€™s where you come in. Our company is a hearty mix of ambitious people who want to make great things happen.  

Location Description:

Post Consumer Brands in Niagara Falls, Ontario is home to the Original Shredded Wheat cereal, first produced at this plant 117 years ago. Today, more than 150 team members work at the plant and support the local food bank and other community organizations. The Niagara Falls plant is just down the road from the iconic and expansive waterfalls of the same name. Check out this majestic natural wonder and the various activities nearby. Niagara Falls is the perfect location for cereal and nature fans alike.

Responsibilities:

Operational Duties:

  • Troubleshooting / repairs / installations of mechanical equipment
  • Carry out oral / printed work requests and apply corrective measures in a timely fashion.
  • Perform Preventative Maintenance and regular work orders and account for inventory and labour on computerized maintenance program.
  • Machining and sheet metal for equipment repairs and / or upgrades to meet equipment and Food Safety specifications.
  • Welding repairs and / or fabrication of equipment parts.
  • Basic understanding of machine/ Programmable logic controllers (PLCs) interface.
  • Maintain all production, packaging and labeling equipment.
  • Communicate daily repair activity with all Dept. Supervisors / lead hands/ operators
  • Accustom to working with computerized maintenance and inventory reporting system

 

Qualifications:

Qualifications:

  • Candidates must have a valid Millwright Certificate of Qualification
  • The successful candidate will have 2-3 years of experience in a manufacturing food processing environment
  • 5+ years of strong mechanical skills and mechanical/electrical troubleshooting experience.
  • Strong Preventive Maintenance (PM) background including experience developing Preventive Maintenance plans is desirable
  • Excellent communication skills both oral and written
  • Self directed / motivated team player open to new technology with a sense of urgency and attention to detail

 Physical Requirements:

  • Must be able to lift up to 45 pounds
  • Must be able to climb stairs and ladders and work at elevated levels
  • This job will require frequent bending and twisting of the back as well as working above shoulder height

title: Industrial Maintenance Mechanic
company: Steven Cardwell Recruitment / Engineering Search Firm Inc
description:
Industrial Maintenance Mechanic
$34-$38 per hour
Qualifications & Experience:
• Industrial Millwright License 433A
• 2-5 years' experience with manufacturing equipment and maintenance in a manufacturing
environment
• Experience with pneumatic and hydraulic systems
• Experience with Fanuc robots
• Ability to work with minimal supervision
• Experience with highly automated equipment
• Effective communication skills (oral and written)
• Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment
 Able to read and interpret blueprints, schematics
 Able to read and interpret equipment manuals and repair instructions
 Able to fulfill physical requirements as required
 Required to work rotating shifts and overtime

• Comply with all policies and procedures and company objectives related to quality, health and
safety, environmental and other legislative requirements
• Interact with maintenance employees to exchange technical information to facilitate teamwork in
troubleshooting and repair process
• Repair and maintain all equipment and machines within the building to ensure the efficient, safe
operation of all machinery with the shortest downtime
• Plans long-term repairs to be completed during planned downtime
• Follows company escalation process on equipment downtime - ensuring everyone is aware of the
problem, the repair and the root cause
• Complete work orders as required
• Timely completion of repairs indicated on work orders
• Completes all PM tasks on equipment by due dates and makes the necessary suggestions to improve
PM effectiveness
• Properly signs out parts from stock
• Responsible to protect own health and safety by working in compliance with established safe
working practices and follows company procedures
• Inspects all machinery for defects and potential problems in accordance with preventative
maintenance programs, repairing and replacing parts as required in the specified time frame
• Modifies machinery and equipment as directed
• Install equipment (i.e. fans, conveyors, chutes, and guards)
• Repair of hydraulics and pneumatics
• Maintains a safe and clean work area at all time

title: 310T Technician (FT)
description:
All-Equip Repair & Service is a growing family-run business that provides a positive work environment, as well as the opportunity to expand your experience and knowledge within the industry.
Our STRATFORD location is looking to expand and has two positions currently available for licensed 310T Technicians.

Duties will Include:
  • Perform maintenance on heavy trucks, trailers and tractors
  • Update and maintain work orders
  • Perform inspections, diagnostic tests, troubleshooting and general repairs
  • conduct housekeeping duties
  • other shop duties and maintenance as assigned
Requirements:
  • Licensed 310T, 310S or Apprentice
  • Excellent customer service
  • Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing
  • Must be dedicated and reliable
  • Must be able to function well in a physically demanding environment
  • Ability to work as part of a team as well as independently
  • Able to work extra hours if required
  • Valid drivers license and means of reliable transportation to and from work
  • Exceptional organizational abilities with task prioritization, multitasking, use of timelines and time management techniques
Benefits:
  • medical and dental coverage
  • An RRSP plan
  • M - F day shift
  • Voluntary overtime available for interested parties
Please email your resume to info@aleq.ca or bring a copy to 21 Griffith Road, Stratford, ON Canada

title: Marine Millwright
description:
Marine Millwright

Overview:
Arrow Marine Services has been one of Vancouver’s most trusted shipyard and boat service repair facilities. We are conveniently located at the mouth of the Fraser River in Richmond, BC, which makes us easily accessible by land or water. We have over 3 acres of shipyard space and covered facilities that allow us to provide year-round service to our customers. We specialize in high-quality services for fishing vessels, tugboats, barges, custom float structures and other marine equipment.
We are looking for an experienced Marine Millwright to join us and become part of our Arrow Marine Services family.
Great people work here!
We offer:
  • Competitive Pay: $35-$45/hr based on qualifications and experience
  • Full Benefits including dental, life insurance, pharmaceutical, vision care, chiropractor, massage, EAP, and more....
  • Opportunity to join an RRSP matching program
  • Year round work
  • A dynamic work environment
  • A career with a strong and growing organization
  • Shift: Monday-Friday 7:30pm-4:00pm with opportunities for OT

Clik here for more info on Arrow Marine Services!

Responsibilities:

As an Marine Millwright, you are required to remove and replace engines, mechanical systems, and fluid systems of commercial vessels. You will have the ability to perform a TCI/CSI (Re/Re prop, shaft, cutlass bearings, packing, dripless seals, various measurements and through hulls and valves) on commercial vessels. You will be able to take readings of shafts, rudder stocks and identify corrosion areas or wear on these parts.
  • Remove and replace engines, mechanical systems, and fluid systems of commercial vessels
  • Perform a TCI/CSI on commercial vessels
  • Install new and added-on equipment
  • Repair cooling, and lubrication systems
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other maintenance work
  • Keep detailed and accurate maintenance reports and documentation
  • Maintain a working knowledge of changes in technology and repair techniques
  • Work in adherence to all safe work practices, procedures, as well as all regulatory requirements
  • Demonstrate continuous effort to improve operations, decrease turnaround times, streamline work processes, and work cooperatively and jointly to provide quality seamless customer service
  • Other duties as assigned by supervisor/manager

You Possess:
  • A minimum of 2-3 years of hands-on mechanical maintenance and repair experience, preferably with coastal tugs or fishing vessels
  • Knowledge of vessel operations and requirements of the marine industry preferred: Candidates with experience in mining, industrial plants or grain terminals tend to be a good fit for this role.
  • Marine engineer experience (4th Class or Higher) would be an asset.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Proven mechanical abilities in hydraulics and electrical, including schematics and diagnostics
  • Electrical experience with 12/24/110 volt is an asset
  • Previous welding & fabricating experience is an asset
  • Confined space training is an asset
  • Class 5 forklift ticket an asset
  • Strong safety mindset
  • Ability to take initiative and work effectively with minimal supervision
  • Able to work well under pressure
  • Demonstrates strong communication skills both verbally and written
  • Solid interpersonal skills that allow one to work effectively in a diverse working environment
  • Quality oriented and strong attention to detail
  • Responsible, accountable and dependable
  • Must be capable of physically demanding work including lifting, carrying and ability to climb on tugboats, fishing vessels and barges

We are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Maintenance Mechanic - Rotating Shift
description:
Are you a â€œfoodieâ€ and love cookies, muffins and pancakes?  Are you are looking for a company where we place high value on teamwork, collaboration, innovation?  Are you looking to gain experience and grow your career with a successful international company?

If you are looking to do the best work of your career, be a part of an extraordinary company and have a passion for what we do, we want to hear from you!

Cerelia Bakery Canada is currently looking to add some awesome new team members to our facility in Mississauga, ON. You will be a critical part of delivering our products to customers everywhere!

About Cerelia Bakery Canada:

We develop and produce exceptionally high-quality products including: Fresh & frozen cookie dough and muffin batter in pre-portion sizes and scoop and bake pails for the foodservice industry as well as in-store bakeries of North American grocery, mass and club stores.

Our baked gourmet cookies and muffins are produced for distribution through multiple channels, including quick service restaurants. Refrigerated products including cookie, pastry and biscuit dough sold to North American Grocery Stores in a variety of formats including canister, chub, break-and-bake and place-and-bake.

Our Research and Development is on-going, aimed at introducing new and exciting products to complement our delectable bakery lines. We are an aggressive, flexible company dedicated to providing quality products that satisfy customer needs and market place demands.

Most importantly, we are GROWING.  As we grow, our team members grow with us.  

About this Position:

The Maintenance Mechanic will be responsible to perform periodic repairs and preventative maintenance on the machines, maintain the day-to-day operations and to assume responsibility for maintaining the physical activities of various assets of the Company including the general maintenance and upkeep of equipment and machinery to minimize production down time. The Maintenance Mechanic is responsible for maintaining electrical, mechanical, and other related systems.  The Maintenance Mechanic must be prepared to work as a team member and with minimal supervision, follow all safety and food safety procedures, and have a high threshold for heat in a manufacturing environment. 

Responsibilities (including but not limited to):

  • Perform preventative, predictive and proactive maintenance on machines and equipment to ensure they run efficiently with minimal downtime.
  • Responsible for installation of machines and all mechanical repairs.
  • Ensure that the assembly and set up of production machines is carried out in line with the requirements.
  • Troubleshoot mechanical issues that may arise from time to time. 
  • Complete required paperwork on all work performed.
  • Adhering to all policies, procedures and programs of the company (GMP, Quality, Food Safety, Health & Safety etc) at all times.
  • Other related duties and assigned.

Working Conditions:

  • Weekend work required
  • Overtime as required
  • Fast paced environment
  • Physical Demands: Bend, Carry, Lift, Push/Pull, Reach, Standing for long periods
  • Ability to work in a hot/cold environment

What you will receive in return:

  • Competitive Hourly Compensation.
  • Fully Employer Paid Medical Insurance includes Dental & Vision.
  • Life Insurance
  • 2 Weeks Paid Vacation.
  • RRSP
  • Comprehensive training program, tailored to each individual - regardless if you're a food manufacturing veteran or new to the industry, we will ensure you receive the training you need to succeed.
  • Clean and safe production facility.
  • Career advancement opportunities.

Cerelia Bakery welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If you are eager and excited to work with a company driven by quality, commitment to excellence, and an awesome product, we want to hear from you!

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
Position: Maintenance Worker

Type of Employment: Full Time, Permanent

Reporting to: Property Manager and Maintenance Supervisor

Shift Schedule:9am to 5pm EST Monday to Friday

Pay Rate: $17 per hour

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • To ensure the daily, operation of the buildings is carried out efficiently and safely; to report to the property manager any and all situations, projects, issues, defects noted, repairs completed etc. Other duties as may be directed by the property manager.
  • Respond to tenant inquiries and promptly inform administration; follow up to ensure issue was resolved.
  • Monitor property and trades working on site; reporting back to property manager.
  • Able to move thru tight spaces as well as handle heavy weight items and work at heights
  • Perform inspections, repair and up keeping duties, working safely and with minimal supervision.
  • Radio and cellphone to be worn at all times during work hours.
  • Conduct and log various property inspection checks. Log book updated.
  • Frequently patrol property to ensure cleanings and good working order; maintain and upkeep parking lot.
  • Perform landscaping, housekeeping and property maintenance duties as required.
  • Monitor all equipment and set heating/cooling according to season/weather.
  • Conduct cleaning and repairs to, common areas, service rooms, tenant space and vacant units as needed.
  • Insure site lights and heating/cooling is reprogramed at least once a month to maximize savings.
  • Removal of snow on roof top, stairs, entrances, sidewalks, apply salting or deicing as needed.
  • Determine marketing needs for the weekend and ensure set-up is completed.
  • Maintain roof, roof storm drains, as well as HVAC repairs ensuring all filters and drain caps are clean and in place daily.
  • Ensure tools are maintained cleaned and stored in an organized fashion in a designated clean area.
  • Communicate with supervisor prior to commencing work on an assignment and/or when changing to another project/duty.
  • Maintain daily log book of occurrences noting weather conditions that may affect operations.
  • Submit daily goals list prior to commencement of shift as well as a shift occurrence report at the end of each shift
  • Place service calls for contractors, if needed per instructions given by property manager.
  • Repair drywall; perform routine maintenance jobs, repairs and painting.
  • Clean & tidy uniform to be worn at all times; PPE as needed; steal toe shoes & safety glasses to be worn at all times while on duty.
  • Work flexible hours as needed and on call for emergency service.
  • Ensure safety is always priority one and adherence to privacy and confidentially protocols.

Equipment:

  • HVAC and Air handling Units: ensure all in good operating condition. Paint any rusted units as required. Ensure all mechanical and electrical equipment are maintained in accordance with preventive maintenance.
  • Fire Safety System: Including overseeing of major tenants systems. Meet with Fire Safety Company and ensure all are inspected per code. Understand the Maglocks and the operation of individuals systems. Understand the placement of the smoke detectors. Ensure the fire exits are all accessible and in good repair ensuring that all extinguishers are inspected monthly in place and mounted properly. Log book updated.
  • Elevator/ Escalator: Meet with technicians on site ensuring that maintenance and safety concerns are known. Ensure that the devises are all clean and running smoothly. Log book updated.
  • Sump Pumps: Knowledge of their operation and maintenance is required. Inspections to be conducted weekly and noted. Log book updated.
  • Generators: Ensure annual maintenance is carried out and that all safety guidelines are met. Inspected weekly. Log book updated.
  • Boilers: Ensure boilers are turned on for the heating season and turned off for the cooling season at the appropriate times; ensure biannual water treatment is conducted. Log book updated.
  • Electrical rooms: Maintain all services and electrical rooms with no storage allowed in electrical rooms. Emergency Lighting - responsible to ensure all is in good operating condition and Emergency light test including monthly audit report.
  • Timers: Ensure all light timers are set according to seasonal standards and adjusted monthly.
  • General Equipment: Ensure proper functioning of lights, heaters, washrooms, hot water heaters, pressure pumps (insure pressures are normal), air compressors, sump pumps. Audit report submitted monthly.
  • Troubleshoot: Perform minor repairs on heating, cooling and ventilation systems, Troubleshoot and perform minor repairs on plumbing systems; electrical systems; appliances. Move heavy furniture, equipment and supplies.
  • Any other duties as may be directed by the property manager.

Sky Development Group is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. If you require any type of accommodation, please let the hiring manager know, and we will work with you to meet your needs.

title: Maintenance Water Slide Repair Technician - 2022
description:
Overview:

Perform daily preventative maintenance checks on waterslides and subsequent repairs.

This position pays $18.00 per hour.

Responsibilities:
  • May conduct repairs on fiberglass units including; rides or other projects as assigned which involves preparing fiberglass (sanding and filing) for painting
  • Perform daily preventative maintenance checks on waterslides and subsequent repairs
  • May assist with the fabrication of new fiberglass units
  • May construct new molds and patterns and select resins to be used
  • May assist with monitoring daily activities of Waterpark Technicians
  • May perform on-the-job repairs while the park is in operation
  • May spray paint ride units and other fiberglass objects throughout the park
  • Perform preventative maintenance on tools and equipment
  • Other duties as required within the Facilities Department
  • Assist with ohter duties as assigned
Qualifications:
  • Must be a minimum of 18 years of age to be considered for this role.
  • Interest in or proven skills working with fiberglass or auto body repairs
  • Familiar and comfortable working with a variety of shop tools
  • Able to work at heights of up to 30m
  • Supply both safety and soft sole shoes (non-marking)
  • Must be able to swim in order to work on a waterslide
  • Previous experience in mould construction, patterns and lay ups of fiberglass parts is an asset
  • Must have a reliable source of transportation outside of public transit
  • Able to work flexible shifts (starting at 6am) including evenings, on weekends and holidays
  • Must have a valid Ontario Driverâ€™s License (class G/G2)
  • May require heavy lifting up to 50 lbs.
  • Able to wear personal protective equipment deemed necessary to perform this job safely (may include; gloves, mask and/or face shield, non-slip shoes etc)

title: Shift Millwright
description:
Johns Manville (JM), a Berkshire Hathaway company (NYSE: BRK.A, BRK.B), is a leading manufacturer and marketer of premium-quality products for building insulation, mechanical insulation, commercial roofing, and roof insulation, as well as fibers and nonwovens for commercial, industrial and residential applications. Its Canadian building insulation manufacturing plant is located in Innisfail, Alberta

At Johns Manville we are committed to delivering positive and powerful experiences, because we are successful only when our employees and customers thrive! We are passionate, we care about people, we perform, and we protect others and our environments. Our Innisfail, Alberta manufacturing facility has an opening for a

Starting wage is: $46.59/hr

As a member of the Mechanical Maintenance Team, you must have the following skills, qualifications and experience:

* Fully Qualified Millwright with an Alberta Journeyman Millwright Trade Certificate or equivalent (Inter Provincial Seal preferred)

* A minimum of 3 years industrial plant maintenance experience

* Good communication skills

* Above average teamwork skills

* Excellent troubleshooting skills

* Basic computer skill (Microsoft Office & Outlook)

* SAP Maintenance Management System experience is an asset

* The successful candidate must be willing to work a continuous 12 hour shift

This position offers a complete benefit package including retirement, health, life, vision, travel and dental insurance.

Candidates may apply at www.jm.com

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled
