title: Millwright - certified (Oakville, ON, CA)
description:
BWXT Precision Manufacturing Inc. is a subsidiary of BWXT Canada Ltd.  BWXT Precision Manufacturing Inc. is a leading supplier of precision-machined components to the international nuclear industry. We specialize in the manufacture of fuel channel and feeder components, tooling and fuelling machine spares. 

 

We are searching for a talented and qualified Millwright for our facility in Oakville, Ontario.

 

As a Millwright, you will have proven experience with manufacturing equipment repairs. You will be responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting, repairing, and installing equipment as well as general maintenance items consistent with a manufacturing facility. The ideal candidate has in-depth knowledge of motors and other industrial machine mechanisms essential for job procedures.

 

Responsibilities and Accountabilities:

 

  • Preventative maintenance of various types of machines including determination of which types of maintenance activities are required.
  • Determine which machines, techniques, and tools to use when completing jobs.
  • Track and document PM reports and downtime.
  • Provide breakdown support.
  • Troubleshoot hydraulic, pneumatic and electric systems.
  • Repair / rebuild / replace parts where required.
  • General facility maintenance.
  • Read and interpret drawings and schematics.
  • Work safely with a range of hand tools.

 

Qualifications:

 

  • Completion of an accredited Millwright certificate program.
  • Certificate of Qualification (CofQ) - Millwright (able to produce a copy of same).
  • Minimum of 2 - 3 years’ experience as a Millwright or similar job.
  • Knowledge of CNC Lathe and Milling machinery would be an asset, as would CNC experience, but not required.
  • Having experience with Electrical and Controls/PLC is also an asset.
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
  • Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills while working within a team-based environment.
  • Strong ability to work independently and to complete assignments promptly while maintaining the high standards required in our industry.
  • Experience using lifting devices (cranes and forklifts).
  • Computer literate with proficiency with Microsoft Outlook and Word.

 

We thank all who apply, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

BWXT Precision Manufacturing Inc. embraces diversity of thought, values individuality, encourages new perspectives and provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status or disability, or any other category protected by provincial law.

 

BWXT Precision Manufacturing Inc. is committed to fostering an accessible, fair, and inclusive environment where all employees are able to access goods and services while being respected and supported. If you require accommodations during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so appropriate arrangements can be made. If you require information in a format that is accessible to you, please contact Human Resources.

title: Building Service Technician
description:
Our culture lifts you up—there is no ego in the way. Our common purpose? We all want to win for our customers. We aim to always be evolving, dynamic, and ambitious. We believe in the power of genuine connections. Each employee is a part of what makes us unique on the market: agile and dedicated.

Time Type:

Regular

Job Description :

POSITION SUMMARY:

You will be responsible for performing ongoing maintenance, repair and upkeep ensuring reliable and efficient operations of three Burlington site buildings   This will include operating and controlling the building automation heating and cooling systems as well as the provision of internal building support to all departments.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Perform daily, weekly and monthly maintenance and inspections of HVAC systems including the trouble response to system alarms of the Siemens control systems. 

  • Manage on-site contractors’ time while ensuring completion of work and follow up of any deficiencies to manager.

  • Prepares trouble history logs for all equipment.

  • Submits technical queries and follows up with external contractors for warranty and building subcontracted services for timely problem resolutions.

  • Investigates and facilitates resolution to daily temperature setting changes and monitors overall building for air quality and comfort.

  • Completes on site inspection and performs repairs (as required) on fans, filters, belts motors sensors, valves, actuators, controllers, and lighting equipment.

  • Performs maintenance including repairs to walls, floors washroom equipment, furniture, lighting including lamp and bulb replacement.

  • Completes minor building renovations equipment moves as required including but not limited to painting, drywall, ceiling tiles, flooring, carpentry and assembly/configuration of work stations and offices.

  • May occasionally be required to coordinate and manage small building projects for specific departments including sourcing materials, costing, design and implementation of work.

  • Inspect lighting & exit signage, fire alarm panel preventative maintenance, secondary power and UPS preventative maintenance. Trouble management of commercial power distribution in building and standby systems.

  • Participates as a member on the Joint Health and Safety Committee.

  • Responds to emergency calls on weekends and evening.

  • Daily building inspections include but are not limited to (seasonal) check entrances for ice and snow, clear as required, check HVAC chiller, boiler and glean building temperature with required adjustments.

  • Perform daily, weekly and monthly checks, inspections and tests in accordance to the Ontario Fire Code, tests are not limited to monthly alarm pull station tests.

  • Maintain and manage storage areas within buildings. Minimize debris and fire hazard potential

  • Repair as required to equipment at the warehouse facility.

  • Pickup and delivery of various warehouse material for 950 Syscon Road.

  • Performs other duties as required.

  • Maintain, record, document and submit reports and logs of HVAC Halocarbon activity and annual leak test reports in accordance with the Federal Halocarbon Regulations Act from Environment Canada for the province of Ontario.

  • Monthly Non Load Generator testing and inspection in accordance with CSA

ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS

ACADEMIC TRAINING

  • Post secondary education in related discipoline

  • Ceritications in HVAC and general maintenance experience

  • Formal recognized training in HVAC, Mechanical or Utility systems with Operator certification or Building Environmental Technician certification

WORK EXPERIENCE

  • 5+ years expereince in a simialr environment

  • 3+ years working with external vendors and contractors to cooridnate genral activities

  • Experience with Health & Safety
     

SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES

  • Strong mechanical aptitude

  • Ability to troubleshoot,  document repairs and methods of procedures

  • Strong problem solving skills

  • Understanding of basic facility mechanical and electrical Systems

  • Understanding of operation and maintenance of Siemens or alike control systems

  • Strong organizational and communication skills

  • Valid Ontario drivers license in good standing

  • Occasionally lifts objects up to 40 pounds.

You’ll benefit from:

·         Flexibility: yes, we think that what you do matters. At work and at home.

·         Fun: we laugh a lot, it makes every day brighter.

·         Discounted services: we provide amazing services to our clients, and you’ll get them at home, because you deserve them.

·         Rewarding Pay: let’s be honest, everybody likes to make a good salary. We offer attractive compensation packages, and it comes with a great culture. 

·         Benefits: we’ve got you covered. 

·         Career Evolution: join us and we will give you the tools to achieve your career goals!

·         Technology: you have a passion for technology? Excellent, we do too. Here, you will manage, influence, play, create, fix, and shape the industry.

​** "Our employees and our customers are at the heart of everything we do. In order to provide a safe and healthy environment for our colleagues and their families, for our clients and for the members of our communities, COGECO has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy, which applies to all of its business units operating in Canada.”

Location :

Burlington, ON

Company :

Cogeco Connexion Inc

  • Being inclusive is simply welcoming you to be yourself!

  • Being inclusive also means fostering a climate of trust and respect, and encouraging diversity and equity for every candidate wanting to be part of the Cogeco team.

  • Being inclusive allows us to reduce barriers in the workplace and to take actions to enable accessibility for all!

  • Being inclusive is more than a word, it's our commitment to you!


If you need any accommodations to apply or as part of the recruitment process, please contact us confidentially at inclusiondiversite@cogeco.com

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Creating Peace of Mind by Pioneering Safety and Security

At Allegion, we help keep the people you know and love safe and secure where they live, work and visit. With more than 30 brands, 11,000+ employees globally and products sold in 130 countries, we specialize in security around the doorway and beyond. 

As Maintenance Technician with Allegion Canada you will perform preventive maintenance, machine repairs and support daily functions within in a high-volume distribution facility in Mississauga, ON. Some of our in-house factory processes include Assembly, stamping and machining.

What you will do:

Production Responsibilities:

  • Troubleshoot and repair factory machinery, electrical and mechanical, pneumatic systems.
  • Correct and/or improve existing production processes and equipment.
  • Collaborate with managers and operations staff on process improvements and plant changes.
  • Operate simple test equipment, including, but not limited to: Multi-meter, tape measure, dial indicators, measurement tools.
  • Move machinery, including rigging and utility connections.
  • Fabricate equipment/fixtures as needed, including 3D printing, cutting, machining and grinding.
  • Design equipment/fixtures using CADD.
  • Troubleshoot single and three phase equipment, control circuits, VFDs, controllers, and sensors.
  • Manage PM and daily maintenance workload.
  • Monitor and communicate on equipment repairs with operations staff level employees.
  • Collaborate with Quality to pinpoint issues and rework parts if possible.
  • Maintain spare part inventory and report when replenishment needed.
  • Changeover and adjust Giuliani Key Cutter, Giuliani Key Mill, Giuliani Key Coiner, Back shaver and Maromatic Pinner.
  • Calibrate pneumatic and electric screwdrivers

Health & Safety Responsibilities:

  • Ensure that proper safety procedures are used in maintaining and repairing of production equipment.
  • Foster Safety program to continually improve safety practices.
  • Inspect production equipment, ladders and lift tables.
  • Help develop Lockout/Tagout procedures

Facilities Responsibilities:

  • Change fluorescent tubes.
  • Hang signs/mirrors as needed.
  • Small repairs as necessary

Schedule: 7:30am – 4:00pm

*Generally, works 40 hours a week plus required overtime as needed.

What you will need:

  • Professional diploma in industrial mechanic or electromechanics
  • Minimum 2 to 3 years of experience in industrial maintenance
  • Basic understanding of industrial maintenance plus good reading, writing, and math skills
  • Ability to establish work priorities and effectively manage project timelines.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills; ability to resolve issues effectively and efficiently
  • Ability to read and have a strong understanding/knowledge in mechanical drawings, blueprints and electrical schematics.
  • Ability to lift to 50 lbs. if needed.
  • Prior experience with the following preferred: Tool grinders, Pumps and compressors, Power tools & Hand tools, Fans and blowers, Lathes and other machining tools, Power transmission system, Hydraulic system, Pneumatic system
  • Organized professional with strong sense of urgency.
  • Excellent teamwork and communication skills.

Allegion is a Great Place to Grow your Career if:  

  • You are seeking a rewarding opportunity that allows you to truly help others.  With thousands of employees and customers around the world, there’s plenty of room to make an impact. As our values state, “this is your business, run with it”. 
  • You value personal well-being and balance, because we do too!  
  • You’re looking for a company that will invest in your professional development.  As we grow, we want you to grow with us.  
  • You want a culture that promotes work-life balance.  Our employees enjoy generous paid time off, because at Allegion we recognize that you have a full life outside of work!  

What You'll Get from Us:

  • Health, dental and other insurance coverage, helping you “be safe, be healthy”   
  • Employee Discounts
  • Community involvement and opportunities to give back so you can “serve others, not yourself”  
  • Opportunities to leverage your unique strengths through Clifton Strengths testing and coaching 

We Celebrate Who We Are! 

Allegion is committed to building and maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace.  Together, we embrace all differences and similarities among colleagues, as well as the differences and similarities within the relationships that we foster with customers, suppliers and the communities where we live and work. Whatever your background, experience, race, color, national origin, religion, age, gender, gender identity, disability status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law, we will make sure that you have every opportunity to impress us in your application and the opportunity to give your best at work, not because we’re required to, but because it’s the right thing to do.   We are also committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If for any reason you cannot apply through our career site and require an accommodation or assistance, please contact our Talent Acquisition Team.

© Allegion plc, 2020 | Block D, Iveagh Court, Harcourt Road, Dublin 2, Co. Dublin, Ireland

REGISTERED IN IRELAND WITH LIMITED LIABILITY REGISTERED NUMBER 527370

Allegion is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer

title: Millwright - Lead Hand
description:
Samuel Coil Processing in Winnipeg is a flat rolled metals service center and is offering an immediate position for an Industrial Mechanic with experience in the maintenance and repair of heavy production equipment. 

WHAT WE OFFER: 

  • Paid weekly, Direct Deposit 
  • Competitive pay rate $37.90 (+ shift premiums)
  • Paid overtime 
  • Vacation time 
  • Paid holidays 
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits after 30 days 
  • DCPP with a company match up to 5% 
  • Annual Safety Boot Allowance 
  • Opportunity for stability and career growth 

RESPONSIBILITIES: 

  • Repairing heavy production machinery, equipment and cranes. 
  • Performing building maintenance. 
  • Operate on a 3-shift rotation changing every 2 weeks. 
  • Coordinating activities of all outside services for the maintenance and servicing of equipment, machines, cranes, electrical HVAC systems. 
  • Preparing reports as necessary and maintaining repair logs and spare parts inventory. 
  • Following preventative maintenance program. 
  • Purchasing of regular parts and maintenance supplies. 
  • Must follow lock-out/tag-out procedures when troubleshooting or performing repairs to equipment, machines and cranes. 
  • Ensures company safety policies are adhered to and safe work habits are utilized by all department personnel and visitors. 
  • Wears personal protective equipment (PPE) as required at all times. 
  • Strives for continuous improvement. 
  • Performs all other related duties as assigned. 

QUALIFICATIONS: 

  • Interprovincial Red Seal Millwright Certification 
  • Minimum 5 years' experience as an Industrial Mechanic, Industrial Millwright or equivalent 
  • Excellent communication and decision-making skills 
  • Intermediate computer skills 
  • Experience with preventative maintenance programs and diagnostic assessment of mechanical processing equipment 
  • Experience with maintenance and repair of overhead cranes, hydraulic and pneumatic equipment 
  • Able to troubleshoot basic electrical circuits and controls 
  • Experience with basic metal fabrication including mig and stick welding 
  • Capable of working independently and as part of a team 
  • Able to work flexible hours including weekends 
  • Must be able to communicate in both written and spoken English 
  • Must demonstrate patience and consistent attention to detail 
  • Must have good organizational skills and be self-starter 

SAM123

title: Maintenance specialist, building and production equipment
description:
Maintenance specialist, building and production equipment Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future.At ABB, we have the clear goal of driving diversity and inclusion across all dimensions: gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity and generations. Together, we are embarking on a journey where each and every one of us, individually and collectively, welcomes and celebrates individual differences.

ABB's Measurement & Analytics division is among the world's leading manufacturers and suppliers of smart instrumentation and analyzers. With thousands of experts around the world and high-performance digital technology, ABB's team is dedicated to making measurement easy for its industrial and energy customers to let them operate more efficiently and profitably.In this role, you are dedicated to overseeing and executing planned and unplanned maintenance activities for our building, equipment and production lines. You will manage improvements related to the building, equipment and production lines of the Measurement and Analysis (PAMA) business segment in Quebec City. Reporting to the Manufacturing Engineering Supervisor, you lead the process of maintaining and preserving the efficiency of a building, equipment and production lines, optimizing technical and financial resources.
This position reports to
Ingenieur Senior, Groupe Systeme
Your responsibilities

  • Maintenance: supervises the execution of the ordinary and extraordinary maintenance of equipment, production lines and buildings (alarms, security, fires, ventilation, etc.). Manages maintenance contracts, issues bonds and work permits. Monitors indoor and outdoor cleanliness. Collaborates with the production engineering team to define maintenance plans for new products, production facilities, and consults on ways to improve the reliability, maintainability and safety of equipment and building.
  • Documentation: manages and updates the technical documentation of equipment, production lines and buildings.
  • Technical Resolution: Solves major technical, equipment or building problems in order to achieve higher performance of production lines. Keeps repair tools and equipment in good working order.
  • Improvement Projects: Proposes process and production improvement projects line aimed at reducing ordinary and extraordinary activities maintenance and optimization of operational and energy efficiency.
  • Failures: Responds to emergencies, breakdowns, malfunctions and other operational issues to minimize disruptions to the production process.

Your background
  • College diploma in electronic, electro-mechanical, industrial or appropriate engineering degree.
  • Good understanding of oral and written English.
  • Be comfortable with the Microsoft Office suite
  • Demonstrate good autonomy, a sense of responsibility and care
  • Collaborative solution-oriented approach, with strong oral and written communication skills
  • An asset, mastery of the following tools:
  • Guide TI (Asset and Facility Management)
  • Atlassian JIRA (Request Management)
  • PTC Windchill (Documentation Management)
  • SAP (Resource and Supply Management)
  • Power BI (Data Visualization)

Benefits
  • Retirement plan
  • Medical insurance
  • Wellbeing program
More about us
Named to Forbes 2020 list of top 15 employers in Canada, ABB values the dedication, commitment and expertise of our employees. ABB is an Employment Equity Employer and believes in an inclusive and diverse workforce. Committed to ensuring that all policies and practices respect the Employment Equity Program, we aim for our workforce to be truly representative of the four designated groups; women, aboriginal people, members of visible minorities, and/or persons with disabilities. ABB will provide reasonable accommodation to applicant with disabilities and encourage applicants to self-identify in the application process.

title: Shop Technician
description:
Spartan Staffing Solutions has partnered with a leader in Construction and Material Handling Equipment rental and sales. Together we are in search of a Shop Technician for their team in Delta BC

Shop Technicians performs service and repairs equipment to ensure that equipment continues to run according to manufacturer’s specifications. This is opportunity for someone who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment with a strong potential for future growth and career advancement.
Responsibilities
  • Diagnose and repair electric motors, transmissions, drive axles, differentials, hydraulic systems, brake systems, steering systems, electrical systems, lifting systems, etc.
  • Rebuild and/or repair all components and systems
  • Properly block, chock and chain equipment, and disassemble equipment as needed to facilitate major component removal and repair
  • Perform routine and operational maintenance to all equipment according to manufacturer’s specifications
  • Perform diagnostic troubleshooting and failure analysis
  • Perform equipment inspections
  • Perform basic welding as necessary
  • Record maintenance and repair work completing necessary paperwork in a timely manner
  • Complete basic and advanced technical training as assigned
  • Maintain parts and supplies needed for job completion
  • Maintain work area cleanliness and ensure shop remains a safe working environment
  • Maintain a culture of safety & participate in all safety meetings
  • Perform other related duties as assigned
Qualifications
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Thorough knowledge of all equipment & operations that apply to the branch
  • Excellent mechanical aptitude, technical knowledge and problem solving skills
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Own tools
Experience/Education:
  • High school diploma or GED equivalent required
  • Mechanical or trade school certificate preferred
  • 3+ years’ experience in forklift repair or related industry
  • Ability to read precision instruments such as micrometers, dial indicators, bore gauges.
Compensation/Benefits:
  • Salary Negotiable.
  • Full Benefits package
  • Monday to Friday with some Over-Time
  • Future growth and career advancement.
Please send resumes to raul@spartanstaffingsolutions.com

title: Maintenance Team Member
description:
BOS LANDSCAPING – located in Smithville, Ontario - is committed to bringing our clients quality landscaping, that will enhance their outdoor experience that dreams are made of.

* We are looking for Landscape Professionals to assist in maintaining either High-End Residential properties or Commercial/Industrial properties. *

Key Responsibilities:

  • Plan and manage time-efficient garden maintenance schedules
  • Work alongside crew members ensuring quality work and safety
  • Ensure all company equipment is properly cared for
  • Submit proper organized paperwork via LMN Software
  • Communicate with customers in a polite and courteous manner

Required experience:

  • Ability to communicate with other team members 
  • Able to operate various equipment
  • Assist maintaining all company equipment
  • Prioritize quality work and customer service
  • Submit proper and organized paperwork
  • Dependable team-player
  • Good time management skills
  • Customer service skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Goal oriented, interested in learning
  • Integrity
  • Valid G driver’s license and own transportation
  • Horticultural certificate an asset

Benefits:

  • Full-time Year-Round work available
  • Monday through Friday or Flex days - 50 hours a week work.
  • Education & Training opportunities to grow your career

Hourly wage: $20.00-$25.00 per hour – or based on experience.

*Also, we have entry level positions for persons interested in building a career in Landscaping!*

title: Plant Technician - PFT - Plant Maintenance
description:
Posting # 2021-883804

CUPE 815

Position : Plant Maintenance Technician

Department :

Status :Full-time

Hours :Monday to Friday – 7 am – 3 pm -- Days and with a 7 day rotation on call( Hours are subject to change based on operational requirements)

Site: Primarily Milton with responsibilities as assigned at Oakville

Halton Healthcare takes great pride in providing quality, compassionate healthcare services to our rapidly growing communities. As a progressive and vibrant healthcare organization, we are committed to being an innovative center of excellence in community hospital care in the Halton and Peel Regions. We are a distinctive center of healthcare excellence that offers first-rate care in an innovative environment that supports the physical, mental, emotional and spiritual needs of the community.

This is what you'll be doing:

To maintain and effectively operate the day-to-day related power plant and related outlying mechanical services and systems required for the efficient on-going operations.

  • Conduct boiler safety checks, boiler water treatment, domestic water treatment, boiler machinery & equipment maintenance
  • Inspect, (maintain) and test auxiliary power System (generators not us), operate and monitor chillers and all associated equipment, monitor medical gas systems, trouble shoot and repair control systems, maintain boiler room and Mechanical spaces cleanliness and safety, work on tube system (we don’t work on tube system), and call bell system.
  • Analyze trouble alarms, fire alarms and correct.
  • Monitor operations of all heating/cooling equipment, perform regular scheduled mechanical maintenance, respond to emergency breakdowns.
  • Maintain reverse osmosis water treatment.
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Maintain rolling stock equipment, including beds, stretchers, staxi chairs, etc.
  • Perform daily rounds and inspections of facility
  • Complete work orders in a timely manner with accurate documentation of work performed in a computerized maintenance system
  • Complete preventative maintenance tasks as assigned

This is what you'll bring to the position:

  • Secondary school education required
  • College level education or equivalent work related knowledge of building operations & maintenance required
  • Minimum of 4 years related experience in plant operations (refrigeration, building automation systems, boilers, chillers, air handling units.)
  • Public relations skills and the ability to diplomatically respond to inquiries in a demanding work environment.
  • Ability to work collaboratively within a team setting.
  • Physically able to perform the essential duties of the job (lifting, bending, stretching and pulling in excess of 30 pounds).
  • Knowledge of trouble shooting & repairing building systems and performing other related plant duties as required.
  • Demonstrated computer skills.
  • S atisfactory employment and attendance record

Salary Scale :$23.82 to $29.79 per hour

Date Posted :September 16, 2021

Internal Applications due by: September 23, 2021

Please apply if you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are. Please submit your application via our website atwww.haltonhealthcare.comdirectly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

W e thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.

In accordance with Directive #6, Halton Healthcare has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination and Management Policy. All new hires must be fully compliant with our Policy as a condition of employment with Halton Healthcare. Successful applicants will be required to provide proof of vaccination or proof of a documented medical exemption as part of the hiring process.

In accordance with theAccessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Actand theOntario Human Rights Code,Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process.If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation.

All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Halton Healthcare is a smoke free facility in and around all three sites. Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products. We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

title: Location Maintenance & Repair Technician - Vancouver, BC Area
description:
Location Maintenance & Repair Technician - Vancouver, BC, Canada

  • Required 3 visits/week for Richmond Centre, 3 visits/week for Guildford Town Centre
    • 2 of the visits for each mall must occur on the weekend, Friday evening – Monday morning
    • Rate: $1200 per month, paid bi-weekly, to service two (2) mall locations
  • Additional fitness club service calls in the Greater Vancouver area; $30.00 per hour
  • Night, weekend, and holiday availability is required

 

COMPANY BACKGROUND

Smarte Carte, Inc. is the leading concessionaire of self-serve vended luggage carts, electronic lockers, commercial strollers and massage chairs, as well as other passenger and guest services. 

 

Smarte Carte is headquartered in St. Paul, MN and has operations in the United States, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Sweden, United Kingdom, and Singapore.

 

BASIC FUNCTION

The Location Maintenance and Repair Technician role at both Richmond Centre and Guildford Town Centre is a part-time position, with direct responsibility for the tablet strollers located throughout the two malls.  The Location Manager will report to the District Service Manager. 

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Maintenance and repair of equipment
  • Maintain clean equipment
  • Accurate and timely collections, bank, and report financial transactions
  • Maintain policy and procedure expectations of the facility and Smarte Carte
  • Maintain regular contact with District Service Manager
  • Improve revenue of location consistent with traffic changes and corporate performance levels
  • Maintain a safe working environment by ensuring all equipment is in good repair and working as designed
  • Maintain a positive relationship with the facility management
  • Other assignments as needed.

 

 

EDUCATION

  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Associates or Technical degree preferred

 

SKILLS

  • Working knowledge of equipment
  • Electrical and mechanical equipment repair
  • Excellent verbal and written communication
  • Maintain accurate records
  • Compile reports
  • Proficient in computer and Smartphone use

 

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

  • Lift 40 lbs. to waist height
  • Push/Pull 75-100 lbs.
  • Bend and stoop, walk and stand for long periods of time
  • Visual acuity/manual dexterity to perform mechanical and electrical repairs

 

LICENSES & CERTIFICATIONS

  • Valid Drivers license required

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
AstenJohnson has more than 200 years of global experience serving the paper industry, making AstenJohnson a preeminent international supplier of reliable, innovative products and technical solutions.

As the flagship manufacturing facility of Dryer fabrics, AstenJohnson Kanata site has been proudly serving our customers for over 50 years. We are committed with actions to Zero Accident Culture and distinctions through continuous improvement.

In AstenJohnson, people are our biggest assets. We foster the culture of trust and respect, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are also committed to a sustainable future by protecting and carefully managing the resources entrusted to us.

Our business has been in operation successfully in the half century with continuance even during the unprecedented pandemic. To meet the business growth needs, we are inviting you to join this warm big family. We offer competitive wage and benefits coverage like extended healthcare, medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, AD&D, company pension, clothing allowance, employee assistance program and so on, as well as site events like BBQs.

General Scope of Responsibilities:

Rebuild, repair and troubleshoot all house plant equipment

Position Requirements:

  • High School Diploma. Some college or technical training a plus
  • Ability to work independently and as a team
  • Ability to work in a 24/7 unionized manufacturing environment
  • Ability to adapt to new equipment and procedures
  • Thoroughness of work performance, detail oriented
  • Strong mechanical aptitude
  • Good coordination and manual dexterity
  • Basic computer skills
  • Industrial Mechanic/ Millwright trade certification a plus

Specific Skills:

  • Welding and fabrication, G.M.A.W, S.M.A.W, Oxy-Fuel
  • Pneumatic and Hydraulics knowledge and experience
  • Hoist and Crane experience
  • Ability to read and follow blueprint and schematics.
  • Machine shop experience, Milling, Lathes and Grinders
  • Experience with alignment and leveling of equipment
  • PLC experience would be considered an asset

title: In-Shop Technician (Workshift per collective agreement)
description:
In-Shop Technician (Workshift per collective agreement)-210003BH

Description

 Completes troubleshooting, repairs and rebuilds on engine products in a service workshop independently while coaching and developing less experienced technicians
Applies documented procedures and policies to perform diagnostics and complex repairs
Performs preventative maintenance based on assessment of engine
Completes required documentation, such as work completed documents, time sheets, warranty claims and quality forms, via handwritten or business system input screens
Completes training in line with skill and business requirements
Coaches and develops technicians and/or apprentices and transfers knowledge and experience to others; may provide work direction; may review repair plans, parts lists, etc
Maintains work area and tools for cleanliness and proper operation
Adheres to and ensures adherence of more junior technicians to all relevant Health, Safety & Environmental policies, procedures and legislation and reports any issues / incidents to their supervisor

Qualifications

 

Skills

Communicates effectively - Developing and delivering multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences.

Customer focus - Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.

Develops talent - Developing people to meet both their career goals and the organization’s goals.

Self-development - Actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels.

Situational adaptability - Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations.

Service Documentation - Creates and verifies customer, equipment and technical information; captures specific data using required service tools; follows procedures and documents required information in the service management system in order to have an accurate record of the work done.

Technical Escalation - Obtains product technical issue information and utilizes available resources including data management tools; elevates issues to a higher level of expertise, balancing timeliness of customer response with investigation efforts; captures all troubleshooting steps in the appropriate database in order to ensure seamless transitions and accurate response to ticket resolution in a timely manner.

Diagnostics Application - Translates customer complaints to develop troubleshooting plan; troubleshoots issue following guided work flows, procedures, specialized equipment such as mechanical and electronic service tools, and diagnoses computer software to isolate failed components to enable a successful repair; validates repair by duplicating complaint to ensure it has been resolved; documents results of troubleshooting in business systems to communicate what has been done for payment and historical tracking.

Electronic Service Tool Application - Identifies the suite of available hardware and software tools required for a service event; utilizes the appropriate electronic tool set to maintain the product or diagnose and troubleshoot an issue; interprets electronic tool results or recommendations to determine next steps for service resolution.

Product Repair and Maintenance - Repairs and maintains mechanical/electrical products following guidelines, using required tools within standard repair time to ensure a quality repair; disassembles and assembles engines or power generators following guidelines, using required tools to ensure a clean and organized environment; inspects and replaces parts and components following re-use guidelines to minimize customers cost of ownership; performs progressive damage check following guidelines to restore to pre-failure condition.

Engine Systems Interactions - Interprets and analyzes the interactions of internal and external electrical and mechanical systems (exhaust, heating, cooling, fuel systems, driveline, aftertreatment, controls, sensors, etc.) by applying tools, service publications (Cummins, Original Equipment Manufacturer) and taking measurements to efficiently and correctly diagnose and repair.

Health and Safety Fundamentals - Champions and models proactive health and safety behaviors by identifying, reporting and participating in actions to improve health and safety in order to build an interdependent culture and contribute to an injury-free workplace.

Education, Licenses, Certifications

Apprentice Trained Engine Technician (Preferred)
Vocational diploma from relevant technical institution
Locally valid driving permit (Preferred)
This position may require licensing for compliance with export controls or sanctions regulations.

Experience

Advanced level knowledge of and/or experience with engine products
Experience providing technical advice and coaching to more junior technicians (preferred)
- Will performed general mechanic in addition to the engine work

Job

 SERVICE

Primary Location

 Canada-Quebec-Montréal-Canada, QC, Pointe-Claire, Cummins Eastern Canada

Job Type

 Shop
Recruitment Job Type Technician

Job Posting

 Jul 8, 2021, 5:51:56 PM

Unposting Date

 Ongoing

title: Millwright
description:
Spinrite is the largest craft yarn and thread company in North America. As an industry leader focused on driving growth and execution excellence, Spinrite is looking for a licensed night shift Millwright to preform preventive maintenance, troubleshooting, and complete repairs.

At Spinrite, our plans are to grow, so this position is an excellent opportunity for anyone who thrives within an evolving workplace and would like exposure to growth. If you would like to get onboard with the fastest growing company in the industry and aspire for success, this role may be for you.

Duties:

  • Perform preventive maintenance tasks including overhaul and repair of pumps and production equipment, line changes, and critical mechanical repairs.
  • Maintaining and troubleshooting all production equipment in a steam environment.
  • Maintain logs to support preventive maintenance.
  • Ordering and maintaining the inventories of parts.
  • Refurbishing components when required.
  • Perform line changes and critical mechanical repairs.
  • Assemble and install new equipment and make modifications to existing equipment.
  • Apply PLC logic for troubleshooting.
  • Order required material.
  • Perform route cause analysis for troubleshooting.
  • Perform up-keep of boiler systems in the Dyehouse production area.
  • Replace steam pumps, traps and piping.
  • Repair dye processing chemical lines and valves.
  • Work in other areas within Spinrite as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Possess Industrial Millwright License.
  • Have welding experience
  • Excellent attendance and safety records.
  • Understanding of steam production systems.
  • Ability to weld stainless steel.
  • 3 to 5 years of relevant experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • Use shop tools such as tig/mig/arc welders, lathe, milling machine and oxy/acetylene torch.
  • Knowledge in pneumatic, hydraulic, and mechanical systems.
  • Knowledge shop tools and blueprint reading.
  • Application of the Occupational Health & Safety Act.
  • Communication and math skills.
  • Available for emergency call-in and overtime work.
  • Ability to climb ladders and handle parts weighing up to 90 pounds.

Spinrite is an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and all applicants for employment without regard to any status protected by the Ontario Human Rights Code, US Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, and applicable state law. If you need assistance or accommodations during any part of the application or interview process, please contact us at 519-291-3780 and ask to be directed to HR.

title: General Handyman (FT)
description:
Wanted: General Maintenance Worker for Building Maintenance/Renovations.

We are a busy renovations and maintenance company looking for a reliable, hard-working, and devoted handyman. You will be responsible for general renovations and maintenance duties, such as drywall, plaster, paint, ceramic tiles, small plumbing and electrical, countertops, etc. in Hi-Rise rental apartments.

This is a full-time position (not for general contractors). Serious applicants only.

Salary based on experience and will be fair and negotiable.

A successful candidate requires:

  • A set of their own tools.
  • 2-3 years of experience.
  • Their own vehicle.
  • An ability to work independently as well as part of a team.




    About Mirage Renovations:

    Mirage renovations Inc. is an interior renovations company that specializes in residential apartment building rental units. We pride ourselves on a quick job, done well and at a reasonable price. Years of experience in the rental apartment sector has allowed us to build a highly dedicated and efficient team that is able to tackle jobs of any size. Capital Projects: - Drop Ceiling installation - Corridor painting - Metal door and frame replacements - Finish work after large scale building updates - Garage Painting - Balcony Repairs - Fences Suite turnovers: We can handle all the components of a complete turnover: - Demolition - Plaster & paint - Electrical - Plumbing - Cabinetry - Tub Surrounds - Flooring - Baseboards - Tiles - Tub surrounds - Doors & Frames - Cleaning In-suite/ Odd jobs: We are well- equipped to provide solutions to all your maintenance needs. - Repairing flood damage - Plaster repairs - Door replacement - Painting - Finish work after plumbing repairs - Leaky faucets - Hardware replacement - Boiler room repairs - Fire- rating updates

title: Maintenance Millwright - Hamilton
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

You independently operate and maintain at least one process, equipment or systems following autonomous maintenance (AM) standards and use your technical skills to improve line and/or system performance to meet business needs.

How you will contribute

You are a key ingredient in changing how the world snacks. With coaching, you will operate and maintain equipment to deliver on our safety, quality, cost, delivery, sustainability and morale targets. You will use execute all standard work processes on your equipment using AM (autonomous maintenance) and PM (progressive maintenance) standards and ensure that safety processes are observed, and that quality assurance activities are performed. You will understand the losses in their area and equipment and report them.

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:

  • Operating machines with coaching
  • Safety and quality standards for operating machines
  • Reading and writing, and fluently conversant in the language of communication as appropriate to the site
  • Collaborating well in a diverse work environment

More about this role

What extra ingredients you will bring:

Education / Certifications:

  • High School diploma

  • Ontario Licensed Millwright certificate is required (433a)

Work schedule:

  • The Continental shift schedule is a fast rotating shift pattern 12 hour shift

No Relocation support available

Business Unit Summary

We are the second-largest snacking company in Canada and in the top 10 food companies in North America. We make and distribute delicious household favorites including Cadbury, Oreo, Mr. Christie and Maynards. We are an ambitious business—in the past few years alone, we have invested $250 million in our Ontario-based factories. Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. We are proud of our “local-first” commercial focus that enables us to take ownership of our own market and make more, faster decisions closer to our consumers. We are also proud of our top 100 position on Forbes magazine’s 2019 Canada’s Best Employers list.

If you are applying to a position in Canada, accommodations for applicants with disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact 847-943-5460 for assistance/support.

Job Type

Regular

Manufacturing core

Manufacturing

â€¢ Procure partsâ€™ specification and order/purchase replacement parts (such as air cylinder, air regulators and flow controls, motor and motor              drives, raw metal material, various plastic raw material, etc.)

â€¢ Analyze and study engineering specifications and manufacturerâ€™s manual to determine correct installation and operation procedures for new  machinery

â€¢ Setup and prepare Ink Jet machine, Laser Coding machine or Labeling machine for routine production at assembly lines

 

Qualifications:

â€¢ Mechanical Aptitude

â€¢ Must be fluent in either Mandarin or Cantonese

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Maintenance Technician

The Greater Toronto Area's Manufacturing Industries are BOOMING! 

Exciting permanent full time opportunities available for Maintenance Technicians, located across the Greater Toronto Area.

Manufacturing experience required. 



Main Duties: 

  • Respond to and prioritize all equipment breakdowns
  • Perform repairs, take responsibility and make decisions necessary for completion within time demands
  • Troubleshoot mechanical and electrical systems
  • Troubleshoot all equipment in the plant such as CNC, hydraulic press, rollers and belt conveyors, dust collector/vaccum systems, boilers and chillers
  • Effectively and efficiently complete all maintenance requests 
  • Perform preventative and predictive maintenance 
  • Set-up equipment
  • Adhere to all safety policies and procedures working in a safe and effective manner
  • Maintain parts and work records
  • Work collectively with other tradespeople


Minimum Requiremnents:

  • Prefer recognized formal training and certification (Ontario Certificate of Qualification) Industrial Millwright, 433A OR currently registered in an Apprenticeship Program OR minimum 10 years Maintenance Technician experience
  • Knowledge in troubleshooting and repair of mechanical equipment including hydraulics, pneumatics, drives, bearings and gears
  • Knowledge and basic understanding of PLC, VFD PLS motor controls, servo drivers, safety sensors and relays with both troubleshooting and technical experience
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills, preferably in a fast paced manufacturing/industrial environment
  • Ability to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities and work environments
  • Ability to understand and interpret mechanical blue prints and electrical and control schematics.
  • Comfortable working alone, but able to contribute to cross functional team
  • Basic welding/fabrication skills considered an asset
  • Ability to communicate effectively in the English language. (Both written and verbal)

title: Millwright
description:
Location: Various Locations
Rotation: Various Rotations
Department: Operations


Key Areas of Responsibility:

  • In coordination with other crew members the Millwright is responsible for performing mechanical repairs and routine planned maintenance on a variety of fixed plan installations and perform any one or more of the following tasks:
    • Perform maintenance and repairs to stationary equipment on surface and underground in a safe and timely manner
    • Perform all required preventative maintenance at the required intervals to the manufacturers specifications
    • Repair or replace defective parts, components or systems
    • Test repaired equipment for proper performance and to ensure work meets manufacturer specifications
    • Maintain accurate and up to date maintenance reports and documentation
    • Maintain a working knowledge of changes in technology and repair techniques
    • Work collaboratively with electricians, welders, and other crew members
    • Other duties as may be assigned

General Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Ensure full understanding and compliance with company policies and work in accordance with the Occupational Health and Safety Act and other local regulatory requirements
  • Have the authority and responsibility to maintain a safe and efficient working environment
  • Fully supports and actively participates in the team safety program based on culture and innovation
  • Ensure that any equipment deemed damaged or unsafe by virtue of a defect, or a machine of which any protection system is inoperative, is not used and communicated to the supervisor
  • Work closely with other crew members to create and maintain a synergy required to accomplish the shift line-up in the cycle
  • Ensure applicable procedures and work standards for all tasks are understood, adhered to and complied at all times for all such work
  • Maintain a high standard of housekeeping in the workplace
  • Utilize all safety systems as specified within the site safety management system


Pre-Employment Qualifications:

  • Pre-employment drug, alcohol and medical testing
  • Criminal Record Check (if applicable)
  • Possess a valid Millwright Journeyperson Certificate
  • Full Basic Underground Common Core
  • Minimum 2 years of work related experience as a licenced Millwright, preferably in a mining environment.


Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:

  • WHMI
  • Fall Arrest
  • First Aid Certification
  • Working at Heights
  • Strong troubleshooting skills
  • Strong mechanical aptitude with ability to perform routine equipment maintenance
  • Knowledgeable with hydraulic, pneumatic, and DC electrical control systems to a maximum of 50 volts DC
  • Demonstrate organizational skills with strong oral and written communication abilities
  • Must be able to work with little supervision; must be self-directed
  • Able to effectively prioritize workload to ensure deadlines are met
  • Experience working with Computerized Maintenance Management Systems is an asset.

Supporting a Diverse and Inclusive Workforce

At Cementation Americas, we believe in diversity and inclusion. We recognize the benefits of a diverse and inclusive workforce and we strive to provide a work environment that is respectful to all employees. One of our core values as a company is giving employees every opportunity to succeed - this starts with treating everyone with dignity and respect and valuing the unique contribution of every employee.

We encourage applications from people of diverse backgrounds and candidates for employment will be assessed in a non-discriminatory manner. In addition to career development training, all employees are provided with diversity and inclusion training. As a team, we will continue to grow and learn together.

We offer a competitive compensation package for our employees, including a generous group benefits plan, and we are committed to providing training and development for all employees.


How to Apply:

Start your application today by following this link https://cementationjobs.applicantpool.com/jobs/. Alternatively resumes can be emailed to

personnel@cementation.com%C2%A0

or faxed to 705-472-0078. When submitting your resume, please include relevant qualifications including, but not limited to, Ontario Common Core.

title: Millwright
description:
Overview:

Flex-N-Gate is a leading manufacturer and supplier of components for the automotive industry, recently ranked 10th of the 150 Top North American Suppliers in â€œAutomotive News.â€ A growing and vital company, Flex-N-Gate provides a great opportunity for hard-working and skilled individuals.

Scope of the Position:

Installs machinery and equipment according to layout plans, blueprints, and other drawings using hoists, lift trucks, hand tools, and power tools.

Responsibilities:

â€¢ Work and dress safely (i.e. wear proper protective equipment, demonstrate safe use of all machinery and equipment, etc.).
â€¢ Reads blueprints and schematic drawings to determine work procedures.
â€¢ Dismantles and moves machinery and equipment using appropriate tools, hoists, dollies, rollers and trucks.
â€¢ Assembles and installs equipment such as presses, shafting and conveyors
â€¢ Constructs foundations for machines
â€¢ Assembles and aligns machines and equipment, and ensures they are appropriately fastened to foundation or other structures
â€¢ Grinds, files or turns machine parts to dimensional specifications
â€¢ Repairs and lubricates machines and equipment
â€¢ May install robots
â€¢ May perform installation and maintenance work as part of a team of skilled trades workers
â€¢ Performs and documents all p.m. activities as directed by Maintenance Manager
â€¢ Assists in maintaining proper inventory levels of spare parts, lubricants, etc.

 

Qualifications:

â€¢ Possess a Provincial Trade License, or equivalent experience
â€¢ Minimum 4 years experience maintaining metal stamping presses, coil feeding equipment, servo transfer systems, overhead cranes, compressors and chillers.
â€¢ Knowledge of press room equipment, general fabrication and machine rebuilding
â€¢ Metal fabricating experience is required
â€¢ Able to work with limited supervision
â€¢ Electrical background an asset
â€¢ Plant Orientation Training
â€¢ Job Specific Training

Benefits:

â€¢ Medical, dental, prescription, vision, life and disability insurance
â€¢ RRSP retirement savings plan
â€¢ Extensive safety training, new hire orientation, continuous learning and development programs and tuition reimbursement
â€¢ Paid holidays and vacation time

What do our employees have to say?
â€œIt engages you professionally, and provides learning opportunities.â€
â€œLots of growth opportunity.â€
â€œThe companyâ€™s young enough to be exciting, but old enough to be stable.â€
Not just a jobâ€”a great place to work!
 

Flex-N-Gate is an equal opportunity employer.     Ontario Human Rights Code and AODA.

title: Dual Ticket - Millwright/Electrician
description:
Overview:

PaperWorks is a leading, integrated North American full-service provider of 100% recycled paperboard and specialized folding cartons for packaging applications. Founded in 2008 and headquartered in Philadelphia, PA, we are committed to the highest sustainable forestry and procurement standards.

 

We want our team members to be proud of the essential work they do, our commitment to the environment, and the overall company.   As part of our culture journey to be recognized as a Great Place to Work ©, we continue to invest heavily in our  people, our company  culture  and in  state-of-the-art technology  to be at the forefront of innovation and market differentiation.   PaperWorksâ€™ products are certified by the Forest Stewardship Council and 100% Recycled Paperboard Alliance.

Summary:

The Dual Ticket is responsible for repairing and maintaining equipment. He/she also ensures conformance to all Health and Safety Policies, Rules and Regulations and general housekeeping standards and is accountable for the efficiency/quality and safety results of his/her shift.

 

Responsibilities:

Responsibilities

  • Wear appropriate PPE and abide by the Electrical Safety Program.
  • Perform repairs on equipment.
  • Troubleshoot mechanical problems on equipment.
  •  Complete required paperwork accurately and on time for each shift.
  • Follow and complete all work instructions for each job.
  • Check quality continually ensuring standards are met or exceeded.
  • Operate a walkie to move product when necessary.
  • Responsible for knowing equipment lockout procedures.
  • Maintain equipment in all departments. Write out maintenance work orders when necessary.
  • Use lathe, mill, drill press and other machining equipment.
  • Use a multi-meter, soldering iron and other shop equipment.
  • Involved in spill response.
  • Guide Maintenance Helpers, Apprentices and fellow Maintenance employees.
  • Understand and apply the Ontario Electrical Code to work practices.
  • Perform housekeeping and other related duties.
  • Other duties as required.
Qualifications:
  • Ticket must hold both a Millwright and Electrician interprovincial license.
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience working in a fast-paced, highly automated manufacturing environment.
  • Confident with reading and interpreting hydraulic and pneumatic schematics.
  • Experienced using a lathe, mill, drill press and other machining equipment.
  • Preference will be given to candidates with experience with printing and high-speed  packaging equipment.
  • Experienced using Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel.
  • The successful applicant will be required to work a 12-hour rotating continental shift schedule (4 weeks days, 2 weeks nights)

title: Property Maintenance Team Member: Full Time & Part Time
description:
As a team member for Green Ventures Landscape Care, you would earn $16.50/hour with the opportunity to learn and grow with the property maintenance team.  We offer a safety focused positive team workplace — once people work at GVLC, they stay because they like it and it pays well!

This job — Team Member — is with the operations team and involves all aspects of property maintenance including mowing, raking, mulch installation, line trimming, edging, leaf and debris removal, planting and more.  This includes loading and unloading and cleaning equipment — rain or shine.  Other job functions not listed here may be required. 

If you have a good work ethic, are dependable and have an overall positive attitude and look forward to working and making money, and you can lift up to 50lbs — send us your resume: info@greenventureslc.com

Complete job description here: https://greenventureslc.com/employment-opportunities/

Website: www.greenventureslc.com

Address: 75 Howard Place, Kitchener, Ontario, N2K 2Z4

title: Bench Technician (Toronto ON, Canada)
description:
BearCom is the largest value-added distributor of wireless, voice, data and video solutions that boost operating efficiency and increase safety. The c...

Current experience with Two-Way radio products. AS degree in Engineering or equivalent certification plus 5+ years’ experience desired.

Extensive troubleshooting experience to the component level, including both analog and digital circuitry.

Able to troubleshoot OEM radio products w/o schematics and OEM assemblies.

Candidates must have experience meeting daily production goals in a fast paced environment.

Previous employment with Motorola, Two-Way radio dealers, Public Safety repair shops and other manufacturers is a plus.

Certifications on a variety of OEM radio equipment models needed.

Very fluent in using instrumentation (service monitors, oscilloscope, watt meters, frequency generator, frequency counter, etc.).

Must be customer service oriented.

 

 

BearCom offers competitive compensation to all of its employees as well as comprehensive benefits which include: Medical, Dental, Vision, RRSP upon hire, Paid-Time-Off, Holiday pay and much more.

 

BearCom is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace free from discrimination and harassment. We seek to recruit and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other disability protected by law. All employment is decided based upon qualifications, merit and business need.

title: Handy Man - Vehicle & Truck Accessories Assembler
description:
Vehicle Accessories Assembler

If you love mechanical assembly and enjoy fresh challenges each day this job is for you! Due to continued business growth, we are looking for a full-time accessories assembler, to join our champion production team. We are an innovative, fast paced vehicle equipment installer with a clean, positive culture & safe work environment.

Sterling Fleet Outfitters exists to improve the lives of mobile technicians! Providing them with outfitting solutions that minimize their downtime and maximize their effectiveness, giving them the best opportunity to be great on the job.

WHO ARE YOU?

  • Have a good attitude & morals
  • Honest
  • Upbeat & Positive
  • A team player
  • Action-oriented
  • Self-Motivated

Experience

  • previous vehicle accessories assembly is preferred, but willing to train the right candidate
  • Have proven mechanical aptitude and problem solving skills
  • Operating Shear, brake, saws and basic hand tools
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Physically fit and be able to lift, bend and stand for a complete shift
  • Class 5 driver's license
  • Able to drive a fork lift
  • Be capable of lifting 50lb

Not required but a definite asset:

Experience with installing 12v electrical lighting/ inverters/ backup alarms and 12v electrical problem solving

WHAT YOU WILL DO:

  • As a Van & Truck Equipment Accessories Assembler you will assemble partitions, shelving, ladder racks, custom cabinets/ draw systems, mount components for commercial vehicles
  • Potential for career progression in to vehicle installations
  • Interpret and follow detailed assembly instructions
  • Customize various panels to fit design specifications
  • Operate: Shear, brake, saws and basic hand tools
  • Be capable of lifting 50lb

YOUR WAGE & HOURS

  • Hours of work: 7:00 am — 3:30 pm Monday – Friday
  • Wage: Dependent upon experience with a 3-month review. $20 - $25


Check out our website and gallery to learn more about what we do. https://sterlingfleetoutfitter...

title: Facility Maintenance Worker
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It With Pride.

You independently operate and maintain at least one process, equipment or systems following autonomous maintenance (AM) standards and use your technical skills to improve line and/or system performance to meet business needs.

How you will contribute

You are a key ingredient in changing how the world snacks. With coaching, you will operate and maintain equipment to deliver on our safety, quality, cost, delivery, sustainability and morale targets. You will use execute all standard work processes on your equipment using AM (autonomous maintenance) and PM (progressive maintenance) standards and ensure that safety processes are observed, and that quality assurance activities are performed. You will understand the losses in their area and equipment and report them.

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:

  • Operating machines with coaching
  • Safety and quality standards for operating machines
  • Reading and writing, and fluently conversant in the language of communication as appropriate to the site
  • Collaborating well in a diverse work environment

More about this role:

What you need to know about this position:

The infrastructure sanitarian will be under the direction of the Sanitation Lead and will be responsible for performing:

a) Scheduled and unscheduled cleaning and sanitizing of the plant building and machinery including drains,

b) Building maintenance and repair work including wall and window repair, floor repair painting and organizing basic facility improvements.

c) Material handling duties with regards to housekeeping.

What extra ingredients you will bring:

  • Knowledge of cleaning supplies and agents used and the required PPE for their use

  • Knowledge of general building repairs including painting, floor and wall repair and use of small power tools.

Education / Certifications:

  • High School diploma

Job specific requirements:

  • Team player with a positive attitude, working well with others.

  • Ability to work independently.

  • Lift Up to 80 pounds.

  • Hand & Power Tools: Able to use.

  • Work schedule:

24B: 24 hours on weekend - 16 hours during weekdays.

Business Unit Summary

We are the second-largest snacking company in Canada and in the top 10 food companies in North America. We make and distribute delicious household favorites including Cadbury, Oreo, Mr. Christie and Maynards. We are an ambitious business—in the past few years alone, we have invested $250 million in our Ontario-based factories. Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. We are proud of our “local-first” commercial focus that enables us to take ownership of our own market and make more, faster decisions closer to our consumers. We are also proud of our top 100 position on Forbes magazine’s 2019 Canada’s Best Employers list.

If you are applying to a position in Canada, accommodations for applicants with disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact 847-943-5460 for assistance/support.

Job Type

Regular

Manufacturing core

Manufacturing

title: Millwright
company: International Union of Operating Engineers (IUOE) Local 793
description:
Join IUOE, Local 793 and build a rewarding mining career working at Baffinland Iron Mines Corporationâ€™s Mary River iron ore mine at Baffin Island, Nunavut.

Local 793 is now recruiting qualified Millwrights to work at Baffinland.

 

Responsibilities
â€¢â€ƒInstall, maintain, repair and troubleshoot stationary industrial machinery and mechanical equipment.
â€¢â€ƒRead diagrams and schematic drawings and service manuals to determine work procedures.
â€¢â€ƒOperate rigging equipment and dollies to place heavy machinery and parts.
â€¢â€ƒFit bearings, align gears and shafts, attach motors, and connect couplings and belts to precise tolerances.
â€¢â€ƒAlign and test equipment, and make any necessary adjustments.
â€¢â€ƒPerform predictive and operational procedures.
â€¢â€ƒRepair or replace defective parts.
â€¢â€ƒService and repair hydraulic and pneumatic systems.

 

Primary Skills & Qualifications
â€¢ (Red Seal) Certified Industrial Millwright
â€¢ 2 years of work experience as an Industrial Millwright in mining industry

 

Secondary Skills & Qualifications
â€¢ Exceptional mechanical aptitude and troubleshooting skills
â€¢ Energetic and enthusiastic approach with the ability to work as part of an interdisciplinary team
â€¢ Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills
â€¢ Ability to manage time effectively, while handling multiple jobs with varying priorities
â€¢ Experience with Mentoring Apprentices
â€¢ Ability to understand and execute oral and written instructions and to interpret technical manuals and specifications as required.
â€¢ Language: Speak English, Read English, Write English (Inuktitut would be an asset).
â€¢ Previous mining experience is an asset.
â€¢ Able to lift up to 50 lbs.
â€¢ Able to work outdoors in all-weather conditions
â€¢ Physically fit to perform all aspects of job

Examples of Supporting Documents:
â€¢ Relevant Certificates from Baffinland recognized training institutes
â€¢ An authorized document from a former employer verifying previous experience

 

All applicants must successfully pass a mandatory Criminal Record Check, Medical Exam and must be fully vaccinated (2 doses) against COVID-19.

 

About IUOE, Local 793

For over 100 years the International Union of Operating Engineers (IUOE) Local 793 has proudly represented its members, more than 17,600 today, in the construction, industrial and mining sectors in Ontario and Nunavut.

Becoming a Local 793 member will provide you with incredible opportunities to expand your experience, training and skills.  With good wages, benefits and working conditions, you will be able to grow your career to an even higher level!

Learn more about the rich history and accomplishments of IUOE Local 793 and its members: https://vimeo.com/378344656 

Learn more about Baffinland Iron Mines Corporation and its Mary River Mine: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kfP4JheT8gw 

Please Note: The Partnership Collective Agreement between the Union and Baffinland recognizes and respects that Baffinland is party to an Inuit Impact and Benefit Agreement (IIBA) that covers its mining operations. The IIBA provides that Inuit must have the opportunity for equitable and meaningful participation in Baffinlandâ€™s work at the mine.  Therefore, Baffinlandâ€™s hiring priority will be given to beneficiaries under the Nunavut Land Claims Agreement (NLCA) from Pond Inlet, Igloolik, Clyde River, Hall Beach and Arctic Bay and Iqaluit, followed by residents from other Baffin region communities and then to all other NLCA beneficiaries.

title: Millwright (Night Shift)
description:
Looking for a mechanical millwright to work for an expanding cosmetics manufacturer in Etobicoke. This is a position with both afternoon and evening shift times available. The successful candidate will be reporting to the mechanical engineer supervisor and would be responsible for the following:

Â·Routinely inspecting and examining all machinery and equipment for malfunctions and irregularities and notifying the Senior Maintenance Manager/Head of Maintenance

Â·Installing, aligning, dismantling and/or moving stationary industrial machinery and mechanical equipment, such as pumps, fans, tanks, conveyors when needed

Â·Operating hoisting and lifting devices such as cranes, and jacks, to position machinery and parts during the installation, set-up, and repair of machinery

Â·Performing maintenance procedures such as sharpening tools, adjusting, clean, lubricating, repairing and/or replacing equipment

Â·Assembling machinery and equipment prior to installation

Â·Maintaining cleanliness and housekeeping standards of the work site

Â·Maintaining records of equipment parts used and provide inventory levels updates on a regular basis

The successful candidate must:

Â·Be able to comply with all safety and health regulations (PPE, lock out procedures, etc.)

Â·Be in possession of a high school diploma or equivalent as well as the relevant designation

Â·Have a minimum of 2 yearsâ€™ experience in the manufacturing industry dealing with machine operation

Â·Be flexible and able to lift up to 25kg at a time

Â·Be able to handle a work environment where noise, dust and motorized equipment are present

Assets

Â·Valid red seal industrial millwright license/433A certification (strong asset)

Â·WHMIS, Pallet Lift Truck, Forklift certifications and/or Red seal experience

title: Industrial Maintenance Electrician
description:
At the Johns Manville Cornwall facility, we are committed to delivering positive and powerful experiences, because we are successful only when our employees and customers thrive! We are passionate, we care about people, we perform, and we protect others and our environments. If these values align with your values too; apply to be part of the Cornwall team!

We have an immediate opening for a full time experienced Industrial Maintenance Electrician to work in our state-of-the-art PolyISO foam manufacturing facility. We manufacture insulation for roofs, building insulation and an innovative tile backer board. It's a neat process, but what's even cooler is how we do it.



Your Day to Day:


* Must possess a safety-first mindset
* Test and maintain industrial equipment (electrical and mechanical)
* Troubleshoot electrical issues with machinery, systems, and fixtures
* Install, repair, and test electronic devices
* Adhere to regularly scheduled maintenance
* Comply with lockout tagout program requirements

Shift:

1st -7-3 pm

2nd- 3-11 pm

3rd- 11-7 am

Rotating 5 days

Compensation: $36.60/hr. to $38.60/hr.



What You Bring to the Team:


* Licensed Industrial Maintenance Electrician (442A)
* A minimum of 3 years of experience in an industrial manufacturing environment
* Able to read and interpret electrical drawings, blueprints, and schematics
* Electrical and mechanical troubleshooting, diagnosis, root cause analysis and implementation of corrective actions
* Self-motivated and ambitious - able to work with minimal supervision, while staying organized and meeting deadlines



Preferred Experience:


* Experience in SAP, MP2 and MAPCON
* Allen Bradley PLC programming experience

Benefits

With Johns Manville you can take pride in helping our team to deliver products that make a difference in the markets that we serve. You'll have the benefit of a supportive environment with good people who care, plus the opportunity for continued growth in your career. Johns Manville brings stability and a space for innovative thinking. Bring your purpose and desire to grow and in return you'll receive competitive pay, annual merit increases, a generous 401k match, paid holidays and vacation, education reimbursement and comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans.

Why Johns Manville

Johns Manville is a proud member of the Berkshire Hathaway family of companies, serving customers in more than 80 countries, supplying innovative products to the construction, aerospace, automotive, filtration and energy industries. With a more than 160-year legacy, we understand that our story continues to grow only with the right people saying, thinking, and doing the right things. Make your story our story.

Learn more at www.jm.com/careers and on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.

Johns Manville is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, protected veteran status or any other status protected by applicable law.





Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Maintenance Worker
location: RattleSnake Point Golf Club, Milton, ON
description:
RattleSnake Point Golf Club is Hiring! 

The Facility Supervisor is responsible for maintaining all aspects of the building’s systems including but not limited to security, HVAC, electrical, water, fire suppression systems, and sewage & waste management. The Facility Supervisor is also directly responsible for the cleanliness and presentation of both inside and outside the building.  

Requirements: 

  • Perform minor repairs to building interiors and exteriors. 
  • Ensure locker rooms and public areas are clean and presentable. 
  • Maintenance of the building including painting, cleaning, minor plumbing and electrical repairs. 
  • Maintain qualified outside contractors to make necessary repairs as required. 
  • Assist with event setup. 
  • Work within budget guidelines. 
  • Ensure the building is a safe, well maintained up to code workplaces (fire system checks, first aid supplies, and safety equipment etc.). 
  • Perform all other duties and tasks as assigned. 

Qualifications:  

  • Minimum 2-5 years of related experience in facility or property management. 
  • Knowledge of electrical, plumbing, security, HVAC systems and fire suppression systems.
  • Strong time management and communication skills. 
  • Ability to work well in a team environment. 
  • Strong organizational skills to manage competing priorities and balance multiple tasks. 
  • Basic computer knowledge of MS Office, ability to work with reports, spreadsheets, and other various documents. 
  • Proven ability to manage a variety of projects simultaneously. 

This is a full-time position. Some evenings and weekend shifts required. 

ClubLink is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive workplace. Please contact 

jobs@clublink.ca

 if a workplace accommodation is needed throughout the selection process. Thank you for your interest in ClubLink.
