title: Line / Maintenance Mechanic - All Shifts
description:
Responsibilities:

Must be able to independently operate at least oneproduction line.  Operation of a production line entails the following:

  1. Maintain specified target weights, torques, and overall product quality at all times.  Complete any necessary documentation. Achieve standard production outputs with standard crewing. Work with Team Leader and entire production team to ensure an efficient and safe work environment. Troubleshoot all minor mechanical difficulties during the course or production.
  2. Maintain a clean and safe production line or work area at all times.  Comply with and enforce plant Safety Standards, Good Manufacturing Practices, Standard Operating Procedures, and all other plant policies
  3. Has the ability to changeover the production line from one product to another
  4. Clean and sanitize (when required) all packaging equipment
  5. Help with any and all jobs on the packaging line when required
  6. Develop and encourage a high level of employee involvement and continuous improvement.  Participate in Team meetings
  7. Perform and record preventive maintenance on all packaging equipment (for your designated line) on a regular and timely basis, where required. Cleans, maintains and cares for all packaging equipment
Occupational Requirements 

Qualifications / Certifications: 
 1) Able to visually concentrate for extended periods of time.
 2) Able to stand, lift and carry consistently for eight hours.
 3) Must be able to read, write and speak English.
 4) Must work in accordance with all Health and Safety and GMP regulations

Working Conditions:
 
1) Possibility of working with unpleasant odours. 

 

2) Working in various temperature changes.  

3) Rotating and/or straight afternoon or midnight shifts.  

4) Possibility of working under conditions of high noise levels.  

5) Constant interaction with a variety of chemicals and chemical products.  

6) Regular work with moving machinery increases potential hazards.

title: Property Maintenance Tech
description:
Property maintenance and lawn care - duties include lawn cutting, fertilizing, laying sod, pruning & trimming...to name a few.

Starting rate of $16 per hour for applicants with no experience.   Will provide training.

Winter work also available if interested.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
This role is perfect for an energetic, motivated, and experienced maintenance technician capable of working independently and with a team. London at Heritage Station is a condominium property of over 700 suites, with a large rental component owned and managed by the developer (Westcorp). The ideal candidate will address common maintenance issues across the property and in the suites. The property management industry is highly customer service driven. This team member must possess strong customer service capabilities to ensure industry-leading customer service and facilities are provided to all stakeholders.  


Perform maintenance work orders for the property and in the rental suites in response to tenant requests.  

Identify and rectify general maintenance issues on the property (i.e. check all doors and lights for proper operation). 

Perform make-ready maintenance in vacant suites upon turnover. 

Perform preventative maintenance and emergency repairs. 

Handle common issues such as electrical, plumbing, heating, painting, light carpentry, caulking, minor appliance repairs, appliance installation and lighting.

Assist with landscaping and cleaning tasks as required and with snow removal and ice management between contractor visits. 

Assist with providing contractor access and inspection of contractor work, as required. 

Change locks and cut keys as directed by the Sr. Property Manager. 

Oversee and perform daily trash bin maintenance and garbage pickup around property as required with the ability to operate and maintain all site equipment, including an ATV (ATV training will be provided). 

Maintain an inventory of spare parts. 

Must have a flexible schedule as this role is required to participate in an emergency after-hours on-call rotation. 

Prioritize and schedule all work to meet deadlines. 

Support the Building Operator when required. 

Keep well-maintained maintenance logs. 

Identify, rectify, mitigate, and report any risks as they arise at the property. 

Execute all work in a safe, professional manner in compliance with Occupational Health and Safety Legislation. 

Ensure comprehension and compliance with all Westcorp Playbook policies.  

Perform other duties as assigned by the Sr. Property Manager. 

 


  • Relevant post-secondary education is an asset 
  • Efficient technological skills are a must as we utilize a variety of software in all aspects of the business 
  • General working knowledge of operations and maintenance functions as noted in responsibilities 
  • Possess a safety conscience and safety-oriented attitude 
  • Three to five years of relevant experience in a similar role is required 
  • Be physically fit, with the ability to lift, carry or move heavy items 
  • Have a high degree of professionalism and dedication 
  • Capable of working independently 
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills  
  • Possess strong English language skills, both written and verbal 
  • Possess a sensational customer service philosophy 
  • Be highly organized, results-oriented, and canwork in a multi-functional team environment 
  • Must have own tools 
  • Must have own vehicle and valid driver’s license   
  • Security clearance required upon offer of employment 
  • In alignment with our Westcorp Values: 
    • Integrity, Vitality, Accountability, Results, Collaboration, Learning and Innovation

title: Journeyman Millwright located in Bonneyville, AB
description:
Phoenix Industrial is seeking Journeyman Millwrights for an upcoming proect in the Bonneyville - Cold Lake area.

Phoenix Industrial provides services in Construction, Fabrication, Maintenance and Modularization. Built upon our values of visibility, value and accountability, we are proud of our growth and to support our continued growth, we are constantly seeking new, qualified talent to join our team. We are the leading fully integrated, single source contractor for all of our clients construction needs. From project planning to turnover and maintenance, we are able to deliver maximum value to clients every step of the way through proven processes and efficient management practices.

Responsibilities:

  • Read blueprints, diagrams and schematic drawings to determine work procedures.
  • Install, align, dismantle and move stationary industrial machinery and mechanical equipment, such as: pumps, fans, tanks, conveyors, furnaces and generators according to layout plans.
  • Use of hand and power tools.
  • Operate hoisting and lifting devices such as cranes, jacks and tractors to position machinery and parts during the installation, set-up and repair of machinery.
  • Inspect and examine machinery and equipment to detect and investigate irregularities and malfunctions.
  • Install, troubleshoot and maintain power transmission, vacuum, hydraulic and pneumatic systems, and programmable logic controls.
  • Adjust machinery and repair or replace defective parts.
  • Operate machine tools such as lathes and grinders to fabricate parts required during overhaul, maintenance or set-up of machinery.
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other routine maintenance work on machinery.
  • Construct foundations for machinery or direct other workers to construct foundations.
  • Assemble machinery and equipment prior to installation using hand and power tools and welding equipment.
  • Provide guidance, direction and supervision to apprentices.

Requirements:

  • Valid provincial Journeyman or Red Seal Certification.
  • CSTS-09 ticket.
  • Confined Space-Entry & Monitor ticket.
  • Fall Protection ticket.
  • Pre-access drug and alcohol testing.
  • Relevant Industrial experience.
  • Must support a safety-orientated work environment.
  • H2S Alive
See Job Description

title: Licensed Technician
description:
Due to Lexus of Oakville’s continued growth, we are looking for an additional Automotive Service Technician to join our award-winning team.  Lexus of Oakville is a Platinum-certified dealer, 5-time winner of the Pursuit of Excellence Award, and recipient of the Consumers Choice award for best Lexus dealership in the GTA for 7 consecutive years.  We’re looking for someone who exudes confidence, motivated, and has the right attitude to deliver the Ultimate Lexus Experience. 

Do you a have passion for working on vehicles and enjoy working in a team focused environment?  If so, we are looking for you.

QUALIFICATIONS:

 

  • Certificate of Qualification
  • Valid Ontario Drivers license
  • Customer satisfaction driven
  • Ability to perform maintenance
  • Ability to diagnose and repair
  • Work within a structured environment
  • Follow all Health and Safety guidelines
  • Lexus/Toyota experience preferred

WE OFFER:

  • Competitive Pay plan
  • Competitive Benefit Plan
  • Paid Lexus Training
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Busy flat rate shop plus Bonuses
  • State of the art service facility
  • Air-conditioned shop
  • Training support

If you are interested in joining a winning team of highly qualified and dedicated individuals please forward your resume. All resumes will be held in the strictest of confidence.

We thank all of those that apply, however only those that qualify will be contacted.

title: Millwright
description:
Our turkey processing facility in Mitchell, Ontario has an opening for a licensed Millwright to join our maintenance department. 

 

Shift: Sunday 11PM to 7:30 AM

Mon - Thurs 8PM - 4:30 AM

 

Position Summary:

Reporting to the Maintenance Manager, the Millwright will perform maintenance and repair of all facility, production machinery and refrigeration equipment. This position will be working on projects to improve safety, production, and environment at the plant. 

 

Key Accountabilities:

  • Quickly trouble shoot, diagnose and repair problems as they occur on any refrigeration, hot water and/or production equipment or the facilities and grounds;
  • Communicate and work in a teamwork environment with other maintenance personnel;
  • Work on projects as assigned;
  • Follow preventative maintenance procedures;
  • Accurately report on all work performed, parts and tools used as well as work required for all plant equipment;
  • Other duties as assigned by the Maintenance Manager and/or designate;
  • Work in and promote a safe environment;
  • Must work strictly in compliance with all Health & Safety, HACCP and follow all relevant GMP’s.

 

Requirements:

  • 3-5 years of experience as a licensed Millwright is required;
  • Valid Refrigeration “B” license for Ontario would be preferred;
  • Basic Electrical troubleshooting knowledge required including a working knowledge of PLC’s and equipment automation;
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) and interpersonal skills;
  • Industrial plant maintenance experience including but not limited to, the installation, maintenance, repair and overhaul of conveyors, pumps, motors, gearboxes rail assemblies, hydraulic assemblies, pneumatic assemblies and packaging machinery.

 

Build your career, apply today!

 

 

 

Sofina Foods Inc. is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (‘AODA’). Applicants are asked to make their needs/requirements, for the purpose of accommodation under AODA, known to Human Resources when they are contacted for an interview.

title: Non-Licensed Tradesperson
description:
Non-Licensed Tradesperson - night shift

Sofina Foods Inc. - Mitchell Ontario

 

Position: Full-time

Shifts: 11:00 PM - 7:30 AM Sunday to Thursday

Wage: $24.98/hr

 

Position Summary:

Reporting to the Maintenance Manager, the Tradesperson will perform maintenance and repair of all facility, production machinery and refrigeration equipment. This position will be working on projects to improve safety, production, and environment at the plant. 

 

Key Accountabilities:

  • Set up in RKE, including filter installs, equipment reassembly, blade changes/installs; 
  • Completion of Daily / Weekly PM’s;
  • Completion of Monthly / Quarterly/ Annual PM’s plant wide;
  • Communicate and work in a teamwork environment with other maintenance personnel;
  • Work on projects as assigned;
  • Accurately report on all work performed parts and tools used as well as work required for all plant equipment;
  • Other duties as assigned by the Maintenance Manager and/or designate;
  • Work in and promote a safe environment;
  • Must work strictly in compliance with all Health & Safety, HACCP and follow all relevant GMP’s.

 

Requirements:

  • 3-5 years of experience working in maintenance or other role requiring technical skill.
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) and interpersonal skills;
  • Industrial plant maintenance experience including but not limited to, preventative maintenance, machine set up and repair.

 

For more information on this Career Growth Opportunity please contact Julie Cooke, Manager, Human Resources at jcooke@sofinafoods.com or call 519-348-0290 ext. 294

title: Handyman
description:
Role

Construction Handyman

Responsibility

We are looking for an experienced Construction Handyman.

Wage: $20-25/HR

Start Date : Immediate

Location: Kitchener ON

Benefits:

- Become a contract worker with us!

- There are countless benefits to being a contract worker vs a regular hourly worker.

- Register yourself as a business (HST #) and work for yourself!!

Responsibilities:

- Rectifying any deficiencies before homeowner moves in including but not limited to:

- Fixing small drywall holes, taping, mudding, sanding.

- Putting in small trim pieces and caulking.

- Complying with the site and safety standards.

- PDI work and cleaning.

  • - Install all guard rails on-site to ensure compliance with all safety guidelines.
Requirements

Qualifications and Skills:

- Comfortably working in new homes (unoccupied & occupied) on a construction job site.

- Extensive knowledge of power tools, including skill saw, mitre saw, and jigsaw.

- Must have their tools and must have their method of transportation.

- Must have steel toe boots and a hard hat.

- Must have a bank account for direct deposits.

title: Senior IBX Facility Technician IV
description:
Senior IBX Facility Technician IVEquinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and brin...Senior IBX Facility Technician IV

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

 

We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents.  

Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best in class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary: Performs repairs, corrective maintenance, and routine installations. Able to resolve incidents as required.

Responsibilities

Facility/Infrastructure Maintenance

  • Performs site inspections and monitors the building and IBX alarms

  • Performs preventative maintenance on site infrastructure (e.g. maintenance of primary infrastructures), or manages vendors

  • Undertakes repairs and corrective maintenance

  • Operates critical infrastructure under the supervision of more senior technical staff


Site Administration

  • Completion of site logs and data gathering issuing for basic permits, such as MOPs and scripts


Incident Management

  • Responds to all on-site incidents and acts as required


Work Orders

  • Completes routine work requests and circuit installations


Collaboration

  • Provides assistance during critical maintenance activities

  • Effectively collaborates within the department and provides input to peers for general maintenance activities


Additional Projects

  • Carries out basic infrastructure projects


Qualifications

  • 1+ years experience

  • High School Diploma

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Equinix is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

title: Maintenance Engineer
description:
Posted Date:4/28/2022
Job Category:
Position Title:Maintenance Engineer
Salary Range:
Location:Mississauga, Ontario, Canada
Desired Skills:
Description:Our client, an award winning world class manufacturer, is currently recruiting for a Maintenance Engineer. The Maintenance Engineer coordinates daily activities of the maintenance staff in setting up, installing, repairing and maintaining machinery / equipment, metal fabricating parts and tools. Applies technical knowledge and expertise in the development and/or implementation of new and improved manufacturing processes, procedures and equipment; and ensures that the design specifications and procurement of equipment, tooling, fixtures, etc. meet company requirements and objectives.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:
Opportunity to work for a very well respected, world class manufacturer that has enjoyed many years of success and stability
Paid additional training and development
Excellent growth and advancement opportunities
An excellent compensation package including excellent benefits

Minimum requirements:
- Education in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
- Minimum 2 years of experience managing Maintenance activities in a metal fabrication and / or manufacturing environment.
- Strong skills in manufacturing and process engineering with knowledge of CNC machining, metal forming and welding.
- Working knowledge of AutoCAD, Pro-E and MasterCAM will be an asset.
- Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite is required.
- Understanding of robotic welding, mechanical and electrical machines, and equipment.
- Knowledge of hydraulic, pneumatic and mechanical theory.
- Knowledge of Safety Legislation.

Responsibilities include:
- Supervisor maintenance staff in electrical, electronic, mechanical, hydraulic, pneumatic maintenance, robotic programming, repair of machinery and equipment and diagnosing malfunctions in machinery and equipment.
- Conduct annual performance appraisals of maintenance staff.
- Supports the development of yearly budget for the maintenance department.
- Establish and maintain a preventative maintenance schedule for all production equipment in the plant.
- Establish up time data on all equipment and set plans to improve.
- Implement TPM activities and lean manufacturing concepts.
- Set up and maintain spare parts program for all equipment. Maintain stores area with Max-Min levels.
- Ensure all processes are documented and have SOP’s and standard work.
- Assist in programming of robots and related equipment such as robot controllers and programmable controllers as required
- Ensures that factory efficiency is maintained at the highest possible level, without sacrificing safety, quality and cost.
- Pass on information, experiences, knowledge and best practices to other maintenance associates with regards to repair jobs, preventative maintenance, problem symptoms, etc.
- Recommends measures to improve production methods, equipment performance and quality of product.
- Suggest changes in working conditions and use of equipment to increase efficiency of shop, department, or work crew.

Contact and Resume Submission
If you feel you are an excellent candidate and have the required skills and experience indicated above, please send your attached resume and any important details to HCR Permanent Search, care of the Recruitment Consultant listed below. Only qualified candidates who can work in Canada without restriction will be contacted.

Dennis Bossé
Director of Operations
HCR Permanent Search
(905) 669-2400 x2236
Email: dbosse@hcr.ca
www.hcrpermsearch.com

title: Senior Maintenance Tech - Millwright
description:
Gilead Sciences is continuing to hire for all open roles. Our interview process may be conducted virtually and some roles will be asked to temporarily work from home. Over the coming weeks and months, we will be implementing a phased approach to bringing employees back to site to ensure the health and safety of our teams.


For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:


Please log onto your Internal Career Site to apply for this job.


Job Description


For more than 30 years, Gilead has built a culture of excellence. We are committed, hardworking and passionate about improving the lives of the patients who use our products. Our values – integrity, inclusion, teamwork, accountability and excellence – are evident in everything we do.


Employees at Gilead challenge one another to ever higher standards and accomplishment. Gilead has attracted some of the sharpest minds in biotech and beyond, and the people who thrive in our culture are those who seek opportunities to do their best work beside others who share the same mission.


Gilead Science is seeking an experienced Sr. Maintenance Technician (Millwright) to join our team at our Edmonton, Alberta location. This role will be focused on the preventative maintenance and corrective immanence of manufacturing equipment for pharmaceutical products.


Job Responsibilities.


+ Locates and diagnoses failure, replaces defective components and performs basic troubleshooting using standard electronic equipment, detailed drawings, diagrams, sketches, specifications, prints, manuals and verbal and/or written instructions.

+ Maintains appropriate electronic maintenance and repair logs.

+ Uses a variety of hand, power and test tools and equipment.

+ Provides general maintenance support as designated by supervisor to include any or all of the following areas: Process equipment; HVAC equipment; Purified Water; centrifugal pumps and hydraulics

+ Coordinates maintenance on critical systems/equipment with supervisor.

+ Assists with root cause analysis and the investigation of specification deviations.

+ May be required to perform the duties of Maintenance Tech I and Tech II as required by supervisor.


Knowledge and Skills


+ Demonstrates a working knowledge of maintenance systems, methods and procedures.

+ Demonstrates strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.

+ Is proficient in Microsoft Office applications.

+ Is able to recognize deviation from accepted practice and troubleshoot.

+ Machining experience and fabrication of small parts or tools as needed


Education and Experience


+ Journeyman Millwright

+ 2+ years of experience in manufacturing equipment maintenance and repairs and a high school diploma or equivalent

+ Good writing and verbal communication

+ Willingness to work a flexible schedule (8- 5 am M-F) But must be willing to work a rotational on- call schedule

+ Must be willing to work in confined spaces and complete Confined Space Training

+ Must be able to lift 50 pounds unassisted, bend, stoop and twist. Must be able to stand for long periods of time as needed

+ Must be physically capable to enter vessels for repair

+ Experience working on mechanical seals

+ Repair and rebuild centrifugal pumps


For Current Gilead Employees and Contractors:


Please log onto your Internal Career Site to apply for this job.

title: Maintenance Engineer
description:
Scope of the Position

 

This position is responsible for assisting the Maintenance Manager and Maintenance Department in all activities and for the mechanical integrity program. The Maintenance Engineer will support and participate in the Responsible Care Program to ensure safe working conditions. Responsible for ensuring the site follows the Management of Change (MOC) process for all changes made to equipment, procedures and personnel. Become knowledgeable of the operation of the plant for the purpose of becoming an On-Call Supervisor for nights, weekends and holiday coverage.Environmental, Health & Safety 

 

What You Need To Be Successful 

  • Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering from an accredited university.
  • Three to five years of manufacturing experience preferably in a chemical or petro-chemical environment
  • Experience with predictive maintenance technologies (vibration analysis, etc.) is a plus
  • Must be a team player, able to direct and lead others.
  • Must be self-motivated with excellent communication and problem solving skills. 

Key Responsibilities

 

Project Management

  • Initiate, manage and complete capital projects as assigned.
  • Develop and document project scope, schedule and cost details.
  • Coordinate outside engineering firms for detailed engineering of complex projects.
  • Initiate, prepare, issue and administer Capital Allocation Requests for capital projects.
  • Hire, and manage qualified outside contractors for project construction.
  • Execute projects as approved and in accordance with the capital plan.

 

Manage projects consistent with Responsible Care and Process Safety Management guidelines.

  • Utilize Change Management processes, perform Process Hazard Analyses and complete Pre-Startup Safety Reviews.
  • Develop and communicate Contractor Safe Work plans.
  • Audit Safe Work Permits and Contractor work performance to ensure compliance with safety and quality expectations.

 

Plant Support

  • Support the Maintenance Department in solving technical issues related to plant equipment.
  • Lead the Brandon Plant’s program for inspection of lifting equipment. Support other facilities as needed to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
  • Lead the Brandon Plant’s pressure vessel management program and pressure relief valve maintenance program. Support other facilities as needed to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
  • Identify and implement continuous improvement initiatives and projects to support safety and cost improvements across the facility.

 

Maintenance Reliability

  • Lead efforts to ensure reliability and maintainability of equipment, processes, utilities and facilities.
  • Define, design, develop, monitor, and refine maintenance strategies based on asset performance.
  • Review plant history and other technical files to identify/resolve opportunities for improvements.
  • Conduct lifecycle costing analyses on new, problematic, and aging assets.
  • Apply value analysis to repair/replace, repair/redesign and make/buy decisions.
  • Track Key Process Indicators and identify areas for improvement.

 

Position:salaried - exempt

Reports to: Maintenance  Manager

 

CHEMTRADE is a publically traded (TSX: CHE.UN) chemical manufacturing and handling company headquartered in Toronto, Canada with 65+ locations across North America and Brazil. Chemtrade provides industrial chemicals and services to our customers in three main business segments; Sulphur & Performance Chemicals, Water Solutions and Electrochemicals. Chemtrade is a reliable industry partner to the Oil & Gas, Pulp & Paper, Water Treatment, Food & Beverage and Pharmaceutical industries and is committed to the codes and ethics of Responsible Care 14001.

 

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for the position; however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

 

Learn more about Chemtrade by visiting www.chemtradelogistics.com or follow us on Facebook.

Chemtrade is committed to fair and accessible employment practices and will, where possible, provide accommodations for persons with disabilities.

title: Industrial mechanic
description:
Graymont is a world leader in the field of lime and limestone solutions. Their products are used in particular for sanitation of air and water, as well as the production of essential items such as steel, paper and metals. Family business established for over 70 years and having its registered office in Canada, Graymont serves the markets of North America and Asia-Pacific.

We are currently looking for an industrial mechanic For its Bedford factory. The factory is located 30 minutes from St-Jean-sur-Richelieu and 40 min from Granby.

welcome to the graduates!


What our client offers you:

  • a safe and environmentally friendly environment;
  • permanent positions and possibilities of progression interesting;
  • A complete collective insurance program (medical, dental, disability and life);
  • The employee assistance program (PAE);
  • A pension plan with the employer's contribution;
  • Work clothes and boots;
  • A competitive salary of $ 40.59/h.

Description of the position

  • Plan and participate in mechanical, welding and plumbing work;
  • Perform preventive maintenance interventions ;
  • Diagnose mechanical problems and make the necessary repairs;
  • Participate in major repairs;
  • Maintain the order and cleanliness of his environment as Work.

This is a rotary schedule of 40h/week, Monday to Friday.

Profile sought

  • DEP in industrial mechanics;
  • Experience in an industrial environment (an asset);

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - Field
description:
Company:

Finning Canada

Number of Openings:

1

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

Join the Finning Canada family, part of the world’s largest Caterpillar dealer. We are currently looking for a dedicated Heavy Duty Mechanic who will be responsible for the field troubleshooting, maintenance and repair of a variety of Caterpillar and auxiliary equipment, based out of the Grande Prairie location.

This position will work a Monday-Friday, 5x2 shift rotation. If you are a safety conscious team player, self-motivated, autonomous, detail-oriented and possess your Journeyperson Heavy Equipment Technician certification with a valid driver’s license, then you are exactly who we are looking for!

Job Description:

  • Troubleshoot and repair Caterpillar equipment
  • Perform field diagnosis and field running repairs
  • Utilize Caterpillar SIS and ET daily
  • Complete technical documentation (service reports, warranty, crossover notes)
  • Interact with customers, sales support, and the rest of the Finning team
  • Work with the Service Supervisor and Leadhand on various tasks as required

Qualifications:

  • Interprovincial Heavy Equipment Technician (HET) Certification
  • Valid driver’s license with a successful recent drivers abstract
  • Safety conscious team player with excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills with a high attention to detail
  • Completion of Finning S-Levels, Failure Analysis, Machine Electronic Controls, or Tier 4 training would be considered an asset
  • Completion of Caterpillar product courses would be considered an asset

Note:

  • This field position is located out of the Grande Prairie branch on a Monday-Friday, 5x2 shift rotation
  • Overtime will be required along with some weekend work
  • May be required to work out of town - stay in camp or hotel
  • Candidate selection will be in compliance with the terms of the current collective agreement
  • Any future shift changes that may occur will be made in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Collective Agreement

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

title: Mecanicien industriel
description:
Nous recherchons des mecaniciens industriels pour compléter notre équipe de maintenance dans l'industrie du bois dans le secteur de la Beauce.

Vous êtes détenteur d'un DEP en mécanique industrielle, en électromécanique ou avez de l'expérience en mécanique? Vous désirez vous joindre à une équipe dynamique, stable et continuer de progresser en emploi? Vous êtes passionné par la maintenance industrielle, l'entretien mécanique et tout autre travail manuel en usine? Voici un poste qui vous intéressera:

Poste: Mecanicien industriel
Salaire: À partir de 58 000$ en fonction de l"expérience
Lieu: Beauce
Domaine: Industrie du bois
Horaire: De jour 3 jours/fin de semaine

Advantages
Voici quelques avantages à occuper ce poste de mecanicien industriel en Beauce

- Un salaire très compétitif
- Un emploi de 3 JOURS/semaine
- Assurances collectives
- Environnement de travail favorisant le travail d'équipe
- Un emploi dans une entreprise en pleine ascension
- Milieu ou la santé et la sécurité au travail sont très importants

Responsibilities
Voici à quoi vos journées ressembleront pour ce poste de mecanicien industriel en Beauce

- Diagnostiquer les troubles, pannes
- Effectuer l'analyse des problèmes qui surviennent
- Troubleshooting
- Effectuer les réparations pour les divers bris mécaniques
- Entretien préventif des divers équipements
- Autres tâches connexes


Qualifications
Voici les compétences recherchées pour cet emploi de mecanicien industriel en Beauce:

- Détenir un DEP en mécanique, électromécanique ou avoir de l'expérience dans le domaine
- Avoir de l'expérience ou un intérêt pour l'industrie du bois
- Posséder des connaissances en mécanique en hydraulique, en pneumatique et en soudure
- Avoir des connaissances de base au niveau de l'électricité
- Être à l'aise avec le travail sous pression
- Avoir le désir de poursuivre ses apprentissages dans le domaine

Summary
Ce poste vous intéresse? Communiquez avec Antoine Paradis, il me fera plaisir de faire votre connaissance et discuter avec vous!

Ma mission est de vous trouver un emploi de choix, un emploi pour vous! Le processus est complètement confidentiel.

Vous pouvez me contacter par téléphone ou par courriel :

Antoine
418-576-9863
418-525-7841
Antoine.Paradis@Randstad.ca

Que vous soyez électromécanicien, mécanicien industriel, soudeur, électrotechnicien, machiniste ou occupez un autre emploi en métiers techniques, nous sommes disponibles pour vous rencontrer.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
OCL Group Inc. (OCL), is a proudly 100% Canadian, privately held, employee owned fully integrated general contractor with design build solutions across Western Canada serving energy and municipal infrastructure markets since 2009. Our competitive advantage lies in our foundation of an empowered employee ownership group resulting in competitive pricing, fiscal responsibility, integrity, client centric relationships based in value and a history of client satisfaction.


We are currently accepting resumes for Journeyperson Heavy Duty Mechanics - Intermediate to Senior experience to support a project near Fort McMurray, AB.


Opportunities for Heavy Duty Mechanics with or without rig.


Responsibilities include:

  • Engine oil changes and oil sampling
  • Minor running maintenance repairs, lights, wipers, leaks, etc.
  • Greasing machines, adjusting tracks
  • G.E.T work. Replacing ripper tips, ripper shanks, bucket teeth, inspecting cutting edges and reporting, measuring ice lugs and reporting.
  • HVAC certification is required as well. Air conditioning and heating system repairs.
  • Ensure FLRA is completed at the beginning of every job and work is completed safely
  • Complete equipment maintenance in line with OCL, client and industry standards, procedures and practices
  • Independent work environment, without direct supervision
  • Ensure goals are met and communicate progress to supervisor
  • Journey-Certified Heavy Duty Mechanic/Inter-provincial Red Seal Certification
  • Experience working on Caterpillar equipment and Caterpillar service information systems
  • Previous side boom, shovel and pipeline equipment repair experience
  • Experience both in-field and in shop an asset
  • A clean driver’s abstract
  • H2S Awareness
  • WHMIS
  • One of CSTS/OSSA or BSO/CSO
  • Great attitude towards health and safety
  • Strong work ethic
  • Comfortable working outside in various weather conditions
  • Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug and alcohol test

OCL offers a collaborative work environment, competitive industry rates and health benefit eligibility.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - Field
description:
Headwater Equipment believes that no organization is any better than the people who work for it.  Therefore, it is of the utmost importance that we set high standards of integrity with an enthusiastic attitude in all that we do. We promise to maintain a well-trained workforce and a safe, modern facility in order to render our customers the best possible support and to provide our employees a secure future.

What Headwater has to offer:

  • Late Model Field Service Truck with Crane
  • Modern facility
  • Clean and Healthy work environment
  • Benefit Package is a Employee – Employer split cost
  • Includes Basic Family Dental and 80% of Cost on Prescription drugs (Family)
  • Life Insurance, Accidental Death and Dismemberment, Long Term Disability
  • Employer matching RRSP Program
  • Competitive Pay – See Pay structure below
  • Potential for advancement into management or sales
  • Positive Work Environment.
  • We are a family run company that cares for its employees
  • We have a proven record with a low turnover rate, we want long term people
  • Dealer for Sany Equipment and Cummins Repair dealer - Cummins certification and training available for employees showing interest

Applicants should have:

  • Experience with Cat and or Komatsu/Deere/Hitachi Equipment
  • Ability to work independently
  • Journeyman or Red Seal Heavy Equipment Technician - Off Road and/or On Road
  • Good Problem Solving Skills
  • Valid drivers license – abstract required
  • Enjoy working in a team environment
  • 2 to 3 years experience work on Heavy Duty Off Road Equipment
  • Potential employee’s to need valid Off road equipment ticket from their province, if not in possession of Red seal, or AB Off Road ticket; be willing to challenge AB exam and/or Red seal within 6 months

Job Duties to Include:

  • Running repair on off road heavy trucks, heavy construction equipment, diesel and diesel electric mining machinery
  • Repairs on bulldozers, graders, dump truck and excavators
  • Will require ability to troubleshoot and inspect equipment to detect faults and malfunctions, determine extent of repair required, adjust equipment and repair or replace defective parts
  • Instruct apprentices, keep maintenance reports and documentation

Pay Structure:

  • Industry competitive wages, and above
  • o $34/hr to $48/hr – Depending on Experience and if in the Field or Shop
  • Overtime at time and half - paid after 8 hours/day
  • Nightshift premium
  • When in the field, Hotels/Condo are paid, travel time paid, as well living out allowance
  • Headwater will assist with relocation costs
  • This is a permanent full time position

Other Requirements:

  • Pre employment Medical exam
  • Some sites we travel to require you pass a drug screen

Shift Structures:

  • Guaranteed minimum of 44 Hrs/week – Overtime available and paid at time and a half
    • Typical shifts are 55 hrs/week
  • Shift Structure varies with our different locations we work at –please contact us and we can give a run down of what you could expect and see if we have a shift rotation that can work for you.

Locations:

  • We are looking for mechanics to ideally be based out of the Lethbridge area - if field work is slow we have our field technicians work from our shop near Lethbridge
  • We have expanded our service field of scope - we also are hiring for the Edmonton area
  • Our mechanics must be willing to travel to remote job sites, travel time, accommodations, and living out allowance paid for travel
  • Locations include Sparwood BC, Edmonton AB, - Remote work locations include Northern AB, Southern SK and Manitoba
  • Our main shop is at 5-92041 River Ridge Road, Coalhurst AB (5 KM West of Lethbridge)

Contact:

  • Submit your resume thru the contact info given on this website
  • Only candidates selected for pre screen will be contacted

A bit about Headwater

We are a Heavy Equipment Sales and Service company, we refurbish and repair late model Cat/Deere/Hitachi heavy construction equipment. We are also a Sany America, Terex Trucks dealer, as well as a Cummins and Isuzu Certified repair center. (Dealer training is available for technicians interested) Headwater runs a very clean modern shop with separate Welding, Washing and Paint bays. We are a family run business that believes its employees are its greatest asset, we do all we can to ensure our employees are satisfied with their position within our company.

We run a fleet of late model 3 and 5 Ton service trucks – our trucks are top of the line, and we run only 1 man per truck.

For more information about Headwater and to see the quality products we turn out, visit our website or visit us on facebook

We are an equal opportunity employer and prohibit discrimination/harassment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - All Service Drilling
description:
The Geotech Drilling Group of Companies is hiring for a Heavy Duty Mechanic for our Alberta based subsidiary, All Service Drilling. this is an exciting role based in Airdrie, AB, working Monday to Friday with the potential for overtime. This dynamic role will allow for growth and further training within the drilling industry.

The Geotech Drilling Group of Companies remains sharply focused on being the drilling contractor of choice for our employees and clients, providing industry leading safety programs, technologically advanced equipment and positive, solution minded employees. For more information on All Service Drilling visit http://www.allservicedrilling.com/.

Key Responsibilities

  • Disassemble and reassemble components such as engines, transmissions, cooling systems, fuel and exhaust systems, breaks, clutches, differentials, hydraulics, electrical systems and lubrication systems
  • Inspect and test to detect faults and malfunctions in drill units, diesel compressors, hydraulic support equipment, high pressure water pumps
  • Diagnose faults or malfunctions using computerized and other testing equipment to determine extent of repair required
  • Perform duties that range from routine preventative maintenance to repairing major breakdowns, including troubleshooting and diagnostics
  • Contributing to the development of apprentices and working as part of a team to accomplish maintenance goals and targets.
  • Service attachments and working tools
  • Verify and repair emission control systems

Professional Experience / Qualifications

  • 3-5 years of experience with industrial heavy equipment including hydraulic equipment, diesel engines and compressors, high-pressure water pumps, drill units, diesel trucks, crawlers, and pumps
  • Ability to diligently organize work, make decisions, and set priorities
  • Valid driver's licence
  • Previous experience working on drilling equipment is an asset.
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Complete and pass a pre-employment drug & alcohol test

Education

  • High School Diploma or equivalent.
  • Preference will be given to individuals with their Red Seal trade qualifications in Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanics.

Compensation

At Geotech, we pride ourselves in offering a challenging and rewarding work environment. Our employees have the opportunity for career and professional growth through development and education.

In addition, our compensation benefit package includes competitive salaries and vacation packages, Health and Insurance benefit program, and Retirement Savings Plan.

If you are qualified for the position posted and are interested in being part of reshaping the future of Geotech Drilling, please contact us through our website at https://www.geotechdrilling.com/geotech-careers/job-opportunities/

title: MÉCANICIEN INDUSTRIEL
description:
Description du poste

Être mécanicien industriel chez EACOM Val-d’Or, une filiale d’INTERFOR, c’est d'avoir le coffre à outils qui te permet de réparer/entretenir/souder/usiner/régler/chouchouter les équipements et la machinerie de la scierie. Tout ça pour que les opérations… opèrent. Enracinées dans les régions du nord de l’Ontario et du Québec, nos scieries transforment bien plus que du bois, elles améliorent nos communautés.

Viens voir chez EACOM. On veut savoir de quel bois tu chauffes quand vient le temps de jouer dans les grosses machines. L’équipe t’attend !

Ce que tu vas faire concrètement :

  • Réparer les équipements : convoyeurs, composantes hydrauliques et pneumatiques, systèmes automatisés, etc. (incluant des travaux de soudure);
  • Identifier la cause des pannes ou du mal fonctionnement de la machinerie et effectuer les réparations nécessaires;
  • Installer/optimiser/régler tous les équipements de l'usine pour en maximiser l’efficacité;
  • Répondre aux situations d’urgence lors de bris mécaniques affectant les opérations;
  • Opérer des outils d'usinage pour fabriquer des pièces.

Ton profil pour bien réussir chez nous :

  • Efficace et organisé;
  • Analytique, consciencieux et rigoureux;
  • Joueur d’équipe avec de l’initiative;
  • Performant, mais sécuritaire (respect des normes en vigueur).
Qualifications

Le genre de vécu qui te servira :

  • DEC en mécanique industrielle ou DEP en maintenance industrielle (une expérience équivalente pourrait aussi bien faire);
  • Minimum 2 ans d’expérience en entretien d’équipements industriels (surtout si c’est dans l’industrie du sciage);
  • Le coffre à outils nécessaires pour ce travail;
  • Disponibilité pour travailler selon un des horaires suivants : Horaire 7/7 – 7 jours de travail régulier de 12 heures, en alternance jour ou nuit, ou de jour seulement selon les besoins, suivi de 7 jours de congé (5h00 à 17h00 ou 17h00 à 5h00).


Informations complémentaires

Chez EACOM, on est là pour toi.

EACOM supporte l’équité en matière d’emploi, la diversité est la bienvenue chez nous, en fait, on l’encourage !  Nous te contacterons si tu es sélectionné pour une entrevue et si tu as besoin d’accommodations particulières, laisse-le nous savoir. Toute information que tu nous envoies sera traitée avec respect et en toute confidentialité. Nos postes sont écrits au masculin pour répondre aux algorithmes de référencement, mais sache que tu es aussi LA BIENVENUE !

#EacomJOBS

title: Mécanicien(ne) Industriel
description:
Sommaire de la fonction

Sous la supervision du superviseur de maintenance, le titulaire du poste :

  • Exécuter de la mécanique générale et entretien préventif;
  • Exécuter des opérations de démontage, d’installation et d’ajustement des équipements;
  • Procéder à l’ajustement des équipements industriels en cours de production;
  • Exécuter des travaux de coupage, de soudage, d’usinage et de meulage;
  • Assurer le bon fonctionnement et l’entretien préventif des systèmes et des équipements;
  • Appliquer des méthodes logiques de diagnostic;
  • Entretenir et/ou réparer certaines pièces ou équipements hydrauliques ou pneumatiques;
  • Localiser, rectifier et réparer adéquatement des instruments et des contrôles automatiques;
  • Travailler selon les standards d’hygiène et salubrité en vigueur;
  • Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes en lien avec sa fonction.

Exigences

Conditions de travail :

  • Horaire du vendredi au dimanche (6H à 18H) ou du lundi au vendredi (14H à 22H30);
  • Salaire horaire de 27,50$, augmentation de salaire après 4 mois à 30,30$/heure;
  • Primes applicables;
  • Horaire de 36 heures par semaine, payé 40h par semaine;
  • Possibilité de temps supplémentaire;
  • Milieu de travail syndiqué.

Pourquoi vous devriez travailler chez Olymel :

  • Assurances collectives ;
  • REER collectif ;
  • Équipements de travail fournis ;
  • Formation continue ;
  • Prix employés ;
  • Programme d'aide aux employés ;
  • Et plusieurs autres

Exigences:

  • Diplôme d’études professionnel en mécanique ou formation pertinente;
  • Expérience de un (1) à deux (2) ans dans un poste similaire en milieu industriel;
  • Anglais parlé et écrit. (Un atout);
  • Connaissance des normes HACCP/SQF, SIMDUT, SST (atout);

Aptitudes :

  • Sens des priorités et très bonne capacité d’analyse dans la résolution de problèmes;
  • Sens de l’initiative;
  • Autonomie et débrouillardise;
  • Rigueur;
  • Disponibilité;
  • Travail d’équipe.

title: On-Road Heavy Duty Mechanic (FT)
description:
Recon Metal Ltd. is seeking an experienced On-Road Fleet Mechanic for our shop located centrally in Ogden Calgary.

Summary:
As the Fleet Mechanic, you will be responsible for performing preventative maintenance, inspections, and repairs to all on-road equipment, forklifts, and miscellaneous shop equipment. Recon Metal Ltd. offers competitive wages, a consistent year-round employment schedule, and a comprehensive benefits program.

Job Duties:
  • Inspect and perform preventative maintenance  
  • Troubleshoot and diagnose potential failures and repair 
  • Evaluate parts required for maintenance and repairs and communicate with the parts department  
  • Perform required CVIP inspections 
  • Road test trucks when required  
  • Complete all necessary maintenance and repair documents  
  • Maintain a tidy, organized, and safe workplace 

Required Skills and Experience: 
  • Licensed Heavy Equipment Technician or On-Road Journeyman/women Certificate  
  • Familiar with diagnostic software  
  • Valid class 3 driver license considered an asset 
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing  
  • Computer literacy, including excel and email 
  • Strong work ethic, integrity, and organization  
  • Own toolbox and tools  
 
Job type:
Full-time, permanent  

Salary:
Commensurate with experience 

Schedule: 
  • 10hr shift 
  • Monday to Friday  
  • Overtime 
  • Weekend repairs when required

title: Service Technician / Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Williams Machinery has been selling, renting, and fixing equipment for over 100 years. We also train people in all corners of British Columbia on how to operate machinery safely and effectively. From forklifts to skid steers, excavators, loaders, and dump trucks, Williams Machinery services industries such as warehousing, milling, construction, forestry, recycling, and more with their equipment needs. Join our award-winning company and experience working at a Gold Certified Canadaâ€™s Best Managed Company, and one of BCâ€™s Top Employers. 

Are you interested in servicing a diverse range of equipment, including Bobcat, Linde, Doosan, Clark, and Vermeer? From skid steers to excavators and more, our service teams handle it all. We are looking for a Service Technician to join our Williams Machinery dealership in the Surrey team. Reporting to the Service Manager, a successful candidate is customer-focused and a team player who can work independently. No matter which industry you have experience in, we hone your transferable skills and teach you all about the ever-changing world of equipment!

Apply Today!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Diagnosis and repair of equipment;
  • Perform routine scheduled Planned Maintenance (PM) services, appraisals, and Safety Inspections;
  • Complete all necessary time card and report documentation as required;
  • Complete shop work as required by Supervisor's direction when required;
  • Communicate repair status and requirements with customers and Supervisors alike;
  • Excel the 'customer experience' by being professional at all times;
  • Order and track all parts request to meet the customer expectation;
  • Complete jobs as assigned. Some out of town at customer site visits might be required;
  • Proactively seek opportunities to grow customer accounts while carrying out your duties;
  • Other related duties, as assigned.

 

Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:  

  • Heavy-Duty Journeyman certification or equivalent (no-licensed technicians with at least four years of working experience as HD mechanic)
  • General ability to carry out diagnostics and repairs on LPG, gas and diesel engines, hydraulic and electrical systems, as well as reading schematics from each
  • Strong troubleshooting skills
  • Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to contribute positively to the team environment
  • Willingness and desire to learn
  • Intermediate English language skills (Spoken and written)
  • A valid driver's license and current Driver's abstract may be required. *

 

Benefits and Perks:

*Our Service Technicians enjoy a competitive remuneration package with the benefits of having membership in the International Union of Operating Engineers. The salary range for a service technician varies from $36.57/hr to $41.74/hr, depending on the experience and qualifications. A valid driver's license and current Driverâ€™s abstract may be required.*

 

Who We Are: Our people are at the core of what we do. We take the time to hire the right people who share our 5 core values, train them, coach them, and reward them for their successes.

  1. Build Trust â€“ Build trust with others and & each other.
  2. Be a Team Player â€“ Commit to working together to win.
  3. Be Customer Focused â€“ â€œWowâ€ customers so they become â€œRaving Fansâ€.
  4. Support Community â€“ Care for our people, our community, and the planet.
  5. Deliver Results â€“ Know what you need to do and get it done.

 

Due to the volume of applicants, please accept our apologies in advance, as only those candidates shortlisted will be contacted. We sincerely appreciate your interest in our company. Thank you for exploring career opportunities with Williams Machinery.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Location: Sparwood, BC, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/18/2022Job ID: 9S525818418Category: Engineering & Technical

Join a top employer and advance your career. David Aplin Group has partnered with a Sparwood, British Columbia-based company to hire an experienced Heavy Duty Mechanic.

 

Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, Heavy Duty Mechanic is responsible for maintaining the fleet of mining equipment in a shop or field environment. The shift schedule is 4 days on 4 days off! Offer a full relocation bonus.

 


Perks & Benefits: 

Permanent full-time tradespeople are offered a competitive compensation package that includes: 

  • Comprehensive Benefits Plan including but not limited to medical, dental, and vision
  • Retirement Package
  • Two Annual Bonus Plans
  • Trades Retention Bonus
  • Relocation Assistance
  • Employee Share Purchase Plan
  • Healthy Lifestyle Account

 

Responsibilities: 

  • Be a courageous safety leader, adhere to and sponsor safety and environmental rules and procedures
  • Perform duties that range from routine preventative maintenance to repairing major breakdowns, including troubleshooting and diagnostics
  • Disassemble and reassemble components such as engines, transmissions, cooling systems, fuel and exhaust systems, breaks, clutches, differentials, hydraulics, electrical systems, and lubrication systems
  • Provide innovative solutions and best practices
  • Diagnose, maintain, and repair mobile off-road mining equipment including haul trucks, graders, bulldozers, excavators, shovels, loaders, and other heavy equipment

 

Qualifications:

  • Valid Interprovincial Red Seal Journeyperson’s Heavy Duty Mechanic or Heavy-Duty Technician Certification
  • Valid driver’s license
  • Strong interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work independently or as part of a team
  • Previous mining experience is an asset

 

Job ID: 9S525818418

 

If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted. 

 

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - Field Service
description:
Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.

As a Field Service Tech IV at United Rentals, you’ll use your skills to perform maintenance and repairs of complex equipment with limited or no supervision in a highly skilled, safe, and professional manner. Every day, you can improve and challenge yourself, and if you have the desire and ambition, you’ll have the potential to work towards leadership roles in our Service Department. Like every member of our team, we will rely on you to provide exceptional customer service to our customers.

If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. You will be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals. Plus, you will have the opportunity to relocate to one of our 1,000+ locations.

Additional duties include the following:

  • Maintenance and repair of complex mechanical, electrical, hydraulic, and diesel systems on a variety of rental and customer equipment and tools while using a high degree of independent judgment

  • Travel to customer job sites for repair/maintenance of rental or customer owned equipment; must maintain service vehicle in a clean and professional manner

  • Assist in the training of lower level technicians as needed

  • Maintain paperwork/electronic documentation of work performed (work orders) in a complete and timely manner on a daily basis

  • Assist with pick-up and delivery of equipment & parts

  • Other duties assigned as needed

Job Requirements:

  • High School diploma or equivalent

  • Valid driver's license with acceptable driving record

  • 5+ years of experience repairing/maintaining equipment and tools

  • Advanced mechanical aptitude and working knowledge of tools

  • Extensive knowledge of construction equipment with an advanced understanding of schematics and diagrams

  • Must own tools applicable to position

  • Superior customer service, teamwork and verbal/written communication skills

  • Ability to frequently lift items up to 45 lbs.

At United Rentals, the largest equipment rental company, we believe that it takes great employees to build a great organization – and we’re passionate about helping our people grow professionally and embrace teamwork in everything they do. Our culture is based on our corporate values and centers on mutual respect, job satisfaction, diversity and a shared responsibility to build a better future.

What's in it for you?

U.S. Full Time roles:  Best in class benefits offering includes medical, dental, vision, flex spending and health savings accounts;  401(k) retirement with company match; life and disability insurance; and paid time off including sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental leave.  Comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

U.S. Part Time roles: Benefits offering includes 401(k) retirement with company match/RRSP; paid time off including sick, vacation and holidays; and comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities.

Canada: Best in class benefits package which includes medical, dental & vision, RRSP/DPSP*, paid time off, comprehensive training and development, and career growth opportunities.

*Offered for full time roles, part time eligibility in select provinces

United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Waste Connections of Canada has an immediate opening for a Heavy Duty Mechanic to join our team in Windsor, ON to work on a fleet of garbage trucks. As a Heavy Duty Mechanic, you will do a lot of hydraulics, brake jobs along with preventative maintenance and minor engine repair. You will be responsible for maintaining Waste Connections of Canada (WCC) vehicles and equipment in a safe working order. The Heavy Duty Mechanic will work directly with the Maintenance Manager to ensure that all vehicles meet all provincial regulations and standards, and WCC safety standards.




Full time with benefits




With OT and bonuses - Mechanics can make up to $80k - $90k per year




Location: 5000 8th Concession Maidstone, ON N0R 1K0




Pay rate: $38.00/hr. plus $3.00 shift premium




Shift timing: Monday to Friday from 2 pm till 11:00 pm




Requirements:



+ 310T license (MANDATORY)


+ 3-4 years of experience as a Heavy Duty Mechanic


+ Must be able to pass all pre-employment tests


+ Commercial drivers license is an asset


+ 3rd or 4th year Apprentices are welcome to apply!!





Text Iram at 416-907-5364




Come, join a team environment, and colleagues who embrace a "work hard, play harder" culture. Our compensation package is competitive and comes with excellent benefits. You’ll also be associating yourself with a company that likes to lead by example through a strong presence in our local communities, charitable giving, sustainability initiatives, and more.




Waste Connections of Canada is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Mécanicien industriel (14261)
description:
Produits forestiers Résolu est une entreprise axée sur la gérance environnementale et le succès financier qui offre des emplois valorisants et prometteurs, donnant ainsi aux gens motivés toutes les chances de faire progresser leur carrière. Si vous êtes une personne enthousiaste et prête à agir utilement, Résolu est le gage de votre réussite professionnelle.

Notre établissement de St-Thomas Didyme (Québec, Canada) est actuellement à la recherche de candidats compétents en vue de pourvoir le poste de Mécanicien industriel. Il s’agit d’un poste permanent à temps plein.

 

Relevant du superviseur d’entretien, vous aurez comme principales responsabilités;

  • Effectuer des entretiens préventifs/correctifs et répondre aux bris pendant la faction de production;
  • Émettre des recommandations d’amélioration ou d’entretien dans une optique d’optimisation de la machinerie;
  • Appliquer les procédures requises en santé et sécurité, en environnement et selon ISO;
  • Assurer la qualité des produits selon  nos standards et les exigences des clients;

 

Exigences:

  • Être détenteur d’un diplôme d’études professionnel (D.E.P) en mécanique industrielle, soudage-montage, électromécanique ou mécanique d'engin de chantier;
  • Être reconnu comme une personne sécuritaire ne faisant aucun compromis pour la sécurité;
  • Avoir des habilités relationnelles reconnues et savoir travailler en équipe;

 

Conditions de travail:

  • Poste temps plein;
  • Salaire compétitif;
  • Bonus de production;
  • Gamme complète d’avantages sociaux disponibles;

L’usage du masculin dans ce document a pour unique but d’alléger le texte.

 

Les produits forestiers sont essentiels, tout comme chacun de nos employés et de nos entrepreneurs. Nous prenons les mesures nécessaires pour protéger la santé et le bien-être de nos employés et préserver l’intégrité de toutes les installations de Résolu.

 

Nous sommes tous solidaires dans cette crise. Nous formons une grande communauté. Nous sommes #FIÈREMENTRÉSOLU

 

Faites partie du changement. Joignez-vous à une équipe dynamique.
Chef de file mondial de l’industrie des produits forestiers, Résolu vous propose un milieu de travail énergique et sécuritaire, riche en occasions et en défis qui vous permettront de développer vos compétences. Nous sommes plus de 8000 employés en poste au Canada, aux États-Unis et dans plusieurs autres pays du monde.

Nous recherchons des personnes possédant l’expérience et le savoir-faire nécessaires pour améliorer notre efficacité, accroître notre rentabilité à long terme et fournir à nos clients des produits et services de premier ordre. Et vous, que recherchez-vous?

Notre entreprise est en train d’écrire une nouvelle page de son histoire au sein d’un secteur en évolution rapide. Nous avons réalisé d’importants progrès pour assurer notre viabilité et devenir un fournisseur de choix, respectueux de l’environnement. Venez participer à notre histoire et faire partie du changement!

Pour savoir comment nous bâtissons le Résolu de demain, consultez notre rapport annuel sur pfresolu.com/publications.

Joignez-vous à la conversation!
Lisez Le blogue Résolu à blogue.pfresolu.com et nous suivez-nous sur LinkedIn, Twitter et YouTube.

title: Industrial Equipment Mechanic
description:
Description

We are looking for Industrial Equipment Mechanic, $20-$26 DOE.

Could be someone with experience in: Plumbing, pipe fitter, millwright, etc.. 

Requirements

Requirements & Abilities:

 

  • Scheduling flexibility and ability to travel up to 75% and work in the field away from home

  • Valid driver’s license required with a good driving record, CDL a plus

In addition to consistent work, top pay, and employment opportunities, we provide a benefits package that is among the best in the industry. Our comprehensive benefits encourage our employees and their families to build a lifelong relationship with us.

  • Dental and vision plan

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic Subcontractor (Kearl)
description:
Position Scope:

NACG is seeking an experienced Journeyperson Heavy Duty Mechanic (Off Road) with Service Truck (Partial Direct Service Provider) to join our dynamic and industry leading organization. Upon hire, you will be eligible for a $7,500 Attraction Bonus* and our long-term service awards which are made in yearly payments. The sooner you start the more you earn!!

 

Looking to build your career?  You can earn up to $60.38 per hour (includes base rate, kearl blended rate which is to compensate for no OT on the 14 day rotation, pension, training, vacation and general holiday pay, tool allowance and health and wellness â€“ benefits, dental and disability). Successful candidates will also receive Camp Accommodations & Client provided flights to/from Edmonton or Calgary  and $225.00 per year of Boot Allowance. Truck rate is $45.00 (flat rate) or Full Direct Service Provider  flat rate is $125

 

Site: Kearl

Schedule: 14x14

Accommodations: Camp provided

Transportation: Client provided flights to/from Edmonton or Calgary

 

The successful candidate  will be required to join the International Union of Operating Engineers Local 955.  

 

NACG also offers an Employee Referral Program*,  an employee may be eligible to receive a referral bonus if he / she refers an eligible candidate for a posted Heavy Equipment Technician (HET) position in the Acheson Shop and/or Fort McMurray area with NACG. Each successful referral will result in a payment of $2,500.  

 

*Note the above is only applicable to HET's hired as a Partial Direct Service Provider, not if you are hired as a Direct Service Provider.*

 

Effective February 15th  2022, Kearl is requiring all employees to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. If you are selected for this position, you will be asked to declare your vaccination status and to submit copies of proof of vaccination.

Responsibilities:
  • Complete repairs on CAT/Komatsu/Hitachi equipment of all sizes.
  • Work closely with peers in both maintenance and operations.
  • Preventative Maintenance and servicing of all equipment.
  • Evaluate equipment performance and inspect to detect faults and malfunctions.
  • Trouble shooting systems â€“ example: hydraulic, electrical & mechanical of all equipment and determine faults and extent of repair.
  • Test repaired equipment for proper performance and to ensure that work meets manufacturer specifications.
  • Mobilization of equipment for maintenance and repair.
  • Develop work scopes and schedules for equipment to be repaired.
  • Order required repair parts, complete reports and fill out work orders.
  • Teach and evaluate apprentices and mentor Mechanics.
  • Follow NACG codes of practice and Safe Operating Procedures.
  • Other maintenance duties as assigned.

Specific Requirements:

  • Minimum 2 yearsâ€™ experience post Journeyman (Journeyperson) certification on large Haul Trucks/Dozers/Graders and Excavators.
  • Possess excellent diagnostic and troubleshooting skills and abilities.
  • Capable of working with minimal supervision.
  • Exhibit professional work behaviors.
  • Committed to continuous learning.
  • Basic knowledge of computer applications.
  • Demonstrate leadership skills in daily work interaction
Qualifications:
  • A valid Alberta Journeyman Equipment Technician (Off Road) Certificate or an Interprovincial Red Seal Journeyman Heavy Duty Equipment Mechanic/Technician (Off Road).
  • Experience with Cat SIS is an asset.
  • Previous experience on a Safety Sensitive work site an asset

Truck Requirements:

  • Current CVIP and Picker Inspection.
  • Oxygen/acetylene cabinets that meet OH&S requirements.
  • Full complement of tools for repairing Off Road Equipment.
  • $5 million liability insurance
Summary:

All successful candidates must:

  1. Be proficient in English, both verbally and written
  2. Have a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Have experience as requested as mentioned above
  4. Subject to Random Testing at: Suncor, Suncor Fort Hills and Kearl sites
  5. Disclose COVID-19 vaccination status:
    • Fully immunized individuals must provide government issued proof of vaccination to be exempt from site testing requirements
    • Individuals not fully immunized may be subject to site COVID-19 testing requirements and associated costs
  7. Undergo and successfully pass the following testing:
    • Breath Alcohol Test
    • Urine Drug Test
    • Fitness-to-Work Assessment
    • Audiometric Testing
    • Vision Screening
    • Criminal Record Check

Shift, site, and start times are subject to change.

 

All successful candidates MUST provide the following items prior to confirmation of their start date:

  1. CSO Certification
  2. Copy of Valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License
  3. Copy of recent Driverâ€™s Abstract
  4. VOID cheque/direct deposit form

Once dispatched the following processes will occur:

  1. Will receive a call from NACG to set up all required pre-employment testing
  2. An email will be sent with all required New Hire Paperwork to be filled out
  3. After all results are received by NACG candidates will be contacted by Site Admin to schedule orientation and confirm your start date and other site specific details.

Please note the entire On-boarding process can take anywhere from 3-8 business days.

 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE, SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES WILL BE CONTACTED VIA PHONE OR EMAIL.

 

Overview:

North American Construction Group (NACG) has served as an industry leader in the heavy construction and mining industries for over 65 years.   In that time, weâ€™ve proven ourselves as a safe and reliable contractor who can complete projects of any size and scope. Weâ€™ve also taken a number of bold steps forward to broaden our footprint, expanding to mines outside our provincial borders, and providing third-party maintenance services to clients and customers.  

 

In addition to providing employees with rewarding careers, North American has a whole lot more to offer:

  • Significant Growth â€“ As a company, NACG is rapidly expanding, and has practically doubled in size over the past year alone.
  • Long Term Contracts â€“ With over $1 billion dollars in contracted work booked through 2023, NACG can provide long term employment solutions and numerous opportunities for advancement.
  • Commitment To Safety â€“ With a top tier record for safety performance, NACG is dedicated to ensuring that everyone gets home safe, and constantly strives for a goal zero performance.
  • Competitive Compensation â€“ NACG provides competitive compensation packages for all employees.

North American Construction Group is an equal opportunity employer, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected.

 

Become a member of the North American family today!

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Rempel Brothers Concreteis currently looking for a responsible, safe, and dependable2nd to4th year apprenticeor Heavy Duty Mechanic/Commercial Transport Mechanicto join our local team on our afternoon shift. As a Mechanic you will be responsible for the preventative and repair maintenance, and troubleshooting on all heavy mobile equipment.
$41.91 /hour

Who We Are:

Rempel Brothers Concreteis part of the Lehigh Hanson group of companies. Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.
With our diverse product lines and locations across North America, there are opportunities to explore different roles and work on a variety of exciting and interesting projects. At Lehigh Hanson, we believe our employees play a key role in the company’s success and future growth.

We offer:

  • Secure, long-term employment
  • Competitive wage and benefits package
  • Training and development
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • OT available
What You Will Get to Do:
  • Lubricate and perform breakdown maintenance and scheduled repairs of mixer trucks and other equipment as required to achieve optimum performance.
  • Operate and inspect machines or heavy equipment to diagnose problems.
  • Ensure that all equipment repairs are performed accurately to the manufacturer standards.
  • Test mechanical products and equipment after repair or assembly to ensure proper performance and compliance with specifications.
  • Perform other miscellaneous mechanical and maintenance duties as assigned.
Who We Are Looking For:
  • Valid Interprovincial or Red Seal Journeyman ticket or2nd to 4th year apprentice
  • 2 years related experience.
  • Proficiency in servicing transmissions, rear ends, running gear, electrical, pneumatic and hydraulic systems on mixer trucks is an asset.
  • Understanding of DOT inspection requirements.
  • Proficient computer skills MS Office.
  • Experience with formal maintenance programs.
  • Requires lifting, kneeling, bending, twisting, pushing and pulling, working at elevated heights, at times in tight and awkward positions.
