title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Weyerhaeuser is seeking individuals who are committed to safety, have a positive attitude, excellent work ethic and a desire to work in a manufacturing facility. Weyerhaeuser’s Edson OSB is currently looking for a Journeyman Mechanic to join our Edson OSB facility.

At Weyerhaeuser, we offer positions with on-the-job training, continued growth potential and a career limited only by you. We continually strive to develop and promote talent from within while offering stable employment with excellent pay and benefits. Our manufacturing facilities are highly automated and utilize many leading-edge technologies in the wood products industry.
*Key Functions*
* Support manufacturing by maximizing equipment uptime and provide support for facility equipment and rolling stock (including vehicles, forklifts, and specialized heavy equipment) in a safe manner, while contributing to corporate, plant, and departmental goals.
* Work with a team of mechanics, millwrights, and electricians to troubleshoot and repair complex mechanical and electrical problems and perform preventative maintenance on facility equipment and rolling stock. These repairs include but are not limited to gasoline, propane, and diesel engine repair; hydraulic, electrical, suspension, transmission, brake and air system repairs; and basic cutting and welding.
* Perform inspections, and diagnosis of facility equipment and rolling stock, by utilizing a variety of devices including an electrical technician diagnosis system.
* Conduct safety checks on facility equipment and rolling stock. Read repair orders and perform necessary tasks to successfully complete the repair of facility equipment and rolling stock.
* Complete required documentation utilizing preventative maintenance software program to track preventative maintenance, repairs, parts usage, and time allocation.


* High School Diploma or GED equivalent is required .
* Journeyman HD Mechanic
* Experience in an industrial setting is preferred
*Specific Skills*
* Knowledge and proficiency in gasoline, propane, and diesel mechanics.
* Knowledge and troubleshooting of complex mechanical and electrical repair of facility equipment and rolling stock, including but not limited to vehicle, forklift, and heavy equipment.
* Must own complete set of hand tools up to an inch and a quarter.
* Qualified and proficient in cutting and welding; basic fabrication skills. Certified welder preferred, but not required.
* Knowledge and experience in computer skills including Outlook, Excel, Word, web-based applications including the internet, and preventative maintenance application.
* Knowledge and experience using computer-based diagnostics systems.
* Ability to read and comprehend service and technical information.
* Knowledge and ability to use Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS). Show proficiency in Job Safety Analysis (JSA) and OSHA standards.
* Ability to work closely with supervisors and other departments; be a team player/leader; good communication skills and demonstrate positive attitude.
* Willingness to work any shift, work overtime and weekends.
* Maintain a clean workstation, and exhibit good performance, safety and attendance records.

*About Wood Products*
We've been delivering quality building products and solutions to our customers for more than 100 years. From builders and dealers to specifiers and homeowners, we offer exceptional product performance and unparalleled support.
*For more than a century, we’ve been building our reputation as a leader in sustainable wood products.*
*About Weyerhaeuser*
We sustainably manage forests and manufacture products that make the world a better place. We’re serious about safety, driven to achieve excellence, and proud of what we do. With multiple business lines in locations across North America, we offer a range of exciting career opportunities for smart, talented people who are passionate about making a difference.
*We know you have a choice in your career. We want you to choose us. *

/Weyerhaeuser is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to taking affirmative action to employ and advance in employment women, minorities, qualified individuals with disabilities and protected veterans./


Job:Operations, Manufacturing, & Construction*


Title: *Heavy Duty Mechanic*

Location: *CAN-AB-Edson*

title: Industrial Millwright
description:
MILLWRIGHT


Considering a Career at Maple Leaf Foods?

Maple Leaf Foods is Canada’s leading consumer-packaged protein company, headquartered in Mississauga, Ontario. We make high-quality, great tasting, nutritious and innovative food products under leading brands including Maple Leaf®, Maple Leaf Prime®, Maple Leaf Natural Selections®, Schneiders®, Schneiders Country Naturals® and Mina™. Our Company employs approximately 11,000 people in its operations across Canada and exports to more than 20 global markets including the U.S. and Asia.

Our people are passionate about the work they do and the products we make. As we move forward, we are determined to leverage their integrity and passion to continue to build a high-performing, values-based company enabled by high-performing, motivated and talented people.

POSITION SUMMARY:


The Reliability Technician will be responsible for maintaining and servicing equipment used in the facility for daily production. They will ensure safe plant operations and a safe working environment for all employees.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Read and interpret blueprints, diagrams, schematic and drawings to determine work procedures and/or order necessary parts.
    Trouble shoot repairs, install processing and packaging equipment with a working knowledge of electrical, utilities and facilities systems to allow efficient repair/replacement result
  • Conduct planned preventive & predictive maintenance and keep maintenance records.
  • Actively participate in preventive maintenance program on building equipment processing equipment daily.
    Efficient production equipment set up, inspection and shutdown of all related equipment when required, including process changeovers.
    Assist in planning, organizing of work activities (drawing interpretation, parts preparation).
  • Install, troubleshoot, repair and maintain industrial equipment and power transmission, pump, vacuum, hydraulic and pneumatic systems.

EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS:

  • Licensed Millwright
  • Knowledge of conveyors, high speed slicers, pumps / compressor, electrical / electronic controls.
  • Knowledge of pipe fitting practices and steam piping.
  • Working knowledge of vacuum systems, pneumatics and hydraulics.
  • Strong SAP skill sets.
  • Must be able to work independently, work with contractors and other Reliability personnel
  • Perform any other duties as assigned

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022). We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws
We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.
Championing diversity and inclusion is a critical component to advancing our collective purpose and vision, living the Maple Leaf Leadership Values, and delivering winning results. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired; please contact our Talent Attraction Team at

accommodations@mapleleaf.com

.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - Licensed Journeyman
description:
Now Hiring

Heavy Duty Mechanic - Licensed

 

At Canada Cartage we work with intelligent and focused leaders who are driven to create an outstanding customer experience in partnership with Canadian leading brands. Canada Cartage is deep rooted in family values with an entrepreneurial culture where ideas are welcomed, growth is fostered and high performance is championed. A recognized thought leader and founded in 1914, Canada Cartage dominates the industry by delivering innovative fleet solutions.

We are currently looking to add a full-time, afternoon shift Heavy Duty Mechanic to our team. Someone who is equally passionate about serving the community and achieving operational success alongside our dedicated and loyal employees.

Working at our unionized shop located at 17508 116 Avenue NW, Edmonton, the Heavy Duty Mechanic with Canada Cartage, reports to our Fleet Shop Manager and will be performing preventative maintenance and repairs on our fleet. This will include carrying out diagnostic testing and repairs to primarily OTR truck & trailer equipment, using modern maintenance practices. This position is maintenance shop based, however our mechanics may be called on to carry out service calls and perform test drives to adequately service our fleet.

Shift: Four day work week, Monday to Thursday from 2:00pm to 12:30pm

 

Responsibilities:

  • Performs assigned repairs and preventive maintenance services
  • Performs inspections, diagnostics and repair of electrical, hydraulic, suspension, brake, and air systems on vehicles and equipment
  • Utilizes vehicle on board diagnostics and diagnostic laptop/software to troubleshoot faults & failures in order to repair as required
  • Performs all work within the Standard Repair Times (SRTs)
  • Conducts safety checks on all vehicles and equipment
  • Completes the required paperwork , enters repair into Transman FMS program. Including detail of vehicle repair, parts used, and repair time
  • Reviews, completes, repairs identified on Driver Vehicle Inspection Reports. As assigned
  • Performs maintenance related repairs as required
  • Maintains a clean, safe work area in compliance with Corporate / OSHA Standards
  • Performs all work in accordance with established safety procedures
  • Is responsible for the quality of their work and the safety of the equipment that is worked on

 

 Core Competencies and Qualification:

  • Licensed Heavy Duty Mechanic
  • Proficient in performing various diagnostics, tests, and repairs with a diagnostic computer system
  • Physical requirements of this position will include the ability to push, pull, drag, and lift items up to 50 pounds, and occasionally must work at shoulder level with equipment weighing up to 25 pounds
  • Must be able to supply your own set of hand tools to perform basic repairs
  • Must have steel toe work boots. We provide an allowance of $150/year for new boots and we provide all PPE and coveralls.
  • Must hold Safety of self & equipment as highest priority
  • CVI inspector license is beneficial
  • Must successfully pass a background check
  • Have your own hand tools

 

Why work for Canada Cartage?

  • No mandatory overtime.
  • Minimal outside mobile work (only boosting).
  • Heated shop equipped with pits for easy servicing.
  • Uniforms provided.
  • Recession-proof business model, steady hours all year around.
  • Well maintained, modern fleet (mostly 2018 and newer).
  • Performance based remuneration.
  • Online OEM Education (Navistar, Cummins).
  • Comprehensive benefits (life, disability, medication, dental, vision, RRSP and more).
  • 3 paid sick days per year.
  • Group discounts (Costco, Hertz, Bell, GMC, Lenovo, Goodlife Fitness and more).
  • Tool, boot and winter coat allowance.
  • College tuition fees reimbursement for apprentices.
  • Solid career advancement opportunities.



Our Team

We are a family-oriented company with competitive benefits, including extended health and dental, RRSP and Company-Matching pension plans; discounted hotels, car rentals, entertainment, gym memberships, phone plans, electronics, to name a few of the perks; a cohesive team and a positive, hard-working atmosphere. We have fun events throughout the year, like truck rodeos, summer barbeques and driver-appreciation week that regularly bring us together. It’s important to give back to the communities in which we operate, so we volunteer with and donate to local charities

We also have Company wide recognition initiatives designed to recognize drivers and staff when they demonstrate outstanding customer service, teamwork and our core values.

Why do we have one of the lowest driver turn-over rates in Canada?  A team environment, short-haul regular routes and great benefits.

Recognized leader in the industry:

Canada Cartage has been recognized on the Forbes list of Canada’s Best Employers 2022. This is the sixth straight year that Canada Cartage has been included on this list. https://www.forbes.com/companies/canada-cartage/?list=canada-best-employers&sh=7841454553d8

The Canada’s Best Employers 2022 title, along with our 6th year of being recognized by Trucking HR as one of Canada’s “Top Fleet Employers” serves to reinforce Canada Cartage’s reputation as an employer of high quality.

Our Values

Integrity: We conduct our business with honour, honest and ethics with our people, the environment and legal matters. We believe I being transparent and trustworthy, respecting the traditional “handshake” value system and earning our way in.

Humanity: We are a family minded organization, caring for people and treating them with dignity, decency and respect, be it employees, customers, suppliers or our partners. Open door policy and dealings is our way.

Accountability: Accountability and accessibility to our staff, customers and our customers’ customers is of utmost importance to us. We enable a high level of two way communication, providing access to people who wil deal with issues ad have the willingness to resolve things.  We will be relied on and held accountable for our results and our long term commitments.

Collaboration: We understand that results are the product of a team effort. As part of our process, we ensure collaboration with all our staff at all levels in all roles across departmental lines. With our customers, we use a collaborative style approach, sharing ownership to ensure a successful operation.

Dedication: Our organization is employee and customer-driven. We encourage an environment of conscientious effort and earnestness, hiring problem solvers who are responsive and have a "can-do" attitude to get the job done.

Leadership: Personal leadership to us means being competent, taking ownership, demonstrating initiative, and having a voice. Corporate leadership to us means being leaders in the market, continuous improvement and innovation, and empowering those around you.https://jobs.jobvite.com/canadacartage

Come work with an industry leader!

 

We would like to thank all those expressing an interest in this position; however only the candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Committed to employment equity, Canada Cartage Systems LP encourages applications from Aboriginal people, members of visible minority groups, and women.

title: Mécanicien industriel
description:
Description de poste :

  • Vérifier les demandes de réparations à chaque début de quart de travail;
  • Effectuer les réparations urgentes;
  • Réparer les équipements de production en général;
  • Effectuer des activités de maintenance préventive sur les équipements;
  • Compléter les bons de travail pour l’entretien des équipements;
  • Accomplir des travaux de soudure mineurs lorsque requis;
  • Suivre adéquatement les procédures de santé et sécurité;
  • Faire toutes autres tâches connexes.

Qualifications :

  • DEP en mécanique industrielle ou équivalent;
  • Expérience passée : non requise;
  • Être capable de conduire un chariot élévateur.

Caractéristiques recherchées :

  • Assidu;
  • Esprit de logique et d’analyse;
  • Sens de l’initiative et autonomie;
  • Facilité pour le travail d’équipe.

title: Industrial Mechanic
description:
Why work for Lafarge?:

 

 

 

 

 

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, weâ€™re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.  

 

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

 

 

Overview:

 

This is an hourly paid position included within the bargaining unit of the Boilermakers Union, Local D454, posting 2022-02. Competitive hourly rate ($33.59/hour) and benefits are offered.

Responsibilities:

 

As a member of the plant maintenance team, you will be responsible for troubleshooting, inspection and repairs on all Lafarge owned equipment.

Qualifications:

 

  • Must hold a valid Nova Scotia or Interprovincial Industrial Mechanicâ€™s Ticket
  • A Mechanical Technologist would be an asset
  • Must be physically fit to perform the job and be able to work in areas of high elevation
  • Must have the ability to work with limited supervision in a team environment
  • Must hold a valid driverâ€™s license

 

Reqirements of the Position

 

  • Will participate in ongoing training and/or certification for millwright, welding, PPM technologies (e.g. vibration, lubrication, non-destructive testing, etc.).
  • Will perform inspection functions as required (e.g. running checks).
  • Will use Computerized Maintenance Management Systems.
  • Will participate in planning and scheduling activities as required.
  • Will be expected to respond to Plant overtime needs and perform shift work when scheduled.
  • Working safely is a condition of employment at the Brookfield Plant.   You must comply with all safety rules and regulations.
LafargeHolcim:

 

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.  

 

We thank you for your interest.  Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.   Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

 

Lafarge Canada Inc. welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. In Ontario, our organization/business is committed to fulfilling our requirements under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.  

 

Lafarge Canada is committed to providing a safe environment for employees, customers, contractors and vendors. As such, in keeping with the requirements of our industry associations, partners, and clients across Canada, Lafarge Canada has implemented a COVID-19 vaccination policy intended to reduce the spread of COVID-19. As of October 1st, 2021, all new employees joining Lafarge Canada, subject to any requirement to accommodate pursuant to applicable human rights legislation, must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Mobile Industrial Technician - Millwright (FT)
description:
MILLER WASTE SYSTEMS – PICKERING

Title: Mobile Industrial Technician - Millwright
Location:  Miller Waste Systems – Durham Region
Start Date: To be determined
Shift: Days
Reporting to: District Equipment Manager 
 
Description:
Miller Waste Systems Inc. has been in operation since 1961. Miller is a leader in waste management and diversion, providing governments and industries with a wide range of services in the provinces of Ontario, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick, and Manitoba. Miller has over 50 years of experience in the waste management sector and currently operates out of more than 30 locations. We are looking for a highly capable Mobile Industrial Technician - Millwright to be located out of our Pickering location in Ontario.
 
Miller Waste Systems is looking for a Mobile Industrial Technician - Millwright with 5+ years of experience in industrial equipment repair and with 1+ years of mobile service experience. A collaborative but strong nature is essential, and the applicant’s background in parts and maintenance and the transportation industry will allow them to succeed and grow within Miller Waste.
 
Responsibilities:
In the position of Mobile Industrial Technician your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: 
  • Must adhere to Miller Waste System safety protocols and must be familiar with occupational Health & Safety Act.
  • Performing daily preventative checklists and recording the conditions of equipment following the manufacturer-recommended preventative maintenance program for various sites within Durham Region.  
  • You will be required to perform electrical repairs on equipment as well you will have experience and general knowledge with welding and cutting.  
  • You must be able to troubleshoot and diagnose breakdowns on MRF and Transfer facility equipment and lines.  
  • This position will require frequent travel to other MRF and transfer station locations within Durham Region.
  • Previous experience with heavy equipment & conveyor systems maintenance, as well as previous experience with baling equipment and compactors is key for this position.  
  • Experience with Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) is an asset.  
Requirements:
  • Journeyman Certification as a Millwright/Industrial Mechanic, but will also consider 3rd and 4th Year Apprentices with a strong working knowledge of conveyors, stationary engines, pumps, compressor, grinders, welding equipment, electrical/electronic controls, power tools, fans/blowers, and hydraulic systems.  
  • Must have a full complement of professional hand tools.  
  • Must have a sense of urgency and attention to detail.  
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills are required as well as excellent organizational skills.  
  • Must be a team player and a self-motivated individual who is able to work without supervision and function safely around equipment.  
  • Must follow all Miller Waste Safety policies & procedures (ie. Lockout/tag-out procedures).
  • A valid and clean driver's license is required. 
  • Flexibility is also required as this position occasionally requires travel, early starts, late finishes, and, on rare occasions, weekend work.

All Miller Waste Systems Employeesmust comply with the company's COVID-19 policy and protocols.
 
We are committed to equity, diversity, and inclusivity in the workplace, we welcome applications from women, racially visible individuals, people with disabilities, indigenous peoples, and LGBTQ2S+ persons.

We are committed to providing persons with disabilities with equal opportunities and standards of goods and services and are fully compliant with the applicable provincial Disabilities Act.

Miller Waste Systems strives to be ‘only the best’. As a privately owned and operated Waste Company we have 50 years experience of in providing quality service to all our customers. We have been successful in achieving this goal by providing a family and employee-centric environment at all our locations. By providing an industry-leading work environment and compensation, benefits, and pension programs, Miller Waste continues to grow our business.  




    About MWS Markham.:

    Miller Waste Systems Inc. has been in operation since 1961. Miller is a leader in waste management, providing governments and industries with a wide range of services in the provinces of Ontario, Nova Scotia, New Brunswick and Manitoba. Miller has over 50 years’ experience in the waste management sector and operates out of 30 locations. From these 30 locations, Miller services a variety of collection areas, from the very urban in downtown Toronto, to the very rural in North Bay. Miller can custom tailor a solution for all its customers.

title: Journeyperson Industrial Mechanic or Journeyperson Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Job Description

Journeyperson Industrial Mechanic or Journeyperson Heavy Duty Mechanic - (Lanigan, Saskatchewan, Canada)

At Nutrien, our Purpose is to grow our world from the ground up and we do so with safety and integrity as our core values. Nothing is more important than sending our people home safe, every day.

Nutrien is a leading provider of agricultural products, services, and solutions. With approximately 23,000 employees world-wide, we are the largest producer of potash (by capacity) and one of the world’s largest producers of nitrogen and phosphate. We also operate a leading agriculture retail network that services over 500,000 growers.

We harvest the best. Diverse views and experience make us strong. We look for people who have a safety-first mindset, who are collaborative team players, who deliver on their commitments, who are innovators in search of a better way, and who believe in inclusion.

Working at Nutrien will provide you an opportunity to help us Feed the Future, and grow your career.

The Journeyperson Mechanic reports to the Mine Mechanical Supervisor.

What you will do:

  • Work safely in a mining environment and able to follow the procedures and policies that are in place
  • Inspect, diagnose, adjust, repair, fabricate, modify, and install plant equipment
  • Plan, layout, and use trade skills for assigned work
  • Play a critical role not only ensuring your own safety, but also the safety of others

What you will bring:

  • Valid Saskatchewan Provincial or Inter-provincial Journeyperson Industrial or Heavy-Duty Certificate
  • Previous experience in an industrial environment is an asset
  • Positive safety behavior and safety leadership
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work in the field or shop environment
  • Ability to interact positively with co-workers and supervisors
  • Ability to work safely and effectively in a labour-intensive team environment as well as independently
  • Willingness to learn and gain adequate knowledge and experience through training
  • Stable work record

 

Are you a good match? Apply today!

Nutrien is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

This job will remain posted until filled. In accordance with Nutrien policies, you will be required to undergo a background check and may be required to undergo a substance test. Being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 is a condition of employment and that proof of vaccination will be required, with minimal exceptions, unless prohibited by applicable law.  While we appreciate all applications we receive, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

To stay connected to us and for the latest job postings and news, follow us on:  LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter 

 

**EOE race/color/sex/sexual orientation/gender identity/disability/veteran

title: Apprentice Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Job Description:

Are you a safety advocate at work and have a passion for diagnosing and fixing heavy equipment? Do you enjoy working in heavy equipment shop environment and have experience with troubleshooting various pieces of heavy equipment such as Haul Trucks, Dozers, Excavators and/or Graders? If you said yes, then we are your Clear Choice!

 

Due to unprecedented growth, Flint, a division of ClearStream is looking to add to their team in Fort McMurray, AB. We are seeking 3rd and 4th year Heavy Equipment Mechanics with a minimum of 1 year of experience for exciting permanent opportunities.

 

This opportunity is a fly-in, fly-out position with shifts starting immediately. Flight hubs are located in Calgary and Edmonton to/from Fort McMurray with the option for bussing also offered. Camp accommodation is provided for all staff.

 

Perks of the Job

  • Total compensation for this position ranges between $52.03 and $58.53/HR
  • Merit Benefits after 300 hours.
  • 7/7 schedule alternating day and night shift, 12 hrs/day
  • Overtime for any additional worked hours outside of schedule
  • Camp accommodation
  • Flights from Calgary and Edmonton

What would you be doing?

  • Diagnose faults or malfunctions using computerized and other testing equipment to determine extent of repair required
  • Inspect and examine equipment to detect irregularities and malfunctions
  • Use hand and power tools to perform repairs and test repaired equipment for proper performance and ensure that the work done meets manufacturersâ€™ specifications and legislated regulation
  • Read and understand work orders, prepare estimates and interpret technical manuals
  • Large scale overhauls and rebuilds
  • Relocate/operate heavy equipment to move it within the shop area
  • Adjust equipment and repair or replace defective parts
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other preventative maintenance work
  • Equipment and facility continuous improvements
  • Interface with customers, products and sales support
  • Provide support with reference to on-site safety requirements
  • Writing technical reports and complete paperwork as required
  • Ensure that safety policies, quality standards, and standard operating procedures are followed
  • Will primarily do work  on the following pieces of equipment or the like:  
    • CAT 797 D & F  
    • Liebherr T284 C    
    • Komatsu 930E  
    • CAT 793 C & D  
    • CAT 777  
    • CAT 785  
    • Hitachi 5000  
    • Engines would be Cummins, CAT or MTU4000  

Does this sound like you?

  • 3rd or 4th year certification as an apprentice Heavy Equipment Mechanic- OFF ROAD
  • Minimum 1 year experience as a Heavy Equipment Mechanic
  • Large off-highway Caterpillar, Liebherr, Komatsu and/or Hitachi mining equipment experience would be considered an asset
  • Oil Sands or large open pit mining equipment experience would be considered an asset
  • Specialize in fuel pumps and injectors, track equipment, engine overhaul, hydraulic controls, power shift transmissions and allied equipment
  • Computer skills, including experience with Microsoft office is essential
  • Dedication to safety
  • Ability to interpret technical manuals.
  • Safety tickets required (CSO or BSO, Fall Protection and AWP)

 

Other Important Details

 

This position has been identified as a safety sensitive position and will require completion of drug and alcohol testing.  

 

Mask Fit will be required and you will be requested to be clean shaven

 

 

Why ClearStream  

 

We are the clear choice for rewarding opportunities and challenging careers. Joining our team would mean you would contribute to the quality of work we do and to the success of ClearStream along with the values we share. If you are driven, dedicated and have a passion for helping our customers bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.â€¯â€¯  

 

We are committed to creating a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion, including fostering a safe and respectful environment that allows for diverse perspectivesâ€”a work environment in which all employees are valued and have an equal opportunity to achieve success.â€¯ Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected factors.â€¯

title: Industrial Mechanic Millwright/Assembler
description:
Industrial Mechanic Millwright/Assembler
(Custom Machine Build)
Location: Mississauga, ON


Do you have a background as a custom machine builder and are a Licensed Industrial Mechanic Millwright /Assembler in Ontario (433A) OR  a Certified Tool and Die maker (430A) OR a Certified Engineering Technician/Technologist or equivalent?  If you answered yes, and you have your own tools, our client wants to talk to you! Come join their ever growing team!

About this Position:

The Mechanical Assembler/Fitter/Millwright  is responsible for the assembling, debugging, modifying and installing machinery accordingly mechanical design. This position is also responsible for, start-up and commissioning of machine lines and systems.

  • Assemble, debug, modify and install custom designed machinery according to the schedule, the company quality standards and to meet or exceed customer expectations
  • Responsible for the integration of purchased mechanical and pneumatic components, manufactured details and sub-assemblies to construct automated machinery for custom applications
  • Perform critical precision alignments and set-ups of mechanical components and systems and take measures to ensure integrity of set-up
  • Responsible for installing pneumatic components and sub-systems as per supplied schematics and specifications, plumbing.
  • Perform machining tasks when required (grinding, milling, lathe etc.)
  • Responsible for testing, pre-commissioning and optimizing system performance and equipment durability concerns, adhering to all applicable codes and standards.
  • Participate in equipment tear down, packaging, rigging and transporting and installation as required
  • Must identify all tools, fasteners, miscellaneous items and equipment required to complete tasks efficiently and work with plant manager to secure all required material in a timely manner.
  • Perform plant related maintenance and maintenance on plant equipment as required.
  • Other duties as assigned

Required Experience
 
      •  
  • 10+ years experience in custom machine building field (preferably wire & cable industry), experience in high speed lean manufacturing environment is an asset
  • Demonstrated experience in building equipment utilizing the following technologies: robotic systems, high speed index transfer (dial, indexing chain, walking beam etc..), pneumatic actuators, servo motors and actuators
  • Familiarity with modern electrical controls technologies as they apply to automated equipment (e.g. PLC’s, HMI’s, safety devices, and instrumentation)

Desired Skills:
 
      •  
  • Read and interpret AutoCAD (2D) and SolidWorks (3D) drawings and understand tolerances & critical dimensions.
  • Perform dimensional & quality inspections using measuring devices (micrometers, Vernier’s, measuring tapes, etc.).

Ability to use the following machine shop equipment safely and efficiently to complete tasks;
      •  
  • milling machine, lathe, surface grinder etc. (CNC milling, sink or wire EDM experience would be an asset)
  • Ability to weld common metals (MIG/TIG) encountered in machine building is an asset
  • Understanding of basic machinery rigging principles and the ability to operate rigging equipment including, cranes and forklifts etc.   AND
      •  
  • Good working knowledge of pneumatic/hydraulic control circuits
  • Good working knowledge of bearing installation and press fits.


Must Haves:
Ability to work overtime as required and travel worldwide on short notice (valid and current Canadian passport is required) is a must
Experience with machine start-up and commissioning activities.
Valid Ontario Driver’s License and access to insured vehicle for travel within the G.T.A. and surrounding areas is a must

Excellent compensation and benefits will be offered and will be based on experience

All qualified candidates are invited to apply

Keywords: hydraulics, assemblies, industrial automation, electromechanical engineering, Brampton, Toronto, North York, Vaughan, Woodbridge, Etobicoke, Halton, Caledon, Bolton, ON, Oakville, Georgetown, Bolton, Acton, Milton, Mechanical Assembler, Custom Machine Assembler, Mechanical Machine Assembler, Machine Builder

title: Industrial Mechanic (Millwright)
description:
Ready for a new challenge?
Join a stable organization that will invest in your future, helping you advance and increase your value!

KP Building Products, a member of the Kaycan Group of companies is seeking an Industrial Mechanic to join our team at our Acton facility. As a Millwright, you will be responsible for, but not limited to, repairing, assembling and testing all types of equipment for production readiness.

Schedule: 8h - Day shift

We Offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • Health and Dental benefits (after 3-months)
  • RRSP
  • Ongoing training initiatives

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for safely and effectively repairing, testing, installing and maintaining production equipment and facility systems
  • Identify and troubleshoot machine irregularities and breakdowns on extruders, cut off machinery, packaging equipment, power transmission, power transfer systems, compressors, pumps, grinders, process water cooling systems, shipping doors and gates
  • Work with and maintain hydraulic and pneumatic systems as well as pumps, gearboxes, bearings, seals and alignment of couplings
  • Perform preventive maintenance tasks as well as breakdown repairs
  • Fabrication for equipment repairs and/or upgrades
  • Perform other duties as assigned
  • Working from heights
  • Good understanding of blueprint reading
  • Good documentation & organizational skills
  • Fit and assemble parts using a variety of hand tools
  • Perform welding, hand finishing, grinding, and polishing
  • Participate in and provide on the Job training with/to other maintenance Team Members and Apprentices

Qualifications:

  • Possess a Certificate of Apprenticeship for Millwright, Industrial Mechanic
  • 3 years of relevant experience in a production plant
  • Experience with welding, fabrication, repair of all equipment found in a manufacturing plant
  • Experience with machining, mill, lathe, grinder, etc. would be an asset
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively with cross functional team members
  • Proven ability to adapt to changing priorities and working conditions
  • Capacity to identify short term and long term countermeasures for production problems that arise specifically when extruding plastic
  • Passion for teamwork, ongoing learning, continuous improvement and maintaining a respectful environment.
  • Support a call-in system for emergency repair
  • Willing to work overtime upon request
  • Strong English language communication skills (both verbal & written)

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those candidates who meet the requirements of the role will be contacted.

KP Products is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Products will provide reasonable accommodation for disabilities to support participation of candidates in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Industrial Mechanic Millwright - Mon-Fri 7a-3:30p
description:
About O-I


Remember the last time you opened a bottle of champagne? A cold beer after a hard day’s work or a bottle of sparkling mineral water to quench your thirst? Well, it was probably made by us. We are O-I and we love that we make more glass containers than anyone in the world.


O-I has more than a century of experience crafting pure, sustainable, brand-building glass packaging for many of the world’s best-known food and beverage brands. We are proud to provide high quality glass packaging for beer, wine, spirits, food, non-alcoholic beverages, cosmetics and pharmaceuticals.


As an Industrial Millwright you will:


+ Install, repair, assemble and maintain plant machinery, equipment and structures.

+ Reading and interpreting engineering blueprints

+ Works from complex blueprints, shop handbooks, layouts, and other specifications (written or verbal) to determine the materials and working procedures needed in the maintenance of plant machinery, equipment, and structures.

+ Welds, brazes, scrapes, solders, cuts, etc. various types of metals necessary for maintenance repairs and fabrication of new components and equipment.

+ Involved in rigging and scaffolding; moves heavy machinery and equipment; lubricates greases, oils, etc., plant machinery and equipment.

+ Conducting routine maintenance and safety checks.

+ Preparing and submitting maintenance reports.


The Industrial Millwright should have:


+ Must possess Industrial Millwright License with Red Seal Endorsement.

+ 5 years of related work experience as an Industrial Maintenance Mechanic

+ Must have experience using hand tools and power tools.

+ Must have experience and basic knowledge of computers and be able to enter PM activities

+ Excellent troubleshooting skills with the ability to read blueprints, diagrams and drawings

+ Basic computer and report writing skills

+ Must be able to read, write, and communicate using English language

+ Must be able to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodations.

+ Must be authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis

+ Ability to lift and manipulate heavy equipment

+ Good time-management skills


Hours of Work:


+ Mon-Fri 7:00 AM to 3:30 PM


What O-I Offers:


+ Competitive Compensation

+ Opportunity for future growth and advancement

+ DC Pension Plan (3% Base company contribution and optional employee/company match component)

+ Comprehensive benefits package

+ Paid time off

+ and much more…


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Mécanicien(ne) industriel (Nuit)
description:
Salaire selon expérience (débute à 29,46$jusqu’à32,77$ selon expérience)avec une prime de soir de0,85$pour les heures effectuées entre 18h00 et 8h00.

Horaire :Continentale (3-2-2), Nuit (18h30-6h30)

Description de l’emploi :

  • Résoudre les problèmes d’équipement de production;
  • Faire l’entretien préventif des équipements de production;
  • Participer à l’installation de nouveaux équipements;
  • Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes.

Profil recherché :

  • DEP ou DEC en électromécanique ou équivalent;
  • 5 à 6 ans d'expérience en entretien industriel;
  • Compétences pour les activités reliées à l’entretien (soudure, ajustage mécanique, pneumatique, etc.)
  • Sens du travail d’équipe;
  • Respect des règles Santé et sécurités
  • Autonomie;
  • Sens des responsabilités

Fière d’être membre de Grupo Bimbo depuis mai 2014, Bimbo Canada est un chef de file de la fabrication et de la distribution de collations et de produits de boulangerie délicieux et nutritifs, offrant des marques comme Villaggio ®, POM ®, Bon Matin ®, Vachon ®, Sara Lee ®, Sanissimo ® et Takis ®. Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un électromécanicien ou d’une électromécanienne pour se joindre à notre équipe de l’usine de Laval.

title: Industrial Millwright
description:
Come join us! The Molded Products Division of Windsor Mold Group is a full service supplier of interior and exterior injection molded plastic components and assemblies, providing innovative solutions for automotive plastics applications to original equipment manufacturers and their suppliers. We offer a great work environment offering industry-competitive pay and benefits.

We are currently seeking apprentice candidates for Industrial Millwright for the Automotive Components Division Emrick Plastics, Windsor to perform a wide variety of Maintenance functions that require a thorough knowledge of machine assembly, procedures, and practices.

DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Read blueprints, diagrams and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Install, align, dismantle and move stationary industrial machinery and mechanical equipment, such as pumps, fans, tanks, conveyors, furnaces and generators according to layout plans using hand and power tools
  • Operate hoisting and lifting devices such as cranes, jacks and lift trucks to position machinery and parts during the installation, set-up and repair of machinery
  • Inspect and examine machinery and equipment to detect and investigate irregularities and malfunctions
  • Install, troubleshoot and maintain power transmission, vacuum, hydraulic and pneumatic systems, and programmable logic controls
  • Adjust machinery and repair or replace defective parts
  • Operate machine tools such as lathes and grinders to fabricate parts required during overhaul, maintenance or set-up of machinery
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other routine maintenance work on machinery
  • Assemble machinery and equipment prior to installation using hand and power tools and welding equipment
  • Plastic injection machine experience preferred
  • Must be available to work rotating shifts

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High school diploma or equivalent (GED)
  • Completion of a in class portion and registered for journeyperson apprentice an asset

Windsor Mold is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation we will work with you to meet your needs. Please review our accessibility policies on our website at www.wmgtec.com

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Our client is a leading diversified forest products company, listed on the TSX, NYSE, and rated as one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for eight years. Are you interested in working for a company that offers both a challenging work environment and a rewarding career path? Quesnel Plywood division in BC has an opportunity for a fully certified:

This position offers a challenging, diverse and exciting opportunity to become part of the team. Job duties will fall within our Mobile Shop department. This position requires an individual who will perform a variety of tasks related to the safe and efficient application of the technical skills and knowledge of a Heavy Duty Mechanic.

Duties involve the repair and maintenance of industrial equipment such as:
  • Log loaders, Wheel Loaders, Forklifts and other mobile equipment used in the manufacture of lumber.
  • Continually ensuring the quality and standards of service to safety and production are maintained.

Our ideal candidate must possess:
  • A valid Inter-Provincial or Provincial Journeyperson mechanic certification
  • Ability to read manuals and schematics
  • Knowledge of Hydraulics
  • Commitment to working safely and creating a safe work place
  • Ability to work independently with little supervision
  • Organizational and planning skills
  • Flexible schedule to work day, evening and weekend shifts
  • Considered a strong asset:
  • Experience working in a fleet shop
  • Cummins and Cat engine experience
  • Strong Electrical back ground
  • Welding
Client has over 60 locations across Canada, the United States and Europe. they believe strongly in promoting from within and pride ourselves on providing a challenging environment with continuous development. The successful candidate should be interested in future growth opportunities within the company.

Client offers an excellent compensation package including a competitive salary, excellent benefits and an outstanding pension plan.

Industrial Mechanic
Standard Manufacturers Services Limited

title: Licensed Industrial Millwright - Midnight Shift
description:
Job Number: 10235 
Group: Magna Seating  
Division: Cam-Slide Mfg. Newmarket 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: NEWMARKET 

 


Group Description
 


Magna is an innovative leader in the development and manufacturing of high quality complete seating systems. Our solution includes seating structures, mechanisms and hardware, as well as foam and trim products for global automotive, heavy truck and bus industries. Our capabilities include market and consumer research; full concept development; design and engineering capabilities; testing, validation and world-class manufacturing. Our award-winning seating solutions are developed from consumer research, finding the ease of operation to be comfortable, convenient and connected.

Available Shifts & Compensation

This position is for Midnight Shift. 

Starting Rate for this position is $37.12  per hour with an additional Midnight Shift Premium of $2.00 per hour. 

Role Summary

Performs direct maintenance work for repair, adaptation, re-design, preventative maintenance and installation of all plant equipment, machinery and infrastructure in accordance with the objectives of the Maintenance Department. The maintenance mechanic is involved in troubleshooting to assess repair requirements.

Key Responsibilities

  • Comply with all policies and procedures of Cam-Slide as well as company objectives related to quality, health and safety, environmental and other legislative requirements
  • Interact with maintenance employees to exchange technical information to facilitate teamwork in troubleshooting and repair process
  • Repair and maintain all equipment and machines within the building to ensure the efficient, safe operation of all machinery with the shortest downtime
  • Plans long-term repairs to be completed during planned downtime
  • Follows company escalation process on equipment downtime - ensuring everyone is aware of the problem, the repair and the root cause
  • All parameter changes to be documented as per company policy
  • Ensures fluid levels are maintained at appropriate levels in respective equipment and machinery
  • Complete work orders as required
  • Check contents of work orders with supervisor prior to repair or modification work and ensure that information is accurate
  • Timely completion of repairs indicated on work orders
  • Completes all PM tasks on equipment by due dates and makes the necessary suggestions to improve PM effectivenss
  • Properly signs out parts from stock and orders appropriate replacements parts and fluids
  • Responsible to protect own health and safety by working in compliance with established safe working practices and follows company procedures
  • Inspects all machinery for defects and potential problems in accordance with preventative maintenance programs, repairing and replacing parts as required in the specified time frame
  • Modifies machinery and equipment as directed
  • Install equipment (i.e. fans, conveyors, chutes, and guards)
  • Repair of hydraulics and pneumatics
  • Responsible for all the coolants, oils, and chemicals being disposed of in a proper manner as per WHMIS and internal recycling programs
  • Maintains a safe and clean work area at all time
  • Adhere to all IATF policies and procedures
  • Must comply with all ISO 14001 (Environmental) and OHSAS 18001 (Health and Safety) Systems and standards as it pertains to their work
  • Abide by all AODA and C-TPAT procedures that apply to their position

Performance Measurement

  • Maintenance work performed on time
  • Preventative vs Breakdown maintenance
  • Process upgrades and improvements
  • Success of improvements
  • Quality of Work
  • Attendance

Key Qualifications/Requirements

  • Industrial Millwright License 433A
  • 2-5 years' experience with manufacturing equipment and maintenance in a manufacturing equipment
  • Experience with pneumatic and hydraulic systems
  • Experience with Motoman and ABB robots
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Previous experience in the following: metal work, welding fabrication and machining
  • Experience with highly automated equipment
  • Effective communication skills (oral and written)
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a team environment

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
Job ID:  371041 

Work Type:  Full Time Permanent 

 

It is a great time to join the CRH Canada team! CRH Canada is going through an exciting business transformation which demands first-class Talent Management support to drive results.


We are building a world- class team. Make your mark!


You will be a successful addition to our team if you look at change as an opportunity to develop and contribute to the business. You will be successful in your role if you like partnering with the business, presenting new ideas and providing excellent customer service.

Mechanic

Are you looking to become part of a dedicated team and contribute to the day-to-day operation of a large shop that services and repairs equipment, and the maintenance of all mobile and contractor equipment? Do you want to stay active in a fast-paced environment? Are you looking for a career path that includes professional growth and career advancement? 


Responsibilities:

Under the general direction of the Shop Superintendent and shop foreman, you will perform shop and field work to support our growing fleet and perform the following duties:

Responsible for providing maintenance and repairs to the Dufferin Construction fleet of heavy-duty trucks and equipment. This includes ordering required parts, removal, rework and installation of various engine and chassis components, as well as performing maintenance schedules.

  • Adhere to all Operations policies and procedures
  • Reading electrical and hydraulic schematic is an asset 
  • Basic knowledge of the construction industry is an asset
  • Other duties as assigned

 Experience & Educational Criteria:

  • 310S or 310T mechanic license
  • Basic knowledge of truck and heavy equipment operation
  • Working knowledge of related maintenance and repair practices
  • Working knowledge of diesel engines, hydraulic pumps, motors, and air brake systems
  • Fabrication and welding skills
  • Knowledge with on and off-road computer systems
  • Dealer trained i.e. Cat, Deere, Hitachi, Volvo, etc.
  • Full G License required

Working Conditions:

  • Standard 50 hours per week, will be required to work overtime, nights weekends, based on operational requirements   
  • Open to working at other locations, as needed
  • The employee will travel to/ from/ within jobsites 
  • Daily exposure to construction environment i.e., heavy equipment, oncoming traffic, inclement weather (heat, cold, rain etc.) 

 

What Makes a Successful Candidate?

  •  Must be self-motivated and work independently
  •  Must have ability to follow directions and effectively perform the work
  • Must be able to maintain a clean safe work environment in and out of shop 
  • Maintain a consistent, high level of productivity 
  • Takes immediate and independent action to resolve issues or problems when they arise.
  • Safety oriented
  • Communicates effectively
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and be reliable well under pressure
  • Ability to deal with multiple tasks and prioritize work effectively
  • Team oriented
  • Flexibility to perform other duties as assigned

Why work for us?

  • We recognize safety as our top priority and support that through our COR certification and Annual Safety recognition awards
  •  With parent companies in Concord, the US and Ireland, your growth potential is limitless!

About Us

  • Under the long established and respected name of Dufferin Construction, CRH Canada operates a multi-million construction business which provides construction services throughout Southern Ontario and on key projects across Canada.
  • Founded in 1912, Dufferin Construction has built a solid reputation for market excellence, drawing on a rich history and a strong heritage of quality, stability and innovative leadership in the marketplace.  Dufferin Construction is one of the largest heavy civil engineering contractors in the industry, employing over 1000 people.

Dufferin Construction offers a wide range of construction services that cater to the Heavy Civil, Commercial/Industrial, Municipal and Land Development market segments.

  • Concrete Construction Services: Concrete paving, roller compacted concrete paving, construction of retaining walls, sidewalks and curbs, barrier walls, cement stabilized base placement and Dufferin-Slipstone extruded wall system
  • Asphalt Construction Services: Asphalt paving, operate ten Asphalt hot mix plants and one portable asphalt plant 
  • Excavation and Underground Construction Services: Sewer and watermain, earth excavation, earth borrow and grading and granular placement
  • Structural Construction Services: Bridge structures, retaining walls, structure rehabilitation and cast in place utility structures
  • Environmental Construction Services: Landfill reclamation and rehabilitation, and the manufacturing of recycled granular materials
  • Design Build Construction Services: Participated in some of the largest and most complex projects in the country including Sir Adam Beck Tunnel in Niagara Falls, Highway 407 and the Infield Development project at the Toronto Pearson International Airport
  • Other Construction Services: Airport snow removal

 

Dufferin Construction builds careers. Our door is always open to hire highly skilled and motivated individuals who want to develop to their full potential while playing a key role in our future plans.  Solid growth opportunities are available that provide progression from entry level to senior management positions.  Our growth and development strategy involves defined practical experience in project management, augmented with annual training programs to accelerate career progression.

 

Visit our website for more information: http://www.crhcanada.com

CRH Canada Group Inc. recognizes Canada’s diverse landscape. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanics - Signing Bonus $5k
description:
We're currently looking for Highly Skilled Heavy Duty Mechanics to start immediately!

Position Duties:

  • Inspect, repair, and adjust Caterpillar, Volvo, Komatsu and other heavy off-road equipment
  • Perform incidental welding operations on equipment
  • Adhere to workplace safety policies, regulations and compliances
  • Communicate any unsafe conditions or accidents/injuries in a timely manner to the supervisor to facilitate prompt correction or reporting
  • Demonstrate continuous effort to improve operations, decrease turnaround times, streamline work processes, and work cooperatively and jointly to provide quality seamless customer service
  • Diagnose defects in heavy duty equipment
  • Perform mechanical repairs on equipment in the shop and road calls when required
  • Electrical and hydraulic troubleshooting and diagnostics
  • Accurate completion of work orders and timecards
  • Repair cooling, and lubrication systems
  • Install and align engines and machinery
  • Repair mechanical transmissions, drivetrains, and final drives
  • Repair cable-operated working attachments, winches, compressors, pumps, electric generators, etc.
  • Test repaired equipment for proper performance
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other maintenance work
  • Keep detailed and accurate maintenance reports and documentation
  • Maintain a working knowledge of changes in technology and repair techniques
  • Other mechanical repair work as required
Wage: $44.19/hr + $5000 Signing Bonus

Position Requirements:

  • Red Seal Journeyman Mechanic Off Road
  • Willing to work overtime
  • Appropriate credentials and certifications
  • 3 years’ experience as a Heavy Equipment Mechanic
  • Possess a valid driver license
  • Proven mechanical abilities in hydraulics and electrical, including schematics and diagnostics
  • Ability to work independently in a busy environment
  • Experience with routine maintenance operations
  • Highly flexible, with solid interpersonal skills that allow one to work effectively in a diverse working environment
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing.
  • Able to work well under pressure
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Able to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally always
  • Computer literate

What's in it for you?

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Vision care

If you are looking for opportunities or would like to discuss this opportunity, apply now to be considered!

title: Columbia Icefield, Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?:

Maintaining our fleet of 21 unique Ice Explorers, 16 Highway Coaches and other heavy duty equipment.

What perks can you expect?:

For the 2022 summer season at the Columbia Icefield, team members will enjoy;

  • Almost free housing and meals, as itâ€™s a taxable benefit
  • $500 referral bonus for each peer referred
  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe  
  • Work experience in an  iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location  
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuitâ€™s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an  inclusive culture  and  make life-long friends  
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth  or future work at  other Pursuit  locations  
  • Access to one of the worldâ€™s most beautiful and iconic National Parks
What will you do in this job?:

As a Heavy duty Mechanic at the Columbia Icefield, you will contribute in making the Columbia Icefield Adventure as safe as possible for our international guests.   As a Heavy Duty Mechanic, our #1 Core value of Safety 1st starts with you in ensuring the mechanical fitness of our motorcoaches, heavy equipment and 21 unique Ice Explorers.

 

This is a multi-faceted position and can include any, or all, of the following:

  • Safety 1st! Ensure to follow adequate and proper safety procedures when performing any duties.
  • Perform preventative maintenance.
  • Diagnose equipment problems and determine repairs as needed.
  • Adjust equipment and repair or replace defective parts.
  • Test repaired equipment for proper performance.
  • Service attachments and working tools.
  • Maintain a clean and tidy work area and assist with cleaning duties in working environment.
  • Maintain daily record of all works orders, part orders and other administrative tasks.
  • Demonstrate continuous efforts to improve operations, decrease downtime and improve processes.
  • Assist in training apprentice mechanics in the trade.
  • Support colleagues and co-workers in their duties.
  • Act as a coach and subject matter expert when it comes to everything vehicles.
What skills and experience do you need for this job?:
  • Valid Alberta (or inter-provincial) Heavy Duty Mechanic Journeyman certification
  • CVIP license for Alberta
  • Experience troubleshooting and diagnostics on Detroit Diesel, CAT, MTU and Allison engines/transmissions
  • Familiar with MCI & Prevost highway coaches
  • Class 1, 2 or 3 driverâ€™s license with airbrake (Q) endorsement an asset
  • Ability to supply own tools up to ¾â€ and impact drives
  • Ability to think outside the box with a positive attitude, and problem-solving skills
  • Mature, energetic, dependable and self-motivated
  • Enjoy working with a team in a busy, fast-paced environment
  • Must enjoy working outdoors, even in challenging mountain weather conditions
  • Comfortable working on your feet for extended periods in an outdoor environment. Be prepared for all types of weather (Snow, Rain, Wind, Hail) at all times. The weather changes quickly at the Columbia Icefield
  • Must adhere to the Companyâ€™s Drug and Alcohol policy
  • Must meet the Organization grooming and appearance standards
  • To honour our commitment to be â€œAlways Honestâ€ all employees must consent to a criminal record check
  • Standard First-Aid or higher an asset
What will your work environment be like?:

Typically 8 days on/6 days off rotation. Expect 80-85 hours per rotation, depending on the time of year and business levels.

  • Beautiful.  Youâ€™ll work in iconic, unforgettable and inspiring locations. Youâ€™ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. Youâ€™ll participate in team events â€“ and fun!  
  • Independent.  Youâ€™ll spend your days in and around  national parks.  
  • Remote.  Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog.  Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of  through  WiFi  
  • Busy.  You  need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required  

This job description describes this role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up.  We work as a team and believe that we succeed together â€“ these job duties may change based on the needs of the  team and company as a whole.  

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in  Alberta, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in  Canada  is required.  

 


#HKAB

EEO Information:Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic
description:
At EVRAZ, our strength starts with our people! As a team we collaborate to solve problems, contribute ideas and challenge each other to ensure growth and ultimately success for the business and our employees.

JOB DESCRIPTION AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Performs as required repairs of all heavy equipment, including but not limited to: Front-end Loaders, Material Handler, Shredder Mill, Skid Steer and Excavator. Working in conjunction with the management team, develops a strategy for working safely, efficiently and effectively. When no mechanic work is required/available the employee will operate heavy equipment to assist with the evening shift production requirements.

EVRAZ is committed to maintaining and promoting a safe, healthy and injury-free environment.  It is required for all jobs.

  • Maintain and repair all mobile equipment

  • Keep  work area clean, tidy and free from unsafe conditions at all times

  • Assist the management team with planning projects, providing input and recommendations to safely initiate, the most efficient and effective approach

  • Ensure all equipment is in good operating conditions by regularly monitoring and inspecting equipment

  • Understand monthly commitments to the mill

  • Mentor fellow employees by sharing skill sets/knowledge and allow for input

  • Operate equipment in a safe and productive manner

  • Promote safety with co-works by pushing the stop button when a potential unsafe act is determined

  • Performs other duties as they might be assigned

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • Completion of High School and/or equivalent

  • Minimum 3 years’ experience working on mobile heavy equipment

  • Mechanically inclined

  • Welding experience considered an Asset

  • Excellent verbal communication skills

  • Ability to push, pull and/or lift up to 50 lbs

  • Must be fluent in verbal and written English

  • Ability to follow directives

  • Valid Driver’s License with acceptable driving record required

  • Communication Skills: Communicates clearly and listens carefully in an open candid and consistent manner

  • Team Player: Establishes trust with team members, stating clear expectations and recognizes group morale and acts to protect and/or build as required

  • Self-motivated:  Initiates and takes action before being required to do so

  • Must be able to work Monday to Friday nights (this position is night shift only)

Our total compensation package includes amazing benefits!

  • Competitive wages and bonus opportunities
  • Family medical, dental, and prescription coverage at minimal employee cost
  • Short and long term disability programs
  • Competitive retirement plans
  • Paid vacations and statutory holidays
  • Apprenticeship and career advancement within the company
  • Tuition reimbursement

All applicants must be eligible to work in Canada without sponsorship.

While we thank all those who apply, only those being actively considered for employment will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

EVRAZ North America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

 

EVRAZ North America is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.

If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking employment, please e-mail

careers@evrazna.com

or call: (312) 533-3577. We will make a determination on your request for reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis.

Join a team that manufactures excellence, drives success and builds careers!

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic (FT)
description:
Please Note:  Any applicant must provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19, a condition of employment, subject to any accommodation required according to applicable human rights legislation.
All safety-sensitive positions will require pre-employment screening which includes drug and alcohol screening.

  • Position Title:  Heavy Duty Mechanic
  • Work Location:  Nisku
  • Title of manager this position reports to:  Fleet Maintenance Manager
  • Work Rotation (if applicable):  8 days on, 6 days off
  • Work Days / Hours:  7:00 am – 5:30 pm – ½ hour unpaid lunch.
  • Purpose of Role:  Maintaining Tiger’s vehicle fleet.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Perform maintenance and repair of heavy trucks and trailers.
  • Perform preventative and predictive maintenance.
  • Diagnose the cause of any malfunction and perform repairs to the manufacturer's specifications.
  • Assist apprentices as needed with maintenance repairs to grow knowledge.
  • Maintain a clean and tidy personal work area and assist with general cleaning duties in a workshop environment.
  • Maintain a  record of all work tasks on work orders in the TMT system.
  • Support and encourage continuous improvement in work practices.
  • Adhere to Tiger’s HSE policies and procedures.
  • Some out of hours work may be required for a call-out basis.
  • Perform related work as required.
  • Completing daily job hazard assessments. 
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS, WORK EXPERIENCE, SKILLS:
  • Journeyman Heavy Duty Mechanic.  
  • Minimum of 3 years experience.
  • Valid driver's license, Class 1 preferred.
  • Current CVIP certificate would be considered an asset.
  • Experience with Cummins engines, hydraulic systems, and Super B would be considered an asset.
  • Experience and considerable knowledge of the methods, materials and equipment used in the maintenance and repair of various types of heavy equipment and other power-driven equipment and tools.
  • Working knowledge of the occupational hazards and safety precautions of the trade.
  • Skilled in the operation of a variety of tools and equipment used in the repair of trucks and heavy equipment
  • Capable of preparing and maintaining accurate records and reports.
  • Familiarity with the TMT software program would be considered an asset.
  • Ability to analyze and repair mechanical failures. 
  • Has a collaborative communication style at all levels of the organization demonstrating an open, honest and consistent approach to working with others. Must be able to successfully pass pre-employment screening requirements including drug and alcohol and health assessment. 
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS/WORK CONDITIONS:
  • Lifting, pulling, climbing, standing, sitting, lying down, squatting and kneeling and managing equipment and tools. 
  • Must work outside in all different weather conditions, including cold and extreme heat.  Work is performed in a repair shop environment.  


About Tiger Calcium Services Inc.:

MissionTiger Calcium isn’t solely a manufacturer and distributor but is the preferred solution provider and reliable advisor to the sectors we serve. We are singularly focused on the needs of our customers, and we develop solutions to the consistent, high quality of standards they demand. Quality and the unassailable expertise of our employees underpin our commercial success.VisionTiger Calcium will lead our industry through the delivery of innovative and sustainable products and services, fulfilled within a working environment that fosters safety, integrity, and job fulfillment for all team members.ValuesTiger Calcium’s core values, reliability, quality, and expertise, guide every decision and partnership we undertake.- Reliability: We each feel responsible for the collective success of Tiger and our customers and take accountability for our actions and outputs. We are dependable and can be trusted to ensure the safety and success of our products. We take pride in our work, ensuring the service and products we deliver are exceptional and completely reliable.- Quality: We only offer products and services of exceptional and unsurpassed caliber.- Expertise: We demonstrate expertise and superior industry knowledge in all we undertake, holding ourselves accountable, both to our customers and to one another, to the highest standard.

title: Maintenance Mechanic
description:
ABOUT THIS CAREER OPPORTUNITY

Black & McDonald Limited is seeking a Maintenance Mechanic at our location in Ottawa, Ontario. The Maintenance Mechanic will maintain, troubleshoot, and repair various mechanical devices and systems to achieve optimum life span of equipment.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Performs physical inspections of building service rooms and areas both interior and exterior
  • Verifies daily environmental controls and ensures readings are within accepted standards
  • Performs periodic and seasonal preventive maintenance tasks and minor repairs
  • Performs mechanical maintenance such as filter and belt changing, greasing, etc.
  • Complete planned maintenance activities as assigned, providing notes and comments on completed work, identifying repair opportunities, taking pictures as required and ensuring minimal rework
  • Report all system, equipment and/or condition anomalies
  • Respond to emergencies and/or complaints from service desks and notify the Facility Manager immediately in the case of an emergency
  • Become involved in inventory monitoring and assist in material purchasing
  • Key contributor to identify equipment or system repairs both preventive and reactive
  • Assist in project related component or system replacements and repair
  • Verifies the quality of the work carried out by the various sub-contractors
  • Reads meters as required, analyze results for anomalies and provide a weekly summary report to the Facility Supervisor or Contract Manager
  • Conduct system investigations with Facility Manager as required
  • Respond to after-hours emergency calls
  • Perform light duties such as sweeping, cleaning, painting, garbage removal, snow removal, assisting zone technicians, mechanics, etc.

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Customer Focus
  • Teamwork and Collaboration
  • Values and Respects Others

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • 2 or more years' experience as a Maintenance Mechanic or Handyman
  • Experience working with Building Automation Systems
  • Experience working with mobile work order systems

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Must hold a G2 license
  • Must be able to attain and maintain a Secret security clearance
  • Good analytical skills and attention to detail with ability to read and interpret blueprints, plans, and manuals.
  • Working knowledge of building HVAC systems including air conditioning, refrigeration and electrical and mechanical equipment controls and systems
  • Excellent customer service skills with desire to exceed customer expectations
  • Excellent verbal and written communications.
  • A team player, committed to working in a quality environment
  • Ability to work in confined spaces, on a ladder or scaffold at various heights
  • Bending and Lifting required; lifting up to 50lbs.
