title: Millwright Apprentice
description:
Be trained, be mentored, and be given the hands-on experience to complete your licensing in our complex, automated Continuous Improvement environment. If you are a Millwright Apprentice, joining us now is a chance to rapidly gain exposure working across different types of production and electrical equipment, and optimizing programming on automated lines.

Who we are

Mother Parkers Tea & Coffee is a leading customer solutions provider, manufacturing and supplying quality coffee and tea to some of North America's largest retailers and foodservice chains. Our fast-growing EcoCupÂ® brand of single-serve pods makes it easy for consumers to recycle through 3 easy steps of separation. Combining state-of-the-art technology and new product innovation with more than 100 years of business success, Mother Parkers continues to grow. We take pride in delivering a better beverage experience for customers and consumers, and a better employment experience for our people! We operate multiple manufacturing facilities in both Canada and the U.S.

We are committed to doing what's right for the planet, people, and the communities in which we operate. From farm to cup, we're engaged locally and at the industry level in ensuring a sustainable future for our customers and consumers.

At Mother Parkers, we will give you every opportunity to voice your ideas, own what you do, and share your passion for people, our products and our customers. We live by our mission to provide a better beverage experience for our customers; and as a fourth-generation family-run company, we know that it starts with great teams and innovative thinkers. We empower our people to turn their ideas into solutions, execute with integrity, deliver with quality, and take pride in their work. In turn, we foster a culture built on our values that supports everyone to be their best. 

Who we need

Our Ajax plant is looking for experienced Millwright Apprentices to work with us and gain the direct exposure and hands-on skills needed to complete your licensing requirements.

You will be fully trained with ongoing mentorships, and positioned as a critical part of our team dedicated to the cost-effective, continuous operations of our 24/7 beverage processing and packaging environment. You will be responsible for priority repairs including fabricating welding, installation projects, and ongoing maintenance of equipment and electrical component repairs. 

Shift Type: Full-time, rotating every two weeks on mornings (7 am - 3:30 pm), afternoons (3 pm - 11:30 pm) and nights (11 pm - 7:30 am)

Pay Rate: up to $39.17/hour shift premiums (afternoons - $0.55/hour, nights - $0.75/hour)

What's in it for you

Professional Development. In addition to initial onboarding and training, you will participate in development opportunities such as programming PLC equipment to continuous improvement to soft skills such as people leadership. You will have the chance to pursue technical education such as robotics. As we continue to grow and add more automation and technology to the floor, you will have an environment to apply your increased skills. Every day or night here offers new and different problems to dig into, analyze and resolve. Working across different types of production and electrical equipment, and optimizing programming on automated lines comes together to form a rewarding work environment. 

A company that cares. This is a chance to be part of a Canadian-owned company that prioritizes the health and safety of their teams, from the highest level of plant operations, preventative maintenance, and quality standards.  

What you will do:

  • Learn. You will be part of a mature, experienced team willing to share knowledge and offer training on our highly specialized equipment. You will gain exposure to our bigger compounding equipment requiring mechanical or fabricating repairs and maintenance such as lubrication, changing belts, and checking gear boxes.
  • Solve problems. You will troubleshoot, repair, test, and maintain packaging, processing, and material handling equipment for optimized performance in a high-speed PLC controlled equipment. You will repair, upgrade and install electronic controls and equipment.  
  • Contribute to continuous improvement. You will play a critical role in our efforts to maintain a safe environment as you carry out the requirements of our Preventative Maintenance programs. 
  • Participate in projects. You will learn how to install, program, modify, and troubleshoot new PLC automation lines. You will train other mechanics as needed.

What you bring to the role:

  • The goal. You have a minimum grade 12 or equivalent and you are an Apprentice.
  • The skills. You are detail-oriented and driven to analyze and solve problems. You are comfortable using and learning new computer systems. You have an understanding of electrical systems and programs and experience troubleshooting electrical, pneumatic and hydraulic systems. Ideally, you have experience with welding and machining. You have demonstrated a history of safe work habits, and you are able to bend frequently and lift heavy equipment as required.
  • The interpersonal skills. You can take verbal and written direction and communicate effectively. You can work independently with minimal supervision and prioritize your work.
  • The flexibility. You understand the demands of a night shift and can commit to the required schedule. In addition, you are available to work rotating shifts.

What we offer you:

  • We want you to feel appreciated. We provide a competitive Total Rewards package, including health benefits from Day 1, employer matched retirement savings plans, and optional Health or Wellness Spending Account. 
  • We value continuous learning, skills development, and career growth and we offer a Tuition Assistance Program for learning outside our environment.
  • We want you to take your work home. While you don't have to drink coffee to work here, we have an employee discount on our tea and coffee products.

If you want to join our mission of creating a better beverage experience as an integral and valued member of our team, and you have 70% or more of the qualifications we are looking for, we invite you to express your interest here. While we can't guarantee an interview, we do promise to review your resume and see if this might be a good fit for both of us. 

Mother Parkers is committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process

title: Level II Technician
description:
Company Bio:

Applus+ is a global leader in the Testing, Inspection and Certification sector delivering non-destructive testing, inspection, engineering, and manpower services to the aerospace, power, and, oil and gas industries. We are a trusted partner who enhances the quality and safety of our clientsâ€™ assets and infrastructures while safeguarding their operations. We deliver this through our technical capabilities, innovative approach, and our motivated team who are committed to operational excellence.

 

Applus+ has achieved a significant global presence and a leading position in its target markets and regions. As a result, our teams have expanded with 19,000 professionals across the world, attracting the very best talent in the industry.

 

Together beyond standards.

Position Purpose:

The overall duty of this position is to oversee the completion of advanced NDT inspections in compliance with legislated industry codes, standards and procedures. The Level II Technician maintains a high level of expertise within the scope and methods of advanced NDT and applies continuous on-the-job training and mentorship to develop the Level I and Trainee Technicians.

 

Due to the nature of this position there will be on-call and overtime requirements as well as some travel.

Duties and Responsibilities:

 

  • Prepares and completes all necessary paperwork required in compliance with client, industry and company standards and policies.
  • Ensures all equipment is setup, calibrated and functional at all times in alignment with client and company procedures.
  • Applies testing criteria in accordance with applicable specifications for advanced NDT methods.
  • Provides direction, guidance and mentorship for the continuous development of the Level I and Trainee Technicians in compliance with industry codes, standards and procedures.
  • Responsible for the setup of boundaries and surveillance of work area to prevent unauthorized personnel from entering work area, as required.
  • Provides applicable orientation and training to Level I and Trainee Technicians.
  • Actively promotes and proactively models the companyâ€™s focus on safety when interacting with all current and future employees and clients.
  • Strong commitment to quality inspection and reporting.
  • Represents Applus with outside groups, regulatory bodies, associations, and clients.
  • Adhering to organizational policies and procedures, including but not limited to Applus Code of Ethics and Confidentiality Agreements.
  • Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary.
Knowledge and Skills:
  • Firmly adheres to the values and ethics of Applus. Exhibits honesty, discretion, confidentiality, and sound judgment.
  • Strong technical knowledge and understanding of advanced NDT techniques, services and procedures.
  • Fundamental understanding of industry codes, regulations and practices.
  • Ability to setup, calibrate, test, interpret and evaluate findings on required NDT equipment for advanced methods in compliance with codes, standards and procedures.
  • Thorough knowledge of radiation safety and operational field requirements regarding radiation safety.
  • Ability to read technical documents and procedures and apply them in the field.
  • Excellent report writing and review skills.
  • Excellent customer service focus, ability to quickly build strong working relationships with business partners and colleagues.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills matched with the ability to negotiate and build relationships with key stakeholders.
  • Ability to adapt in a high pressure and high production environment while managing competing priorities with minimal supervision.
  • Strong organizational skills with demonstrated ability to prioritize, solve problems, and consistently meet deadlines.
  • Focused on continuous improvement and committed to learning new practices and developing better ways of doing things.
  • A sense of urgency, good attention to detail, excellent organizational and analytical skills, pragmatic, eager to learn.
  • Ability to excel in a team environment.
  • Strong computer skills in MS Office and other software applications.
Education and Work Experience:
  • High School Diploma or Canadian General Equivalency Diploma, (GED).
  • Canadian General Standards Board (CGSB) Level II certification/s.
  • 3-5 yearsâ€™ experience in NDT inspection with a strong focus on advanced NDT methods.
  • Valid Class 5 driverâ€™s license.
Working Conditions:
  • Required to work both inside and outside in heat/cold, wet/humid and dry/arid conditions in temperature extremes and inclement weather.
  • Frequently required to use personal protective equipment to prevent exposure to hazardous materials in various working environments.
  • Commonly exposed to walking on slippery or uneven surfaces.
  • Occasionally required to work in noisy/loud working environments especially on project
  • Required to work overtime during the week and weekend depending on project scope and work volume.
  • Occasional to frequent travel will be required within Canada.
  • Working conditions will vary between project locations.
  • Overtime required during the week and weekend with work volume
  • Ability to be flexible with work schedules and respond to requests without advance warning or notification

title: Handy Person - The Palace
description:
TITLE:  Handyperson

REPORTS TO:  Environmental Supervisor / Executive Director

POSITION SUMMARY:

Required, under supervision, to perform various skilled and semi-skilled tasks in construction, maintenance, and operation work as assigned also consist of janitorial duties of ground floor.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  1. Promote and respect Residentsâ€™ Bill of Rights through all interactions with residents, family members, staff and all customers of the Home.
  2. Functions as a resident advocate.
  3. May help with residents move in and outs ( personal belongings and furniture.
  4. Daily Responsibility  of all janitorial duties of ground floor cleaning and disinfecting bathrooms, common areaâ€™s cleaning floors, kitchen & dining area as per task list.
  5. Aware of and respond to the needs of the residents and family members at all times.
  6. Perform general mechanical maintenance, minor building repairs and keeps clean and tidy.
  7. Perform typical work such as replacing fuses and light bulbs, repairing / replacing call bells, clearing drains, repairing beds, chairs, tables, minor plumbing repairs  etc redecorating tasks, replacing tiles and removing garbage.
  8. Direct and assist in weeding, snow removal, shoveling, and general ground maintenance.
  9. Painting , Gyproc repairs of common areaâ€™s and residents rooms / suites ( RH Sector)
  10. Sanitize home during pandemic with Clorox machine on a weekly basis all residents rooms and commons areaâ€™s. ( must be done on evening for common areaâ€™s)
  11. Input work requests into computerized maintenance system (Maintenance Care App).
  12. Observe and monitor all areas of the facility for ongoing maintenance requirements and carry out repairs, as needed.
  13. Provide general assistance to skilled trades persons, as required.
  14. Participate in fire prevention and fire drill procedures. 
  15. Maintain required records, reports, in accordance with policies and procedures and legislative requirements.
  16. Ensure privacy of residents during performance of duties.
  17. Maintain work area in a clean, orderly and safe manner and ensure proper care in use of tools, equipment and supplies.
  18. Adhere to established departmental policies and procedures regarding quality improvement, Occupational Health and Safety, WHMIS, environmental and infection control practices.
  19. Commitment to ongoing education to meet residentsâ€™ needs and legislative requirements
  20. Perform related work as assigned.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

Repeated reaching, squatting, kneeling and climbing ladders and scaffolding.  Regular lifting of heavy objects, including equipment.  May be exposed to hazards from use of tools and power equipment.  Exposure to heat, biochemical agents and weather conditions.  Some stress resulting from frequent interruption of routines.  Exposure to resident elements through regular resident contact.  Stress in dealing with resident, family, staff and customer needs. Could be called in  for urgent matters.

Day shifts, working every second week-end will be required. Some Evening shifts to be determined by your Environmental Supervisor to accomplish certain tasks.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

  • High School graduate. 
  • Ability to speak, read and write in English. 
  • Ability to follow oral and written instructions.
  •  Ability to maintain neat and accurate storage records. 
  • Some computer skills. 
  • Some experience in working around machinery and ability to use hand tools. 
  • Some practical experience in mechanical building equipment operation. 
  • Some practical knowledge of valves, pipes and equipment and building maintenance. 
  • Efficiency in performance of duties.
  • Detail oriented and accurate in all work performed. 
  • Compliance with established policies and procedures of the Home. 
  • Proficiency in care and use of equipment, supplies and maintaining a neat work area. 
  • Able to work both independently and as a member of a multidisciplinary team. 
  • Ability to prioritize work and keep organized in a busy environment. 
  • Ability to relate to residents, family members, staff and community in a professional manner.

 

Interested applicants should apply directly through this posting. We would like to thank all applicants for your interest in working as part of our team! Only those applicants selected to move forward in the recruitment process will be contacted.  

Southbridge Care Homes welcomes those applicants with disability related needs and those whom a need for accommodation in the recruitment process. Please provide notice of your need for accommodation to the hiring manager upon scheduling of an interview.

In Ontario, Extendicare, ParaMed Home Health Care, and affiliated organizations including our partner homes in Extendicare Assist accommodate the needs of job applicants throughout its recruitment and selection processes in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodation needs must be provided in advance. To discuss your needs, please contact the individual noted in the posting

title: Apartment Maintenance Technician - Temporary
description:
Madison Park

We recognize the Apartment Maintenance Technician is the core of the resident experience. Not only are they troubleshooting and solving various maintenance issues, they are going into the homes of our residents. This is a huge responsibility and we value the level of customer care it takes to do this well.

The Apartment Maintenance Technician is responsible for assisting in the upkeep and maintenance of the Weidner community. The Apartment Maintenance Technician is very motivated to find solutions to complex issues and has an eye for detail. Most of all, Apartment Maintenance Technicians enjoy the work they do and continuously help create the resident experience.

Responsibilities:
  • Assist in the preparation of apartments for occupancy
  • Respond to service requests
  • Performs maintenance and repairs on electrical, plumbing, as well as small and large appliances
  • Maintain pools and wading area and HVAC systems depending on the community amenities
  • Modest carpentry work as needed
  • Interior and exterior painting as needed
  • Provide customer service
Qualifications:
  • Experience in apartment maintenance or related field preferred
  • Strong verbal communication skills
  • All service personnel are also required to have a personal set of general tools
  • Ability to lift and carry up to 80 pounds
  • Push/pull up to 200 pounds
  • Have a valid driver license and reliable transportation

title: Facilities Maintenance Specialist
description:
Description


PeaceHealth is seeking a Facilities Maintenance Specialist for a Per Diem/Relief, Variable position. Hourly compensation starts at $25.78, more depending on experience.


Must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 including 2 doses of a 2-dose series or 1 dose of a 1-dose series plus 14 days beyond the final dose prior to start date.


JOB SUMMARY


Responsible for performing repairs and maintenance to plant facilities which may include utilizing some or all of the following skills areas: carpentry, locksmith, painting and plastering, plumbing, minor mechanical/electrical repairs, lighting, and furniture/fixture installation.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS


1. Performs repairs and maintenance. This includes: locksmith functions—maintaining building master key system and duplicate keys for various types of furniture and fixtures; maintaining, troubleshooting, repairing Access Card Systems; installing and maintaining equipment and managing database installing and repairing door hardware; installing and moving signage as needed; inspection/assessment, maintenance for roofs and drains; flooring and ceramic tile repairs and maintenance; installation of various types of fixtures (i.e. soap dispensers, bulletin boards, etc.); installation and moving of modular furniture, keyboard installations and changes for ergonomic issues; and painting and patch work.

2. Coordinates contractor installs and repairs for all areas of responsibility.

3. Performs cost estimates as needed in support of capital projects as well as for other materials and remodel projects.

4. Works collaboratively with Employee Health and Safety (EH&S) to address safety issues. This includes: fall risk analysis and mitigate planning and implementation; incident investigation and risk mitigation; infection control leak team response.

5. Assures compliance with all regulatory standards.

6. Participates in maintenance and construction contractor/vendor selection and oversight.

7. Participates in process improvement project planning support and execution in sensitive environments.

8. Performs creative needs assessments and problem solving.

9. Performs/participates in preventive maintenance inspection, correction and evaluation programs as appropriate.

10. Performs other duties as assigned.


QUALIFICATIONS


EDUCATION


+ Post high school carpentry apprenticeship or other equivalent formalized training preferred.


EXPERIENCE/TRAINING


+ Minimum of five years of commercial carpentry/facilities maintenance experience or equivalent required including at least one year of related painting experience.


LICENSE/CERTIFICATION


+ Valid state driver’s license.


OTHER SKILLS


+ Basic computer skills including Microsoft Office applications.

+ Good visual color discrimination.

+ Good communication skills.


REGION/LOCATION SPECIFIC NOTES


PIMC


+ Responsible for performing routine maintenance on the physical plant stocking and delivering of materials and supplies to the appropriate unit.

+ Will perform environmental services, security assistance and emergency response duties as needed.

+ Successfully completes the non-violent Crisis Intervention (CPI) course during orientation and renews training as outlined in policy.


PIMC PHYSICAL COGNITIVE REQUIREMENTS


+ Work requires moderate physical exertion 33-66% of the time.

+ Ability to frequently lift objects weighing 50 lbs and occasionally lift 80 lbs. Must push/pull up to 100 lbs occasionally.

+ Work requires occasional exposure to minor cold, outdoor elements, heat, poor ventilation, or sharp tools. Reasonably anticipated exposure to blood or body fluids on rare occasion exists. Work may require operating company owned vehicles. Work may require exposure to lung or skin irritants.

+ Job duties require intense concentration and attention to detail up to 80% of the time. May require on call availability 24/7.

+ Work may require occasional use of PPE including respirator, mask, gloves, gowns. Must be able to bend/twist/stretch/squat, reach and climb ladders.


See how PeaceHealth is committed to Inclusivity, Respect for Diversity and Cultural Humility (https://www.thecaregiver.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/PeaceHealth-Statement-of-Commitment-to-Diversity-and-Inclusion-vFINAL.pdf) .


For full consideration of your skills and abilities, please attach a current resume with your application. EEO Affirmative Action Employer/Vets/Disabled in accordance with applicable local, state or federal laws.


REQNUMBER: 18588

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
Position Title: Maintenance Technician Department: Property Services

Reports to: Manager of Maintenance Pay Range: $26.52-$28.56 per hour

Location: Victoria, BC

Position 1: 8:30am-4:00pm, Monday-Friday (70 hours bi-weekly)

Position 2: 8:30am-4:00pm, Monday-Friday (70 hours bi-weekly)

Organizational Focus:

Pacifica Housing has been providing safe and affordable homes for almost 35 years. We are a rapidly growing organization dedicated to meeting the housing and support needs of our community. As such, we are committed to building our fast-growing team with a culture that supports our people and reinforces our core values of authenticity, leadership, respect, and social justice.

Pacifica is proud to be a Certified Living Wage Employer by The Living Wage for Families Campaign.

What we Offer:

  • A mission driven, meaningful working environment.
  • Minimum three (3) Weeks Vacation Entitlement.
  • Best-in-class Benefits Package for full-time employees (includes extended health & dental, life insurance, among others).
  • Employer RRSP Contributions (employee matching not required).
  • Significant wellness time.
  • Career development and internal advancement opportunities.
  • Organization and individual training opportunities.
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

Primary Objectives:

The Maintenance Technician is primarily accountable for fulfilling maintenance work orders according to a prescribed schedule and to meet quality standards established by Property Services.

Key Responsibilities:

  • As a member of the Maintenance Team performs a variety of maintenance functions according to maintenance work orders and following an established schedule, including:
  • Carrying out repairs and other maintenance activities as required such as plumbing, appliance, drywall, painting and minor electrical repairs;
  • Residential installation and assembly including: doors, blinds, etc.;
  • Posting a variety of notices as instructed by the Property Services Coordinator or by the Manager of Maintenance, such as Notice To End Tenancy and Notices To Enter, in compliance with the Residential Tenancy Act;
  • Cleaning and repairing units upon turnover and according to the Society’s specifications;
  • Immediately reporting safety or accident/injury incidents to the Manager of Maintenance or to the Property Services Coordinator;
  • Completing required paperwork such as maintenance work orders and mileage claims and submitting to the Manager of Maintenance;
  • Maintaining cordial and cooperative relationships with Supportive Housing staff and with the tenants of Pacifica Housing;
  • Work independently to meet deadlines and complete assignments as arranged; and
  • Report to the Manager of Maintenance regarding issues resolved, those needing attention, and those currently in progress.

Qualifications:

Education:

  • High school graduation.
  • Must hold a Basic First Aid Certificate.

Experience:

  • Experience as a maintenance technician or other similar position, preferably in a non-profit housing environment.
  • Demonstrated experience in a building maintenance role.
  • Experience using hand and electrical tools.
  • Preferred 2 years’ experience doing suite renovations/ building maintenance.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Ability to demonstrate skills in residential building maintenance including carpentry, plumbing and electrical is required.
  • General proficiency using a mobile phone to e-mail, text, call and manage calendar appointments.
  • Must have trade skills including painting, drywall patching and installation, door hardware repairs, and flooring and carpentry repairs.

Note: An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.

Additional Criteria for Role:

  • Completion of a Criminal Record Check is required before employment commences.
  • Must have valid driver’s licence and access to a reliable vehicle with a minimum of $2 million liability ‘business class’ insurance.
  • Must be available to be on call in off hours for emergency call out.


Pacifica Housing advises all employees, contractors and volunteers of the risk of violence, injury and harm that is present in the execution of their duties. Pacifica Housing is committed to providing a safe and risk-free work place, however, we acknowledge the inherent risk in social housing and direct support work while in homes and in other support relationships.

Pacifica celebrates diversity and what makes you uniquely you. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring in terms of your culture, ethnicity, race, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, nation of origin, age, languages spoken, veteran’s status, color, religion, and diversability.

title: Night Shift Millwright - Cambridge, ON
description:
Job ID:  401223

 

Permacon, a CRH Company, is a leader and pioneer in the manufacturing of concrete masonry and landscaping products.  Permacon is a division of Oldcastle APG and operates 9 plants in Ontario and Quebec. 

 

We are currently looking for a Night Shift Millwright at our Cambridge site.

 

The incumbent will be mainly responsible for the reliability and good functioning of machines, equipment and systems.   More specifically, he or she will be a self-starter, troubleshoot, repair, adjust, program and lead the preventative maintenance on mechanical components under his or her responsibility.  The incumbent will also be involved in parts inventory, lead mechanical shutdowns, reporting, record keeping, housekeeping, and safety improvements.

 

Qualifications
 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or abilities required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties of the job.
 

Requirements 
 

  • Certified Industrial Mechanic or Millwright
  • CWB (Canadian welding Board) member will be an asset
  • Technical or College Diploma in Industrial mechanic
  • At least 5 years of relevant experience in industrial mechanic
  • Safety oriented
  • Excellent problem-solving skills
  • Excellent teamwork skills
  • Demonstrated skills in industrial mechanic (hydraulic and pneumatic), electrical, and welding

 

 

Why work at Permacon ?

 

  • We offer a competitive salary and group insurance plan
  • Permacon continuously strives to create a secure, respectful and inclusive work environment 
  • Opportunity of career

 

APPLY NOW!

 

At Permacon, diversity is one of our main assets! We therefore invite visible minorities, ethnic minorities and people living with a disability to apply.

title: Facilities Assistant
description:
About Fresh City Family of Brands:
Fresh City is an award-winning urban farm and omnichannel retailer. Founder-led, we’re on a mission to provide a better life through food. More than one decade after we first began, our belief in that is even stronger. Every day, we deliver organic produce, chef-inspired and made from scratch prepared foods, bespoke meats and more to thousands of Greater Toronto Area families.

In 2018, Fresh City acquired Mabel’s Bakery, a popular bakery in Toronto producing artisan bread and pastries, and shortly after acquired The Healthy Butcher, a pioneer in organic and 100% Grass-Fed beef, in 2019.  In 2022, subscription-based organic produce and grocery delivery company Mama Earth Organics was added to the lineup of brands making Fresh City the largest organic online retailer in Ontario.

With eight retail locations and home delivery across the GTA between our four brands, the Fresh City family of brands continues to bring farmers, makers and eaters, together to deliver a food experience that respects our bodies, our planet, and our shared tomorrow.

Food is our passion. We proudly employ over 500 employees across our four brands including our farm, our two warehouses, our food production facilities, our offices and our retail locations. We’re continuously advancing our culture of belonging, where everyone feels seen, heard, valued and free to be their authentic selves.

What you will be doing: 
  • Maintain essential systems including but not limited to refrigeration, plumbing, lighting and kitchen equipment in retail locations
  • Monitor and troubleshoot the efficiency of all building systems
  • Ensure all utility systems are inspected and in accordance with regulations
  • Assist store managers with store interior and exterior maintenance
  • Work proactively with Facilities leadership in planning and executing repair and maintenance tasks, warehouse facilities and space allocation and equipment moves
  • Participate in retail safety programs, including Joint Health and Safety Committee meetings as scheduled
  • Oversee third party workers as necessary and keep an open line of communication back to the Retail Facilities and Maintenance Manager to troubleshoot issues
  • Other duties as required
What you will bring to the table: 
  • Experience with facilities maintenance, including but not limited to refrigeration, plumbing and HVAC
  • High school diploma, facilities management, business management or related field preferred
  • Strong verbal communication skills and written skills in preparing service reports 
  • Self-motivated and self-directed with excellent time management, multitasking and organizational skills
  • Access to a vehicle is required
Certification/Licensing Requirements:
  • Valid G class Ontario driver’s license 
  • Certification or enrollment in facilities management is an asset
Physical Requirements:
  • Ability to physically stand, bend, squat, and lift up to 50lbs
Working Conditions:
  • Some weekend and emergency calls required
  • Able to move swiftly and proactively to deal with emergency situations
  • Mileage reimbursement to cover costs of travel between retail locations

We thank all interested applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
 
Fresh City is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We consider all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, and Indigenous status. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.


About Fresh City Farms:

Fresh City is an award-winning urban farm and omni-channel retailer. Founder-led, we’re on a mission to provide a better life through food. More than one decade after we first began, our belief in that is even stronger. Every day, we deliver organic produce, chef-inspired and made from scratch prepared foods, bespoke meats and more to thousands of Greater Toronto Area families.In 2018, Fresh City acquired Mabel’s Bakery, a popular bakery in Toronto producing artisan breads and pastries, and shortly after acquired The Healthy Butcher, a pioneer in organic and 100% Grassfed beef, in 2019. In 2022, subscription-based organic produce and grocery delivery company Mama Earth Organics was added to the lineup of brands making Fresh City the largest organic online retailer in Ontario.With eight retail locations and home delivery across the GTA between our four brands, the Fresh City family of brands continues to bring farmers, makers and eaters together to deliver a food experience that respects our bodies, our planet, and our shared tomorrow.Food is our passion. We proudly employ over 500 employees across our four brands including our farm, our two warehouses, our food production facilities, our offices and our retail locations. We’re continuously advancing our culture of belonging, where everyone feels seen, heard, valued and free to be their authentic selves.

title: Millwright - Richmond
description:
About the Company:

Uptime Industrial is a leading provider of full-service industrial and commercial equipment repair, upgrades, installation and relocation across North America. As a service provider, our mission is simple -  to keep our clientsâ€™ businesses running â€“ 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

 

Our recent growth and continued success stems not only from being highly trained experts in our craft, but also from our most important values: integrity and innovation. These values are a big part of who we are and how we work. We are committed to always doing the right thing for the job, for our customer and most importantly, for our people and each other. To learn more about Uptime Industrial and the core values that shape our company today, visit https://www.uptimeindustrial.com/about/.

About the Role:

Reporting to the Operations Manager, Service, the Millwright will be consistently working at one customer site on a 12 month basis in the food and beverage industry. This full-time, permanent employment opportunity provides structure and stability. With successful completion of the 12 month project, there is an opportunity to either continue with another project or join our Service team. If you are interested in joining the Service team after this 12 month project, you will venture out to various customer sites in a Company vehicle solving challenges one site at a time. Your duties will range from planned work order execution to troubleshooting and repairs. You will be responsible for diagnosing and ensuring customer concerns are resolved in a timely manner.

 

Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

 

  • Observe, test, and install newly built machinery;
  • Cleaning, lubricating and performing other routine maintenance work on machineries;
  • Interpret and study blueprints to determine correct installation and operation of machinery;
  • Safely perform and diagnose preventative maintenance work in an efficient method to minimize machine downtime.
What you Bring:

The ideal candidate is not only determined to meet customer demands but understands what it really means to be part of a team representing a Company of highly skilled trades. You are always prepared to put your best foot forward no matter how many setbacks you may face. You can demonstrate the ability to exercise sound judgement and possesses a creative problem-solving mindset. You are someone who strives to meet customer needs in an innovative and safe manner. You are eager to work in a challenging team environment and to develop strong working relationships with all levels of the business.

 

 

Our Must Haves

  • Minimum 3rd year Millwright Apprenticeship;
  • 12 month project commitment to Customer and Company;
  • Hold a valid Class 5 Driverâ€™s License with a clean driverâ€™s abstract;
  • Committed to customer service and going the extra mile while servicing client;
  • Ability to think on your feet and utilize strong problem-solving capabilities;
  • Experience working in food and beverage will be considered an asset.
  • Available Shifts: Sunday to Thursday, 5:00am to 1:30pm OR Monday to Friday, 8:30am to 5:00pm

 

 

Your Rewards

 

Our most important offering to anyone that joins the Uptime Industrial team is our culture of innovation, achievement, and ownership.   We bring out the best in each other by constantly striving to be world class in all we do. These values are reflected in our Work, our Company, and our People.  

 

At Uptime, we also offer a very competitive compensation structure that supplements your regular income with a robust benefits package:

  • Medical and Dental Coverage:  Our industry leading benefits package covers you and your dependents at no cost
  • Friends and Family Program:  Early and exclusive access to our newly released projects
  • Professional Development and Education Support
  • Registered Retirement Savings Plan:  A plan that helps you save for your retirement with employer matching.
  • Mobile Phone

title: Maintenance Mechanic (Millwright)
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Job Description:

UPS is hiring a Maintenance Mechanic (Millwright) to support the package sorting system, including belt conveyors at Calgary Hub. In our industry this position is also known as Plant Mechanic or Industrial Mechanic.

Position Summary:

This position is responsible for a broad range of maintenance activities that are performed to keep UPS package handling facilities operating efficiently and effectively. The work is sometimes fast-paced and requires routine interaction with other operations employees.

  • Job Type: Full-Time - Permanent
  • Department: Buildings and Systems Engineering
  • Work Location: 22 Aero Drive NE, Calgary
  • Workdays: Monday to Friday (flexibility is required to work occasional weekends and non-regular shifts especially in peak season) Available Shifts: Day
  • Average work Hours: 42.5 hours per week with potential for overtime

Responsibilities and Duties:

  • Inspecting troubleshooting repairing and/or replacing mechanical components such as motors, reducers, drive chains, sprockets, sheaves, pulleys, rollers, conveyor belts, bearings and transfer plates.
  • Troubleshooting adjusting and replacing AC and DC electrical equipment such as batteries, control stations, fuses, motor starters, relays, switches and timers.
  • Inspecting troubleshooting repairing and/or replacing pneumatic equipment such as diverters, air compressors, lubricators, hoses and coils.
  • Inspecting, troubleshooting, repairing and/or replacing hydraulic equipment such as hoses, fittings, cylinders and pumps.
  • Welding equipment such as hand rails, conveyor supports, package handling equipment, carts and grating.
  • Performing preventive maintenance inspections of plant equipment such as conveyors, bulk carts, and power industrial equipment.

Qualifications:

  • Grade 12 education or equivalent.
  • Possession of a valid 433A Millwright Certification of Qualification is highly preferred but extensive relevant experience may be considered.
  • Minimum 3 years of post-apprenticeship experience performing maintenance on industrial equipment.
  • Ability to receive and give instruction over radio in industrial environment.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills.

Assets:

  • Experience of performing maintenance on conveyor belts.
  • Knowledge of plumbing and building schematics.
  • Knowledge of keyboard and basic computer skills.

Compensation and Benefits:

  • Weekly pay (every Friday).
  • Automatic pay progression as per the existing union Collective Agreement.
  • Paid vacation:
  • 2 weeks after 1 year of service
  • 3 weeks after 5 years of service
  • 4 weeks after 10 years of service
  • 5 weeks after 20 years of service
  • 6 weeks after 25 years of service
    • Group Benefits (Dental and Extended Medical)
    • Pension Plan
    • Immediate access to UPS Employee Discount Program upon hire.
    • EAP (Employee Assistance Program)
    • Opportunities for future growth within a Fortune 50 company.

Working Conditions:

  • Mainly indoors (in a warehouse). Occasionally work outdoors.
  • Exposed to hot/cold temperatures when working outdoors.

Future You wants to know – what is life at UPS really like? You’ll see that it’s about opportunity, teamwork, a supportive culture and benefits that help you become everything you’re envisioning right now.  Explore the many ways UPS can enrich life for Future You. And if you’d like benefit information, find it with the specific job you’re looking for.

UPS is the world’s largest package delivery company and a provider of supply chain management solutions. At UPS we discover how we combine endless opportunities innovation and rewards to create a truly unique career experience. With our unique promote-from-within culture you'll always find exciting new opportunities at every level of the organization. From training and education to growth and empowerment you have the freedom to forge a career path that can take you anywhere you want to go.

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Manufacturing Maintenance Technician
description:
Job Description:
Title: Manufacturing Maintenance Technician
Location: Burlington, ON
Contract: 6 – 8-month contract with high possibility to convert FTE
8 Hour Shift (Flexible Start Time: 9am-12noon)

Job Description:
  • The Manufacturing Maintenance Technician will participate in the oversight of the Personalization and Manufacturing equipment cells and support the Mailing Equipment Cell in parallel.
  • They will play a critical part in new product and technology introduction projects in roles varying from design, to integration, to testing by collaborating with other technical teams.
  • You will be given assignments to lead critical projects, discussions, and activities within the plant.

Preferred Requirements:
  • Atleast 1 years of experience in working with repairing electro-mechanical equipment in a manufacturing environment.
  • Atleast 1 year experience working with mechanical and electrical tools to troubleshoot and do beginner level repairs of equipment.
  • Must have experience with troubleshooting electrical and mechanical issues, performing beginner range electrical repairs.
  • Must have experience with troubleshooting electrical and mechanical issues (beginner level).
  • Experience with reading and deciphering technical documentation, parts diagrams, etc.
  • Prior Experience working as either one of manufacturing technician, hands-on repairman, IT specialist, Automation Expert, mechanical technician, electrician, etc.
  • Solid understanding of basic IT Networking, taking backups of machines, restoring computers.
  • Experience repairing embossing machinery (Data card/Matica equipment).
  • Experience with mechanical repairs, machine shop tools, key mechanical concepts and pneumatic systems.
  • Must possess an understanding of the philosophy and application of Total Preventive Maintenance.
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook emailing, Calendar, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel.
  • Experience with reading and deciphering technical documentation, parts diagrams, etc.
 
Duties:
  • Providing direct support with the integration of new equipment and technology introduced in the plant related to the production and packaging processes.
  • Maintaining manufacturing machinery systems in proper working order to ensure business continuity and minimize production downtime.
  • Providing daily reports to the Production Manager and Shift Supervisors, as well as the Maintenance team.
  • Maintaining a log of all work done during the shift that relates to machines and items related to ongoing developments or projects.
  • Maintaining the inventory system that serves as the foundation for parts usage tracking, machines parts usage tracking, parts reordering process, and parts reception process.
  • Analyzing downtime data, making graphs using Excel, and presenting downtime and assessment for reasons of downtime to support continuous improvement initiatives.
  • Covering other shifts as needed with short notice to assist with coverage needs.
  • Creating purchase requests, following up with Purchasing and Finance to ensure orders are placed and executed, to their final reception and audit.
  • Developing the Repair Training program for equipment repair using your experience with the equipment.
  • Performing IT tasks, such as network troubleshooting, patching software, backing up machine systems, etc.
 
Skills:
  • Formal education or training with embossing machinery (Datacard/Matica equipment).
  • Formal education or training with mailing and packaging equipment (Bell & Howell or Client).
  • Experience working in Card Personalization Center and it’s regulatory requirements.
  • Experience with Kaizen, Lean Manufacturing, Six Sigma continuous improvement processes like DMAIC.
  • Experience capturing and reporting on Key Performance Indices related to Maintenance.
  • Experience using Oracle or Other Inventory Management ERP system for order placing and inventory control.
  • Experience coordinating work and project actions with vendors to their completion through follow ups.
  • Knowledge being able to read and review PLC, circuit logic, electrical repairs and assessments.
  • Prior experience working with other departments (Quality Assurance, New Product Introduction NPI, IT, and Logistics) to administer quality validations, ensure NPI processes followed, fulfill communication with logistics for shipping and receiving of engineering products.

title: SEMI RETIRED HANDYMAN
description:
SKILLED HANDYMAN

We have year-round work with over 50% repeat/referral customer base and are seeking experienced Handyman and Tradesman with a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company serving (Scarborough, Pickering, Ajax, Whitby) with excellent customer service and quality work.

What You Will Receive

  • Earning potential $35-$40 per hour(you are paid by the job), depending on your skills, availability
  • Work as Independent Contractor  - part-time or full-time - on your own schedule
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers
Responsibilities

The Skilled Craftsman has expertise in multiple types of home repair, maintenance and remodeling. You must have basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate with others with a positive attitude.  We are looking for craftsmen (and women!) who can bid work and produce it.  If you have at least 3 of the following skill areas, you're the kind of person we need to add to our team:

  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish
  • Bathroom Upgrades / Remodel
  • Painting Interior and Exterior
  • Drywall Repair / Patching / Caulking
  • Tiling floors and walls
  • Handyman, General Home Repairs 
All candidates should be confident in the following areas:

  • English language skills verbal and written
  • Great Customer Service and Client Relations
  • Knowledge of Building Codes
  • Sourcing materials or helping the customer select materials
Requirements

  • Must have current Driver's License and submit to a background check
  • Must have tools, vehicle, cell phone and good references
  • Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades
  • Must pass screening process (Interviews and Police Background Clearance)
  • Must be able to work as an Independent Contractor
We are always looking to speak with an experienced handyman or craftsman (or woman!) who has professional experience as a Remodeler, Carpenter, ESA Master Electrical Contractor, Plumber, Painter, Mason, or Installer or any skilled tradesman from the residential or commercial construction industry.

Ready to Learn More?

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.  Check us out on the web at:scarborough.handymanconnection.com

What our customers say:

Watch More

Why Handyman Connection?

title: Solutions Maintenance Technician
description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW:

AGS Automotive Systems is a full-service automotive supplier specializing in the manufacture and supply of complex high value-add automotive metal components, including in particular front and rear impact assemblies, principally for pick-ups and the heavy truck market. AGS offers full range of in-house capabilities including design and engineering, high tonnage metal stamping, light weighting solutions, innovative multi-material joining, high performance coatings including chrome plating and automated manufacturing processes.

AGS is committed to delivering high quality, high value products to our customers, who include several of North America's largest automakers. For over 70 years AGS has stood behind our belief in quality, technology, and teamwork.

BASIC FUNCTION:

Reporting to the Solutions Maintenance Supervisor, the Solutions Maintenance Technician is responsible for, but not limited to, overseeing the operation of the D.I. Water System, Boiler, and E-coat systems, providing guidance to production personnel on the chemical adds required to maintain the processes within normal operating parameters.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:

-Adherence to the IATF Procedures and Instructions.
-Comply with all Company safety policies, procedures and rules.
-Monitor inventory levels of process chemicals and orders replenishment quantities.
-Act as the backup Waste Water Treatment Operator.
-Monitor processes on a time schedule as outlined in the Control Plans and proactively makes necessary adjustments to ensure optimum process parameters are maintained by adding chemicals or raw materials to process solutions or product batches to correct or establish the formulations required to meet specifications.
-Select the appropriate test method and test equipment and tests solutions used in the coating processes such as pre-treatment solutions, cleaning, plating, and paint solutions for chemical concentration, specific gravity and other characteristics.
-Select samples for tests at specific stages in the production process and tests the parts or has the parts tested for a variety of characteristics such as; dimensions, coating performance, mechanical, electrical or chemical characteristics of the coatings.
-Issue date: September 2006 Revision#/Date: 05 / 29JL16 HRF-18.102
-Setup or adjusts test equipment as required to perform the solutions tests following established procedures and safe practices to ensure accuracy and safety.
-Record test data, prepare graphs or charts of analysis data and record solution adjustments using established procedures or methods.
-Participate in ISO / IATF internal or external audits.
-Clean and sterilize laboratory equipment. Report any equipment malfunctions, Calibrate instruments per established procedures and frequencies.
-Participate in APQP activities such as developing and updating Process Flow Charts, PFMEA's and Control Plans.
-Actively participate in PDT meetings, process improvement, Problem Solving and corrective action review and meetings.
-Liaise with internal and external customers and suppliers as required.
-Conduct system audits of the production and support areas and provide reports of findings to area supervision and management.
-Assist when required in the solution of shop floor problems.
-Interact with customer to help reduce and eliminate PPM's including review of accumulations prior to PPM reporting.
-Ability to travel if required representing the company during meetings.
-Ensure the Standards of Section 28 of the OHSA are met.
-Performs other duties as assigned.

QUALIFICATIONS:

-Post secondary education in chemistry related field and two (2) years related experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience would be an asset.
-Proficiency in mathematics to perform calculations and analysis would be an asset.
-Analytical ability and problem solving skills to recognize deficiencies and abnormalities and to recommend the appropriate corrective actions would be an asset.
-Proficiency in the operation, calibration and maintenance of instrumentation and equipment would be an asset.
-A well-organized approach to problem solving, good record keeping skills as well as the ability to follow instructions and procedures would be an asset.

AGS Automotive Systems is proud to support the full inclusion of persons with disabilities as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At AGS we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request by contacting AGS Human Resources at

HR@agsautomotive.com

title: 5981 - SAP Technician
description:
Our client, the third largest producer of Canadian oil and natural gas and the second largest refiner and upgrader with extensive midstream and downstream infrastructure, has an immediate need for a SAP Technician to collaborate with business stakeholders and execution teams. This is a contract position for eleven (11) months located in Lloydminster, Saskatchewan.

Description

The SAP Technician is responsible to investigate and collaborate with internal and external teams to verify data to accurately create credible asset information in SAP. Optimize costs and improve lifecycle and manages work from multiple assets across one or more business areas in Canada.

 Accountabilities

  • Investigate and collaborate with internal and external teams to verify data to accurately create credible asset information in SAP to optimize costs and improve lifecycle.
  • Find errors and anomalies in large data sets
  • Comply with data standards, which is a key metric.
  • Assess information to make decisions
  • Influence stakeholders to maintain data quality standards.
  • Manage initiatives related to data improvement.

Required

  • Business / Technical Diploma and / or equivalent training is an asset
  • Experience with SAP, or asset management software, is an asset
  • Experience in MS Project, MS Office
  • Oil and gas equipment knowledge is an asset
  • Attention to detail - able to find errors and anomalies in large data sets
  • Experience complying with data standards, which is a key metric.
  • Experience managing initiatives related to data improvement.
  • Experience influencing stakeholders to maintain data quality standards.
  • Ability to accurately assess information to determine a course of action based on findings
  • Effective communication skills with field and office personnel
  • Able to adapt to changing priorities to meet deadlines
  • Able to organize and manage multiple work streams
  • Team player that can work with multiple stakeholders to achieve success.

Additional Information

  • Client requires proof of Covid-19 vaccination to access job site. Providing proof of vaccination is a condition of employment with Ian Martin” for this opportunity.
  • This role is primarily in an office environment and does not include field work.

f you're a technical professional, you know that it can be difficult to find fulfilling work that advances your career. At the Ian Martin Group, we exist to connect professionals like you with meaningful work at industry-leading companies in your field. And we walk the walk, too: as a Certified B Corporation, we believe in using business as a force for good for people, our communities, and the environment.

We value diversity and inclusion and encourage all qualified people to apply. If we can make this easier through accommodation in the recruitment process, please contact us at

http://recruit@ianmartin.com/

We encourage all qualified candidates to apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

 

#WES

#MON

title: Water Damage Technician
description:
First Onsite is seeking to hire a full-time Water Damage Technician to save the day for our residential and commercial customers as the first responder for water-related emergencies. Do you have previous experience in restoration or construction? Are you looking to build a successful career while rebuilding lives? If so, keep reading!

Our Water Damage Technician earns a competitive hourly wage based on experience. We offer an exceptional extended health plan including medical, dental, and vision. Our other benefits include an employee assistance program, educational assistance, professional development, internal growth opportunities, the opportunity for national career movement, and a healthy work/life balance. If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today!


A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A WATER DAMAGE TECHNICIAN

As a Water Damage Technician, you are the first responder to commercial and residential properties when water disasters strike. You're the calm after the storm, and your helpful demeanor eases the worries of our customers. Stabilizing, cleaning, and placing drying equipment, you prepare for restoration. Once you arrive at customer locations, you manage onsite emergency response activities including pumping water, clearing carpet, removing drywall, mitigation, etc. You set up deodorization, negative air, ozone, thermal fogging, and related equipment. Monitoring the drying process, you adjust equipment as necessary.

Your excellent communication skills assist you as you work collaboratively with construction and content crews. Health and safety are important to you which is why you respect all policies and procedures and ensure that they are followed by other employees and subcontractors. You are a get-it-done person who likes to be active and isn't afraid to jump right in and make things happen. You take pride in your work and feel good about being able to save the day for people in our community while helping us build a loyal customer base!

QUALIFICATIONS

  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • At least 1 year of experience in the construction or restoration industry (relevant cleaning experience may be considered)
  • Ability to pass a background check
  • Availability for scheduled on-call and after-hour shifts

Valid driver's license is preferred, but not necessarily required. Are you able to work independently? Do you have excellent communication and interpersonal skills? Can you work collaboratively with construction crews? Are you service-oriented? Is safety important to you? Do you project a professional appearance and attitude? If so, you may be perfect for this position!

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, First Onsite Restoration will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resources or the Hiring Manager of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require in respect of any materials or processes used to ensure your equal participation.

title: Licensed Technician- OpenRoad Mazda Port Moody
description:
UNLIMITED POSSIBILITIES AHEAD


We believe in doing good for our customers and for ourselves. Whether it’s launching the most anticipated model of the year or purchasing a vehicle for your next adventure, great people and relationships are at every turn with OpenRoad.


 We are proud of our forward-thinking culture developed over 40 years of continuous improvement initiatives. OpenRoad is one of the largest and fastest growing automotive retail groups in the country (representing 20 automotive brands across 25 locations) with a shared vision to become the national automotive leader in customer experience. As one of Canada’s Best Employers and Best Managed Companies, we are looking for team players who are excited to continually learn, work hard, and take ownership of their role.


If you love the idea of joining an organization with unlimited possibilities to accelerate your career, then apply to OpenRoad and grow with us today! 


OpenRoad Auto Group is currently seeking to expand our team with a Full-Time Licensed/Ticketed Technician (ie/ Red Seal Certificate, Journeyman) at OpenRoad Mazda Port Moody.


A Career at OpenRoad Means You’ll Enjoy:


  • Many opportunities for internal growth
  • Discounted vehicle purchase program
  • Associate perks program
  • Company social events
  • And more!


ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Receive repair orders from dispatch tower/Service Advisor and perform work as outlined on repair order with efficiency and accuracy.
  • Ensure work is performed in accordance with dealership and factory standards.
  • Communicate with parts department to obtain needed parts. Save and tag parts if the job is under warranty or if requested by the customer.
  • Examine the vehicle to determine if additional safety or service work is required.
  • Advise Service Advisor immediately if additional work is needed, if work outlined is not needed, or if repairs cannot be completed within the time promised.
  • Inform dispatcher when job is started, finished, or interrupted. Be particularly attentive to repair orders on vehicles marked “RUSH” or “CUSTOMER WAITING”.
  •  Complete and maintain documentation of work performed.
  • Road-test vehicles to quality-check work performed.
  • Supervise work of any Apprentice technicians as assigned to you by management.
  •  Attend factory-sponsored training classes. Keep abreast of factory technical bulletins.
  • Ensure that customers’ cars are kept clean.
  •  Keep shop area neat, clean and free of safety hazards.
  • Comply with Federal, Provincial and Municipal regulations, such as those governing the disposal of hazardous wastes
  •  Assist in creating quotes for additional work required.
  •  Keep up to date on online training as require
  •  Follow company safety policies and practices, and immediately, report any and all accidents to a Manager/Supervisor.
  • This position will be expected to perform other duties as assigned by management.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

  • Must be a fully licensed Technician.
  • Working knowledge of automotive equipment
  • Possess strong diagnostic and problem solving skills in order to maintain optimal customer satisfaction.
  • A highly self-motivated and organized individual.
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills to effectively work with other members of the Service Department team.
  • Must be committed to consistently delivering high quality work.
  • Ability to make sound decisions in a manner consistent with the essential job functions.
  • A valid Canadian driver’s license, and ability to provide drivers abstract for review. 


Internal Candidates MUST apply by filling out the Internal Endorsement Form on the Intranet. Failure to complete the form will cause a delay in your application. 


https://orag.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=3124 


We are an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity. We stand behind the growth of our associates to help them achieve their vision and goals.


JOIN US AND GROW WITH US! 


We thank all those that have applied. Only those considered for the position will be contacted.

title: Service Technician - Shop
description:
Brandt is currently seeking a Service Technician for our Barrie location.

This position is responsible for the repair and maintenance of construction and forestry based equipment and attachments in a shop environment.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Efficiently and effectively evaluate the working condition of, diagnose, assemble/disassemble, order parts for, and repair heavy duty equipment
  • Use secondary materials and equipment safely and efficiently
  • Use related instruments, hand and power tools, secondary equipment, and computer systems
  • Accurately and completely document on work orders all machine information, actions taken, and time taken
  • Continually assess service task hazards and ensure work is performed safely, and to accepted standards
  • Use computer applications and information systems (i.e. John Deere Service Advisor) to document maintenance, inspection, and diagnosis
  • Use parts catalogues to locate parts, and order parts from parts personnel
  • Road test equipment and check attachment operation as required
  • Must have the ability to communicate and work effectively with customers, the service team, and branch personnel
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds
  • Previous mechanical experience in a heavy equipment environment is preferred
  • Certified Journeyperson in the Heavy Duty Equipment technician trade or equivalent designated trade preferred
  • Must be committed to customer service and service excellence

title: Utility Technician (General Labourer) - Kenora
description:
• Location: Kenora
  • Full-time permanent position, day shift with some flexibility in hours
  • Frequent opportunities for overtime available, with evening and weekend work as needed
  • Competitive hourly rate ($17-19 per hour or more based on previous experience) with opportunities for performance review and potential increases every 6 months
  • Benefits, and defined contribution pension plan
  • Company vehicle, cell phone, and laptop provided
  • Opportunity to work independently outdoors

 

Are you ready to learn a skilled trade and begin your career in a fast-growing and lucrative industry?

Look no further. G-Tel is hiring and training Damage Prevention Technicians to complete utility locates in your area right now.

Our technicians prevent significant damage and even danger by making sure utility lines are marked and visible.

If you’ve ever seen a thin metal rod sticking up from someone’s lawn -- usually topped with a brightly colored pennant – that’s where a damage prevention technician or utility locator has found and marked the path of underground utility lines through neighborhoods.

 

In this role, you will:

  • Use state of the art locating equipment, geographic information systems (GIS), maps, and engineering drawings to identify the location of underground utilities
  • Thoroughly search for all gas, phone and fiber optic cables in an area and mark them with spray paint/coloured flags
  • Prepare reports and documentation to track the work you and your team are doing across the city

You’ll be supplied with a company vehicle, phone and laptop for work use. You’ll work on your own, travelling to sites within your territory. You’ll mostly work Monday to Friday during the day with flexible hours, with overtime work on the weekends or evenings as required.

 

Qualifications

  • Have experience, or definitely would enjoy working outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Be physically fit and able to walk frequently on uneven surfaces, sit in a vehicle, lift up to 20 lbs with one hand, complete repetitive arm motions and use a shovel and other similar equipment
  • Be able to visually distinguish colours
  • Have a valid Ontario “G” class driver’s license and be able to produce a clean drivers abstract
  • Have a high school diploma
  • Be willing to obtain and wear CSA approved steel toe safety boots
  • Be willing to undergo and successfully clear a criminal background check
  • Be able to work weekends and evenings when overtime is required
  • Have strong computer literacy and ability to use new software/Microsoft Office

 

And here’s what would be an asset:

  • Experience in construction, farming, utilities (e.g., gas fitting or electrical background), land surveying, GIS, or similar
  • Experience working as a Damage Prevention Technician or Utility Locator would be an asset but is not required

Please note: G-Tel does not require proof of Covid-19 vaccination.

title: Millwright (433A) - $5,000 Signing Bonus
description:
Weston Foods is a leading North American bakery company with distinct business units in fresh (Weston Bakeries), frozen (Maplehurst Bakeries), artisan (ACE Bakery), and biscuit (Interbake Foods). We bake our products in more than 50 facilities across Canada and the USA, and are committed to delivering great quality and high value baked goods and bakery solutions to our customers across North America. We conduct our business with integrity, contribute to our communities, and foster a supportive company culture.

We are building a culture of success here, and it depends on each of our employees committing to getting better every day. We’re always interested in connecting with high-performing, career-minded professionals who want to build a better Weston Foods with us.

Shift Details:

  • Bi-Weekly Rotations , 12 Hour Continental Shifts
  • Week 1: Work Monday/Tuesday, Off Wednesday/Thursday, Work Friday/Saturday/Sunday
  • Week 2: Off Monday/Tuesday, Work Wednesday/Thursday, Off Friday/Saturday/Sunday
  • 2 Weeks Nights 6PM - 6AM , 2 Weeks Days 6AM - 6PM
  • Great working environment
  • Opportunity for growth and development
  • Must be able to work every other weekend

Pay Rate: $37.88 per hour to start + shift premium (extra $2.00/hr night shift premium)

Bonus: $5,000 signing bonus ($2,500 paid out after probationary period and $2,500 after 6 months of service)

As a member of the maintenance team, your primary responsibility includes perform electrical maintenance, install, examine, replace or repair components; trouble shoot electrical systems and building services. In addition, you will provide technical support to production teams in supporting production uptime, ensuring optimal functioning of the production equipment and facilities. This position provides critical support in reducing production down time, maintaining overhaul programs, preventive maintenance of equipment, and effective troubleshooting and repair of equipment. The Millwright is a member of the maintenance team and as such, participates in team efforts to achieve assigned department goals; works closely with other team members to ensure all maintenance activities are completed on time, according to SOPs and regulatory requirements; and provides support to other roles within the maintenance team.

Job Duties:

  • Read blueprints, diagrams and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Install, troubleshoot and maintain power transmission, vacuum, hydraulic and pneumatic systems, and programmable logic controls
  • Inspect and examine machinery and equipment to detect and investigate irregularities and malfunctions
  • Adjust machinery and repair or replace defective parts
  • Operate machine tools such as lathes and mill machines to fabricate parts required during overhaul, maintenance or set-up of machinery
  • Assemble machinery and equipment prior to installation using hand and power tools and welding equipment.
  • Troubleshooting/repairs/installations of processing equipment with a working knowledge of electrical to allow efficient repair/replacement results
  • Extensive mechanical knowledge including power transmission, pneumatics and hydraulics
  • Optimize equipment safety, efficiency and reliability, participating in continuous improvement projects and completing work orders according to PM schedules
  • Comply with all applicable legislative and Bakery food safety, health and safety and environmental policies and procedures.
  • Service, clean and perform preventative maintenance and overhaul on all production and bakery equipment
  • Continually improve equipment function via design improvements
  • Ensure that work area is clean of debris and hazards at all times and check work area for such hazards upon arrival and when departing each area of work
  • Work in a safe manner in accordance with legislated and company health and safety standards
  • Perform other related duties as assigned or required.
  • Must have Industrial Millwright License (433A)
  • Strong Mechanical Aptitude
  • Proven track record working with mechanics, machine shop practices (lathe & milling machines), welding (ARC, TIG, MIG), and pneumatic & hydraulic fields is required.
  • Instrumentation ticket a strong asset
  • 2-5 years' industrial, electrical and mechanical experience, preferably in the food industry
  • Problem solving skills and good communication skills are required
  • Flexibility to 12 hour rotational shifts as well as on weekends and holidays

 

#INDOPBR

title: Millwright Journeyperson
description:
Millwright Journeyperson

 Build Your Future. Come Build With Us!

 

Job Overview

JVD Installations Inc. is seeking  experienced Millwright Journeyperson to work in Edmonton, Alberta. The successful candidate will be responsible for executing Millwright duties in a maintenance setting.

Rotation Schedule:

  • 4 days on, 4 days off
  • 12hr shifts (10hr straight time and 2hr Overtime daily)
  • Positions available: Temporary night shift 

 Responsibilities: 

  • Comprehends diagrams and schematic drawings and service manuals to determine work procedures
  • Operates rigging equipment to place heavy machinery and parts
  • Understands how to fit bearings, align gears, pulleys, and shafts, attach motors, and connect couplings and belts to precise tolerances
  • Track, maintain and repair belt and chain conveyors
  • Aligns and tests equipment to make any necessary adjustments
  • Performs predictive and operational maintenance using procedures manufacturers specifications and repair or replace defective parts when necessary
  • Clean equipment as required to perform maintenance activities
  • May perform other related duties as assigned.

 Job Requirements:

  • Must be willing to be hired as a direct employee.
  • Must be able to perform physically demanding work for a long duration of time
  • Must be able to perform duties at heights
  • Must be able to work in a live plant environment
  • Work will be a combination of indoors and outdoors in various weather conditions
  • Must have previous millwright experience in a maintenance environment
  • Must complete specific in class and online training as a pre-hire requirement

Required Certificates: 

  • Journeyperson from a recognized provincial training authority
  • Valid government issued photo identification
  • Valid Drivers license

Preferred Certificates

  • CSTS 09 or CSTS 2020
  • Fall Protection
  • Elevated Work Platform
  • Confined Space
  • Rigging-Basic
  • WHMIS2015
