title: Tool & Equipment Rental Coordinator
description:
Company Description

 

We are Chandos

Inclusion. Collaboration. Ingenuity. Innovation.

These values speak to our desire to create places where all people belong, listening and learning from one another in a way that sparks ideas and leads to positive changes in our industry and community. They also demonstrate our commitment to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture. And, if they resonate with you too, we should talk!

We are 100 percent employee owned and proud to be the first and largest B Corp certified commercial builder in North America, meaning we put our values at the centre of everything we do. 

Continuous improvement is core to our success. Championing innovative and collaborative ways to build is just one example of that. Collaborative construction leads to more efficiency, cost savings, social value, and a much better working experience for everyone.

Every day, our teams are working to build places for people to live, work, learn, serve, and play. But above all, we’re building community. And, we’re looking for like-minded people to join us. Together, we can build a better world.

 

Job Description

The Tools and Equipment Rental Coordinator is responsible to assist the Tool and Equipment Manager in organizing, tracking and distributing tools and equipment to Chandos construction sites.
 

  • Perform all functions related to shipping and receiving of tools and materials to and from job sites.
  • Receive and coordinate rental and sales contracts electronically.
  • Co-ordinator the repairs, rental, deliveries, pick ups and maintenance of tools
  • Perform minor tool repairs as necessary.
  • Assist in the maintenance and repair of tools and equipment.
  • Ensure the maintenance of accurate records for the receipt, rental and transfer of goods/tools.
  • Be responsible for proper completion of all vehicle inspection reports.
  • Interact with customers by telephone, email or in person in a prompt, courteous, business-like manner.
  • Work with warehouse staff, superintendents and project managers to reconcile discrepancies in project inventory.
Qualifications

  • Experience in tool rental is considered an Important asset.
  • Knowledge of maintenance schedules, rental contracts, various manufacturers and their guidelines.
  • Two or more years of experience in tool/shop work.
  • Two or more years of experience in the construction industry.
  • Broad technical understanding of tools and materials.
  • Must be able to work alone, as the shop is in a different location from the main office.
  • Will work both indoors and outdoors in inclement weather at times.


Additional Information

Chandos is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and this includes our recruitment and hiring process. 

We recognize that our differences are our greatest strengths. We uncover talent. We nurture talent. And then we give people the tools they need to use their talent to create a positive impact.

  • We are 100% employee owned. Every person who works for Chandos can become an owner. There is only one class of units at Chandos, because we believe everyone should be treated equal. We talk about being an entrepreneurial-minded organization and you can be sure we mean it!
  • Competitive wages
  • Well rounded employer paid benefits program including health, dental, vision care and employee assistance program
  • RRSP matching program to aid and prepare employees for long-term financial security
  • Educational assistance for employees who wish to pursue job-performance enhancing education
  • Recognition and annual salary reviews program
  • Leadership conferences that allow employees to connect and collaborate
  • Regular company-wide engagement opportunities

title: Handyperson
description:
Company Description

We are hiring part time/casual: Handyperson in Burlington, ON.

Seniors for Seniors (a division of Spectrum Health Care) is a non-medical home care agency proudly serving seniors for over 30 years. 

If you enjoy helping seniors - Apply Today! 

Job Description

  •  Provide general household maintenance, painting, minor plumbing, and other projects
  • Listen, observe, and communicate any concerns/changes in the client’s physical, emotional, and/or environmental
Qualifications

  • Experience in household maintenance
  • Experience in customer service
  • Ability to interact with others in a caring, tactful and courteous manner
  • Ability to speak other languages an asset 
  • Valid Vulnerable Sector Police Check and TB Test (within 6 months) as a condition of employment 
  • Mandatory COVID 19 Vaccine Policy 


Additional Information

Spectrum Health Care is thrilled to be named one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. This award recognizes top companies across Canada for overall performance, sustained growth, strategy, capabilities and innovation, culture and commitment, and leadership. Click here to learn more about this esteemed honour.  

We thank all applicants, however, only those individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act 2005, upon request, support will be provided for accommodations throughout the recruitment process.

If you require accommodation because of disability through the recruitment process, please contact Human Resources at (corphr@spectrumhealthcare.com) for assistance.

title: Night Maintenance Associate (FT)
description:
Do you love hospitality? Love to meet and interact with fun and diverse people? Love to work in a friendly environment? If so, come be a part of our Boulevard Club family.

We take pride in providing safe and inclusive communities;
that inspire wellness, growth, and excellence.
We create exceptional, social, athletic, and recreational
environments; celebrating memorable experiences
and positive connections.

For over a century, The Boulevard Club has built a reputation around time honoured traditions, exemplary service, and unrivalled athletics programs for all ages and abilities, including tennis, badminton, water sports, fitness, swimming, basketball, pickleball, and more.

We pride ourselves on creating an exceptional Member experience thanks to an equally diverse and inclusive team. We know that our team members are vital to the success of the Club, which is why we hire well and enjoy developing and rewarding our team.

If you would like to work and learn from a team of professionals and build your career at one of Toronto’s top private clubs, The Boulevard Club may be a good fit.

As an employee of The Boulevard Club, you will enjoy a high quality pleasant working environment and the following benefits:

  • Education & Professional Development Assistance
  • Employee Health & Wellness Program
  • Extensive medical and dental benefits for Employees and their families
  • Summer and Holiday Bonus (eligibility criteria applies)
  • Meal Plan
  • Bike Share TO
  • Night Transportation Assistance
  • Summer Recognition Program
  • Complimentary Parking (subject to availability)

Job Overview

Reporting to the Facilities Manager and Night Supervisor, this person will perform tennis court maintenance and repairs as well as will ensure the Club property and equipment are maintained in good working order and well presented for the benefit of Members and Staff. Specific duties would include, but are not limited to:

  • Maintains tennis courts (including watering, dragging, sweeping, rolling, court amenities, etc.) and grounds within and around the tennis courts, including the tennis patio (cleaning, tidying, set up/take down of the patio).
  • Monitors air temperatures and pressure readings of the tennis bubbles and takes immediate action to correct incorrect conditions.
  • Performs nightly walk rounds within the Club’s property.
  • Clears snow from doorways, walkways, around structures and applies salt/ice melter product to outdoor surfaces as required.
  • Performs general cleaning tasks such as windows, spider webs, doors, handles, etc. as required.
  • Provides support (physical and/or skilled labour) to other departments as directed.

Job Qualifications

  • Related post-secondary education and/or skills and experience
  • Awareness of health and safety
  • Private Club industry experience an asset
  • Ability to speak, read and write English
  • Pleasant personality appropriate for a hospitality environment

We thank all candidates for their interest, however only those being considered for an interview will be contacted.

The Boulevard Club is an inclusive work environment and as such, has a workplace accommodation policy in place. Accommodations are available, upon request, for the interview process and other selection stages for job applicants with accessibility needs. Please contact Human Resources to discuss further.



About boulevardclub.com:

The Boulevard Club is a family-oriented waterfront community that embraces caring, friendly individuals in an environment that celebrates diversity, respect and teamwork.Our Workplace Values are: Caring, Creativity, Diversity, Friendliness, Fun, Integrity, Respect and Teamwork.

title: Building Maintenance
description:
Weâ€™re growing!! And looking for a detail-oriented and enthusiastic candidate to join our team for the position of Building Maintenance located in Windsor, Ontario. This is an ideal FULL-TIME and LIVE-IN opportunity for someone who is mechanically inclined and loves a challenge! 

Duties include:

  • Maintaining the physical integrity of the building through general maintenance and up-keep of the assigned properties.
  • Cleaning and repairing items in vacant and occupied units (minor plumbing, electrical, carpentry, etc).
  • Completing physically demanding work which includes the use of ladders, power tools and occasionally lifting up to 50 pounds.
  • Applying knowledge of building HVAC, plumbing, electrical, DDC BAS systems and life safety systems. 

Qualifications:

  • Proven relevant mechanical/electrical aptitude and trouble-shooting skills.
  • General understanding of basic plumbing, electrical and carpentry.
  • Ability to troubleshoot and problem solve effectively. 
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills required.
  • Ability to multi-task and remain detail oriented.
  • Ability to work independently as well as with a team.
  • Ability to lift up to 50lbs.
  • Ability to bend, push and pull as well as go up and down stairs.
  • PC skills are an asset (Word, Excel, e-mail/web).

Education & Experience:

  • High School Diploma and 5 years work related experience.
  • Previous experience in residential maintenance or related field.
  • Previous experience renting apartments and assisting tenants an asset.
  • Knowledge of applicable legislation respecting residential tenancies in Ontario and the rights and obligations of Landlords and Tenants an asset. 

Why you want to work here:

  • Providing great customer service is something you thrive on.
  • You get a thrill from staying organized and details are your â€œthingâ€.
  • Being part of a great team has been your dream.
  • Working for a growing company that supports environmental stewardship and social responsibilities is a must for you.
  • You are a jack-of-all-trades and love working with your hands!

*Please note that all Skyline buildings, apartment units, and premises are smoke free, with the exception of a designated outdoor smoking area*

How to Apply:
Online: www.skylineonline.ca/careers
Fax: 519 341 0178

The Skyline Group of Companies is comprised of four primary entities to oversee its real estate investment, development, asset management and property management interests. The Skyline Group prides itself on its continuous ability to achieve its objective of owning and managing viable, reputable and accretive commercial and multi-residential real estate. We offer our employees competitive pay, benefits, paid volunteer day, on-going training, growth potential and so much more. Our workplace culture empowers staff at all levels of Skyline to become involved in supporting and building vibrant communities.

Building Careers and Communities!

title: Maintenance Millwright 433a - Weekend Shift
company: The Wohl Group - Recruitment Made Easy!
description:
Summary:

In this position you will be reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor. As the Maintenance
Mechanic, you will be responsible for maintaining equipment in the entire facility on the
Weekend Night Shift.

Shift: Weekend Nights shift (Friday to Sunday – 6:00 pm to 6:00 am)

Primary Responsibilities:
  • Extremely Safety conscious, practice safe work habits and maintain work areas in a 5S environment. Follow and enforce all our safety policies with great care and due diligence.
  • To maintain and support the facility and all facility and production related equipment.
  • Respond to equipment breakdowns or malfunctions on a priority basis.
  • Analyze, identify, evaluate and troubleshoot the problems to determine the points of errors and make the necessary repairs
  • Identify the RCCA and turn backs to make the necessary proactive measures to eliminate future equipment issues.
  • This position requires a sound knowledge of troubleshooting and repairs of production and surface treatment machinery including:
  • Automatic tool changers, Work/Pallet Changers, Axis support/motor replacement and main spindle support/motor replacement etc.
  • Steam systems, pumps, piping, chillers and general chemical handling equipment
  • Demonstrated proficiency reading and interpretation of schematics, both North American and European, and have a full understanding of Feedback devices, Measuring systems (Heidenhain, Inductosyn etc.), Relay logic, Electronics, PLC, and Motor controls both VSD’s and conventional.
  • Proficiency with Mechanical/Hydraulic and Pneumatic concepts related to Machine tools.
  • Completing SAP work orders with accurate notations and files on the equipment and also ordering the necessary parts as required.
  • Fully support ACE focus on the TPM process.
  • Coordinating and scheduling repairs with Shop load and/or contractors.
  • Experience in Vibration analysis and/or Laser operations, Machine alignments, and general Machine tool maintenance.
  • Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing and Continuous Improvement.
  • Ability to operate CNC controls in Maintenance mode.
  • Strong understanding of Machine diagnostics.

Basic Qualifications:
  • Certificate from a University, College or Technical school in the trade of Licensed Mechanic/Millwright(433A )is Mandatory and holding and Industrial Electrician License (442) is considered an asset.
  • Minimum 5 - 10 years experience in a manufacturing environment; previous experience with CNC PLC controls/drives and general chemical handling equipment is required.
  • Must be willing to work the Weekend Nights shift (Friday to Sunday – 6pm to 6am)
  • Successful candidate must meet all requirements under ITAR and CCGP
Salary Range: $40-50/hr
***Only qualified candidates who meet all of the requirements will be contacted for interview. Thank you and good luck with your search.

title: Maintenance Technician
company: Northview Canadian High Yield Residential Fund
description:
Description: Maintenance team members play a key role in ensuring that Northview’s buildings show pride of ownership and respect for our residents, by making sure they are kept in good repair, and that maintenance issues are resolved in a timely and cost efficient manner

Responsibilities:

  • Ensuring the safety of common areas, and complying with Northview’s Health and Safety requirements
  • With a  focus on customer service, troubleshoot and prioritize work orders and handle emergency situations
  • Drywall repairs, painting prep and painting
  • Minor electrical repairs
  • Minor plumbing repairs, including boiler checks and hot water tank replacements where applicable
  • Perform water and sewer line repairs where applicable
  • Dealing with subcontract labour
  • Maintain company vehicle where applicable
  • Assisting with and or performing suite renovations and other upgrades
  • Moving furniture, equipment, materials and supplies, including clearing of vacant units
  • Maintain clean vacant lots, removal of garbage and debris from building and grounds
  • Maintain tools and equipment
  • Snow removal and ice control from all entrances/exits and walkways as required
  • Delivery of notices to building residents and posting of notices in common areas
  • Completion of suite inspections
  • Assisting with the development and implementation of preventive maintenance programs
  • Other related duties as assigned by the manager

Qualifications:

  • Able to work independently, is a self-starter and takes pride in a job well done
  • Three years' previous experience in building maintenance
  • Proven ability to work productively and safely while under pressure
  • Good customer service skills and pleasant demeanor
  • An ability to speak and write English fluently
  • Able to lift up to 50lbs
  • Able to provide a criminal record check free of relevant convictions
  • Hold a valid driver’s license with a clean drivers abstract
  • Flexible schedule, able to work on call and weekends as needed

Why Northview

Northview Canadian High Yield Residential Fund (“Northview”) owns and operates real estate properties across six provinces and two territories with a portfolio of approximately $1.9 billion in assets consisting of approximately 11,000 multi-residential units, 1.1 million sq. ft of commercial space, and 200 executive suites. Northview’s Class A Units trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange (“TSX”) under the symbol “NHF.UN” along with two classes of unlisted units.

At Northview, we are a passionate, community-focused team dedicated to making our properties the best they can be. We are proud to live, work, and play in the neighborhoods we serve, next to our residents, hotel guests and commercial tenants.

Northview is committed to health and safety in the workplace for the protection of its employees, residents, tenants, and guests. As a condition of employment, all Northview employees are expected to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or can provide reason for exemption based on a protected ground under applicable human rights legislation. The successful candidate will be required to demonstrate their vaccinated status or reason for exemption before they start work with Northview. Northview will review and consider requests for exemption and will accommodate where required. Personal preference is not sufficient grounds for an exemption.

title: Facilities Maintenance Mechanic – (CAT 27) – HVAC
description:
Are you passionate about reaching new heights, teamwork and making a meaningful contribution? Do you picture yourself as a valued member of an industry-leading organization? If you answered yes to these questions, Air Canada is seeking enthusiastic individuals to join the diverse and vibrant team working together to lead the growth and expansion of Canada’s flag carrier.

Description:

  • Perform preventative maintenance & servicing, to Building related HVAC equipment.
  • Investigate and troubleshoot faulty Boilers, Chillers, Air Handling units, Rooftop units.
  • Ability toinstall, maintain, repair, dismantle, and reassemble HVAC related components
  • Ability to work at heights, form a scissor lift, boom lift or catwalks.
  • Perform minor repairs including replacement of Filters, belts, bearings, ignition controls
  • Preform visual inspections of buildings to maintain Building Code standards.
  • Ensure all work is completed in a safe manner and complies with applicable industry standards.
  • Performing other facility related duties as requested.
  • Team oriented individual with demonstrated ability to work unsupervised and self directed.
  • Able to work under pressure.
  • Able to work shifts, including weekends & participate in on-call rotation

  • MandatoryCovid-19 Vaccination Required
  • Must posses a valid DVS (Diploma of Vocational Studies).
  • Must posses valid Driver’s licence with clean abstract
  • Must posses 313A Certification or equivalent
  • Must Posses G1/G2 Gas licence Certification
  • Minimum 5 years field experience.
  • Knowledge of building mechanics, Complex HVAC systems, Mechanical system operation, Building Automation, CMMS
  • Candidate must have excellent written and oral communication skills and be detailed oriented.
  • Basic computer knowledge (Word, Excel, e-mail and internet).
  • Employees in this role, conduct safety-critical work and as such, Air Canada medical standards must be met in order to qualify for the role. Candidates will be subject to a medical evaluation, including a drug and alcohol test and are expected to be free of any intoxicating substances.
  • Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibly of the candidates applying for this position.

Linguistic Requirements:

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

Diversity and Inclusion

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees’ unique contributions to our company’s success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

title: Industrial Maintenance Assistant - Manufacturing
description:
Location: Winnipeg, MB, CanadaJob Type: PermanentDate: 4/4/2022Job ID: DS44147744Category: Engineering & Technical
If you are a talented and experienced Industrial Maintenance Assistance with experience in Manufacturing, Deborah Sutherland, Senior Consultant at David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you!  Our client, a leader in their field, has partnered with David Aplin Group to grow their team in Headingly, MB, to assist the Maintenance Manager with diversified duties such as installing, repairing, troubleshooting, and maintaining manufacturing moulds and processing equipment.
 
Benefits & Perks
  • Full benefits
  • $45,000 to $50,000
  • Opportunity to work with a successful team in a family environment

Responsibilities
  • Complete maintenance and repairs on manufacturing moulds
  • Complete scheduled preventative maintenance on all processing, production, and building equipment
  • Perform minor repairs on the production equipment, including potential hydraulic leaks, based on daily requirements
  • Periodically check all work done by employees for the daily and weekly preventative maintenance of their equipment
  • Train employees on completing daily clean up of the equipment they are using 
  • After-hours response to emergency equipment breakdowns may be required
  • Comply with safety regulations and maintain clean and orderly work areas

Qualifications
  • 2+ years of industrial maintenance in a manufacturing environment preferred
  • Strong mechanical background with the ability to dismantle and replace components of equipment/ tools
  • Ability to read and understand hydraulic and electrical schematics along with experience in minor hydraulic repairs (dismantling, replacing seals or valves)
  • Able to use a Voltmeter (voltage, amperage, and continuity measuring)
  • Valid driver's license and preference is given to those certified on both Forklift and Sky Lift (onsite training possible)
  • Flexibility to respond to issues outside of regular working hours as needed
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills including Microsoft Office


If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.


David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Contract Millwright Apprentice-2nd or 3rd year
description:
You already LOVE us and the SNACKS WE MAKE

Chips, Cookies, Crackers, Wafers, Cheese Curls, Popcorn, Tortilla Chips... yeah, we make them ALL! Shearer's is the company behind all your favorite snack brands.

We have nearly 5,000 associates in 11 state-of-the-art manufacturing and warehouse sites in North America that produce over 800 million pounds of snacks per year.  Did you know that we buy 20% of all the potatoes grown in the US?  WOW!

And we know what you're thinking…how can I get my hands on some free goodies?Our team members can crunch on oodles of free snacks – everyday!

 

 Contract Millwright Apprentice- 2nd or 3rd year

Monday to Friday 3PM- 11PM  - Guelph, Canada 

Pay Rate is based on on apprentice level: $30.48/hr for 2nd yr apprentice; $32.49/hr for 3rd yr apprentice; $30.03 for end of 3rd year apprenticeship; $38.19/hr for Ticketed Millwright

Your seat at the best snacks table

Are you a motivated, focused and eager leader looking for an opportunity where you can make a difference from day one? Then we want you! This is a contract position that will run through September 2nd, 2022. 

What you bring to the party

We are building the best team in the food industry, and we're looking for people like you who possess the following:

  • Maintains the building premises, inside and outside performs minor and major repair. Major repairs are performed under the supervision of licensed maintenance associates.
  • Perform and/or report minor maintenance repairs of preventive maintenance procedures on building mechanical equipment on a scheduled basis; inspects belts, checks fluid levels, replaces filters, greases bearings, seals, repairs or replaces broken parts etc.
  • Maintenance helper assists maintenance technicians in installing, maintaining and repairing equipment and machinery. Their duties include: handing tools, supplies and materials to other workers; preparing the work area; and cleaning the work area or equipment.
  • Maintains records of scheduled maintenance procedures
  • Completes daily, weekly and monthly checklists on building equipment maintenance procedures and maintains records of scheduled maintenance procedures
  • General filter changes on all mechanical and electrical equipment
  • May be assigned work in elevated areas within the plant using ladders or aerial lift platform and successfully obtaining license

These Qualifications are required of the successful candidate:

  • Self-starter, working with minimal supervision
  • Must follow all safety regulations while working
  • Must be comfortable working at various heights
  • Must be a 2nd or 3rd year maintenance apprentice
  • Must have a full complement of personal/professional hand tools
  • This person must be available to work Monday to Friday 3pm-11pm

Please note: we have the following allergens in our facility:  Peanuts, Wheat, Whey, Dairy and Soya

You will be considered for employment in our inclusive workplace

Shearer's Foods Canada, Inc. is committed to providing accommodation for applicants with disabilities; please advise us if you require accommodation during the recruitment process.

 

This is your invitation to apply now!

title: General Building Maintenance Associate
description:
Company Description

Looking for a change, an opportunity to show your exceptional skills, a chance to help lead and build a team? Grow your career with a company that shares your passion!

Contributing to The Well-Being and Quality of Our Consumers

The well-being of our consumers is at the heart of Sodexo's approach, customer engagement is integral in the services provided by Sodexo employees in various locations across Canada. We work closely with our consumers and clients to create an interactive and personalized environment for the well-being of everyone we serve.

Sodexo is proud to announce these nominations:  2021 Canada’s Best Diversity Employer; 2021 Canada’s Greenest Employers; 2020 Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index featured company; 2020 Parity Certification - Platinum level and Progressive Aboriginal Relations (PAR) Program company – Gold Level.

What We Can Offer You

Sodexo offers you a flexible and dynamic work environment, competitive compensation, access to ongoing training and development programs, and countless opportunities to grow within the company.

Job Description

Sodexo is growing! We are looking for a General Building Maintenance Coordinator to join our dynamic team. This position is a full-time role(specify type of schedule: FULL TIME ). You will be offered is a great team environment, work/life balance and the ability to ensure customer satisfaction.

Qualifications

You are a dynamic and reliable person with good communication and interpersonal skills. You are committed to quality assurance and safety.

During your mandate, you will be asked to perform light maintenance work including plumbing, carpentry, painting and plastering. You will be required to perform tasks such as, but not limited to, changing light bulbs, installing paper dispensers, changing filters, changing door locks, performing minor decorative maintenance and other tasks that do not require a journeyperson or skilled tradesperson. You will identify and correct unsafe working conditions under the supervision of management. You will be required to assist at special events as needed, assist skilled workers and subcontractors/vendors. You will also be responsible for performing moving services as required.

You will be attending training programs (classroom and virtual) as needed, comply with all company safety and risk management policies and procedures, perform all work in accordance with established safety procedures, participate in regular safety meetings, safety training and hazard assessments.  Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned as required

You must have a high school diploma, GED or equivalent experience. Minimum of one-year related experience. Bilingualism is an asset and you must have the ability to occasionally lift up to 50 pounds.

What's Next?

If you're looking for a role where you can truly impact the lives of others, click "I'm interested" for a quick 5-minute online application.



Additional Information

Sodexo is committed to Employment Equity and Diversity. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of national origin, race, religion, ethnicity, age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other federal, provincial, or local protected class.

We welcome and encourage applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates who participate in all aspects of the selection process. 

Thank you for your interest in Sodexo.

Please note that only selected candidates will be contacted.

Follow us on social media to see first-hand what we are all about!  

Instagram: @SodexoCanadaCareers

Twitter: @SodexoJobsCA

LinkedIn: Sodexo Canada Careers

Facebook: Sodexo CA Jobs

title: Banff Gondola, Building Maintenance Supervisor
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?

Maintain and contribute to a safe and healthy workplace by performing facilities maintenance.

What perks can you expect?

  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe 
  • Work experience in an iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location 
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuit’s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an inclusive culture and make life-long friends 
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth or future work at other Pursuit locations 
  • Access to one of the world’s most beautiful and iconic National Parks 

What will you do in this job?

  • Maintain and contribute to a safe and healthy workplace by performing facilities maintenance, always ensuring all safety procedures are enforced
  • Monitor and maintain building systems such as heating, electrical, plumbing and mechanical components
  • Carry out daily, weekly and monthly inspections of upper and lower buildings and grounds
  • Carry out minor electrical and plumbing work such as changing light bulbs and replacing furnace filters
  • Carry out minor building cosmetic repairs such as patches and painting
  • Supervise front line operations employees
  • Ensure that all department operations are properly executed, and all Banff Gondola safety and operational policies and procedures are followed
  • Ensure that each guest interaction is friendly and professional
  • Contribute to the overall cleanliness of all gondola facilities particularly in the operations department areas
  • Perform other duties as assigned by the Operations Manager

What skills and experience do you need for this job?

  • General carpentry, plumbing and electrical experience
  • Journeyman Certifications an asset
  • Proven history of safe work practices
  • Proven supervisory experience
  • Computer knowledge and experience
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Ability to take direction under stressful conditions
  • Class 5 driving license
  • First aid training an asset

What will your work environment be like?

  • Beautiful. You’ll work in iconic, unforgettable and inspiring locations. You’ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. You’ll participate in team events – and fun! 
  • Independent. You’ll spend your days in and around national parks. 
  • Remote. Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog. Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of through WiFi 
  • Busy. You need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required 

This job description describes this role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up. We work as a team and believe that we succeed together – these job duties may change based on the needs of the team and company as a whole. 

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in Alberta, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in Canada is required. 

#HKAB

EEO Information

Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Maintenance Person
description:
Our client is a private real estate partnership, was established in 2004 with a mandate to acquire and operate income producing properties the Yukon. Since then, they expanded outside of Whitehorse with investments in Carcross, Dawson City, and Mayo, while still growing it’s Whitehorse base. 

The Maintenance position reports directly to the Maintenance Manager. You will achieve excellence by facilitating the day-to-day maintenance of the properties including the Downtown Coast Hotel, Midnight Sun Hotel, and the staff accommodation buildings. The position will oversee minor repairs and improvements, preventative maintenance, championing life & safety standards, collaborating with the Whitehorse head office on major repairs and improvements and supporting other operational departments. Your efforts will align to deliver the best quality products, improve both guest and employee satisfaction and deliver against key financial goals and performance metrics for your department. Relocation assistance may be provided for the right candidate.

Responsibilities:
  • Inspecting the condition of the property is an important part of the job; maintain and promptly repair what you can.
  • Document and report immediately all deficiencies you can’t fix.
  • Meeting with your team daily, weekly and monthly; keeping your people informed of property and corporate goals.
  • Achieving a target of 50% conversion ratio on all incoming inquiries Guarding our guests and your own personal safety and security is paramount; you must know and practice all emergency procedures for the hotel and policies that protect the privacy and security of our guests and yourself.
  • Owning the guest experience by maintaining the physical building, grounds, guest rooms, and amenities to their fullest potential.
  • Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variables in situations where only limited resources/solutions exist. Must be able to respond to emergencies when not on site.
Education:
  • Secondary School Diploma
  • Trade Qualification in one or more of the following: electrical, plumbing, HVAC, or refrigeration an preferred
  • Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) training an asset
  • Able to obtain a clear criminal record check
Skills:
  • Physical mobility and stamina
  • Experience working with contractors and sub-trades
  • Excellent communication, specifically written and oral English, and customer service skills
  • Excellent knowledge of health and safety regulations
  • Attention to details;
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a group environment;
  • Ability to prioritize workload and adjust to shifting priorities;
  • Strong work ethic, respectful and reliable;
  • Excellent written, oral, listening and communication skills;
  • Valid driver’s license.
  • Clear criminal record
Compensation: $20 to $24 Hourly
Extended Benefits, Life Insurance, Paid vacation and sick leave, hotel and flight discounts
Security & Building Maintenance
Duration: Permanent
Job Level: Assistant

Anyone who can legally work in Canada can apply for this job. If you are not currently authorized to work in Canada, the employer will not consider your job application.

title: Préposé(e) à l'entretien du bâtiment
description:
Rôle

Le (la) préposé(e) à l'entretien du bâtiment assure l'entretien régulier de l'immeuble hôtellier. 

Responsabilités

  • Aider au nettoyage, à la maintenance et aux réparations sur divers équipements ,
  • Effectuer les travaux d’entretien général et de réparation,
  • Participer aux rénovations.

Qualités recherchées:

  • Polyvalente et autonome
  • Avec le souci du détail
  • Une attitude positive et un sourire contagieux
  • Un service clientèle hors pair comme première priorité

title: Handyman (FT)
description:
Goals & Outcomes:
Assist with a variety of service projects and installations at various sites. Customer service and attention to detail are critical skills to ensure that projects are completed to Customer specifications. 

Responsibilities include:
  • Efficiently completes all daily work orders in a specific amount of time. Communicates any delays in completing a work order with the supervisor.
  • Troubleshoot and repair maintenance issues involving electrical, plumbing and carpentry.
Knowledge and Skills:
  • Knowledge of carpentry, experience with door and window installation, and lock repair.
  • Ability to perform basic arithmetic skills such as measurement, addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
  • Candidate must have computer skills that include knowledge of MS Office suite.
Work Environment/Physical Demands:
  • Extensive daily travel around northern Alberta
  • Be able to climb ladders multiple times a day.
  • Lift 75 lbs.
  • Work long hours.
  • Experience using hand tools.
  • Experience using small power tools.
  • Take direction from supervisors.
  • Detail-oriented.
  • Fast learner.
  • Valid Full driver's license.




    About Paramount Services:

    Paramount Service Ltd. began as Paramount Restaurant Service Ltd. over 25 years ago. Since then, the company has evolved into a full-service equipment supply and facility maintenance company based from Winnipeg, Manitoba. Our presence is focused in South West Ontario & North West Ontario, Manitoba and Saskatchewan but we have strong partnerships spanning coast-to-coast-to-coast across Canada. As part of our full-service commitment throughout the country, we employ refrigerationber, HVAC, plumbing and electrical journeymen, handymen, general labourers and we have over 600 subcontractors at our disposal. Our customer relationships are based on our performance and built on trust. As a result, our customers ask us if we can do more, and we do. From general contracting to minor service calls, landscape and parking lot maintenance, to hot and cold beverage services, equipment sales to preventative maintenance – we do it all.

title: Certified Millwright (Prince George, BC, CA)
description:
Posting ID:   22668
Position Type:  Regular  
City: Prince George, BC, Canada 
Location: Intercontinental Pulp (BC17) 

 

You are a Certified Millwright who knows the ins and outs of keeping a mill’s machinery up and running. You have a natural ability to diagnose and resolve complex mechanical issues and you're looking to expand your knowledge with an amazing company where safety and sustainability are the most important priorities. If this speaks to you, this opportunity, at our Pulp Mill in Prince George, BC might just be your calling. 

 

This is your opportunity to use your Red Seal technical chops, communication, and troubleshooting skills to keep our modern pulp mill running at peak performance.  You will be working alongside the best and brightest in the business with an innovative leader in the forest products industry.

 

At a minimum, you bring your Red Seal certification and for bonus points, you've got a couple of years of experience in an industrial or wood products manufacturing environment, so you can recognize why we’re consistently rated amongst BC’s best employers. You’re a Millwright who is a critical thinker, problem-solver, and quick learner who brings a “can-do” attitude to everything you do. Come make a difference and build your career with Canfor!

 

At Canfor, diversity means understanding, recognizing and valuing the differences that make each person unique. We see inclusion and diversity as an essential part of our productivity, creativity, innovation and competitive advantage. We strive for a fair and equitable recruitment process, where hiring decisions are based on the individual qualifications and experience of each applicant. 

 

We are not your run of the mill forest products company, join us and find out why. #canfortalent

Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook for Canfor news, career opportunities, and upcoming events!

Prince George, BC
Known as BC’s Northern Capital, Prince George is city that offers big city comfort and convenience, but small town serenity and sensibilities. As the largest city in northern BC, Prince George is a hub of industry, offering numerous employment opportunities and is home to the University of Northern British Columbia. This region’s temperate climate creates a lush environment of emerald-green forests and ample opportunities for outdoor activity. For more information, visit http://canfor.com/our-company/our-communities/prince-george

title: Maintenance Technician - Rotating Shift
description:
Are you a â€œfoodieâ€ and love cookies, muffins and pancakes?  Are you are looking for a company where we place high value on teamwork, collaboration, innovation?  Are you looking to gain experience and grow your career with a successful international company?

If you are looking to do the best work of your career, be a part of an extraordinary company and have a passion for what we do, we want to hear from you!

Cerelia Bakery Canada is currently looking to add some awesome new team members to our facility in Mississauga, ON. You will be a critical part of delivering our products to customers everywhere!

About Cerelia Bakery Canada:

We develop and produce exceptionally high-quality products including: Fresh & frozen cookie dough and muffin batter in pre-portion sizes and scoop and bake pails for the foodservice industry as well as in-store bakeries of North American grocery, mass and club stores.

Our baked gourmet cookies and muffins are produced for distribution through multiple channels, including quick service restaurants. Refrigerated products including cookie, pastry and biscuit dough sold to North American Grocery Stores in a variety of formats including canister, chub, break-and-bake and place-and-bake.

Our Research and Development is on-going, aimed at introducing new and exciting products to complement our delectable bakery lines. We are an aggressive, flexible company dedicated to providing quality products that satisfy customer needs and market place demands.

Most importantly, we are GROWING.  As we grow, our team members grow with us.  

About this Position:

The Maintenance Technician will be responsible to carry out preventative maintenance, maintain the day-to-day operations and to assume responsibility for maintaining the physical activities of various assets of the Company including the general maintenance and upkeep of equipment and machinery to minimize production down time.   The Maintenance Technician is responsible for maintaining electrical, mechanical, and other related systems.  The Maintenance Technician must be prepared to work as a team member and with minimal supervision, follow all safety and food safety procedures, and have a high threshold for heat in a manufacturing environment. 

Job Duties and Responsibilities (include but not limited to):

  1. Contribute to the resolution of system and equipment breakdowns and general maintenance tasks such as troubleshooting and equipment modification.
  2. Troubleshoot process and production issues sufficient to facilitate repairs.
  3. Completion of documentation related to preventative maintenance, repairs, safety, inventory and process/procedures.
  4. Perform maintenance and repair of production line and Packaging equipment.
  5. Utilize welding, fabrication, pneumatics and hydraulic skills for equipment repair.
  6. Adhering to all policies, procedures and programs of the company (GMP, Quality, Food Safety, Health & Safety etc) at all times.
  7. Other related duties and assigned.

Key Behavioural Competencies:

  • Communication
  • Energy & Stress
  • Teamwork         
  • Time Management
  • Adaptability/ Flexibility
  • Thinking, Decision Making and Judgement
  • Planning and Organizing
  • Problem Solving
  • Result Focus
  • Accountability and Dependability
  • Ethics and Integrity
  • Attention to Detail
  • Read/Fill out Paperwork

Working Conditions

  • Weekend work required
  • Overtime as required
  • Fast paced environment
  • Physical Demands: Bend, Carry, Lift, Push/Pull, Reach, Standing for long periods
  • Ability to work in a hot/cold environment
  • Competitive Pay Depending on Experience 
  • Hourly Wage CAD 22 -CAD 28

What you will receive in return:

  • Competitive Hourly Compensation.
  • Fully Employer Paid Medical Insurance includes Dental & Vision.
  • Life Insurance
  • 2 Weeks Paid Vacation.
  • RRSP
  • Comprehensive training program, tailored to each individual - regardless if you're a food manufacturing veteran or new to the industry, we will ensure you receive the training you need to succeed.
  • Clean and safe production facility.
  • Career advancement opportunities.

Cerelia Bakery welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If you are eager and excited to work with a company driven by quality, commitment to excellence, and an awesome product, we want to hear from you!

title: Maintenance Team Leader (Weekend Shift)
description:
Job Number: 42736 
Group: Magna Exteriors  
Division: Plastcoat 
Job Type: Permanent/Regular 
Location: BRAMPTON 

 

Group Description

The Magna Exteriors portfolio of products includes access systems such as liftgates, exterior trim, modular systems, front-end modules including fascia, active aerodynamic systems and other lightweight structural components for automotive, commercial truck and other industrial markets.

Recognized globally as an innovator in all aspects of vehicle exteriors, Magna provides everything needed, from materials development and design through manufacturing and assembly, to help automakers create sleek, state-of-the-art vehicles across the world.

 

Key Responsibilities

•    Manage scheduled Maintenance shift and motivate/steer team toward objectives
•    Manage and coordinate Maintenance department operational activities on the shift as required to achieve safety, quality, housekeeping, and productivity
•    Utilize the employee corrective action and progressive discipline process as required
•    Perform scheduled audits 
•    Maintain and approve employee work hours and attendance records to support accurate payroll 
and HR records through the Workforce Now system
•    Report on team metrics and activities
•    Facilitate a supportive and cooperative team atmosphere
•    Educate team members on current and new Plastcoat policies
•    Allocate shift resources to support effective management of the departmental workload for repairs and improvement projects based on requirements and competency
•    Assist in resource recruitment, planning, training and development of staff
•    Work with the Maintenance Coordinator to ensure adequate supplies and spare parts inventories are maintained
•    Assist other Maintenance staff in carrying out maintenance work as instructed by the Department Manager
•    Ensure maintenance staff levels are adequately maintained during required work hours
•    Engage the team and participate in troubleshooting/diagnosis of malfunctions of equipment, focus on root cause determination and guide permanent corrective action implementation
•    Support planning and scheduling of plant and equipment repairs, preventive maintenance, and other departmental initiatives.
•    Enforce lockout procedure and other maintenance-related safety procedures
•    Communicate with other department leads as required
•    Complete and maintain effective documentation. Utilize, and ensure all technicians adequately use the department’s computerized Maintenance Management software.
•    Maintain confidentiality and integrity 
•    Supervise staff within the department, providing training, mentoring and performance management to ensure employee productivity and effectiveness
•    Perform regular formal/informal workplace inspections
•    Report all accidents/incidents and unsafe conditions/behavior
 

•    Perform and ensure team performs all job functions in a safe and healthful manner, abiding by all health, safety and environmental rules and regulations, promoting safety in the workplace
•    Train employees on the specific job hazards
•    Enforce safety rules and correct unsafe acts or conditions
•    Be involved in the accident/incident investigation process 
•    Inform Plastcoat Management of any additional training or resources required by their employees to effectively perform their work
•    Adhere to applicable quality systems and IATF 16949 standards
•    Adhere to and promote the Employee Charter and work within the rules, regulations and guidelines of the Plastcoat Employee Handbook 
•    Comply with the requirements of C-TPAT/PIP
•    Conduct business in an ethical manner in compliance with the Magna Code of Conduct
•    Encourage and support the Open Door Process, as well as the Fairness Committee and Employee Advocate 

•    Ensure that all employee questions, suggestions and concerns are addressed in a timely manner; communicate regularly with all employees
•    Participate in and support Continuous Improvement initiatives
•    Maintain work area in accordance with the principles of 5S and operate daily within these standards
•    Ensure work area is kept neat and organized
 

Key Qualifications/Requirements

EDUCATION:
•    Skilled Trades Certificate of qualification as a Millwright / Industrial Electrician or similar or post-secondary education in a technical field
EXPERIENCE:
•    Experience in a leadership function preferred
•    Experience in automotive industry an asset
•    Minimum 2 years’ Injection Moulding experience
SKILLS:
•    Able to demonstrate proficiency in multi trade functions.  (Electrical/Hydraulic/Mechanical/PLC)
•    Strong leadership skills with the ability to coach, mentor and build effective teams
•    Strategic thinker
•    Results-oriented and able to work under pressure
•    Strong verbal and written communication skills
•    Computer literate in word & spreadsheet programs
•    Demonstrated ability to effectively solve problems
•    Strong interpersonal skills
•    Well-developed organizational and time management skills
 

Additional Information

Accommodations for disabilities in relation to the job selection process are available upon request.

Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.

At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That’s why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law.

title: Journeyman Millwright-Brooks, Alberta
description:
Journeyman Millwright-Brooks, Alberta

With approximately 3,300 employees, JBS Food Canada ULC ( JBS Canada ) is one of Canada's largest beef processors. Consisting of four locations the main processing facility located in Brooks, Alberta, where approximately 4,200 head of cattle are harvested and processed daily; the Head Office and a case ready plant, both based in Calgary, Alberta; and JBS Ontario, a case ready plant located in Belleville, Ontario. The JBS Canada facility in Brooks has the capacity to produce products ranging from boxed beef primals, ground beef, beef trimmings, beef by-products and hides which are shipped across Canada and worldwide. At the multi-protein Mountain Creek Farms case-ready facility in Calgary, JBS Canada produces value-added products including marinated, portion sized, multi-pack options, kebabs and much more. JBS Ontario in Belleville produces fresh meat and seafood products for leading retailers in Canada.

During the pandemic, we have implemented hundreds of safety measures including offering unlimited PPE, constructing permanent physical barriers, establishing physical distancing protocols, and installing hospital-grade ventilation systems in all of our facilities.

At JBS Canada, our people are our greatest asset. We are very proud to have a team of high achieving, engaged employees. We are currently seeking the Journeyman Millwright to join our team at our main processing facility in Brooks, AB.

NOTE: THIS ROLE WILL BE LOCATED IN BROOKS, AB

**RELOCATION ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE**

This Roles is eligible for the JBS Canada Critical Worker bonus program

As a member of the team you will be responsible for a variety of duties including:

  • Read blueprints, diagrams and schematic drawings to determine work procedures
  • Install, align, dismantle and move stationary industrial machinery and mechanical equipment, such as pumps, fans, tanks, conveyors, furnaces and generators according to layout plans using hand and power tools
  • Inspect and examine machinery and equipment to detect and investigate irregularities and malfunctions
  • Install, troubleshoot and maintain power transmission, vacuum, hydraulic and pneumatic systems, and programmable logic controls
  • Adjust machinery and repair or replace defective parts
  • Operate machine tools such as lathes and grinders to fabricate parts required during overhaul, maintenance or set-up of machinery
  • Clean, lubricate and perform other routine maintenance work on machinery
  • Construct foundations for machinery or direct other workers to construct foundations
  • Assemble machinery and equipment prior to installation using hand and power tools and welding equipment.

Requirements:

  • Completion of college/CEGEP/vocational or industrial mechanics (Millwright), Red Seal Endorsement experience an asset
  • 3 or more years in a maintenance function; demonstrated experienced in hands-on support of operations, technical and maintenance work teams; (inclusive of time spent as a millwright/industrial mechanic apprentice)
  • Leadership of a multi-disciplined work group during operating and turnaround situations would be considered an asset;
  • Technical strength coupled with good people skills, and good planning;
  • Basic computer skills, written and verbal communication skills;
  • Rotating and stationary equipment maintenance experience;
  • Foundation in Preventive and predictive maintenance systems;
  • RPS/RCM maintenance troubleshooting techniques;
  • Superior skills within your area of expertise.

Work Site Environment:Noisy, Odours, Hot, Cold/refrigerated.

Earn Competitive Wage from $41.75 to $43.00

Please note that Applicants will be asked to complete a pre-hire medical and drug and alcohol test. Any offer of employment to the Applicant will be conditional upon passing satisfactory completion of the medical and passing the drug and alcohol test.

Exceptional Benefits including:

Competitive Wage | Relocation Assistance | Extended Health/Medical Benefit | Group Life &Accidental Death Insurance | Short/Long Term Disability | Vision/Dental Care | Employee Beef Purchasing Program | Voluntary Employee RRSP Contributions | Employer RRSP Contributions | Medical Clinic on-site | Career Growth and Continued Training

JBS Food Canada ULC

www.jbsfoodcanada.ca

Mailing Address: PO Box 1868 Brooks AB T1R 1C6

Physical Location: 193002A Range Road 150, Brooks, Alberta, T1R 1C6

Telephone: 403-501-2223 Fax: 403-501-2239

title: Maintenance Technician I. WorldMark Canmore Resort
description:
Put the World on VacationAt Wyndham Destinations our mission is simple: to put the world on vacation. With a spirit of caring, creativity and fun, our teams help families and friends create memories that last a lifetime. As the world’s largest v...

Put the World on Vacation

At Wyndham Destinations our mission is simple: to put the world on vacation. With a spirit of caring, creativity and fun, our teams help families and friends create memories that last a lifetime. As the world’s largest vacation ownership company and part of Travel + Leisure Co., we’re shaping the future of the travel industry.

Essential Job Functions

The Maintenance Technician I performs all general facility maintenance under minimum supervision in a manner which ensures the preservation of optimum quality and efficient production.  Perform service requests and repairs as directed.  Perform maintenance work for make-ready units as directed.  Clean and inspect in building systems and report deficiencies to supervisor.  Adhere to the company’s safety programs. 

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Apply basic knowledge of repair and replacement of general fixtures, general repair includes: doors, windows, walls, flooring, ceilings, roofs, furniture, and cabinetry.  (45% time)
  • Perform general painting throughout the resort.  (10% time)
  • Apply general working knowledge of appliance and repair. (5% time)
  • Apply general working knowledge of in room maintenance. (15% time)
  • Clean and maintain outside landscape: including emptying trash, pick up of trash, general landscape work and ashtray cleanliness. (10% time)
  • Complete all necessary work orders and inventory requirements. (10% time)
  • Performs other duties as needed. (5% time)

Travel Requirements

No travel requirements for this role

Minimum Requirements and Qualifications

Education

  • High school diploma or equivalent preferred
  • CPO Certification may be required for some sites

Training requirements

  • Basic maintenance training 1-2 years
  • Basic landscape training 1-2 years (select sites)
  • Basic pool maintenance (select sites)

Knowledge and skills

  • Ability to complete work orders
  • Ability to take direction and complete tasks
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize assignments
  • Ability to test chemicals and ensure proper pool maintenance (select sites)

Technical Skills

  • Basic Plumbing
  • Drywall repair
  • Painting
  • Minor electrical
  • Minor carpentry
  • Minor appliance repair
  • Basic PC skills preferred

Job experience

  • 1 year maintenance experience is preferred

Unless there is a legal requirement, experience will be accepted for the education requirement.

A Place for Everyone

Hospitality is at the heart of all we do at Travel + Leisure Co., including how we treat each member of our growing community. Here, you’ll find a team that’s inclusive, values diversity, and is built on a foundational respect for people from all over the world.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to mycareer@wyn.com, including the title and the location of the position for which you are applying.

title: Maintenance Technician - South East, MB
description:
MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN – Steinbach MB
Steinbach, MB Area – Full Time Position
                                                                                                                          
POSITION SUMMARY
 
The Maintenance Technician will be responsible for providing general maintenance support and will be based out of the South East, MB area.  Travel will be required throughout the province of MB with the possibility of occasional travel to SK.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES 
  • General carpentry
  • Drywall repairs, painting
  • Basic plumbing
  • Moving furniture and equipment
  • Cleaning and organizing
  • Basic welding of stalls and crates
  • Installation of equipment such as feed and water lines and animal stalls
  • Preventative maintenance to generators, tractors and other equipment
  • Active contribution to the preventative maintenance program by submitting recommendations for improvement
  • Document and record all finished and unfinished scheduled work orders
  • Seek out and apply best practices as solutions to correct deficiencies
  • Conduct assessments and/or audits of facilities and/or equipment
  • Minimize production downtime by responding to production calls promptly
  • Provide on the job training to barn staff and other employees
  • Other related duties as assigned
 
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS: 
  • Grade 12 diploma
  • Trades related post-secondary education is preferred
  • Thorough working knowledge of general computer programs (Microsoft Office, Excel)
  • Ability to lift 25 kgs
  • One to three years related experience in general maintenance
  • A valid driver’s license and the ability to travel (including overnighting) within business operation
  • Self-directed/motivated team player
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to work in a livestock farm (hogs) atmosphere
  • Ability to adhere to all Biosecurity requirements
  • Knowledge of Health and Safety regulations
  • The ability to work at various heights and in confined spaces
  • An ability to live and teach our Maple Leaf Leadership Values
 
Please submit resume to:
Email:

mlafjobs@mapleleaf.com



Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees.  As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated by March 31, 2022 and to show proof of vaccination.   In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination by March 31, 2022 (or prior to their first day of work if the start date is after March 31, 2022).  We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position. We offer a diverse workforce inclusive to all.

title: Millwright - Afternoon shift
description:
Posted Date:4/28/2022
Job Category:
Position Title:Millwright - Afternoon shift
Salary Range:$37.00 - $39.30
Location:Bradford, Ontario, Canada
Desired Skills:
Description:Our client, a world class manufacturer, has an immediate requirement for an Industrial Millwright on their afternoon shift. This person is accountable to support the Maintenance function by preventing and repairing mechanical breakdowns.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:
Opportunity to work for a very well respected, world class manufacturer that has enjoyed many years of success and stability.
Paid additional training and development.
Excellent growth and advancement opportunities.
An excellent compensation package including:
- Competitive salary
- Excellent benefits
- RRSP matching
- Profit sharing

• Minimum Certified Tradesman (Maintenance Mechanic/Millwright)
• Minimum 1 year directly related trade experience in a manufacturing or industrial environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO:
• Perform repairs to machinery and plant support systems with regards to hydraulics, pneumatics, and mechanical problems

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
Company mission is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

We are seeking a full-time skilled building maintenance worker to support the Facilities team. The successful candidate will be accountable for, but not limited to overseeing and completing scheduled maintenance and emergency (after hours) repairs to building systems, response times of service requests, shipping and receiving, light repairs, grounds and equipment for appearance and safety.
We are looking for someone who can work on their own initiative, take responsibility, and represent the Facilities team following company standards with our goal of operational excellence and continual improvement in mind.

You Are Great At:
General Building Maintenance:
  • Conducts daily routine inspections of premises, equipment, and grounds
  • Completes daily visual inspections of building operating systems for proactive maintenance
  • Monitors work performed by 3rd party contractors, contact vendors and suppliers to obtain quotes and arranges for major repairs and maintenance work
  • Works with Facility Manager to establish, monitor and carry out preventative maintenance procedures and schedules
  • Ensures building and grounds meet all safety, security, and fire regulations according to policies and procedures
Maintains building maintenance manual for building operations

General Labour:
  • Performs general repairs that do not require a specialized technician. Examples may include carpentry, electrical, painting, mechanical and plumbing, maintenance, and repairs such as adjusting furniture, constructing shelves, basic appliance repairs, applying paint and other finishes, repairing drywall
  • Cleans external areas such as entranceways, sidewalks and parking lot stairwells using power washer, brooms, rakes, shovels, and other equipment to remove dirt, leaves, snow and other refuse.
  • Moving of equipment, furniture and supplies manually and/or using aides such as pump trucks, dollies, and carts
  • Manages the receipt of all products, materials, and supplies
  • Arrange furniture for special event set ups
  • Assist with minor MAC (Moves, Adds, & Changes) requests i.e. employee moves
  • Ensuring all your workspaces are kept organized, clean and safe
  • Orders and pick up supplies when necessary
  • All tools, equipment, and uniform to be supplied

What It Takes:
  • Basic knowledge of HVAC, and Building Automation Systems (BAS), on the job training offered
  • Basic knowledge of plumbing and electrical systems
  • Basic knowledge of mechanical systems
  • Basic computer skills, (ticketing system, outlook, office suite)
  • Skilled with various hand and power tools
  • Ability to prioritize tasks
  • Ability to read technical manuals and drawings
  • Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of employees, vendors, and suppliers
  • Ability to respond quickly for emergencies (leaks/heating etc.) outside of normal business hours
  • Prolonged periods standing and walking
  • Must be physically able to climb ladders, bend, or crawl into awkward spaces
  • Must be able to lift up to 40-50 pounds at a time
  • Have an eye for detail and strong time management skills
  • You will be well presented, and have an outgoing personality
  • High school diploma or equivalent
  • Minimum 4+ years of maintenance experience
  • Experience working in a corporate environment an asset
  • Valid driver’s license and vehicle required

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
Black & McDonald's Saskatchewan team is growing! If you are a hands-on, customer service-oriented, and technically-inclined professional searching for the opportunity to build a solid foundation for your career, this position is for you. The Maintenance Worker is located in Regina & 15 Wing Moose Jaw and reports directly to the Project Manager.

The Maintenance Worker is responsible for facility general maintenance and repairs, minor carpentry, drywall repair and painting, preventative maintenance, and assisting other trades.

  • Prepare areas for painting by repairing & patching surfaces.
  • Perform various duties to maintain the Facility including work associated with carpentry, furniture, drywall, painting, mechanical & plumbing repairs.
  • Assist with obtaining quotes, meet with sub-contractors and quote work.
  • Provide repairs and preventative maintenance to locks, doors & door closing systems.
  • Responsible for replacing locks, hinges, changing cores and adjusting door closers.
  • Assist other maintenance trades and perform other duties, e.g. changing filters or fan belts, preparing HVAC & plumbing systems for operation or winterization.
  • Assist in grounds keeping and snow removal
  • Performs daily rounds and log readings.
  • Complete maintenance records and work orders; input histories and comments as required.
  • Observe and implement safety regulations and practices.
  • Maintain the cleanliness of all sites, workspaces, and mechanical rooms.

COMPETENCY REQUIREMENTS

  • Communicates Effectively
  • Holds Self and Others Accountable
  • Teamwork and Collaboration
  • Values and Respects Others
  • Change Orientation
  • Continuous Learning
  • Customer Focus
  • Problem Solving & Innovation
  • Working Knowledge of Email Platforms & Calendars

WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

  • A minimum of 3 years' experience in all aspects of facility maintenance.

SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

  • Basic general maintenance knowledge and experience.
  • Knowledge of the Health and Safety Act and all applicable CSA Codes.
  • Must be able to speak, read & write in English.
  • Must work in compliance with the provisions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and the regulations including but not limited to: use or wear of equipment or protective devices or clothing for safety purposes, report any known contravention of this Act or regulations or the existence of any hazards.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills required.
  • Follow instructions both written and verbal.
  • Maintain a professional demeanor at all times with fellow employees and customer.
  • Maintain clear and courteous phone etiquette.
  • A team player, committed to working in a quality environment. 
  • Comply with all company policies and procedures and adhere to company standards.
  • Act in accordance with the commitment to safe and compassionate patient care and a safe and healthy work environment.
  • Must be able to lift up to 30 kg (bending and lifting is required).
  • Must be able to work on ladder or scaffold at various heights.
  • Must be able to pass Federal Security Clearance to work on military facilities.
  • Must provide proof of double vaccination to meet Covid protocols.

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities.  Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Utility Systems Technician - áƒá’¥á•á’§á‘¦ á‘á“ˆá“—á–•á’§á“ªá“— á±á“•á•†á”¨
description:
Employment Opportunity

Title:                     Utility System Technician

Department:      Public Works

Status:                  Full-time, 1-year term, 40 hour/week

Salary:                  $61,326.07

Settlement

Allowance:         $20,907.43

Union Status:     Unionized

Housing:              No Staff housing available

Closing Date:     Open until filled.

Under the direction of the Utilidor Foreman, the Utility System Technician is an entry level position responsible for assisting in the hands-on operation, repair and maintenance of all components making up the Utilidor system and sewage collection system to ensure efficient operations.  The Technician will assist in the normal operation, maintenance, preventative maintenance and repairs as required to ensure minimal interruption of water and sewer services. 

The incumbent must be willing to work in harsh outdoor weather conditions, some areas with obnoxious odors caused by waste as well as some confined spaces.  They must be willing to participate in training and other safety related courses pertaining to the position. 

Minimum Qualifications:

â€¢             Must have completed a grade 10 level of education

â€¢             2 to 3 years prior plumbing experience

â€¢             Valid class 5 Nunavut Drivers License

Preferred Qualifications:

â€¢             Journeyman plumbing or oil burning certification is an asset

â€¢             Additional training and certifications in a related field is an asset

â€¢             Related experience within a Municipal setting is an asset

â€¢             Experience working in piped water/sewage is an asset

â€¢             The ability to communicate in both Inuktitut and English is an asset

â€¢             The ability to be scheduled at the last minute

â€¢             Some overtime is necessary

Assets include the ability to speak and write in Inuktitut and or French

Equivalencies that include a combination of education, knowledge, skills and abilities to formal education may be considered.

Due to the nature of this position, a Criminal Record check and a clean driverâ€™s abstract are required of this position. 

Please visit our website https://www.iqaluit.ca/careers to apply.

  • The City of Iqaluit embraces the intent and spirit of the Nunavut Land Claims Agreement.  Priority will be given to Nunavut Inuit; Candidates must clearly identify their eligibility in order to receive consideration under this agreement.
  • Only those selected to interview will be contacted
