title: Maintenance Worker 5
description:
Job Description:
Job Title: Maintenance Worker 5
Work Site: Plant Maintenance, Vancouver General Hospital
Status: Temporary Full Time
Start Date: As soon as possible
Salary: $26.22 per hour

Hours:

 

0730-1530, Monday to Friday

Days off: Saturday, Sunday, Statutory Holidays

Reference#: 159756-lba

 

Come work as a Maintenance Worker with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Maintenance Worker to join the Plant Maintenance team at Vancouver General Hospital. Apply today to join our team!

 

As a Maintenance Worker at Vancouver Coastal Health you will:

  • Perform trades duties approaching the journeyman level in a variety of tradesâ€™ areas such as electrical, mechanical, plumbing, carpentry, painting, and welding.
  • Perform maintenance and repair duties related to buildings and equipment and perform mechanical and electrical repairs to equipment and systems.
  • Participate on the Rapid Response Team and as a member of the Maintenance team.
  • You will assist other team members in their duties to ensure a timely and complete delivery of service to our clients.
  • Act in various capacities, supporting maintenance in general terms.
  • Act as a customer service advocate, accelerating the resolution of customer concerns.

This position may require inter-site work assignments, and working in a support role to trades personnel.

 

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education & Experience

  • Grade 10, plus four (4) yearsâ€™ recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Knowledge & Abilities

  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?


VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.

  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff

Diversity, equity and inclusion are essential to delivering exceptional care and building a great place to work. At VCH, we value and accommodate unique differences to ensure that our staff and medical staff (both current and prospective) have the opportunity and are supported to thrive.

To build a strong and representative workforce, we are seeking candidates who will contribute to a caring and inclusive culture. We encourage applications from members of communities that are disadvantaged on any grounds under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including Indigenous Peoples, people of colour, people of all genders and sexualities and people with disabilities.

VCH is proud to be recognized as a Best Place to Work in Canada in 2021 by Glassdoor and Forbes.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.


***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Plant Maintenance Technician
description:
Overview

 

 

PLANT MAINTENANCE TECHNICIAN

 

Hermitage Processing Inc., a division of Cooke Aquaculture Inc., a dynamic and growing east coast family company, with Platinum Member status in the Canada’s Best Managed Companies Program has an opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join the Company’s Maintenance Team based out of our facility located in Hermitage, NL.Cooke is a global seafood company with operations in North America, Europe, and South America. Our company’s success is driven by our dynamic, highly-skilled and innovative management team, supported by dedicated employees who live in coastal communities and contribute to the local area’s economy and sense of community.

 

The Role:As a result of our robust growth, we are adding to our maintenance team of professionals. Reporting to the Plant Manager, this position will be responsible for the repair and service of equipment as per maintenance schedule. You will be required to detect and troubleshoot irregularities and malfunctions as well as perform safety and security checks on equipment and building.

 

The ideal candidate will be a team player who possess excellent problem solving and communication skills. Preference will be given to applicants who are mechanically inclined with a background in and understanding of preventative maintenance. This position is based mainly out of our Hermitage Processing Plant facility; however, support to the maintenance departments of our 24/7 operations may be required.

 

Salary commensurate with experience which includes a competitive health and dental benefit package.

 

The Opportunity:The role description is just one part of the story. This is an opportunity to grow, to stretch, to work within the parameters of the role but stretch to your fullest potential. We are a team that counts performance, we reward contribution and we recognize talent. It is about being at the center of the fastest growing company in New Brunswick and knowing you are part of that growth. The ability to bring your passion for learning, desire for growth, and energy for moving your career forward is what we offer. The Why:Why Cooke…simple because we are a company that rewards initiative, resourcefulness and work ethic. We will champion your growth and provide you with the platform to create your path, your career, and your future.

title: Técnico de Mantenimiento de Moldeo-1
description:
Descripción del grupo

El grupo de Mechatronics, Mirrors y Lighting se especializa en tecnologías automotrices que impulsan el futuro de la movilidad. Combinando un profundo conocimiento de sistemas para desarrollar experiencias únicas de acceso a vehículos, sistemas de visión inteligentes y tecnologías avanzadas de iluminación automotriz, la experiencia de MML ilumina el camino hacia la innovación, la seguridad y el estilo.

 

Resumen de la función

Proveerá de soporte en las áreas de mecánica, electricidad, hidráulica, neumática, soldadura en general, electrónica básica, instalaciones y apoyo al área de moldeo. Esta posición está fuertemente enfocada a brindar apoyo a producción en las áreas antes mencionadas con la finalidad de mantener trabajando los equipos en óptimas condiciones y apoyar en las instalaciones donde sea requerido.

Responsabilidades clave

  • Cumplir con las actividades programadas del plan de mantenimiento preventivo semanal.
  • Mantener trabajando los equipos en óptimas condiciones en cada turno y deberá de resolver las fallas que se puedan presentar lo más pronto posible para no interrumpir la producción.
  • Deberá de realizar recorridos aleatorios para monitorear y observar los equipos para descartar la probabilidad de alguna falla en los equipos, tales como maquinas inyectoras, robots, secadores y cargadores de resina y cualquier otro equipo en general.
  • Mantenimiento correctivo a equipo, deberá de reparar, modificar o reconstruir componentes de máquina de inyección o equipo periférico de esta según se requiera.
  • Administrar eficientemente las refacciones y ordenar y/o mantener inventario de piezas para reparaciones, cuidando el presupuesto del departamento.
  • Llenado de reportes establecidos.

Calificaciones/requerimientos clave

  • Carrera técnica en mecánica, electricidad, electrónica o afín.
  • Experiencia previa dando mantenimiento a máquinas de inyección de plástico Engel y equipos periféricos.
  • Conocimientos de electricidad, electrónica, software de programación de maquinaria, circuitos hidráulicos.
  • Conocimiento básico del proceso de inyección de plástico.
  • Conocimientos de neumática e hidráulica.
  • Disponibilidad completa de horario.

07--Operations F--Permanent/Regular

title: Industrial Maintenance Technician - $5000 SIGN ON BONUS
description:
**$5000.00 SIGN ON BONUS AVAILABLE**

Job Title: Maintenance Technician (Rotating Shift)

Hours of work:Rotating shift, Continental Shift: 12-hour shifts,

The Role:

TheIndustrial Maintenance Associate is responsible for the efficient, safe, and reliable operating condition of complex process and high-speed food processing equipment (80% mechanical, 20% electrical). This candidate must be multi-crafted (mechanical/electrical) and mainly focused on providing equipment troubleshooting and breakdown maintenance. As troubleshooting requirements are accomplished, the Industrial Maintenance Associate will change focus toward preventive maintenance activities as assigned through planned work orders. They must systematically repair, adjust and maintain processing, filling, conveying, packaging machinery and monitor utilities such as Biofilters, Boiler, Air Compressors, and Wastewater treatment plant as assigned using established maintenance reliability practices, consistent observation, repair, and follow-up of operational effectiveness.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Maintain, troubleshoot electromechanical equipment to include but not limited to:
    • Grinding tower
    • Extrusion Tower
    • Pressurized fluid systems
    • Raw product material handling
    • Mixers and vessels
    • Dryers with gas burners
    • Coating system
    • Dry product handling and conveying systems
    • Flexible filling and sealing equipment
    • Packaging printing, labeling, and conveying systems
    • Case packers and palletizing equipment
  • Apply mechanical and electrical knowledge to eliminate production problems and improve efficiency and reliability
  • Participation in continuous improvement activities
  • Perform Root Cause Failure Analysis on major unplanned breakdowns and recurring problems
  • This position and all site associates are responsible for quality and food safety

Physical/Environmental Requirements:

  • Standing on a concrete floor, extensive walking
  • Frequent climbing of stairs
  • Wearing proper personal protective equipment (safety glasses, hair net, bump cap, ear plugs,safety shoes, and uniform)
  • Bending, stooping, twist, turn, standing for extended time periods, reaching, climbing stairs, and lifting
  • Must be able to adapt to temperature and tolerate environmental extremes such as hot to cold, working in hot conditions, dust, dirt and chemicals

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Be 18 years of age or older
  • Have a valid Ontario Certificate of Qualification for an Industrial Millwright or equivalent experience
  • Must be willing and able to work and accept varying shifts and schedules
  • Ability to understand and effectively communicate inthe English language
  • 5+ years' experience maintaining mechanical systems on complex process and/or high-speed production equipment.
  • Demonstrable capabilityof experience troubleshooting, testing, and pneumatic circuits
  • Ability to work independently or as a group

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of safety regulations as related to the trade
  • Demonstrated competency in computer and pc software including MS Office and email
  • Ability to maintain, troubleshoot, and modify close-tolerance mechanical systems, mechanically timed equipment, hydraulic and pneumatic controlled and powered systems, and components.
  • Management of area assets, equipment maintenance schedules, predictive maintenance, and improvement projects
  • Experience in general shop practices
  • Hydraulic and pneumatic control and powered systems
  • Thermal processing instruments and controls
  • Welding experience
  • Proper use of hand and power tools
  • Electrical troubleshooting experience

What can you expect from Mars?

  • Work with over 130,000 like-minded and talented Associates, all guided by The Five Principles.
  • Join a purpose driven company, where we're striving to build the world we want tomorrow, today.
  • Best-in-class learning and development support from day one, including access to our in-house Mars University.
  • An industry competitive salary and benefits package, including company bonus.

title: General Maintenance Person, Permanent Full-time, Nights
description:
We currently have a full-time permanent opportunity in our Maintenance Department. Work days are Friday to Tuesday from 11pm- 7:30am.

Find meaningful work with seniors.

Enjoy working on a high-performance team while making a difference in the lives of independent seniors.

Choose to work at one of our many communities across Calgary.

Benefit from flexible hours, healthcare coverage and a pension plan.

Reporting to the Community Manager, the General Maintenance Person (GMP) is responsible for following maintenance processes and procedures for routine, preventative, emergency, and after-hours maintenance requests and work orders. The General Maintenance Person is responsible for the overall maintenance, servicing, and repairs required to ensure Silvera's Independent and Supportive Living Communities including, equipment, furnishings, fixtures and the surrounding grounds remain in excellent condition.

Key responsibilities include:

  • Troubleshoot and repair maintenance issues; Estimate vendor costs and issue vendor purchase orders in accordance with Silvera's signing authority matrix
  • Perform minor electrical, heating, mechanical, HVAC, plumbing, light carpentry, light landscaping, and building repairs
  • Complete work orders in order of priority; update Maintenance Supervisors on outstanding work orders and escalate issues as required
  • Support Silvera's Move In/Out KPI and KPM targets by completing timely suite renovation work orders in accordance to Silvera's established standards and guidelines; monitor vendor work and update Move In/Out Coordinator on the renovation progress
  • Complete all routine and preventative maintenance work orders within scheduled timelines and ensure accurate record keeping
  • Comply with all fire, health, and safety regulations and remain alert to any potential threats to the safety and security of residents, staff, and visitors
  • Serve as On-Call Maintenance GMP on a rotational basis

Desired qualifications:

  • High school diploma or GED required
  • 1 - 3 years of previous general maintenance experience required. Basic electrical, heating, mechanical, HVAC, and plumbing experience required
  • Experience operating low-pressure boiler systems an asset
  • Building operator training or certification an asset
  • Must be in good health with no history of back problems – a medical may be required
  • Class 5 driver's license and a clean driver's abstract are required

Working conditions:

  • Company vehicle provided as extensive travel within Calgary will be required; must be comfortable driving in heavy traffic
  • Heavy lifting will be required (up to 50lbs), including pulling, pushing and lifting equipment
  • Some exposure to corrosive and non-corrosive chemicals will be required
  • Frequent bending and stretching will be required
  • Operation of various types of equipment and machinery will be required
  • Working alone and in confined spaces will be required
  • Working under somewhat stressful situations may be required.
  • Working outdoors in inclement weather will be required

Silvera is a leading advocate and caring provider of homes and services for older Calgarians. We offer non-profit service to more than 1,450 residents and have continued to do so proudly for over 60 years.

Silvera employees create positive impact every day. Together, we serve people who make their home with us, including in our supportive living communities, which provide meals, housekeeping and Active Aging programs. Silvera provides a respectful, inclusive, diverse workplace. Our employees work hard to make our communities the safe, comfortable places residents call home. We offer employment opportunities in dining, housekeeping, maintenance and administration. We reward staff through training, recognition and opportunities for growth. We offer flexible full-time, part-time and casual hours, and lieu time.. Our communities are located in all quadrants of Calgary and our head office is located on Macleod Trail near Chinook Centre. 

Come build a career with our committed, high-performing team and make a positive difference in the lives of others.

  • Our singular purpose: Live your best life.
  • We value accountability, honesty, relationships and innovation. 

We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Due to the current high volume of applications, we will not be accepting phone calls about individual applications.

All pre-screen questions must be answered completed for an application to be processed.

In accordance with the Alberta Accommodation Standards, all successful candidates are required to complete a criminal record check prior to commencing employment and all offers made are contingent upon a successful criminal record check.

For further information on us, please visit our website: www.silvera.ca

title: 310s Technician (Simcoe VW)
description:
The 401 Group of Companies, is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's fastest growing dealer groups offering a full line of automotive, recreational vehicle, powersport and marine products and services. The 401 Group of Companies has 20+ locations across Ontario including the Blackshop Restaurant and Wine Bar as well as our headquarters, both located in the thriving city of Cambridge, Ontario. Our brands include but aren't limited to Kia, Mitsubishi, Volkswagen, Hyundai, Yamaha, 401 Auto Financing, CampMart and Grand River Boats. If you have a growth mindset like us, we'd love to see your resume and have a conversation. The opportunities at the 401 Group of Companies are endless!


Location: 370 Queensway West, Simcoe, ON


Hours: Monday – Friday |8-5pm | Occasional Saturdays   


Wage: $28-35 based on experience


Role and Responsibilities:

  • Diagnosing source of malfunctions and performing repairs
  • Determining if additional safety or service work is required by thoroughly examining vehicles
  • Ensure all vehicles qualify for warranty prior to performing warranty repairs
  • Performing road tests using safe driving standards
  • Excellent customer service, communication, and time management skills both verbal and written
  • Ensure the service shop is maintained in a clean, organized, hazard-free manner
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment


Qualifications and Skills:

  • Applicant must possess a 310S License
  • Valid G Driver’s License with a clean driver’s abstract
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  • Positive Teamwork Attitude


The 401 Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer and we are pleased to accommodate individual needs within our recruitment process. Please speak with our HR department should you require any accommodation.

title: Millwright - Afternoon Shift
description:
The Company:Grand River Foods is a leading food solutions company serving customers in the North American grocery and food service industry. As a member of the Sunrise Farm family, we remain as dedicated as ever to both providing a quality work environment for our employees, as well as producing only the highest quality products for our customers. 

The Location: Grand River Foods is based in Cambridge, Ontario. Our location is commutable from a number of cities in the region: Kitchener, Waterloo, Brantford, Guelph, and more. 

GRF is currently seeking an experienced Maintenance Millwright for the Afternoon shift. 

Afternoon shift: 1:30pm – 10:30pm/ 2:00pm – 11:00 pm (should be flexible).  Overtime may be required, including weekend rotation.

GRF operates in a cold, fast-paced, and physical environment. Applicants must be comfortable working with meat products (beef, pork, chicken, seafood, soy, etc.)

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Installs, maintains and repairs all mechanical and electrical systems and all machinery at the plant.
  • Provide support to production in troubleshooting and repairing electrical and mechanical breakdowns.
  • Complies with all necessary manufacturing codes, regulations and standards i.e. GMP, HACCP, WHIMIS, MSDS etc.
  • Conduct scheduled preventive maintenance and calibration activities.  Maintain an updated record of PM.
  • Identify opportunities to continuously improve maintenance operations
  • Actively promote health and safety in the workplace.
  • Completes Maintenance reports and logs as required.
  • Ensure all production equipment is serviced as required
  • Monitor and adjust equipment to lower utility costs
  • Enforce established safety, health, contamination and housekeeping policies and procedures in order to minimize staff injuries, lost production time, damage, and contamination of product
  • Track building and equipment repairs
  • Ensure that work area is clean of debris and hazards at all times and check work area for such hazards upon arrival and when departing each area of work
  • Work in a safe manner in accordance with legislated and company health and safety standards
  • Perform other duties as required

 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Valid Millwright license 
  • Proven track record working with mechanics, machine shop practices (lathe & milling machines), welding (ARC, TIG, MIG), and pneumatic & hydraulic fields is required
  • 2-5 years' industrial mechanical experience, preferably in the food industry
  • Service, clean and perform preventative maintenance and overhaul on all production equipment (spiral ovens, freezers, formers, cartoners, traypacks, bread and batter equipment)
  • Continually improve equipment function via design improvements
  • Problem solving skills and good communication skills
  • Knowledge of appropriate health & safety and environmental regulations
  • Adherence to Food Safety Protocols
  • Must have Ontario Millwright License

Wages and Benefits:

$37.00/hr to start, increasing to $39.80/hr upon successful completion of the training period.

Wages starting from $26.67+/hr for apprentices, depending on years of schooling/training completed

GRF also offers its employees:

  • Comprehensive benefits after three-month probation
  • Option to participate in GRF Pension Program after three-month probation
  • As an essential business, we can offer steady shifts with plenty of opportunity for overtime, even in these trying times
  • Product can be purchased at a reduced cost
  • All company PPE provided

Apply Now:

  • Submit your resume today via this posting
  • You can also apply to GRF job postings on Indeed, Kijiji, LinkedIn, and more

Grand River Foods (Cambridge) embraces diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. Grand River Foods (Cambridge) is dedicated to attracting, development and retaining talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), 2005, under the Human Rights Code accommodation will be provided at any point throughout the recruitment process, the candidate will need to make their accommodation need known to the HR Department.

title: Industrial Maintenance Technician - Day Shift
description:
Based in Alexandria, Ontario, KP Windows is a high-quality window and patio door manufacturer that has been a member of the Kaycan family since 2014. We foster a strong and lasting employment relationship, enhanced by the strength of the group to which we belong.

We are currently seeking an Industrial Maintenance Technician to join our maintenance team. Reporting to the Maintenance Supervisor, the persons we are looking for will be responsible for the maintenance and repair of mechanical equipment.

Shifts: Day - Monday to Friday : 7:00 a.m. to 3p.m.

    We offer:

    • Competitive salary
    • Flexible group insurance program
    • RRSP
    • Opportunity for growth and development

    Duties:

    • Maintenance and repair of facility equipment
    • Maintenance and repair of structural components
    • Maintenance and repair of manufacturing and process systems
    • Maintenance and repair of mechanical systems
    • Electrical repairs and troubleshooting
    • Hydraulic and pneumatic repairs and troubleshooting
    • Inspection, Maintenance and Repair of fork ifts, materials handling equipment and cranes
    • Documentation of work
    • Accurate and updated work schedule and logs
    • Training/Certification Hazmat transportation
    • Welding/Fabrication and Assembly Skills

    Requirements:

    • Completed Certificate, Diploma or apprenticeship program in a related discipline
    • Red Seal License (or in process)
    • MIG welding
    • Knowledge of H&S Standards, all appropriate life safety and fire and health codes, and applicable provincial and local building codes
    • Familiar with multimeter, servo drives, encoders, a variety of presence sensors, temperature controllers and thermocouples
    • Ability to interpret electrical and pneumatic schematics

    While we appreciate any interest expressed in joining our team, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

    KP Windows is committed to creating a diverse environment and takes pride in being an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, KP Windows will provide reasonable accommodations for disabilities to promote candidate participation in all aspects of the recruitment process.

title: Millwright - Continental
description:
Our client, a national manufacturer, requires a Millwright for their location in Woodbridge, ON. This will be for a rotating continental shift.
 
Reporting to the Maintenance Superintendent, the millwright will be responsible to participate in a team environment and undertake the tasks associated with maintenance, troubleshooting, fabricating and the installation of mechanical equipment.
 
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
 
May include, but are not limited to, the following:
  • Troubleshoot mechanical problems as required.
  • Interpret all mechanical schematics.
  • Properly uses all hand and power tools and precision measuring equipment.
  • Maintain conveyor system, all compressors and pumps.
  • Perform welding and soldering operations.
  • Install and maintain all fans, blowers, pneumatic systems.
  • Install and maintain pipe systems and valves.
  • Ensure that all shop equipment is kept clean and in safe working order.
  • “Call in” duty as per schedule.
  • General Maintenance.         
  • Read and interpret drawings, blue prints, schematics to determine layout of industrial equipment installations.
  • Install, examine replace or repair feeders, fibre-optic and coaxial cable assemblies.
  • Maintain, repair, test and install hydraulic and pneumatic control systems.
  • Conduct preventive maintenance programs and keep maintenance records.
  • May install, maintain and calibrate industrial instrumentation and related devices.
  • Maintain safety and environmental regulations and plant operability as top priorities as maintenance duties take place.
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS
 
  • Must hold a valid industrial mechanic/millwright certificate 433A
  • Minimum of 7 years’ experience, preferably in a manufacturing environment.
  • Knowledge of calipers and other measuring devices.
  • Must have knowledge of computer skills using MS Office products.
  • Ability to read prints.
  • Must be able to work Continental Shift.

title: Millwright Apprentice - Scarborough/Durham
description:
JOB POSTING

Millwright Apprentice Opportunity in Scarborough,  ONTARIO

 

 

A well-established, successful manufacturing company in Scarborough, Ontario is looking to hire a Millwright Apprentice with one to three years experience. This is an excellent opportunity to work in a great team atmosphere.

 

As a Millwright Apprentice, your key responsibilities are:

  • Repair and maintain, in accordance with local codes, diagrams, sketches, engineering drawings, manuals and manufacturer’s specifications, machinery, such as motors, conveyors, boilers, compressors, production equipment and other related machinery
  • Shift work required
  • Overtime when required

Qualifications:

  • One to three years experience
  • Ability to lift to 50 lbs
  • Strong analytical and decision-making skills
  • Able to work in a team and to handle priorities under pressure
  • Strong understanding and conscious of safe work practices
  • Available to attend schooling and attain Journeymen certification within a specified time period
  • Mechanical maintenance experience is necessary and preferably currently working towards a millwright apprentice
  • Strong analytical and decision-making skills

What The Employer Offers:

  • Full-time employment with opportunities to grow and learn within a team environment in a sustainable and growing economic environment.
  • Competitive compensation package
  • Full benefits package

You are applying to a position that has been posted through Support Ontario Youth. It is an organization that screens apprentices for employers. 

How to apply:

Click on the link to complete an online application AND assessment: 

1.       Attach a detailed cover letter and resume. 

We will ONLY be in touch with candidates who qualify for the positions.  We wish all applicants success.

title: Theatre Building Maintenance | Canada
description:
Overview:

The MTheatre Building Maintenance Technician is responsible for effective preventative and planned maintenance of site assets as well as troubleshooting and repairing mechanical systems including but not limited to HVAC, electrical, plumbing, refrigeration, and carpentry for Spectra at our venue.

 

Spectra, an industry leader in sports, entertainment, and venue management, is dedicated to recruiting and developing individuals with the skills, experience, desire, and values to contribute to the continued growth and success of our organization.   Together, with our 250+ sports & entertainment venue partners, we transform events into experiences! These experiences create excitement, turn heads, and make memories.   Come Join Us!    You can learn more about Spectra  at  www.spectraexperiences.com/

Responsibilities:
  • Building repairs and maintenance on flooring, drywall, theatre seating, stage components, tables and chairs.
  • Patching and painting walls, trims and cabinets and refinish materials
  • Maintains a clean and tidy workspace
  • Constructs items such as cabinets, counter tops, shelves drywall partitions in offices, stairs and risers
  • Checks & completes daily logs on equipment such as ice machine, refrigerators, freezers, etc. to ensure proper operations and makes minors repairs as necessary.
  • Repairs and adjusts domestic water systems such as toilets, taps, water fountains, plugged drains, leaks on supply lines. Makes minor pump repairs.
  • Checks fire systemâ€™s components such as pull stations, sprinklers, sand pipes, hose cabinets, air compressors
  • Adjusts and installs door hardware such as door closures, hinges and locks
  • Operates and maintains power tools such as table saw, drill press, planer, joiner, jigsaw, band saw and wood lathe
  • Operates hand tools such as wrenches, hammer, screwdrivers, trowel, chisels, files and measuring instruments
  • Performs preventative maintenance around the venue and on equipment as required
  • Orders parts and materials necessary to complete minor repairs and fabrications
  • Assists contractors on equipment such as refrigeration, plumbing or fire controls
  • Performs housekeeping duties such as cleaning workshop and power tools
  • Contacts outside agencies to arrange for any necessary services as per the purchasing guidelines of the company with the final approval of the Director of Operations
  • Experience with any or all of - Sky Jack, Scissor Lift, Fork Lift, Boom Lift and Fall Arrest is an asset
  • Performs other duties assigned which influence the success of the company and directly relate to the responsibilities of the job

 

Qualifications:
  • Requires a minimum of 2-5 years related experience.
  • Ability to deal with contractors and fellow employees in a courteous and tactful manner.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and a demonstrated commitment to safety, teamwork and co-operation.
  • Demonstrated ability to work from verbal and written instructions; must be able to accurately interpret sketches, diagrams, and building drawings.
  • Demonstrated mechanical aptitude including proficiency in the use of tools and equipment associated with most building repairs and maintenance activities.
  • Must have excellent problem solving skills and be adept at troubleshooting power tool and maintenance equipment related problems.
  • Must have basic knowledge of all major building systems (HVAC, mechanical, plumbing, electrical, lighting control, fire alarm, fire protection, security, refrigeration) and a good understanding of where the major equipment components are located in the building
  • Physical ability to work in either an inside or outside environment, operate equipment and perform work functions as required.
  • Able to diagnose minor heating/cooling issues
  • Knowledge of Building Codes and Municipal bylaws as they relate to our property
  • Exhibit a professional appearance and comply with all uniform requirements
  • Maintain a regular and reliable level of attendance and punctuality with an open availability for shifts
  • Able to multi-task and perform miscellaneous job related duties as assigned
  • Operating knowledge of Microsoft Office software, general computer understanding of basic IT functions
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Must have availability to work long hours, nights, weekends and holidays as needed
  • Solid problem solving skills

Spectra, an industry leader in sports, entertainment and venue management, is dedicated to recruiting and developing individuals with the skills, experience, desire, and values to contribute to the continued growth and success of our organization.   Together, with our 250+ sports & entertainment venue partners, we transform events into experiences! These experiences create excitement, turn heads, and make memories.   Come Join Us!    You can learn more about Spectra  at  www.spectraexperiences.com/

 

Spectra  is an equal opportunity employer and our employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, handicap, marital status, or any other status or condition protected by Federal and/or State laws, except where bona fide occupational qualifications apply.

Vaccination Statement:

We are committed to ensuring all our buildings and office locations are the safest in the world for artists, teams, employees, and fans. Based on recent encouraging trends in the U.S. and Canada. We highly encourage our employees to continue to get vaccinated and boosted against COVID-19.    Should circumstances change, we may need to reinstate vaccination requirements, in whole or in part, to safeguard the health of our employees, guests, performers, athletes, and partners.

title: Handyman for Residential and Light Commercial
description:
To meet the demands of our rapidly growing base of satisfied customers, Handyman Connection of Toronto west is seeking an experienced Handyman.  This skilled Handyman would ideally have a variety of home improvement skills to support the growth of our business.  Handyman Connection is a locally owned and operated, well established Home Improvement Company dedicated to excellent customer service and quality work.  Our customers love us!  We have over 50% repeat/referral customer base and our business is growing!

What You Will Receive

  • Earn $30-45/hour, depending on your skills and availability
  • Work as Independent Contractor on your own schedule
  • Professional Office Support - scheduling, customer support, job tracking
  • Free access to custom mobile application for scheduling and communications
  • Successful marketing campaign that brings us well qualified customers
  • Branded apparel and signage

Responsibilities

The handyman will need to have expertise in multiple types of home repair, maintenance and remodeling. You must have basic construction skills, be organized, and effectively communicate with others with a positive attitude.  We are looking for a craftsman or craftswoman who can bid work and produce it.  If you have at least 3 of the following skill areas, you're the kind of person we need to add to our team:

  • Handyman, General Home Repairs and Maintenance Work
  • General Carpentry - Rough and Finish
  • Painting Interior and Exterior
  • Drywall Repair / Patching / Caulking
  • Minor Plumbing and Minor Electrical Knowledge
  • Flooring Repair and Installation
  • Bathroom Upgrades / Remodel
  • Kitchen Refresh / Remodel

All candidates should be confident in the following areas:

  • Great Customer Service and Client Relations
  • Knowledge of Building Codes
  • Material Management

Requirements

  • Must have current Driver's License and Insurance
  • Must have tools, work vehicle and good references
  • Must have experience in the remodeling or home repair trades
  • Must pass screening process which includes a background check
  • Independent Contractors must carry liability insurance and WSIB Clearance 
  • Must have a smart phone and access to the internet

Please, no Project Managers or those whose experience is primarily New Construction.

Ready to Learn More?

Please complete the short application, and we will contact you for a quick conversation to see if this could be the right match for you.  Check us out on the web at: https://handymantorontowest.careerplug.com/account 

What our customers say:

Watch More

Why Handyman Connection?

title: Maintenance Worker
description:
We are excited to announce the opening of Golden Life’s newest location, Ocean Front Village, in the gorgeous Comox Valley! We are on track to open in Summer of 2022, and this will be our company’s first Village on Vancouver Island. We are excited to build an amazing team, and we are looking for exceptional, passionate individuals dedicated to providing an unparalleled experience for our residents.

We’re looking for a Maintenance Worker to grow with our team at Ocean Front Village in Courtenay, BC. If you are an enthusiastic team player, who is mechanically-inclined with a passion for providing high quality care and support for seniors, then we would love to hear from you!

Duties will include, but are not limited to:
  • Under the direction of the Community Manager will maintain all aspects of the building including but not limited to building interior, exterior, and grounds, mechanical, electrical and site aesthetics.
  • Ensure preventative maintenance duties on all building components are fulfilled as per the preventative maintenance schedule and manufactures specification.
  • In conjunction with the Community Manager, will review, perform or coordinate all maintenance requests and resident requests; these items will be reviewed daily and will be prioritized in order of importance.
  • Directly deal with trades, suppliers and contracted services that relate to the maintenance department.
  • Works closely with the Community Managers to mitigate all resident and staff
  • complaints.
  • Sources new trades, suppliers, material & manpower.
  • Assists the Community Managers in training and ongoing education of staff in relation to building system components and maintenance practices.
  • Works closely with construction during the turnover of a new building, addition or project.
Our culture attracts proactive self-starters who exhibit good judgment, innovation, selflessness, courage, impact, candid communication, inclusion, integrity, passion, and curiosity. If this resonates, maybe you’re the right person to join the Golden Life team.

The successful candidate will meet the following qualifications:
  • A strong mechanical or electrical understanding.
  • Minimum of three years’ related experience.
  • Must have a strong ability to trouble shoot and work through a variety of situations.
  • Ability to multi-task, manage time effectively and prioritize work.
  • Ability to plan, deliver and evaluate budgets.
  • Strong communication skills.
  • The ability to create sound & economical solutions in emergency situation.
  • Clear Vulnerable Sector Criminal Record Check.
  • Physician’s Waiver, Negative TB Screening, and Immunization Record.
  • Can provide proof of full and current COVID-19 vaccines.
What we offer you

At Golden Life Management Corporation, we are purpose-led. Our Philosophy is focused entirely upon providing the best possible quality of care to our residents and those we serve. We recognize that engaged employees are necessary to achieve our purpose and our Philosophy.

As a Golden Life Team member, you can expect to be treated with dignity and respect, to be challenged with your work, and to have the autonomy necessary to excel. We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package that includes a voluntary retirement program with company contributions, for eligible employees.

Golden Life welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

If this sound attractive to you, please apply today!

title: Junior Technician (electro-mechanical) – Electrical Control Parts
description:
We are a Mississauga (Ontario) based fast-growing business supplying original equipment to the construction and other industries.  We are seeking Junior Technicians for our workshop to support our growth. 

Primary functions: 

Responsible for assisting technicians in reconditioning and testing various types of electrical apparatus such as circuit breakers, transformers, and motor control systems.

Qualifications:

  • High school/vocational school/trade school.
  • Mechanical or electro-mechanical skills.
  • Class G license.

Experience:

Not essential but up to two years of related experience would be an asset.

Technical and business skills:

  • Willingness to learn and should be self-study so that they can be trained into the job.
  • Must have good work ethics – e.g. reliable and punctual.
  • Must have a mechanical aptitude and/or an electrical aptitude.
  • Basic skills with hand tools.
  • Good English skills - reading, writing and spoken.
  • Basic MS office skills.

Wage and Benefits:

  • Hourly rate of $16-18 depending on qualifications.
  • Extended health benefits after three months including prescription drugs, dental, etc. fully paid by the Company.
  • Vacation of two weeks per year and paid sick leave up to five days per year.
  • Work environment that supports development and growth with opportunities to grow with the Company with training opportunities.

We appreciate your interest and thank you for applying. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted for next steps.

title: General Renovation Handyman
description:
Wanted: General Maintenance Worker for Building Maintenance/Renovations.
 
 We are a busy renovations and maintenance company looking for a reliable, hard-working, and devoted handyman. You will be responsible for general renovations and maintenance duties, such as:
  • Drywall
  • Plaster
  • Paint
  • Ceramic tiles
  • Minor plumbing
  • Minor electrical
  • Countertops
  • Kitchen Cabinets

***All work is in Hi-Rise rental apartments.***
 
This is a full-time position (not for general contractors). Serious applicants only.

Salary based on experience and will be fair and negotiable.
  • $25-$30/hr
  • Mon-Friday
  • 8-10 hour shifts
 
A successful candidate requires: 
  • A set of their own tools.
  • 2-3 years of experience.
  • Their own vehicle.
  • An ability to work independently as well as part of a team.






    About Mirage Renovations:

    Mirage renovations Inc. is an interior renovations company that specializes in residential apartment building rental units. We pride ourselves on a quick job, done well and at a reasonable price. Years of experience in the rental apartment sector has allowed us to build a highly dedicated and efficient team that is able to tackle jobs of any size. Capital Projects: - Drop Ceiling installation - Corridor painting - Metal door and frame replacements - Finish work after large scale building updates - Garage Painting - Balcony Repairs - Fences Suite turnovers: We can handle all the components of a complete turnover: - Demolition - Plaster & paint - Electrical - Plumbing - Cabinetry - Tub Surrounds - Flooring - Baseboards - Tiles - Tub surrounds - Doors & Frames - Cleaning In-suite/ Odd jobs: We are well- equipped to provide solutions to all your maintenance needs. - Repairing flood damage - Plaster repairs - Door replacement - Painting - Finish work after plumbing repairs - Leaky faucets - Hardware replacement - Boiler room repairs - Fire- rating updates

title: 310T Technician (FT)
description:
All-Equip Repair & Service is a growing family-run business that provides a positive work environment, as well as the opportunity to expand your experience and knowledge within the industry.
Our STRATFORD location is looking to expand and has two positions currently available for licensed 310T Technicians.

Duties will Include:
  • Perform maintenance on heavy trucks, trailers and tractors
  • Update and maintain work orders
  • Perform inspections, diagnostic tests, troubleshooting and general repairs
  • conduct housekeeping duties
  • other shop duties and maintenance as assigned
Requirements:
  • Licensed 310T, 310S or Apprentice
  • Excellent customer service
  • Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing
  • Must be dedicated and reliable
  • Must be able to function well in a physically demanding environment
  • Ability to work as part of a team as well as independently
  • Able to work extra hours if required
  • Valid drivers license and means of reliable transportation to and from work
  • Exceptional organizational abilities with task prioritization, multitasking, use of timelines and time management techniques
Benefits:
  • medical and dental coverage
  • An RRSP plan
  • M - F day shift
  • Voluntary overtime available for interested parties
Please email your resume to info@aleq.ca or bring a copy to 21 Griffith Road, Stratford, ON Canada

title: IS Technician
description:
Join a global professional services leader. We are committed to solving the world’s biggest challenges in the areas of water, energy and urbanization.

GHD is currently undergoing a company-wide upgrade to Windows 10! We’re currently looking to bring onboard some temporary assistance to help our IS team with this initiative. This will be an excellent opportunity for you to gain some hands-on experience with upgrading and creating new systems for our North American employees. This position will be based in our Waterloo, ON office.

The successful candidate will possess the following skills and qualifications:

  • Completed a 2-year or 4-year program in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field
  • Minimum of 2 years experience in a related field
  • Basic understanding of both MS Windows 7 and Windows 10 workstations
  • Familiarity with repairing and installing computers, printers and peripherals
  • Troubleshooting experience with Windows Server, Microsoft Exchange a plus

If you are passionate about pursuing this position, please submit your resume and cover letter via the link below.

As a multicultural organization, we encourage individual achievement and recognize the strength of a diverse workforce. GHD is an equal opportunity employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants without regard to race, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status or veteran status.

This position is not remote and the successful candidate will be required to work from the office.

title: Shop Technician
description:
Spartan Staffing Solutions has partnered with a National Heavy Equipment company. We are in search of a Service Technician to join their team in Mississauga, ON

Ideal Fit:
The ideal fit will have extensive knowledge of all areas of Heavy Equipment maintenance and Forklift repair.

Qualifications:
• Knowledge of internal combustion engines (gas and diesel)
• Hands on experience maintaining and repairing Heavy Equipment
• Must own tool set
• Willing to work overtime when needed
• Strong attention to detail
• Ability to multitask

Responsibilities:
• Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot fuel systems, electrical systems, hydraulic systems, and propane systems
• Perform complete repair and overhaul functions, including diagnostics and testing
• Perform parts management
• Maintain own tools and equipment

Compensation & Benefits:
• Hour Based on Experience
• Insurance package


Please send resume to raul@spartanstaffingsolutions.com

title: Millwright Maintenance Mechanic
description:
Industrial Maintenance Mechanic



Main Duties: 

  • Respond to and prioritize all equipment breakdowns
  • Perform repairs, take responsibility and make decisions necessary for completion within time demands
  • Troubleshoot mechanical and electrical systems
  • Troubleshoot all equipment in the plant such as CNC, hydraulic press, rollers and belt conveyors, dust collector/vaccum systems, boilers and chillers
  • Effectively and efficiently complete all maintenance requests 
  • Perform preventative and predictive maintenance 
  • Set-up equipment
  • Adhere to all safety policies and procedures working in a safe and effective manner
  • Maintain parts and work records
  • Work collectively with other tradespeople


Minimum Requiremnents:

  • Recognized formal training and certification (Ontario Certificate of Qualification) Industrial Millwright, 433A
  • Knowledge in troubleshooting and repair of mechanical equipment including hydraulics, pneumatics, drives, bearings and gears
  • Knowledge and basic understanding of PLC, VFD PLS motor controls, servo drivers, safety sensors and relays with both troubleshooting and technical experience
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills, preferably in a fast paced manufacturing/industrial environment
  • Ability to multi-task and adapt to changing priorities and work environments
  • Ability to understand and interpret mechanical blue prints and electrical and control schematics.
  • Comfortable working alone, but able to contribute to cross functional team
  • Basic welding skills considered an asset
  • Ability to communicate effectively in the English language. (Both written and verbal)

title: General Maintenance Technician - PFT - Equipment & Asset Management
description:
Posting #:2021-881816

CUPE 815

Position:General Maintenance Technician

Department: Equipment & Asset Management

Status: Permanent Full-time

Hours: Monday to Friday, 7.5 hour days - 8am to 4pm (hours subject to change based on operational requirements)

Site:Oakville

Halton Healthcare takes great pride in providing quality, compassionate healthcare services to our rapidly growing communities. As a progressive and vibrant healthcare organization, we are committed to being an innovative centre of excellence in community hospital care in the Halton and Peel Regions.We are a distinctive centre of healthcare excellence that offers first-rate care in an innovative environment that supports the physical, mental, emotional and spiritual needs of the community.

This is what you’ll be doing:

  • Repair, calibrate and maintain hospital equipment to ensure it is operating safely, effectively and efficiently (e.g. wheelchairs, stretchers, beds, bedside tables, carts, etc.).
  • Perform scheduled preventative maintenance (PM) on patient beds, stretchers, Staxi chairs, designated therapy equipment and designated food service carts.
  • Includes function and ground fault tests, visual, cleaning and lubricating, test run and fastening or tightening, use of hand tools and electrical tester.
  • Document all preventative maintenance work, checklists, time & materials in the CMMS.
  • Administrative functions performed in MobileView (RTLS Software) for updating battery life on all Rolling Stock RTLS tags
  • Installation of new furniture accessories, such as keyboard trays, monitor arms and CPU holders
  • Assembling of new equipment such as, shelves, bed accessories, carts, furniture accessories.
  • Demand repairs on all Hospital maintained equipment, not covered by Biomed or a Service Contract, that need broken parts replaced, repaired or adjusted. Equipment includes. but not limited to, Beds, Stretchers, Wheelchairs, Furniture, Overbed tables, Fridge/Freezers, Enclosed Carts, General Carts etc.
  • Monitoring and maintaining stock part inventory levels

This is what you’ll need to do it:

Halton Healthcare endeavors to hire individuals who are competent in their chosen profession and who exemplify our mission, vision and values of accountability, respect and compassion which guide our individual behaviours and attitudes.

  • 2+ years of experience in an acute care hospital preventative maintenance program required
  • Technical College Program, electronics based preferred or equivalent experience required
  • Experience with Hill Rom beds preferred
  • Hill Rom Technical Bed Maintenance Certification an asset
  • Ability to work with your hands, make proper use of tools,verbal training on equipment by service technician
  • Must be able to work with our CMMS and Real Time Locating Software systems, or similar experience would be considered an asset.
  • Basic Excel knowledgerequired
  • Good communications skills essential across all staff levels
  • Ability to work effectively and collaboratively in a team environment
  • Must be comfortable interacting with patients and working in patient rooms
  • Must be able to read and write English
  • Demonstrate initiative and self-motivation.
  • Must be physically able to perform the job and able lift 40 - 60 lbs
  • Able to walk significant distance per day
  • Satisfactory employment and attendance record

Salary: $20.26 to $25.29 per hour

DatePosted: August 10, 2021

Internal Applicants due by : August 17, 2021

Please apply if you are passionate about what you do, motivated by a job well done, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient satisfaction as we are. Please submit your application via our website at www.haltonhealthcare.com directly to this posting and include a current copy of your resume.

W e thank all those who apply but only those individuals selected for further consideration will be contacted.

In accordance with Directive #6, Halton Healthcare has implemented a COVID-19 Vaccination and Management Policy. All new hires must be fully compliant with our Policy as a condition of employment with Halton Healthcare. Successful applicants will be required to provide proof of vaccination or proof of a documented medical exemption as part of the hiring process.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Halton Healthcare will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs to ensure your equal participation.

All personal information is collected under the authority of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act.

Halton Healthcare is a smoke free facility in and around all three sites. Smoking is not permitted on hospital properties. We thank everyone who works at or visits our hospitals for respecting this healthy initiative. We are also a scent-free environment for all employees and visitors to accommodate individuals’ health concerns arising from exposure to scented products. We ask for everyone's cooperation in our efforts to accommodate health concerns.

title: Maintenance Technician
description:
AstenJohnson has more than 200 years of global experience serving the paper industry, making AstenJohnson a preeminent international supplier of reliable, innovative products and technical solutions.

As the flagship manufacturing facility of Dryer fabrics, AstenJohnson Kanata site has been proudly serving our customers for over 50 years. We are committed with actions to Zero Accident Culture and distinctions through continuous improvement.

In AstenJohnson, people are our biggest assets. We foster the culture of trust and respect, we embrace diversity and inclusion. We are also committed to a sustainable future by protecting and carefully managing the resources entrusted to us.

Our business has been in operation successfully in the half century with continuance even during the unprecedented pandemic. To meet the business growth needs, we are inviting you to join this warm big family. We offer competitive wage and benefits coverage like extended healthcare, medical, dental, vision, disability, life insurance, AD&D, company pension, clothing allowance, employee assistance program and so on, as well as site events like BBQs.

General Scope of Responsibilities:

Rebuild, repair and troubleshoot all house plant equipment

Position Requirements:

  • High School Diploma. Some college or technical training a plus
  • Ability to work independently and as a team
  • Ability to work in a 24/7 unionized manufacturing environment
  • Ability to adapt to new equipment and procedures
  • Thoroughness of work performance, detail oriented
  • Strong mechanical aptitude
  • Good coordination and manual dexterity
  • Basic computer skills
  • Industrial Mechanic/ Millwright trade certification a plus

Specific Skills:

  • Welding and fabrication, G.M.A.W, S.M.A.W, Oxy-Fuel
  • Pneumatic and Hydraulics knowledge and experience
  • Hoist and Crane experience
  • Ability to read and follow blueprint and schematics.
  • Machine shop experience, Milling, Lathes and Grinders
  • Experience with alignment and leveling of equipment
  • PLC experience would be considered an asset

title: Millwright (Canada)
description:
Overview:

PaperWorks is a leading, integrated North American full-service provider of 100% recycled paperboard and specialized folding cartons for packaging applications. Founded in 2008 and headquartered in Philadelphia, PA, we are committed to the highest sustainable forestry and procurement standards.

 

We want our team members to be proud of the essential work they do, our commitment to the environment, and the overall company.   As part of our culture journey to be recognized as a Great Place to Work ©, we continue to invest heavily in our  people, our company  culture  and in  state-of-the-art technology  to be at the forefront of innovation and market differentiation.   PaperWorksâ€™ products are certified by the Forest Stewardship Council and 100% Recycled Paperboard Alliance.

Summary:

The Millwright is responsible for troubleshooting, repairing and maintaining all mechanical issues on our food-safe production equipment. The Millwright is responsible for troubleshooting, repairing and maintaining all mechanical issues on our food-safe production equipment.

Responsibilities:
  • Work as a member of the Maintenance team to complete scheduled PMâ€™s in a timely manner, and make recommendations for continuous improvement of our PM program and the equipment.
  • Respond to breakdowns with a sense of urgency.
  • Troubleshooting and problem solving of production equipment.
  • Complete detailed work logs for all repairs, to help our predictive maintenance process.
  • Understand and apply the Ontario Electrical Code to work practices.
  • Act as a member of the emergency response team.  
  • Other duties as required.
Qualifications:
  • Licensed 433A Industrial Maintenance Mechanic required
  • Minimum of 5 yearsâ€™ experience working in a fast-paced, highly automated manufacturing environment.
  • Confident with reading and interpreting hydraulic and pneumatic schematics.
  • Experienced using a lathe, mill, drill press and other machining equipment.
  • Preference will be given to candidates with experience with printing and high-speed  packaging equipment.
  • Experienced using Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel.
  • The successful applicant will be required to work a Continental shift schedule.

title: Property Maintenance Team Leader - Full time
description:
As a team Lead for Green Ventures Landscape Care, you would earn $20.00/hour (experience pays more).  We offer a professional, safety focused, positive team workplace — once people work at GVLC, they stay because they like it and it pays well!

As a Property Maintenance Team Leader, you are the role model for the team in both professionalism and quality of work. You would be responsible for managing your team and their work, ensuring that the work is done professionally with positive attitude and that all property maintenance tasks are completed to the expectation of the client and to company standards including mowing, line trimming, blowing, leaf and debris removal, weeding, edging, shrub, and perennial trimming, raking and mulch installation, as well as seasonal clean-ups and winter work.

If you have a at least 2 years of supervisor experience in landscaping, property maintenance, horticulture, agriculture or related field, are a leader with an overall positive attitude and look forward to working and making money, you can lift up to 50lbs, and have a driver’s license— send us your resume: info@greenventureslc.com

Website: www.greenventureslc.com

Address: 75 Howard Place, Kitchener, Ontario, N2K 2Z4
